translation: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse is a declaration of the source of the revelation, emphasizing that the message of the Quran comes from a merciful and compassionate God, and that His guidance is rooted in love and kindness.
orig: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم

translation: Praise be to Allah, the Lord of the Worlds.
interpretation: This verse is a declaration of the exclusive right of Allah to be worshipped and praised, emphasizing His sovereignty and dominion over all creation, and implying that all praise and gratitude belong to Him alone.
orig: الحمد لله رب العالمين

translation: The Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse is a description of God's nature, emphasizing His infinite mercy and compassion, which are fundamental attributes of His character, and which are extended to all of humanity.
orig: الرحمن الرحيم

translation: Master of the Day of Judgment
interpretation: This title of God, 'Master of the Day of Judgment', signifies God's absolute authority and control over the ultimate destiny of humanity, emphasizing that He is the one who will judge and hold accountable every individual for their deeds on the Day of Judgment.
orig: مالك يوم الدين

translation: You (alone) we worship, and You (alone) we ask for help.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the exclusive nature of worship and seeking help, highlighting the Oneness of God and the importance of directing all acts of worship and supplication solely to Him.
orig: إياك نعبد وإياك نستعين

translation: Guide us to the straight path
interpretation: The verse is a prayer to God to guide humanity to the path of righteousness and moral uprightness, indicating a deep sense of humility and recognition of one's need for divine guidance.
orig: اهدنا الصراط المستقيم

translation: The path of those upon whom You have bestowed favor, not of those who earned Your anger nor of those who are astray.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of following the path of those who have been blessed by God's favor, implying that their guidance and wisdom are a source of inspiration and a model to be emulated, and warning against following the paths of those who have earned God's anger or are lost and misguided.
orig: صراط الذين أنعمت عليهم غير المغضوب عليهم ولا الضالين

translation: These are the verses of the Wise Book.
interpretation: The verse is an affirmation of the authenticity and wisdom of the Quran, emphasizing that it is a book of divine guidance, and its verses are a source of wisdom and knowledge.
orig: الم

translation: That is the Book, no doubt in it, a guide for the righteous.
interpretation: The verse asserts the divine origin and authority of the Quran, emphasizing its role as a reliable guide for those who are God-conscious and committed to a life of righteousness.
orig: ذلك الكتاب لا ريب فيه هدى للمتقين

translation: Those who believe in the unseen and establish prayer and spend out of what We have provided them.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of demonstrating one's faith through actions, specifically by establishing a strong prayer habit and being charitable, as a natural consequence of believing in the unseen and being grateful for God's blessings.
orig: الذين يؤمنون بالغيب ويقيمون الصلاة ومما رزقناهم ينفقون

translation: And those who believe in what has been revealed to you and what was revealed before you, and in the Hereafter they are certain.
interpretation: This verse highlights the significance of having faith in the divine revelations, both past and present, and being confident in the existence of the Hereafter, which is a fundamental aspect of a believer's worldview.
orig: والذين يؤمنون بما أنزل إليك وما أنزل من قبلك وبالآخرة هم يوقنون

translation: Those are upon guidance from their Lord, and those are the successful ones.
interpretation: The verse is saying that those who are guided by God's will, as revealed through the prophets and scriptures, are the ones who will ultimately succeed and achieve true happiness and fulfillment in this life and the hereafter.
orig: أولئك على هدى من ربهم وأولئك هم المفلحون

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve - it is all the same for them whether you warn them or do not warn them - they will not believe.
interpretation: The verse highlights the stubbornness of those who reject faith, implying that they are so entrenched in their disbelief that even warnings or admonitions will not make a difference, and they will persist in their unbelief.
orig: إن الذين كفروا سواء عليهم أأنذرتهم أم لم تنذرهم لا يؤمنون

translation: God has set a seal on their hearts and on their hearing, and on their eyes is a covering, and for them is a great punishment.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who have rejected God's message have been spiritually blinded and hardened, and as a result, they are unable to understand or respond to the truth, and are thus doomed to suffer a severe punishment.
orig: ختم الله على قلوبهم وعلى سمعهم وعلى أبصارهم غشاوة ولهم عذاب عظيم

translation: And among mankind is he who says: 'We believe in Allah and the Last Day,' but they do not really believe.
interpretation: This verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who claim to be believers but their actions and behavior contradict their claims, implying that their declaration of faith is mere lip service and lacks sincerity.
orig: ومن الناس من يقول آمنا بالله وباليوم الآخر وما هم بمؤمنين

translation: They deceive Allah and those who believe, but they deceive not except themselves and they perceive not.
interpretation: This verse highlights the futility of trying to deceive God, as those who attempt to do so are only deceiving themselves, and ultimately, they will face the consequences of their actions.
orig: يخادعون الله والذين آمنوا وما يخدعون إلا أنفسهم وما يشعرون

translation: In their hearts is a disease, so Allah has increased them in disease, and for them is a painful punishment because they used to lie.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept that those who reject the truth and lie about it will be afflicted with spiritual and moral decay, which will ultimately lead to their downfall, and their punishment will be a direct consequence of their own actions.
orig: في قلوبهم مرض فزادهم الله مرضا ولهم عذاب أليم بما كانوا يكذبون

translation: And when it is said to them: 'Do not cause corruption on the earth,' they say: 'We are only reformers.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who claim to be working for the betterment of society, but in reality, their actions are causing harm and corruption, and they refuse to acknowledge their wrongdoing.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم لا تفسدوا في الأرض قالوا إنما نحن مصلحون

translation: Nay, they themselves are the Mufsidun, but they do not perceive.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who spread corruption and mischief are often unaware of the harm they are causing, and it is this lack of self-awareness that allows them to continue down a destructive path.
orig: ألا إنهم هم المفسدون ولكن لا يشعرون

translation: And when it is said to them: 'Believe as the people believed,' they say: 'Shall we believe as the foolish have believed?' Ah, no! They are the foolish, but they do not know.
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and ignorance of those who reject faith, as they consider themselves superior to others and look down upon those who have already believed, unaware of their own foolishness and lack of understanding.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم آمنوا كما آمن الناس قالوا أنؤمن كما آمن السفهاء ألا إنهم هم السفهاء ولكن لا يعلمون

translation: And when they meet those who believe, they say: 'We believe.' And when they are alone with their evil ones, they say: 'Indeed, we are with you; we were only mocking.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who pretend to be believers in the presence of true believers, but secretly mock and undermine them, revealing their true allegiance to evil forces.
orig: وإذا لقوا الذين آمنوا قالوا آمنا وإذا خلوا إلى شياطينهم قالوا إنا معكم إنما نحن مستهزئون

translation: God mocks them and leaves them to wander blindly in their defiance.
interpretation: The verse suggests that when people persist in their arrogance and disobedience, God allows them to continue in their ways, giving them a sense of freedom and control, but in reality, they are only being led further into darkness and confusion.
orig: الله يستهزئ بهم ويمدهم في طغيانهم يعمهون

translation: Those are the ones who have purchased error at the price of guidance, so their commerce has brought no profit, and they were not guided.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of trading one's spiritual guidance for worldly gains, emphasizing that such a transaction will ultimately lead to spiritual bankruptcy and a loss of direction in life.
orig: أولئك الذين اشتروا الضلالة بالهدى فما ربحت تجارتهم وما كانوا مهتدين

translation: Their likeness is as the likeness of one who kindled a fire, and when it illuminated what was around him, Allah took away their light and left them in darknesses, (so) they do not see.
interpretation: The verse highlights the fleeting nature of worldly achievements and the deceptive nature of earthly success, which can be taken away by God at any moment, leaving individuals in spiritual darkness and ignorance.
orig: مثلهم كمثل الذي استوقد نارا فلما أضاءت ما حوله ذهب الله بنورهم وتركهم في ظلمات لا يبصرون

translation: Deaf, dumb, and blind, they will not return [to the right path]
interpretation: The verse highlights the spiritual state of those who reject the truth, implying that they are so entrenched in their ignorance and disobedience that they are unable to hear, see, or understand the guidance being offered to them, and thus are incapable of returning to the right path.
orig: صم بكم عمي فهم لا يرجعون

translation: Or like a rainstorm from the sky, wherein is darkness, thunder and lightning, they put their fingers in their ears against the thunderclaps, fearing death, and Allah is encompassing of the disbelievers.
interpretation: The verse illustrates the helplessness and despair of the disbelievers when they are faced with the wrath of God, likening their state to being caught in a terrifying storm, where they are overwhelmed by the darkness, thunder, and lightning, and are forced to cover their ears in fear of death, highlighting the futility of their attempts to escape God's punishment.
orig: أو كصيب من السماء فيه ظلمات ورعد وبرق يجعلون أصابعهم في آذانهم من الصواعق حذر الموت والله محيط بالكافرين

translation: The lightning almost snatches away their sight; every time it flashes for them, they walk therein, and when it becomes dark on them, they stand still. And if Allah had willed, He would have taken away their hearing and their sight. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that people are so blinded by their own desires and ignorance that they are unable to see the truth, and it is only through the guidance of Allah that they are able to navigate through the darkness of their own making.
orig: يكاد البرق يخطف أبصارهم كلما أضاء لهم مشوا فيه وإذا أظلم عليهم قاموا ولو شاء الله لذهب بسمعهم وأبصارهم إن الله على كل شيء قدير

translation: O mankind, worship your Lord, who created you and those before you, so that you may become righteous.
interpretation: The verse is an exhortation to humanity to worship the One who created them and their ancestors, emphasizing the importance of recognizing and submitting to the divine authority in order to attain righteousness and moral excellence.
orig: يا أيها الناس اعبدوا ربكم الذي خلقكم والذين من قبلكم لعلكم تتقون

translation: Who has made the earth a resting place for you, and the sky a canopy, and sent down water from the sky, then brought forth with it fruits as a provision for you, so do not set up rivals to Allah while you know.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the uniqueness of God's creative power and provision, implying that humans should not attribute these blessings to anyone else, and that recognizing God's sole authority is a fundamental aspect of faith.
orig: الذي جعل لكم الأرض فراشا والسماء بناء وأنزل من السماء ماء فأخرج به من الثمرات رزقا لكم فلا تجعلوا لله أندادا وأنتم تعلمون

translation: And if you are in doubt about what We have sent down to Our servant, then bring a surah like it, and call your witnesses besides Allah, if you are truthful.
interpretation: The verse is a challenge to those who doubt the authenticity of the revelation, calling them to produce a similar chapter if they are truthful in their claims, and implying that they will be unable to do so, thus confirming the divine origin of the Quran.
orig: وإن كنتم في ريب مما نزلنا على عبدنا فأتوا بسورة من مثله وادعوا شهداءكم من دون الله إن كنتم صادقين

translation: Then if you do not, and you will not, then fear the Fire whose fuel is men and stones, prepared for the disbelievers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of obeying God's commandments, warning that if one fails to do so, they will face a severe punishment in the afterlife, where the fuel of the Fire is not only material things but also the very people who were once loved and cherished, making the punishment even more agonizing and humiliating.
orig: فإن لم تفعلوا ولن تفعلوا فاتقوا النار التي وقودها الناس والحجارة أعدت للكافرين

translation: And give good news to those who believe and do righteous deeds that they will have gardens beneath which rivers flow. Every time they are provided with a provision of fruit there, they will say, 'This is what was given to us before,' and they will be given something similar, and they will have therein purified spouses, and they will abide therein forever.
interpretation: The verse is emphasizing the concept of spiritual familiarity and comfort in paradise, where believers will feel a sense of nostalgia and familiarity with the blessings they receive, which will be reminiscent of the good things they experienced in their worldly lives, but with a twist of improvement and purification.
orig: وبشر الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات أن لهم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار كلما رزقوا منها من ثمرة رزقا قالوا هذا الذي رزقنا من قبل وأتوا به متشابها ولهم فيها أزواج مطهرة وهم فيها خالدون

translation: Indeed, Allah is not shy to strike a parable about a mosquito or what is smaller. As for those who believe, they know that it is the truth from their Lord, and as for those who disbelieve, they say, 'What did Allah intend by this parable?' He misguides many thereby, and He guides many thereby, and He does not misguide except the defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of humility and openness to understanding, as those who are arrogant and disobedient will be misguided by God's signs and parables, while those who are humble and faithful will be guided towards the truth.
orig: إن الله لا يستحيي أن يضرب مثلا ما بعوضة فما فوقها فأما الذين آمنوا فيعلمون أنه الحق من ربهم وأما الذين كفروا فيقولون ماذا أراد الله بهذا مثلا يضل به كثيرا ويهدي به كثيرا وما يضل به إلا الفاسقين

translation: Those who break the covenant of Allah after its confirmation, and sever that which Allah has commanded to be joined, and spread corruption on earth, those are the losers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of breaking one's covenant with God and disobeying His commands, which ultimately leads to corruption and chaos on earth, resulting in spiritual loss and failure.
orig: الذين ينقضون عهد الله من بعد ميثاقه ويقطعون ما أمر الله به أن يوصل ويفسدون في الأرض أولئك هم الخاسرون

translation: How do you disbelieve in Allah when you were dead and He gave you life, then He will cause you to die, and then He will bring you to life, and then to Him you will return.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of the cycle of life and death, and how it is a reminder of the omnipotence of God, emphasizing humanity's dependence on Him and the inevitability of returning to Him.
orig: كيف تكفرون بالله وكنتم أمواتا فأحياكم ثم يميتكم ثم يحييكم ثم إليه ترجعون

translation: It is He who created for you all that is in the earth, then He directed Himself to the heaven, and fashioned them into seven heavens, and He is Knowing of all things.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's absolute power and control over the universe, emphasizing His role as the creator of everything on earth and in the heavens, and His all-encompassing knowledge of all things.
orig: هو الذي خلق لكم ما في الأرض جميعا ثم استوى إلى السماء فسواهن سبع سماوات وهو بكل شيء عليم

translation: And when your Lord said to the angels, 'I am going to place a successor on Earth.' They said, 'Will You place therein one who will cause corruption and shed blood, while we glorify You with praise and sanctify You?' He said, 'I know what you do not know.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that God has knowledge and wisdom that surpass human understanding, and that His decisions are not to be questioned, but rather trusted and obeyed.
orig: وإذ قال ربك للملائكة إني جاعل في الأرض خليفة قالوا أتجعل فيها من يفسد فيها ويسفك الدماء ونحن نسبح بحمدك ونقدس لك قال إني أعلم ما لا تعلمون

translation: And He taught Adam all the names, then presented them to the angels, saying: 'Tell Me the names of these, if you are truthful.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the superior knowledge and wisdom granted to Adam by God, which enabled him to surpass the angels in understanding and recognition of the divine plan, establishing Adam's authority and leadership on earth.
orig: وعلم آدم الأسماء كلها ثم عرضهم على الملائكة فقال أنبئوني بأسماء هؤلاء إن كنتم صادقين

translation: They said: 'Glory be to You, we have no knowledge except what You have taught us, indeed You are the All-Knowing, the Wise.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the humility and recognition of the limitations of human knowledge, as the angels acknowledge that their understanding is limited to what God has revealed to them, and that God's knowledge is superior and all-encompassing.
orig: قالوا سبحانك لا علم لنا إلا ما علمتنا إنك أنت العليم الحكيم

translation: He said, 'O Adam, inform them of their names.' So when he informed them of their names, He said, 'Did I not tell you that I know the unseen of the heavens and the earth, and I know what you reveal and what you conceal?'
interpretation: The verse highlights God's omniscience, emphasizing that He has complete knowledge of everything, including the hidden and the apparent, and that He is aware of all human thoughts and actions, whether they are open or secret.
orig: قال يا آدم أنبئهم بأسمائهم فلما أنبأهم بأسمائهم قال ألم أقل لكم إني أعلم غيب السماوات والأرض وأعلم ما تبدون وما كنتم تكتمون

translation: And when We said to the angels, 'Prostrate to Adam,' they prostrated except for Iblis, who refused and was arrogant and was among the disbelievers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the pride and arrogance of Satan, who refused to obey God's command, which ultimately led to his downfall and expulsion from heaven, serving as a warning to humanity about the dangers of pride and disobedience.
orig: وإذ قلنا للملائكة اسجدوا لآدم فسجدوا إلا إبليس أبى واستكبر وكان من الكافرين

translation: And We said: O Adam, dwell you and your wife in the Garden, and eat thereof freely wherever you desire; but do not approach this tree, lest you become of the unjust.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of obedience to God's commands and the consequences of disobedience, as Adam's failure to comply with the divine instruction led to his expulsion from the Garden, serving as a lesson for humanity on the significance of adhering to God's will.
orig: وقلنا يا آدم اسكن أنت وزوجك الجنة وكلا منها رغدا حيث شئتما ولا تقربا هذه الشجرة فتكونا من الظالمين

translation: So Satan expelled them from it, and he removed them from what they were in, and We said, 'Go down, some of you to others, enemies, and for you in the earth is a dwelling place and a provision for a time.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of disobedience, where Satan's temptation leads to expulsion from a state of bliss, and instead, humanity is left to struggle with each other and their environment, with a temporary reprieve from God's wrath.
orig: فأزلهما الشيطان عنها فأخرجهما مما كانا فيه وقلنا اهبطوا بعضكم لبعض عدو ولكم في الأرض مستقر ومتاع إلى حين

translation: Then Adam received from his Lord Words, and He relented towards him. Lo! He is the One Who relents, the Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the mercy of God, who forgives Adam's mistake and accepts his repentance, demonstrating God's willingness to pardon and show compassion to those who turn to Him in sincerity.
orig: فتلقى آدم من ربه كلمات فتاب عليه إنه هو التواب الرحيم

translation: We said: 'Get you down all from it, then if there comes to you guidance from Me, then whoever follows My guidance, no fear shall be on them, nor shall they sorrow.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of following divine guidance, emphasizing that those who do so will be saved from fear and sorrow, indicating that obedience to God's commands is the key to achieving peace and security in this life and the hereafter.
orig: قلنا اهبطوا منها جميعا فإما يأتينكم مني هدى فمن تبع هداي فلا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: And those who disbelieve and deny Our signs, those are the companions of the Fire, they will abide therein forever.
interpretation: The verse highlights the severity of rejecting God's revelations and the consequences of deliberately denying the truth, emphasizing that those who do so will suffer eternal punishment in the Fire.
orig: والذين كفروا وكذبوا بآياتنا أولئك أصحاب النار هم فيها خالدون

translation: O Children of Israel, remember My favor which I bestowed upon you, and fulfill your covenant with Me, I will fulfill My covenant with you, and fear Me.
interpretation: The verse is a reminder to the Children of Israel of God's favor and blessings upon them, and a call to fulfill their covenant with Him, implying that they have a responsibility to respond to God's blessings with obedience and gratitude.
orig: يا بني إسرائيل اذكروا نعمتي التي أنعمت عليكم وأوفوا بعهدي أوف بعهدكم وإياي فارهبون

translation: And believe in what I have sent down, confirming what is with you, and be not the first to disbelieve in it, nor sell My signs for a small price, and fear Me.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of believing in the revelation sent by God, while also respecting and honoring the previous revelations, and not rejecting or selling out the divine signs for worldly gains or fleeting benefits.
orig: وآمنوا بما أنزلت مصدقا لما معكم ولا تكونوا أول كافر به ولا تشتروا بآياتي ثمنا قليلا وإياي فاتقون

translation: And do not mix the truth with falsehood, nor conceal the truth while you know.
interpretation: The verse is warning against intentionally distorting the truth, by mixing it with falsehood, or concealing it altogether, which is a form of deception and dishonesty, and is considered a grave sin in the eyes of God.
orig: ولا تلبسوا الحق بالباطل وتكتموا الحق وأنتم تعلمون

translation: And establish prayer and give zakah and bow with those who bow [in prayer].
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of collective worship and communal prayer, highlighting the significance of unity and solidarity among believers in their spiritual practices.
orig: وأقيموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة واركعوا مع الراكعين

translation: Do you enjoin righteousness upon others and forget yourselves while you recite the Scripture? Do you not understand?
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of self-reflection and personal accountability, warning against hypocrisy and double standards, where individuals preach righteousness to others but neglect their own moral shortcomings.
orig: أتأمرون الناس بالبر وتنسون أنفسكم وأنتم تتلون الكتاب أفلا تعقلون

translation: And seek help through patience and prayer, and indeed, it is a great burden except for the humble ones.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of humility in seeking spiritual growth and closeness to God, implying that only those who are humble and recognize their limitations can truly benefit from the means of patience and prayer.
orig: واستعينوا بالصبر والصلاة وإنها لكبيرة إلا على الخاشعين

translation: Those who think that they will meet their Lord and that they will return to Him.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of having a strong conviction in one's faith, emphasizing that true believers are those who are certain of their accountability to God and their eventual return to Him, which motivates them to live a righteous life.
orig: الذين يظنون أنهم ملاقو ربهم وأنهم إليه راجعون

translation: O Children of Israel, remember My favour which I bestowed upon you and that I preferred you to the worlds.
interpretation: The verse is a reminder to the Children of Israel of God's favour and blessings upon them, and how they were chosen and preferred by God above all other nations, emphasizing their special status and the responsibility that comes with it.
orig: يا بني إسرائيل اذكروا نعمتي التي أنعمت عليكم وأني فضلتكم على العالمين

translation: And beware of a Day when no soul will be of any avail to another soul, nor will intercession be accepted from it, nor will compensation be taken from it, nor will they be helped.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of individual accountability on the Day of Judgment, emphasizing that no one will be able to help or intercede for another, and that each person will be solely responsible for their own actions.
orig: واتقوا يوما لا تجزي نفس عن نفس شيئا ولا يقبل منها شفاعة ولا يؤخذ منها عدل ولا هم ينصرون

translation: And when We saved you from the people of Pharaoh, who subjected you to severe torment, slaughtering your sons and sparing your women, and in that was a great trial from your Lord.
interpretation: This verse highlights the significance of God's intervention in the lives of His people, demonstrating His power and mercy in delivering them from oppression and persecution, and serves as a reminder of God's justice and protection.
orig: وإذ نجيناكم من آل فرعون يسومونكم سوء العذاب يذبحون أبناءكم ويستحيون نساءكم وفي ذلكم بلاء من ربكم عظيم

translation: And [remember] when We parted the sea for you, We saved you and drowned the people of Pharaoh, and you were looking on.
interpretation: This verse highlights the miraculous event of the parting of the sea as a demonstration of God's power and mercy, and serves as a reminder to the believers of God's ability to save and protect them, even in the most desperate of situations.
orig: وإذ فرقنا بكم البحر فأنجيناكم وأغرقنا آل فرعون وأنتم تنظرون

translation: And when We appointed with Moses forty nights, then you took the calf after him, and you were unjust.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of trust and obedience to God's commands, as the Israelites failed to uphold their covenant with God and instead turned to idolatry, demonstrating their lack of faith and disobedience.
orig: وإذ واعدنا موسى أربعين ليلة ثم اتخذتم العجل من بعده وأنتم ظالمون

translation: Then We pardoned you after that, so that you might give thanks.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of gratitude and appreciation for God's mercy and forgiveness, emphasizing that the purpose of forgiveness is to encourage people to be thankful and obedient to God.
orig: ثم عفونا عنكم من بعد ذلك لعلكم تشكرون

translation: And when We gave Moses the Book and the Criterion, so that you might be guided.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of divine guidance, emphasizing that the revelation of the Book and the Criterion to Moses was a means of guidance for the people, implying that true guidance can only come from God.
orig: وإذ آتينا موسى الكتاب والفرقان لعلكم تهتدون

translation: And when Moses said to his people, 'O my people, indeed you have wronged yourselves by taking the calf. So turn in repentance to your Creator and kill each other. That is best for you in the sight of your Creator, then He turned to you, indeed, He is the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of taking drastic measures to rectify past mistakes, and that sometimes this requires making difficult sacrifices, such as punishing those who have erred, in order to restore justice and purity within a community.
orig: وإذ قال موسى لقومه يا قوم إنكم ظلمتم أنفسكم باتخاذكم العجل فتوبوا إلى بارئكم فاقتلوا أنفسكم ذلكم خير لكم عند بارئكم فتاب عليكم إنه هو التواب الرحيم

translation: And when you said: 'O Moses, we will not believe in you until we see Allah openly.' Then the thunderbolt seized you while you were looking on.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of humility and the dangers of arrogance, as the Israelites' demand to see God openly was met with a severe punishment, serving as a reminder that humans are limited in their understanding and should not try to impose their will on God.
orig: وإذ قلتم يا موسى لن نؤمن لك حتى نرى الله جهرة فأخذتكم الصاعقة وأنتم تنظرون

translation: Then We raised you after your death, that you may be grateful.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's mercy and benevolence in giving humanity a second chance at life, implying that this new life is a precious gift that warrants gratitude and appreciation towards the Creator.
orig: ثم بعثناكم من بعد موتكم لعلكم تشكرون

translation: And We shaded you with clouds and sent down to you manna and quails, [saying], Eat from the good things We have provided for you. And they did not wrong Us, but they were wronging themselves.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that God's blessings and favors can sometimes be a test, and that humans have a tendency to take these blessings for granted, ultimately leading to their own downfall.
orig: وظللنا عليكم الغمام وأنزلنا عليكم المن والسلوى كلوا من طيبات ما رزقناكم وما ظلمونا ولكن كانوا أنفسهم يظلمون

translation: And when We said: Enter this town and eat from it wherever you wish, abundantly, and enter the gate in prostration and say: 'Relief', We will forgive you your sins and increase the good-doers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of humility and gratitude, as the people are instructed to enter the town in a state of prostration, acknowledging the blessings and mercy of God, and seeking forgiveness for their past mistakes.
orig: وإذ قلنا ادخلوا هذه القرية فكلوا منها حيث شئتم رغدا وادخلوا الباب سجدا وقولوا حطة نغفر لكم خطاياكم وسنزيد المحسنين

translation: But those who did wrong changed the word that had been ordered to them, so We sent down on those who did wrong a scourge from the sky for their wickedness.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequence of altering or distorting God's message, which is a punishment that comes from God Himself, emphasizing the gravity of tampering with divine revelation.
orig: فبدل الذين ظلموا قولا غير الذي قيل لهم فأنزلنا على الذين ظلموا رجزا من السماء بما كانوا يفسقون

translation: And when Moses prayed for water for his people, We said: 'Strike the rock with your staff.' There gushed forth from it twelve springs. Each tribe knew its drinking place. Eat and drink from God's provision, and do not act corruptly in the earth, spreading mischief.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of gratitude and responsible stewardship of God's blessings, as exemplified by the miraculous provision of water in the desert, and warns against abusing God's favors and causing corruption on earth.
orig: وإذ استسقى موسى لقومه فقلنا اضرب بعصاك الحجر فانفجرت منه اثنتا عشرة عينا قد علم كل أناس مشربهم كلوا واشربوا من رزق الله ولا تعثوا في الأرض مفسدين

translation: And when you said, 'O Moses, we will not be patient on one kind of food, so pray to your Lord to bring out for us of what the earth grows of its beans and cucumbers and garlic and lentils and onions.' He said, 'Do you exchange what is lower for what is better? Go down to any town and indeed, you will have what you have asked for.' And We struck them with humiliation and poverty and they returned with wrath from Allah. That was because they used to disbelieve in the signs of Allah and kill the prophets without right. That was because they disobeyed and used to transgress.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of being ungrateful and disobedient to God's blessings, as the Israelites were punished with humiliation and poverty due to their constant demands and lack of appreciation for what they had, ultimately leading to their downfall.
orig: وإذ قلتم يا موسى لن نصبر على طعام واحد فادع لنا ربك يخرج لنا مما تنبت الأرض من بقلها وقثائها وفومها وعدسها وبصلها قال أتستبدلون الذي هو أدنى بالذي هو خير اهبطوا مصرا فإن لكم ما سألتم وضربت عليهم الذلة والمسكنة وباءوا بغضب من الله ذلك بأنهم كانوا يكفرون بآيات الله ويقتلون النبيين بغير الحق ذلك بما عصوا وكانوا يعتدون

translation: Indeed, those who have believed and those who have Judaized and the Christians and the Sabeans - whoever believed in Allah and the Last Day and did righteousness - will have their reward with their Lord. Upon them shall be no fear, nor shall they grieve.
interpretation: The verse highlights the universal principle of divine justice, where all those who believe in God and the Last Day, regardless of their religious affiliation, will be rewarded for their good deeds and will be free from fear and grief in the Hereafter.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا والذين هادوا والنصارى والصابئين من آمن بالله واليوم الآخر وعمل صالحا فلهم أجرهم عند ربهم ولا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: And when We took a covenant from you and raised the Mount above you, saying: 'Take what We have given you with determination and remember what is in it, that you may guard against evil.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of remembering and reflecting on the covenant and the revelation received from God, as a means of achieving righteousness and avoiding evil.
orig: وإذ أخذنا ميثاقكم ورفعنا فوقكم الطور خذوا ما آتيناكم بقوة واذكروا ما فيه لعلكم تتقون

translation: Then you turned away after that; and if not for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy, indeed, you would have been among the losers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of gratitude and humility, as it emphasizes that the only reason the believers were not destroyed was due to God's favor and mercy, implying that they did not deserve salvation on their own merit.
orig: ثم توليتم من بعد ذلك فلولا فضل الله عليكم ورحمته لكنتم من الخاسرين

translation: And indeed, you knew those among you who transgressed in the Sabbath, so We said to them, 'Be apes, despised.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of obedience to God's commands and the consequences of disobedience, as exemplified by the story of the Sabbath-breakers who were punished by being transformed into apes, symbolizing their degradation and humiliation.
orig: ولقد علمتم الذين اعتدوا منكم في السبت فقلنا لهم كونوا قردة خاسئين

translation: And We made it an example for what is between its hands and what is behind it, and a warning to the God-fearing.
interpretation: The verse suggests that the destruction of a sinful community serves as a lesson and a warning to those who are God-fearing, implying that the righteous can learn from the mistakes of others and be motivated to continue on the path of righteousness.
orig: فجعلناها نكالا لما بين يديها وما خلفها وموعظة للمتقين

translation: And when Moses said to his people: 'God commands you to sacrifice a cow.' They said: 'Do you take us in mockery?' He said: 'I seek refuge in God from being among the ignorant.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of humility and seeking guidance from God, as exemplified by Moses' response to his people's skepticism, demonstrating that true wisdom lies in acknowledging one's limitations and relying on divine wisdom.
orig: وإذ قال موسى لقومه إن الله يأمركم أن تذبحوا بقرة قالوا أتتخذنا هزوا قال أعوذ بالله أن أكون من الجاهلين

translation: They said, 'Supplicate for us to your Lord to make clear to us what it is.' He said, 'He says, indeed it is a cow neither too old nor too young, but between that, so do what you are commanded.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of obedience to God's commands, even if they seem unclear or difficult to understand, as the Israelites are being asked to sacrifice a cow that meets specific and seemingly arbitrary criteria, testing their faith and willingness to submit to God's will.
orig: قالوا ادع لنا ربك يبين لنا ما هي قال إنه يقول إنها بقرة لا فارض ولا بكر عوان بين ذلك فافعلوا ما تؤمرون

translation: They said, 'Invoke your Lord for us to make clear to us what her colour is.' He said, 'He says, indeed, she is a yellow cow, bright in colour, pleasing to the beholders.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of clarity and specificity in communication, as the people asked for a clear description of the cow's colour, and Moses provided a detailed answer, emphasizing the significance of precise language in avoiding confusion and ensuring understanding.
orig: قالوا ادع لنا ربك يبين لنا ما لونها قال إنه يقول إنها بقرة صفراء فاقع لونها تسر الناظرين

translation: They said: Pray to your Lord to make clear to us what (kind of) cow? For to us all cows are alike. And indeed, if Allah wills, we will be guided.
interpretation: The verse highlights the stubbornness and ignorance of the people, who despite being given clear instructions, still demanded more clarification, revealing their lack of faith and willingness to obey God's commands.
orig: قالوا ادع لنا ربك يبين لنا ما هي إن البقر تشابه علينا وإنا إن شاء الله لمهتدون

translation: He said, indeed, she is a cow neither old nor virgin, nor does she plough the earth, nor does she irrigate the land, there is no blemish in her. They said, 'Now you have brought the truth', so they slaughtered her, and they were about to do it.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of obedience to God's commandments, as the people were finally willing to follow God's instructions and slaughter the cow, demonstrating that faith requires submission to God's will, even if it seems difficult or unclear.
orig: قال إنه يقول إنها بقرة لا ذلول تثير الأرض ولا تسقي الحرث مسلمة لا شية فيها قالوا الآن جئت بالحق فذبحوها وما كادوا يفعلون

translation: And (remember) when you killed a person and disputed about it, and Allah was to bring out what you were concealing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that humans often try to conceal their wrongdoings, but ultimately, Allah will reveal the truth, and justice will be served.
orig: وإذ قتلتم نفسا فادارأتم فيها والله مخرج ما كنتم تكتمون

translation: So We said, 'Strike him with part of it.' Thus God brings the dead to life and shows you His signs that you may understand.
interpretation: The verse symbolizes the reviving power of God's guidance, which can bring spiritual life to those who are morally dead, and highlights the importance of reflecting on God's signs in nature and scripture to gain wisdom and understanding.
orig: فقلنا اضربوه ببعضها كذلك يحيي الله الموتى ويريكم آياته لعلكم تعقلون

translation: Then your hearts became hardened after that, so they are like rocks or even harder; and indeed, among the rocks are those from which rivers burst forth, and indeed, among them are those that split open and water comes out, and indeed, among them are those that fall in fear of Allah; and Allah is not unaware of what you do.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of maintaining a soft and receptive heart, as a hardened heart becomes incapable of receiving guidance and wisdom, and only through fear of Allah can one's heart be protected from hardness and corruption.
orig: ثم قست قلوبكم من بعد ذلك فهي كالحجارة أو أشد قسوة وإن من الحجارة لما يتفجر منه الأنهار وإن منها لما يشقق فيخرج منه الماء وإن منها لما يهبط من خشية الله وما الله بغافل عما تعملون

translation: Do they then hope that they will believe you, while a party of them used to hear the Word of Allah, then alter it knowingly after they had understood it, and they know?
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of some people who claim to be believers but secretly alter the Word of God for their own interests, revealing their deceitful nature and lack of commitment to the truth.
orig: أفتطمعون أن يؤمنوا لكم وقد كان فريق منهم يسمعون كلام الله ثم يحرفونه من بعد ما عقلوه وهم يعلمون

translation: And when they meet those who believe, they say, 'We believe.' And when they are alone with their evil ones, they say, 'Indeed, we were only mocking.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who pretend to be believers when they are with the faithful, but secretly harbor evil intentions, revealing their true nature when they are alone with their like-minded companions, thereby exposing their deceitful and manipulative behavior.
orig: وإذا لقوا الذين آمنوا قالوا آمنا وإذا خلا بعضهم إلى بعض قالوا أتحدثونهم بما فتح الله عليكم ليحاجوكم به عند ربكم أفلا تعقلون

translation: They know that Allah knows what they conceal and what they declare.
interpretation: This verse highlights the omniscience of Allah, emphasizing that He is aware of all human thoughts, actions, and intentions, whether they are hidden or openly expressed, and that humans will be held accountable for them.
orig: أولا يعلمون أن الله يعلم ما يسرون وما يعلنون

translation: And among them are unlettered people who do not know the Scripture except in wishful thinking, and they are only speculating.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ignorance and lack of understanding of those who claim to have knowledge of the Scripture but are merely relying on speculation and unfounded assumptions, rather than actual knowledge and insight.
orig: ومنهم أميون لا يعلمون الكتاب إلا أماني وإن هم إلا يظنون

translation: Woe to those who write the scripture with their own hands, then say, 'This is from Allah,' that they may exchange it for a small price. Woe to them for what their hands have written and woe to them for what they earn.
interpretation: The verse highlights the seriousness of fabricating religious knowledge and attributing it to God, as it undermines the authenticity of divine revelation and leads to corruption and chaos in society.
orig: فويل للذين يكتبون الكتاب بأيديهم ثم يقولون هذا من عند الله ليشتروا به ثمنا قليلا فويل لهم مما كتبت أيديهم وويل لهم مما يكسبون

translation: And they say: 'The Fire shall not touch us except for a few numbered days.' Say: 'Have you taken a covenant with Allah? For Allah will not break His covenant. Or do you say about Allah what you do not know?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and ignorance of those who think they can negotiate with God, and that their punishment will be limited to a short period of time, when in reality, they have no knowledge of God's plan and are only deceiving themselves.
orig: وقالوا لن تمسنا النار إلا أياما معدودة قل أتخذتم عند الله عهدا فلن يخلف الله عهده أم تقولون على الله ما لا تعلمون

translation: Nay, but whoever earns evil and his sin besets him, those are the inmates of the Fire, they shall abide in it.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of personal responsibility, emphasizing that individuals will be held accountable for their own actions, and that their sinful deeds will ultimately lead to their downfall and eternal punishment in the Hereafter.
orig: بلى من كسب سيئة وأحاطت به خطيئته فأولئك أصحاب النار هم فيها خالدون

translation: And those who believed and did righteous deeds, those are the companions of Paradise, they will abide therein forever.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of not only believing in God but also doing good deeds, emphasizing that it is the combination of faith and righteous actions that guarantees eternal residence in Paradise.
orig: والذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات أولئك أصحاب الجنة هم فيها خالدون

translation: And when We took a covenant from the Children of Israel, 'You shall not worship except Allah, and be good to your parents, and the relatives, and the orphans, and the needy, and speak good to the people, and establish the prayer, and give the zakah.' Then you turned away, except for a few of you, and you are neglectful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of fulfilling one's covenant with God, emphasizing that obedience to God's commands is a fundamental aspect of faith, and that neglecting these duties leads to spiritual decay and moral corruption.
orig: وإذ أخذنا ميثاق بني إسرائيل لا تعبدون إلا الله وبالوالدين إحسانا وذي القربى واليتامى والمساكين وقولوا للناس حسنا وأقيموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة ثم توليتم إلا قليلا منكم وأنتم معرضون

translation: And when We took your covenant: 'You shall not shed your blood, nor turn your people out of your cities, then you ratified and bore witness.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of fulfilling one's covenant with God, emphasizing that the covenant is not just a verbal agreement, but a solemn promise that requires action and commitment, and that breaking it has severe consequences.
orig: وإذ أخذنا ميثاقكم لا تسفكون دماءكم ولا تخرجون أنفسكم من دياركم ثم أقررتم وأنتم تشهدون

translation: Then do you kill your own selves and evict a party of your people from their homes, cooperating against them in sin and aggression? And if they come to you as captives, you ransom them, although it was forbidden to you to evict them. Do you believe in part of the Scripture and disbelieve in part? Then what is the recompense of those who do that among you, except disgrace in the life of this world and on the Day of Resurrection they will be returned to the most severe punishment, and Allah is not unaware of what you do.
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who claim to believe in God's scripture but selectively choose to follow or ignore certain parts of it, leading to contradictions in their behavior, and ultimately, to their downfall and punishment.
orig: ثم أنتم هؤلاء تقتلون أنفسكم وتخرجون فريقا منكم من ديارهم تظاهرون عليهم بالإثم والعدوان وإن يأتوكم أسارى تفادوهم وهو محرم عليكم إخراجهم أفتؤمنون ببعض الكتاب وتكفرون ببعض فما جزاء من يفعل ذلك منكم إلا خزي في الحياة الدنيا ويوم القيامة يردون إلى أشد العذاب وما الله بغافل عما تعملون

translation: Those are the ones who have bought the life of this world with the Hereafter, so the punishment will not be lightened for them, nor will they be helped.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of prioritizing worldly gains over spiritual well-being, suggesting that those who do so will not only face severe punishment but also be abandoned by Allah, leaving them without any support or rescue.
orig: أولئك الذين اشتروا الحياة الدنيا بالآخرة فلا يخفف عنهم العذاب ولا هم ينصرون

translation: And indeed We gave Moses the Book, and We followed up after him with messengers, and We gave Jesus, the son of Mary, clear signs and supported him with the Holy Spirit. But is it [not] that every time a messenger came to you with what your souls did not desire, you were arrogant? And a party [of messengers] you denied and another party you killed.
interpretation: The verse highlights the recurring pattern of human arrogance and rejection of divine guidance, as people consistently refuse to accept the messages of prophets that challenge their desires and expectations, leading to their downfall.
orig: ولقد آتينا موسى الكتاب وقفينا من بعده بالرسل وآتينا عيسى ابن مريم البينات وأيدناه بروح القدس أفكلما جاءكم رسول بما لا تهوى أنفسكم استكبرتم ففريقا كذبتم وفريقا تقتلون

translation: And they say: 'Our hearts are wrapped in covers.' Nay, Allah has cursed them for their unbelief; so little is it that they believe.
interpretation: The verse highlights the state of those who claim to have faith but are actually hardened in their hearts, and as a result, they are cursed by God and unable to truly believe or accept the truth.
orig: وقالوا قلوبنا غلف بل لعنهم الله بكفرهم فقليلا ما يؤمنون

translation: And when there came to them a Book from Allah, confirming what was with them - and they aforetime prayed for victory over those who disbelieved - but when there came to them that which they knew, they disbelieved in it; so the curse of Allah be on disbelievers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who claimed to seek victory over their oppressors, but when they were given the means to achieve it, they rejected it, revealing their true intentions and lack of faith.
orig: ولما جاءهم كتاب من عند الله مصدق لما معهم وكانوا من قبل يستفتحون على الذين كفروا فلما جاءهم ما عرفوا كفروا به فلعنة الله على الكافرين

translation: Evil is that for which they have sold themselves, that they should disbelieve in what Allah has revealed, grudgingly that Allah should reveal of His grace to whom He wills of His servants, so they have drawn on themselves wrath upon wrath. And for the unbelievers is a humiliating punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of self-deception, where individuals deliberately choose to disbelieve in the divine revelation, thereby selling their own souls to ignorance and misguidance, and as a result, they invite upon themselves multiple layers of divine wrath and humiliation.
orig: بئسما اشتروا به أنفسهم أن يكفروا بما أنزل الله بغيا أن ينزل الله من فضله على من يشاء من عباده فباءوا بغضب على غضب وللكافرين عذاب مهين

translation: And when it is said to them: 'Believe in what Allah has sent down', they say: 'We believe in what was sent down to us', and they reject what is beyond that, while it is the truth confirming what is with them. Say: 'Why then did you kill the prophets of Allah before, if you are believers?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who claim to believe in their own scripture, but reject the truth that comes from other sources, and even go as far as to kill the prophets who brought that truth, revealing the contradiction in their claims of faith.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم آمنوا بما أنزل الله قالوا نؤمن بما أنزل علينا ويكفرون بما وراءه وهو الحق مصدقا لما معهم قل فلم تقتلون أنبياء الله من قبل إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: And indeed Moses came to you with clear signs, then you took the calf [for worship] after him, and you were wrongdoers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the ingratitude and disobedience of the Israelites, who, despite witnessing the miracles and clear signs brought by Moses, still chose to worship the golden calf, demonstrating their tendency to deviate from the right path and indulge in sinful behavior.
orig: ولقد جاءكم موسى بالبينات ثم اتخذتم العجل من بعده وأنتم ظالمون

translation: And when We took a covenant from you and raised the mountain above you, 'Take what We have given you with determination and listen.' They said, 'We have heard and disobeyed.' And they were made to drink the calf into their hearts because of their disbelief. Say, 'How evil is that which your faith commands you if you are believers.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who claim to believe, but their actions contradict their faith, implying that their faith is not genuine, but rather a superficial claim.
orig: وإذ أخذنا ميثاقكم ورفعنا فوقكم الطور خذوا ما آتيناكم بقوة واسمعوا قالوا سمعنا وعصينا وأشربوا في قلوبهم العجل بكفرهم قل بئسما يأمركم به إيمانكم إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: Say, 'If the Hereafter with Allah is exclusively for you, apart from the people, then long for death if you are truthful.'
interpretation: The verse is a challenge to those who claim to be certain of their place in Paradise, asking them to be willing to die immediately if they are truly confident in their beliefs, implying that if they are not willing to do so, then their claims are likely to be false.
orig: قل إن كانت لكم الدار الآخرة عند الله خالصة من دون الناس فتمنوا الموت إن كنتم صادقين

translation: And they will never wish for it, because of what their hands have sent forth, and Allah is All-Knowing of the wrongdoers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that those who have committed wrongdoings will eventually regret their actions and wish they had not done them, but it will be too late, and they will be held accountable for their deeds.
orig: ولن يتمنوه أبدا بما قدمت أيديهم والله عليم بالظالمين

translation: And you will find them the most greedy of people for life, and (even) more than those who associate (others with Allah). Each one of them wishes that he could be given a life of a thousand years. But to flee from the punishment will not save him, even if he were given a life of a thousand years. And Allah is Ever-Watching what they do.
interpretation: The verse highlights the irony of those who are greedy for life and yet are unwilling to reform themselves, despite knowing that they will ultimately face God's judgment, implying that their desire for a long life is actually a desire to escape accountability.
orig: ولتجدنهم أحرص الناس على حياة ومن الذين أشركوا يود أحدهم لو يعمر ألف سنة وما هو بمزحزحه من العذاب أن يعمر والله بصير بما يعملون

translation: Say, 'Whoever is an enemy to Gabriel - it is he who has brought down this [Qur'an] to your heart, by permission of Allah, confirming what was before it and a guidance and glad tidings for the believers'
interpretation: The verse highlights the divine origin of the Quran, emphasizing that it is a revelation from God, brought down by Gabriel, and that those who reject it are essentially rejecting God's message, which serves as a guidance and glad tidings for the believers.
orig: قل من كان عدوا لجبريل فإنه نزله على قلبك بإذن الله مصدقا لما بين يديه وهدى وبشرى للمؤمنين

translation: Whoever is an enemy to Allah and His Angels and His Messengers and Gabriel and Michael, then indeed Allah is an enemy to the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the gravity of opposing Allah and His messengers, implying that those who do so will face Allah's wrath and enmity, which is a terrible consequence.
orig: من كان عدوا لله وملائكته ورسله وجبريل وميكال فإن الله عدو للكافرين

translation: And indeed, We have sent down to you clear signs, and none reject them except the defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: The verse highlights the clarity and unmistakable nature of God's signs and revelations, implying that those who reject them do so out of deliberate disobedience and arrogance, rather than due to any lack of understanding or ambiguity in the message itself.
orig: ولقد أنزلنا إليك آيات بينات وما يكفر بها إلا الفاسقون

translation: And how often they made a covenant, a party of them cast it aside, nay, most of them do not believe.
interpretation: The verse highlights the inconsistency and hypocrisy of those who make promises and covenants, but then break them, revealing their lack of true faith and commitment.
orig: أوكلما عاهدوا عهدا نبذه فريق منهم بل أكثرهم لا يؤمنون

translation: And when there came to them a Messenger from Allah, confirming what was with them, a party of those who were given the Scripture threw away the Scripture of Allah behind their backs as if they did not know.
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy and arrogance of those who were given the Scripture, as they deliberately rejected and ignored the truth brought by the Messenger, despite having knowledge of it, and instead chose to follow their own desires and interests.
orig: ولما جاءهم رسول من عند الله مصدق لما معهم نبذ فريق من الذين أوتوا الكتاب كتاب الله وراء ظهورهم كأنهم لا يعلمون

translation: And they followed what the devils used to recite during the reign of Solomon, and Solomon did not disbelieve, but the devils disbelieved, teaching people magic and what was sent down to the two angels, Harut and Marut, in Babylon. They did not teach anyone until they said, 'Indeed, we are a trial, so do not disbelieve.' And they learned from them what they used to cause separation between a man and his wife. But they did not harm anyone with it except by permission of Allah. And they learned what harmed them, not benefiting them. And they knew that whoever purchased it would have no share in the Hereafter, and evil is what they sold themselves with, if only they knew.
interpretation: This verse highlights the danger of seeking knowledge or power that is forbidden or harmful, as it can lead to spiritual harm and separation from God's guidance, ultimately resulting in a loss in the afterlife.
orig: واتبعوا ما تتلو الشياطين على ملك سليمان وما كفر سليمان ولكن الشياطين كفروا يعلمون الناس السحر وما أنزل على الملكين ببابل هاروت وماروت وما يعلمان من أحد حتى يقولا إنما نحن فتنة فلا تكفر فيتعلمون منهما ما يفرقون به بين المرء وزوجه وما هم بضارين به من أحد إلا بإذن الله ويتعلمون ما يضرهم ولا ينفعهم ولقد علموا لمن اشتراه ما له في الآخرة من خلاق ولبئس ما شروا به أنفسهم لو كانوا يعلمون

translation: And if they had believed and feared, a reward from Allah would be better, if they only knew.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of faith and righteousness, emphasizing that if people had believed in God and lived a virtuous life, they would have received a far greater reward from God, implying that their current state is inferior to what could have been achieved through faith and righteousness.
orig: ولو أنهم آمنوا واتقوا لمثوبة من عند الله خير لو كانوا يعلمون

translation: O you who have believed, do not say 'Ra'ina' but say 'Unzurna' and listen. And for the disbelievers is a painful punishment.
interpretation: The verse is emphasizing the importance of humility and sincerity in one's language and behavior, as the Prophet and his companions were instructed to avoid using a phrase that could be misinterpreted as disrespectful, and instead use a phrase that conveys a sense of humility and respect, highlighting the significance of mindfulness in one's speech and actions.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تقولوا راعنا وقولوا انظرنا واسمعوا وللكافرين عذاب أليم

translation: Those who disbelieve from the People of the Book and the polytheists wish that nothing good should be sent down upon you from your Lord, and Allah singles out for His mercy whom He wills, and Allah is the Possessor of Great Bounty.
interpretation: The verse highlights the envy and resentment of the disbelievers towards the believers, who are recipients of God's blessings and mercy, and serves as a reminder that God's favors are not limited to any particular group, but are bestowed upon whomever He wills, emphasizing God's absolute sovereignty and wisdom in distributing His blessings.
orig: ما يود الذين كفروا من أهل الكتاب ولا المشركين أن ينزل عليكم من خير من ربكم والله يختص برحمته من يشاء والله ذو الفضل العظيم

translation: Whatever verse We abrogate or cause to be forgotten, We bring a better one or similar to it. Do you not know that Allah is capable of everything?
interpretation: The verse is a declaration of God's absolute power and authority over the revelation process, implying that God has the right to modify or replace certain verses or commands as He sees fit, and that His wisdom and knowledge are beyond human comprehension.
orig: ما ننسخ من آية أو ننسها نأت بخير منها أو مثلها ألم تعلم أن الله على كل شيء قدير

translation: Did you not know that to Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and you have not besides Allah any guardian or helper?
interpretation: The verse highlights the absolute authority and power of Allah, emphasizing that He is the sole guardian and helper, and that humans have no one else to turn to for protection or support.
orig: ألم تعلم أن الله له ملك السماوات والأرض وما لكم من دون الله من ولي ولا نصير

translation: Do you wish to question your Messenger as Moses was questioned before? And whoever exchanges faith for disbelief has certainly strayed from the even path.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of respecting and following the Prophet's guidance, and warns against abandoning faith for disbelief, which would lead to spiritual confusion and misguidance.
orig: أم تريدون أن تسألوا رسولكم كما سئل موسى من قبل ومن يتبدل الكفر بالإيمان فقد ضل سواء السبيل

translation: And many of the People of the Book wish they could turn you back to disbelief after you have believed, out of envy from themselves, even after the truth has become clear to them. So pardon and forgive until Allah brings about His affair. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of forgiveness and patience in the face of opposition and envy from those who reject the truth, trusting that God will ultimately prevail and bring about justice.
orig: ود كثير من أهل الكتاب لو يردونكم من بعد إيمانكم كفارا حسدا من عند أنفسهم من بعد ما تبين لهم الحق فاعفوا واصفحوا حتى يأتي الله بأمره إن الله على كل شيء قدير

translation: And establish prayer and give zakah, and whatever good you put forward for yourselves - you will find it with Allah. Indeed, Allah of what you do is Seeing.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of not only performing the obligatory acts of worship, such as prayer and zakah, but also of doing good deeds that benefit others, as these will be rewarded by God in the hereafter, and God is all-seeing and aware of every action.
orig: وأقيموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة وما تقدموا لأنفسكم من خير تجدوه عند الله إن الله بما تعملون بصير

translation: And they say: 'None shall enter Paradise unless he be a Jew or a Christian.' Those are their vain desires. Say: 'Bring your proof if you are truthful.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and exclusivity of the Jews and Christians who believe that only they will enter Paradise, and challenges them to provide evidence for their claims, emphasizing the importance of humility and openness to divine guidance.
orig: وقالوا لن يدخل الجنة إلا من كان هودا أو نصارى تلك أمانيهم قل هاتوا برهانكم إن كنتم صادقين

translation: Nay, whoever submits his face to Allah while being a doer of good, then his reward is with his Lord, and there is no fear for them, nor will they grieve.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of sincerity in one's devotion to God, emphasizing that those who genuinely submit to God's will and do good deeds will be rewarded and protected from fear and grief.
orig: بلى من أسلم وجهه لله وهو محسن فله أجره عند ربه ولا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: The Jews say: 'The Christians are not upon anything,' and the Christians say: 'The Jews are not upon anything,' while they recite the Scripture. Similarly, the polytheists say. God will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.
interpretation: This verse highlights the futility of interfaith disputes and the arrogance of claiming exclusive possession of truth, as God will ultimately settle these differences on the Day of Judgment, revealing the truth and rendering human opinions and biases irrelevant.
orig: وقالت اليهود ليست النصارى على شيء وقالت النصارى ليست اليهود على شيء وهم يتلون الكتاب كذلك قال الذين لا يعلمون مثل قولهم فالله يحكم بينهم يوم القيامة فيما كانوا فيه يختلفون

translation: And who is more unjust than he who prohibits the mention of Allah's name in Allah's masjids and strives to ruin them? Those, it was not for them to enter them except in fear; for them, in this world, is disgrace and, in the Hereafter, a great punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of preventing the remembrance of Allah in His own houses of worship, emphasizing that such individuals will face severe consequences in both this life and the next, and will ultimately be denied the blessings of Allah's sacred spaces.
orig: ومن أظلم ممن منع مساجد الله أن يذكر فيها اسمه وسعى في خرابها أولئك ما كان لهم أن يدخلوها إلا خائفين لهم في الدنيا خزي ولهم في الآخرة عذاب عظيم

translation: And to Allah belong the east and the west, so wherever you turn, there is the Face of Allah; indeed, Allah is all-Encompassing, all-Knowing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the omnipresence of God, implying that wherever one turns, they will find God's presence, and that God's knowledge and power are not limited by geographical direction or physical location.
orig: ولله المشرق والمغرب فأينما تولوا فثم وجه الله إن الله واسع عليم

translation: And they say, 'Allah has taken a son.' Exalted is He! Rather, to Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth, all are obedient to Him.
interpretation: The verse highlights the absurdity of attributing a son to Allah, emphasizing His transcendence and lordship over all creation, implying that everything in the universe is under His control and submission.
orig: وقالوا اتخذ الله ولدا سبحانه بل له ما في السماوات والأرض كل له قانتون

translation: The Originator of the heavens and the earth! When He decrees a matter, He only says to it, 'Be,' and it is.
interpretation: The verse highlights the absolute power and authority of God, emphasizing that His will is instantly fulfilled, and His command is not subject to any delay or obstruction, implying that God's power is unmatched and unparalleled in the universe.
orig: بديع السماوات والأرض وإذا قضى أمرا فإنما يقول له كن فيكون

translation: And those who do not know say: 'Why does Allah not speak to us or there come to us a sign?' Thus spoke those before them, similar to their statement. Their hearts are alike. We have indeed made clear the signs for a people who are certain.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of faith and certainty in Allah's existence and signs, and how those who demand tangible proof of Allah's existence are similar to those who rejected the prophets in the past, ultimately leading to their downfall.
orig: وقال الذين لا يعلمون لولا يكلمنا الله أو تأتينا آية كذلك قال الذين من قبلهم مثل قولهم تشابهت قلوبهم قد بينا الآيات لقوم يوقنون

translation: Indeed, We have sent you with the truth as a bearer of good news and a warner, and you will not be asked about the companions of Hellfire.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the role of the Prophet as a messenger of God, who brings both good news of salvation to those who believe and a warning of punishment to those who reject the message, and ultimately, he will not be held accountable for those who reject the message and end up in Hellfire.
orig: إنا أرسلناك بالحق بشيرا ونذيرا ولا تسأل عن أصحاب الجحيم

translation: And never will the Jews nor the Christians be pleased with you until you follow their religion. Say, 'Indeed, the guidance of Allah is the [only] guidance.' If you were to follow their desires after what has come to you of knowledge, you would not have from Allah any protector or helper.
interpretation: This verse highlights the futility of seeking approval from others, especially when it comes to matters of faith, and emphasizes the importance of staying true to one's convictions and values, even in the face of opposition or disapproval from others.
orig: ولن ترضى عنك اليهود ولا النصارى حتى تتبع ملتهم قل إن هدى الله هو الهدى ولئن اتبعت أهواءهم بعد الذي جاءك من العلم ما لك من الله من ولي ولا نصير

translation: Those to whom We have given the Book, they recite it as it should be recited, they believe in it, and whoever disbelieves in it, those are the losers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of not only having access to divine guidance, but also truly understanding and living by it, for it is only those who internalize and act upon the teachings of the scripture who will be truly faithful and successful.
orig: الذين آتيناهم الكتاب يتلونه حق تلاوته أولئك يؤمنون به ومن يكفر به فأولئك هم الخاسرون

translation: O Children of Israel, remember My favor that I have bestowed upon you and that I preferred you over the worlds.
interpretation: The verse is a reminder to the Children of Israel of the special favors and blessings bestowed upon them by God, and how they were chosen above all other nations, implying a sense of responsibility and accountability to live up to the high standards expected of them.
orig: يا بني إسرائيل اذكروا نعمتي التي أنعمت عليكم وأني فضلتكم على العالمين

translation: And fear a Day when no soul will suffice for another soul at all, nor will intercession be accepted from it, nor will compensation be taken from it, nor will they be helped.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the concept of individual accountability, where each person will be responsible for their own actions and no one will be able to help or intercede on behalf of another, highlighting the importance of personal responsibility and moral agency.
orig: واتقوا يوما لا تجزي نفس عن نفس شيئا ولا يقبل منها عدل ولا تنفعها شفاعة ولا هم ينصرون

translation: And when Abraham was tried by his Lord with certain words, he fulfilled them. He said, 'Indeed, I will make you a leader for the people.' He said, 'And from my descendants?' He said, 'My covenant does not include the wrongdoers.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of being righteous and just, as only those who are free from wrongdoing will be included in God's covenant, implying that leadership and guidance are reserved for those who are morally upright.
orig: وإذ ابتلى إبراهيم ربه بكلمات فأتمهن قال إني جاعلك للناس إماما قال ومن ذريتي قال لا ينال عهدي الظالمين

translation: And when We made the House a place of visitation for the people and a sanctuary, and took the station of Ibrahim as a place of prayer, and We covenanted with Ibrahim and Ismail, saying, 'Purify My House for those who circumambulate, and those who retreat, and those who bow and prostrate.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of the Kaaba as a sacred space where people can connect with God, emphasizing the importance of spiritual purification and devotion, and reminding believers of their responsibility to maintain the sanctity of the House of God.
orig: وإذ جعلنا البيت مثابة للناس وأمنا واتخذوا من مقام إبراهيم مصلى وعهدنا إلى إبراهيم وإسماعيل أن طهرا بيتي للطائفين والعاكفين والركع السجود

translation: And when Ibrahim said: 'My Lord, make this city secure, and provide its people with fruits, such of them as believe in Allah and the Last Day.' He said: 'And whoever disbelieves, I will grant him enjoyment for a little while, then I will drive him to the torment of the Fire, and worst indeed is that destination.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of gratitude and faith in Allah, as Ibrahim's request for provision and security is conditional upon the people's belief in Allah and the Last Day, emphasizing that true prosperity and peace can only be achieved through righteousness and faith.
orig: وإذ قال إبراهيم رب اجعل هذا بلدا آمنا وارزق أهله من الثمرات من آمن منهم بالله واليوم الآخر قال ومن كفر فأمتعه قليلا ثم أضطره إلى عذاب النار وبئس المصير

translation: And [mention] when Ibrahim was raising the foundations of the House and [with him] Ismail, [saying], 'Our Lord, accept [this] from us. Indeed, You are the Hearing, the Knowing.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of humility and sincerity in one's actions, as Ibrahim and Ismail's prayer demonstrates their acknowledgement of their limitations and dependence on God's mercy and acceptance.
orig: وإذ يرفع إبراهيم القواعد من البيت وإسماعيل ربنا تقبل منا إنك أنت السميع العليم

translation: Our Lord, and make us submit to You, and from our descendants a nation submitting to You, and show us our ways of worship, and turn to us, indeed You are the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful.
interpretation: This verse is a heart-felt prayer for spiritual guidance, seeking God's mercy and forgiveness, and expressing a deep desire to live a life of obedience and devotion to God, and to pass on this legacy to future generations.
orig: ربنا واجعلنا مسلمين لك ومن ذريتنا أمة مسلمة لك وأرنا مناسكنا وتب علينا إنك أنت التواب الرحيم

translation: Our Lord, and send among them a Messenger from themselves who shall recite to them Your verses and teach them the Book and the Wisdom and purify them, indeed You are the Mighty, the Wise.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of a prophet or messenger who is from among the people themselves, emphasizing the significance of a relatable and accessible guide for spiritual growth and self-purification.
orig: ربنا وابعث فيهم رسولا منهم يتلو عليهم آياتك ويعلمهم الكتاب والحكمة ويزكيهم إنك أنت العزيز الحكيم

translation: And who turns away from the religion of Ibrahim except him who fools himself? And indeed, We chose him in this world, and indeed, he, in the Hereafter, is among the righteous.
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of following the righteous path of Prophet Ibrahim, emphasizing that deviating from it is a form of self-deception, and that those who follow his example will be rewarded with righteousness in the Hereafter.
orig: ومن يرغب عن ملة إبراهيم إلا من سفه نفسه ولقد اصطفيناه في الدنيا وإنه في الآخرة لمن الصالحين

translation: When his Lord said to him, 'Submit!', he said, 'I have submitted to the Lord of the Worlds.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of submission to God's will, which is the fundamental aspect of Islam, and how it is a natural response to God's command, demonstrating the believer's humility and obedience to their Creator.
orig: إذ قال له ربه أسلم قال أسلمت لرب العالمين

translation: And Abraham instructed his sons and Jacob, saying, 'O my sons, indeed Allah has chosen for you the religion, so do not die except as Muslims.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of adhering to the faith until the end of one's life, emphasizing that a true believer's commitment to Islam should be unwavering and unshakeable, even in the face of death.
orig: ووصى بها إبراهيم بنيه ويعقوب يا بني إن الله اصطفى لكم الدين فلا تموتن إلا وأنتم مسلمون

translation: Or were you witnesses when death approached Jacob, when he said to his sons, 'What will you worship after me?' They said, 'We will worship your God, the God of your fathers, Abraham, Ishmael, and Isaac, one God, and to Him we submit.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of the continuity of faith and the transmission of religious knowledge from one generation to the next, as exemplified by Jacob's concern for his sons' spiritual well-being even in his final moments.
orig: أم كنتم شهداء إذ حضر يعقوب الموت إذ قال لبنيه ما تعبدون من بعدي قالوا نعبد إلهك وإله آبائك إبراهيم وإسماعيل وإسحاق إلها واحدا ونحن له مسلمون

translation: That is a nation that has passed on; it shall have what it earned, and you shall have what you earn; and you shall not be questioned about what they used to do.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of individual responsibility, emphasizing that each person is accountable for their own actions and will be judged accordingly, without being held responsible for the actions of others.
orig: تلك أمة قد خلت لها ما كسبت ولكم ما كسبتم ولا تسألون عما كانوا يعملون

translation: And they say: 'Be Jews or Christians, then you will be guided.' Say: 'Nay, (we follow) the religion of Ibrahim, Hanifa, and he was not of the Mushrikun.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of following the pure and original faith of Prophet Ibrahim, which was free from polytheism and idolatry, and serves as a reminder to Muslims to adhere to the straight path and avoid the corrupting influences of other religions.
orig: وقالوا كونوا هودا أو نصارى تهتدوا قل بل ملة إبراهيم حنيفا وما كان من المشركين

translation: Say, 'We have believed in Allah and what was revealed to us and what was revealed to Ibrahim and Ismail and Ishaq and Yaqub and the Descendants and what was given to Musa and Isa and what was given to the prophets from their Lord. We make no distinction between any of them, and we are Muslims [in submission] to Him.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the unity of faith and the continuity of prophetic traditions, implying that the believers acknowledge and respect the divine revelations received by all prophets, without differentiating between them, and submit to the will of God, affirming their commitment to the faith.
orig: قولوا آمنا بالله وما أنزل إلينا وما أنزل إلى إبراهيم وإسماعيل وإسحاق ويعقوب والأسباط وما أوتي موسى وعيسى وما أوتي النبيون من ربهم لا نفرق بين أحد منهم ونحن له مسلمون

translation: If they believe as you believe, then they are guided, and if they turn away, then they are only in opposition, and Allah will suffice you against them, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of faith and trust in God, emphasizing that if others believe as the believers do, they will be guided, but if they turn away, God will be sufficient to protect and defend the believers.
orig: فإن آمنوا بمثل ما آمنتم به فقد اهتدوا وإن تولوا فإنما هم في شقاق فسيكفيكهم الله وهو السميع العليم

translation: The Baptism of Allah, and who is better than Allah in baptism, and we are His worshippers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the uniqueness and superiority of Allah's guidance and direction, implying that no one can provide a more comprehensive and perfect way of life than Allah, and that true believers acknowledge and submit to His will.
orig: صبغة الله ومن أحسن من الله صبغة ونحن له عابدون

translation: Say, 'Do you argue with us about Allah while He is our Lord and your Lord? For us are our deeds and for you are your deeds. We are sincere to Him.'
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the futility of arguing with believers about God, highlighting the personal nature of one's relationship with Him, and the individual accountability for one's actions.
orig: قل أتحاجوننا في الله وهو ربنا وربكم ولنا أعمالنا ولكم أعمالكم ونحن له مخلصون

translation: Or do you say that Ibrahim and Ismail and Ishaq and Yaqub and the tribes were Jews or Christians? Say: 'Do you know better or Allah? And who is more unjust than he who conceals a testimony he has from Allah? And Allah is not unaware of what you do.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of submitting to God's will and revelation, rather than relying on one's own judgment or tradition, as it is God who has the ultimate knowledge and wisdom.
orig: أم تقولون إن إبراهيم وإسماعيل وإسحاق ويعقوب والأسباط كانوا هودا أو نصارى قل أأنتم أعلم أم الله ومن أظلم ممن كتم شهادة عنده من الله وما الله بغافل عما تعملون

translation: That is a nation that has passed on. It will have [the consequence of] what it earned, and you will have what you have earned. And you will not be asked about what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of personal responsibility, where every individual is accountable for their own actions and will be judged accordingly, without being held responsible for the actions of others.
orig: تلك أمة قد خلت لها ما كسبت ولكم ما كسبتم ولا تسألون عما كانوا يعملون

translation: The foolish among the people will say: 'What has turned them from their Qiblah which they were facing?' Say: 'To Allah belong the East and the West, He guides whom He wills to a straight path'
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that God's guidance is not limited by geographical direction or physical orientation, emphasizing that true guidance comes from God alone, and that He guides those whom He wills, regardless of their physical location or direction of prayer.
orig: سيقول السفهاء من الناس ما ولاهم عن قبلتهم التي كانوا عليها قل لله المشرق والمغرب يهدي من يشاء إلى صراط مستقيم

translation: And thus We have made you a moderate nation that you will be witnesses over the people and the Messenger will be a witness over you. And We did not make the qiblah which you used to face except to know who follows the Messenger from those who turn back on their heels. And indeed, it was a great trial except for those whom Allah guided. And Allah would not waste your faith. Indeed, Allah is to the people Kind and Merciful.
