interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of the Muslim community as a moderate and balanced nation, serving as a model for humanity, and emphasizes the importance of following the Prophet's guidance, as those who turn away from it will face trial and hardship, while those who remain faithful will be rewarded with Allah's mercy.
orig: وكذلك جعلناكم أمة وسطا لتكونوا شهداء على الناس ويكون الرسول عليكم شهيدا وما جعلنا القبلة التي كنت عليها إلا لنعلم من يتبع الرسول ممن ينقلب على عقبيه وإن كانت لكبيرة إلا على الذين هدى الله وما كان الله ليضيع إيمانكم إن الله بالناس لرءوف رحيم

translation: Many will see you turning your face towards the sky, then We will turn you to a Qiblah that will please you. Turn then your face in the direction of the Sacred Mosque, and wherever you are, turn your faces towards it. Those who have been given the Book know that it is the truth from their Lord, and Allah is not unaware of what they do.
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of the Qiblah, the direction of prayer, as a symbol of unity and obedience to God, and reminds believers that their actions are always under God's watchful eye.
orig: قد نرى تقلب وجهك في السماء فلنولينك قبلة ترضاها فول وجهك شطر المسجد الحرام وحيث ما كنتم فولوا وجوهكم شطره وإن الذين أوتوا الكتاب ليعلمون أنه الحق من ربهم وما الله بغافل عما يعملون

translation: And even if you were to bring to those who were given the Scripture every sign, they would not follow your direction; and you do not follow their direction; and some of them do not follow the direction of others. And if you were to follow their desires after what has come to you of knowledge, indeed, you would then be among the wrongdoers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of trying to convince those who are stubbornly opposed to the truth, and the importance of staying firm in one's convictions, rather than compromising with those who reject the guidance that has been revealed.
orig: ولئن أتيت الذين أوتوا الكتاب بكل آية ما تبعوا قبلتك وما أنت بتابع قبلتهم وما بعضهم بتابع قبلة بعض ولئن اتبعت أهواءهم من بعد ما جاءك من العلم إنك إذا لمن الظالمين

translation: Those to whom We have given the Scripture recognize it as they recognize their own sons; but indeed a party of them conceal the truth while they know.
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of some people who have been given the Scripture, as they deliberately conceal the truth despite having knowledge of it, and this concealment is a clear indication of their dishonesty.
orig: الذين آتيناهم الكتاب يعرفونه كما يعرفون أبناءهم وإن فريقا منهم ليكتمون الحق وهم يعلمون

translation: The truth is from your Lord, so do not be among the doubters.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of having faith in the revelation from God, and warns against doubting the truth, which can lead to spiritual confusion and ultimately, deviation from the right path.
orig: الحق من ربك فلا تكونن من الممترين

translation: And for every nation there is a direction to which they turn, so hasten to good deeds wherever you are, God will bring you all together, indeed God is over all things competent.
interpretation: The verse suggests that every individual or community has a unique spiritual direction or orientation, and that they should strive to do good deeds regardless of their geographical location, as ultimately God will bring all people together and judge their actions.
orig: ولكل وجهة هو موليها فاستبقوا الخيرات أين ما تكونوا يأت بكم الله جميعا إن الله على كل شيء قدير

translation: And from wherever you go out, turn your face towards the Sacred Mosque, and indeed, it is the truth from your Lord. And Allah is not unaware of what you do.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of facing the Sacred Mosque in prayer, symbolizing the unity and direction of the Muslim community, and serves as a reminder that God is always aware of human actions, implying that one's deeds will be accounted for.
orig: ومن حيث خرجت فول وجهك شطر المسجد الحرام وإنه للحق من ربك وما الله بغافل عما تعملون

translation: And from wherever you went out, turn your face towards the Sacred Mosque, and wherever you are, turn your faces towards it, lest the people should have an argument against you, except those of them who did wrong; so do not fear them, but fear Me, and so that I may complete My favor upon you and that you may be guided.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of obedience to God's commands, in this case, the change of the direction of prayer from Jerusalem to the Sacred Mosque in Mecca, and warns against fearing the opposition of others, instead, one should fear God and trust in His guidance and favor.
orig: ومن حيث خرجت فول وجهك شطر المسجد الحرام وحيث ما كنتم فولوا وجوهكم شطره لئلا يكون للناس عليكم حجة إلا الذين ظلموا منهم فلا تخشوهم واخشوني ولأتم نعمتي عليكم ولعلكم تهتدون

translation: Just as We have sent among you a Messenger from yourselves, reciting to you Our verses and purifying you and teaching you the Book and wisdom and teaching you what you did not know.
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of the Prophet Muhammad's role as a teacher and guide, emphasizing that he was sent to educate and purify the believers, and to impart wisdom and knowledge that they previously lacked, thereby elevating their spiritual and intellectual understanding.
orig: كما أرسلنا فيكم رسولا منكم يتلو عليكم آياتنا ويزكيكم ويعلمكم الكتاب والحكمة ويعلمكم ما لم تكونوا تعلمون

translation: So remember Me, I will remember you, and be grateful to Me and do not be ungrateful to Me.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the reciprocal nature of the relationship between God and humanity, where God's remembrance and blessings are contingent upon humanity's remembrance and gratitude towards Him, highlighting the importance of gratitude and obedience in maintaining a strong connection with the divine.
orig: فاذكروني أذكركم واشكروا لي ولا تكفرون

translation: O you who have believed, seek help through patience and prayer. Indeed, Allah is with the patient.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of patience and prayer in times of hardship, and assures believers that God is always with those who persevere and remain steadfast in their faith.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا استعينوا بالصبر والصلاة إن الله مع الصابرين

translation: And do not say about those who are killed in the way of Allah, 'They are dead.' Rather, they are alive, but you do not perceive.
interpretation: This verse highlights the honorable status of martyrs in Islam, emphasizing that they are not dead, but rather alive in the presence of God, and their souls are in a state of bliss, even though their physical bodies may have perished.
orig: ولا تقولوا لمن يقتل في سبيل الله أموات بل أحياء ولكن لا تشعرون

translation: And We will surely test you with something of fear and hunger and a loss of wealth and lives and crops, but give good tidings to the patient ones.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of patience in the face of adversity, implying that those who persevere through trials and hardships will be rewarded with good tidings, suggesting that their patience will ultimately lead to a favorable outcome.
orig: ولنبلونكم بشيء من الخوف والجوع ونقص من الأموال والأنفس والثمرات وبشر الصابرين

translation: Those who, when a disaster strikes them, say, 'Indeed we belong to Allah, and to Him we will return.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the attitude of believers in the face of calamity, demonstrating their trust in God's sovereignty and their acceptance of His will, which is a hallmark of their spiritual maturity and submission to Him.
orig: الذين إذا أصابتهم مصيبة قالوا إنا لله وإنا إليه راجعون

translation: Those are they on whom are blessings from their Lord and mercy, and those are the guided ones.
interpretation: The verse highlights the special status of those who have received God's blessings and mercy, implying that they have been chosen for a higher purpose and are being guided towards a righteous path.
orig: أولئك عليهم صلوات من ربهم ورحمة وأولئك هم المهتدون

translation: Indeed, as-Safa and al-Marwah are among the symbols of Allah. So whoever performs Hajj to the House or performs Umrah, there is no blame upon him for walking between them. And whoever volunteers good - then indeed, Allah is Appreciative and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of humility and obedience to God's commands, emphasizing that performing rituals such as walking between as-Safa and al-Marwah is an act of devotion and submission to God's will, and that God is aware of and appreciative of such acts of righteousness.
orig: إن الصفا والمروة من شعائر الله فمن حج البيت أو اعتمر فلا جناح عليه أن يطوف بهما ومن تطوع خيرا فإن الله شاكر عليم

translation: Verily, those who conceal what We have sent down of the clear signs and the guidance after We have made it clear to the people in the Book, those are cursed by Allah and cursed by those who curse.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of concealing divine guidance and truth, implying that those who do so are not only cursed by God but also by others who are aware of their deceit, emphasizing the severity of the consequences of hiding the truth.
orig: إن الذين يكتمون ما أنزلنا من البينات والهدى من بعد ما بيناه للناس في الكتاب أولئك يلعنهم الله ويلعنهم اللاعنون

translation: Except for those who repent, reform, and make clear. Those - I will accept their repentance, and I am the Accepting, the Merciful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of sincere repentance and reformation, emphasizing that God's mercy is available to those who genuinely turn away from their wrongdoings and make amends, and that He is always willing to accept their repentance and forgive them.
orig: إلا الذين تابوا وأصلحوا وبينوا فأولئك أتوب عليهم وأنا التواب الرحيم

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieved and died while they were disbelievers - upon them is the curse of Allah and the angels and the people, all together.
interpretation: The verse highlights the severity of God's wrath towards those who reject faith and die in a state of disbelief, implying that their fate is sealed and that they will face eternal punishment.
orig: إن الذين كفروا وماتوا وهم كفار أولئك عليهم لعنة الله والملائكة والناس أجمعين

translation: Abiding therein, the punishment shall not be lightened for them, nor shall they be reprieved.
interpretation: The verse highlights the eternal nature of punishment in the afterlife, emphasizing that the torment will be relentless and unending, with no respite or reprieve for the sinners.
orig: خالدين فيها لا يخفف عنهم العذاب ولا هم ينظرون

translation: And your God is one God, there is no god except He, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the unity and uniqueness of God, asserting that there is only one God, who is full of mercy and compassion, and that He is the only one worthy of worship and devotion.
orig: وإلهكم إله واحد لا إله إلا هو الرحمن الرحيم

translation: Indeed, in the creation of the heavens and the earth and the alternation of night and day, and the ships which sail through the sea with that which benefits people, and what Allah has sent down from the sky of rain, and gave life thereby to the earth after its death, and dispersed therein every kind of moving creature, and the directing of the winds and the clouds that are driven between the sky and the earth, are signs for a people who understand.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of contemplation and reflection on the signs of God's creation, which are evident in the natural world, and emphasizes that these signs are only appreciated by those who possess intellect and understanding.
orig: إن في خلق السماوات والأرض واختلاف الليل والنهار والفلك التي تجري في البحر بما ينفع الناس وما أنزل الله من السماء من ماء فأحيا به الأرض بعد موتها وبث فيها من كل دابة وتصريف الرياح والسحاب المسخر بين السماء والأرض لآيات لقوم يعقلون

translation: And of the people are some who take others besides Allah as rivals, loving them as they should love Allah, but those who believe are stronger in love for Allah, and if the wrongdoers could see, when they see the punishment, that the power belongs entirely to Allah, and that Allah is severe in punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the intensity of the believers' love for God, which surpasses their love for anything or anyone else, and serves as a reminder of God's absolute power and authority, which will be manifest on the Day of Judgment when the wrongdoers will realize their mistake.
orig: ومن الناس من يتخذ من دون الله أندادا يحبونهم كحب الله والذين آمنوا أشد حبا لله ولو يرى الذين ظلموا إذ يرون العذاب أن القوة لله جميعا وأن الله شديد العذاب

translation: When those who were followed will disown those who followed, and they will see the punishment, and the bonds between them will be cut off.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of worldly relationships and alliances in the face of divine judgment, where even those who were once close will disown each other, and the only thing that will matter is one's individual accountability before God.
orig: إذ تبرأ الذين اتبعوا من الذين اتبعوا ورأوا العذاب وتقطعت بهم الأسباب

translation: And those who followed said, 'If only we could return [to the world], we would disassociate ourselves from them, just as they have disassociated themselves from us.' Thus Allah will show them their deeds, and they will regret them, and they will not come out of the Fire.
interpretation: The verse highlights the regret and remorse that the followers of misguided leaders will experience in the afterlife, when they realize their mistakes and wish they could go back in time to correct them, but it will be too late and they will be trapped in the Fire.
orig: وقال الذين اتبعوا لو أن لنا كرة فنتبرأ منهم كما تبرءوا منا كذلك يريهم الله أعمالهم حسرات عليهم وما هم بخارجين من النار

translation: O mankind, eat from what is lawful and good on earth and do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of living a righteous life by consuming only what is permissible and good, and avoiding the influences of Satan, who is a clear enemy of humanity, seeking to lead people astray from the path of righteousness.
orig: يا أيها الناس كلوا مما في الأرض حلالا طيبا ولا تتبعوا خطوات الشيطان إنه لكم عدو مبين

translation: He only orders you to evil and lewdness, and that you should say about Allah what you do not know.
interpretation: The verse highlights the deceitful nature of Satan, who encourages people to engage in evil and immoral behavior, and to attribute false statements to God, which they have no knowledge of, thus leading people astray from the right path.
orig: إنما يأمركم بالسوء والفحشاء وأن تقولوا على الله ما لا تعلمون

translation: And when it is said to them: 'Follow what Allah has sent down', they say: 'Nay, we shall follow what we found our fathers following', even though their fathers did not understand anything nor were they guided.
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to blindly follow their ancestors' traditions and customs, even if they are wrong, rather than following the truth and guidance revealed by God, indicating a lack of critical thinking and a strong attachment to cultural heritage.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم اتبعوا ما أنزل الله قالوا بل نتبع ما ألفينا عليه آباءنا أولو كان آباؤهم لا يعقلون شيئا ولا يهتدون

translation: And the example of those who disbelieve is like the one who shouts at one who hears nothing except calls and cries, deaf, dumb, and blind, so they do not understand.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of trying to guide those who have deliberately closed their minds and hearts to the truth, and are thus unable to comprehend or respond to the call to faith.
orig: ومثل الذين كفروا كمثل الذي ينعق بما لا يسمع إلا دعاء ونداء صم بكم عمي فهم لا يعقلون

translation: O you who have believed, eat from the good things We have provided for you and be grateful to Allah if it is [indeed] Him that you worship.
interpretation: The verse encourages believers to appreciate and express gratitude for the blessings and provisions they receive from God, as a way of acknowledging and honoring their relationship with Him.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا كلوا من طيبات ما رزقناكم واشكروا لله إن كنتم إياه تعبدون

translation: He has only forbidden to you dead animals, and blood, and the flesh of swine, and that which has been dedicated to other than Allah, but whoever is forced, not rebelling, nor transgressing, there is no sin upon him. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's mercy and forgiveness towards those who are forced to eat forbidden food out of necessity, as long as they do not rebel or transgress, indicating that Allah's laws are not meant to be harsh or punitive, but rather to guide humanity towards a righteous path.
orig: إنما حرم عليكم الميتة والدم ولحم الخنزير وما أهل به لغير الله فمن اضطر غير باغ ولا عاد فلا إثم عليه إن الله غفور رحيم

translation: Indeed, those who conceal what Allah has revealed of the Book and exchange it for a small price - those will not eat except the Fire in their bellies. Allah will not speak to them on the Day of Resurrection, nor will He purify them. And they will have a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse suggests that those who distort or hide the truth of God's revelation for personal gain will be punished severely, implying that their corruption will ultimately consume them from within, leaving them with a sense of emptiness and despair.
orig: إن الذين يكتمون ما أنزل الله من الكتاب ويشترون به ثمنا قليلا أولئك ما يأكلون في بطونهم إلا النار ولا يكلمهم الله يوم القيامة ولا يزكيهم ولهم عذاب أليم

translation: Those are the ones who have bought delusion at the price of guidance, and torment at the price of forgiveness, so how can they endure the Fire?
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of spiritual transaction, where individuals trade their spiritual well-being for worldly gains, ultimately leading to their downfall and inability to withstand the punishment of Hellfire.
orig: أولئك الذين اشتروا الضلالة بالهدى والعذاب بالمغفرة فما أصبرهم على النار

translation: That is because Allah has sent down the Book with the truth, and indeed, those who differed over the Book are in a far-reaching dissension.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of adhering to the divine revelation, emphasizing that those who deviate from the truth and engage in disputes over the Book will ultimately find themselves in a state of profound discord and confusion.
orig: ذلك بأن الله نزل الكتاب بالحق وإن الذين اختلفوا في الكتاب لفي شقاق بعيد

translation: Righteousness is not that you turn your faces towards the east or the west, but righteousness is the one who believes in Allah and the Last Day and the Angels and the Book and the Prophets, and gives wealth, in spite of love for it, to the near relatives, the orphans, the needy, the traveler, and the beggars, and for freeing slaves, and establishes prayer and gives zakah, and the fulfillers of their covenant when they make a covenant, and the patient in poverty and hardship and during battle. Those are the ones who are truthful, and those are the righteous.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes that true righteousness is not about external rituals or superficial actions, but rather about having a deep faith in God and demonstrating it through acts of kindness, generosity, and compassion towards others, while also being steadfast and patient in the face of adversity.
orig: ليس البر أن تولوا وجوهكم قبل المشرق والمغرب ولكن البر من آمن بالله واليوم الآخر والملائكة والكتاب والنبيين وآتى المال على حبه ذوي القربى واليتامى والمساكين وابن السبيل والسائلين وفي الرقاب وأقام الصلاة وآتى الزكاة والموفون بعهدهم إذا عاهدوا والصابرين في البأساء والضراء وحين البأس أولئك الذين صدقوا وأولئك هم المتقون

translation: O you who have believed, prescribed for you is retaliation in cases of murder - the free for the free, the slave for the slave, and the female for the female. But if anyone remits the revenge by way of charity, it is an act of atonement for him. And whoever vengeance is forgone, and he is compensated with good, then that is a relief from your Lord and a mercy. And whoever transgresses after that, then for him is a painful punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of justice and the need for balance in punishment, emphasizing that the punishment should fit the crime, and that forgiveness and atonement are also acceptable alternatives, reflecting God's mercy and desire for human rehabilitation.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا كتب عليكم القصاص في القتلى الحر بالحر والعبد بالعبد والأنثى بالأنثى فمن عفي له من أخيه شيء فاتباع بالمعروف وأداء إليه بإحسان ذلك تخفيف من ربكم ورحمة فمن اعتدى بعد ذلك فله عذاب أليم

translation: And there is life for you in retaliation, O you who possess intellect, that you may become righteous.
interpretation: The verse suggests that the principle of retaliation, or an eye for an eye, is a means of preserving life and promoting righteousness, as it deters people from committing crimes and encourages them to live in a state of mutual respect and fear of God.
orig: ولكم في القصاص حياة يا أولي الألباب لعلكم تتقون

translation: It is prescribed for you when death approaches one of you, if he leaves wealth, that the will should be for parents and near relatives, a duty upon the righteous.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of fulfilling the rights of parents and relatives, even in one's final moments, as a demonstration of righteousness and a commitment to justice and fairness.
orig: كتب عليكم إذا حضر أحدكم الموت إن ترك خيرا الوصية للوالدين والأقربين بالمعروف حقا على المتقين

translation: And whoever changes it after he has heard it, the sin is only upon those who change it. Indeed, Allah is Hearing, Knowing.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of preserving the authenticity of divine revelations and warnings, and that any alterations or distortions will be held accountable by God, emphasizing His all-knowing and all-hearing nature.
orig: فمن بدله بعدما سمعه فإنما إثمه على الذين يبدلونه إن الله سميع عليم

translation: And if someone fears a breach between two people, and makes peace between them, there is no blame on him. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of reconciliation and forgiveness in resolving conflicts, and that those who work towards peace and harmony will be rewarded by God's forgiveness and mercy.
orig: فمن خاف من موص جنفا أو إثما فأصلح بينهم فلا إثم عليه إن الله غفور رحيم

translation: O you who have believed, fasting has been prescribed for you as it was prescribed for those before you, so that you may become righteous.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of self-reflection and spiritual growth through the practice of fasting, highlighting its role in helping believers develop a sense of righteousness and moral consciousness.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا كتب عليكم الصيام كما كتب على الذين من قبلكم لعلكم تتقون

translation: For a limited number of days. And whoever among you is ill or on a journey, the same number of days later. And on those who are able to do so, there is a ransom, the feeding of a poor person. And whoever volunteers good, it is better for him. And to fast is better for you, if you only knew.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of self-reflection and self-control, as it allows individuals to develop a stronger connection with God and to understand their own limitations and weaknesses, ultimately leading to spiritual growth and a deeper understanding of oneself and one's relationship with God.
orig: أياما معدودات فمن كان منكم مريضا أو على سفر فعدة من أيام أخر وعلى الذين يطيقونه فدية طعام مسكين فمن تطوع خيرا فهو خير له وأن تصوموا خير لكم إن كنتم تعلمون

translation: The month of Ramadan in which was revealed the Quran, a guidance for the people, and clear proofs of the guidance and the criterion. So whoever among you witnesses the month, let him fast it. And whoever is ill or on a journey, then an equal number of other days. Allah intends for you ease and does not intend for you hardship and that you complete the count and that you magnify Allah for what He has guided you and that you be grateful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of Ramadan as a month of spiritual growth and gratitude, where Muslims are encouraged to fast and reflect on the guidance and blessings received from God, and to express their gratitude for the revelation of the Quran.
orig: شهر رمضان الذي أنزل فيه القرآن هدى للناس وبينات من الهدى والفرقان فمن شهد منكم الشهر فليصمه ومن كان مريضا أو على سفر فعدة من أيام أخر يريد الله بكم اليسر ولا يريد بكم العسر ولتكملوا العدة ولتكبروا الله على ما هداكم ولعلكم تشكرون

translation: And when My servants ask you about Me, then I am near. I respond to the invocation of the supplicant when he calls on Me, so let them respond to Me and believe in Me, so that they may be guided.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes God's proximity to humanity, implying that He is always available to respond to their prayers and invocations, and that He desires a personal relationship with each individual, guiding them towards righteousness and faith.
orig: وإذا سألك عبادي عني فإني قريب أجيب دعوة الداع إذا دعان فليستجيبوا لي وليؤمنوا بي لعلهم يرشدون

translation: Permitted to you, on the night of fasting, is the approach to your wives. They are your garments and you are their garments. Allah knows what you used to do secretly among yourselves, so He turned to you and forgave you. So now, have relations with them and seek that which Allah has ordained for you, and eat and drink until the white thread of dawn appears to you distinct from the black thread, then complete your fast till nightfall. And do not have relations with them while you are devoted to the mosques. These are the limits of Allah, so do not approach them. Thus Allah makes clear His verses to the people that they may become righteous.
interpretation: The verse is highlighting the importance of self-control and moderation in seeking pleasure, even in lawful matters like marital relationships, in order to maintain a balance between physical and spiritual needs, and to prioritize spiritual growth and righteousness.
orig: أحل لكم ليلة الصيام الرفث إلى نسائكم هن لباس لكم وأنتم لباس لهن علم الله أنكم كنتم تختانون أنفسكم فتاب عليكم وعفا عنكم فالآن باشروهن وابتغوا ما كتب الله لكم وكلوا واشربوا حتى يتبين لكم الخيط الأبيض من الخيط الأسود من الفجر ثم أتموا الصيام إلى الليل ولا تباشروهن وأنتم عاكفون في المساجد تلك حدود الله فلا تقربوها كذلك يبين الله آياته للناس لعلهم يتقون

translation: And do not consume one another's wealth unjustly, and do not bribe the rulers that you may consume a portion of people's wealth sinfully, while you know.
interpretation: This verse is a warning against corruption and bribery, emphasizing the importance of fairness and transparency in financial transactions and dealings with those in authority.
orig: ولا تأكلوا أموالكم بينكم بالباطل وتدلوا بها إلى الحكام لتأكلوا فريقا من أموال الناس بالإثم وأنتم تعلمون

translation: They ask you about the crescent moons. Say: 'They are timings for the people and for the Hajj. And it is not righteousness that you enter the houses from their backs, but righteousness is he who fears God, so enter the houses from their doors, and fear God that you may be successful.'
interpretation: The verse emphasizes that true righteousness is not about outward actions, but about having a sincere fear of God, and that is what leads to success.
orig: يسألونك عن الأهلة قل هي مواقيت للناس والحج وليس البر بأن تأتوا البيوت من ظهورها ولكن البر من اتقى وأتوا البيوت من أبوابها واتقوا الله لعلكم تفلحون

translation: And fight in the way of Allah those who fight you, but do not transgress; indeed, Allah does not love the transgressors.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of self-defense in the face of aggression, while also warning against exceeding the limits of justice and committing atrocities, as God does not approve of those who transgress.
orig: وقاتلوا في سبيل الله الذين يقاتلونكم ولا تعتدوا إن الله لا يحب المعتدين

translation: And kill them wherever you find them, and turn them out from where they have turned you out. And Fitnah is worse than killing. And do not fight them at Al-Masjid Al-Haram until they fight you there. But if they fight you, then kill them. Such is the recompense of the disbelievers.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of self-defense and fighting against oppression, highlighting that persecution and Fitnah (persecution or trial) can be a greater evil than physical killing, and that Muslims should not hesitate to defend themselves when attacked, even in a sacred place like the Al-Masjid Al-Haram.
orig: واقتلوهم حيث ثقفتموهم وأخرجوهم من حيث أخرجوكم والفتنة أشد من القتل ولا تقاتلوهم عند المسجد الحرام حتى يقاتلوكم فيه فإن قاتلوكم فاقتلوهم كذلك جزاء الكافرين

translation: But if they desist, then indeed, Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
interpretation: This verse conveys the idea that God is always willing to forgive and show mercy to those who repent and abandon their sinful ways, highlighting the importance of seeking forgiveness and turning to God in humility.
orig: فإن انتهوا فإن الله غفور رحيم

translation: And fight them until there is no more tumult or oppression, and there prevail justice and faith in Allah; if they cease, let there be no hostility except to those who practice oppression.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of fighting against oppression and persecution, and that the ultimate goal is to establish justice and faith in Allah, and that those who practice oppression are the ones who will face hostility.
orig: وقاتلوهم حتى لا تكون فتنة ويكون الدين لله فإن انتهوا فلا عدوان إلا على الظالمين

translation: The sacred month for the sacred month, and for the prohibited things, retaliation. And whoever transgresses against you, transgress against him in similar manner as he transgressed against you, and fear Allah and know that Allah is with the righteous.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of reciprocity in response to aggression, but also cautions against excessive retaliation, as it is tempered by the need to fear Allah and be mindful of His presence with the righteous.
orig: الشهر الحرام بالشهر الحرام والحرمات قصاص فمن اعتدى عليكم فاعتدوا عليه بمثل ما اعتدى عليكم واتقوا الله واعلموا أن الله مع المتقين

translation: And spend in the cause of Allah and do not throw [yourselves] with your [own] hands to destruction. And do good; indeed, Allah loves the doers of good.
interpretation: The verse encourages believers to be mindful of their actions, as they have the power to bring about their own downfall or success, and reminds them that Allah rewards those who do good and are mindful of their actions.
orig: وأنفقوا في سبيل الله ولا تلقوا بأيديكم إلى التهلكة وأحسنوا إن الله يحب المحسنين

translation: And complete the Hajj and 'Umrah for Allah. And if you are prevented, then [offer] what can be obtained with ease of sacrifice. And do not shave your heads until the sacrifice has reached its place. And whoever among you is ill or has an ailment of the head, then [as a ransom] a fasting or a charity or a sacrifice. And when you are secure, then whoever performs 'Umrah [during the Hajj] then [offer] what can be obtained with ease of sacrifice. And whoever cannot, then [fasting] three days in the Hajj and seven when you have returned. Those are ten complete [days]. That [is for] those whose family is not present at the Sacred Mosque. And fear Allah and know that Allah is severe in punishment.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of fulfilling one's religious obligations, specifically the Hajj and 'Umrah, and reminds believers that Allah is severe in punishment, implying that those who neglect their duties will face consequences.
orig: وأتموا الحج والعمرة لله فإن أحصرتم فما استيسر من الهدي ولا تحلقوا رءوسكم حتى يبلغ الهدي محله فمن كان منكم مريضا أو به أذى من رأسه ففدية من صيام أو صدقة أو نسك فإذا أمنتم فمن تمتع بالعمرة إلى الحج فما استيسر من الهدي فمن لم يجد فصيام ثلاثة أيام في الحج وسبعة إذا رجعتم تلك عشرة كاملة ذلك لمن لم يكن أهله حاضري المسجد الحرام واتقوا الله واعلموا أن الله شديد العقاب

translation: The Hajj is [in] months well-known. So, whoever has made Hajj obligatory upon himself therein, there is [to be for him] no sexual relations and no disobedience and no disputing during the Hajj. And whatever good you do - Allah knows it. And take provisions, but indeed, the best provision is fear of Allah. And fear Me, O you of understanding.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of spiritual preparation and moral purity during the Hajj pilgrimage, highlighting that the true provision for the journey is not material goods, but rather the fear of Allah, which is the key to a successful and meaningful pilgrimage.
orig: الحج أشهر معلومات فمن فرض فيهن الحج فلا رفث ولا فسوق ولا جدال في الحج وما تفعلوا من خير يعلمه الله وتزودوا فإن خير الزاد التقوى واتقون يا أولي الألباب

translation: There is no blame upon you that you seek bounty from your Lord. So when you depart from Arafat, remember Allah at the Sacred Monument. And remember Him, as He has guided you, for indeed, you were of those astray.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of gratitude and remembrance of God's guidance, emphasizing that seeking God's bounty and remembering Him is a way to express gratitude for His guidance, which is a fundamental aspect of the spiritual journey.
orig: ليس عليكم جناح أن تبتغوا فضلا من ربكم فإذا أفضتم من عرفات فاذكروا الله عند المشعر الحرام واذكروه كما هداكم وإن كنتم من قبله لمن الضالين

translation: Then go forth from where the people forth went, and ask forgiveness of Allah; indeed, Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
interpretation: The verse is encouraging the believers to learn from the mistakes of those who came before them and to seek forgiveness from Allah, emphasizing Allah's infinite mercy and forgiveness.
orig: ثم أفيضوا من حيث أفاض الناس واستغفروا الله إن الله غفور رحيم

translation: And when you have performed your acts of devotion, remember Allah as you remember your forefathers, or with even more remembrance. So among mankind is he who says: 'Our Lord, give us in this world,' and he has no portion in the Hereafter.
interpretation: The verse highlights the contrast between those who focus on the worldly gains and those who prioritize the Hereafter, implying that true devotion to Allah should not be driven by worldly desires, but rather by a sincere desire to please Him in the eternal life.
orig: فإذا قضيتم مناسككم فاذكروا الله كذكركم آباءكم أو أشد ذكرا فمن الناس من يقول ربنا آتنا في الدنيا وما له في الآخرة من خلاق

translation: And there are some who say: 'Our Lord, give us in this world that which is good and in the Hereafter that which is good, and save us from the punishment of the Fire.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of having a balanced approach to life, where an individual seeks goodness and blessings in both this world and the next, while also being conscious of the consequences of their actions and seeking protection from the punishment of the Hereafter.
orig: ومنهم من يقول ربنا آتنا في الدنيا حسنة وفي الآخرة حسنة وقنا عذاب النار

translation: Those, they will have their portion of what they earned, and Allah is swift in reckoning.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that individuals will be rewarded or punished according to their actions, and that God's judgment is swift and certain, implying that one's deeds will be accounted for promptly and accurately.
orig: أولئك لهم نصيب مما كسبوا والله سريع الحساب

translation: And remember Allah in limited days. Whoever hastens to two days, there is no sin upon him. And whoever delays, there is no sin upon him, for one who fears Allah. Fear Allah and know that you will be gathered unto Him.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of prioritizing one's spiritual growth and accountability to God, especially during sacred times, and reminds believers that their ultimate goal is to return to God, emphasizing the need for mindfulness and righteousness in their daily lives.
orig: واذكروا الله في أيام معدودات فمن تعجل في يومين فلا إثم عليه ومن تأخر فلا إثم عليه لمن اتقى واتقوا الله واعلموا أنكم إليه تحشرون

translation: And among mankind is he who impresses you with his speech in the life of this world, and he calls Allah to witness what is in his heart, yet he is the most bitter in opposition.
interpretation: This verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who use their eloquent speech to deceive others, while their hearts are filled with hatred and opposition, demonstrating the disconnect between their words and actions.
orig: ومن الناس من يعجبك قوله في الحياة الدنيا ويشهد الله على ما في قلبه وهو ألد الخصام

translation: And when he goes away, he strives in the earth to cause corruption therein and to destroy the crops and the offspring. And Allah does not love corruption.
interpretation: This verse highlights the destructive nature of humanity when left unchecked, and how it can lead to chaos and devastation, not only harming the individual but also the environment and future generations, which is against the will of God who loves order and harmony.
orig: وإذا تولى سعى في الأرض ليفسد فيها ويهلك الحرث والنسل والله لا يحب الفساد

translation: And when it is said to him, 'Fear Allah', pride carries him off to sin, so Hell will be his due, and how evil a bed!
interpretation: The verse highlights the stubbornness of those who refuse to listen to advice and instead allow their pride to consume them, leading them down a path of sin and ultimately, to their downfall.
orig: وإذا قيل له اتق الله أخذته العزة بالإثم فحسبه جهنم ولبئس المهاد

translation: And there are some people who sell themselves seeking the pleasure of Allah, and Allah is Kind to His slaves.
interpretation: The verse highlights the selflessness and devotion of those who sacrifice their own interests and desires for the sake of pleasing God, and in return, God showers them with kindness and compassion.
orig: ومن الناس من يشري نفسه ابتغاء مرضات الله والله رءوف بالعباد

translation: O you who have believed, enter into Islam completely and do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of fully embracing Islam and avoiding the temptations of Satan, who is a clear and declared enemy of humanity, and whose influence can lead people astray from the path of righteousness.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا ادخلوا في السلم كافة ولا تتبعوا خطوات الشيطان إنه لكم عدو مبين

translation: Then if you slide back after the clear proofs have come to you, then know that Allah is All-Mighty, All-Wise.
interpretation: The verse serves as a warning to believers that if they revert to their old ways after having received clear guidance from God, they will be reminded of God's power and wisdom, implying that God will not hesitate to take action against those who deliberately reject the truth.
orig: فإن زللتم من بعد ما جاءتكم البينات فاعلموا أن الله عزيز حكيم

translation: Do they wait except that Allah comes to them in shades of clouds, and the angels, and the matter is decided? And to Allah all matters return.
interpretation: The verse highlights the inevitability of God's judgment and the futility of human attempts to delay or escape it, emphasizing that all matters ultimately return to God for reckoning and justice.
orig: هل ينظرون إلا أن يأتيهم الله في ظلل من الغمام والملائكة وقضي الأمر وإلى الله ترجع الأمور

translation: O Children of Israel, how many a clear sign have We given you, and whoever changes the blessing of Allah after it has come to him, then Allah is severe in punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of gratitude and appreciation for the blessings and favors bestowed upon the Children of Israel, warning them that any attempts to alter or reject these blessings will be met with severe punishment from Allah, emphasizing the gravity of ingratitude and disobedience.
orig: سل بني إسرائيل كم آتيناهم من آية بينة ومن يبدل نعمة الله من بعد ما جاءته فإن الله شديد العقاب

translation: More pleasant is the life of this world for those who disbelieve, and they ridicule those who believe. And those who are pious will be above them on the Day of Resurrection. And Allah provides for whom He wills without measure.
interpretation: The verse highlights the contrast between the fleeting joys of this life and the eternal rewards of the hereafter, emphasizing that true superiority belongs to the pious who will be exalted on the Day of Judgment.
orig: زين للذين كفروا الحياة الدنيا ويسخرون من الذين آمنوا والذين اتقوا فوقهم يوم القيامة والله يرزق من يشاء بغير حساب

translation: Mankind was one community, and Allah sent Prophets with good news and warnings, and with them He sent down the Scripture with truth that He might judge between people in that in which they differed, and only those who were given it differed about it after the clear proofs came to them, out of envy among themselves, and Allah guided those who believed to the truth about which they had differed, by His permission, and Allah guides whom He wills to a Straight Path.
interpretation: The verse highlights the unity of humanity and the role of prophets in guiding people to the truth, emphasizing that the differences and conflicts among people arise from their own desires and envy, rather than from any deficiency in the divine guidance.
orig: كان الناس أمة واحدة فبعث الله النبيين مبشرين ومنذرين وأنزل معهم الكتاب بالحق ليحكم بين الناس فيما اختلفوا فيه وما اختلف فيه إلا الذين أوتوه من بعد ما جاءتهم البينات بغيا بينهم فهدى الله الذين آمنوا لما اختلفوا فيه من الحق بإذنه والله يهدي من يشاء إلى صراط مستقيم

translation: Or do you think that you will enter Paradise while there has not yet befallen you the like of what befell those who have passed on before you? They were afflicted with hardship and suffering, and were so shaken that the Messenger and those who believed with him said, 'When will the help of Allah come?' Yes, indeed, the help of Allah is near.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of patience and perseverance in the face of adversity, as believers will inevitably face trials and hardships, just as those who came before them did, but ultimately, God's help and victory are always near.
orig: أم حسبتم أن تدخلوا الجنة ولما يأتكم مثل الذين خلوا من قبلكم مستهم البأساء والضراء وزلزلوا حتى يقول الرسول والذين آمنوا معه متى نصر الله ألا إن نصر الله قريب

translation: They ask you what they should spend. Say: 'Whatever you spend of good, it is for the parents, and the near of kin, and the orphans, and the needy, and the wayfarer. And whatever good you do, Allah is All-Aware of it.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of charitable spending, emphasizing that one's wealth should be used to benefit family, relatives, and the disadvantaged, and that God is fully aware of all good deeds.
orig: يسألونك ماذا ينفقون قل ما أنفقتم من خير فللوالدين والأقربين واليتامى والمساكين وابن السبيل وما تفعلوا من خير فإن الله به عليم

translation: Fighting has been prescribed for you, and it is hateful to you, but it may be that you dislike a thing which is good for you and that you love a thing which is bad for you, and Allah knows while you do not know.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of obeying God's commands, even if they go against our personal desires or inclinations, as God's wisdom and knowledge are far greater than ours.
orig: كتب عليكم القتال وهو كره لكم وعسى أن تكرهوا شيئا وهو خير لكم وعسى أن تحبوا شيئا وهو شر لكم والله يعلم وأنتم لا تعلمون

translation: They ask you about the sacred month - about fighting in it. Say, 'Fighting in it is a great transgression, and hindering from the path of Allah, and disbelieving in Him, and the Sacred Mosque, and expelling its people from it, is greater at Allah. And persecution is greater than killing. And they will not cease to fight you until they turn you back from your religion if they can. And whoever of you reverts from his religion and dies while he is a disbeliever - for those, their deeds have become worthless in this world and the Hereafter. And those are the companions of the Fire, wherein they will abide forever.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of persecution and forced apostasy, emphasizing that these acts are even more heinous than murder, as they seek to eradicate one's faith and identity.
orig: يسألونك عن الشهر الحرام قتال فيه قل قتال فيه كبير وصد عن سبيل الله وكفر به والمسجد الحرام وإخراج أهله منه أكبر عند الله والفتنة أكبر من القتل ولا يزالون يقاتلونكم حتى يردوكم عن دينكم إن استطاعوا ومن يرتدد منكم عن دينه فيمت وهو كافر فأولئك حبطت أعمالهم في الدنيا والآخرة وأولئك أصحاب النار هم فيها خالدون

translation: Indeed, those who have believed and those who have emigrated and striven in the cause of Allah - those expect the mercy of Allah. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of not only believing in God, but also taking action in His cause, such as emigrating and striving, in order to attain God's mercy and forgiveness.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا والذين هاجروا وجاهدوا في سبيل الله أولئك يرجون رحمت الله والله غفور رحيم

translation: They ask you about wine and gambling. Say, 'In them is great sin and [yet, some] benefit for people. But their sin is greater than their benefit.' And they ask you what they should spend. Say, 'The excess [beyond needs].' Thus God clarifies to you the verses that you might reflect.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of moderation and balance in life, as it emphasizes that while there may be some benefits to certain activities, their negative consequences can far outweigh their benefits, and thus one must be cautious and mindful of the consequences of their actions.
orig: يسألونك عن الخمر والميسر قل فيهما إثم كبير ومنافع للناس وإثمهما أكبر من نفعهما ويسألونك ماذا ينفقون قل العفو كذلك يبين الله لكم الآيات لعلكم تتفكرون

translation: In this world and in the Hereafter. And they ask you about orphans. Say: 'Reform for them is best, and if you mix with them, then they are your brothers. And Allah knows the corrupter from the reformer. And if Allah had willed, He would have put you into difficulty. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Power, Wise.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of treating orphans with kindness and justice, and warns against corrupting them, as Allah is all-knowing and all-powerful, and will hold people accountable for their actions.
orig: في الدنيا والآخرة ويسألونك عن اليتامى قل إصلاح لهم خير وإن تخالطوهم فإخوانكم والله يعلم المفسد من المصلح ولو شاء الله لأعنتكم إن الله عزيز حكيم

translation: And do not marry polytheistic women until they believe. A believing slave woman is better than a polytheistic woman, even if she attracts you. And do not marry polytheistic men until they believe. A believing slave is better than a polytheistic man, even if he attracts you. Those invite to the Fire, and Allah invites to the Paradise and the forgiveness by His permission, and He makes clear His signs to the people so that they may remember.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of prioritizing faith and morality in personal relationships, emphasizing that a believing partner, even if of a lower social status, is more desirable than a non-believing one, regardless of their outward attractiveness.
orig: ولا تنكحوا المشركات حتى يؤمن ولأمة مؤمنة خير من مشركة ولو أعجبتكم ولا تنكحوا المشركين حتى يؤمنوا ولعبد مؤمن خير من مشرك ولو أعجبكم أولئك يدعون إلى النار والله يدعو إلى الجنة والمغفرة بإذنه ويبين آياته للناس لعلهم يتذكرون

translation: They ask you about menstruation. Say, 'It is harm, so keep away from wives during menstruation and do not approach them until they are clean. Then come to them from where Allah has commanded you. Indeed, Allah loves those who are constantly repentant and loves those who purify themselves.'
interpretation: The verse teaches that spiritual purification is closely linked to physical purification, and that one's spiritual state is reflected in their physical cleanliness, emphasizing the importance of maintaining both physical and spiritual purity in one's relationship with God and with others.
orig: ويسألونك عن المحيض قل هو أذى فاعتزلوا النساء في المحيض ولا تقربوهن حتى يطهرن فإذا تطهرن فأتوهن من حيث أمركم الله إن الله يحب التوابين ويحب المتطهرين

translation: Your women are a tilth for you, so go to your tilth when or how you will, and send (good deeds) before you for yourselves, and fear Allah and know that you will (all) meet Him. Give good tidings to the believers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of righteous deeds and the fear of God in one's personal and marital life, emphasizing that a believer's ultimate goal is to meet God and that righteous living will lead to a blissful encounter with Him.
orig: نساؤكم حرث لكم فأتوا حرثكم أنى شئتم وقدموا لأنفسكم واتقوا الله واعلموا أنكم ملاقوه وبشر المؤمنين

translation: And do not make [your] oaths by God an excuse not to do good and fear God and reconcile between people. And God is Hearing, Knowing.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of not using oaths as an excuse to avoid doing good deeds and reconciling with others, and instead, to prioritize fear of God and maintenance of good relationships with people.
orig: ولا تجعلوا الله عرضة لأيمانكم أن تبروا وتتقوا وتصلحوا بين الناس والله سميع عليم

translation: Allah will not call you to account for thoughtlessness in your oaths, but He will call you to account for what your hearts have earned. And Allah is Ever-Forgiving, Most Forbearing.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of intention and sincerity in one's actions, emphasizing that it is not the careless words or oaths that matter, but rather the true intentions and motivations of the heart, which will be judged by God.
orig: لا يؤاخذكم الله باللغو في أيمانكم ولكن يؤاخذكم بما كسبت قلوبكم والله غفور حليم

translation: Those who take an oath for abstention from their wives shall wait for four months, and if they return, then Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of reconciliation in marital disputes, emphasizing that even in cases where husbands have taken an oath to abstain from their wives, there is still an opportunity for forgiveness and mercy from God if they choose to return to their wives.
orig: للذين يؤلون من نسائهم تربص أربعة أشهر فإن فاءوا فإن الله غفور رحيم

translation: And if they decide on divorce, then indeed, Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
interpretation: The verse is reassuring the believers that even in the difficult situation of divorce, God is fully aware of their circumstances and is always listening to their prayers and concerns.
orig: وإن عزموا الطلاق فإن الله سميع عليم

translation: And divorced women shall wait by themselves for three courses; and it is not lawful for them to conceal what Allah hath created in their wombs, if they believe in Allah and the Last Day. And their husbands have the better right to take them back in that period, if they wish for reconciliation. And women shall have rights similar to the obligations upon them, according to what is reasonable. And men have a degree over them. And Allah is Exalted in Power, Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of reconciliation in marital disputes, giving the husband the opportunity to take his wife back during the waiting period, and highlighting the role of men as guardians and protectors of women, while also acknowledging the rights and dignity of women.
orig: والمطلقات يتربصن بأنفسهن ثلاثة قروء ولا يحل لهن أن يكتمن ما خلق الله في أرحامهن إن كن يؤمن بالله واليوم الآخر وبعولتهن أحق بردهن في ذلك إن أرادوا إصلاحا ولهن مثل الذي عليهن بالمعروف وللرجال عليهن درجة والله عزيز حكيم

translation: Divorce is twice, then [either] retention with kindness or release with goodness. And it is not lawful for you to take back anything you have given them unless both fear that they may not be able to keep [within] the limits of Allah. And if you fear that they will not keep [within] the limits of Allah, then there is no blame upon them concerning that by which she ransoms herself. These are the limits of Allah, so do not transgress them. And whoever transgresses the limits of Allah - it is those who are the wrongdoers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of respecting the limits and boundaries set by God, particularly in the context of divorce, and warns against transgressing those limits, emphasizing that those who do so are wrongdoers.
orig: الطلاق مرتان فإمساك بمعروف أو تسريح بإحسان ولا يحل لكم أن تأخذوا مما آتيتموهن شيئا إلا أن يخافا ألا يقيما حدود الله فإن خفتم ألا يقيما حدود الله فلا جناح عليهما فيما افتدت به تلك حدود الله فلا تعتدوها ومن يتعد حدود الله فأولئك هم الظالمون

translation: Then if he divorces her, she shall not be lawful to him after that, until she marries another husband; and if he divorces her, then there is no blame on them that they may reunite, if they think that they can observe the limits of Allah; and these are the limits of Allah, He makes them clear for a people who know.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of reconciliation in marital relationships, emphasizing that even after divorce, there is still a chance for reuniting if both partners are willing to work within the boundaries set by Allah, and that this reunion is not only permissible but also desirable if it means maintaining the sanctity of marriage and family.
orig: فإن طلقها فلا تحل له من بعد حتى تنكح زوجا غيره فإن طلقها فلا جناح عليهما أن يتراجعا إن ظنا أن يقيما حدود الله وتلك حدود الله يبينها لقوم يعلمون

translation: And when you divorce women, and they reach their term, then retain them with kindness or release them with kindness. Do not retain them to harm them, intending to transgress. Whoever does that has certainly wronged himself. Do not take the verses of Allah in mockery. Remember the favor of Allah upon you and what has been revealed to you of the Book and wisdom, by which He instructs you. Fear Allah and know that Allah is Knowing of all things.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of treating divorced women with kindness and respect, and not using divorce as a means to harm or oppress them, as this would be a form of self-oppression and a sin against oneself.
orig: وإذا طلقتم النساء فبلغن أجلهن فأمسكوهن بمعروف أو سرحوهن بمعروف ولا تمسكوهن ضرارا لتعتدوا ومن يفعل ذلك فقد ظلم نفسه ولا تتخذوا آيات الله هزوا واذكروا نعمت الله عليكم وما أنزل عليكم من الكتاب والحكمة يعظكم به واتقوا الله واعلموا أن الله بكل شيء عليم

translation: And when you divorce women, and they reach their term, do not prevent them from marrying their husbands if they agree among themselves in a fair manner. This is advised to whoever among you believes in Allah and the Last Day. That is better and purer for you. And Allah knows, but you do not know.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of fairness and mutual agreement in marital relationships, emphasizing that believers should prioritize righteousness and purity in their dealings, trusting in Allah's knowledge and wisdom rather than their own limited understanding.
orig: وإذا طلقتم النساء فبلغن أجلهن فلا تعضلوهن أن ينكحن أزواجهن إذا تراضوا بينهم بالمعروف ذلك يوعظ به من كان منكم يؤمن بالله واليوم الآخر ذلكم أزكى لكم وأطهر والله يعلم وأنتم لا تعلمون

translation: And the mothers shall give suck to their children for two whole years, for him who desires to complete the term of suckling; and on him who has had the bringing forth is the mother's provision and her clothing according to usage; no soul is tasked except to its capacity; no mother shall be treated unfairly on account of her child, nor father on account of his child, and on the heir is incumbent the like of that; then if they both desire weaning, by mutual consent and counsel, there is no blame on them; and if you wish to have your children suckled, there is no blame on you, if you pay what is due from you with kindness and if you are careful of your duty to Allah, then know that Allah is Seer of what you do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of mutual understanding and cooperation between parents in matters related to childcare, highlighting the need for fairness and kindness in their dealings with each other and with their children, and reminding them that Allah is aware of all their actions.
orig: والوالدات يرضعن أولادهن حولين كاملين لمن أراد أن يتم الرضاعة وعلى المولود له رزقهن وكسوتهن بالمعروف لا تكلف نفس إلا وسعها لا تضار والدة بولدها ولا مولود له بولده وعلى الوارث مثل ذلك فإن أرادا فصالا عن تراض منهما وتشاور فلا جناح عليهما وإن أردتم أن تسترضعوا أولادكم فلا جناح عليكم إذا سلمتم ما آتيتم بالمعروف واتقوا الله واعلموا أن الله بما تعملون بصير

translation: And those who are taken in death among you and leave behind wives, they (the wives) shall wait by themselves for four months and ten (days). Then, when they have fulfilled their term, there is no blame on you in what they do with themselves in a decent manner. And Allah is All-Aware of what you do.
interpretation: The verse is emphasizing the importance of patience and self-control during times of grief and loss, as exemplified by the widows who are instructed to wait for a certain period before remarrying, and it highlights the need for believers to conduct themselves with dignity and modesty in all aspects of their lives.
orig: والذين يتوفون منكم ويذرون أزواجا يتربصن بأنفسهن أربعة أشهر وعشرا فإذا بلغن أجلهن فلا جناح عليكم فيما فعلن في أنفسهن بالمعروف والله بما تعملون خبير

translation: And there is no blame upon you in what you have proposed of a marriage contract to women or what you have concealed within yourselves. Allah knows that you will remember them, but do not make a secret contract with them except for a saying that is known. And do not resolve on the marriage tie until the writing reaches its term. And know that Allah knows what is in your souls, so beware of Him. And know that Allah is Forgiving, Gentle.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of sincerity and transparency in one's intentions, particularly in matters of marriage, and serves as a reminder that God is aware of one's inner thoughts and desires, encouraging individuals to be mindful of their actions and to cultivate a sense of accountability before God.
orig: ولا جناح عليكم فيما عرضتم به من خطبة النساء أو أكننتم في أنفسكم علم الله أنكم ستذكرونهن ولكن لا تواعدوهن سرا إلا أن تقولوا قولا معروفا ولا تعزموا عقدة النكاح حتى يبلغ الكتاب أجله واعلموا أن الله يعلم ما في أنفسكم فاحذروه واعلموا أن الله غفور حليم

translation: There is no sin on you if you divorce women whom you have not touched nor specified the dower for them, and to make provision for them, the wealthy according to his means and the poor according to his means, a provision according to the acceptable, a duty upon the good-doers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of fair treatment of women during divorce, highlighting the responsibility of men to provide for their wives, regardless of their financial situation, and promoting a sense of justice and compassion in marital relationships.
orig: لا جناح عليكم إن طلقتم النساء ما لم تمسوهن أو تفرضوا لهن فريضة ومتعوهن على الموسع قدره وعلى المقتر قدره متاعا بالمعروف حقا على المحسنين

translation: And if you divorce them before you have touched them and you have appointed for them a dower, then [give] half of what you have appointed, unless they forego it or he in whose hand is the marriage tie foregoes it. And to forego is nearer to righteousness. And do not forget graciousness between you. Indeed, Allah is Seeing of what you do.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of fairness and generosity in marital relationships, encouraging husbands to show graciousness and kindness to their wives, even in the event of divorce, as a means of cultivating a sense of righteousness and earning God's approval.
orig: وإن طلقتموهن من قبل أن تمسوهن وقد فرضتم لهن فريضة فنصف ما فرضتم إلا أن يعفون أو يعفو الذي بيده عقدة النكاح وأن تعفوا أقرب للتقوى ولا تنسوا الفضل بينكم إن الله بما تعملون بصير

translation: Guard strictly the prayers and the middle prayer, and stand before Allah in devotion.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of establishing a strong connection with Allah through prayer, specifically the middle prayer, which is considered a crucial part of one's spiritual routine, and encourages believers to approach Allah with humility and sincerity.
orig: حافظوا على الصلوات والصلاة الوسطى وقوموا لله قانتين

translation: And if you fear, then (pray) on foot or riding, but when you are secure, then remember Allah as He has taught you what you did not know.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of gratitude and remembrance of God's blessings, especially during times of peace and security, as it is easy to forget God's favors during such times, and it is crucial to acknowledge and thank Him for the knowledge and blessings He has bestowed upon us.
orig: فإن خفتم فرجالا أو ركبانا فإذا أمنتم فاذكروا الله كما علمكم ما لم تكونوا تعلمون

translation: And those who are taken in death among you and leave behind wives, a bequest for their wives, provision for a year without turning them out; but if they go out, there is no blame on you for what they do with themselves in a fair manner, and Allah is Exalted in Power, Wise.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of treating widows with kindness and respect, ensuring their well-being and protection, and allowing them to move on with their lives in a dignified manner, free from blame or restriction.
orig: والذين يتوفون منكم ويذرون أزواجا وصية لأزواجهم متاعا إلى الحول غير إخراج فإن خرجن فلا جناح عليكم في ما فعلن في أنفسهن من معروف والله عزيز حكيم

translation: And for the divorced women, maintenance (should be given) on reasonable (scale), a duty upon the righteous.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of taking care of the financial needs of divorced women, highlighting the responsibility of the community, particularly the righteous, to ensure their welfare and dignity.
orig: وللمطلقات متاع بالمعروف حقا على المتقين

translation: Thus Allah makes clear to you His verses so that you may understand.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of contemplation and reflection, implying that understanding and wisdom can only be attained by pondering over the signs and verses of God.
orig: كذلك يبين الله لكم آياته لعلكم تعقلون

translation: Have you not seen those who went forth from their homes, and they were thousands, fearing death? Allah said to them, 'Die!' And then He brought them to life. Indeed, Allah is full of bounty to the people, but most of the people do not give thanks.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of gratitude towards God's blessings, as many people tend to take them for granted, and instead of being thankful, they become arrogant and unappreciative.
orig: ألم تر إلى الذين خرجوا من ديارهم وهم ألوف حذر الموت فقال لهم الله موتوا ثم أحياهم إن الله لذو فضل على الناس ولكن أكثر الناس لا يشكرون

translation: And fight in the way of Allah and know that Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of fighting in the way of Allah, not for personal gain or glory, but with the understanding that Allah is watching and aware of all actions, and will judge accordingly.
orig: وقاتلوا في سبيل الله واعلموا أن الله سميع عليم

translation: Who is it that will lend Allah a good loan, so He will multiply it for him many times over? And Allah is the One who withholds and grants abundance, and to Him you will return.
interpretation: The verse is encouraging believers to spend their wealth in the way of Allah, promising a multiplied reward in return, and reminding them that Allah is the ultimate provider and sustainer of all things, and that all will ultimately return to Him.
orig: من ذا الذي يقرض الله قرضا حسنا فيضاعفه له أضعافا كثيرة والله يقبض ويبسط وإليه ترجعون

translation: Have you not seen the council of the Children of Israel after Moses, when they said to a prophet of theirs, 'Appoint for us a king, that we may fight in the way of God.' He said, 'Would you perhaps refrain from fighting if fighting was prescribed for you?' They said, 'Why should we not fight in the way of God, when we have been driven out of our homes and our children?' But when fighting was prescribed for them, they turned away, except for a few of them. And God is aware of the wrongdoers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of the Children of Israel, who demanded a king to lead them in battle, but when the time came to fight, they refused, revealing their lack of commitment to their cause and their true nature as cowards.
orig: ألم تر إلى الملإ من بني إسرائيل من بعد موسى إذ قالوا لنبي لهم ابعث لنا ملكا نقاتل في سبيل الله قال هل عسيتم إن كتب عليكم القتال ألا تقاتلوا قالوا وما لنا ألا نقاتل في سبيل الله وقد أخرجنا من ديارنا وأبنائنا فلما كتب عليهم القتال تولوا إلا قليلا منهم والله عليم بالظالمين

translation: And their Prophet said to them, 'Indeed, Allah has appointed Talut as a king over you.' They said, 'How can he have kingship over us when we are more worthy of kingship than him and he has not been given an abundance of wealth?' He said, 'Indeed, Allah has chosen him over you and has given him an abundance of knowledge and physical strength. And Allah gives His kingdom to whom He wills. And Allah is All-Encompassing, All-Knowing.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of God's choice and wisdom in selecting leaders, emphasizing that true leadership is not based on wealth or social status, but rather on God's selection and granting of knowledge and strength to those He chooses.
orig: وقال لهم نبيهم إن الله قد بعث لكم طالوت ملكا قالوا أنى يكون له الملك علينا ونحن أحق بالملك منه ولم يؤت سعة من المال قال إن الله اصطفاه عليكم وزاده بسطة في العلم والجسم والله يؤتي ملكه من يشاء والله واسع عليم

translation: And their prophet said to them, 'Indeed, a sign of his kingship is that the chest will come to you in which is assurance from your Lord and a remnant of what the family of Moses and the family of Aaron had left behind, carried by the angels. Indeed, in that is a sign for you if you are believers.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of faith in the divine signs and miracles, which serve as a means of strengthening one's belief and trust in God's power and wisdom.
orig: وقال لهم نبيهم إن آية ملكه أن يأتيكم التابوت فيه سكينة من ربكم وبقية مما ترك آل موسى وآل هارون تحمله الملائكة إن في ذلك لآية لكم إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: And when Saul went forth with the army, he said, 'Indeed, Allah will be testing you with a river. So whoever drinks from it is not of me, and whoever does not taste it is indeed of me, except for him who takes a handful thereof.' But they drank from it, except for a few of them. And when he crossed it, he and those who believed with him, they said, 'We have no power today against Goliath and his armies.' But those who were certain that they would meet Allah said, 'How many a small company has overcome a large company by permission of Allah. And Allah is with the patient.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of perseverance and trust in God, emphasizing that even a small group of believers can overcome a larger force with God's permission, as long as they remain patient and steadfast in their faith.
orig: فلما فصل طالوت بالجنود قال إن الله مبتليكم بنهر فمن شرب منه فليس مني ومن لم يطعمه فإنه مني إلا من اغترف غرفة بيده فشربوا منه إلا قليلا منهم فلما جاوزه هو والذين آمنوا معه قالوا لا طاقة لنا اليوم بجالوت وجنوده قال الذين يظنون أنهم ملاقو الله كم من فئة قليلة غلبت فئة كثيرة بإذن الله والله مع الصابرين

translation: And when they went forth to [face] Goliath and his armies, they said, 'Our Lord, pour forth upon us patience and make firm our feet and give us victory over the disbelieving people.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of seeking God's help and guidance in times of crisis, and the need to ask for patience, steadfastness, and victory when facing adversity.
orig: ولما برزوا لجالوت وجنوده قالوا ربنا أفرغ علينا صبرا وثبت أقدامنا وانصرنا على القوم الكافرين

translation: So they routed them by the permission of Allah, and Dawud (David) killed Jalut (Goliath), and Allah gave him (Dawud) the kingdom and wisdom, and taught him of that which He willed. And if it were not for Allah checking one set of people by means of another, the earth would indeed be full of mischief. But Allah is full of bounty to all the worlds.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of Allah's intervention in human affairs, as without it, the forces of evil would prevail and the earth would be corrupted, emphasizing Allah's role in maintaining balance and order in the world.
orig: فهزموهم بإذن الله وقتل داوود جالوت وآتاه الله الملك والحكمة وعلمه مما يشاء ولولا دفع الله الناس بعضهم ببعض لفسدت الأرض ولكن الله ذو فضل على العالمين

translation: Those are the verses of Allah which We recite to you in truth, and indeed you are of the messengers.
interpretation: The verse is a reminder to the Prophet Muhammad that the revelations he is receiving are the words of Allah, and that he is among the select group of messengers chosen by Allah to convey His message to humanity.
orig: تلك آيات الله نتلوها عليك بالحق وإنك لمن المرسلين

translation: Those messengers, We preferred some of them over others; among them were those to whom Allah spoke, and He raised some of them in degrees. And We gave Isa, the son of Maryam, clear signs and supported him with the Holy Spirit. If Allah had willed, those who came after them would not have fought each other after the clear signs had come to them, but they differed; among them were those who believed and among them were those who disbelieved. If Allah had willed, they would not have fought each other, but Allah does what He wills.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of divine predetermination, emphasizing that God's will is supreme and that He does what He wills, and that human beings, despite their differences and conflicts, are ultimately subject to His decree.
orig: تلك الرسل فضلنا بعضهم على بعض منهم من كلم الله ورفع بعضهم درجات وآتينا عيسى ابن مريم البينات وأيدناه بروح القدس ولو شاء الله ما اقتتل الذين من بعدهم من بعد ما جاءتهم البينات ولكن اختلفوا فمنهم من آمن ومنهم من كفر ولو شاء الله ما اقتتلوا ولكن الله يفعل ما يريد

translation: O you who have believed, spend from that which We have provided for you before a Day comes when there will be no bargaining, nor friendship, nor intercession. And the disbelievers - they are the wrongdoers.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of using one's wealth and resources for the sake of God while one still can, before the Day of Judgment, when it will be too late to make amends or seek forgiveness.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا أنفقوا مما رزقناكم من قبل أن يأتي يوم لا بيع فيه ولا خلة ولا شفاعة والكافرون هم الظالمون

translation: Allah, there is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of [all] existence. Neither drowsiness overtakes Him nor sleep. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who is it that can intercede with Him except by His permission? He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, and they encompass not a thing of His knowledge except for what He wills. His Kursi extends over the heavens and the earth, and their preservation does not tire Him. And He is the Most High, the Most Great.
interpretation: The verse highlights the absolute power and authority of Allah, emphasizing that He is the sole sustainer of all existence, and that His knowledge and power are beyond human comprehension, and that He is not limited by human frailties like sleep or drowsiness.
orig: الله لا إله إلا هو الحي القيوم لا تأخذه سنة ولا نوم له ما في السماوات وما في الأرض من ذا الذي يشفع عنده إلا بإذنه يعلم ما بين أيديهم وما خلفهم ولا يحيطون بشيء من علمه إلا بما شاء وسع كرسيه السماوات والأرض ولا يئوده حفظهما وهو العلي العظيم

translation: There is no compulsion in religion. The right direction is henceforth distinct from error. And he who rejecteth the transgressor and believeth in Allah hath grasped a firm handle that will not break. And Allah is Hearer, Knower.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of freedom of choice in religious matters, highlighting that faith cannot be forced upon someone, but rather it is a personal decision that requires conviction and commitment.
orig: لا إكراه في الدين قد تبين الرشد من الغي فمن يكفر بالطاغوت ويؤمن بالله فقد استمسك بالعروة الوثقى لا انفصام لها والله سميع عليم

translation: God is the Guardian of those who believe, He brings them out of the darkness into the light, and those who disbelieve, their guardians are the Taghut, they bring them out of the light into the darkness, those are the companions of the Fire, they will abide in it forever.
interpretation: This verse highlights the contrast between the guidance and protection provided by God to the believers, and the misguidance and deception inflicted by the forces of evil on the disbelievers, emphasizing the eternal consequences of each path.
orig: الله ولي الذين آمنوا يخرجهم من الظلمات إلى النور والذين كفروا أولياؤهم الطاغوت يخرجونهم من النور إلى الظلمات أولئك أصحاب النار هم فيها خالدون

translation: Have you not seen him who disputed with Ibrahim about his Lord, because Allah had given him the kingdom? When Ibrahim said: 'My Lord is He Who gives life and causes death.' He said: 'I give life and cause death.' Ibrahim said: 'Verily, Allah brings the sun from the east, then bring it from the west.' So the disbeliever was utterly defeated. And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of human arrogance and the limitations of human power, as exemplified by the story of Ibrahim and the king who claimed to have the power of life and death, demonstrating the ultimate power and sovereignty of God.
orig: ألم تر إلى الذي حاج إبراهيم في ربه أن آتاه الله الملك إذ قال إبراهيم ربي الذي يحيي ويميت قال أنا أحيي وأميت قال إبراهيم فإن الله يأتي بالشمس من المشرق فأت بها من المغرب فبهت الذي كفر والله لا يهدي القوم الظالمين

translation: Or like the one who passed by a town, and it had fallen on its roofs. He said: 'How will Allah bring it to life after its death?' So Allah caused him to die for a hundred years, then raised him to life. He said: 'How long did you remain?' He replied: 'I remained a day or part of a day.' He said: 'Nay, you have remained for a hundred years. Look at your food and drink, they show no change, and look at your donkey, and We will make you a sign for the people. Look at the bones, how We raise them and cover them with flesh.' When it became clear to him, he said: 'I know that Allah has power over all things.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the power of God to resurrect and revive even the dead and the destroyed, and that He is capable of bringing life to what is dead and destroyed, just as He brought back to life the person who was dead for a hundred years, and restored his donkey and his food, which remained fresh and unchanged.
orig: أو كالذي مر على قرية وهي خاوية على عروشها قال أنى يحيي هذه الله بعد موتها فأماته الله مائة عام ثم بعثه قال كم لبثت قال لبثت يوما أو بعض يوم قال بل لبثت مائة عام فانظر إلى طعامك وشرابك لم يتسنه وانظر إلى حمارك ولنجعلك آية للناس وانظر إلى العظام كيف ننشزها ثم نكسوها لحما فلما تبين له قال أعلم أن الله على كل شيء قدير

translation: And when Ibrahim said: 'My Lord! Show me how You give life to the dead.' He said: 'Do you not believe?' He said: 'Yes, but to be strengthened in faith.' He said: 'Take four birds, and cause them to incline towards you, then place a part of each on every mountain, then call them, they will come to you in haste, and know that Allah is All-Mighty, All-Wise.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of spiritual growth and the need to continually seek a deeper understanding of one's faith, even for a prophet like Ibrahim, who was already a firm believer, demonstrating that even the most righteous individuals can always benefit from a stronger connection with God.
orig: وإذ قال إبراهيم رب أرني كيف تحيي الموتى قال أولم تؤمن قال بلى ولكن ليطمئن قلبي قال فخذ أربعة من الطير فصرهن إليك ثم اجعل على كل جبل منهن جزءا ثم ادعهن يأتينك سعيا واعلم أن الله عزيز حكيم

translation: The likeness of those who spend their wealth in the way of Allah is as the likeness of a grain that grows seven ears, in each ear a hundred grains. And Allah multiplies for whom He wills. And Allah is All-Encompassing, All-Knowing.
interpretation: The verse highlights the boundless rewards that await those who spend their wealth in the way of Allah, implying that their charitable acts will yield exponential benefits, symbolizing the infinite blessings and mercy of Allah.
orig: مثل الذين ينفقون أموالهم في سبيل الله كمثل حبة أنبتت سبع سنابل في كل سنبلة مائة حبة والله يضاعف لمن يشاء والله واسع عليم

translation: Those who spend their wealth in the cause of Allah, and then do not follow what they have spent with reminders of their generosity or with injury, their reward is with their Lord, and there is no fear for them, nor will they grieve.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of sincerity in charitable acts, emphasizing that true generosity is not about seeking praise or recognition, but about selflessly giving for the sake of God, without expecting anything in return, and without causing harm to others.
orig: الذين ينفقون أموالهم في سبيل الله ثم لا يتبعون ما أنفقوا منا ولا أذى لهم أجرهم عند ربهم ولا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: A kind word and forgiveness are better than a charity followed by injury, and Allah is Free of need and Forbearing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of kindness and forgiveness in our interactions with others, suggesting that these qualities are more valuable than even charitable acts, especially when they are accompanied by hurtful behavior, and that God's nature is characterized by self-sufficiency and patience.
orig: قول معروف ومغفرة خير من صدقة يتبعها أذى والله غني حليم

translation: O you who have believed, do not invalidate your charities with reminders and injury, like one who spends his wealth to be seen by the people and does not believe in Allah and the Last Day. His example is like that of a smooth rock on which is dust, and then it is hit by a heavy rain that leaves it bare. They are not able to do anything with what they have earned. And Allah does not guide the disbelieving people.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of sincerity in one's charitable acts, warning that if they are accompanied by reminders of one's generosity and causing harm to others, they become worthless in the eyes of God, and the person performing them is no better than an unbeliever, unable to benefit from their deeds in the hereafter.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تبطلوا صدقاتكم بالمن والأذى كالذي ينفق ماله رئاء الناس ولا يؤمن بالله واليوم الآخر فمثله كمثل صفوان عليه تراب فأصابه وابل فتركه صلدا لا يقدرون على شيء مما كسبوا والله لا يهدي القوم الكافرين
