translation: And the likeness of those who spend their wealth seeking Allah's pleasure, and for the strengthening of their souls, is as a garden on a high ground, upon which descends a heavy rain, and it yields its produce twofold; if it does not receive a heavy rain, then a light rain; and Allah is All-Seer of what you do.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of spending one's wealth in the way of Allah, as it brings about spiritual growth and purification, just like a garden that flourishes and yields abundant produce when nourished by rain, symbolizing the blessings and rewards that come from Allah.
orig: ومثل الذين ينفقون أموالهم ابتغاء مرضات الله وتثبيتا من أنفسهم كمثل جنة بربوة أصابها وابل فآتت أكلها ضعفين فإن لم يصبها وابل فطل والله بما تعملون بصير

translation: Would any of you wish to have a garden of palm trees and grapes, with rivers flowing beneath, and he has old age and weak offspring, then it is hit by a whirlwind containing fire, and it is burned. Thus Allah makes clear to you the verses so that you may reflect.
interpretation: The verse illustrates how worldly desires and possessions can be suddenly taken away, leaving one with nothing, and serves as a reminder to prioritize spiritual growth and reflection over material pursuits.
orig: أيود أحدكم أن تكون له جنة من نخيل وأعناب تجري من تحتها الأنهار له فيها من كل الثمرات وأصابه الكبر وله ذرية ضعفاء فأصابها إعصار فيه نار فاحترقت كذلك يبين الله لكم الآيات لعلكم تتفكرون

translation: O you who have believed, spend from the good things which We have provided for you and from what We have produced for you from the earth. And do not aim to spend from that which is bad, expecting that you will get good in return, while you would not take it yourselves unless you close an eye on it. And know that Allah is Free of need, Worthy of all praise.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of sincerity and purity of intention in one's charitable acts, emphasizing that one should not try to give away inferior or defective goods, expecting to receive something better in return, as this would be a form of hypocrisy and deceit.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا أنفقوا من طيبات ما كسبتم ومما أخرجنا لكم من الأرض ولا تيمموا الخبيث منه تنفقون ولستم بآخذيه إلا أن تغمضوا فيه واعلموا أن الله غني حميد

translation: Shaitan promises you poverty and orders you to commit Fahsha' (evil deeds, etc.), and Allah promises you forgiveness from Himself and Fadl ( bounty or abundance). And Allah is All-Sufficient for His creatures' needs, All-Knower.
interpretation: The verse highlights the contrasting nature of Satan's and God's promises, emphasizing that while Satan promises poverty and evil, God offers forgiveness and abundance, thereby encouraging believers to turn to God and reject Satan's temptations.
orig: الشيطان يعدكم الفقر ويأمركم بالفحشاء والله يعدكم مغفرة منه وفضلا والله واسع عليم

translation: He grants wisdom to whom He pleases, and he to whom wisdom is granted, is indeed granted abundant good, and none remember but men of understanding.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of wisdom as a divine gift, emphasizing that only those with a deep understanding and insight can truly appreciate and benefit from it.
orig: يؤتي الحكمة من يشاء ومن يؤت الحكمة فقد أوتي خيرا كثيرا وما يذكر إلا أولو الألباب

translation: And whatever you spend in charity or vow you vow, indeed Allah knows it. And for the wrongdoers there are no helpers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that God is all-knowing and aware of every single action, including charitable deeds and vows, emphasizing the importance of sincerity and accountability in one's actions.
orig: وما أنفقتم من نفقة أو نذرتم من نذر فإن الله يعلمه وما للظالمين من أنصار

translation: If you disclose the charities, then it is good; and if you conceal them and give them to the poor, then it is better for you, and He will expiate some of your evil deeds, and Allah is All-Aware of what you do.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of humility and sincerity in acts of charity, suggesting that giving secretly to the poor is more virtuous than public displays of generosity, as it purifies the giver's intentions and cleanses them of their past misdeeds.
orig: إن تبدوا الصدقات فنعما هي وإن تخفوها وتؤتوها الفقراء فهو خير لكم ويكفر عنكم من سيئاتكم والله بما تعملون خبير

translation: Not upon you is their guidance, but Allah guides whom He wills. And whatever you spend in good, it is for yourselves, when you spend not except seeking Allah's Face. And whatever you spend of good - it will be fully repaid to you, and you will not be wronged.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of sincerity in one's actions, emphasizing that the ultimate goal should be to seek Allah's pleasure, rather than seeking recognition or reward from others.
orig: ليس عليك هداهم ولكن الله يهدي من يشاء وما تنفقوا من خير فلأنفسكم وما تنفقون إلا ابتغاء وجه الله وما تنفقوا من خير يوف إليكم وأنتم لا تظلمون

translation: Those who are restrained from begging, yet they are driven away, are not recognized by the ignorant as being wealthy due to their self-restraint. You would know them by their mark, they do not beg of people importunately. And whatever good you spend, indeed Allah is Knowing of it.
interpretation: The verse highlights the humility and self-sufficiency of true believers, who despite being in need, refrain from begging and instead rely on God's provision, and their true character is only recognizable to those who are spiritually aware.
orig: للفقراء الذين أحصروا في سبيل الله لا يستطيعون ضربا في الأرض يحسبهم الجاهل أغنياء من التعفف تعرفهم بسيماهم لا يسألون الناس إلحافا وما تنفقوا من خير فإن الله به عليم

translation: Those who spend their wealth by night and day, secretly and openly, they shall have their reward with their Lord, and there shall be no fear on them, nor shall they grieve.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of charity and generosity, emphasizing that those who spend their wealth selflessly, whether in public or in private, will be rewarded by God and will live a life free from fear and sorrow.
orig: الذين ينفقون أموالهم بالليل والنهار سرا وعلانية فلهم أجرهم عند ربهم ولا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: Those who consume usury will not stand except as stands one whom the devil has driven to madness by his touch. That is because they say: 'Trade is only like usury.' While Allah has permitted trade and forbidden usury. So, whoever receives an admonition from his Lord and desists, he shall have his past. His affair is for Allah. But whoever returns, they are the inmates of the Fire, and they shall abide therein forever.
interpretation: The verse highlights the severe consequences of indulging in usury, likening it to being driven to madness by the devil, and emphasizes that those who engage in usury will ultimately end up in the Fire, while those who repent and desist will be forgiven and their past mistakes will be overlooked.
orig: الذين يأكلون الربا لا يقومون إلا كما يقوم الذي يتخبطه الشيطان من المس ذلك بأنهم قالوا إنما البيع مثل الربا وأحل الله البيع وحرم الربا فمن جاءه موعظة من ربه فانتهى فله ما سلف وأمره إلى الله ومن عاد فأولئك أصحاب النار هم فيها خالدون

translation: God blots out usury and brings interest to increase, and God does not love any sinful disbeliever.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's dislike for those who engage in sinful and unjust practices, such as usury, and His preference for charitable acts, emphasizing the importance of righteous behavior and the consequences of sinful actions.
orig: يمحق الله الربا ويربي الصدقات والله لا يحب كل كفار أثيم

translation: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds and established prayer and given zakah, their reward is with their Lord, and there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
interpretation: The verse highlights the ultimate reward and security that awaits believers who have demonstrated their faith through righteous actions, prayer, and charity, emphasizing that they will be free from fear and sorrow in the Hereafter.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات وأقاموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة لهم أجرهم عند ربهم ولا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: O you who have believed, fear Allah and give up what remains [due to you] of usury, if you should be believers.
interpretation: The verse is an exhortation to believers to abandon usury and unjust financial practices, implying that true faith is demonstrated by righteous actions, and that a genuine believer must reform their economic dealings to conform to divine principles.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اتقوا الله وذروا ما بقي من الربا إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: But if you do not, then be informed of a war from Allah and His Messenger. And if you repent, you shall have your capital sums. You shall not be wronged and you shall not be wronged.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of fulfilling financial obligations, such as paying zakat, and warns of severe consequences if these obligations are neglected, implying that failure to do so will lead to a state of war with Allah and His Messenger, emphasizing the gravity of the matter.
orig: فإن لم تفعلوا فأذنوا بحرب من الله ورسوله وإن تبتم فلكم رءوس أموالكم لا تظلمون ولا تظلمون

translation: And if someone is in hardship, then let him have respite until ease, and that you give charity is better for you, if you know.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of considering the financial difficulties of others and being patient with them, rather than demanding immediate repayment, and it also highlights the virtues of charity, which is a means of purification and spiritual growth.
orig: وإن كان ذو عسرة فنظرة إلى ميسرة وأن تصدقوا خير لكم إن كنتم تعلمون

translation: And fear a Day when you will be returned to Allah; then every soul will be paid in full what it has earned, and they will not be wronged.
interpretation: The verse is emphasizing the importance of accountability, highlighting that every individual will be held responsible for their actions, and will receive exactly what they deserve, without any injustice or oppression.
orig: واتقوا يوما ترجعون فيه إلى الله ثم توفى كل نفس ما كسبت وهم لا يظلمون

translation: O you who have believed, when you contract a debt for a specified term, write it. And let a scribe write [it] in justice. Let not the scribe refuse to write, as Allah has taught him. So let him write, and let him who has the right [to receive the debt] dictate, and let him fear Allah, his Lord, and not leave out anything of it. And if the debtor is of limited understanding or weak or unable to dictate himself, then let his guardian dictate in justice. And bring to witness two witnesses from among your men. And if there are not two men [available], then one man and two women from those whom you approve of as witnesses - that if one of the women forgets, then the other can remind her. And the witnesses must not refuse when they are called upon. And do not be [too] lazy to write it, whether it is small or large, to its fixed term. That is more just in the sight of Allah and stronger as evidence and more likely to prevent doubt between you. And if it is an immediate transaction, which you conduct among yourselves, then there is no blame on you if it is not written. But take witnesses when you conclude a contract. And let not the scribe be harmed nor the witness, for if you do so, indeed it is defiance [against Allah] by you. And fear Allah. And Allah teaches you. And Allah is Knowing of all things.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of justice and fairness in financial transactions, highlighting the need for written records and witnesses to prevent disputes and ensure transparency, thereby promoting trust and accountability in business dealings.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إذا تداينتم بدين إلى أجل مسمى فاكتبوه وليكتب بينكم كاتب بالعدل ولا يأب كاتب أن يكتب كما علمه الله فليكتب وليملل الذي عليه الحق وليتق الله ربه ولا يبخس منه شيئا فإن كان الذي عليه الحق سفيها أو ضعيفا أو لا يستطيع أن يمل هو فليملل وليه بالعدل واستشهدوا شهيدين من رجالكم فإن لم يكونا رجلين فرجل وامرأتان ممن ترضون من الشهداء أن تضل إحداهما فتذكر إحداهما الأخرى ولا يأب الشهداء إذا ما دعوا ولا تسأموا أن تكتبوه صغيرا أو كبيرا إلى أجله ذلكم أقسط عند الله وأقوم للشهادة وأدنى ألا ترتابوا إلا أن تكون تجارة حاضرة تديرونها بينكم فليس عليكم جناح ألا تكتبوها وأشهدوا إذا تبايعتم ولا يضار كاتب ولا شهيد وإن تفعلوا فإنه فسوق بكم واتقوا الله ويعلمكم الله والله بكل شيء عليم

translation: And if you are on a journey and cannot find a scribe, then a security deposit to be handed over. If one of you deposits something with another, let the trustee discharge his trust and let him fear Allah, his Lord. And do not conceal testimony, for whoever conceals it, his heart is indeed sinful. And Allah is All-Aware of what you do.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of fulfilling one's trust and being honest in all dealings, as Allah is all-knowing and aware of all actions, and concealment of truth can lead to a sinful heart, emphasizing the need for accountability and integrity in all aspects of life.
orig: وإن كنتم على سفر ولم تجدوا كاتبا فرهان مقبوضة فإن أمن بعضكم بعضا فليؤد الذي اؤتمن أمانته وليتق الله ربه ولا تكتموا الشهادة ومن يكتمها فإنه آثم قلبه والله بما تعملون عليم

translation: To Allah belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth, and whether you manifest what is in your souls or conceal it, Allah will reckon with you for it, then He will forgive whom He wills and punish whom He wills, and Allah is All-Powerful over all things.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes God's absolute sovereignty and control over all things, implying that humans are accountable to Him for their innermost thoughts and feelings, and that He has the power to forgive or punish as He wills, highlighting the importance of living a virtuous life in obedience to His will.
orig: لله ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وإن تبدوا ما في أنفسكم أو تخفوه يحاسبكم به الله فيغفر لمن يشاء ويعذب من يشاء والله على كل شيء قدير

translation: The Messenger believes in what has been revealed to him from his Lord, and so do the believers. Each one believes in Allah, His Angels, His Books, and His Messengers. They say, 'We make no distinction between one and another of His Messengers.' And they say, 'We hear and we obey. We seek Your forgiveness, our Lord, and to You is the return.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of having faith in all aspects of Islam, including the Prophet, Allah, Angels, Books, and Messengers, without making any distinction between them, and emphasizes the need for obedience and seeking forgiveness from Allah.
orig: آمن الرسول بما أنزل إليه من ربه والمؤمنون كل آمن بالله وملائكته وكتبه ورسله لا نفرق بين أحد من رسله وقالوا سمعنا وأطعنا غفرانك ربنا وإليك المصير

translation: Allah does not burden a soul beyond what it can bear. It gets every good that it earns, and it suffers every ill that it earns. Our Lord, do not take us to task if we forget or err. Our Lord, do not lay on us a burden like that which You laid on those before us. Our Lord, do not lay on us what we have no strength to bear. Pardon us, forgive us, and have mercy on us. You are our Protector, so help us against the disbelieving people.
interpretation: The verse is a humble prayer to God, acknowledging human limitations and weaknesses, and seeking divine mercy and protection from the disbelievers, emphasizing the importance of humility and reliance on God's guidance and support.
orig: لا يكلف الله نفسا إلا وسعها لها ما كسبت وعليها ما اكتسبت ربنا لا تؤاخذنا إن نسينا أو أخطأنا ربنا ولا تحمل علينا إصرا كما حملته على الذين من قبلنا ربنا ولا تحملنا ما لا طاقة لنا به واعف عنا واغفر لنا وارحمنا أنت مولانا فانصرنا على القوم الكافرين

translation: The
interpretation: This verse is an introductory phrase that sets the tone for the revelation that is to come, and it is a symbol of the Quran's divine origin, emphasizing the sacred and mystical nature of the message that follows.
orig: الم

translation: Allah, there is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of [all] existence.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes God's unity and uniqueness, highlighting His eternal and self-sustaining nature, which is the source of all existence and sustenance, implying that all things rely on Him for their existence and continuation.
orig: الله لا إله إلا هو الحي القيوم

translation: He has sent down to you the Book with the truth, confirming what was before it, and He sent down the Torah and the Gospel
interpretation: This verse highlights the continuity and consistency of God's message throughout history, emphasizing that the revelation sent to the Prophet Muhammad is a confirmation and validation of the previous revelations, and that all prophets and messengers were sent by the same God, conveying the same message of truth and guidance.
orig: نزل عليك الكتاب بالحق مصدقا لما بين يديه وأنزل التوراة والإنجيل

translation: Before, as a guidance to the people, and We have sent down the Criterion. Indeed, those who disbelieve in the signs of Allah, for them is a severe punishment, and Allah is Exalted in Power, the Lord of Retribution.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of recognizing God's power and authority, emphasizing that those who reject God's signs will face severe punishment, and that God is capable of exacting revenge on those who disobey Him.
orig: من قبل هدى للناس وأنزل الفرقان إن الذين كفروا بآيات الله لهم عذاب شديد والله عزيز ذو انتقام

translation: Indeed, Allah is not unaware of the least little thing on the earth or in the heaven.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's omniscience and omnipresence, emphasizing that nothing, no matter how small or insignificant, escapes God's knowledge and awareness, whether it is on earth or in the heavens.
orig: إن الله لا يخفى عليه شيء في الأرض ولا في السماء

translation: He it is Who shapes you in the wombs as He wills. There is no god but He, the Exalted in Power, the Wise.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's absolute power and control over the creation of human life, emphasizing that every individual's development in the womb is a manifestation of God's will and wisdom.
orig: هو الذي يصوركم في الأرحام كيف يشاء لا إله إلا هو العزيز الحكيم

translation: He it is Who has sent down to you the Book, of it are verses basic or fundamental (of established meaning), they are the foundation of the Book: others are allegorical. But as for those in whose hearts is perversity, they will follow the part thereof that is allegorical, seeking to mislead, and seeking to give it an interpretation of their own. But none knows its interpretation except Allah, and those who are firmly grounded in knowledge say: 'We believe in it, all of it is from our Lord.' But none will grasp the message except men of understanding.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of understanding the Qur'an in its entirety, rather than selectively choosing certain parts to support one's own biases or agendas, and emphasizes the need for a deep understanding of the scripture to avoid misinterpretation.
orig: هو الذي أنزل عليك الكتاب منه آيات محكمات هن أم الكتاب وأخر متشابهات فأما الذين في قلوبهم زيغ فيتبعون ما تشابه منه ابتغاء الفتنة وابتغاء تأويله وما يعلم تأويله إلا الله والراسخون في العلم يقولون آمنا به كل من عند ربنا وما يذكر إلا أولو الألباب

translation: Our Lord, let not our hearts deviate after You have guided us and grant us from Yourself mercy. Indeed, You are the Bestower [of all].
interpretation: This verse conveys the believer's humble and sincere request to God to protect their faith and prevent them from straying from the right path, acknowledging God's mercy and benevolence as the ultimate source of guidance and protection.
orig: ربنا لا تزغ قلوبنا بعد إذ هديتنا وهب لنا من لدنك رحمة إنك أنت الوهاب

translation: Our Lord, indeed You will gather the people for a Day about which there is no doubt. Indeed, Allah does not fail in His promise.
interpretation: The verse highlights the inevitability of the Day of Judgment, emphasizing that God's promise is absolute and will not be delayed or broken, and that all humanity will be gathered before Him to account for their deeds.
orig: ربنا إنك جامع الناس ليوم لا ريب فيه إن الله لا يخلف الميعاد

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve, neither their wealth nor their children will avail them at all against Allah, and those are the fuel of the Fire.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of material possessions and worldly relationships in the face of God's judgment, implying that those who reject faith will ultimately be consumed by their own disbelief, which will fuel the fires of their spiritual destruction.
orig: إن الذين كفروا لن تغني عنهم أموالهم ولا أولادهم من الله شيئا وأولئك هم وقود النار

translation: The people of Pharaoh and those before them rejected Our signs, so Allah seized them for their sins, and Allah is severe in punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of rejecting God's signs and messages, emphasizing that those who do so will be punished severely for their disobedience and arrogance.
orig: كدأب آل فرعون والذين من قبلهم كذبوا بآياتنا فأخذهم الله بذنوبهم والله شديد العقاب

translation: Say to those who disbelieve: 'You will be overcome and gathered together to Hell, and wretched is the resting place.'
interpretation: The verse is a warning to those who reject faith, emphasizing their ultimate defeat and humiliation, and the terrible fate that awaits them in the afterlife.
orig: قل للذين كفروا ستغلبون وتحشرون إلى جهنم وبئس المهاد

translation: Indeed, there was a sign for you in the two groups that met: one fighting in the cause of Allah, and another of disbelievers. They saw them with their own eyes as equal in number, but Allah supports with His victory whom He wills. Indeed, in that is a lesson for those who have insight.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of spiritual insight and discernment in understanding the nature of conflict and victory, emphasizing that true strength and support come from God, and that human perceptions can be misleading.
orig: قد كان لكم آية في فئتين التقتا فئة تقاتل في سبيل الله وأخرى كافرة يرونهم مثليهم رأي العين والله يؤيد بنصره من يشاء إن في ذلك لعبرة لأولي الأبصار

translation: Beautified for people is the love of desires, of women and sons, and of heaped-up treasures of gold and silver, and of branded horses, and cattle and crops. That is the enjoyment of worldly life, but Allah has with Him the best return.
interpretation: The verse highlights the allure of worldly desires and material possessions, but also reminds us that true and eternal fulfillment can only be found in the hereafter, and that our focus should be on the eternal rewards that Allah has in store for us.
orig: زين للناس حب الشهوات من النساء والبنين والقناطير المقنطرة من الذهب والفضة والخيل المسومة والأنعام والحرث ذلك متاع الحياة الدنيا والله عنده حسن المآب

translation: Say, 'Shall I inform you of something better than that? For those who fear Allah, with their Lord, are Gardens under which rivers flow, wherein they will abide, and purified spouses, and Allah's pleasure.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the superiority of the rewards in the afterlife, which are reserved for those who fear Allah, over any worldly gains, emphasizing that true happiness and fulfillment can only be achieved through a life of righteousness and obedience to God's will.
orig: قل أؤنبئكم بخير من ذلكم للذين اتقوا عند ربهم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها وأزواج مطهرة ورضوان من الله والله بصير بالعباد

translation: Those who say: 'Our Lord! We believe; then forgive us our sins and save us from the punishment of the Fire'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of humility and acknowledgment of one's mistakes, as the believers are asking for forgiveness and protection from the punishment of the Fire, demonstrating their recognition of their own shortcomings and dependence on God's mercy.
orig: الذين يقولون ربنا إننا آمنا فاغفر لنا ذنوبنا وقنا عذاب النار

translation: The patient, the truthful, the obedient, the spenders, and those who pray for forgiveness in the early morning hours.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of cultivating virtues such as patience, truthfulness, obedience, generosity, and seeking forgiveness, which are essential for spiritual growth and closeness to God.
orig: الصابرين والصادقين والقانتين والمنفقين والمستغفرين بالأسحار

translation: Allah bears witness that there is no deity except Him, and so do the angels and those of knowledge - [that He is] maintaining [creation] in justice. There is no deity except Him, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes God's absolute unity and power, as well as His role in maintaining the universe in a state of justice and balance, and serves as a reminder of His greatness and wisdom.
orig: شهد الله أنه لا إله إلا هو والملائكة وأولو العلم قائما بالقسط لا إله إلا هو العزيز الحكيم

translation: Indeed, the religion in the sight of Allah is Islam. And those who were given the Scripture did not differ except, [after knowledge had come to them], out of jealousy among themselves. And whoever disbelieves in the verses of Allah, then indeed, Allah is swift in [taking] account.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of unity and the oneness of God's message, emphasizing that Islam is the only true religion in God's sight, and that any deviation from it is a result of human jealousy and arrogance, which ultimately leads to disbelieving in God's signs and facing His swift judgment.
orig: إن الدين عند الله الإسلام وما اختلف الذين أوتوا الكتاب إلا من بعد ما جاءهم العلم بغيا بينهم ومن يكفر بآيات الله فإن الله سريع الحساب

translation: And if they argue with you, say: 'I have submitted my face to Allah, and so have those who follow me.' And say to those who were given the Scripture and the unlearned: 'Have you submitted?' If they submit, then they are guided; but if they turn away, then your duty is only to convey the message, and Allah sees His servants.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of conveying the message of Islam to others, regardless of their response, and trusting in God's ability to guide those who are open to the truth, while also being aware that one's responsibility is limited to conveying the message, and not in forcing others to accept it.
orig: فإن حاجوك فقل أسلمت وجهي لله ومن اتبعن وقل للذين أوتوا الكتاب والأميين أأسلمتم فإن أسلموا فقد اهتدوا وإن تولوا فإنما عليك البلاغ والله بصير بالعباد

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve in the signs of Allah and kill the prophets without right and kill those who order justice among the people, then give them tidings of a painful punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of rejecting God's signs and the consequences of killing prophets and those who advocate for justice, emphasizing that such actions will be met with severe punishment, implying that God is the ultimate upholder of justice and will not tolerate injustice.
orig: إن الذين يكفرون بآيات الله ويقتلون النبيين بغير حق ويقتلون الذين يأمرون بالقسط من الناس فبشرهم بعذاب أليم

translation: Those are the ones whose deeds have become worthless in this world and the Hereafter, and they will have no helpers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequence of a life of sin and disobedience, where one's deeds become worthless and have no value in the eyes of God, leaving the individual helpless and without any support or allies in this world and the next.
orig: أولئك الذين حبطت أعمالهم في الدنيا والآخرة وما لهم من ناصرين

translation: Have you not seen those who were given a portion of the Scripture, they are invited to the Book of Allah to judge between them, then a party of them turns away, and they are averse.
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of some people who, despite being given a portion of the Scripture, refuse to accept the truth and instead turn away from it, revealing their aversion to the divine guidance.
orig: ألم تر إلى الذين أوتوا نصيبا من الكتاب يدعون إلى كتاب الله ليحكم بينهم ثم يتولى فريق منهم وهم معرضون

translation: That is because they said: 'The Fire will not touch us except for a few numbered days.' And what they used to invent about their religion deceived them.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who are deceived by their own misconceptions about their religion will ultimately be held accountable for their actions, and their false sense of security will not protect them from God's judgment.
orig: ذلك بأنهم قالوا لن تمسنا النار إلا أياما معدودات وغرهم في دينهم ما كانوا يفترون

translation: But how will it be when We gather them together on a day about which there is no doubt, and every soul is paid in full what it has earned, and they will not be wronged?
interpretation: The verse highlights the absolute fairness and justice of God's judgment, where every individual will be rewarded or punished based on their deeds, without any injustice or bias, and serves as a reminder of the accountability of human actions on the Day of Judgment.
orig: فكيف إذا جمعناهم ليوم لا ريب فيه ووفيت كل نفس ما كسبت وهم لا يظلمون

translation: Say: 'O Allah, Owner of Sovereignty, You give sovereignty to whom You will and take sovereignty away from whom You will, and You honor whom You will and humble whom You will. In Your hand is [all] good. Indeed, You are over all things competent.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes God's absolute power and control over all things, highlighting His ability to grant or remove power and authority from anyone, and to bestow honor or humility upon anyone, as He sees fit, and that all good ultimately comes from Him.
orig: قل اللهم مالك الملك تؤتي الملك من تشاء وتنزع الملك ممن تشاء وتعز من تشاء وتذل من تشاء بيدك الخير إنك على كل شيء قدير

translation: He merges the night into the day and merges the day into the night, and He brings forth the living from the dead and brings forth the dead from the living, and He provides for whom He wills without account.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's absolute power and control over the universe, emphasizing His ability to reverse and transform natural phenomena, such as the cycles of day and night, and the cycles of life and death, demonstrating His limitless authority and wisdom.
orig: تولج الليل في النهار وتولج النهار في الليل وتخرج الحي من الميت وتخرج الميت من الحي وترزق من تشاء بغير حساب

translation: Let not the believers take the unbelievers for allies instead of the believers, and whoever does that, he indeed has no connection with Allah, unless you guard against them, and Allah warns you of Himself, and to Allah is the return.
interpretation: The verse is emphasizing the importance of loyalty and allegiance to one's own community and faith, warning believers against forming close bonds with those who reject the faith, as this can lead to compromise and dilution of one's own beliefs and values.
orig: لا يتخذ المؤمنون الكافرين أولياء من دون المؤمنين ومن يفعل ذلك فليس من الله في شيء إلا أن تتقوا منهم تقاة ويحذركم الله نفسه وإلى الله المصير

translation: Say, 'Whether you conceal what is in your breasts or reveal it, Allah knows it. And He knows what is in the heavens and what is in the earth. And Allah is over all things competent.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the omniscience of Allah, emphasizing that He is aware of all thoughts, intentions, and actions, whether they are hidden or openly expressed, and that His knowledge and power encompass everything in the universe.
orig: قل إن تخفوا ما في صدوركم أو تبدوه يعلمه الله ويعلم ما في السماوات وما في الأرض والله على كل شيء قدير

translation: The day when every soul will find what it has done of good and what it has done of evil, it will wish that there were a long distance between it and itself. And Allah warns you against Himself, and Allah is full of mercy to the servants.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of accountability, emphasizing that on the Day of Judgment, individuals will be confronted with their own deeds, and will regret their past mistakes, wishing they had more time to make amends, but ultimately, it is Allah's mercy that will prevail.
orig: يوم تجد كل نفس ما عملت من خير محضرا وما عملت من سوء تود لو أن بينها وبينه أمدا بعيدا ويحذركم الله نفسه والله رءوف بالعباد

translation: Say, 'If you love Allah, then follow me, Allah will love you and forgive your sins. And Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of following the Prophet Muhammad's guidance in order to gain Allah's love and forgiveness, emphasizing the idea that obedience to the Prophet is a key factor in achieving a strong and loving relationship with Allah.
orig: قل إن كنتم تحبون الله فاتبعوني يحببكم الله ويغفر لكم ذنوبكم والله غفور رحيم

translation: Say, 'Obey Allah and the Messenger; but if you turn away, then indeed, Allah does not love the disbelievers.'
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of obedience to Allah and the Prophet, and warns that those who turn away from this obedience will be considered disbelievers, and as such, will not be loved by Allah.
orig: قل أطيعوا الله والرسول فإن تولوا فإن الله لا يحب الكافرين

translation: Indeed, Allah chose Adam and Noah and the family of Ibrahim and the family of Imran above the worlds.
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of the families of Ibrahim and Imran, and the individuals Adam and Noah, as chosen by God, implying that they were entrusted with a special mission to guide humanity, and that their legacy continues to inspire and guide people across the ages.
orig: إن الله اصطفى آدم ونوحا وآل إبراهيم وآل عمران على العالمين

translation: He created you from one soul, and created from it its mate, and sent down for you of the cattle eight kinds. He created you in the wombs of your mothers, creation after creation, in threefold darkness. This is Allah, your Lord. There is no god but He, the Creator of all things. So worship Him, and He is Guardian over all things.
interpretation: This verse highlights the unity and interconnectedness of humanity, emphasizing that all human beings come from a single soul, and that our individual identities are shaped by our relationships with one another.
orig: ذرية بعضها من بعض والله سميع عليم

translation: When the wife of 'Imran said, 'My Lord, I have vowed to You what is in my womb, dedicated, so accept from me. Indeed, You are the Hearing, the Knowing.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of fulfilling one's vows and the significance of dedicating one's children to the service of God, as the wife of 'Imran did, demonstrating her trust in God's wisdom and knowledge.
orig: إذ قالت امرأت عمران رب إني نذرت لك ما في بطني محررا فتقبل مني إنك أنت السميع العليم

translation: So when she delivered her, she said: 'My Lord, I have delivered a female.' And Allah knew best what she had delivered, and the male is not like the female. And I have named her Mary, and I seek refuge in You for her and her offspring from Satan, the rejected.
interpretation: The verse highlights the humility and devotion of Mary's mother, who acknowledges the will of God and seeks protection for her child from the evil of Satan, demonstrating the importance of trusting in God's plan and seeking refuge in Him from the forces of evil.
orig: فلما وضعتها قالت رب إني وضعتها أنثى والله أعلم بما وضعت وليس الذكر كالأنثى وإني سميتها مريم وإني أعيذها بك وذريتها من الشيطان الرجيم

translation: Her Lord accepted her with a goodly acceptance and caused her to grow in a good manner, and Zachariah took care of her. Every time Zachariah entered upon her in the prayer chamber, he found with her provisions. He said: 'O Mary, from where is this for you?' She said: 'It is from Allah. Allah provides for whom He wills without measure.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the miraculous provision of Mary, indicating that God's blessings and provisions are not limited by worldly means, and that He can provide for His chosen ones in unexpected ways, emphasizing the importance of trust and reliance on God's providence.
orig: فتقبلها ربها بقبول حسن وأنبتها نباتا حسنا وكفلها زكريا كلما دخل عليها زكريا المحراب وجد عندها رزقا قال يا مريم أنى لك هذا قالت هو من عند الله إن الله يرزق من يشاء بغير حساب

translation: There did Zakariya call upon his Lord, he said: 'My Lord! Grant me from You a good offspring, verily You are All-Hearer of invocation.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of humility and sincerity in one's prayers, as demonstrated by Zakariya's heartfelt plea to God for a good offspring, showcasing the prophet's recognition of God's omnipotence and his own powerlessness.
orig: هنالك دعا زكريا ربه قال رب هب لي من لدنك ذرية طيبة إنك سميع الدعاء

translation: The angels called out to him while he was standing, praying in the sanctuary, that Allah gives you good news of Yahya, confirming a word from Allah, and noble, chaste, and a prophet from the righteous.
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of the angelic announcement of the birth of Yahya (John the Baptist) to his father, Zakariya, while he was in a state of devotion and prayer, emphasizing the divine origin and nobility of Yahya's prophetic mission.
orig: فنادته الملائكة وهو قائم يصلي في المحراب أن الله يبشرك بيحيى مصدقا بكلمة من الله وسيدا وحصورا ونبيا من الصالحين

translation: My Lord, I have become old, and my wife is barren. He said: 'Thus Allah does what He wills.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that God's power and will are not limited by human circumstances, and that He can bring about unexpected and miraculous events, such as the birth of a child to an elderly couple.
orig: قال رب أنى يكون لي غلام وقد بلغني الكبر وامرأتي عاقر قال كذلك الله يفعل ما يشاء

translation: He said, 'My Lord, appoint for me a sign.' He said, 'Your sign is that you will not speak to people for three days, except by gestures. And remember your Lord much and glorify Him in the evening and the morning.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of remembering and glorifying God, and how this remembrance can be a means of spiritual growth and closeness to God, even in times of difficulty or silence.
orig: قال رب اجعل لي آية قال آيتك ألا تكلم الناس ثلاثة أيام إلا رمزا واذكر ربك كثيرا وسبح بالعشي والإبكار

translation: And when the angels said: 'O Mary, indeed Allah has chosen you and purified you and chosen you above the women of the worlds'
interpretation: The verse highlights Mary's exceptional status as a woman chosen by God, emphasizing her purity and superiority over all other women in the world, implying that she was destined for a great role in the divine plan.
orig: وإذ قالت الملائكة يا مريم إن الله اصطفاك وطهرك واصطفاك على نساء العالمين

translation: O Mary, be obedient to your Lord, and prostrate, and bow with those who bow.
interpretation: The verse is an instruction to Mary, the mother of Jesus, to humble herself and submit to God's will, and to join the community of believers in their acts of worship, emphasizing the importance of humility and obedience to God.
orig: يا مريم اقنتي لربك واسجدي واركعي مع الراكعين

translation: That is of the news of the unseen which We reveal to you, and you were not with them when they cast their pens as to which of them should take care of Maryam, and you were not with them when they disputed.
interpretation: The verse highlights the miraculous nature of the revelation, emphasizing that the knowledge of the unseen is only accessible through divine revelation, and that human reasoning and deliberation are limited in understanding the mysteries of the past.
orig: ذلك من أنباء الغيب نوحيه إليك وما كنت لديهم إذ يلقون أقلامهم أيهم يكفل مريم وما كنت لديهم إذ يختصمون

translation: When the angels said, 'O Mary, indeed Allah gives you good tidings of a word from Him, whose name is the Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary, distinguished in this world and the Hereafter, and among those brought near [to Allah].'
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of Jesus, son of Mary, who is not only a prophet but also a distinguished figure in this world and the Hereafter, and one of those who are brought near to Allah, emphasizing his exalted status in Islam.
orig: إذ قالت الملائكة يا مريم إن الله يبشرك بكلمة منه اسمه المسيح عيسى ابن مريم وجيها في الدنيا والآخرة ومن المقربين

translation: And We have certainly honored the children of Adam and carried them on the land and sea and provided for them of the good things and preferred them over much of what We created, with [definite] preference.
interpretation: The verse highlights the unique dignity and honor bestowed upon humanity by God, elevating them above other creations, and emphasizing their special status in the eyes of God.
orig: ويكلم الناس في المهد وكهلا ومن الصالحين

translation: She said: 'O my Lord! How shall I have a son when no man has touched me.' He said: 'Thus Allah creates what He wills, when He decrees a matter, He only says to it: Be! And it is.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the miraculous nature of divine creation, where God's will is the sole determining factor, unbound by the laws of nature or human understanding, emphasizing the idea that God's power is limitless and unparalleled.
orig: قالت رب أنى يكون لي ولد ولم يمسسني بشر قال كذلك الله يخلق ما يشاء إذا قضى أمرا فإنما يقول له كن فيكون

translation: And He teaches him the Book and the Wisdom and the Torah and the Gospel
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of divine guidance and revelation, emphasizing that God is the ultimate teacher who imparts knowledge and wisdom to His prophets, including the Torah and the Gospel, which are considered sacred scriptures.
orig: ويعلمه الكتاب والحكمة والتوراة والإنجيل

translation: And (I have come) to the Children of Israel, saying: 'I have brought to you a sign from your Lord, that I design for you out of clay (a figure) like that of a bird, and breathe into it, and it becomes a bird, by Allah's Leave; and I heal him who was born blind, and the leper, and I bring the dead to life by Allah's Leave, and I inform you of what you eat and what you store in your houses. Surely, therein is a sign for you, if you believe.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of faith, as it emphasizes that the miraculous signs and wonders performed by the prophets, including the ability to bring the dead to life, are only meaningful if one believes in God's power and authority.
orig: ورسولا إلى بني إسرائيل أني قد جئتكم بآية من ربكم أني أخلق لكم من الطين كهيئة الطير فأنفخ فيه فيكون طيرا بإذن الله وأبرئ الأكمه والأبرص وأحيي الموتى بإذن الله وأنبئكم بما تأكلون وما تدخرون في بيوتكم إن في ذلك لآية لكم إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: And I confirm what is between my hands of the Torah, and to make lawful for you some of what was forbidden to you, and I have come to you with a sign from your Lord, so fear Allah and obey me.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of following the guidance of the Prophet Muhammad, who has come to confirm the previous revelations, to clarify what was previously forbidden, and to bring a new divine guidance, emphasizing the need to obey him as a means of fearing and obeying Allah.
orig: ومصدقا لما بين يدي من التوراة ولأحل لكم بعض الذي حرم عليكم وجئتكم بآية من ربكم فاتقوا الله وأطيعون

translation: Indeed, Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. This is a straight path.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of recognizing and submitting to the oneness of God, and that true worship is only due to Him, and that this recognition is the key to being on the straight path, free from deviation and misguidance.
orig: إن الله ربي وربكم فاعبدوه هذا صراط مستقيم

translation: Then when Jesus sensed their disbelief, he said: 'Who will be my helpers to Allah?' The disciples said: 'We are Allah's helpers. We believe in Allah and bear witness that we are Muslims.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of having faith and being a true helper of Allah, as exemplified by the disciples of Jesus who stood by him in the face of disbelief and persecution, demonstrating their unwavering commitment to Allah and their willingness to stand up for the truth.
orig: فلما أحس عيسى منهم الكفر قال من أنصاري إلى الله قال الحواريون نحن أنصار الله آمنا بالله واشهد بأنا مسلمون

translation: Our Lord, we believe in what You have sent down and we follow the Messenger, so write us down among the witnesses.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of having faith in the divine revelation and following the guidance of the Prophet, and in return, being counted among those who bear witness to the truth.
orig: ربنا آمنا بما أنزلت واتبعنا الرسول فاكتبنا مع الشاهدين

translation: And they schemed, and Allah schemed, and Allah is the best of schemers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of human plans and schemes when they are directed against God's will, implying that God's plans and wisdom are superior and will ultimately prevail.
orig: ومكروا ومكر الله والله خير الماكرين

translation: And when Allah said: O Jesus, I will take you and raise you to Myself and purify you from those who disbelieve and make those who follow you superior to those who disbelieve until the Day of Resurrection. Then to Me is your return, and I will judge between you in what you used to differ.
interpretation: The verse highlights the special relationship between God and Jesus, emphasizing God's protection and support for Jesus against his enemies, and ultimately, God's judgment on the disputes among people on the Day of Resurrection.
orig: إذ قال الله يا عيسى إني متوفيك ورافعك إلي ومطهرك من الذين كفروا وجاعل الذين اتبعوك فوق الذين كفروا إلى يوم القيامة ثم إلي مرجعكم فأحكم بينكم فيما كنتم فيه تختلفون

translation: As for those who disbelieve, We will punish them with a severe punishment in this world and the Hereafter, and they will have no helpers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that those who reject faith will not only face punishment in the afterlife, but also in this world, and that they will be utterly helpless and abandoned by all, including those they may have relied on.
orig: فأما الذين كفروا فأعذبهم عذابا شديدا في الدنيا والآخرة وما لهم من ناصرين

translation: And as for those who believe and do righteous deeds, He will give them their rewards in full, and Allah does not love the wrongdoers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of not only believing in God, but also performing good deeds, as it is the combination of faith and righteous actions that will earn a person their full reward from God, emphasizing the idea that faith without action is incomplete.
orig: وأما الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات فيوفيهم أجورهم والله لا يحب الظالمين

translation: Thus We relate to you some of the news of the messengers, and that We have revealed to you of the Reminder, the Wise.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of learning from the stories of the prophets and messengers, as they serve as a reminder and guidance for humanity, and their experiences and struggles can provide valuable lessons for those who seek wisdom and understanding.
orig: ذلك نتلوه عليك من الآيات والذكر الحكيم

translation: Verily, the likeness of Jesus in the sight of Allah is as the likeness of Adam. He created him from dust, then said to him, 'Be!' and he was.
interpretation: This verse highlights the miraculous nature of Jesus' creation, drawing a parallel with the creation of Adam from dust, emphasizing God's power to bring into existence without the need for a biological process, and underscoring the idea that God's will is the sole determining factor in the creation of life.
orig: إن مثل عيسى عند الله كمثل آدم خلقه من تراب ثم قال له كن فيكون

translation: The truth is from your Lord, so do not be among the doubters.
interpretation: The verse is a call to have faith in God's revelation and not to be among those who doubt or disbelieve in it, emphasizing the importance of certainty and conviction in one's beliefs.
orig: الحق من ربك فلا تكن من الممترين

translation: And whoever disputes with you concerning him, after the knowledge has come to you, say: 'Come, let us call our sons and your sons, our women and your women, ourselves and yourselves, then supplicate humbly, and invoke the curse of Allah upon the liars.'
interpretation: The verse is encouraging believers to stand firm in their faith and to challenge the disbelievers to a prayer duel, where both parties would pray to God and ask Him to curse the liars, thus revealing the truth and authenticity of their beliefs.
orig: فمن حاجك فيه من بعد ما جاءك من العلم فقل تعالوا ندع أبناءنا وأبناءكم ونساءنا ونساءكم وأنفسنا وأنفسكم ثم نبتهل فنجعل لعنت الله على الكاذبين

translation: Indeed, this is the true narrative, and there is no deity except Allah, and indeed, Allah is the Exalted in Power, the Wise.
interpretation: The verse asserts the absolute authority and wisdom of God, emphasizing that He is the only true deity and that His power and wisdom are unmatched, implying that humans should submit to His will and recognize His supremacy.
orig: إن هذا لهو القصص الحق وما من إله إلا الله وإن الله لهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: But if they turn away, then Allah is All-Aware of the corrupters.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's omniscience and His ability to see and know those who spread corruption and evil, implying that they cannot escape God's knowledge and justice, no matter how hard they try to hide or deny their wrongdoing.
orig: فإن تولوا فإن الله عليم بالمفسدين

translation: Say, 'O People of the Scripture, come to a word that is just between us and you - that we will not worship except Allah and not associate anything with Him, and not take one another as lords instead of Allah.' But if they turn away, then say, 'Bear witness that we are Muslims.'
interpretation: This verse is an invitation to the People of the Book to unite under the common principle of monotheism, and to reject any form of idolatry or polytheism, emphasizing the oneness of God and the rejection of any human authority that may be worshipped or obeyed instead of Him.
orig: قل يا أهل الكتاب تعالوا إلى كلمة سواء بيننا وبينكم ألا نعبد إلا الله ولا نشرك به شيئا ولا يتخذ بعضنا بعضا أربابا من دون الله فإن تولوا فقولوا اشهدوا بأنا مسلمون

translation: O People of the Book! Why do you argue about Abraham, when the Torah and the Gospel were not revealed till after him? Have you then no sense?
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of using intellect and reason in understanding religious matters, and not blindly following traditions or prejudices, as the People of the Book are accused of doing in this verse.
orig: يا أهل الكتاب لم تحاجون في إبراهيم وما أنزلت التوراة والإنجيل إلا من بعده أفلا تعقلون

translation: Thus you were arguing about what you had knowledge of, but you did not argue about what you had no knowledge of. And Allah knows while you do not know.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of recognizing the limits of one's knowledge and not pretending to have knowledge about things one is not aware of, lest one falls into arrogance and ignorance.
orig: ها أنتم هؤلاء حاججتم فيما لكم به علم فلم تحاجون فيما ليس لكم به علم والله يعلم وأنتم لا تعلمون

translation: Abraham was neither a Jew nor a Christian, but he was a Hanif, a Muslim, and he was not of the polytheists.
interpretation: The verse highlights the universal nature of Abraham's faith, which is not limited to any particular religious denomination, but rather a pure and sincere submission to God, making him a model for all believers.
orig: ما كان إبراهيم يهوديا ولا نصرانيا ولكن كان حنيفا مسلما وما كان من المشركين

translation: Indeed, the people most worthy of Abraham are those who followed him, and this Prophet, and those who believe. And Allah is the Wali of the believers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the special connection between Prophet Muhammad and Prophet Abraham, emphasizing their shared values and message, and implying that those who follow the teachings of these two prophets will be blessed with divine guidance and protection.
orig: إن أولى الناس بإبراهيم للذين اتبعوه وهذا النبي والذين آمنوا والله ولي المؤمنين

translation: A party of the People of the Book wish to lead you astray, but they only lead themselves astray, and they do not perceive.
interpretation: This verse highlights the futility of attempts by some People of the Book to mislead Muslims, as ultimately they only end up deceiving themselves, demonstrating a profound lack of self-awareness.
orig: ودت طائفة من أهل الكتاب لو يضلونكم وما يضلون إلا أنفسهم وما يشعرون

translation: O People of the Book, why do you reject the signs of Allah while you bear witness?
interpretation: The verse is a rebuke to the People of the Book (Jews and Christians) for rejecting the signs of Allah despite being aware of their truth, implying that their rejection is a result of their arrogance and stubbornness rather than a lack of knowledge.
orig: يا أهل الكتاب لم تكفرون بآيات الله وأنتم تشهدون

translation: O People of the Book, why do you mix the truth with falsehood and conceal the truth while you know?
interpretation: The verse is a rebuke to those who knowingly distort the truth, implying that they are guilty of a grave sin and that their actions will have serious consequences.
orig: يا أهل الكتاب لم تلبسون الحق بالباطل وتكتمون الحق وأنتم تعلمون

translation: And a party of the People of the Scripture say: 'Believe in that which is revealed unto those who believe, at the opening of the day, and disbelieve at the end of it, that perchance they may turn back'
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of some People of the Scripture who pretended to believe in the morning, only to reject the faith later in the day, in an attempt to deceive and manipulate others, revealing their dishonest intentions and lack of sincerity.
orig: وقالت طائفة من أهل الكتاب آمنوا بالذي أنزل على الذين آمنوا وجه النهار واكفروا آخره لعلهم يرجعون

translation: And they will not believe in you, except for him who follows your religion. Say: 'The guidance is the guidance of Allah, that He gives it to whom He wills.' Or lest they argue with you before your Lord. Say: 'The favor is in the hand of Allah; He gives it to whom He wills. And Allah is All-Encompassing, All-Knowing.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of divine guidance and favor, emphasizing that it is solely in the hands of God to bestow upon whom He wills, and that human beings have no control over it, implying that salvation is a divine prerogative.
orig: ولا تؤمنوا إلا لمن تبع دينكم قل إن الهدى هدى الله أن يؤتى أحد مثل ما أوتيتم أو يحاجوكم عند ربكم قل إن الفضل بيد الله يؤتيه من يشاء والله واسع عليم

translation: He specially chooses for His mercy whom He wills, and Allah is the Owner of Great Bounty.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's absolute sovereignty in bestowing His mercy and blessings, implying that His favors are not based on human merit or deserving, but rather on His own wisdom and grace.
orig: يختص برحمته من يشاء والله ذو الفضل العظيم

translation: And among the People of the Scripture is he who, if you entrust him with a qintar, he will return it to you, and among them is he who, if you entrust him with a dinar, will not return it to you unless you remain standing over him. That is because they say, 'There is no obligation upon us toward the unlettered.' And they say, 'We speak lies against Allah while they know [it].'
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy and dishonesty of some People of the Scripture, who will only keep their word if they are under close supervision, revealing their lack of integrity and trustworthiness.
orig: ومن أهل الكتاب من إن تأمنه بقنطار يؤده إليك ومنهم من إن تأمنه بدينار لا يؤده إليك إلا ما دمت عليه قائما ذلك بأنهم قالوا ليس علينا في الأميين سبيل ويقولون على الله الكذب وهم يعلمون

translation: Yes, whoever fulfills his pledge and fears Allah, then indeed, Allah loves those who fear Him.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of fulfilling one's commitments and being mindful of Allah's presence, as this is a key characteristic of those who are beloved by Allah.
orig: بلى من أوفى بعهده واتقى فإن الله يحب المتقين

translation: Indeed, those who trade the covenant of Allah and their oaths for a small price, those will have no share in the Hereafter, nor will Allah speak to them or look at them on the Day of Resurrection, nor will He purify them, and they will have a painful punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of betraying one's covenant with God and trading it for worldly gains, emphasizing that such individuals will not only be deprived of God's mercy in the Hereafter but will also be shunned by God Himself, implying a complete disconnection from divine guidance and redemption.
orig: إن الذين يشترون بعهد الله وأيمانهم ثمنا قليلا أولئك لا خلاق لهم في الآخرة ولا يكلمهم الله ولا ينظر إليهم يوم القيامة ولا يزكيهم ولهم عذاب أليم

translation: And indeed, among them is a group that twists their tongues with the Scripture, so you think it is from the Scripture, but it is not from the Scripture, and they say, 'This is from Allah,' but it is not from Allah, and they speak falsehood against Allah, while they know.
interpretation: The verse highlights the deception of those who manipulate religious texts to serve their own interests, and attributes their own fabrications to God, while being fully aware of their deceit.
orig: وإن منهم لفريقا يلوون ألسنتهم بالكتاب لتحسبوه من الكتاب وما هو من الكتاب ويقولون هو من عند الله وما هو من عند الله ويقولون على الله الكذب وهم يعلمون

translation: It is not for a human that Allah should give him the Scripture and authority and prophethood, then he would say to the people, 'Be devoted servants to me, excluding Allah,' but rather, 'Be devoted servants of the One who taught you the Scripture and taught you what you know.'
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of humility and modesty for prophets and religious leaders, reminding them that their role is to guide people to worship and obey God alone, rather than seeking to elevate themselves or seeking devotion from others.
orig: ما كان لبشر أن يؤتيه الله الكتاب والحكم والنبوة ثم يقول للناس كونوا عبادا لي من دون الله ولكن كونوا ربانيين بما كنتم تعلمون الكتاب وبما كنتم تدرسون

translation: And He does not order you to take the angels and the prophets as lords. Would He order you to disbelieve after you had believed?
interpretation: The verse highlights the absurdity of taking angels and prophets as lords, implying that such an action would be a rejection of the faith, and that God would never command such a thing, as it would be a form of disbelief.
orig: ولا يأمركم أن تتخذوا الملائكة والنبيين أربابا أيأمركم بالكفر بعد إذ أنتم مسلمون

translation: And when Allah took the covenant of the prophets, saying, 'When I give you a scripture and wisdom, then a messenger comes to you confirming what is with you, you shall believe in him and aid him.' He said, 'Do you testify and accept my covenant?' They said, 'We testify.' He said, 'Then bear witness, and I am with you among the witnesses.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of fulfilling one's covenant with God, emphasizing the responsibility of prophets and believers to support and aid one another in the cause of truth and justice.
orig: وإذ أخذ الله ميثاق النبيين لما آتيتكم من كتاب وحكمة ثم جاءكم رسول مصدق لما معكم لتؤمنن به ولتنصرنه قال أأقررتم وأخذتم على ذلكم إصري قالوا أقررنا قال فاشهدوا وأنا معكم من الشاهدين

translation: And whoever turns away after that, those are the defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of turning away from the truth and guidance, emphasizing that such individuals are not merely mistaken, but rather defiantly disobedient, implying a willful and intentional rejection of the divine guidance.
orig: فمن تولى بعد ذلك فأولئك هم الفاسقون

translation: Do they seek other than the religion of Allah, while to Him submitted all who are in the heavens and the earth, willingly or unwillingly, and to Him they will be returned.
interpretation: This verse highlights the futility of seeking any other way of life or religion besides Islam, as all creation, whether willingly or unwillingly, is already under God's dominion and will ultimately return to Him, emphasizing the inevitability of judgment and accountability.
orig: أفغير دين الله يبغون وله أسلم من في السماوات والأرض طوعا وكرها وإليه يرجعون

translation: Say, 'We believe in Allah and what has been sent down to us and what was sent down to Ibrahim, Isma'il, Ishaq, Ya'qub, and the Asbat, and what was given to Musa, 'Isa, and the prophets from their Lord. We make no distinction between any of them, and we are Muslims [in submission] to Him.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of believing in all the prophets and the revelations sent down to them, without making any distinction between them, and submitting to the will of God, which is the essence of being a Muslim.
orig: قل آمنا بالله وما أنزل علينا وما أنزل على إبراهيم وإسماعيل وإسحاق ويعقوب والأسباط وما أوتي موسى وعيسى والنبيون من ربهم لا نفرق بين أحد منهم ونحن له مسلمون

translation: And whoever seeks a religion other than Islam, it will never be accepted of him, and in the Hereafter he will be among the losers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the exclusivity of Islam as the only acceptable religion to God, implying that any other religion or belief system will not be recognized or rewarded in the afterlife.
orig: ومن يبتغ غير الإسلام دينا فلن يقبل منه وهو في الآخرة من الخاسرين

translation: How shall Allah guide a people who disbelieved after their belief and witnessed that the Messenger is true and came to them with clear signs? And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that once a person has been guided to the truth and has witnessed the signs of Allah, but still chooses to disbelieve, they will not be guided again, and will be left to their wrongdoing.
orig: كيف يهدي الله قوما كفروا بعد إيمانهم وشهدوا أن الرسول حق وجاءهم البينات والله لا يهدي القوم الظالمين

translation: Those, their recompense is that upon them is the curse of Allah and the angels and the people, all together.
interpretation: The verse highlights the severity of God's punishment on those who reject faith, emphasizing that they will be cursed not only by God, but also by the angels and all humanity, implying a complete and utter rejection by all of creation.
orig: أولئك جزاؤهم أن عليهم لعنة الله والملائكة والناس أجمعين

translation: Abiding therein, the punishment shall not be lightened for them, nor shall they be reprieved.
interpretation: The verse highlights the eternal nature of punishment in the afterlife, emphasizing that there will be no relief or respite from the suffering, and that the punishment will be continuous and unrelenting.
orig: خالدين فيها لا يخفف عنهم العذاب ولا هم ينظرون

translation: Except for those who repent afterwards and reform, for Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of sincere repentance and reform, emphasizing that even those who have committed wrongdoings can be forgiven by God if they genuinely change their ways and seek forgiveness.
orig: إلا الذين تابوا من بعد ذلك وأصلحوا فإن الله غفور رحيم

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieved after their belief and then increased in disbelief, never will their repentance be accepted. And those are the ones who are astray.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of apostasy, implying that once an individual has turned away from faith, it becomes increasingly difficult for them to return to the right path, and even if they attempt to repent, their efforts may be in vain.
orig: إن الذين كفروا بعد إيمانهم ثم ازدادوا كفرا لن تقبل توبتهم وأولئك هم الضالون

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieved and died while they were disbelievers - never would the [whole] earth full of gold be accepted from one of them even if one offered it as ransom. For those, there will be a painful punishment, and they will have no helpers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the gravity of dying in a state of disbelief, implying that even the most valuable material possessions, like gold, would be insufficient to redeem oneself from the consequences of rejecting faith, and that those who die in such a state will face a severe punishment and will be utterly helpless.
orig: إن الذين كفروا وماتوا وهم كفار فلن يقبل من أحدهم ملء الأرض ذهبا ولو افتدى به أولئك لهم عذاب أليم وما لهم من ناصرين

translation: You will never attain righteousness until you spend from what you love, and whatever you spend - indeed Allah is Knowing of it.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of selfless charity, emphasizing that true righteousness can only be achieved when one is willing to part with what they hold dear, demonstrating a genuine commitment to their faith.
orig: لن تنالوا البر حتى تنفقوا مما تحبون وما تنفقوا من شيء فإن الله به عليم

translation: All food was lawful to the Children of Israel except what Israel forbade for himself before the Torah was revealed. Say: 'Bring the Torah and recite it, if you are truthful.'
interpretation: The verse is a challenge to the Jews to back up their claims with proof from their own scripture, implying that they are not truthful in their accusations against the Prophet Muhammad, and that they are hiding the truth that is revealed in the Torah.
orig: كل الطعام كان حلا لبني إسرائيل إلا ما حرم إسرائيل على نفسه من قبل أن تنزل التوراة قل فأتوا بالتوراة فاتلوها إن كنتم صادقين

translation: And whoever invents about Allah a lie after that, then those are the wrongdoers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of attributing false statements to God, which is considered a grave injustice, as it undermines the trust and respect due to Him, and can lead to misguiding others and causing harm to oneself and others.
orig: فمن افترى على الله الكذب من بعد ذلك فأولئك هم الظالمون

translation: Say, 'Truth has come and falsehood has vanished. Indeed, falsehood is bound to vanish.' So follow the religion of Ibrahim, inclining towards truth, and he was not of the polytheists.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of following the true religion of Ibrahim, which is based on the principles of monotheism and submission to the will of God, and warns against polytheism and idolatry, which are destined to disappear.
orig: قل صدق الله فاتبعوا ملة إبراهيم حنيفا وما كان من المشركين

translation: Indeed, the first House [of worship] established for mankind was that at Bakkah, blessed and a guidance for the worlds.
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of the Kaaba as the first house of worship, emphasizing its sacredness and its role as a source of guidance for all humanity.
orig: إن أول بيت وضع للناس للذي ببكة مباركا وهدى للعالمين

translation: In it are clear signs, the Station of Ibrahim; and whoever enters it shall be secure; and pilgrimage to the House is a duty unto Allah for mankind, whoever can make his way to it; and whoever disbelieves, then Allah is Independent of the worlds.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the significance of the Kaaba as a sacred place of worship, where people can find security and peace, and highlights the importance of performing the pilgrimage as a fundamental aspect of the Islamic faith, while also warning those who reject the truth that God is not in need of them.
orig: فيه آيات بينات مقام إبراهيم ومن دخله كان آمنا ولله على الناس حج البيت من استطاع إليه سبيلا ومن كفر فإن الله غني عن العالمين

translation: Say, 'O People of the Scripture, why do you reject the verses of Allah while Allah is Witness over what you do?'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of acknowledging and accepting the truth revealed by God, and serves as a warning to those who reject God's signs and verses, reminding them that God is always watching and aware of their actions.
orig: قل يا أهل الكتاب لم تكفرون بآيات الله والله شهيد على ما تعملون

translation: Say, 'O People of the Scripture, do you resent that we have believed in Allah and what has been revealed to us and what was revealed before? And Allah is not unaware of what you do.'
interpretation: The verse is a call to the People of the Book to reflect on their own actions and to recognize the truth of the revelation, rather than rejecting it out of pride or prejudice, and to acknowledge that Allah is fully aware of their deeds and will hold them accountable.
orig: قل يا أهل الكتاب لم تصدون عن سبيل الله من آمن تبغونها عوجا وأنتم شهداء وما الله بغافل عما تعملون

translation: O you who have believed, if you obey a group of those who were given the Scripture, they will turn you back, after your belief, to unbelievers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of being cautious in taking guidance from people of the Scripture, as they may lead believers astray and cause them to revert to their pre-Islamic state of ignorance.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إن تطيعوا فريقا من الذين أوتوا الكتاب يردوكم بعد إيمانكم كافرين

translation: And how can you disbelieve while to you are recited the verses of Allah and among you is His Messenger, and whoever holds firmly to Allah has been guided to a straight path.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of having faith in God and following the guidance of the Prophet, emphasizing that those who hold firmly to God will be guided to the straight path, implying a sense of spiritual security and stability.
orig: وكيف تكفرون وأنتم تتلى عليكم آيات الله وفيكم رسوله ومن يعتصم بالله فقد هدي إلى صراط مستقيم

translation: O you who have believed, fear Allah as He should be feared and die not except in a state of Islam.
interpretation: The verse is a call to believers to maintain a state of consciousness and awareness of God's presence in their lives, and to strive to live in accordance with His will, so that they may die in a state of righteousness and obedience to Him.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اتقوا الله حق تقاته ولا تموتن إلا وأنتم مسلمون

translation: And hold firmly to the rope of Allah all together and do not be divided. And remember the favor of Allah upon you - when you were enemies and He brought your hearts together and you became brothers by His favor. And you were on the edge of a pit of the Fire, and He saved you from it. Thus Allah makes clear to you His verses that you may be guided.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of unity among believers, highlighting how God's favor brought them together and saved them from the brink of destruction, implying that their unity is a key factor in their salvation.
orig: واعتصموا بحبل الله جميعا ولا تفرقوا واذكروا نعمت الله عليكم إذ كنتم أعداء فألف بين قلوبكم فأصبحتم بنعمته إخوانا وكنتم على شفا حفرة من النار فأنقذكم منها كذلك يبين الله لكم آياته لعلكم تهتدون

translation: And let there be [arising] from you a nation inviting to [all that is] good, enjoining what is right, and forbidding what is wrong. And those are the successful ones.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of having a community that promotes goodness, justice, and morality, and discourages evil, injustice, and immorality, and that such a community is the key to success and prosperity.
orig: ولتكن منكم أمة يدعون إلى الخير ويأمرون بالمعروف وينهون عن المنكر وأولئك هم المفلحون

translation: And be not like those who divided and differed after the clear proofs had come to them, and for them is a great punishment.
interpretation: The verse is warning believers against falling into the same trap of disunity and discord that afflicted previous nations, emphasizing that those who do so will face severe punishment from God.
orig: ولا تكونوا كالذين تفرقوا واختلفوا من بعد ما جاءهم البينات وأولئك لهم عذاب عظيم

translation: On the Day when some faces will become white and some faces will become black; then as for those whose faces will become black: Did you disbelieve after believing? Taste the punishment for what you used to reject.
interpretation: The verse highlights the contrast between the righteous and the wicked on the Day of Judgment, emphasizing the consequences of abandoning faith and reverting to disbelief, and serves as a warning to those who have turned away from God's guidance.
orig: يوم تبيض وجوه وتسود وجوه فأما الذين اسودت وجوههم أكفرتم بعد إيمانكم فذوقوا العذاب بما كنتم تكفرون

translation: And as for those whose faces have become white, they will be in the mercy of Allah, they will dwell therein forever.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who are blessed with Allah's mercy will experience eternal bliss and happiness in the hereafter, free from any fear or anxiety, and that their faces will radiate with joy and contentment.
orig: وأما الذين ابيضت وجوههم ففي رحمة الله هم فيها خالدون

translation: Those are the verses of Allah which We recite to you in truth, and Allah intends no injustice to the worlds.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the divine origin and authenticity of the Quranic revelations, and that God's intention is to guide humanity, not to oppress or harm them, implying that God's justice is universal and all-encompassing.
orig: تلك آيات الله نتلوها عليك بالحق وما الله يريد ظلما للعالمين

translation: And to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, and to Allah return all matters.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes God's absolute sovereignty and control over all creation, implying that everything in the universe is ultimately subject to His will and that all matters, whether worldly or spiritual, will ultimately be judged and decided by Him.
orig: ولله ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وإلى الله ترجع الأمور

translation: You are the best nation produced for mankind, you enjoin what is right, forbid what is wrong, and believe in Allah. If only the People of the Scripture had believed, it would have been better for them. Among them are believers, but most of them are defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of the Muslim community as a moral compass for humanity, emphasizing their role in promoting virtue and preventing vice, and suggests that if the People of the Scripture had followed the righteous path, it would have been beneficial for them, but instead, many of them chose a path of disobedience.
orig: كنتم خير أمة أخرجت للناس تأمرون بالمعروف وتنهون عن المنكر وتؤمنون بالله ولو آمن أهل الكتاب لكان خيرا لهم منهم المؤمنون وأكثرهم الفاسقون

translation: They will not harm you except for a slight hurt; and if they fight you, they will turn their backs, then they will not be helped.
interpretation: The verse is a message of reassurance and confidence, implying that the believers will ultimately emerge victorious, and their enemies will be defeated and humiliated, despite their initial attempts to harm them.
orig: لن يضروكم إلا أذى وإن يقاتلوكم يولوكم الأدبار ثم لا ينصرون

translation: Humiliation was imposed on them wherever they were found, except for a rope from Allah and a rope from men. And they incurred wrath from Allah, and were afflicted with misery. That is because they used to disbelieve in the signs of Allah and kill the prophets unjustly. That is because they disobeyed and were transgressors.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of disobedience and transgression, where those who reject God's signs and unjustly kill prophets will be met with humiliation, wrath, and misery, emphasizing the severe repercussions of such actions.
orig: ضربت عليهم الذلة أين ما ثقفوا إلا بحبل من الله وحبل من الناس وباءوا بغضب من الله وضربت عليهم المسكنة ذلك بأنهم كانوا يكفرون بآيات الله ويقتلون الأنبياء بغير حق ذلك بما عصوا وكانوا يعتدون

translation: They are not all alike, among the People of the Book is an upright community, reciting the verses of Allah during the night, and they prostrate.
interpretation: This verse highlights the existence of a righteous group among the People of the Book, who are devoted to the worship of Allah, reciting His verses and prostrating in humility, indicating their sincerity and devotion to their faith.
orig: ليسوا سواء من أهل الكتاب أمة قائمة يتلون آيات الله آناء الليل وهم يسجدون

translation: They believe in Allah and the Last Day, and they enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong and hasten to good deeds, and those are among the righteous.
interpretation: The verse highlights the characteristics of righteous individuals who not only believe in Allah and the Day of Judgment but also actively promote goodness and prevent evil, demonstrating their commitment to a morally upright life.
orig: يؤمنون بالله واليوم الآخر ويأمرون بالمعروف وينهون عن المنكر ويسارعون في الخيرات وأولئك من الصالحين

translation: And whatever good they do, it will not be rejected, and Allah is All-Aware of the righteous.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes God's justice and fairness, implying that good deeds will always be acknowledged and rewarded, and that God is fully aware of the righteous individuals who perform them.
orig: وما يفعلوا من خير فلن يكفروه والله عليم بالمتقين

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve, neither their wealth nor their children will avail them against Allah at all. And those - they are the companions of the Fire, they will abide therein forever.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of worldly possessions and family ties in the face of God's judgment, emphasizing that only righteousness and faith can guarantee salvation.
orig: إن الذين كفروا لن تغني عنهم أموالهم ولا أولادهم من الله شيئا وأولئك أصحاب النار هم فيها خالدون

translation: The likeness of what they spend in this life of the world is as the likeness of a wind wherein is a bitter cold, it struck the harvest of a people who did injustice to themselves, and destroyed it, and Allah did not do them any injustice, but they used to do injustice to themselves.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of one's own actions, emphasizing that the suffering and destruction that people experience is often a result of their own wrongdoing, rather than any injustice from God.
orig: مثل ما ينفقون في هذه الحياة الدنيا كمثل ريح فيها صر أصابت حرث قوم ظلموا أنفسهم فأهلكته وما ظلمهم الله ولكن أنفسهم يظلمون

translation: O you who have believed, do not take as intimates those other than your believers, for they will not spare you in the least. They wish you would lose all sense, and hatred has already appeared from their mouths, and what their breasts conceal is greater. We have certainly made clear to you the signs, if you use reason.
interpretation: This verse is a warning to believers to be cautious in their relationships with non-believers, as they may pretend to be friends but ultimately wish harm upon them, and their hidden intentions are even more sinister than their open hostility.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تتخذوا بطانة من دونكم لا يألونكم خبالا ودوا ما عنتم قد بدت البغضاء من أفواههم وما تخفي صدورهم أكبر قد بينا لكم الآيات إن كنتم تعقلون

translation: Or do you think that they will love you when you do not love them, and you believe in the entire Book? When they meet you, they say, 'We believe.' But when they are alone, they bite their fingertips in rage against you. Say, 'Die in your rage.' Indeed, Allah is Knowing of what is within the breasts.
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who claim to believe, but secretly harbor hatred and resentment, and the importance of looking beyond superficial appearances to understand the true intentions of others.
