interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of gratitude and trust in God, reminding believers of God's protection and favor in times of danger and persecution, and encouraging them to rely solely on Him for their safety and well-being.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اذكروا نعمت الله عليكم إذ هم قوم أن يبسطوا إليكم أيديهم فكف أيديهم عنكم واتقوا الله وعلى الله فليتوكل المؤمنون

translation: And indeed, Allah took the covenant of the Children of Israel and sent among them twelve leaders, and Allah said: 'Verily, I am with you, if you establish the prayer, and give the zakat, and believe in My messengers, and support them, and lend Allah a good loan, I will surely forgive you your sins and admit you to gardens beneath which rivers flow. But whoever disbelieves after that among you, has certainly strayed from the even path.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of fulfilling one's covenant with God, emphasizing the reciprocal nature of the relationship between God and humanity, where obedience to God's commands is met with forgiveness, guidance, and eternal reward, while disobedience leads to deviation from the straight path.
orig: ولقد أخذ الله ميثاق بني إسرائيل وبعثنا منهم اثني عشر نقيبا وقال الله إني معكم لئن أقمتم الصلاة وآتيتم الزكاة وآمنتم برسلي وعزرتموهم وأقرضتم الله قرضا حسنا لأكفرن عنكم سيئاتكم ولأدخلنكم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار فمن كفر بعد ذلك منكم فقد ضل سواء السبيل

translation: So because of their breach of their covenant, We cursed them and made their hearts hard. They distort words from their context and have forgotten a portion of what they were reminded of. You will still observe deceit from most of them, except a few of them. Pardon them and overlook. Indeed, Allah loves the doers of good.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of breaking one's covenant with God, which leads to a hardening of the heart, distortion of the truth, and forgetfulness of divine reminders, emphasizing the importance of fulfilling one's commitments to God and adhering to the truth.
orig: فبما نقضهم ميثاقهم لعناهم وجعلنا قلوبهم قاسية يحرفون الكلم عن مواضعه ونسوا حظا مما ذكروا به ولا تزال تطلع على خائنة منهم إلا قليلا منهم فاعف عنهم واصفح إن الله يحب المحسنين

translation: And from those who said, 'Indeed, we are Christians.' We took their covenant; but they forgot a portion of that of which they were reminded, so We stirred up enmity and hatred among them until the Day of Resurrection, and Allah will inform them of what they used to do.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of forgetting or neglecting one's covenant with God, leading to division, enmity, and hatred among people, and ultimately, accountability before God on the Day of Judgment.
orig: ومن الذين قالوا إنا نصارى أخذنا ميثاقهم فنسوا حظا مما ذكروا به فأغرينا بينهم العداوة والبغضاء إلى يوم القيامة وسوف ينبئهم الله بما كانوا يصنعون

translation: O People of the Book! There has come to you Our Messenger, explaining to you much of what you used to hide from the Book, and overlooking much. There has come to you from Allah a light and a clear Book.
interpretation: The verse highlights the role of the Prophet as a revealer of truth, who brings to light the hidden aspects of the scripture, and at the same time, is merciful in overlooking some of the mistakes of the past, thus providing a sense of hope and forgiveness to those who seek it.
orig: يا أهل الكتاب قد جاءكم رسولنا يبين لكم كثيرا مما كنتم تخفون من الكتاب ويعفو عن كثير قد جاءكم من الله نور وكتاب مبين

translation: God guides to Him who follows His pleasure ways of peace, and brings them out of the darkness into the light by His will, and guides them to a straight path.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that spiritual guidance is a divine gift, and those who are favored by God are led out of darkness and ignorance into the light of knowledge and understanding, and are placed on the straight path of righteousness.
orig: يهدي به الله من اتبع رضوانه سبل السلام ويخرجهم من الظلمات إلى النور بإذنه ويهديهم إلى صراط مستقيم

translation: They have certainly disbelieved who say, 'Indeed, Allah is the Messiah, the son of Mary.' Say, 'Then who can prevent Allah at all if He had willed to destroy the Messiah, the son of Mary, and his mother and everyone in the earth?' And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them. He creates what He wills, and Allah is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes God's absolute power and authority over all creation, implying that if He wills to destroy someone or something, no one can prevent it, and that He has the power to create whatever He wills, highlighting His omnipotence.
orig: لقد كفر الذين قالوا إن الله هو المسيح ابن مريم قل فمن يملك من الله شيئا إن أراد أن يهلك المسيح ابن مريم وأمه ومن في الأرض جميعا ولله ملك السماوات والأرض وما بينهما يخلق ما يشاء والله على كل شيء قدير

translation: The Jews and the Christians say: 'We are the sons of Allah and His beloved.' Say: 'Why then does He punish you for your sins?' Nay, you are but human beings, of those He has created, He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills, and to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, and to Him is the return.
interpretation: The verse highlights the misconception of the Jews and Christians who claimed to be the favored children of God, and instead, emphasizes the reality that they are mere mortals, subject to God's justice and mercy, and that their fate is entirely in God's hands.
orig: وقالت اليهود والنصارى نحن أبناء الله وأحباؤه قل فلم يعذبكم بذنوبكم بل أنتم بشر ممن خلق يغفر لمن يشاء ويعذب من يشاء ولله ملك السماوات والأرض وما بينهما وإليه المصير

translation: O People of the Book! There hath come to you Our Messenger, revealing to you much that ye used to hide in the Book, and passing over much (without mentioning it): there hath come to you from Allah a (new) light and a clear Book,
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of the Prophet's arrival as a messenger who brings clarity and revelation to the People of the Book, implying that the Prophet's message is a fulfillment of their own scriptures and a correction of their misunderstandings.
orig: يا أهل الكتاب قد جاءكم رسولنا يبين لكم على فترة من الرسل أن تقولوا ما جاءنا من بشير ولا نذير فقد جاءكم بشير ونذير والله على كل شيء قدير

translation: And when Moses said to his people, 'O my people, remember the favor of Allah upon you when He appointed among you prophets and made you kings and gave you what He had not given to anyone among the worlds.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of gratitude and recognition of God's blessings, emphasizing that the favors bestowed upon the people are a test of their character and a means of distinguishing those who are truly faithful.
orig: وإذ قال موسى لقومه يا قوم اذكروا نعمة الله عليكم إذ جعل فيكم أنبياء وجعلكم ملوكا وآتاكم ما لم يؤت أحدا من العالمين

translation: O my people, enter the Holy Land which Allah has assigned to you and do not turn back on your heels for then you will turn back as losers.
interpretation: The verse is a call to trust in God's promise and have faith in His plan, rather than doubting or fearing the unknown, as the Israelites did when they were commanded to enter the Holy Land.
orig: يا قوم ادخلوا الأرض المقدسة التي كتب الله لكم ولا ترتدوا على أدباركم فتنقلبوا خاسرين

translation: They said: O Musa! Verily, therein are a people given to great might and we will not enter it till they go out from it, so if they go out from it, then we will enter it.
interpretation: The verse highlights the fear and hesitation of the Israelites in the face of a powerful enemy, and how they were reluctant to take action without a guarantee of success, demonstrating a lack of trust in God's promise and power.
orig: قالوا يا موسى إن فيها قوما جبارين وإنا لن ندخلها حتى يخرجوا منها فإن يخرجوا منها فإنا داخلون

translation: Two men among those who feared God said: 'Enter upon them through the gate, and when you have entered it, you will be victorious. Put your trust in God if you are believers.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of trust in God's plan, even in the face of overwhelming odds, and that with faith, one can overcome even the most daunting challenges.
orig: قال رجلان من الذين يخافون أنعم الله عليهما ادخلوا عليهم الباب فإذا دخلتموه فإنكم غالبون وعلى الله فتوكلوا إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: They said: O Musa! We will never enter it as long as they are in it, so go you and your Lord and fight, we will stay here sitting.
interpretation: The verse highlights the cowardice and lack of faith of the Israelites, who refused to take action against their enemies and instead pushed the responsibility onto Musa and God, demonstrating their lack of trust in God's power and their own inability to take initiative.
orig: قالوا يا موسى إنا لن ندخلها أبدا ما داموا فيها فاذهب أنت وربك فقاتلا إنا هاهنا قاعدون

translation: He said: 'My Lord! I do not control except myself and my brother, so separate us from the defiantly disobedient people.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of individual responsibility and accountability, emphasizing that one can only be responsible for oneself and those under their care, and that ultimately, it is up to God to separate the righteous from the wicked.
orig: قال رب إني لا أملك إلا نفسي وأخي فافرق بيننا وبين القوم الفاسقين

translation: He said, 'Indeed, it is forbidden to them for forty years, they will wander on the earth, so do not grieve for the defiantly disobedient people.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of detachment from those who reject God's guidance, and instead, focusing on one's own spiritual growth and obedience to God's commands.
orig: قال فإنها محرمة عليهم أربعين سنة يتيهون في الأرض فلا تأس على القوم الفاسقين

translation: And recite to them the story of the two sons of Adam, in truth, when they both offered a sacrifice, and it was accepted from one of them but not from the other. He said: 'I will surely kill you.' He said: 'Indeed, Allah only accepts from the righteous.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of intentions and righteousness in one's actions, suggesting that even good deeds can be rejected by God if they are not accompanied by a pure heart and sincere intentions.
orig: واتل عليهم نبأ ابني آدم بالحق إذ قربا قربانا فتقبل من أحدهما ولم يتقبل من الآخر قال لأقتلنك قال إنما يتقبل الله من المتقين

translation: If you stretch out your hand to kill me, I am not stretching out my hand to kill you. Indeed, I fear Allah, Lord of the Worlds.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of self-control and restraint in the face of aggression, as exemplified by the prophet's words, demonstrating that true strength lies not in retaliation, but in the ability to forgive and trust in God's justice.
orig: لئن بسطت إلي يدك لتقتلني ما أنا بباسط يدي إليك لأقتلك إني أخاف الله رب العالمين

translation: Verily, I shall bear the burden of my sin and yours, then you shall be among the companions of the Fire, and that is the recompense of the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of accountability, where an individual takes responsibility for their own actions and those of others, ultimately leading to a shared fate of punishment in the afterlife.
orig: إني أريد أن تبوء بإثمي وإثمك فتكون من أصحاب النار وذلك جزاء الظالمين

translation: And he allowed himself to kill his brother, and he killed him, so he became of the losers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the devastating consequences of unchecked desires and unbridled emotions, as Cain's giving in to his jealousy and anger led him to commit a heinous crime, resulting in his own spiritual downfall.
orig: فطوعت له نفسه قتل أخيه فقتله فأصبح من الخاسرين

translation: Then Allah sent a crow searching in the earth to show him how to hide his brother's naked corpse. He said, 'Woe to me! Am I unable to be like this crow and hide my brother's naked corpse?' Then he became of those who regretted.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of taking responsibility for one's actions, as the brother's regret and remorse serve as a reminder that it is never too late to make amends and take corrective action, and that seeking guidance and wisdom, as exemplified by the crow, can lead to personal growth and redemption.
orig: فبعث الله غرابا يبحث في الأرض ليريه كيف يواري سوءة أخيه قال يا ويلتا أعجزت أن أكون مثل هذا الغراب فأواري سوءة أخي فأصبح من النادمين

translation: For this reason, We ordained for the Children of Israel that whoever kills a person, except in retribution for murder or spreading corruption, it is as if he had killed all mankind, and whoever saves a life, it is as if he had saved all mankind. And certainly, Our messengers came to them with clear proofs, then indeed, many of them after that were excessive in the earth.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of taking a human life and the importance of preserving it, emphasizing that killing one person is equivalent to killing all of humanity, and saving one life is equivalent to saving all of humanity, thus emphasizing the value and sanctity of human life.
orig: من أجل ذلك كتبنا على بني إسرائيل أنه من قتل نفسا بغير نفس أو فساد في الأرض فكأنما قتل الناس جميعا ومن أحياها فكأنما أحيا الناس جميعا ولقد جاءتهم رسلنا بالبينات ثم إن كثيرا منهم بعد ذلك في الأرض لمسرفون

translation: The recompense of those who wage war against Allah and His Messenger and strive upon earth corruption is that they be killed or crucified or that their hands and feet be cut off from opposite sides or that they be exiled from the earth. That is for them a disgrace in this world, and for them in the Hereafter is a great punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the severe consequences of actively working against God and His Messenger, emphasizing that such individuals will face severe punishments in both this life and the next, serving as a warning to those who would seek to spread corruption and chaos.
orig: إنما جزاء الذين يحاربون الله ورسوله ويسعون في الأرض فسادا أن يقتلوا أو يصلبوا أو تقطع أيديهم وأرجلهم من خلاف أو ينفوا من الأرض ذلك لهم خزي في الدنيا ولهم في الآخرة عذاب عظيم

translation: Except for those who repent before you have power over them, so know that Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of repentance and Allah's mercy, emphasizing that even those who have committed wrongs can escape punishment if they genuinely repent before being caught, and that Allah is always ready to forgive and show mercy to those who return to Him.
orig: إلا الذين تابوا من قبل أن تقدروا عليهم فاعلموا أن الله غفور رحيم

translation: O you who have believed, fear Allah and seek the means of approach to Him, and strive in His path that you may succeed.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of striving to please God and seeking a strong connection with Him, which is the key to achieving success in this life and the hereafter.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اتقوا الله وابتغوا إليه الوسيلة وجاهدوا في سبيله لعلكم تفلحون

translation: If those who disbelieved had all that is in the earth and the like of it with it, to ransom themselves from the punishment of the Day of Resurrection, it would not be accepted from them, and they will have a painful punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of disbelief and the futility of material wealth in the face of God's justice, implying that even if the disbelievers possessed all the riches in the world, it would not be enough to save them from the punishment awaiting them on the Day of Judgment.
orig: إن الذين كفروا لو أن لهم ما في الأرض جميعا ومثله معه ليفتدوا به من عذاب يوم القيامة ما تقبل منهم ولهم عذاب أليم

translation: They wish to get out of the Fire, but they shall not get out of it, and theirs is a lasting punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futile desire of those in Hell to escape their torment, emphasizing that their punishment is eternal and inescapable, and that they will be trapped in their suffering forever.
orig: يريدون أن يخرجوا من النار وما هم بخارجين منها ولهم عذاب مقيم

translation: As for the thief, male or female, cut off their hands as a recompense for what they have earned, an exemplary punishment from Allah, and Allah is Exalted in Power, Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of justice and punishment for crimes, highlighting that the punishment should be proportionate to the crime, and that it serves as a deterrent to others, thereby maintaining social order and stability.
orig: والسارق والسارقة فاقطعوا أيديهما جزاء بما كسبا نكالا من الله والله عزيز حكيم

translation: And whoever repents after his wrongdoing and reforms, then indeed, Allah will turn to him. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the boundless mercy of God, emphasizing that no matter how grave one's sins may be, repentance and reform can lead to forgiveness, and God's mercy is always available to those who seek it.
orig: فمن تاب من بعد ظلمه وأصلح فإن الله يتوب عليه إن الله غفور رحيم

translation: Did you not know that to Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth? He punishes whom He wills and forgives whom He wills, and Allah is Able to do all things.
interpretation: The verse highlights the absolute authority and power of God, emphasizing that He has complete control over the universe and can punish or forgive anyone at His will, demonstrating His omnipotence and sovereignty.
orig: ألم تعلم أن الله له ملك السماوات والأرض يعذب من يشاء ويغفر لمن يشاء والله على كل شيء قدير

translation: O Messenger, let not grieve you those who hasten to disbelief from those who say, 'We believe' with their mouths, but their hearts do not believe, and from among the Jews, listeners to falsehood, listeners to other people who have not come to you. They distort words from their [proper] places, saying, 'If you are given this, take it, but if you are not given it, be cautious.' And whoever Allah wants to put to trial, you cannot avail him against Allah at all. Those are the ones whom Allah does not want to purify their hearts. For them is disgrace in this world, and for them is a great punishment in the Hereafter.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of sincerity in faith, warning against those who claim to believe but do not truly have faith in their hearts, and instead seek to deceive and manipulate others for their own gain.
orig: يا أيها الرسول لا يحزنك الذين يسارعون في الكفر من الذين قالوا آمنا بأفواههم ولم تؤمن قلوبهم ومن الذين هادوا سماعون للكذب سماعون لقوم آخرين لم يأتوك يحرفون الكلم من بعد مواضعه يقولون إن أوتيتم هذا فخذوه وإن لم تؤتوه فاحذروا ومن يرد الله فتنته فلن تملك له من الله شيئا أولئك الذين لم يرد الله أن يطهر قلوبهم لهم في الدنيا خزي ولهم في الآخرة عذاب عظيم

translation: They listen to falsehood, devour usury. If they come to you, judge between them or turn away from them. If you turn away from them, they will not harm you in the least. If you judge, judge between them with justice. Indeed, Allah loves the just.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of justice and fairness in judgment, emphasizing that God loves those who are just and fair in their dealings with others.
orig: سماعون للكذب أكالون للسحت فإن جاءوك فاحكم بينهم أو أعرض عنهم وإن تعرض عنهم فلن يضروك شيئا وإن حكمت فاحكم بينهم بالقسط إن الله يحب المقسطين

translation: And how do they make you a judge and they have the Torah, wherein is the judgment of Allah, then they turn away after that, and those are not believers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who claim to follow the Torah, but reject the authority of the Prophet Muhammad, implying that they are not true believers, as they selectively choose to follow or ignore the divine guidance according to their whims.
orig: وكيف يحكمونك وعندهم التوراة فيها حكم الله ثم يتولون من بعد ذلك وما أولئك بالمؤمنين

translation: Indeed, We sent down the Torah, in which is guidance and light. The prophets who submitted [to Allah] judged by it for those who were Jews, as did the rabbis and the scholars, with what they were entrusted of the Scripture of Allah, and they were witnesses thereto. So do not fear the people but fear Me, and do not sell My verses for a little price. And whoever does not judge by what Allah has revealed, then those are the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of following the divine guidance and not compromising on the principles of justice and morality, even if it means going against the norms of society, and that fear of God should be the primary motivator for human actions, rather than fear of people or material gain.
orig: إنا أنزلنا التوراة فيها هدى ونور يحكم بها النبيون الذين أسلموا للذين هادوا والربانيون والأحبار بما استحفظوا من كتاب الله وكانوا عليه شهداء فلا تخشوا الناس واخشون ولا تشتروا بآياتي ثمنا قليلا ومن لم يحكم بما أنزل الله فأولئك هم الكافرون

translation: And We ordained therein for them: a life for a life, an eye for an eye, a nose for a nose, an ear for an ear, a tooth for a tooth, and wounds equal for equal. But if anyone remits the retaliation by way of charity, it shall be an expiation for him. And whoever does not judge by what Allah has revealed, then it is those who are the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of justice and accountability, emphasizing that the punishment should fit the crime, but also leaving room for forgiveness and mercy, as a way to encourage moral growth and self-reflection.
orig: وكتبنا عليهم فيها أن النفس بالنفس والعين بالعين والأنف بالأنف والأذن بالأذن والسن بالسن والجروح قصاص فمن تصدق به فهو كفارة له ومن لم يحكم بما أنزل الله فأولئك هم الظالمون

translation: And We have sent, following in the footsteps of those sent, Jesus, the son of Mary, confirming what was before him in the Torah and We gave him the Gospel, wherein is guidance and light, and confirming what was before him in the Torah, and a guidance and an admonition unto those who ward off (evil).
interpretation: The verse highlights the connection between the message of Jesus and the previous scriptures, emphasizing the continuity and consistency of God's revelation, and reminding believers of their responsibility to follow the guidance and light provided by these sacred texts.
orig: وقفينا على آثارهم بعيسى ابن مريم مصدقا لما بين يديه من التوراة وآتيناه الإنجيل فيه هدى ونور ومصدقا لما بين يديه من التوراة وهدى وموعظة للمتقين

translation: And let the People of the Gospel judge by what Allah has revealed therein. And whoever does not judge by what Allah has revealed - then it is those who are the defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of adhering to the divine guidance and judgment, and warns against rejecting or disobeying God's revelations, which is considered a characteristic of the defiantly disobedient.
orig: وليحكم أهل الإنجيل بما أنزل الله فيه ومن لم يحكم بما أنزل الله فأولئك هم الفاسقون

translation: And We have revealed to you the Book with the truth, confirming what is between his hands of the Book and a guardian over it. So judge between them by what Allah has revealed, and do not follow their inclinations away from what has come to you of the truth. For each We have made a law and a clear way. If Allah had willed, He would have made you one community, but He wanted to test you in what He has given you. So hasten to good deeds. To Allah is your return all together, and He will inform you about that in which you used to differ.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of adhering to the divine guidance and not being swayed by personal desires or inclinations, as it is only through submission to God's will that one can attain true guidance and righteousness.
orig: وأنزلنا إليك الكتاب بالحق مصدقا لما بين يديه من الكتاب ومهيمنا عليه فاحكم بينهم بما أنزل الله ولا تتبع أهواءهم عما جاءك من الحق لكل جعلنا منكم شرعة ومنهاجا ولو شاء الله لجعلكم أمة واحدة ولكن ليبلوكم في ما آتاكم فاستبقوا الخيرات إلى الله مرجعكم جميعا فينبئكم بما كنتم فيه تختلفون

translation: And judge between them by what Allah has revealed, and do not follow their desires, and beware of them lest they tempt you away from some of what Allah has revealed to you. If they turn away, then know that Allah intends to afflict them for some of their sins. And indeed, many of the people are defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of adhering to divine guidance and not being swayed by personal desires or external influences, as this can lead to deviation from the right path and ultimately, divine retribution.
orig: وأن احكم بينهم بما أنزل الله ولا تتبع أهواءهم واحذرهم أن يفتنوك عن بعض ما أنزل الله إليك فإن تولوا فاعلم أنما يريد الله أن يصيبهم ببعض ذنوبهم وإن كثيرا من الناس لفاسقون

translation: Do they seek the judgment of the time of ignorance? And for people who are certain, who is better than Allah in judgment?
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of seeking guidance from pre-Islamic customs and traditions, emphasizing that Allah's judgment is the most superior and trustworthy, especially for those who have conviction in their faith.
orig: أفحكم الجاهلية يبغون ومن أحسن من الله حكما لقوم يوقنون

translation: O you who have believed, do not take the Jews and the Christians as allies. Some of them are allies to one another. And whoever among you takes them as allies, then indeed, he is [one] of them. Indeed, Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
interpretation: This verse warns believers against forming close relationships with Jews and Christians, as they are in a state of opposition to the truth, and such relationships can lead to spiritual corruption and deviation from the right path.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تتخذوا اليهود والنصارى أولياء بعضهم أولياء بعض ومن يتولهم منكم فإنه منهم إن الله لا يهدي القوم الظالمين

translation: You see those in whose hearts is a disease, hastening to them, saying: 'We fear lest a change of fortune bring us disaster.' Perhaps Allah will bring about a victory or a command from Him, so that they will become regretful of what they have concealed in their own selves.
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who claim to be believers but are actually driven by fear and uncertainty, and are therefore unable to take a clear stance, and will ultimately regret their cowardice and deceit.
orig: فترى الذين في قلوبهم مرض يسارعون فيهم يقولون نخشى أن تصيبنا دائرة فعسى الله أن يأتي بالفتح أو أمر من عنده فيصبحوا على ما أسروا في أنفسهم نادمين

translation: And those who believe say: 'Are these the men who swore by Allah, their solemn oaths, that they were with you?' Their deeds have been annulled, and they have become losers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the irony and hypocrisy of those who claimed to be allies, but ultimately proved to be false and unreliable, and as a result, their actions became worthless and they suffered loss.
orig: ويقول الذين آمنوا أهؤلاء الذين أقسموا بالله جهد أيمانهم إنهم لمعكم حبطت أعمالهم فأصبحوا خاسرين

translation: O you who have believed, whoever of you turns back from his religion, Allah will bring a people whom He will love and who will love Him, humble towards the believers, stern towards the disbelievers, striving in the cause of Allah and fearing not the blame of a critic. That is the favor of Allah, He gives it to whom He wills, and Allah is all-Encompassing, Knowing.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of spiritual transformation, where those who abandon their faith will be replaced by a new generation of believers who will be loved and cherished by God, and will be characterized by their humility towards fellow believers and firmness towards disbelievers, exemplifying the ideal of a true believer.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا من يرتد منكم عن دينه فسوف يأتي الله بقوم يحبهم ويحبونه أذلة على المؤمنين أعزة على الكافرين يجاهدون في سبيل الله ولا يخافون لومة لائم ذلك فضل الله يؤتيه من يشاء والله واسع عليم

translation: Your ally is only Allah and His Messenger and the believers, those who establish prayer and give zakah while they are bowing.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of spiritual connection and alliance with Allah, His Messenger, and the community of believers, emphasizing the need for a strong bond with those who are devoted to prayer and charitable giving, as a means of achieving spiritual growth and protection.
orig: إنما وليكم الله ورسوله والذين آمنوا الذين يقيمون الصلاة ويؤتون الزكاة وهم راكعون

translation: And whoever takes Allah and His Messenger and those who believe as their allies, then indeed the party of Allah will be victorious.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of loyalty and allegiance to Allah, His Messenger, and the believers, emphasizing that those who do so will ultimately emerge victorious and triumphant in their struggle against the forces of evil and disbelief.
orig: ومن يتول الله ورسوله والذين آمنوا فإن حزب الله هم الغالبون

translation: O you who have believed, do not take those who take your religion in ridicule and amusement from among those who were given the Scripture before you and the disbelievers as allies. And fear Allah, if you are believers.
interpretation: The verse warns believers against forming alliances with those who mock their faith, including both the People of the Book and the disbelievers, and instead emphasizes the importance of maintaining a strong sense of faith and fear of God.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تتخذوا الذين اتخذوا دينكم هزوا ولعبا من الذين أوتوا الكتاب من قبلكم والكفار أولياء واتقوا الله إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: And when you call to prayer, they take it in ridicule and play, that is because they are a people who do not understand.
interpretation: The verse highlights the lack of understanding and ignorance of those who mock and ridicule the call to prayer, indicating that they are not only rejecting the invitation to worship, but also demonstrating their lack of comprehension of the significance of faith and spirituality.
orig: وإذا ناديتم إلى الصلاة اتخذوها هزوا ولعبا ذلك بأنهم قوم لا يعقلون

translation: Say, 'O People of the Scripture, do you resent us except [for the fact] that we have believed in Allah and what has been revealed to us and what was revealed before? And most of you are defiantly disobedient.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the irony of the People of the Scripture's resentment towards the believers, when in fact the believers are simply following the same divine guidance that was revealed to them, and yet they are met with defiance and disobedience from the very people who claim to be followers of the Scripture.
orig: قل يا أهل الكتاب هل تنقمون منا إلا أن آمنا بالله وما أنزل إلينا وما أنزل من قبل وأن أكثركم فاسقون

translation: Say, 'Shall I inform you of something worse than that as a punishment from Allah? The ones whom Allah has cursed and with whom He became angry and made some of them apes and pigs and slaves of Taghut. Those are in a worse situation and farther astray from the right path.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the gravity of God's punishment, where those who have earned His wrath are not only cursed but also transformed into creatures that are despised in society, such as apes and pigs, symbolizing their loss of dignity and humanity, and ultimately, their complete deviation from the righteous path.
orig: قل هل أنبئكم بشر من ذلك مثوبة عند الله من لعنه الله وغضب عليه وجعل منهم القردة والخنازير وعبد الطاغوت أولئك شر مكانا وأضل عن سواء السبيل

translation: And when they come to you, they say, 'We believe.' But they have entered with disbelief, and they have departed with it, and Allah is most knowing of what they were concealing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who pretend to believe, but in reality, they harbor disbelief in their hearts, and the all-knowing Allah is aware of their hidden intentions.
orig: وإذا جاءوكم قالوا آمنا وقد دخلوا بالكفر وهم قد خرجوا به والله أعلم بما كانوا يكتمون

translation: And you see many of them hastening to sin and aggression and devouring usury. How evil is that which they were doing.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of indulging in sinful and harmful behavior, such as usury, and how it can lead to a downward spiral of moral decay and social corruption.
orig: وترى كثيرا منهم يسارعون في الإثم والعدوان وأكلهم السحت لبئس ما كانوا يعملون

translation: If only the rabbis and the scholars had forbidden them from speaking evil and consuming ill-gotten gains, it would have been better for them, for what they used to do was evil.
interpretation: The verse highlights the responsibility of religious leaders and scholars in guiding their followers towards righteousness, and warns that their failure to do so can lead to corruption and evil deeds.
orig: لولا ينهاهم الربانيون والأحبار عن قولهم الإثم وأكلهم السحت لبئس ما كانوا يصنعون

translation: The Jews say: 'Allah's hand is tied up.' Be their hands tied up and be they accursed for what they utter. Nay, both His hands are widely outstretched. He spends as He wills. And what has been revealed to you from your Lord will increase many of them in transgression and disbelief. And We have cast among them enmity and hatred till the Day of Resurrection. Every time they kindled the fire of war, Allah extinguished it. And they strive to make mischief on earth. And Allah does not love the mischief-makers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of rejecting God's guidance, as the Jews' accusations against God are met with increased transgression and disbelief, ultimately leading to enmity, hatred, and mischief on earth.
orig: وقالت اليهود يد الله مغلولة غلت أيديهم ولعنوا بما قالوا بل يداه مبسوطتان ينفق كيف يشاء وليزيدن كثيرا منهم ما أنزل إليك من ربك طغيانا وكفرا وألقينا بينهم العداوة والبغضاء إلى يوم القيامة كلما أوقدوا نارا للحرب أطفأها الله ويسعون في الأرض فسادا والله لا يحب المفسدين

translation: And if the people of the Scripture had believed and kept from evil, We would have forgiven them their evil deeds and admitted them to Gardens of Delight.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of faith and righteousness, emphasizing that if the people of the Scripture had embraced faith and avoided evil, they would have been rewarded with forgiveness and admission to Paradise, underscoring the direct correlation between one's actions and their ultimate destination.
orig: ولو أن أهل الكتاب آمنوا واتقوا لكفرنا عنهم سيئاتهم ولأدخلناهم جنات النعيم

translation: And if they had observed the Torah and the Gospel and what was revealed to them from their Lord, they would have eaten from above them and from beneath their feet. Among them is a moderate nation, but many of them - evil is that which they do.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of adhering to the divine guidance, suggesting that if the people had followed the scriptures, they would have been blessed with prosperity and abundance from all directions, but instead, their disobedience has led to their downfall.
orig: ولو أنهم أقاموا التوراة والإنجيل وما أنزل إليهم من ربهم لأكلوا من فوقهم ومن تحت أرجلهم منهم أمة مقتصدة وكثير منهم ساء ما يعملون

translation: O Messenger, announce what has been revealed to you from your Lord, and if you do not, then you have not conveyed His message. And Allah will protect you from the people. Indeed, Allah does not guide the disbelieving people.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of the Prophet's role in conveying the message of God, and warns that if he fails to do so, he will be held accountable for not fulfilling his duty, and that God will protect him from the people who may try to harm him.
orig: يا أيها الرسول بلغ ما أنزل إليك من ربك وإن لم تفعل فما بلغت رسالته والله يعصمك من الناس إن الله لا يهدي القوم الكافرين

translation: Say, 'O People of the Scripture, you are not upon anything until you establish the Torah and the Gospel and what has been sent down to you from your Lord.' And it will increase many of them in transgression and disbelief. So do not grieve over the disbelieving people.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of adhering to the original teachings of the scripture, rather than deviating from them, and serves as a warning to those who have strayed from the right path, highlighting the consequences of their disobedience.
orig: قل يا أهل الكتاب لستم على شيء حتى تقيموا التوراة والإنجيل وما أنزل إليكم من ربكم وليزيدن كثيرا منهم ما أنزل إليك من ربك طغيانا وكفرا فلا تأس على القوم الكافرين

translation: Indeed, those who have believed, and those who were Jews, and the Sabeans, and the Christians - whoever believed in Allah and the Last Day and did good deeds - there will be no fear upon them, nor will they grieve.
interpretation: The verse highlights the universal principle of salvation, emphasizing that it is not limited to a particular faith or community, but rather is open to all who believe in God, the Last Day, and do good deeds, regardless of their religious affiliation.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا والذين هادوا والصابئون والنصارى من آمن بالله واليوم الآخر وعمل صالحا فلا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: Indeed, We took a covenant from the Children of Israel and sent among them messengers. Whenever there came to them a messenger with what their souls did not desire, a party rejected and another party killed.
interpretation: This verse highlights the tendency of people to reject or even harm those who bring a message that challenges their desires or interests, emphasizing the importance of humility and openness to guidance from God.
orig: لقد أخذنا ميثاق بني إسرائيل وأرسلنا إليهم رسلا كلما جاءهم رسول بما لا تهوى أنفسهم فريقا كذبوا وفريقا يقتلون

translation: And they thought that there would be no trial, so they became blind and deaf, then Allah turned to them, then they became blind and deaf, many of them, and Allah is seeing of what they do.
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to become complacent and neglectful of their spiritual duties, leading to a state of spiritual blindness and deafness, and only when they are afflicted with trials and hardships do they turn to God, but soon they forget and return to their state of neglect, and God is always aware of their actions.
orig: وحسبوا ألا تكون فتنة فعموا وصموا ثم تاب الله عليهم ثم عموا وصموا كثير منهم والله بصير بما يعملون

translation: They indeed disbelieved who said: 'Verily, Allah is the Messiah, son of Mary.' And the Messiah said: 'O Children of Israel! Worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord.' Verily, whoever associates partners with Allah, Allah has forbidden Paradise for him, and the Fire will be his abode. And for the wrongdoers there will be no helpers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of associating partners with God, emphasizing that it is a grave sin that will lead to exclusion from Paradise and eternal damnation in Hell, and that those who commit this sin will have no one to help them on the Day of Judgment.
orig: لقد كفر الذين قالوا إن الله هو المسيح ابن مريم وقال المسيح يا بني إسرائيل اعبدوا الله ربي وربكم إنه من يشرك بالله فقد حرم الله عليه الجنة ومأواه النار وما للظالمين من أنصار

translation: They have certainly disbelieved who say, 'Allah is the third of three.' And there is no god except one God. And if they do not desist from what they are saying, there will surely afflict those who disbelieve among them a painful punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of committing shirk (polytheism) by associating partners with Allah, emphasizing that the belief in the Trinity is a form of disbelief and a rejection of the fundamental principle of Tawhid (the oneness of God), and warns those who persist in this belief of a severe punishment.
orig: لقد كفر الذين قالوا إن الله ثالث ثلاثة وما من إله إلا إله واحد وإن لم ينتهوا عما يقولون ليمسن الذين كفروا منهم عذاب أليم

translation: Then will they not turn to Allah and ask His forgiveness? And Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
interpretation: The verse is an invitation to repentance, emphasizing the availability of God's mercy and forgiveness to those who turn to Him, implying that it is never too late to change one's ways and seek forgiveness.
orig: أفلا يتوبون إلى الله ويستغفرونه والله غفور رحيم

translation: The Messiah, son of Mary, was no more than a messenger; many were the messengers that passed away before him. And his mother was a woman of truth. They used to eat food. See how We explain the signs to them, then see how they are turned away.
interpretation: The verse highlights the humanity of Jesus and his mother Mary, emphasizing that they were ordinary human beings who needed to eat to survive, unlike gods who do not need food. This serves as a reminder to those who elevate Jesus to a divine status, emphasizing his mortality and humanity.
orig: ما المسيح ابن مريم إلا رسول قد خلت من قبله الرسل وأمه صديقة كانا يأكلان الطعام انظر كيف نبين لهم الآيات ثم انظر أنى يؤفكون

translation: Say, 'Do you worship besides Allah that which does not possess the power to harm or benefit you, while Allah is the Hearing, the Knowing?'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the futility of worshiping anything other than Allah, as those objects of worship are powerless to bring harm or benefit, whereas Allah is all-knowing and all-hearing, implying that only He is worthy of worship.
orig: قل أتعبدون من دون الله ما لا يملك لكم ضرا ولا نفعا والله هو السميع العليم

translation: Say, 'O People of the Scripture, do not exceed limits in your religion other than the truth, and do not follow the inclinations of a people who had gone astray before and led many astray, and have strayed from the right path.'
interpretation: The verse is a warning to the People of the Book (Jews and Christians) against extremism and excess in their religious practices, and against blindly following the desires and traditions of their ancestors, which led them astray from the straight path of God.
orig: قل يا أهل الكتاب لا تغلوا في دينكم غير الحق ولا تتبعوا أهواء قوم قد ضلوا من قبل وأضلوا كثيرا وضلوا عن سواء السبيل

translation: Curses were pronounced on those among the Children of Israel who rejected faith, by the tongue of David and Jesus the son of Mary, because they disobeyed and were given to transgression.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of disobedience and transgression, emphasizing that those who reject faith and disobey God's commandments will ultimately face divine retribution and condemnation.
orig: لعن الذين كفروا من بني إسرائيل على لسان داوود وعيسى ابن مريم ذلك بما عصوا وكانوا يعتدون

translation: They would not desist from the evil they were doing, and it was evil what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse highlights the stubbornness of those who persist in their wrongdoing, implying that they are unwilling to change their ways despite being aware of the evil nature of their actions, and that their persistence in sin will ultimately lead to their downfall.
orig: كانوا لا يتناهون عن منكر فعلوه لبئس ما كانوا يفعلون

translation: You see many of them taking the disbelievers as allies. Evil is that which they have sent forth for themselves, that Allah is angry with them, and in the punishment they will abide.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who befriend and ally with disbelievers will ultimately face the wrath of God and suffer eternal punishment, implying that such alliances are a grave mistake with severe consequences.
orig: ترى كثيرا منهم يتولون الذين كفروا لبئس ما قدمت لهم أنفسهم أن سخط الله عليهم وفي العذاب هم خالدون

translation: And if they had believed in Allah and the Prophet and what was revealed to him, they would not have taken them as allies, but many of them are defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse highlights the contradiction in the behavior of those who claim to believe in God and the Prophet, yet they still maintain close relationships with those who oppose God's message, indicating a lack of sincerity in their faith.
orig: ولو كانوا يؤمنون بالله والنبي وما أنزل إليه ما اتخذوهم أولياء ولكن كثيرا منهم فاسقون

translation: You will surely find the most intense of the people in animosity toward the believers to be the Jews and those who associate others with Allah; and you will find the nearest of them in affection to the believers to be those who say, 'We are Christians.' That is because among them are scholars and monks, and they do not behave arrogantly.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of humility in faith, suggesting that those who are humble and unassuming in their beliefs are more likely to be friendly and affectionate towards the believers, whereas those who are arrogant and proud are more likely to be hostile and antagonistic.
orig: لتجدن أشد الناس عداوة للذين آمنوا اليهود والذين أشركوا ولتجدن أقربهم مودة للذين آمنوا الذين قالوا إنا نصارى ذلك بأن منهم قسيسين ورهبانا وأنهم لا يستكبرون

translation: And when they hear what has been revealed to the Messenger, you see their eyes overflowing with tears because of the truth they recognize. They say: 'Our Lord, we believe, so write us down among the witnesses.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the emotional and spiritual response of believers when they hear the revelations of God, demonstrating their humility, sincerity, and eagerness to be counted among those who bear witness to the truth.
orig: وإذا سمعوا ما أنزل إلى الرسول ترى أعينهم تفيض من الدمع مما عرفوا من الحق يقولون ربنا آمنا فاكتبنا مع الشاهدين

translation: And what prevents us from believing in Allah and what has come to us of the truth, and we hope that our Lord will admit us among the righteous people.
interpretation: The verse reveals the inner struggle and desire of the believers to be counted among the righteous, and their hope of being admitted into the company of the virtuous, demonstrating their humility and eagerness to be pleasing to God.
orig: وما لنا لا نؤمن بالله وما جاءنا من الحق ونطمع أن يدخلنا ربنا مع القوم الصالحين

translation: So Allah rewarded them for what they said, with Gardens underneath which rivers flow, they will abide in them, and that is the reward of the doers of good.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of spiritual reward, where believers will be granted eternal bliss in Paradise, symbolized by the gardens and rivers, in return for their righteous deeds and faithfulness to God's words.
orig: فأثابهم الله بما قالوا جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها وذلك جزاء المحسنين

translation: And those who disbelieve and deny Our signs, those are the companions of the blazing fire.
interpretation: The verse highlights the eternal consequence of rejecting God's signs and revelations, which is eternal damnation in the blazing fire of Hell, emphasizing the gravity of disbelief and its consequences in the afterlife.
orig: والذين كفروا وكذبوا بآياتنا أولئك أصحاب الجحيم

translation: O you who have believed, do not prohibit the good things which Allah has made lawful to you and do not transgress; indeed, Allah does not like transgressors.
interpretation: This verse is a warning against extremism in religious practices, reminding believers that they should not overstep the boundaries set by God and not deprive themselves of the good things that are permissible, as this can lead to a slippery slope of fanaticism and ultimately, disobedience.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تحرموا طيبات ما أحل الله لكم ولا تعتدوا إن الله لا يحب المعتدين

translation: And eat of the good and lawful things that Allah has provided for you, and fear Allah in whom you believe.
interpretation: The verse is emphasizing the importance of being grateful for the blessings and provisions given by Allah, and to use them in a way that is pleasing to Him, which in turn will strengthen one's faith and trust in Allah.
orig: وكلوا مما رزقكم الله حلالا طيبا واتقوا الله الذي أنتم به مؤمنون

translation: God does not take you to task for the vagueness in your oaths, but He takes you to task for the oaths which you have made binding; its expiation is to feed ten poor people with the average of what you feed your families, or to clothe them, or to free a slave; but whoever cannot find, then a fast of three days; that is the expiation of your oaths when you have sworn; and keep your oaths; thus God makes clear to you His signs, so that you may be grateful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of keeping one's oaths and promises, emphasizing that God holds people accountable for the commitments they make, and provides a way for them to make amends if they fail to fulfill their oaths, serving as a reminder to be mindful of the power of one's words and actions.
orig: لا يؤاخذكم الله باللغو في أيمانكم ولكن يؤاخذكم بما عقدتم الأيمان فكفارته إطعام عشرة مساكين من أوسط ما تطعمون أهليكم أو كسوتهم أو تحرير رقبة فمن لم يجد فصيام ثلاثة أيام ذلك كفارة أيمانكم إذا حلفتم واحفظوا أيمانكم كذلك يبين الله لكم آياته لعلكم تشكرون

translation: O you who have believed, indeed, intoxicants, and gambling, and [sacrificing to] stones, and [divining with] arrows are but defilement from the work of Satan, so avoid it that you may be successful.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of avoiding sinful activities, as they are considered to be inspired by Satan and can lead to spiritual impurity, and that refraining from them is essential for achieving success and salvation in the Hereafter.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إنما الخمر والميسر والأنصاب والأزلام رجس من عمل الشيطان فاجتنبوه لعلكم تفلحون

translation: Satan only wants to stir up enmity and hatred among you through intoxicants and games of chance, and to prevent you from remembering Allah and from prayer. Will you then abstain?
interpretation: The verse highlights the subtle yet powerful influence of Satan in promoting social vices that lead people away from their spiritual responsibilities, and how these vices can become obstacles to a strong faith.
orig: إنما يريد الشيطان أن يوقع بينكم العداوة والبغضاء في الخمر والميسر ويصدكم عن ذكر الله وعن الصلاة فهل أنتم منتهون

translation: And obey Allah and obey the Messenger, and beware. If you turn away, then know that the duty of Our Messenger is only to convey clearly.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of obedience to Allah and His Messenger, and warns that if one turns away from this obedience, they will be held accountable, and the Messenger's responsibility is only to convey the message clearly, not to enforce its acceptance.
orig: وأطيعوا الله وأطيعوا الرسول واحذروا فإن توليتم فاعلموا أنما على رسولنا البلاغ المبين

translation: There is no blame on those who believe and do righteous deeds concerning what they ate, as long as they fear and believe and do righteous deeds, then fear and believe, then fear and do good, and Allah loves the good-doers.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of fear of God and doing good deeds, suggesting that a true believer is not only one who believes but also one who consistently practices righteousness and fears God.
orig: ليس على الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات جناح فيما طعموا إذا ما اتقوا وآمنوا وعملوا الصالحات ثم اتقوا وآمنوا ثم اتقوا وأحسنوا والله يحب المحسنين

translation: O you who have believed, Allah will surely test you with something of the game that your hands and lances [can] reach, that Allah may make evident those who fear Him unseen. Then whoever transgresses after that - for him is a painful punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that God tests believers through various means, including the provision of sustenance, in order to distinguish those who truly fear Him from those who do not, and to prepare them for the ultimate test of faith and obedience.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا ليبلونكم الله بشيء من الصيد تناله أيديكم ورماحكم ليعلم الله من يخافه بالغيب فمن اعتدى بعد ذلك فله عذاب أليم

translation: O you who have believed, do not kill game while you are in the state of ihram. And whoever of you kills it intentionally - the penalty is an offering, brought to the Kaaba, of a sacrificial animal equivalent in value to the game killed, as judged by two just persons among you, or as an expiation, the feeding of poor persons, or the equivalent of that, the fasting. That is in order that he may taste the consequence of his deed. Allah has pardoned what is past, but whoever returns, Allah will take retribution from him. And Allah is Exalted in Power, Able to enforce His Will.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obedience to God's commands, even in situations where it may be difficult or inconvenient, and serves as a reminder that disobedience will be punished, while obedience will be rewarded, and that God is all-powerful and will not hesitate to take revenge on those who disobey Him.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تقتلوا الصيد وأنتم حرم ومن قتله منكم متعمدا فجزاء مثل ما قتل من النعم يحكم به ذوا عدل منكم هديا بالغ الكعبة أو كفارة طعام مساكين أو عدل ذلك صياما ليذوق وبال أمره عفا الله عما سلف ومن عاد فينتقم الله منه والله عزيز ذو انتقام

translation: Lawful to you is the game of the sea and its food, a provision for you and for the travelers, and forbidden to you is the game of the land as long as you are in a state of Ihram, and fear Allah to Whom you will be gathered.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of following God's commands, even in the smallest details, such as what is permissible to eat, especially during sacred rituals like Ihram, and reminds believers of their ultimate accountability to God.
orig: أحل لكم صيد البحر وطعامه متاعا لكم وللسيارة وحرم عليكم صيد البر ما دمتم حرما واتقوا الله الذي إليه تحشرون

translation: Allah has made the Ka'bah, the Sacred House, a maintenance for mankind, and the Sacred Month, and the offerings, and the garlands. That you may know that Allah knows whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, and that Allah is All-Knower of everything.
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of the Ka'bah as a symbol of God's presence and guidance, emphasizing that it serves as a reminder of God's omniscience and omnipotence, and that He is aware of all things in the universe.
orig: جعل الله الكعبة البيت الحرام قياما للناس والشهر الحرام والهدي والقلائد ذلك لتعلموا أن الله يعلم ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وأن الله بكل شيء عليم

translation: Know that Allah is severe in punishment and that Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the dual nature of God, emphasizing both His justice and mercy, warning humans of the consequences of their actions while also offering hope for forgiveness and redemption.
orig: اعلموا أن الله شديد العقاب وأن الله غفور رحيم

translation: The Messenger's duty is only to convey (the message). And Allah knows what you reveal and what you conceal.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the limited role of the Prophet as a mere messenger, and that he is not responsible for the actions or beliefs of his followers, but rather his duty is only to convey the message of God, and it is God who knows the true intentions and actions of individuals.
orig: ما على الرسول إلا البلاغ والله يعلم ما تبدون وما تكتمون

translation: Say, 'Not equal are the evil and the good, although the abundance of evil may please you. So fear Allah, O you of understanding, that you may be successful.'
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of distinguishing between good and evil, and not being deceived by the superficial appeal of evil, and instead, it urges the believers to fear Allah and pursue the path of righteousness in order to achieve success and salvation.
orig: قل لا يستوي الخبيث والطيب ولو أعجبك كثرة الخبيث فاتقوا الله يا أولي الألباب لعلكم تفلحون

translation: O you who believe, do not ask about things which, if they are shown to you, will distress you. But if you ask about them while the Quran is being revealed, they will be shown to you. Allah has pardoned what is past, and Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Forbearing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of not prying into matters that are not yet clear, as it may lead to unnecessary distress or confusion. Instead, it encourages believers to wait for guidance from Allah, which will be revealed in due time, and to trust in His mercy and forgiveness.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تسألوا عن أشياء إن تبد لكم تسؤكم وإن تسألوا عنها حين ينزل القرآن تبد لكم عفا الله عنها والله غفور حليم

translation: A people before you asked about it, then they became disbelievers in it.
interpretation: This verse highlights the futility of seeking knowledge or guidance from those who have already rejected the truth, as they will only lead to further disbelief and darkness.
orig: قد سألها قوم من قبلكم ثم أصبحوا بها كافرين

translation: What Allah has made, no pool, nor any date-palm, nor any slaughtered animal, nor any consecrated animal, but those who disbelieve invent lies against Allah, and most of them do not understand.
interpretation: The verse highlights the ignorance and arrogance of those who reject the truth, as they attribute their own false and idolatrous practices to Allah, and in doing so, they demonstrate their lack of understanding and appreciation for the true nature of God.
orig: ما جعل الله من بحيرة ولا سائبة ولا وصيلة ولا حام ولكن الذين كفروا يفترون على الله الكذب وأكثرهم لا يعقلون

translation: And when it is said to them, 'Come to what Allah has revealed and to the Messenger,' they say, 'Enough for us is what we found our fathers upon.' Even though their fathers knew nothing, nor were they guided.
interpretation: The verse highlights the stubbornness of those who blindly follow their ancestors' traditions, even if they are misguided, rather than seeking guidance from the revelations of Allah and the teachings of the Prophet.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم تعالوا إلى ما أنزل الله وإلى الرسول قالوا حسبنا ما وجدنا عليه آباءنا أولو كان آباؤهم لا يعلمون شيئا ولا يهتدون

translation: O you who believe, take care of your own souls; if you are guided, he who has gone astray will not harm you when you return to Allah, all of you, then He will inform you of what you used to do.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of individual accountability and personal responsibility, highlighting that one's own righteousness is not affected by the misguidance of others, and that ultimately, each person will be accountable to God for their own actions.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا عليكم أنفسكم لا يضركم من ضل إذا اهتديتم إلى الله مرجعكم جميعا فينبئكم بما كنتم تعملون

translation: O you who have believed, testimony [is required] among you when death approaches one of you, at the time of bequest, [take] two just men from among you, or two others from among others, if you are traveling through the land and the affliction of death befalls you. Detain them after the prayer, and they will swear by Allah, 'We will not exchange it for a price, even if he was a near relative, and we will not hide the testimony of Allah, indeed, we would then be among the sinful.'
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of truthful testimony, even in the face of personal loss or familial relationships, and warns against hiding or distorting the truth for personal gain, highlighting the gravity of such an act as a sinful offense against God.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا شهادة بينكم إذا حضر أحدكم الموت حين الوصية اثنان ذوا عدل منكم أو آخران من غيركم إن أنتم ضربتم في الأرض فأصابتكم مصيبة الموت تحبسونهما من بعد الصلاة فيقسمان بالله إن ارتبتم لا نشتري به ثمنا ولو كان ذا قربى ولا نكتم شهادة الله إنا إذا لمن الآثمين

translation: And if they have been found guilty of a sin, then two others shall stand in their place from among those against whom the first two have testified, and they shall swear by Allah, 'Our testimony is truer than their testimony, and we have not transgressed, for then we would be among the wrongdoers.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of justice and fairness in giving testimony, emphasizing that truthfulness is essential in witnessing, and that any deviation from the truth is a form of oppression, which is a characteristic of the wrongdoers.
orig: فإن عثر على أنهما استحقا إثما فآخران يقومان مقامهما من الذين استحق عليهم الأوليان فيقسمان بالله لشهادتنا أحق من شهادتهما وما اعتدينا إنا إذا لمن الظالمين

translation: That is nearer that they bring forth their testimony according to its (right) aspect, or they fear that oaths will be rejected after their oaths, and fear Allah and listen; and Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of being truthful and honest in one's testimony, as it is a fundamental aspect of justice and fairness, and warns against perjury, emphasizing that Allah will not guide those who are defiantly disobedient and dishonest.
orig: ذلك أدنى أن يأتوا بالشهادة على وجهها أو يخافوا أن ترد أيمان بعد أيمانهم واتقوا الله واسمعوا والله لا يهدي القوم الفاسقين

translation: The Day when Allah will assemble the Messengers and say, 'What was the response you received?' They will say, 'We have no knowledge, indeed You, You are the Knower of the unseen.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the humility and acknowledgment of the limitations of the prophets, who, despite being chosen by God, recognize their own ignorance and dependence on God's knowledge, emphasizing the absolute nature of God's knowledge and power.
orig: يوم يجمع الله الرسل فيقول ماذا أجبتم قالوا لا علم لنا إنك أنت علام الغيوب

translation: When Allah said, 'O Jesus, son of Mary, remember My favor upon you and upon your mother, when I supported you with the Holy Spirit, you spoke to the people in the cradle and in maturity; and when I taught you the Scripture and wisdom and the Torah and the Gospel; and when you created from clay the form of a bird with My permission, and you breathed into it, and it became a bird with My permission; and you healed the blind and the leper with My permission; and when you brought forth the dead with My permission; and when I restrained the Children of Israel from you when you came to them with clear proofs, those who disbelieved among them said, 'This is nothing but obvious magic.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the extraordinary favors and miracles bestowed upon Jesus by God, demonstrating Jesus' extraordinary status as a prophet and messenger, and serving as a testament to God's power and authority.
orig: إذ قال الله يا عيسى ابن مريم اذكر نعمتي عليك وعلى والدتك إذ أيدتك بروح القدس تكلم الناس في المهد وكهلا وإذ علمتك الكتاب والحكمة والتوراة والإنجيل وإذ تخلق من الطين كهيئة الطير بإذني فتنفخ فيها فتكون طيرا بإذني وتبرئ الأكمه والأبرص بإذني وإذ تخرج الموتى بإذني وإذ كففت بني إسرائيل عنك إذ جئتهم بالبينات فقال الذين كفروا منهم إن هذا إلا سحر مبين

translation: And when I inspired the disciples, [saying], 'Believe in Me and in My Messenger.' They said, 'We have believed, and bear witness that we are Muslims.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the significance of obedience to God and His messenger, emphasizing that true faith is demonstrated through submission to God's will and following the guidance of the prophets.
orig: وإذ أوحيت إلى الحواريين أن آمنوا بي وبرسولي قالوا آمنا واشهد بأننا مسلمون

translation: When the disciples said: 'O Jesus, son of Mary, can your Lord send down to us a table spread with food from heaven?' He said: 'Fear Allah, if you are believers.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of having faith and trust in God's power and wisdom, rather than seeking signs or miracles to validate one's beliefs, as true faith is not based on external proofs but on inner conviction and submission to God's will.
orig: إذ قال الحواريون يا عيسى ابن مريم هل يستطيع ربك أن ينزل علينا مائدة من السماء قال اتقوا الله إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: They said: 'We wish to eat thereof and that our hearts may be at peace, and that we may know that you have told the truth, and that we may be witnesses thereof.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the desire of the people to have a tangible experience of the divine, seeking a physical manifestation of God's power to dispel their doubts and uncertainties, and to have a sense of conviction and peace in their hearts.
orig: قالوا نريد أن نأكل منها وتطمئن قلوبنا ونعلم أن قد صدقتنا ونكون عليها من الشاهدين

translation: Said Isa, the son of Maryam: 'O Allah, our Lord! Send down to us a table spread with food from heaven, to be a festival for us, for the first of us and the last of us, and a sign from You; and provide for us, for You are the Best of Providers.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the humility and dependence of Isa (Jesus) on Allah, as he asks for a miraculous provision from heaven, not for personal gain, but as a sign of Allah's power and a means of bringing his people closer to their Lord.
orig: قال عيسى ابن مريم اللهم ربنا أنزل علينا مائدة من السماء تكون لنا عيدا لأولنا وآخرنا وآية منك وارزقنا وأنت خير الرازقين

translation: Allah said: 'I am going to send it down to you, so whoever disbelieves afterwards from among you, then I will punish him with a punishment the like of which I have not punished anyone among the worlds.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of rejecting God's message and the severe consequences that follow, implying that those who refuse to accept the truth will be punished in a way that no one has ever been punished before, emphasizing the uniqueness and severity of God's wrath.
orig: قال الله إني منزلها عليكم فمن يكفر بعد منكم فإني أعذبه عذابا لا أعذبه أحدا من العالمين

translation: And when Allah said, 'O Jesus, son of Maryam, did you say to the people, "Take me and my mother as two gods besides Allah?" He said, "Glory be to You! It is not for me to say what is not right for me. If I had said it, You would have known it. You know what is in my soul, and I do not know what is in Your soul. Indeed, You are the Knower of the Unseen."
interpretation: The verse highlights the humility and honesty of Jesus, who refuses to take credit for something he did not say, and instead attributes all knowledge to God, recognizing the limitations of his own understanding and the omniscience of God.
orig: وإذ قال الله يا عيسى ابن مريم أأنت قلت للناس اتخذوني وأمي إلهين من دون الله قال سبحانك ما يكون لي أن أقول ما ليس لي بحق إن كنت قلته فقد علمته تعلم ما في نفسي ولا أعلم ما في نفسك إنك أنت علام الغيوب

translation: I did not say to them except what You commanded me to say, 'Worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord.' And I was a witness over them as long as I remained among them, but when You took me up, You were the Watcher over them, and You are a Witness to all things.
interpretation: The verse highlights the role of the Prophet as a witness to his people, emphasizing that he only conveyed the message of Allah and did not add or subtract from it, and that Allah is the ultimate Witness and Watcher over all creation.
orig: ما قلت لهم إلا ما أمرتني به أن اعبدوا الله ربي وربكم وكنت عليهم شهيدا ما دمت فيهم فلما توفيتني كنت أنت الرقيب عليهم وأنت على كل شيء شهيد

translation: If You punish them, they are Your servants, and if You forgive them, then You are the Mighty, the Wise.
interpretation: The verse highlights the absolute authority and wisdom of God, emphasizing that whether He chooses to punish or forgive, His decision is always just and wise, and that His servants are completely dependent on His mercy and will.
orig: إن تعذبهم فإنهم عبادك وإن تغفر لهم فإنك أنت العزيز الحكيم

translation: Allah has said, 'This is a day when the truthful will benefit from their truthfulness. For them are Gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever. Allah is pleased with them, and they are pleased with Him. That is the great attainment.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of truthfulness, emphasizing that those who are truthful will be rewarded with eternal bliss in Paradise, where they will live in a state of eternal happiness and contentment, pleasing to Allah and pleasing themselves.
orig: قال الله هذا يوم ينفع الصادقين صدقهم لهم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها أبدا رضي الله عنهم ورضوا عنه ذلك الفوز العظيم

translation: To Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and what is in them, and He is Powerful over all things.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes God's absolute sovereignty and power over the entire universe, implying that He is the ultimate authority and controller of all things, and that His power is unmatched and unrestricted.
orig: لله ملك السماوات والأرض وما فيهن وهو على كل شيء قدير

translation: Praise be to Allah, Who created the heavens and the earth, and made the darkness and the light, yet those who disbelieve equate others with their Lord.
interpretation: The verse highlights the absurdity of those who reject God, implying that they are blind to the obvious signs of God's existence and power, as evident in the creation of the universe and the interplay of light and darkness.
orig: الحمد لله الذي خلق السماوات والأرض وجعل الظلمات والنور ثم الذين كفروا بربهم يعدلون

translation: He is the One who created you from clay, then decreed a term, and a specified term is with Him; yet you doubt.
interpretation: The verse highlights the contrast between God's absolute knowledge and control over human destiny, and human beings' uncertainty and doubt about their own existence and purpose.
orig: هو الذي خلقكم من طين ثم قضى أجلا وأجل مسمى عنده ثم أنتم تمترون

translation: And He is Allah in the heavens and in the earth, He knows your secret and your public (deeds), and He knows what you earn.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's omnipresence and omniscience, emphasizing that He is aware of all human actions, whether they are private or public, and will hold individuals accountable for their deeds.
orig: وهو الله في السماوات وفي الأرض يعلم سركم وجهركم ويعلم ما تكسبون

translation: And never did any sign come to them from among the signs of their Lord, but they turned away from it.
interpretation: The verse highlights the stubbornness and arrogance of those who reject the signs and revelations of God, and instead of being guided by them, they deliberately turn away from the truth.
orig: وما تأتيهم من آية من آيات ربهم إلا كانوا عنها معرضين

translation: So they denied the truth when it came to them, but soon they will come to know the news of what they used to mock.
interpretation: The verse highlights the irony of those who reject the truth, for they will ultimately be faced with the reality of what they once mocked, and this confrontation will bring them a sense of regret and remorse.
orig: فقد كذبوا بالحق لما جاءهم فسوف يأتيهم أنباء ما كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: Did they not see how many a generation We have destroyed before them, whom We had established in the earth as We have not established you, and sent down on them abundant water from the sky and made the rivers flow beneath them, then We destroyed them for their sins and established after them another generation?
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of learning from the mistakes of previous generations, who were punished for their sins despite being blessed with abundant resources and opportunities, and serves as a warning to the current generation to avoid repeating the same mistakes and facing similar consequences.
orig: ألم يروا كم أهلكنا من قبلهم من قرن مكناهم في الأرض ما لم نمكن لكم وأرسلنا السماء عليهم مدرارا وجعلنا الأنهار تجري من تحتهم فأهلكناهم بذنوبهم وأنشأنا من بعدهم قرنا آخرين

translation: And even if We had sent down to you a scripture on paper, and they had touched it with their hands, those who disbelieve would say: 'This is nothing but obvious magic.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the stubbornness of those who reject faith, as they would refuse to believe even if they were presented with tangible evidence of the truth, and instead would attribute it to magic or deception.
orig: ولو نزلنا عليك كتابا في قرطاس فلمسوه بأيديهم لقال الذين كفروا إن هذا إلا سحر مبين

translation: And they say: 'Why has not an angel been sent down to him?' And had We sent down an angel, the matter would have been decided, then they would not have been reprieved.
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to demand miracles and signs, but if they were to receive them, they would not be grateful and would still not believe, rather they would be punished immediately, implying that people are not willing to listen to the message of God.
orig: وقالوا لولا أنزل عليه ملك ولو أنزلنا ملكا لقضي الأمر ثم لا ينظرون

translation: And if We had made him an angel, We would have made him a man, and We would have dressed them in what they dress.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that if God had chosen to send an angel as a prophet, He would have made the angel take on a human form, and would have made the angel's appearance similar to that of the people, emphasizing the importance of the prophet being relatable and accessible to the people.
orig: ولو جعلناه ملكا لجعلناه رجلا وللبسنا عليهم ما يلبسون

translation: And indeed, messengers before you were mocked, but those who mocked them were surrounded by what they used to mock.
interpretation: The verse highlights the irony of those who mocked the prophets, only to be surrounded by the very consequences they had ridiculed, implying that God's justice will ultimately prevail and those who reject the truth will face the consequences of their actions.
orig: ولقد استهزئ برسل من قبلك فحاق بالذين سخروا منهم ما كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: Say, 'Travel in the land and observe how was the end of the deniers.'
interpretation: The verse encourages people to learn from the past by traveling and observing the consequences of those who rejected God's message, implying that history repeats itself and that those who reject the truth will ultimately face the same fate as those who came before them.
orig: قل سيروا في الأرض ثم انظروا كيف كان عاقبة المكذبين

translation: Say, [O Muhammad], 'To whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth?' Say, 'To Allah.' He has decreed upon Himself mercy, that He will gather you on the Day of Resurrection, about which there is no doubt. Those who have lost themselves will not believe.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of Tawhid, or the oneness of God, by emphasizing that everything in the universe belongs to Allah, and that He is the ultimate authority who will gather humanity on the Day of Judgment, implying that all human beings will be accountable to Him for their actions.
orig: قل لمن ما في السماوات والأرض قل لله كتب على نفسه الرحمة ليجمعنكم إلى يوم القيامة لا ريب فيه الذين خسروا أنفسهم فهم لا يؤمنون

translation: And to Him belongs whoever settles at night and whoever travels by day, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's omnipresence and omniscience, emphasizing that He is aware of all human activities, whether they take place at night or during the day, and that He has complete knowledge of all that happens in the universe.
orig: وله ما سكن في الليل والنهار وهو السميع العليم

translation: Say: 'Is it other than Allah that I should take as a guardian, the Originator of the heavens and the earth, and He feeds and is not fed?' Say: 'I am commanded to be the first of those who submit, and be not of the polytheists.'
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the uniqueness and self-sufficiency of God, highlighting the absurdity of taking anyone or anything else as a guardian or protector besides Him, and serves as a declaration of the Prophet's commitment to Islam and his rejection of polytheism.
orig: قل أغير الله أتخذ وليا فاطر السماوات والأرض وهو يطعم ولا يطعم قل إني أمرت أن أكون أول من أسلم ولا تكونن من المشركين

translation: Say, 'Indeed, I fear, if I disobey my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous Day.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of obedience to God's commands and the fear of His punishment, emphasizing the gravity of disobedience and the severity of the consequences on the Day of Judgment.
orig: قل إني أخاف إن عصيت ربي عذاب يوم عظيم

translation: He who is drawn away from it on that day, indeed, He has mercy on him, and that is the clear triumph.
interpretation: The verse implies that on the Day of Judgment, those who are spared from God's wrath and punishment will be the ones who have been merciful to others during their lifetime, and thus will receive God's mercy in return.
orig: من يصرف عنه يومئذ فقد رحمه وذلك الفوز المبين

translation: And if Allah should touch you with harm, there is none who can remove it except Him; and if He intends for you good, then He is Able to do all things.
interpretation: This verse highlights the absolute power and control of God over human affairs, emphasizing that only He can bring harm or good to humanity, and that He is the sole authority who can remove harm or bestow good upon individuals.
orig: وإن يمسسك الله بضر فلا كاشف له إلا هو وإن يمسسك بخير فهو على كل شيء قدير

translation: And He is the Dominant over His servants, and He is the Wise, the Acquainted.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's absolute authority and control over all His creation, emphasizing His infinite wisdom and complete knowledge of all things.
orig: وهو القاهر فوق عباده وهو الحكيم الخبير

translation: Say, 'What can be greater in testimony than Allah? And He is Witness between me and you. And this Quran has been revealed to me that I may warn you thereby, and whomsoever it reaches. Do you bear witness that there are other gods besides Allah?' Say, 'I do not bear witness.' Say, 'He is only One God, and I am innocent of what you associate.'
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the uniqueness and oneness of God, and the Prophet's role as a warner to his people, highlighting the distinction between the one true God and the false gods worshipped by the polytheists.
orig: قل أي شيء أكبر شهادة قل الله شهيد بيني وبينكم وأوحي إلي هذا القرآن لأنذركم به ومن بلغ أئنكم لتشهدون أن مع الله آلهة أخرى قل لا أشهد قل إنما هو إله واحد وإنني بريء مما تشركون

translation: Those to whom We have given the Scripture recognize him as they recognize their own sons, those who have lost themselves do not believe.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that those who have been given the scripture, i.e. the Jews and Christians, have a deep understanding of the Prophet Muhammad and his message, just as they have a deep understanding of their own children, but despite this, they still reject him, indicating that their rejection is not due to a lack of knowledge, but rather due to their own stubbornness and refusal to accept the truth.
orig: الذين آتيناهم الكتاب يعرفونه كما يعرفون أبناءهم الذين خسروا أنفسهم فهم لا يؤمنون

translation: And who is more unjust than he who invents a lie against Allah or denies His signs? Indeed, the wrongdoers will not succeed.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of fabricating lies about God or rejecting His signs, implying that those who do so will ultimately face failure and disappointment in their endeavors.
orig: ومن أظلم ممن افترى على الله كذبا أو كذب بآياته إنه لا يفلح الظالمون

translation: And the Day We will gather them all together, then We will say to those who associated others with Allah, 'Where are your partners that you used to claim?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of associating partners with Allah, as on the Day of Judgment, those who committed shirk will be left alone to face the consequences of their actions, and their supposed partners will be nowhere to be found, leaving them to realize the error of their ways.
orig: ويوم نحشرهم جميعا ثم نقول للذين أشركوا أين شركاؤكم الذين كنتم تزعمون

translation: Then their faith did not benefit them except that they said, 'By Allah, our Lord, we were not polytheists.'
