interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who, when faced with the consequences of their actions, try to deny their past misdeeds and pretend to have been faithful, when in reality they had been guilty of polytheism and disobedience.
orig: ثم لم تكن فتنتهم إلا أن قالوا والله ربنا ما كنا مشركين

translation: Look how they lied against themselves, and what they used to invent has departed from them.
interpretation: The verse highlights the self-deception of those who fabricate lies and false accusations, and how ultimately, their own schemes will abandon them, leaving them with nothing but the consequences of their own deceit.
orig: انظر كيف كذبوا على أنفسهم وضل عنهم ما كانوا يفترون

translation: And among them are those who listen to you, but We have placed a covering on their hearts and a heaviness in their ears, lest they understand it, and even if they see every sign, they will not believe in it, until when they come to you, arguing with you, those who disbelieve say, 'This is nothing but the tales of the ancients.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the obstinacy of those who reject the truth, and how they are spiritually blinded, unable to comprehend the divine message, and instead, they resort to ridicule and dismissal, revealing their deep-seated arrogance and ignorance.
orig: ومنهم من يستمع إليك وجعلنا على قلوبهم أكنة أن يفقهوه وفي آذانهم وقرا وإن يروا كل آية لا يؤمنوا بها حتى إذا جاءوك يجادلونك يقول الذين كفروا إن هذا إلا أساطير الأولين

translation: And they try to turn away from it and turn away from it, and they destroy none but themselves, without realizing it.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of human efforts to reject or ignore the truth, as in the end, they only harm themselves, often unknowingly, and are ultimately responsible for their own downfall.
orig: وهم ينهون عنه وينأون عنه وإن يهلكون إلا أنفسهم وما يشعرون

translation: And if you see when they are made to stand by the Fire, they will say: 'Would that we were sent back, and we would not deny the signs of our Lord, and we would be among the believers.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the regret and remorse that will be felt by those who rejected God's signs and message in this life, when they are faced with the consequences of their actions on the Day of Judgment, and how they will wish they had lived a life of faith and obedience to God.
orig: ولو ترى إذ وقفوا على النار فقالوا يا ليتنا نرد ولا نكذب بآيات ربنا ونكون من المؤمنين

translation: Nay, what they used to hide before has appeared to them; and if they were returned, they would certainly go back to what they were forbidden, and most surely they are liars.
interpretation: The verse suggests that people's true nature and hidden intentions will ultimately be exposed, and if given the opportunity, they would revert to their old sinful ways, revealing their dishonesty and hypocrisy.
orig: بل بدا لهم ما كانوا يخفون من قبل ولو ردوا لعادوا لما نهوا عنه وإنهم لكاذبون

translation: And they say: 'There is nothing but our life of this world, and we shall not be raised again.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the ignorance and arrogance of those who deny the existence of an afterlife, believing that their worldly life is all that matters, and that they will not be held accountable for their actions.
orig: وقالوا إن هي إلا حياتنا الدنيا وما نحن بمبعوثين

translation: And if you could see when they will stand before their Lord. He will say, 'Is this not the truth?' They will say, 'Yes, by our Lord.' He will say, 'Then taste the punishment for what you used to deny.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of accountability and the consequences of denying the truth, where those who rejected faith and divine guidance will be confronted with the reality of their actions and will be punished accordingly.
orig: ولو ترى إذ وقفوا على ربهم قال أليس هذا بالحق قالوا بلى وربنا قال فذوقوا العذاب بما كنتم تكفرون

translation: Those who reject the meeting with Allah have certainly failed, until when the Hour comes to them suddenly, they will say: 'Alas for what we neglected in it,' and they will bear their burdens on their backs. Alas, evil is what they bear.
interpretation: The verse highlights the regret and remorse that will be felt by those who reject the idea of accountability to God, when they are suddenly confronted with the reality of the Day of Judgment, and are forced to acknowledge their own shortcomings and the weight of their accumulated sins.
orig: قد خسر الذين كذبوا بلقاء الله حتى إذا جاءتهم الساعة بغتة قالوا يا حسرتنا على ما فرطنا فيها وهم يحملون أوزارهم على ظهورهم ألا ساء ما يزرون

translation: And the life of this world is nothing but play and amusement, and the Hereafter - that is better for those who fear Allah. Do you not then understand?
interpretation: The verse highlights the fleeting nature of worldly pleasures and the importance of prioritizing the afterlife, implying that those who prioritize their spiritual growth and fear Allah will ultimately reap greater rewards.
orig: وما الحياة الدنيا إلا لعب ولهو وللدار الآخرة خير للذين يتقون أفلا تعقلون

translation: We know that it grieves you what they say, but they do not deny you, they deny the verses of Allah, and the wrongdoers reject.
interpretation: The verse is a message of comfort and reassurance to the Prophet Muhammad, emphasizing that the rejection of his message is not a personal rejection of him, but rather a rejection of the divine message and the truth that he brings.
orig: قد نعلم إنه ليحزنك الذي يقولون فإنهم لا يكذبونك ولكن الظالمين بآيات الله يجحدون

translation: And indeed, messengers before you were denied, so they were patient with what they were denied and were harmed until Our help came to them. And there is no changer of the words of Allah. And indeed, there has come to you from the news of the messengers.
interpretation: The verse conveys the message of perseverance and patience in the face of adversity, as exemplified by the prophets who were rejected and harmed, yet ultimately received divine help, emphasizing that God's words and promises remain unchanged and unaltered.
orig: ولقد كذبت رسل من قبلك فصبروا على ما كذبوا وأوذوا حتى أتاهم نصرنا ولا مبدل لكلمات الله ولقد جاءك من نبإ المرسلين

translation: And if their aversion is grievous to thee, if thou canst seek a tunnel in the earth or a ladder in the sky, thou wouldst bring them a sign. And if Allah had willed, He would have gathered them on guidance, so be not of the ignorant.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of patience and trust in God's plan, as even if the Prophet was able to perform a miraculous act to convince the unbelievers, it would not necessarily lead to their guidance, as it is ultimately God who guides or misguides.
orig: وإن كان كبر عليك إعراضهم فإن استطعت أن تبتغي نفقا في الأرض أو سلما في السماء فتأتيهم بآية ولو شاء الله لجمعهم على الهدى فلا تكونن من الجاهلين

translation: Only those who listen will respond, and the dead, Allah will raise them, then to Him they will return.
interpretation: The verse highlights the distinction between those who are spiritually alive, who listen to the divine call and respond to it, and those who are spiritually dead, who will be resurrected by God on the Day of Judgment to face accountability for their deeds.
orig: إنما يستجيب الذين يسمعون والموتى يبعثهم الله ثم إليه يرجعون

translation: And they say: 'Why has no sign been sent down to him from his Lord?' Say: 'Indeed, Allah is able to send down a sign, but most of them do not know.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the ignorance of those who demand a sign from God, implying that they lack understanding of God's power and wisdom, and that their demands are often driven by arrogance and skepticism rather than a genuine desire for guidance.
orig: وقالوا لولا نزل عليه آية من ربه قل إن الله قادر على أن ينزل آية ولكن أكثرهم لا يعلمون

translation: And there is not a creature on the earth or a bird that flies with its wings except that they are communities like you. We have not neglected anything in the Book, then to their Lord they will be gathered.
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that all living beings, including humans, animals, and birds, are part of a larger community and are accountable to God, emphasizing the unity and interconnectedness of all creation.
orig: وما من دابة في الأرض ولا طائر يطير بجناحيه إلا أمم أمثالكم ما فرطنا في الكتاب من شيء ثم إلى ربهم يحشرون

translation: And those who reject Our signs are deaf and dumb in darkness. Whomsoever Allah wills, He lets go astray, and whomsoever He wills, He places on a straight path.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that those who reject God's signs and messages are already in a state of spiritual darkness, and if God wills, He can further lead them astray, whereas those whom He wills, He guides towards the right path, emphasizing God's sovereignty over human guidance.
orig: والذين كذبوا بآياتنا صم وبكم في الظلمات من يشإ الله يضلله ومن يشأ يجعله على صراط مستقيم

translation: Say, 'Have you seen? If the punishment of Allah comes to you or the Hour comes to you, will you call upon other than Allah, if you are truthful?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the inconsistency of those who claim to be truthful in their devotion to other deities, but when faced with the reality of punishment or the Hour, they instinctively turn to Allah, revealing their underlying faith in Him as the ultimate authority.
orig: قل أرأيتكم إن أتاكم عذاب الله أو أتتكم الساعة أغير الله تدعون إن كنتم صادقين

translation: Nay, but you call upon Him, and He exposes what you call upon Him to, if He wills, and you forget what you associate (with Him)
interpretation: The verse highlights the irony of humans calling upon God in times of need, yet forgetting their own idolatry and associations with Him, implying that true devotion to God requires sincerity and recognition of His sole authority.
orig: بل إياه تدعون فيكشف ما تدعون إليه إن شاء وتنسون ما تشركون

translation: And indeed, We sent [messengers] to nations before you, and We seized them with adversity and hardship that they might humble themselves.
interpretation: The verse highlights the mercy of God, who, despite punishing previous nations for their disobedience, did so in the hope that they would repent and return to the right path, demonstrating God's desire for humanity's salvation.
orig: ولقد أرسلنا إلى أمم من قبلك فأخذناهم بالبأساء والضراء لعلهم يتضرعون

translation: Why, when Our punishment came to them, did they not humble themselves? But their hearts were hardened, and Satan made fair-seeming to them what they used to do.
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to refuse to repent and change their ways even when faced with the consequences of their actions, and how Satan's influence can make their sinful behavior seem appealing to them.
orig: فلولا إذ جاءهم بأسنا تضرعوا ولكن قست قلوبهم وزين لهم الشيطان ما كانوا يعملون

translation: So when they forgot what they had been reminded of, We opened to them the doors of everything until when they rejoiced in what they were given, We seized them suddenly, and behold, they were bewildered.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of forgetting the warnings and reminders from God, leading to a false sense of security and complacency, which ultimately results in sudden and unexpected punishment, leaving the individuals bewildered and caught off guard.
orig: فلما نسوا ما ذكروا به فتحنا عليهم أبواب كل شيء حتى إذا فرحوا بما أوتوا أخذناهم بغتة فإذا هم مبلسون

translation: So were the people who did wrong cut off, and all praise is due to Allah, the Lord of the Worlds.
interpretation: The verse suggests that the destruction of unjust people is a manifestation of God's justice and wisdom, and that God's power and authority are the ultimate reality that deserves all praise and gratitude.
orig: فقطع دابر القوم الذين ظلموا والحمد لله رب العالمين

translation: Say, 'Have you seen if Allah took away your hearing and your sight and sealed your hearts, is there a god besides Allah who could bring it to you?' Look how We diversify the verses, then they turn away.
interpretation: The verse highlights the absolute dependence of human beings on God for their senses and faculties, and how easily He can take them away, leaving humans helpless and unable to function, emphasizing the futility of idolatry and the uniqueness of God's power and authority.
orig: قل أرأيتم إن أخذ الله سمعكم وأبصاركم وختم على قلوبكم من إله غير الله يأتيكم به انظر كيف نصرف الآيات ثم هم يصدفون

translation: Say: 'Have you considered, if the punishment of Allah comes to you suddenly or openly, will anyone be destroyed except the wrongdoing people?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that God's punishment is not arbitrary, but rather a consequence of the wrongdoings of people, implying that those who are righteous have nothing to fear from God's wrath.
orig: قل أرأيتكم إن أتاكم عذاب الله بغتة أو جهرة هل يهلك إلا القوم الظالمون

translation: And We sent not the Messengers but as bearers of good news and warners. So whoever believes and reforms, then there shall be no fear upon them, nor shall they grieve.
interpretation: The verse highlights the role of prophets as conveyors of both hope and warning, and that those who respond to the message by believing and reforming themselves will be spared from fear and grief in the hereafter.
orig: وما نرسل المرسلين إلا مبشرين ومنذرين فمن آمن وأصلح فلا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: And those who rejected Our signs, punishment will afflict them because of what they used to commit.
interpretation: The verse highlights the direct correlation between rejecting God's signs and the subsequent punishment, implying that those who deliberately ignore or deny God's message will inevitably face the consequences of their actions.
orig: والذين كذبوا بآياتنا يمسهم العذاب بما كانوا يفسقون

translation: Say, 'I do not tell you that I have the treasuries of Allah, nor do I know the unseen, nor do I tell you that I am an angel. I only follow what is revealed to me.' Say, 'Are the blind and the seeing equal? Then will you not give thought?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of humility and recognition of one's limitations, as the Prophet Muhammad is instructed to acknowledge that he is not all-knowing and does not possess divine knowledge, but rather relies on divine revelation, emphasizing the distinction between human and divine knowledge.
orig: قل لا أقول لكم عندي خزائن الله ولا أعلم الغيب ولا أقول لكم إني ملك إن أتبع إلا ما يوحى إلي قل هل يستوي الأعمى والبصير أفلا تتفكرون

translation: And warn with it those who fear that they will be gathered to their Lord - (it is) none other than Him - no protector or intercessor apart from Him - so that they might become righteous.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of warning those who are already God-fearing, encouraging them to become even more righteous, as they will ultimately be accountable to God, who is the only true protector and intercessor.
orig: وأنذر به الذين يخافون أن يحشروا إلى ربهم ليس لهم من دونه ولي ولا شفيع لعلهم يتقون

translation: And do not drive away those who call upon their Lord in the morning and the evening, seeking His Face. You are not accountable for them at all, nor are they accountable for you at all. So, if you drive them away, you will be among the unjust.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of tolerance and acceptance towards those who are devoted to their spiritual practices, and warns against driving them away, as this would be an act of injustice and oppression.
orig: ولا تطرد الذين يدعون ربهم بالغداة والعشي يريدون وجهه ما عليك من حسابهم من شيء وما من حسابك عليهم من شيء فتطردهم فتكون من الظالمين

translation: And thus We have tried some of them with others, that they say: 'Are these the ones upon whom Allah has bestowed favor from among us?' Is not Allah most knowing of those who are grateful?
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to doubt the favor of God bestowed upon others, and instead of being grateful for their own blessings, they question the worthiness of those who have received God's favor, thereby revealing their own ingratitude and lack of faith.
orig: وكذلك فتنا بعضهم ببعض ليقولوا أهؤلاء من الله عليهم من بيننا أليس الله بأعلم بالشاكرين

translation: And when those who believe in Our signs come to you, say: 'Peace be upon you.' Your Lord has decreed mercy upon Himself, that whoever among you does evil in ignorance and thereafter repents and makes amends, then indeed He is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of self-reflection and repentance, emphasizing that God's mercy is available to those who recognize their mistakes, make amends, and turn back to Him, demonstrating God's willingness to forgive and show compassion to those who genuinely seek forgiveness.
orig: وإذا جاءك الذين يؤمنون بآياتنا فقل سلام عليكم كتب ربكم على نفسه الرحمة أنه من عمل منكم سوءا بجهالة ثم تاب من بعده وأصلح فأنه غفور رحيم

translation: And thus We explain the verses, and that the way of the criminals may be clarified.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of explaining and clarifying the verses of the Quran, so that the wrongdoers may be distinguished and their path may be made clear, implying that the Quran serves as a guide to distinguish between right and wrong.
orig: وكذلك نفصل الآيات ولتستبين سبيل المجرمين

translation: Say, 'Indeed, I have been forbidden from worshiping those you invoke besides Allah.' Say, 'I will not follow your desires, for I would then have gone astray, and I would not be of the guided.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of not following the desires and whims of others, especially when it comes to worshiping false gods, and instead, staying firm on the path of guidance and righteousness.
orig: قل إني نهيت أن أعبد الذين تدعون من دون الله قل لا أتبع أهواءكم قد ضللت إذا وما أنا من المهتدين

translation: Say, 'Indeed, I am on clear proof from my Lord, and you denied it. I do not have what you are hastening. The judgment is only for Allah. He relates the truth, and He is the best of deciders.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the confidence and conviction of the Prophet in the revelation he received from God, and his detachment from the reactions of those who deny the truth, emphasizing that the ultimate judgment and decision-making authority rests with God alone.
orig: قل إني على بينة من ربي وكذبتم به ما عندي ما تستعجلون به إن الحكم إلا لله يقص الحق وهو خير الفاصلين

translation: Say, 'If I had that for which you are hastening, the matter would have been decided between me and you, and Allah is most knowing of the wrongdoers.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the Prophet's confidence in God's justice and his own innocence, implying that if he had the power to hasten the punishment, he would have done so, but ultimately it is God who knows best and will deal with the wrongdoers accordingly.
orig: قل لو أن عندي ما تستعجلون به لقضي الأمر بيني وبينكم والله أعلم بالظالمين

translation: And with Him are the keys of the unseen; none knows them except He. He knows whatever is in the land and the sea. Not a leaf falls but He knows it, and there is not a grain in the darkness of the earth nor anything fresh or dry but it is in a clear record.
interpretation: This verse highlights the omniscience of God, emphasizing that He has complete knowledge of everything, from the smallest details to the largest events, and that everything is recorded in a clear and precise manner, emphasizing God's absolute control and knowledge over all aspects of creation.
orig: وعنده مفاتح الغيب لا يعلمها إلا هو ويعلم ما في البر والبحر وما تسقط من ورقة إلا يعلمها ولا حبة في ظلمات الأرض ولا رطب ولا يابس إلا في كتاب مبين

translation: And He it is Who takes your souls at night, and He knows what you have committed by day, then He raises you up therein to complete a term appointed, then to Him is your return, and then He will inform you of what you used to do.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's absolute control and knowledge over human actions, emphasizing that God is aware of every detail of human life, and that He will hold humans accountable for their deeds, making them face the consequences of their actions.
orig: وهو الذي يتوفاكم بالليل ويعلم ما جرحتم بالنهار ثم يبعثكم فيه ليقضى أجل مسمى ثم إليه مرجعكم ثم ينبئكم بما كنتم تعملون

translation: And He is the Subduer over His servants, and He sends over you guardians until, when death comes to one of you, Our messengers take his soul, and they do not neglect.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's omnipotence and control over human life, emphasizing that even at the moment of death, God's messengers are present to take the soul, underscoring the idea that God is always in control and that human life is in His hands.
orig: وهو القاهر فوق عباده ويرسل عليكم حفظة حتى إذا جاء أحدكم الموت توفته رسلنا وهم لا يفرطون

translation: Then they are returned to Allah, their Maula, the True One; His is the judgment, and He is the swiftest of accountants.
interpretation: The verse highlights the inevitability of accountability before God, emphasizing that all things will ultimately return to Him, and He will settle all accounts with swift and perfect justice.
orig: ثم ردوا إلى الله مولاهم الحق ألا له الحكم وهو أسرع الحاسبين

translation: Say, 'Who rescues you from the darkness of the land and the sea? You call upon Him in humility and in secret, 'If He saves us from this, we will surely be among the grateful.''
interpretation: The verse highlights the human tendency to turn to God in times of crisis and desperation, and how this desperation can lead to a sense of humility and gratitude, but often only temporarily, until the crisis has passed and the individual returns to their old ways.
orig: قل من ينجيكم من ظلمات البر والبحر تدعونه تضرعا وخفية لئن أنجانا من هذه لنكونن من الشاكرين

translation: God will save you from it and from every distress, then you will associate others with Him
interpretation: The verse highlights human tendency to forget God's favors and blessings once they are relieved of their difficulties, and instead, attribute their salvation to other factors or beings, thereby committing the sin of polytheism.
orig: قل الله ينجيكم منها ومن كل كرب ثم أنتم تشركون

translation: Say, 'He is the [One] Able to send upon you punishment from above you or from beneath your feet or to confuse you [so you become] sects and make you taste the violence of one another.' Look how We diversify the signs so that they might understand.
interpretation: This verse highlights the omnipotence of God, emphasizing His ability to punish humanity in various ways, whether through natural disasters or internal conflicts, and that His signs and messages are diverse and multifaceted, requiring careful consideration and reflection to understand.
orig: قل هو القادر على أن يبعث عليكم عذابا من فوقكم أو من تحت أرجلكم أو يلبسكم شيعا ويذيق بعضكم بأس بعض انظر كيف نصرف الآيات لعلهم يفقهون

translation: And your people have denied it, and it is the truth. Say: I am not a guardian over you.
interpretation: The verse highlights the role of a prophet as a mere messenger, emphasizing that they are not responsible for guiding or protecting those who reject the truth, and that ultimately, it is up to individuals to accept or reject the message.
orig: وكذب به قومك وهو الحق قل لست عليكم بوكيل

translation: For every news there is a fixed time, and you will come to know.
interpretation: The verse suggests that every event, whether good or bad, has a predetermined time and will inevitably occur, emphasizing the concept of divine decree and the inevitability of fate.
orig: لكل نبإ مستقر وسوف تعلمون

translation: And when you see those who engage in [idle] talk about Our verses, turn away from them until they turn to another topic. And if Satan should cause you to forget, then do not sit with the wrongdoing people after the reminder.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of avoiding those who mock or engage in idle talk about God's signs, and instead focusing on remembering and reflecting on God's message, lest one becomes influenced by their negativity and forgets the divine guidance.
orig: وإذا رأيت الذين يخوضون في آياتنا فأعرض عنهم حتى يخوضوا في حديث غيره وإما ينسينك الشيطان فلا تقعد بعد الذكرى مع القوم الظالمين

translation: And those who are mindful have no responsibility for them, except for a reminder, so that they may be mindful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of spiritual guidance and the role of prophets and messengers, emphasizing that their responsibility is only to convey the message and remind people, rather than to force them to follow the right path, as ultimately it is up to individuals to take heed and be mindful of their actions.
orig: وما على الذين يتقون من حسابهم من شيء ولكن ذكرى لعلهم يتقون

translation: And leave those who take their religion as play and amusement, and are deceived by the life of this world. And remind them with it that souls will be punished for what they have earned. They will not have besides Allah any protector or intercessor. And even if they try to ransom themselves with all ransom, it will not be accepted from them. Those are the ones who will be punished for what they have earned. For them is a drink of boiling water and a painful punishment for what they used to deny.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of those who treat their religion lightly and are distracted by the allurements of this world, emphasizing that they will ultimately be held accountable for their actions and will not be able to escape the punishment of God.
orig: وذر الذين اتخذوا دينهم لعبا ولهوا وغرتهم الحياة الدنيا وذكر به أن تبسل نفس بما كسبت ليس لها من دون الله ولي ولا شفيع وإن تعدل كل عدل لا يؤخذ منها أولئك الذين أبسلوا بما كسبوا لهم شراب من حميم وعذاب أليم بما كانوا يكفرون

translation: Say: 'Do you worship besides Allah that which does not benefit you nor harm you? And when Allah has guided us, we turned back on our heels; as one whom the devils have made to stray in the earth, bewildered, his companions calling him to guidance, saying: 'Come to us.' Say: 'The guidance of Allah is the guidance, and we have been commanded to submit to the Lord of the Worlds.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of worshipping false deities, emphasizing that they have no power to benefit or harm, and that true guidance comes only from Allah.
orig: قل أندعو من دون الله ما لا ينفعنا ولا يضرنا ونرد على أعقابنا بعد إذ هدانا الله كالذي استهوته الشياطين في الأرض حيران له أصحاب يدعونه إلى الهدى ائتنا قل إن هدى الله هو الهدى وأمرنا لنسلم لرب العالمين

translation: And establish the prayer and fear Him, it is to Him that you will be gathered.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of establishing a strong connection with God through prayer, and cultivating a sense of reverence and fear of Him, as it is to Him that humanity will ultimately be gathered and held accountable.
orig: وأن أقيموا الصلاة واتقوه وهو الذي إليه تحشرون

translation: And He it is who has created the heavens and the earth with truth, and on the day He says: 'Be!' it is. His word is the truth, and to Him belongs the kingdom on the day when the trumpet is blown, the Knower of the unseen and the seen, and He is the Wise, the All-Aware.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's absolute power and authority, emphasizing that His word is the ultimate truth and that He is the sole possessor of the kingdom on the day of judgment, when all secrets will be revealed, and His wisdom and knowledge will be manifest.
orig: وهو الذي خلق السماوات والأرض بالحق ويوم يقول كن فيكون قوله الحق وله الملك يوم ينفخ في الصور عالم الغيب والشهادة وهو الحكيم الخبير

translation: And when Ibrahim said to his father Azar, 'Do you take idols as gods? I see you and your people in manifest error.'
interpretation: This verse highlights Ibrahim's courageous stance against idolatry and his concern for his father and people who were misled, demonstrating the importance of speaking truth to power and guiding others towards the right path.
orig: وإذ قال إبراهيم لأبيه آزر أتتخذ أصناما آلهة إني أراك وقومك في ضلال مبين

translation: And thus We showed Abraham the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, that he might be of those who are certain.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of spiritual insight and certainty in faith, suggesting that Abraham's vision of the universe was a means of strengthening his conviction and trust in God, and that this kind of spiritual awakening is essential for true faith.
orig: وكذلك نري إبراهيم ملكوت السماوات والأرض وليكون من الموقنين

translation: And when the night covered him, he saw a star, he said: 'This is my Lord.' But when it set, he said: 'I do not like those that set.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the primitive and immature stage of idolatry, where people worship celestial bodies, thinking they are gods, but quickly abandon them when they disappear from sight, revealing their superficial understanding of divinity.
orig: فلما جن عليه الليل رأى كوكبا قال هذا ربي فلما أفل قال لا أحب الآفلين

translation: But when he saw the moon rising, he said, 'This is my Lord.' But when it set, he said, 'Unless my Lord guides me, I will be among the people who are astray.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the superficial and fleeting nature of idolatry, as the person in question is easily deceived by the beauty of the moon and mistakenly takes it as his lord, only to abandon it when it sets, revealing the instability of his faith.
orig: فلما رأى القمر بازغا قال هذا ربي فلما أفل قال لئن لم يهدني ربي لأكونن من القوم الضالين

translation: And when he saw the sun rising, he said: 'This is my Lord; this is the greatest!' But when it set, he said: 'O my people! I am indeed free from all that you join as partners in worship.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the mistake of associating partners with God, as the person in the verse initially mistakes the sun for God, but later corrects himself, emphasizing the importance of recognizing and worshiping the one true God.
orig: فلما رأى الشمس بازغة قال هذا ربي هذا أكبر فلما أفلت قال يا قوم إني بريء مما تشركون

translation: Indeed, I have turned my face towards the One who originated the heavens and the earth, being upright; and I am not of those who associate partners with Allah.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of sincerity and devotion in one's worship, emphasizing the need to direct one's heart and intentions solely towards Allah, free from any polytheistic tendencies or idolatrous influences.
orig: إني وجهت وجهي للذي فطر السماوات والأرض حنيفا وما أنا من المشركين

translation: And his people argued with him, he said: 'Do you argue with me about Allah, when He has guided me? I do not fear what you associate with Him, unless my Lord wills something. My Lord encompasses all things in knowledge. Will you not be reminded?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of trusting in God's plan and not being swayed by the opinions of others, even if they are from one's own community, and instead, having faith in God's all-encompassing knowledge and will.
orig: وحاجه قومه قال أتحاجوني في الله وقد هدان ولا أخاف ما تشركون به إلا أن يشاء ربي شيئا وسع ربي كل شيء علما أفلا تتذكرون

translation: And how can I fear what you associate, while you do not fear that you have associated with Allah that for which He has not sent down to you any authority? So which of the two parties is more worthy of security, if you know?
interpretation: The verse highlights the absurdity of idolatry, where humans fear the false gods they have created, while ignoring the power and authority of the one true God, Allah, who has not authorized these false deities.
orig: وكيف أخاف ما أشركتم ولا تخافون أنكم أشركتم بالله ما لم ينزل به عليكم سلطانا فأي الفريقين أحق بالأمن إن كنتم تعلمون

translation: Those who believe and have not mixed their belief with wrongdoing, those will have security and they are guided.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of sincerity in faith, emphasizing that true believers are those who not only profess faith but also avoid wrongdoing, and as a result, they will be granted security and guidance from God.
orig: الذين آمنوا ولم يلبسوا إيمانهم بظلم أولئك لهم الأمن وهم مهتدون

translation: And that was Our argument which We gave to Ibrahim against his people. We raise in degrees whom We will. Indeed, your Lord is Wise, Knowing.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's wisdom and knowledge in granting prophethood and authority to whomever He wills, and that His decisions are not based on human criteria such as lineage or social status, but rather on His infinite wisdom and knowledge.
orig: وتلك حجتنا آتيناها إبراهيم على قومه نرفع درجات من نشاء إن ربك حكيم عليم

translation: And We bestowed upon him Isaac and Jacob, all (of them) We guided; and Noah, We guided before, and among his progeny, David, Solomon, Job, Joseph, Moses, and Aaron. Thus do We reward the doers of good.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of spiritual lineage and the continuity of prophetic guidance, emphasizing that God's favor and guidance are not limited to one individual or family, but are bestowed upon those who are worthy and righteous, regardless of their lineage or background.
orig: ووهبنا له إسحاق ويعقوب كلا هدينا ونوحا هدينا من قبل ومن ذريته داوود وسليمان وأيوب ويوسف وموسى وهارون وكذلك نجزي المحسنين

translation: And Zechariah, John, Jesus and Elias, each one of the righteous.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of these prophets as models of righteousness, emphasizing their exemplary behavior and moral excellence, and implying that their righteousness is a key aspect of their prophetic character.
orig: وزكريا ويحيى وعيسى وإلياس كل من الصالحين

translation: And Ishmael, and Idris, and Dhul-Kifl, and Yunus, and Lut, and each We preferred over the worlds.
interpretation: This verse highlights the exceptional virtues and merits of these prophets, emphasizing their superiority over others in their respective eras, and implying that their righteousness and dedication to God's cause earned them a special place in the eyes of the Almighty.
orig: وإسماعيل واليسع ويونس ولوطا وكلا فضلنا على العالمين

translation: And from their fathers and their offspring and their brethren, We chose them and guided them to a straight path
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of spiritual inheritance, where the righteous individuals are chosen by God and guided to the straight path, not just because of their own merits, but also due to the blessings and virtues of their ancestors and family members.
orig: ومن آبائهم وذرياتهم وإخوانهم واجتبيناهم وهديناهم إلى صراط مستقيم

translation: That is the guidance of Allah. He guides therewith whom He pleases of His servants. And if they had associated, it would have ruined for them what they used to do.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of divine guidance, emphasizing that it is a selective process, where Allah chooses whom to guide, implying that faith is a gift from Allah, and those who receive it are blessed with a special favor.
orig: ذلك هدى الله يهدي به من يشاء من عباده ولو أشركوا لحبط عنهم ما كانوا يعملون

translation: Those to whom We have given the Book, and the authority, and the Prophethood, if they disbelieve in it, We have entrusted it to a people who are not disbelievers in it.
interpretation: This verse highlights the responsibility that comes with knowledge and power, emphasizing that those who have been entrusted with sacred knowledge and authority will be held accountable for their actions, and if they fail to fulfill their duties, the responsibility will be transferred to others who are more worthy.
orig: أولئك الذين آتيناهم الكتاب والحكم والنبوة فإن يكفر بها هؤلاء فقد وكلنا بها قوما ليسوا بها بكافرين

translation: Those are the ones whom Allah has guided, so follow their guidance. Say: I do not ask you for it any reward. It is not but a reminder to the worlds.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of following the guidance of those who have been guided by Allah, implying that the prophet Muhammad is one of them, and that the message of the Quran is a universal reminder for all humanity.
orig: أولئك الذين هدى الله فبهداهم اقتده قل لا أسألكم عليه أجرا إن هو إلا ذكرى للعالمين

translation: And they did not appreciate Allah with true appreciation when they said, 'Allah has not sent down anything to a human being.' Say, 'Who revealed the Scripture that Moses brought as a light and guidance for the people?' You make it into pages, revealing some of it and concealing much. And you were taught that which you and your fathers did not know. Say, 'Allah,' then leave them to their play.
interpretation: The verse highlights the ignorance of those who deny the divine origin of the revelation, implying that they are playing with their own souls and are unaware of the consequences of their actions.
orig: وما قدروا الله حق قدره إذ قالوا ما أنزل الله على بشر من شيء قل من أنزل الكتاب الذي جاء به موسى نورا وهدى للناس تجعلونه قراطيس تبدونها وتخفون كثيرا وعلمتم ما لم تعلموا أنتم ولا آباؤكم قل الله ثم ذرهم في خوضهم يلعبون

translation: And this is a blessed Book which We have revealed, confirming what was before it, and a guidance and a warning to the Mother of Cities and those around it, and those who believe in the Hereafter believe in it, and they are those who guard their prayers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of the Qur'an as a guide and a warning, emphasizing its role in confirming previous scriptures and its relevance to the people of Mecca and its surroundings, as well as those who believe in the Hereafter and prioritize their spiritual obligations.
orig: وهذا كتاب أنزلناه مبارك مصدق الذي بين يديه ولتنذر أم القرى ومن حولها والذين يؤمنون بالآخرة يؤمنون به وهم على صلاتهم يحافظون

translation: And who is more unjust than he who invents a lie against Allah or says: 'It has been revealed to me,' when nothing has been revealed to him, and who says: 'I will reveal the like of what Allah has revealed.' And if you could see when the wrongdoers are in the agonies of death, and the angels are stretching out their hands, saying: 'Bring out your souls. Today you will be rewarded with the punishment of humiliation for what you used to say against Allah other than the truth, and for being arrogant towards His verses.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of lying against God and pretending to receive divine revelations, emphasizing that such individuals will face a humiliating punishment in the afterlife, where they will be forced to confront the reality of their arrogance and lies.
orig: ومن أظلم ممن افترى على الله كذبا أو قال أوحي إلي ولم يوح إليه شيء ومن قال سأنزل مثل ما أنزل الله ولو ترى إذ الظالمون في غمرات الموت والملائكة باسطو أيديهم أخرجوا أنفسكم اليوم تجزون عذاب الهون بما كنتم تقولون على الله غير الحق وكنتم عن آياته تستكبرون

translation: And indeed, you have come to Us alone, as We created you the first time, and you left behind what We had provided you, and We do not see your intercessors with you, those you claimed were among you as partners. Indeed, all ties between you have been severed, and what you used to claim has failed you.
interpretation: The verse highlights the reality of individual accountability on the Day of Judgment, where all worldly attachments and false claims of partnership with God are stripped away, leaving each person to face the consequences of their actions alone.
orig: ولقد جئتمونا فرادى كما خلقناكم أول مرة وتركتم ما خولناكم وراء ظهوركم وما نرى معكم شفعاءكم الذين زعمتم أنهم فيكم شركاء لقد تقطع بينكم وضل عنكم ما كنتم تزعمون

translation: Indeed, Allah is the cleaver of grain and date-pits. He brings forth the living from the dead and brings forth the dead from the living. That is Allah; then how are you deluded?
interpretation: The verse highlights God's power and wisdom in creating and sustaining life, emphasizing that He is the one who brings forth life from death and death from life, implying that He has complete control over the cycle of life and death, and that humans should not be misled or deluded about His existence and power.
orig: إن الله فالق الحب والنوى يخرج الحي من الميت ومخرج الميت من الحي ذلكم الله فأنى تؤفكون

translation: And He who splits the dawn, and makes the night for rest, and the sun and the moon for counting, that is the determination of the All-Mighty, the All-Knowing.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's power and wisdom in creating a universe with a precise and harmonious system, where day and night, sun and moon, are all interconnected and interdependent, reflecting the perfect balance and order that exists in the universe.
orig: فالق الإصباح وجعل الليل سكنا والشمس والقمر حسبانا ذلك تقدير العزيز العليم

translation: And He it is Who has made the stars for you that you may guide yourselves by them in the darkness of the land and the sea; indeed, We have explained the signs for a people who know.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of guidance and the role of the stars in navigating through life's challenges, symbolizing the need for spiritual guidance in the darkness of ignorance and uncertainty.
orig: وهو الذي جعل لكم النجوم لتهتدوا بها في ظلمات البر والبحر قد فصلنا الآيات لقوم يعلمون

translation: And it is He who created you from a single soul, then a dwelling and a repository. We have certainly distinguished the verses for a people who understand.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's role in creating humanity from a single soul, emphasizing His power and unity, and suggesting that the distinction between individuals is not a reflection of separate creations, but rather a manifestation of God's wisdom and purpose.
orig: وهو الذي أنشأكم من نفس واحدة فمستقر ومستودع قد فصلنا الآيات لقوم يفقهون

translation: And He it is Who sends down water from the sky, then We bring forth with it every kind of growth, then We bring forth from it greenery, then We bring forth from it grain, piled up. And from the date-palm, from its spathe, are clusters of dates, hanging low. And gardens of grapes, and olives, and pomegranates, similar and not similar. Look at its fruit when it bears fruit, and its ripeness. Indeed, in that are signs for a people who believe.
interpretation: The verse highlights the majesty and power of God in creating and sustaining life, emphasizing the intricate and interconnected nature of creation, and inviting believers to contemplate and appreciate the beauty and wonder of God's signs in the natural world.
orig: وهو الذي أنزل من السماء ماء فأخرجنا به نبات كل شيء فأخرجنا منه خضرا نخرج منه حبا متراكبا ومن النخل من طلعها قنوان دانية وجنات من أعناب والزيتون والرمان مشتبها وغير متشابه انظروا إلى ثمره إذا أثمر وينعه إن في ذلكم لآيات لقوم يؤمنون

translation: And they have attributed to Allah partners from the jinn and created them, and they have claimed for Him sons and daughters without knowledge. Glorified and Exalted is He above what they attribute.
interpretation: The verse highlights the ignorance and arrogance of those who attribute false qualities to God, such as assigning partners and offspring to Him, demonstrating a profound lack of understanding of God's nature and power.
orig: وجعلوا لله شركاء الجن وخلقهم وخرقوا له بنين وبنات بغير علم سبحانه وتعالى عما يصفون

translation: Originator of the heavens and the earth! How could He have a son when He has no consort, and He created everything, and He is all-knowing of everything?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes God's absolute unity and uniqueness, refuting any notion of divine progeny, and highlighting His unparalleled creative power and infinite knowledge.
orig: بديع السماوات والأرض أنى يكون له ولد ولم تكن له صاحبة وخلق كل شيء وهو بكل شيء عليم

translation: That is Allah, your Lord; there is no deity except Him, the Creator of all things, so worship Him. And He is over all things a Guardian.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the oneness and uniqueness of Allah, highlighting His role as the Creator of all things and the Guardian over all creation, implying that He is the sole object of worship and obedience.
orig: ذلكم الله ربكم لا إله إلا هو خالق كل شيء فاعبدوه وهو على كل شيء وكيل

translation: No vision can grasp Him, but He grasps all vision, and He is the Subtle, the All-Aware.
interpretation: The verse highlights the transcendence of God, emphasizing that human perception is limited and cannot fully comprehend God's essence, while God's knowledge and awareness encompass all things.
orig: لا تدركه الأبصار وهو يدرك الأبصار وهو اللطيف الخبير

translation: There has come to you a clear proof from your Lord; whoever, then, will see, it is for his own soul, and whoever is blind, it is against it; and I am not a guardian over you.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of individual responsibility in accepting or rejecting the message of God, emphasizing that the Prophet is not responsible for guiding those who refuse to see the truth.
orig: قد جاءكم بصائر من ربكم فمن أبصر فلنفسه ومن عمي فعليها وما أنا عليكم بحفيظ

translation: And thus We explain the signs, that they may say: 'You have studied' and that We may make it clear to a people who know.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of guidance and clarity in understanding the divine message, emphasizing that the signs and revelations are explained in a clear and detailed manner so that people of knowledge and understanding may grasp the truth and appreciate the wisdom of God's message.
orig: وكذلك نصرف الآيات وليقولوا درست ولنبينه لقوم يعلمون

translation: Follow what has been revealed to you from your Lord; there is no deity except Him, and turn away from the polytheists.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of following the divine revelation and staying away from those who associate partners with God, implying that true believers must be firm in their faith and not be swayed by the influences of polytheists.
orig: اتبع ما أوحي إليك من ربك لا إله إلا هو وأعرض عن المشركين

translation: And if Allah had willed, they would not have associated partners with Him, and We have not appointed you a guardian over them, nor are you a manager over them.
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) was not responsible for guiding people to the right path, as guidance is in the hands of God alone, and it is God's will that determines who will be guided and who will not.
orig: ولو شاء الله ما أشركوا وما جعلناك عليهم حفيظا وما أنت عليهم بوكيل

translation: And do not insult those they invoke besides Allah, lest they insult Allah in revenge without knowledge. Thus We have made pleasing to every community their deeds. Then to their Lord is their return, and He will inform them about what they used to do.
interpretation: The verse cautions believers against insulting the false deities of other religions, as this can lead to retaliation and insults against Allah, and highlights the importance of respecting the beliefs of others, even if they are misguided, in order to maintain peaceful coexistence and avoid unnecessary conflict.
orig: ولا تسبوا الذين يدعون من دون الله فيسبوا الله عدوا بغير علم كذلك زينا لكل أمة عملهم ثم إلى ربهم مرجعهم فينبئهم بما كانوا يعملون

translation: And they swear by Allah with the strongest of oaths that if a sign comes to them, they will surely believe in it. Say, 'The signs are only with Allah.' And what will make you realize that even if a sign comes, they will not believe?
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who claim to believe in God but reject the signs and revelations sent by Him, implying that their oaths and claims of belief are empty and insincere.
orig: وأقسموا بالله جهد أيمانهم لئن جاءتهم آية ليؤمنن بها قل إنما الآيات عند الله وما يشعركم أنها إذا جاءت لا يؤمنون

translation: And We turned their hearts and their eyes, as they did not believe in it the first time, and We cursed them for their transgression, they were wandering.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of rejecting faith, where one's heart and eyes are turned away from the truth, leading to spiritual blindness and a state of confusion, as if they are wandering in darkness.
orig: ونقلب أفئدتهم وأبصارهم كما لم يؤمنوا به أول مرة ونذرهم في طغيانهم يعمهون

translation: And even if We had sent down to them the angels, and the dead had spoken to them, and We had gathered everything in front of them, they would not have believed unless Allah had willed it, but most of them are ignorant.
interpretation: The verse highlights the stubbornness of people in their disbelief, suggesting that even if they were to witness extraordinary and miraculous events, they would still refuse to believe unless it is God's will, implying that faith is a gift from God that cannot be forced upon someone.
orig: ولو أننا نزلنا إليهم الملائكة وكلمهم الموتى وحشرنا عليهم كل شيء قبلا ما كانوا ليؤمنوا إلا أن يشاء الله ولكن أكثرهم يجهلون

translation: And thus We have made for every prophet an enemy - devils from mankind and jinn, inspiring one another with adorned speech as a delusion. And if your Lord had willed, they would not have done it, so leave them and that which they invent.
interpretation: The verse suggests that the enemies of the prophets, who are devils from both human and jinn origins, are inspired to deceive and mislead people with eloquent but false speech, and that it is God's will that allows them to do so, implying that God is testing people's faith and resolve.
orig: وكذلك جعلنا لكل نبي عدوا شياطين الإنس والجن يوحي بعضهم إلى بعض زخرف القول غرورا ولو شاء ربك ما فعلوه فذرهم وما يفترون

translation: And incline not to those who do not believe in the Hereafter, and are pleased with the life of this world, and let them rejoice in what they have earned.
interpretation: The verse is warning believers against being influenced by the disbelievers who are content with their worldly life and neglect the Hereafter, and instead, they should focus on their own spiritual growth and not be distracted by the fleeting pleasures of this life.
orig: ولتصغى إليه أفئدة الذين لا يؤمنون بالآخرة وليرضوه وليقترفوا ما هم مقترفون

translation: Is it other than Allah I should seek as a judge when it is He who has revealed to you the Book, explained in detail? And those to whom We have given the Book know that it has been sent down from your Lord with truth, so never be among the doubters.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the authority and authenticity of the Quran, implying that it is the ultimate source of guidance and judgment, and that those who have been given the scripture should have no doubt about its divine origin and truth.
orig: أفغير الله أبتغي حكما وهو الذي أنزل إليكم الكتاب مفصلا والذين آتيناهم الكتاب يعلمون أنه منزل من ربك بالحق فلا تكونن من الممترين

translation: And the Word of your Lord has been fulfilled in truth and justice, none can change His Words, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the absolute authority and power of God's Words, emphasizing that they are unchangeable and irreversible, and that God's knowledge and awareness of all things are unparalleled.
orig: وتمت كلمت ربك صدقا وعدلا لا مبدل لكلماته وهو السميع العليم

translation: And if most of those on earth follow you, they will lead you away from the path of Allah; they follow nothing but conjecture, and they only lie.
interpretation: The verse highlights the danger of blindly following the majority, as they can lead one astray from the path of righteousness, and instead, one should rely on certainty and truth rather than mere conjecture and speculation.
orig: وإن تطع أكثر من في الأرض يضلوك عن سبيل الله إن يتبعون إلا الظن وإن هم إلا يخرصون

translation: Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has strayed from His way, and He is most knowing of the guided.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's omniscience, emphasizing that He has complete knowledge of those who have deviated from the right path and those who are rightly guided, thus implying that God's judgment is always fair and just.
orig: إن ربك هو أعلم من يضل عن سبيله وهو أعلم بالمهتدين

translation: Then eat of that over which the name of Allah has been mentioned, if you are believers in His verses.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the importance of gratitude and trust in God's provision, and that believers should acknowledge and respect the blessings they receive from Him.
orig: فكلوا مما ذكر اسم الله عليه إن كنتم بآياته مؤمنين

translation: And why should you not eat of that upon which the name of Allah has been mentioned, when He has explained to you what He has forbidden to you, except when you are forced to it? And indeed, many are misled by their desires without knowledge. Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of the transgressors.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of following God's commands and prohibitions, and not being swayed by personal desires or whims, as this can lead to transgression and disobedience.
orig: وما لكم ألا تأكلوا مما ذكر اسم الله عليه وقد فصل لكم ما حرم عليكم إلا ما اضطررتم إليه وإن كثيرا ليضلون بأهوائهم بغير علم إن ربك هو أعلم بالمعتدين

translation: And they have ignored the evident and hidden aspects of the sin. Indeed, those who earn sin will be punished for what they used to commit.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of acknowledging and taking responsibility for one's sinful actions, both the evident and hidden aspects, as individuals will be held accountable for their deeds and punished accordingly.
orig: وذروا ظاهر الإثم وباطنه إن الذين يكسبون الإثم سيجزون بما كانوا يقترفون

translation: And do not eat of that upon which the name of Allah has not been mentioned, and indeed it is a kind of disobedience. And indeed, the devils inspire their allies to dispute with you. And if you obey them, indeed, you would be polytheists.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of following God's commands and avoiding disobedience, highlighting the subtle influence of Satan and his allies, who try to mislead humans and lead them astray from the right path, and warning that obeying them would be equivalent to committing polytheism.
orig: ولا تأكلوا مما لم يذكر اسم الله عليه وإنه لفسق وإن الشياطين ليوحون إلى أوليائهم ليجادلوكم وإن أطعتموهم إنكم لمشركون

translation: Or one who was dead and We gave him life and made for him a light by which he walks among the people, like one who is in darknesses and is not out of them. Thus, the deeds of the disbelievers are made fair-seeming to them.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that people who are spiritually dead, meaning they are disconnected from God, can be revived through faith and guidance, and that this revival brings about a transformation that allows them to navigate through life with clarity and purpose, unlike those who remain in spiritual darkness and are misled by their own desires.
orig: أومن كان ميتا فأحييناه وجعلنا له نورا يمشي به في الناس كمن مثله في الظلمات ليس بخارج منها كذلك زين للكافرين ما كانوا يعملون

translation: And thus We have made in every town the great ones of its criminals to plot therein, but they do not plot except against themselves, and they do not perceive.
interpretation: The verse suggests that the corrupt leaders and influential individuals in a society are actually harming themselves and their own people through their evil schemes, even though they think they are benefiting themselves.
orig: وكذلك جعلنا في كل قرية أكابر مجرميها ليمكروا فيها وما يمكرون إلا بأنفسهم وما يشعرون

translation: And when a sign comes to them, they say: 'We will not believe until we are given what the Messengers of Allah were given.' Allah knows best where He places His Message. He will afflict those who have committed crimes with humiliation and severe torment for what they used to plot.
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and stubbornness of those who reject the signs of God, thinking that they deserve the same level of revelation as the Prophets, and that they will only believe if they receive a direct revelation from God, demonstrating their lack of humility and refusal to accept the truth.
orig: وإذا جاءتهم آية قالوا لن نؤمن حتى نؤتى مثل ما أوتي رسل الله الله أعلم حيث يجعل رسالته سيصيب الذين أجرموا صغار عند الله وعذاب شديد بما كانوا يمكرون

translation: And whomsoever Allah wills to guide, He opens his breast to Islam, and whomsoever He wills to send astray, He makes his breast narrow and constricted as if he were climbing up in the sky. Thus Allah puts the impurity upon those who do not believe.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that faith is a gift from God, and those who are guided by Him are those whose hearts are open to the truth of Islam, whereas those who are misguided are those whose hearts are closed and constricted, making it difficult for them to accept the truth.
orig: فمن يرد الله أن يهديه يشرح صدره للإسلام ومن يرد أن يضله يجعل صدره ضيقا حرجا كأنما يصعد في السماء كذلك يجعل الله الرجس على الذين لا يؤمنون

translation: And this is the Straight Path of your Lord, We have detailed the signs for a people who remember.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of following the Straight Path, which is the path of righteousness and morality, and that the signs and revelations of God are meant to guide and remind those who are mindful and reflective.
orig: وهذا صراط ربك مستقيما قد فصلنا الآيات لقوم يذكرون

translation: For them is the Home of Peace with their Lord, and He is their Ally because of what they used to do.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who have lived a righteous life will be rewarded with a state of eternal peace and harmony in the Hereafter, and that their Lord will be their protector and guardian, implying a deep sense of security and trust.
orig: لهم دار السلام عند ربهم وهو وليهم بما كانوا يعملون

translation: And the day He will gather them all together [saying], 'O assembly of jinn, you have made great use of mankind.' And their allies among mankind will say, 'Our Lord, some of us made use of others, and we have reached the end of our term which You appointed for us.' He will say, 'The Fire is your residence, wherein you will dwell forever, except as Allah wills.' Indeed, your Lord is Wise and Knowing.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that the jinn and their human allies will be held accountable for their actions and will be punished accordingly, emphasizing the concept of personal responsibility and the consequences of one's deeds.
orig: ويوم يحشرهم جميعا يا معشر الجن قد استكثرتم من الإنس وقال أولياؤهم من الإنس ربنا استمتع بعضنا ببعض وبلغنا أجلنا الذي أجلت لنا قال النار مثواكم خالدين فيها إلا ما شاء الله إن ربك حكيم عليم

translation: And thus We make some of the wrongdoers allies of others because of what they used to earn.
interpretation: The verse suggests that the suffering of the wicked is often a direct result of their own actions, and that they are often punished by being made to serve or be dominated by others who are equally wicked, implying a sense of poetic justice.
orig: وكذلك نولي بعض الظالمين بعضا بما كانوا يكسبون

translation: O assembly of the jinn and mankind, did there not come to you messengers from among you, reciting to you My verses and warning you of the meeting of this your day? They said, 'We bear witness against ourselves.' And the life of the world deceived them, and they testified against themselves that they were disbelievers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that people are responsible for their own actions and cannot blame others for their lack of faith, as they had been warned by prophets and messengers from among their own kind, and yet they chose to reject the message and indulge in worldly desires.
orig: يا معشر الجن والإنس ألم يأتكم رسل منكم يقصون عليكم آياتي وينذرونكم لقاء يومكم هذا قالوا شهدنا على أنفسنا وغرتهم الحياة الدنيا وشهدوا على أنفسهم أنهم كانوا كافرين

translation: That is because your Lord did not destroy the towns unjustly while their people were unaware.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's justice, emphasizing that He does not destroy towns or communities without a valid reason, implying that the destruction of towns is a consequence of the people's own actions and that God is not arbitrary in His punishment.
orig: ذلك أن لم يكن ربك مهلك القرى بظلم وأهلها غافلون

translation: And for all are degrees according to what they did, and your Lord is not unaware of what they do.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of personal accountability, emphasizing that each individual will be judged and rewarded or punished based on their own actions, and that God is fully aware of every deed, no matter how small or seemingly insignificant.
orig: ولكل درجات مما عملوا وما ربك بغافل عما يعملون

translation: And your Lord is the Self-Sufficient One, full of Mercy. If He wills, He can take you away and give succession after you to whom He wills, just as He produced you from the posterity of another people.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's absolute power and control over human existence, emphasizing that He can replace one generation with another at will, and that human beings are entirely dependent on His mercy and benevolence.
orig: وربك الغني ذو الرحمة إن يشأ يذهبكم ويستخلف من بعدكم ما يشاء كما أنشأكم من ذرية قوم آخرين

translation: What you are promised is surely coming, and you cannot escape it.
interpretation: The verse is a reminder that the consequences of one's actions, whether good or bad, are inevitable and cannot be avoided, emphasizing the idea of personal responsibility and accountability.
orig: إن ما توعدون لآت وما أنتم بمعجزين

translation: Say, 'O my people, work according to your position; I am working. Soon you will come to know who will have the ultimate abode. Indeed, the wrongdoers will not succeed.'
interpretation: The verse is a call to accountability, emphasizing that every individual will be responsible for their actions and will ultimately face the consequences, and that those who do wrong will not prosper in the end.
orig: قل يا قوم اعملوا على مكانتكم إني عامل فسوف تعلمون من تكون له عاقبة الدار إنه لا يفلح الظالمون

translation: And they assign to Allah from that which He created of the crops and the cattle a share, and they say: 'This is for Allah,' according to their claim, and 'This is for our partners.' But what is for their partners does not reach Allah, while what is for Allah reaches their partners. Evil is that which they judge.
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who claim to believe in Allah but also associate partners with Him, and how they deceive themselves by allocating a portion of their goods to Allah, while in reality, they are only serving their own interests and desires.
orig: وجعلوا لله مما ذرأ من الحرث والأنعام نصيبا فقالوا هذا لله بزعمهم وهذا لشركائنا فما كان لشركائهم فلا يصل إلى الله وما كان لله فهو يصل إلى شركائهم ساء ما يحكمون

translation: And thus, many of the polytheists have been led to kill their own children, their partners have led them astray, so that they may return them to unbelief and dress them with their polytheism. And if Allah had willed, they would not have done it, so leave them and what they invent.
interpretation: This verse highlights the depths of ignorance and misguidance of the polytheists, who were so deceived by their partners in polytheism that they were led to kill their own children, and thus, perpetuating their misguided beliefs and practices.
orig: وكذلك زين لكثير من المشركين قتل أولادهم شركاؤهم ليردوهم وليلبسوا عليهم دينهم ولو شاء الله ما فعلوه فذرهم وما يفترون

translation: And they say: 'These cattle and crops are forbidden; none shall eat them except whom we please,' - by their claim - and there are cattle whose backs are forbidden, and cattle over which they do not mention the name of Allah, inventing a lie against Him. He will punish them for what they used to invent.
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and pretentiousness of those who claim to have the authority to dictate what is permissible and what is not, and how they use their supposed piety as a means to exert control over others, while in reality, they are driven by their own selfish desires and false assumptions.
orig: وقالوا هذه أنعام وحرث حجر لا يطعمها إلا من نشاء بزعمهم وأنعام حرمت ظهورها وأنعام لا يذكرون اسم الله عليها افتراء عليه سيجزيهم بما كانوا يفترون

translation: And they say: What is in the bellies of these cattle is exclusively for our men and forbidden to our women, and if it is stillborn, then they all have a share in it. He will punish them for their attribution, for He is Wise and Knowing.
interpretation: The verse highlights the ignorance and injustice of the pagan Arabs who attributed divine qualities to their own rules and customs, and restricted the benefits of their cattle to their men while forbidding them to their women, showing that they were far from the true understanding of God's wisdom and justice.
orig: وقالوا ما في بطون هذه الأنعام خالصة لذكورنا ومحرم على أزواجنا وإن يكن ميتة فهم فيه شركاء سيجزيهم وصفهم إنه حكيم عليم

translation: Losers are those who, in ignorance and without knowledge, slaughtered their children and prohibited what Allah has provided for them, inventing a lie against Allah. They have indeed gone astray and were not guided.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of committing atrocities, such as infanticide, out of ignorance and superstition, and how it leads to a life of deviation and misguidance, where individuals fabricate lies against God and reject the blessings He has bestowed upon them.
orig: قد خسر الذين قتلوا أولادهم سفها بغير علم وحرموا ما رزقهم الله افتراء على الله قد ضلوا وما كانوا مهتدين

translation: And He it is Who has created gardens of vines and [others] not of vines, and the palm trees, and the crops of different flavor, and the olives, and the pomegranates, similar [in shape] and not similar [in taste]. Eat of their fruit when they ripen, and pay the due of it on the day of its harvest, and do not be extravagant. Indeed, He does not love the extravagant.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of gratitude and moderation, emphasizing that God's blessings should be appreciated and utilized wisely, without excess or waste, as extravagance is disliked by God.
orig: وهو الذي أنشأ جنات معروشات وغير معروشات والنخل والزرع مختلفا أكله والزيتون والرمان متشابها وغير متشابه كلوا من ثمره إذا أثمر وآتوا حقه يوم حصاده ولا تسرفوا إنه لا يحب المسرفين

translation: And of the cattle are some for burden and some for slaughter; eat of what Allah has provided for you, and do not follow the footsteps of Satan; indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.
interpretation: The verse reminds believers that God has provided them with means of sustenance, and they should be grateful for it, while also being cautious of the whispers of Satan, who is a clear enemy that tries to mislead them from the right path.
orig: ومن الأنعام حمولة وفرشا كلوا مما رزقكم الله ولا تتبعوا خطوات الشيطان إنه لكم عدو مبين

translation: Eight pairs: of sheep two, and of goats two. Say: 'Has He forbidden the two males or the two females, or that which the wombs of the two females enclose? Inform me with knowledge if you are truthful.'
interpretation: The verse is challenging the pagan Arabs to provide evidence for their claims and superstitions, emphasizing the idea that they are making unsubstantiated claims about what is lawful or unlawful, and that they have no knowledge or authority to back up their assertions.
orig: ثمانية أزواج من الضأن اثنين ومن المعز اثنين قل آلذكرين حرم أم الأنثيين أما اشتملت عليه أرحام الأنثيين نبئوني بعلم إن كنتم صادقين

translation: And of the camels a pair, and of the cows a pair. Say, 'Is it the two males that He has forbidden or the two females, or what the wombs of the two females may contain? Were you witnesses when Allah enjoined this upon you? Then who does more wrong than he who invents a lie against Allah to mislead people without knowledge? Indeed, Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of following divine guidance and not inventing lies against God, emphasizing that those who do so are misguided and will not be guided by God.
orig: ومن الإبل اثنين ومن البقر اثنين قل آلذكرين حرم أم الأنثيين أما اشتملت عليه أرحام الأنثيين أم كنتم شهداء إذ وصاكم الله بهذا فمن أظلم ممن افترى على الله كذبا ليضل الناس بغير علم إن الله لا يهدي القوم الظالمين

translation: Say, I do not find within that which was revealed to me forbidden to an eater who eats it, except that it be a dead animal or blood poured forth or the flesh of swine - for that indeed is impure - or it be dedicated to other than Allah, by one who does not intend thereby to obey, and one who is forced, not dissenting, not rebelling, then indeed your Lord is Forgiving, Merciful.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of intention and obedience to God's commands, implying that even if one is forced to consume forbidden food due to circumstances, God will be merciful and forgiving as long as the person's heart remains obedient and faithful to Him.
orig: قل لا أجد في ما أوحي إلي محرما على طاعم يطعمه إلا أن يكون ميتة أو دما مسفوحا أو لحم خنزير فإنه رجس أو فسقا أهل لغير الله به فمن اضطر غير باغ ولا عاد فإن ربك غفور رحيم

translation: And to those who were Jews, We forbade every animal with claws, and of the cattle and the sheep, We forbade to them their fat, except what their backs or their entrails carried, or what was mixed with bones. Thus We recompensed them for their disobedience, and indeed, We are truthful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of disobedience, as the Jews were punished by being forbidden from consuming certain foods, which were previously permitted to them, due to their disobedience and transgressions.
orig: وعلى الذين هادوا حرمنا كل ذي ظفر ومن البقر والغنم حرمنا عليهم شحومهما إلا ما حملت ظهورهما أو الحوايا أو ما اختلط بعظم ذلك جزيناهم ببغيهم وإنا لصادقون

translation: But if they deny you, say: 'Your Lord is the Lord of vast mercy, and His wrath will not be turned back from the guilty people.'
interpretation: The verse is emphasizing God's mercy and justice, warning the guilty people that they will not be able to escape God's wrath, and that His mercy will not be bestowed upon them unless they repent and change their ways.
orig: فإن كذبوك فقل ربكم ذو رحمة واسعة ولا يرد بأسه عن القوم المجرمين

translation: Those who associate will say, 'If Allah had willed, we would not have associated anything, nor our forefathers, nor would we have forbidden anything.' Thus did those before them lie until they tasted Our might. Say, 'Do you have any knowledge that you can produce for us? You follow only assumption and you are only guessing.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the futile excuses of those who associate partners with God, who will claim that they were simply following their forefathers and had no choice but to adopt their ways, implying that they are not responsible for their actions. The verse emphasizes that this is nothing but a weak excuse, and that those who make such claims are merely following their own assumptions and whims, rather than any genuine knowledge or conviction.
orig: سيقول الذين أشركوا لو شاء الله ما أشركنا ولا آباؤنا ولا حرمنا من شيء كذلك كذب الذين من قبلهم حتى ذاقوا بأسنا قل هل عندكم من علم فتخرجوه لنا إن تتبعون إلا الظن وإن أنتم إلا تخرصون

translation: Say, 'To Allah belongs the conclusive argument.' If He had willed, He would have guided you all.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the idea that guidance is a gift from God, and that it is not something that can be attained through human effort alone, highlighting the importance of humility and recognizing one's limitations in the pursuit of knowledge and truth.
orig: قل فلله الحجة البالغة فلو شاء لهداكم أجمعين

translation: Say, 'Bring your witnesses who can testify that Allah has prohibited this.' Then if they testify, do not testify with them, and do not follow the desires of those who deny Our verses and do not believe in the Hereafter, and they are unfair to their Lord.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of seeking evidence and testimony from credible witnesses, and warns against blindly following the desires of those who reject God's signs and deny the Hereafter, implying that true justice can only be achieved by adhering to God's commandments and not by following human whims.
orig: قل هلم شهداءكم الذين يشهدون أن الله حرم هذا فإن شهدوا فلا تشهد معهم ولا تتبع أهواء الذين كذبوا بآياتنا والذين لا يؤمنون بالآخرة وهم بربهم يعدلون

translation: Say, 'Come, I will recite what your Lord has forbidden to you. [He commands] that you not associate anything with Him, and to parents, good treatment, and do not kill your children out of poverty; We will provide for you and them. And do not approach immoralities - what is apparent of them and what is concealed. And do not kill the soul which Allah has forbidden [to be killed] except by [legal] right. This He has commanded you that you may use reason.'
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of using reason and intellect to understand and follow God's commandments, and to avoid sinful and immoral behaviors, in order to live a righteous and virtuous life.
orig: قل تعالوا أتل ما حرم ربكم عليكم ألا تشركوا به شيئا وبالوالدين إحسانا ولا تقتلوا أولادكم من إملاق نحن نرزقكم وإياهم ولا تقربوا الفواحش ما ظهر منها وما بطن ولا تقتلوا النفس التي حرم الله إلا بالحق ذلكم وصاكم به لعلكم تعقلون

translation: And do not approach the orphan's property except in the best way until he reaches his maturity, and fulfill the measure and the scale with justice. We do not burden a soul beyond its capacity, and when you speak, be just, even if it concerns a relative, and fulfill the covenant of Allah. That He has commanded you, that you may remember.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of fairness and justice in all aspects of life, even in seemingly mundane tasks like measuring and weighing, and serves as a reminder to uphold moral values and fulfill one's obligations, even when it comes to those closest to us.
orig: ولا تقربوا مال اليتيم إلا بالتي هي أحسن حتى يبلغ أشده وأوفوا الكيل والميزان بالقسط لا نكلف نفسا إلا وسعها وإذا قلتم فاعدلوا ولو كان ذا قربى وبعهد الله أوفوا ذلكم وصاكم به لعلكم تذكرون

translation: And this is My Straight Path, so follow it, and do not follow other paths, lest you be separated from His Path. That is an admonition from Him, so that you may become righteous.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of following the straight path of God, which is the path of righteousness and guidance, and avoiding deviation from it, as deviation can lead to separation from God's path and ultimately to sin and disobedience.
orig: وأن هذا صراطي مستقيما فاتبعوه ولا تتبعوا السبل فتفرق بكم عن سبيله ذلكم وصاكم به لعلكم تتقون

translation: Then We gave Moses the Book, completing [Our favor] upon the one who did good and detailing everything and a guidance and a mercy that they might believe in the meeting with their Lord.
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of the revelation given to Moses, which served as a guidance and a mercy, and emphasizes the importance of believing in the eventual meeting with God, implying that faith in the Hereafter is a fundamental aspect of a believer's worldview.
orig: ثم آتينا موسى الكتاب تماما على الذي أحسن وتفصيلا لكل شيء وهدى ورحمة لعلهم بلقاء ربهم يؤمنون

translation: And this is a blessed Book which We have sent down, so follow it and fear, that you may receive mercy.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of following the guidance of the Quran, which is a blessed and sacred book, in order to receive God's mercy and forgiveness.
orig: وهذا كتاب أنزلناه مبارك فاتبعوه واتقوا لعلكم ترحمون

translation: Or do you say that the Book was only revealed to two groups before us, and we were unaware of their study?
interpretation: The verse highlights the ignorance of the disbelievers who claimed that the Book (the Quran) was only revealed to two groups before them, implying that they had no knowledge of the scriptures of the previous prophets, and therefore, they could not recognize the truth of the Quran.
orig: أن تقولوا إنما أنزل الكتاب على طائفتين من قبلنا وإن كنا عن دراستهم لغافلين

translation: Or do you say, 'If only the Scripture had been sent down to us, we would have been better guided than them.' Now there has come to you a clear proof from your Lord, and a guidance and a mercy. So who does more wrong than one who rejects the signs of Allah and turns away from them? We will punish those who turn away from Our signs with a painful punishment because they used to turn away.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of excuses made by those who reject the signs of God, emphasizing that the revelation of the Scripture is a clear proof of God's guidance and mercy, and that those who turn away from it will face a painful punishment, implying that they are responsible for their own misguidance.
orig: أو تقولوا لو أنا أنزل علينا الكتاب لكنا أهدى منهم فقد جاءكم بينة من ربكم وهدى ورحمة فمن أظلم ممن كذب بآيات الله وصدف عنها سنجزي الذين يصدفون عن آياتنا سوء العذاب بما كانوا يصدفون

translation: Do they wait except that the Angels should come to them, or your Lord should come, or that some of the Signs of your Lord should come. The Day that some of the Signs of your Lord do come, no soul will benefit from its faith as long as it had not believed before or earned some good in its faith. Say, 'Wait, indeed, we are waiting.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of waiting for a catastrophic event or a divine sign to occur before believing, as it will be too late to repent or benefit from faith at that point, emphasizing the importance of taking proactive steps towards faith and righteousness in the present.
orig: هل ينظرون إلا أن تأتيهم الملائكة أو يأتي ربك أو يأتي بعض آيات ربك يوم يأتي بعض آيات ربك لا ينفع نفسا إيمانها لم تكن آمنت من قبل أو كسبت في إيمانها خيرا قل انتظروا إنا منتظرون

translation: Verily, those who divide their religion and break up into sects, thou hast no concern with them in the least. Their affair is only with Allah, then He will inform them of what they used to do.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of unity among believers and warns against sectarianism, implying that those who engage in it will be accountable to God for their actions.
orig: إن الذين فرقوا دينهم وكانوا شيعا لست منهم في شيء إنما أمرهم إلى الله ثم ينبئهم بما كانوا يفعلون

translation: Whoever brings a good deed, he shall have ten like it, and whoever brings an evil deed, he shall be punished only with its like, and they will not be wronged.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of moral reciprocity, where good deeds are rewarded manifold, while evil deeds are punished in proportion, emphasizing the idea that justice is fair and balanced in the eyes of God.
orig: من جاء بالحسنة فله عشر أمثالها ومن جاء بالسيئة فلا يجزى إلا مثلها وهم لا يظلمون

translation: Say, 'Indeed, my Lord has guided me to a straight path - a correct din, the way of Abraham, inclining toward truth, and he was not among those who associate others with Allah.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of following the straight path of faith, untainted by polytheism, and instead, embracing the pure and upright way of Abraham, who was a true believer in one God.
orig: قل إنني هداني ربي إلى صراط مستقيم دينا قيما ملة إبراهيم حنيفا وما كان من المشركين
