translation: Say, 'Indeed, my prayer, my sacrifice, my living, and my dying are for Allah, Lord of the Worlds.'
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the complete surrender and devotion of a believer to Allah, indicating that every aspect of their life, including their worship, daily life, and even their death, is dedicated to the service of Allah, the Lord of the Worlds.
orig: قل إن صلاتي ونسكي ومحياي ومماتي لله رب العالمين

translation: He has no partner, and I have been commanded with this, and I am the first of the Muslims.
interpretation: The verse highlights the Prophet Muhammad's submission to Allah's oneness and uniqueness, and his acceptance of the divine command to spread the message of monotheism, making him the first to surrender to Allah's will.
orig: لا شريك له وبذلك أمرت وأنا أول المسلمين

translation: Say, 'Is it other than Allah I should desire for a Lord while He is the Lord of all things? And every soul earns not but against itself, and no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. Then to your Lord is your return, and He will inform you concerning that over which you used to differ.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of personal responsibility, emphasizing that each individual is accountable for their own actions and will be judged accordingly, and that no one can bear the burden of another's sins.
orig: قل أغير الله أبغي ربا وهو رب كل شيء ولا تكسب كل نفس إلا عليها ولا تزر وازرة وزر أخرى ثم إلى ربكم مرجعكم فينبئكم بما كنتم فيه تختلفون

translation: And it is He who has made you successors upon the earth and has raised some of you above others in degrees, that He may try you in what He has given you. Indeed, your Lord is swift in penalty; and indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's testing of humanity through the varying degrees of power and wealth that He has bestowed upon them, and serves as a reminder that God's justice is swift, yet His mercy and forgiveness are always available to those who seek it.
orig: وهو الذي جعلكم خلائف الأرض ورفع بعضكم فوق بعض درجات ليبلوكم في ما آتاكم إن ربك سريع العقاب وإنه لغفور رحيم

translation: The Opening
interpretation: This chapter, being the first in the Quran, serves as an introduction to the entire scripture, setting the tone for the revelation to come, and providing a concise summary of the main themes and principles that will be explored in the Quran.
orig: المص

translation: A Book revealed to you, so let there not be in your breast a difficulty for it, that you may warn thereby, and a reminder to the believers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of the Prophet's role as a warner, emphasizing that the revelation of the Quran is a means of guidance and a reminder to the believers, and that the Prophet's responsibility is to convey the message without being hesitant or uncertain.
orig: كتاب أنزل إليك فلا يكن في صدرك حرج منه لتنذر به وذكرى للمؤمنين

translation: Follow what has been sent down to you from your Lord and do not follow besides Him any guardians; little do you remember.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obedience to God's commands and the rejection of any alternative sources of guidance or authority, highlighting the tendency of humans to forget their responsibilities towards God.
orig: اتبعوا ما أنزل إليكم من ربكم ولا تتبعوا من دونه أولياء قليلا ما تذكرون

translation: And how many a town have We destroyed, so Our punishment came to it by night, or while they were taking their noonday rest.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's power and authority in dealing with the wicked, demonstrating that He can punish them at any time, even when they are most vulnerable or least expecting it, such as during their sleep at night or during their rest in the day.
orig: وكم من قرية أهلكناها فجاءها بأسنا بياتا أو هم قائلون

translation: But was not their cry, when Our punishment came to them, except that they said: 'Verily, we were wrong-doers'
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy and insincerity of those who, when faced with punishment, suddenly acknowledge their wrongdoing, but only after it is too late, implying that their confession is not a genuine expression of remorse, but rather a desperate attempt to escape the consequences of their actions.
orig: فما كان دعواهم إذ جاءهم بأسنا إلا أن قالوا إنا كنا ظالمين

translation: Then We shall question those to whom We sent, and We shall question the Messengers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of accountability, emphasizing that not only the recipients of the divine message but also the messengers themselves will be held accountable for their actions and the fulfillment of their duties, underscoring the importance of responsibility and trust in the divine plan.
orig: فلنسألن الذين أرسل إليهم ولنسألن المرسلين

translation: We will soon settle the score with them with knowledge, and We were not absent.
interpretation: The verse suggests that God is all-knowing and all-seeing, and that He will ultimately hold people accountable for their actions, implying that no one can escape God's judgment and punishment.
orig: فلنقصن عليهم بعلم وما كنا غائبين

translation: And the weighing [of deeds] on that day is the truth. So, he whose scales are heavy, those are the successful ones.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that true success is not measured by worldly achievements, but by the weight of one's good deeds on the Day of Judgment, emphasizing the importance of living a righteous life.
orig: والوزن يومئذ الحق فمن ثقلت موازينه فأولئك هم المفلحون

translation: And whoever is light in scales, then those are the ones who have lost their souls because they used to wrong Our verses.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who are found wanting in their scales of justice on the Day of Judgment, having failed to live up to the moral standards set by God's revelations, will ultimately be the losers, having squandered their own souls through their disobedience and disregard for divine guidance.
orig: ومن خفت موازينه فأولئك الذين خسروا أنفسهم بما كانوا بآياتنا يظلمون

translation: And indeed, We have established you firmly on the earth and made for you therein [facilities of] livelihood, a little [while] you give thanks.
interpretation: This verse highlights humanity's ingratitude towards God's blessings, as despite being provided with the necessities of life and established firmly on earth, humans still fail to show appreciation and gratitude to their Creator.
orig: ولقد مكناكم في الأرض وجعلنا لكم فيها معايش قليلا ما تشكرون

translation: And indeed, We created you, then We shaped you, then We said to the angels, 'Prostrate to Adam,' and they prostrated, except Iblis; he was not of those who prostrated.
interpretation: The verse highlights the unique status of human beings as God's creation, emphasizing the special attention and honor bestowed upon them, as evident in the command to the angels to prostrate before Adam, and thus serves as a reminder of humanity's dignity and responsibility.
orig: ولقد خلقناكم ثم صورناكم ثم قلنا للملائكة اسجدوا لآدم فسجدوا إلا إبليس لم يكن من الساجدين

translation: He said: 'What prevented you from prostrating when I commanded you?' He said: 'I am better than he, You created me from fire and created him from clay.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and pride of Iblis (Satan) who refused to obey God's command to prostrate to Adam, claiming superiority over him due to his perceived noble origin from fire, whereas Adam was created from clay, indicating that Iblis's disobedience stemmed from his own self-conceit and sense of superiority.
orig: قال ما منعك ألا تسجد إذ أمرتك قال أنا خير منه خلقتني من نار وخلقته من طين

translation: He said: 'Get down from this, it is not for you to be proud therein, so get out, indeed you are of the humble ones.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of humility and the dangers of pride, as it can lead to expulsion from a place of honor and blessings, and instead, one becomes humbled and brought low.
orig: قال فاهبط منها فما يكون لك أن تتكبر فيها فاخرج إنك من الصاغرين

translation: He said: 'Look at me, until the Day they are resurrected'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of accountability and the inevitability of judgment, as the speaker requests to be held accountable until the Day of Resurrection, emphasizing the gravity of one's actions in this life.
orig: قال أنظرني إلى يوم يبعثون

translation: He said: 'Indeed, you are of those who are to be delayed.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of accountability in the Hereafter, where individuals will be held responsible for their actions, and those who have been unjust or disobedient will be delayed in receiving their judgment, implying a sense of punishment or retribution.
orig: قال إنك من المنظرين

translation: He said: 'For what Thou hast decreed a trial for me, I will certainly waylay them on Thy straight path.'
interpretation: The verse highlights Satan's arrogance and defiance towards God, as he vows to mislead humanity from the straight path, implying that Satan sees himself as a rival to God in guiding humanity, and that he will use his cunning and deceit to lead people astray.
orig: قال فبما أغويتني لأقعدن لهم صراطك المستقيم

translation: Then We will come to them from in front of them and from behind them, and from their right and from their left, and you will not find most of them grateful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the all-encompassing nature of God's power and knowledge, where He can approach humanity from all directions, emphasizing His omnipresence and ability to surround humanity from all sides, making it impossible to escape His wrath or judgment.
orig: ثم لآتينهم من بين أيديهم ومن خلفهم وعن أيمانهم وعن شمائلهم ولا تجد أكثرهم شاكرين

translation: He said: 'Get out of it, despised and rejected, whoever of them follows you, I will fill Hell with you all.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the anger and frustration of the one who is being addressed, indicating that those who follow him will also suffer the same fate, implying that the consequences of disobedience will affect not only the individual but also those who follow in their footsteps.
orig: قال اخرج منها مذءوما مدحورا لمن تبعك منهم لأملأن جهنم منكم أجمعين

translation: And O Adam, dwell you and your wife in Paradise, eat from it freely wherever you wish, but do not approach this tree, lest you become of the wrongdoers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of obedience to God's commands, as Adam and Eve's disobedience led to their expulsion from Paradise, serving as a reminder to humanity of the consequences of disobeying God's will.
orig: ويا آدم اسكن أنت وزوجك الجنة فكلا من حيث شئتما ولا تقربا هذه الشجرة فتكونا من الظالمين

translation: Then Satan whispered to them to reveal to them what was hidden from them of their shame, and he said: 'Your Lord did not forbid you this tree, except that you become angels or become of the immortals.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the deceitful nature of Satan, who whispers false promises to humans, making them believe that they can achieve divine status or immortality by disobeying God's commands.
orig: فوسوس لهما الشيطان ليبدي لهما ما ووري عنهما من سوآتهما وقال ما نهاكما ربكما عن هذه الشجرة إلا أن تكونا ملكين أو تكونا من الخالدين

translation: And I am to you both a sincere advisor.
interpretation: The verse is a declaration of Prophet Abraham's sincerity and honesty in his advice to his father and his people, emphasizing his genuine concern for their well-being and salvation.
orig: وقاسمهما إني لكما لمن الناصحين

translation: So he misled them through deceit; then when they tasted the tree, their nakedness became apparent to them, and they began to sew together leaves from the Garden to cover themselves. And their Lord called out to them, 'Did I not forbid you from that tree, and tell you that Satan is your sworn enemy?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the cunning nature of Satan, who deceives humans into disobeying God's commands, and how this disobedience leads to a loss of innocence and a sense of shame, emphasizing the eternal enmity between humans and Satan.
orig: فدلاهما بغرور فلما ذاقا الشجرة بدت لهما سوآتهما وطفقا يخصفان عليهما من ورق الجنة وناداهما ربهما ألم أنهكما عن تلكما الشجرة وأقل لكما إن الشيطان لكما عدو مبين

translation: They said: 'Our Lord! We have wronged ourselves. If You do not forgive us and have mercy on us, we will certainly be among the losers.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of self-awareness and humility in recognizing one's mistakes, and the need to seek forgiveness and mercy from God, as those who fail to do so will ultimately be the losers.
orig: قالا ربنا ظلمنا أنفسنا وإن لم تغفر لنا وترحمنا لنكونن من الخاسرين

translation: He said, 'Descend, being to one another enemies. And you will have in the earth an abode and a provision for a time.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of disobedience and sin, where humanity is doomed to live in a state of conflict and strife, and even the blessings of the earth and its provisions are only temporary and fleeting.
orig: قال اهبطوا بعضكم لبعض عدو ولكم في الأرض مستقر ومتاع إلى حين

translation: In it you will live, and in it you will die, and from it you will be brought out.
interpretation: This verse highlights the significance of the earth as the stage where human life unfolds, emphasizing that it is the realm where humanity experiences birth, death, and ultimately, resurrection.
orig: قال فيها تحيون وفيها تموتون ومنها تخرجون

translation: O children of Adam, We have bestowed upon you clothing that conceals your nakedness and adornment, and the garment of righteousness, that is better. That is from the signs of Allah, so that they may take heed.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of righteousness as the most valuable and essential aspect of human life, surpassing physical needs and worldly adornments, and serves as a reminder to prioritize spiritual development and moral character.
orig: يا بني آدم قد أنزلنا عليكم لباسا يواري سوآتكم وريشا ولباس التقوى ذلك خير ذلك من آيات الله لعلهم يذكرون

translation: O children of Adam, let not Satan tempt you as he removed your parents from Paradise, stripping them of their garments to show them their private parts. Indeed, he sees you, he and his tribe, from where you do not see them. Indeed, We have made the devils allies to those who do not believe.
interpretation: The verse serves as a warning to humanity to be cautious of Satan's temptations, which can lead to the loss of innocence and dignity, just like Adam and Eve in Paradise, and reminds believers that Satan and his tribe are always lurking, watching and influencing those who do not believe, making them their allies.
orig: يا بني آدم لا يفتننكم الشيطان كما أخرج أبويكم من الجنة ينزع عنهما لباسهما ليريهما سوآتهما إنه يراكم هو وقبيله من حيث لا ترونهم إنا جعلنا الشياطين أولياء للذين لا يؤمنون

translation: And when they do an evil, they say: 'We found our fathers doing it, and Allah has commanded us to do it.' Say: 'Allah never commands evil. Do you attribute to Allah what you do not know?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the tendency of people to justify their sinful actions by citing the example of their ancestors, and attributing their own desires to God's will, which is a form of idolatry, as they are essentially worshipping their own desires rather than the true God.
orig: وإذا فعلوا فاحشة قالوا وجدنا عليها آباءنا والله أمرنا بها قل إن الله لا يأمر بالفحشاء أتقولون على الله ما لا تعلمون

translation: And your Lord creates whatsoever He wills and chooses; they have no choice. Glorified be your Lord, the Lord of Majesty, from what they attribute. And turn your face towards the Religion, Hanif, and be not of the polytheists. And call not upon another god with Allah, lest you be thrown into Hell, blamed and rejected.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of sincerity and purity of intention in one's worship and devotion to God, warning against polytheism and idolatry, and encouraging believers to remain steadfast in their faith and to turn away from false deities.
orig: قل أمر ربي بالقسط وأقيموا وجوهكم عند كل مسجد وادعوه مخلصين له الدين كما بدأكم تعودون

translation: A party was guided, and a party was left to stray, indeed they took the devils as allies instead of Allah, and they think they are guided.
interpretation: This verse highlights the stark contrast between those who have received divine guidance and those who have been led astray, emphasizing that those who have strayed have done so by choosing to follow the whispers of Satan rather than the guidance of Allah.
orig: فريقا هدى وفريقا حق عليهم الضلالة إنهم اتخذوا الشياطين أولياء من دون الله ويحسبون أنهم مهتدون

translation: O children of Adam, take your adornment at every mosque, and eat and drink and do not be extravagant; indeed, He does not like the extravagant.
interpretation: The verse is emphasizing the importance of moderation in all aspects of life, warning against excess and extravagance, which can lead to corruption and moral decay, and instead encouraging a balanced and humble approach to life.
orig: يا بني آدم خذوا زينتكم عند كل مسجد وكلوا واشربوا ولا تسرفوا إنه لا يحب المسرفين

translation: Say, 'Who has forbidden the adornment of Allah which He has produced for His servants and the good things of provision?' Say, 'They are for those who believe, in the life of this world, purely on the Day of Resurrection.' Thus We explain the verses for a people who know.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes that the blessings and adornments of life are not inherently forbidden, but are in fact a gift from God to His believing servants, and that they will be rewarded for their faith and good deeds in this life and the next.
orig: قل من حرم زينة الله التي أخرج لعباده والطيبات من الرزق قل هي للذين آمنوا في الحياة الدنيا خالصة يوم القيامة كذلك نفصل الآيات لقوم يعلمون

translation: Say, 'My Lord has only forbidden the shameful deeds, whether open or secret, and sin and rebellion without right, and that you associate with Allah that for which He has not sent down authority, and that you say about Allah what you do not know.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of avoiding sinful and rebellious behavior, and highlights the gravity of associating partners with God or attributing false statements to Him, which is considered a major sin in Islam.
orig: قل إنما حرم ربي الفواحش ما ظهر منها وما بطن والإثم والبغي بغير الحق وأن تشركوا بالله ما لم ينزل به سلطانا وأن تقولوا على الله ما لا تعلمون

translation: And for every nation is a term, and when their term comes, they will not remain behind an hour, nor will they precede.
interpretation: The verse highlights the inevitability and precision of God's plan, emphasizing that each nation has a predetermined term, and when that term arrives, they will not be able to delay or hasten their fate by even an hour, underscoring the absolute control of God over the destiny of nations.
orig: ولكل أمة أجل فإذا جاء أجلهم لا يستأخرون ساعة ولا يستقدمون

translation: O children of Adam, if there come to you messengers from among you relating to you My signs, then whoever fears (Allah) and reforms, there shall be no fear on them, nor shall they grieve.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of heeding the message of the prophets, who come from among the people, and reforming one's ways in response to the divine guidance, promising a state of freedom from fear and grief for those who do so.
orig: يا بني آدم إما يأتينكم رسل منكم يقصون عليكم آياتي فمن اتقى وأصلح فلا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: And those who reject Our signs and are arrogant towards them, those are the companions of the Fire, they will abide in it forever.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of rejecting God's signs and revelations, emphasizing that such arrogance will lead to eternal damnation in the Fire, where the rejecters will reside forever, cut off from God's mercy and compassion.
orig: والذين كذبوا بآياتنا واستكبروا عنها أولئك أصحاب النار هم فيها خالدون

translation: And who is more unjust than he who invents a lie against Allah or denies His verses? Those will attain their portion from the Book until, when Our messengers come to them to take them in death, they will say, 'Where is what you used to call upon besides Allah?' They will say, 'They have departed from us,' and they will bear witness against themselves that they were disbelievers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the grave consequences of fabricating lies against God or rejecting His signs, emphasizing that such individuals will ultimately acknowledge their disbelief and bear witness against themselves on the Day of Judgment.
orig: فمن أظلم ممن افترى على الله كذبا أو كذب بآياته أولئك ينالهم نصيبهم من الكتاب حتى إذا جاءتهم رسلنا يتوفونهم قالوا أين ما كنتم تدعون من دون الله قالوا ضلوا عنا وشهدوا على أنفسهم أنهم كانوا كافرين

translation: He will say: 'Enter into a nation which has passed away before you, of the jinn and mankind, into the Fire.' Every time a nation enters, it will curse its sister nation, until when they are all gathered together, the last of them will say to the first of them: 'Our Lord, these misled us, so give them a double punishment of the Fire.' He will say to each of them: 'You will have a double punishment, but you do not know.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of collective responsibility, where each group will blame the previous one for leading them astray, but ultimately, they will all be held accountable for their actions, and each will receive a double punishment in the Fire, emphasizing the idea that everyone will be responsible for their own actions and decisions.
orig: قال ادخلوا في أمم قد خلت من قبلكم من الجن والإنس في النار كلما دخلت أمة لعنت أختها حتى إذا اداركوا فيها جميعا قالت أخراهم لأولاهم ربنا هؤلاء أضلونا فآتهم عذابا ضعفا من النار قال لكل ضعف ولكن لا تعلمون

translation: The chiefs of the former people said to the latter: 'You have no superiority over us, so taste the punishment for what you used to earn.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of accountability, where those who were in positions of power will be held responsible for their actions and will not be able to escape the consequences of their deeds, and that their power and status will not protect them from God's justice.
orig: وقالت أولاهم لأخراهم فما كان لكم علينا من فضل فذوقوا العذاب بما كنتم تكسبون

translation: Indeed, those who deny Our verses and are arrogant towards them - the gates of heaven will not be opened for them, nor will they enter Paradise until a camel passes through the eye of a needle. And thus We recompense the criminals.
interpretation: This verse highlights the gravity of rejecting God's signs and being arrogant towards them, emphasizing that such individuals will be denied entry to Paradise and will instead face severe punishment, implying that their chances of salvation are as impossible as a camel passing through the eye of a needle.
orig: إن الذين كذبوا بآياتنا واستكبروا عنها لا تفتح لهم أبواب السماء ولا يدخلون الجنة حتى يلج الجمل في سم الخياط وكذلك نجزي المجرمين

translation: For them, from Hell, a bed, and over them, a covering, and thus We recompense the wrongdoers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the severe punishment awaiting the wrongdoers in the afterlife, where they will be confined to a bed of fire and covered with a layer of flames, emphasizing the intensity of their suffering and the justice of God's retribution.
orig: لهم من جهنم مهاد ومن فوقهم غواش وكذلك نجزي الظالمين

translation: And those who believe and do righteous deeds - We will not burden any soul beyond its capacity. Those are the companions of Paradise, they will abide therein eternally.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of spiritual capacity, emphasizing that God does not burden a soul with more than it can bear, and that those who believe and do good deeds will be rewarded with eternal life in Paradise.
orig: والذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات لا نكلف نفسا إلا وسعها أولئك أصحاب الجنة هم فيها خالدون

translation: And We removed from their hearts the malice that was in them, and the rivers flowed beneath them, and they said: 'Praise be to Allah who guided us to this, and we would not have been guided if Allah had not guided us. Verily, the Messengers of our Lord did come with the truth, and they will be given the Paradise they have inherited, because of what they used to do.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the transformative power of faith, where the believers' hearts are cleansed of malice and they are guided to the truth, resulting in their inheritance of Paradise, emphasizing the direct correlation between their righteous deeds and their ultimate reward.
orig: ونزعنا ما في صدورهم من غل تجري من تحتهم الأنهار وقالوا الحمد لله الذي هدانا لهذا وما كنا لنهتدي لولا أن هدانا الله لقد جاءت رسل ربنا بالحق ونودوا أن تلكم الجنة أورثتموها بما كنتم تعملون

translation: And the companions of Paradise will call out to the companions of the Fire, 'We have found what our Lord promised us to be true. Did you find what your Lord promised you to be true?' They will say, 'Yes.' Then a crier will cry out among them, 'The curse of Allah is upon the wrongdoers.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the contrast between the believers in Paradise, who have been rewarded for their righteousness, and the wrongdoers in Hell, who are being punished for their evil deeds, emphasizing that the consequences of one's actions in this life will be realized in the Hereafter.
orig: ونادى أصحاب الجنة أصحاب النار أن قد وجدنا ما وعدنا ربنا حقا فهل وجدتم ما وعد ربكم حقا قالوا نعم فأذن مؤذن بينهم أن لعنة الله على الظالمين

translation: Those who hinder (men) from the Path of Allah, and seek to make it crooked, and they are disbelievers in the Hereafter.
interpretation: The verse highlights the characteristics of those who deliberately mislead others from the path of righteousness, and instead, choose a deviated path, revealing their lack of faith in the Hereafter and its consequences.
orig: الذين يصدون عن سبيل الله ويبغونها عوجا وهم بالآخرة كافرون

translation: And between them is a barrier, and on Al-A'raf are men who recognize all by their marks, and they call out to the companions of Paradise, 'Peace be upon you!' They have not entered it, but they hope.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of hope and longing for Paradise, where the righteous souls are eager to enter, but are still awaiting their turn, and in the meantime, they are sending greetings of peace to those who have already entered.
orig: وبينهما حجاب وعلى الأعراف رجال يعرفون كلا بسيماهم ونادوا أصحاب الجنة أن سلام عليكم لم يدخلوها وهم يطمعون

translation: And when they turn their eyes towards the companions of the Fire, they will say: 'Our Lord, do not place us with the wrongdoing people.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the regret and remorse of those who are being punished in hell, who will beg to be separated from the unjust and wicked people, indicating that they have come to realize the gravity of their own mistakes and the company they kept, and are now desperate to escape the consequences of their actions.
orig: وإذا صرفت أبصارهم تلقاء أصحاب النار قالوا ربنا لا تجعلنا مع القوم الظالمين

translation: And the companions of the Elevations will call out to men whom they will recognize by their marks, saying: 'Of what benefit to you was your gathering, and your being arrogant?'
interpretation: The verse suggests that on the Day of Judgment, the righteous will rebuke the wicked, pointing out the futility of their worldly gains and pride, implying that their arrogance and material possessions did not bring them any benefit in the afterlife.
orig: ونادى أصحاب الأعراف رجالا يعرفونهم بسيماهم قالوا ما أغنى عنكم جمعكم وما كنتم تستكبرون

translation: These are the ones who have been cursed by Allah, and upon whom His wrath has fallen. Enter you into the Fire, you will not be grieved nor will you grieve.
interpretation: The verse highlights the severity of God's wrath upon those who have rejected His message, implying that their fate is sealed and that they are irredeemable, leaving them with no hope of redemption or salvation.
orig: أهؤلاء الذين أقسمتم لا ينالهم الله برحمة ادخلوا الجنة لا خوف عليكم ولا أنتم تحزنون

translation: And the companions of the Fire will call to the companions of Paradise: 'Pour upon us some water or from what Allah has provided you.' They will say: 'Indeed, Allah has forbidden them to the disbelievers.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the desperation and regret of those in Hell, who will plead with the righteous in Paradise for relief, but will be denied due to their own disbelief and rejection of God's message during their lifetime.
orig: ونادى أصحاب النار أصحاب الجنة أن أفيضوا علينا من الماء أو مما رزقكم الله قالوا إن الله حرمهما على الكافرين

translation: Those who take their religion as amusement and play, and the life of the world has deceived them. So today We forget them as they forgot the meeting of this their Day, and as they used to reject Our signs.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of prioritizing worldly pleasures over spiritual growth, suggesting that those who do so will ultimately be forgotten by God and will face the consequences of their own forgetfulness.
orig: الذين اتخذوا دينهم لهوا ولعبا وغرتهم الحياة الدنيا فاليوم ننساهم كما نسوا لقاء يومهم هذا وما كانوا بآياتنا يجحدون

translation: And indeed, We have brought them a Book which We have explained in detail with knowledge - a guidance and a mercy to a people who believe.
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of the revealed Book, which is a comprehensive guide that provides knowledge, guidance, and mercy to those who believe, implying that faith is not blind, but rather based on knowledge and understanding.
orig: ولقد جئناهم بكتاب فصلناه على علم هدى ورحمة لقوم يؤمنون

translation: Do they wait except for its interpretation? The Day it is interpreted, those who forgot it before will say, 'Indeed, the messengers of our Lord came with the truth.' Will they be granted intercessors to intercede for them, or will they be sent back so they may do other than what they used to do? They have lost themselves, and what they used to invent has gone astray from them.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of those who neglect the truth and wait for the consequences of their actions, only to realize too late that they have lost themselves and their false beliefs, and that they will not be able to escape the consequences of their deeds.
orig: هل ينظرون إلا تأويله يوم يأتي تأويله يقول الذين نسوه من قبل قد جاءت رسل ربنا بالحق فهل لنا من شفعاء فيشفعوا لنا أو نرد فنعمل غير الذي كنا نعمل قد خسروا أنفسهم وضل عنهم ما كانوا يفترون

translation: Indeed, your Lord is Allah, who created the heavens and the earth in six days and then established Himself above the Throne. He covers the day with the night, chasing it rapidly, and (He created) the sun, the moon, and the stars, subjected to His command. Unquestionably, His is the creation and the command. Blessed is Allah, the Lord of the worlds.
interpretation: The verse highlights the omnipotence of Allah, emphasizing that He is the sole Creator and Controller of the universe, and that everything in existence is subject to His will and command, implying that humans should submit to His authority and recognize His majesty.
orig: إن ربكم الله الذي خلق السماوات والأرض في ستة أيام ثم استوى على العرش يغشي الليل النهار يطلبه حثيثا والشمس والقمر والنجوم مسخرات بأمره ألا له الخلق والأمر تبارك الله رب العالمين

translation: Invoke your Lord with humility and in secret; indeed, He does not like the transgressors.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of humility and sincerity in one's prayer, suggesting that true devotion to God can only be achieved by acknowledging one's limitations and weaknesses, and approaching God with a sense of reverence and modesty.
orig: ادعوا ربكم تضرعا وخفية إنه لا يحب المعتدين

translation: And do not cause corruption on the earth after it has been set in order, and call upon Him in fear and in hope. Indeed, the mercy of Allah is near to the doers of good.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of maintaining the balance and order established by God on earth, and warns against corrupting it, while encouraging people to call upon God with a sense of fear and hope, as His mercy is always near to those who do good.
orig: ولا تفسدوا في الأرض بعد إصلاحها وادعوه خوفا وطمعا إن رحمت الله قريب من المحسنين

translation: And He is the One who sends the winds as harbingers of His mercy, until when they bring a heavy cloud, We drive it to a dead land, then We send down rain upon it, and bring forth every kind of fruit. Thus We bring forth the dead. Perhaps you will remember.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's power and mercy in reviving and bringing life to barren lands, symbolizing His ability to bring spiritual life to those who are spiritually dead, and reminding humanity of His omnipotence and benevolence.
orig: وهو الذي يرسل الرياح بشرا بين يدي رحمته حتى إذا أقلت سحابا ثقالا سقناه لبلد ميت فأنزلنا به الماء فأخرجنا به من كل الثمرات كذلك نخرج الموتى لعلكم تذكرون

translation: And the good land, its vegetation comes forth by the permission of its Lord, and that which is bad, nothing comes forth except barely, thus We explain the signs for a people who are grateful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of gratitude and faith in the blessings and favors bestowed by God, implying that those who are thankful and appreciative of God's blessings will be rewarded with abundance and prosperity, while those who are ungrateful and disobedient will be deprived of God's favors.
orig: والبلد الطيب يخرج نباته بإذن ربه والذي خبث لا يخرج إلا نكدا كذلك نصرف الآيات لقوم يشكرون

translation: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people, and he said, 'O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a tremendous Day.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of recognizing and submitting to the one true God, warning that those who reject this truth will face a terrible punishment on the Day of Judgment.
orig: لقد أرسلنا نوحا إلى قومه فقال يا قوم اعبدوا الله ما لكم من إله غيره إني أخاف عليكم عذاب يوم عظيم

translation: The chiefs of his people said, 'Indeed, we see you in clear error.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the tendency of those in power to reject and ridicule the message of truth, and instead, label the messenger as being in error, demonstrating their own arrogance and ignorance.
orig: قال الملأ من قومه إنا لنراك في ضلال مبين

translation: He said: O my people, there is no error in me, but I am a messenger from the Lord of the Worlds.
interpretation: The verse highlights the confidence and conviction of the prophet in his mission, as he clearly dissociates himself from any error or wrongdoing, and instead, affirms his role as a messenger of God, emphasizing his divine authority and the universal scope of his message.
orig: قال يا قوم ليس بي ضلالة ولكني رسول من رب العالمين

translation: I convey to you the messages of my Lord, and I advise you, and I know from Allah what you do not know.
interpretation: This verse highlights the role of the Prophet as a messenger and advisor, emphasizing his unique access to divine knowledge and wisdom, which he conveys to his people, guiding them towards the right path.
orig: أبلغكم رسالات ربي وأنصح لكم وأعلم من الله ما لا تعلمون

translation: Do you wonder that a reminder has come to you from your Lord through a man among you, that he may warn you and that you may fear and that you may receive mercy?
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of the Prophet Muhammad's role as a warner, emphasizing that the revelation he received from God was a mercy to humanity, and that it was meant to guide people towards righteousness and away from sin, so that they may attain God's mercy.
orig: أوعجبتم أن جاءكم ذكر من ربكم على رجل منكم لينذركم ولتتقوا ولعلكم ترحمون

translation: So they denied him, but We saved him and those with him in the ship, and drowned those who denied Our signs. Indeed, they were a blind people.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of rejecting God's signs and messengers, as those who deny the truth will ultimately face destruction, while those who believe and follow the righteous path will be saved and protected by God.
orig: فكذبوه فأنجيناه والذين معه في الفلك وأغرقنا الذين كذبوا بآياتنا إنهم كانوا قوما عمين

translation: And to Aad, their brother Hud said, 'O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity besides Him. Will you not fear?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of recognizing and submitting to the one true God, emphasizing that worship of Allah is the only way to achieve salvation and avoid His wrath.
orig: وإلى عاد أخاهم هودا قال يا قوم اعبدوا الله ما لكم من إله غيره أفلا تتقون

translation: The chiefs of his people who disbelieved said: 'Indeed, we see you in foolishness, and indeed, we think you are of the liars.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the response of the disbelieving leaders to the prophet's message, where they attributed his warnings and messages to foolishness and lies, thereby rejecting the divine truth and refusing to acknowledge the prophet's authenticity.
orig: قال الملأ الذين كفروا من قومه إنا لنراك في سفاهة وإنا لنظنك من الكاذبين

translation: He said: O my people, there is no foolishness in me, but I am a messenger from the Lord of the Worlds.
interpretation: The verse highlights the sincerity and integrity of the prophet, who is not driven by personal motives or whims, but is rather a divinely appointed messenger, conveying the message of God to his people.
orig: قال يا قوم ليس بي سفاهة ولكني رسول من رب العالمين

translation: I convey to you the messages of my Lord, and I am a sincere and trustworthy advisor to you.
interpretation: The verse highlights the role of the Prophet as a trusted and sincere advisor, emphasizing the importance of following his guidance and adhering to the divine message.
orig: أبلغكم رسالات ربي وأنا لكم ناصح أمين

translation: Do you wonder that a reminder has come to you from your Lord through a man from among you, that he may warn you and that you may remember, and that you may be grateful? And remember when He made you successors after the people of Nuh, and increased you in creation with a mighty increase, so remember the favors of Allah, that you may be successful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of gratitude and remembrance of God's favors, which is a key to achieving success and prosperity in this life and the hereafter.
orig: أوعجبتم أن جاءكم ذكر من ربكم على رجل منكم لينذركم واذكروا إذ جعلكم خلفاء من بعد قوم نوح وزادكم في الخلق بسطة فاذكروا آلاء الله لعلكم تفلحون

translation: They said: 'Have you come to turn us away from our gods and what our fathers used to worship? Then bring us what you threaten us with, if you are of the truthful ones.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and skepticism of the disbelievers, who demand proof of the prophet's claims and threaten to continue their idolatrous ways, revealing their deep-seated resistance to the divine message.
orig: قالوا أجئتنا لنعبد الله وحده ونذر ما كان يعبد آباؤنا فأتنا بما تعدنا إن كنت من الصادقين

translation: He said: 'Indeed, there has befallen you from your Lord a scourge and wrath. Do you dispute with me about names that you have named, you and your fathers, for which Allah has sent down no authority? Then wait, I am with you among those who wait.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of not blindly following ancestral traditions and instead seeking divine authority for one's beliefs and practices, emphasizing the need for patience and trust in God's plan.
orig: قال قد وقع عليكم من ربكم رجس وغضب أتجادلونني في أسماء سميتموها أنتم وآباؤكم ما نزل الله بها من سلطان فانتظروا إني معكم من المنتظرين

translation: So We saved him and those with him by mercy from Us, and We cut off the roots of those who rejected Our signs, and they were not believers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that salvation and mercy from God are reserved for those who are faithful and obedient, while those who reject God's signs and refuse to believe will ultimately be cut off and destroyed.
orig: فأنجيناه والذين معه برحمة منا وقطعنا دابر الذين كذبوا بآياتنا وما كانوا مؤمنين

translation: And to Thamud, their brother Salih said, 'O my people, worship Allah. You have no god but Him. Clear evidence has come to you from your Lord. This is Allah's she-camel, a sign for you, so let her graze in Allah's earth and do not harm her, lest a painful punishment should seize you.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of obedience to Allah and the consequences of disobedience, as exemplified by the story of Salih and the people of Thamud, who were punished for their disobedience and disregard for Allah's signs.
orig: وإلى ثمود أخاهم صالحا قال يا قوم اعبدوا الله ما لكم من إله غيره قد جاءتكم بينة من ربكم هذه ناقة الله لكم آية فذروها تأكل في أرض الله ولا تمسوها بسوء فيأخذكم عذاب أليم

translation: And remember when He made you successors after Aad and established you in the earth, you take from its plains palaces and you carve out the mountains as houses, so remember the favors of Allah and do not act corruptly in the earth.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of gratitude and remembering God's favors, as He has given humanity the ability to thrive and build on the earth, and warns against corruption and mischief that can lead to destruction and chaos.
orig: واذكروا إذ جعلكم خلفاء من بعد عاد وبوأكم في الأرض تتخذون من سهولها قصورا وتنحتون الجبال بيوتا فاذكروا آلاء الله ولا تعثوا في الأرض مفسدين

translation: The chiefs of those who disbelieved among his people said to those who were deemed weak among them, to those who believed, 'Do you know that Salih is sent by his Lord?' They said, 'We believe in what he has been sent with.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the irony of the situation where the oppressed believers, who were considered weak, were more open to the message of the prophet Salih, whereas the arrogant chiefs, who were supposed to be the leaders, rejected the truth.
orig: قال الملأ الذين استكبروا من قومه للذين استضعفوا لمن آمن منهم أتعلمون أن صالحا مرسل من ربه قالوا إنا بما أرسل به مؤمنون

translation: Those who were arrogant said: 'We disbelieve in what you believe in.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the attitude of arrogance and rejection displayed by those who refused to accept the message of faith, demonstrating their obstinacy and refusal to acknowledge the truth.
orig: قال الذين استكبروا إنا بالذي آمنتم به كافرون

translation: They hamstrung the she-camel, and they defied the command of their Lord, and they said: 'O Salih, bring us what you threaten us with, if you are one of the messengers.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and defiance of the people towards the prophet Salih and God's command, as they challenge him to bring forth the punishment he had warned them about, demonstrating their lack of faith and willingness to disobey God's will.
orig: فعقروا الناقة وعتوا عن أمر ربهم وقالوا يا صالح ائتنا بما تعدنا إن كنت من المرسلين

translation: So the earthquake seized them, and they became, in their homes, prostrate.
interpretation: The verse highlights the sudden and overwhelming nature of God's punishment, where the people are caught off guard and left helpless, unable to do anything but fall to the ground in their own homes, emphasizing the idea that no one can escape God's wrath.
orig: فأخذتهم الرجفة فأصبحوا في دارهم جاثمين

translation: But he turned away from them and said: 'O my people! I have conveyed to you the message of my Lord, and I have advised you, but you do not love the advisors.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of accepting and heeding the advice of the righteous, as they are often rejected by those who are unwilling to change their ways, and this rejection can lead to their downfall.
orig: فتولى عنهم وقال يا قوم لقد أبلغتكم رسالة ربي ونصحت لكم ولكن لا تحبون الناصحين

translation: And Lot, when he said to his people: 'Do you commit the shameful act? No one in the world has preceded you in it.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the uniqueness of the sinful act of the people of Lot, implying that they had reached a level of depravity that was unprecedented in human history, and that their actions were a perversion of the natural order.
orig: ولوطا إذ قال لقومه أتأتون الفاحشة ما سبقكم بها من أحد من العالمين

translation: Indeed, you come to men with desire, instead of women, nay, you are a transgressing people.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of same-sex relations, condemning it as a transgression that goes against the natural order of human relationships, and warning those who engage in it of the consequences of their actions.
orig: إنكم لتأتون الرجال شهوة من دون النساء بل أنتم قوم مسرفون

translation: And his people's only answer was, 'Expel them from your town, for they are people who keep themselves pure.'
interpretation: The verse reveals the arrogance and ignorance of the people who rejected the prophets, as they believed that the prophets and their followers were a threat to their way of life and wanted to expel them, not realizing that it was they who were corrupt and in need of purification.
orig: وما كان جواب قومه إلا أن قالوا أخرجوهم من قريتكم إنهم أناس يتطهرون

translation: So We saved him and his family, except his wife; she was of those who lagged behind.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of spiritual companionship and the consequences of being left behind, suggesting that even the closest of family ties cannot guarantee salvation, and that individual accountability is paramount in the eyes of God.
orig: فأنجيناه وأهله إلا امرأته كانت من الغابرين

translation: And We rained upon them a rain, so see how was the end of the criminals.
interpretation: The verse highlights the devastating consequences of God's wrath, which is likened to a destructive rain that pours down upon the wicked, serving as a stark reminder of the fate that awaits those who persist in their evil ways.
orig: وأمطرنا عليهم مطرا فانظر كيف كان عاقبة المجرمين

translation: And to Midian, their brother Shu'aib. He said: 'O my people! Worship Allah. You have no god other than Him. A clear proof has come to you from your Lord. So give full measure and weight, and do not deprive people of their things, nor do mischief on earth after it has been set in order. That is better for you, if you are believers.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of justice and fairness in society, emphasizing the need to give people their due and not cheat them, and to maintain the order and harmony of the earth, which is seen as a reflection of one's faith and commitment to God.
orig: وإلى مدين أخاهم شعيبا قال يا قوم اعبدوا الله ما لكم من إله غيره قد جاءتكم بينة من ربكم فأوفوا الكيل والميزان ولا تبخسوا الناس أشياءهم ولا تفسدوا في الأرض بعد إصلاحها ذلكم خير لكم إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: And do not sit on every path, threatening and averting from the path of Allah, those who believe in Him, and seeking to make it crooked, and remember when you were few and oppressed, and see how was the end of the corrupters.
interpretation: The verse is warning against obstructing the path of Allah and intimidating those who believe in Him, and instead, encouraging believers to remember their humble beginnings and the fate of those who corrupted the earth, serving as a reminder to stay on the righteous path.
orig: ولا تقعدوا بكل صراط توعدون وتصدون عن سبيل الله من آمن به وتبغونها عوجا واذكروا إذ كنتم قليلا فكثركم وانظروا كيف كان عاقبة المفسدين

translation: And if a group from among you believed in what I have been sent with, and a group did not believe, then be patient until Allah judges between us, and He is the Best of Judges.
interpretation: The verse is encouraging believers to be patient and trust in God's judgment, even in the face of opposition and disbelief from others, as God's justice will ultimately prevail and separate truth from falsehood.
orig: وإن كان طائفة منكم آمنوا بالذي أرسلت به وطائفة لم يؤمنوا فاصبروا حتى يحكم الله بيننا وهو خير الحاكمين

translation: The chiefs who disbelieved among his people said: 'We will certainly drive you out, O Shu'aib, and those who believed with you from our town, or lest you return to our way.' He said: 'Even though we were averse?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and stubbornness of those who reject the truth, as they try to intimidate and threaten the prophet Shu'aib and his followers, demonstrating their refusal to accept the message of God and their determination to maintain their corrupt ways.
orig: قال الملأ الذين استكبروا من قومه لنخرجنك يا شعيب والذين آمنوا معك من قريتنا أو لتعودن في ملتنا قال أولو كنا كارهين

translation: Perhaps we may take revenge on God if we return to your religion after God has saved us from it, and it is not for us to return to it unless God, our Lord, wills. Our Lord has encompassed all things in knowledge. In God, our Lord, we put our trust. Our Lord, decide between us and our people in truth, and You are the best of those who decide.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of putting one's trust in God, especially in times of uncertainty and conflict, and seeking God's guidance and justice in resolving disputes and overcoming challenges.
orig: قد افترينا على الله كذبا إن عدنا في ملتكم بعد إذ نجانا الله منها وما يكون لنا أن نعود فيها إلا أن يشاء الله ربنا وسع ربنا كل شيء علما على الله توكلنا ربنا افتح بيننا وبين قومنا بالحق وأنت خير الفاتحين

translation: The chiefs of those who disbelieved among his people said, 'If you follow Shu'aib, you will indeed be losers.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and ignorance of the chiefs who rejected the prophet Shu'aib, threatening those who would follow him, implying that they would suffer losses, but in reality, they were the ones who were blind to the truth and would ultimately suffer the consequences.
orig: وقال الملأ الذين كفروا من قومه لئن اتبعتم شعيبا إنكم إذا لخاسرون

translation: So the earthquake seized them, and they became, in their homes, (dead) prostrate.
interpretation: The verse highlights the swift and merciless nature of God's punishment, where those who were guilty of wrongdoing were suddenly struck by an earthquake, and in an instant, they were laid low in their own homes, a stark contrast to their former pride and arrogance.
orig: فأخذتهم الرجفة فأصبحوا في دارهم جاثمين

translation: Those who denied Shu'aib, it is as if they had never lived there; those who denied Shu'aib, they were the losers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of rejecting the prophets of God, implying that those who deny them will ultimately be the ones who suffer loss and destruction, as if their existence was meaningless and without purpose.
orig: الذين كذبوا شعيبا كأن لم يغنوا فيها الذين كذبوا شعيبا كانوا هم الخاسرين

translation: But he turned away from them and said: O my people! I have conveyed to you the messages of my Lord, and I have given you good advice; how then shall I grieve for a disbelieving people?
interpretation: The verse highlights the sense of detachment and resignation of a prophet who has fulfilled his duty of conveying the message of God to his people, but they have refused to listen, and now he is freed from any responsibility towards them, leaving them to their fate.
orig: فتولى عنهم وقال يا قوم لقد أبلغتكم رسالات ربي ونصحت لكم فكيف آسى على قوم كافرين

translation: And We did not send a prophet to a town except that We seized its people with distress and hardship, so that they might humble themselves.
interpretation: The verse highlights the pattern of God's dealing with communities that reject His prophets, where they are subjected to difficulties and hardships, not as a punishment, but as a means of awakening their humility and recognition of their mistakes, and ultimately, their return to the path of righteousness.
orig: وما أرسلنا في قرية من نبي إلا أخذنا أهلها بالبأساء والضراء لعلهم يضرعون

translation: Then We changed the evil for the good, until they grew and said: 'Our fathers too were touched by misfortune and prosperity.' So We seized them suddenly, while they were unaware.
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to take their prosperity for granted, forgetting the struggles of their ancestors, and becoming complacent, which ultimately leads to their downfall, as they are caught off guard by God's punishment.
orig: ثم بدلنا مكان السيئة الحسنة حتى عفوا وقالوا قد مس آباءنا الضراء والسراء فأخذناهم بغتة وهم لا يشعرون

translation: And if the people of the towns had believed and feared Allah, We would have opened upon them blessings from the sky and the earth. But they denied, so We seized them for what they were earning.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of faith and righteousness in bringing about prosperity and blessings, and warns that denial and disobedience will inevitably lead to punishment and suffering.
orig: ولو أن أهل القرى آمنوا واتقوا لفتحنا عليهم بركات من السماء والأرض ولكن كذبوا فأخذناهم بما كانوا يكسبون

translation: Do the people of the towns feel secure that Our punishment will not come to them at night while they are sleeping?
interpretation: The verse questions whether people who are indulging in sinful activities feel secure from God's punishment, even when they are in a state of vulnerability, such as when they are sleeping, implying that God's punishment can come at any moment, even when they are most unaware.
orig: أفأمن أهل القرى أن يأتيهم بأسنا بياتا وهم نائمون

translation: Or do the people of the towns feel secure that Our punishment will not come to them in the morning while they are playing?
interpretation: The verse highlights the sense of complacency and false security that people often have, thinking that they are immune to God's punishment, and that it will not come to them suddenly, even when they are engaged in frivolous activities.
orig: أوأمن أهل القرى أن يأتيهم بأسنا ضحى وهم يلعبون

translation: Do they feel secure from Allah's plan? But no one feels secure from Allah's plan except the losing people.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of trying to outsmart or deceive God, emphasizing that only those who are destined to lose and are far from God's guidance would think they can evade His plan.
orig: أفأمنوا مكر الله فلا يأمن مكر الله إلا القوم الخاسرون

translation: Does it not occur to those who inherit the earth after its inhabitants that if We willed, We could punish them for their sins and seal up their hearts so they do not hear?
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of self-reflection and accountability, warning those who have inherited the earth that they too can fall victim to God's punishment if they do not correct their ways, and that their hearts can become hardened and closed to guidance if they continue to disobey.
orig: أولم يهد للذين يرثون الأرض من بعد أهلها أن لو نشاء أصبناهم بذنوبهم ونطبع على قلوبهم فهم لا يسمعون

translation: Those are the towns, We relate to you some of their news. And certainly, their messengers came to them with clear proofs, but they would not believe what they had denied before. Thus, Allah sets a seal on the hearts of the disbelievers.
interpretation: The verse suggests that the hearts of those who reject the truth are sealed by God, implying a spiritual hardening that makes it impossible for them to accept the truth, and that this hardening is a consequence of their own refusal to believe.
orig: تلك القرى نقص عليك من أنبائها ولقد جاءتهم رسلهم بالبينات فما كانوا ليؤمنوا بما كذبوا من قبل كذلك يطبع الله على قلوب الكافرين

translation: And we did not find most of them faithful to their covenant, and indeed, we found most of them to be defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of humans to disregard their commitments and covenants with God, and instead, engage in sinful and rebellious behavior, which ultimately leads to their downfall.
orig: وما وجدنا لأكثرهم من عهد وإن وجدنا أكثرهم لفاسقين

translation: Then We sent after them Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they wronged them, so see how was the end of the corrupters.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of rejecting and disobeying God's messengers and signs, as exemplified by the Pharaoh and his chiefs, and serves as a warning to those who persist in their corruption and disobedience.
orig: ثم بعثنا من بعدهم موسى بآياتنا إلى فرعون وملئه فظلموا بها فانظر كيف كان عاقبة المفسدين

translation: And Moses said: 'O Pharaoh, I am a messenger from the Lord of the Worlds'
interpretation: The verse highlights the audacity and confidence of Moses in proclaiming his prophethood and divine mission to Pharaoh, despite being in a position of powerlessness, demonstrating the unwavering trust in God's support and guidance.
orig: وقال موسى يا فرعون إني رسول من رب العالمين

translation: It is not for me to say about Allah except the truth. I have come to you with a clear proof from your Lord, so send with me the Children of Israel.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of honesty and integrity in conveying the message of God, and the need to be truthful and transparent in one's words and actions, especially when it comes to matters of faith and divine revelation.
orig: حقيق على أن لا أقول على الله إلا الحق قد جئتكم ببينة من ربكم فأرسل معي بني إسرائيل

translation: He said: 'If you have come with a sign, then bring it forth, if you are of the truthful.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of backing up one's claims with tangible evidence, emphasizing that mere words are not enough to establish credibility, and that action and proof are necessary to validate one's assertions.
orig: قال إن كنت جئت بآية فأت بها إن كنت من الصادقين

translation: So he threw his staff, and behold! It was a serpent manifest
interpretation: The verse symbolizes the transformation of something ordinary into something extraordinary, highlighting the power and wisdom of God in revealing the truth and exposing the false, as exemplified in the story of Moses.
orig: فألقى عصاه فإذا هي ثعبان مبين

translation: And he drew out his hand, and behold, it was white to the onlookers.
interpretation: The verse symbolizes the miraculous transformation of Moses' hand, which became a symbol of divine power and authority, demonstrating God's ability to intervene in the physical world and to authenticate the prophetic mission.
orig: ونزع يده فإذا هي بيضاء للناظرين

translation: The chiefs of the people of Pharaoh said: 'Indeed, this is a knowing sorcerer.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and ignorance of the Pharaoh's chiefs, who instead of recognizing the miracles of Moses as a sign from God, attributed them to magic, demonstrating their refusal to accept the truth and their stubbornness in their disbelief.
orig: قال الملأ من قوم فرعون إن هذا لساحر عليم

translation: He intends to expel you from your land. What do you command?
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of taking a strong stance against oppression, as the oppressor's intention is to displace and dominate, and it is up to the oppressed to decide how to respond to this threat.
orig: يريد أن يخرجكم من أرضكم فماذا تأمرون

translation: They said: 'Put him off and his brother, and send among the cities heralds.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the plot of the people to get rid of the prophet and his brother, and to spread false propaganda against them in the cities, revealing the extent of their hostility and opposition to the divine message.
orig: قالوا أرجه وأخاه وأرسل في المدائن حاشرين

translation: They come to you with every sorcerer skilled
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of seeking help from sorcerers and magicians, implying that even the most skilled among them are no match for the power of God.
orig: يأتوك بكل ساحر عليم

translation: And the magicians came to Pharaoh, saying: 'Verily, there will be a reward for us if we are the victors.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the confidence and determination of the magicians who, despite being in the presence of the powerful Pharaoh, were willing to challenge his authority and demonstrate their skills, demonstrating their conviction in their own abilities and their expectation of a reward for their efforts.
orig: وجاء السحرة فرعون قالوا إن لنا لأجرا إن كنا نحن الغالبين

translation: He said: 'Yes, and indeed you are among those brought near.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the closeness of the prophets and righteous individuals to God, emphasizing their privileged position and proximity to the Divine.
orig: قال نعم وإنكم لمن المقربين

translation: They said: O Moses! Either you throw or we will be the ones who throw.
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and defiance of Pharaoh's magicians, who, despite witnessing the miraculous signs of Moses, refused to surrender and instead challenged him to a magical duel, demonstrating their stubbornness and rejection of the truth.
orig: قالوا يا موسى إما أن تلقي وإما أن نكون نحن الملقين

translation: They said: 'Cast!' So when they cast, they bewitched the people's eyes and overawed them, and they came with a great magic.
interpretation: The verse highlights the impressive but ultimately deceitful nature of magic, which can deceive people's perceptions and create a false sense of awe, but ultimately lacks true power and substance.
orig: قال ألقوا فلما ألقوا سحروا أعين الناس واسترهبوهم وجاءوا بسحر عظيم

translation: And We revealed to Moses that: 'Throw down your staff.' So behold! It swallowed up what they fabricated.
interpretation: The verse highlights the miraculous power of God, demonstrating His ability to intervene in the world and validate the prophethood of Moses, thereby establishing the authority of divine revelation.
orig: وأوحينا إلى موسى أن ألق عصاك فإذا هي تلقف ما يأفكون

translation: And the truth prevailed, and what they used to do was nullified.
interpretation: The verse suggests that when the truth is finally revealed, all the false claims and actions of the wrongdoers will be rendered useless and void, leaving them with nothing to stand on.
orig: فوقع الحق وبطل ما كانوا يعملون

translation: So they were defeated there, and they turned back, humbled.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of disobedience and arrogance, as those who were once proud and powerful were ultimately defeated and humbled, serving as a lesson in the fleeting nature of worldly power and the inevitability of accountability to God.
orig: فغلبوا هنالك وانقلبوا صاغرين

translation: And the wizards fell down prostrating
interpretation: The verse highlights the humility and submission of the wizards to the power of God, demonstrating that even those who were once opposed to the truth were compelled to acknowledge and submit to God's authority.
orig: وألقي السحرة ساجدين

translation: They said: 'We believe in the Lord of the Worlds.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the initial declaration of faith by the people, which seems sincere on the surface, but may not necessarily translate into actions, as their subsequent behavior and attitudes may contradict their professed beliefs.
orig: قالوا آمنا برب العالمين

translation: The Lord of Moses and Aaron
interpretation: The verse is emphasizing the connection between God and the two prophets Moses and Aaron, implying that God is the One who guides, supports, and empowers them in their mission.
orig: رب موسى وهارون

translation: Pharaoh said: 'Have you believed in him before I give you permission? Indeed, this is a conspiracy that you conspired in the city to drive its people out of it. You will come to know.'
interpretation: The verse highlights Pharaoh's arrogance and refusal to accept the truth, as he accuses Moses and his followers of conspiring against him and his people, demonstrating his own lack of faith and understanding.
orig: قال فرعون آمنتم به قبل أن آذن لكم إن هذا لمكر مكرتموه في المدينة لتخرجوا منها أهلها فسوف تعلمون

translation: I will cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, then I will crucify you all.
interpretation: The verse highlights the severe punishment that awaits those who reject the truth and engage in treacherous activities, implying that their crimes will be met with a proportionally severe and humiliating punishment, which will serve as a deterrent to others.
orig: لأقطعن أيديكم وأرجلكم من خلاف ثم لأصلبنكم أجمعين

translation: They say: 'Verily, we shall return to our Lord'
interpretation: This verse highlights the acknowledgment of the people that they will ultimately return to God, implying a sense of accountability and responsibility for their actions, and serves as a reminder of the inevitability of judgment and the consequences of one's deeds.
orig: قالوا إنا إلى ربنا منقلبون

translation: And nothing prevents us from believing in the signs of our Lord when they come to us, except that our Lord has blessed us with patience and we meet our end as Muslims.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of patience and perseverance in the face of trials and hardships, as a means of attaining spiritual growth and ultimately, a peaceful and contented death.
orig: وما تنقم منا إلا أن آمنا بآيات ربنا لما جاءتنا ربنا أفرغ علينا صبرا وتوفنا مسلمين

translation: The chiefs of Pharaoh's people said: 'Will you leave Moses and his people to spread corruption in the land and forsake you and your gods?' He said: 'We will kill their sons and spare their women, and we are above them, dominant.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and tyranny of Pharaoh and his chiefs, who believe they have absolute power and control over others, and that they can decide the fate of others, including killing their sons and enslaving their women, demonstrating their complete disregard for human life and dignity.
orig: وقال الملأ من قوم فرعون أتذر موسى وقومه ليفسدوا في الأرض ويذرك وآلهتك قال سنقتل أبناءهم ونستحيي نساءهم وإنا فوقهم قاهرون

translation: Musa said to his people: 'Seek help from Allah and be patient. The earth belongs to Allah; He bequeaths it to whom He wills of His servants, and the end is for the righteous.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of trusting in God's sovereignty and justice, and that ultimately, it is God who determines the fate of nations and individuals, and that the righteous will ultimately triumph.
orig: قال موسى لقومه استعينوا بالله واصبروا إن الأرض لله يورثها من يشاء من عباده والعاقبة للمتقين

translation: They said: 'We were oppressed before you came to us and after you came to us.' He said: 'Perhaps your Lord will destroy your enemy and make you successors in the land, and see how you act.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of patience and trust in God's plan, as the Prophet is reassuring his people that God will ultimately destroy their enemies and grant them victory, but it is their responsibility to act righteously and justly in the land.
orig: قالوا أوذينا من قبل أن تأتينا ومن بعد ما جئتنا قال عسى ربكم أن يهلك عدوكم ويستخلفكم في الأرض فينظر كيف تعملون

translation: And indeed, We seized the people of Pharaoh with years of famine and shortfall of fruits, so that they might remember.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's method of sending gentle reminders to people through natural disasters and calamities, giving them an opportunity to reflect and return to the right path before a greater punishment is inflicted.
orig: ولقد أخذنا آل فرعون بالسنين ونقص من الثمرات لعلهم يذكرون

translation: Then when good betide them, they say: 'This is ours.' And if evil afflict them, they ascribe it to evil omens connected with Moses and those with him. Be not ye in doubt, it is on Allah that they attribute their evil omens.
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of people who attribute their good fortune to their own efforts, but blame their misfortunes on others, in this case, on Moses and his followers, demonstrating their lack of faith and understanding of God's sovereignty.
orig: فإذا جاءتهم الحسنة قالوا لنا هذه وإن تصبهم سيئة يطيروا بموسى ومن معه ألا إنما طائرهم عند الله ولكن أكثرهم لا يعلمون

translation: And they say: 'Bring us a sign that we may be enchanted thereby', but we are not going to believe you.
interpretation: This verse highlights the stubbornness and arrogance of those who demand miracles or signs from the prophets, not because they genuinely seek guidance, but rather to mock and defy them, having already made up their minds not to believe regardless of the evidence presented.
orig: وقالوا مهما تأتنا به من آية لتسحرنا بها فما نحن لك بمؤمنين

translation: So We sent upon them the flood and the locusts and the lice and the frogs and the blood, clear signs, but they were a haughty people and were a criminal people.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of rejecting God's signs and warnings, where God's punishment is not just a single event, but a series of calamities that emphasize the gravity of their disobedience and the certainty of their destruction.
orig: فأرسلنا عليهم الطوفان والجراد والقمل والضفادع والدم آيات مفصلات فاستكبروا وكانوا قوما مجرمين

translation: And when the punishment fell upon them, they said: 'O Moses, pray to your Lord for us according to the promise He made with you. If you remove the punishment from us, we will certainly believe in you and we will send the Children of Israel with you.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to turn to God only in times of distress, making promises they do not intend to keep, and seeking relief from their troubles without genuinely repenting or changing their ways.
orig: ولما وقع عليهم الرجز قالوا يا موسى ادع لنا ربك بما عهد عندك لئن كشفت عنا الرجز لنؤمنن لك ولنرسلن معك بني إسرائيل

translation: And when We removed the punishment from them until a term they were to reach, then lo! They break their promise.
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to forget their promises and commitments to God as soon as they are relieved of their difficulties, and instead, they return to their rebellious and disobedient ways.
orig: فلما كشفنا عنهم الرجز إلى أجل هم بالغوه إذا هم ينكثون

translation: So We took revenge on them, and drowned them in the sea, because they denied Our signs and were heedless of them.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of deliberately rejecting and ignoring God's signs and revelations, which can lead to catastrophic consequences, as seen in the drowning of those who rejected God's signs.
orig: فانتقمنا منهم فأغرقناهم في اليم بأنهم كذبوا بآياتنا وكانوا عنها غافلين

translation: And We caused the people who were deemed weak to inherit the eastern and western parts of the land which We had blessed. And the good word of your Lord was fulfilled for the Children of Israel because of their patience. And We destroyed what Pharaoh and his people were building, and what they were erecting.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of patience and perseverance in the face of oppression, as it is the key to achieving victory and inheriting the blessings of God, and that ultimately, God's promise will be fulfilled, and the oppressors will be destroyed.
orig: وأورثنا القوم الذين كانوا يستضعفون مشارق الأرض ومغاربها التي باركنا فيها وتمت كلمت ربك الحسنى على بني إسرائيل بما صبروا ودمرنا ما كان يصنع فرعون وقومه وما كانوا يعرشون

translation: And We took the Children of Israel across the sea, then they came upon a people devoted to some idols of theirs. They said, 'O Moses, make for us a god just as they have gods.' He said, 'Indeed, you are an ignorant people.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the ignorance of the Children of Israel in demanding a physical idol to worship, similar to the idols of the people they encountered, indicating their lack of understanding of the true nature of God and their tendency to imitate the idolatrous practices of others.
orig: وجاوزنا ببني إسرائيل البحر فأتوا على قوم يعكفون على أصنام لهم قالوا يا موسى اجعل لنا إلها كما لهم آلهة قال إنكم قوم تجهلون

translation: Indeed, these people are ruined by what they are in, and useless is what they used to do.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of the actions and pursuits of those who reject the truth, implying that their efforts are ultimately worthless and will lead to their downfall.
orig: إن هؤلاء متبر ما هم فيه وباطل ما كانوا يعملون

translation: He said: 'Is it other than Allah that I should take as a god, when He has guided me?' He said: 'I will take you as a god, besides Allah, and He has favored you above the worlds.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of Tawhid, or the oneness of God, by emphasizing that God's guidance is what sets humans apart from others, and that it is this guidance that makes humans superior to others, not any false deity or idol.
orig: قال أغير الله أبغيكم إلها وهو فضلكم على العالمين

translation: And when We saved you from the people of Pharaoh, who afflicted you with a terrible torment, slaughtering your sons and sparing your women, and in that was a great trial from your Lord.
interpretation: The verse is highlighting the importance of gratitude and remembrance of God's favors, as He has saved the Israelites from the tyranny of Pharaoh, and therefore they should remain obedient and faithful to Him.
orig: وإذ أنجيناكم من آل فرعون يسومونكم سوء العذاب يقتلون أبناءكم ويستحيون نساءكم وفي ذلكم بلاء من ربكم عظيم

translation: And We appointed with Moses thirty nights and completed them with ten, so the term of his Lord was forty nights. And Moses said to his brother Aaron, 'Take my place among my people, and reform, and do not follow the way of the corruptors.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of leadership and responsibility, as Moses entrusts Aaron with the duty of guiding their people, emphasizing the need to reform and avoid corruption, implying that true leadership requires a commitment to justice and righteousness.
orig: وواعدنا موسى ثلاثين ليلة وأتممناها بعشر فتم ميقات ربه أربعين ليلة وقال موسى لأخيه هارون اخلفني في قومي وأصلح ولا تتبع سبيل المفسدين

translation: And when Moses came to Our appointed time and his Lord spoke to him, he said, 'My Lord, show me that I may look at You.' He said, 'You will not see Me, but look at the mountain; if it should remain in its place, then you will see Me.' So when his Lord revealed Himself to the mountain, He made it crumble and Moses fell down unconscious. Then when he recovered, he said, 'Glory be to You! I turn to You, and I am the first of the believers.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the humility and recognition of one's limitations that is required in the presence of the divine, as exemplified by Moses' request to see God and his subsequent reaction to the experience.
orig: ولما جاء موسى لميقاتنا وكلمه ربه قال رب أرني أنظر إليك قال لن تراني ولكن انظر إلى الجبل فإن استقر مكانه فسوف تراني فلما تجلى ربه للجبل جعله دكا وخر موسى صعقا فلما أفاق قال سبحانك تبت إليك وأنا أول المؤمنين

translation: He said: 'O Musa, I have chosen you over people with My messages and My words, so take what I have given you and be among the grateful.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of gratitude and humility in the face of divine favor and blessings, emphasizing that true gratitude is not just a feeling, but an active response to God's blessings, which in turn leads to a deeper sense of closeness and connection with the Divine.
orig: قال يا موسى إني اصطفيتك على الناس برسالاتي وبكلامي فخذ ما آتيتك وكن من الشاكرين

translation: And We have written in the Tablets for him of all things an admonition and a detailed explanation of all things, so take it with determination and command your people to take the best of it, I will show you the abode of the wicked.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of taking the guidance and wisdom of the scripture with determination and conviction, and to command others to do the same, in order to avoid the fate of those who reject the truth and end up in the abode of the wicked.
orig: وكتبنا له في الألواح من كل شيء موعظة وتفصيلا لكل شيء فخذها بقوة وأمر قومك يأخذوا بأحسنها سأريكم دار الفاسقين

translation: I will turn away from My signs those who are arrogant in the earth without right, and if they see every sign, they do not believe in it, and if they see the path of guidance, they do not take it as a path, and if they see the path of error, they take it as a path, that is because they denied Our signs and were heedless of them.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequence of arrogance, where those who are proud and unjust will be blinded to the truth and guidance of God, and instead, they will be led astray, choosing the path of error and ignoring the signs of God.
orig: سأصرف عن آياتي الذين يتكبرون في الأرض بغير الحق وإن يروا كل آية لا يؤمنوا بها وإن يروا سبيل الرشد لا يتخذوه سبيلا وإن يروا سبيل الغي يتخذوه سبيلا ذلك بأنهم كذبوا بآياتنا وكانوا عنها غافلين

translation: And those who reject Our signs and the meeting of the Hereafter, their deeds will become worthless. Are they rewarded except for what they used to do?
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of accountability, implying that those who reject God's signs and the afterlife will ultimately be judged based on their actions, and their deeds will be rendered worthless if they were done with selfish motives or without consideration for the afterlife.
orig: والذين كذبوا بآياتنا ولقاء الآخرة حبطت أعمالهم هل يجزون إلا ما كانوا يعملون

translation: And the people of Moses, after him, took from their ornaments a calf, a body that lowed. Did they not see that it could not speak to them or guide them on a way? They took it, and they were wrongdoers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the foolishness and ignorance of the people of Moses, who worshipped a calf made of gold, which was a mere idol and could not even speak or guide them, showing how they blindly followed their desires and abandoned the path of righteousness.
orig: واتخذ قوم موسى من بعده من حليهم عجلا جسدا له خوار ألم يروا أنه لا يكلمهم ولا يهديهم سبيلا اتخذوه وكانوا ظالمين

translation: And when it falls into their hands and they see that they have gone astray, they say: If only our Lord would have mercy on us and forgive us, we would certainly be among the losers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the regret and remorse that people will feel when they realize their mistakes and misdeeds, and how they will beg for mercy and forgiveness, but it will be too late and they will ultimately be among the losers.
orig: ولما سقط في أيديهم ورأوا أنهم قد ضلوا قالوا لئن لم يرحمنا ربنا ويغفر لنا لنكونن من الخاسرين

translation: And when Moses returned to his people, angry and grieved, he said: 'Evil is that which you have substituted for me after I was gone. Did you hasten on the command of your Lord? And he threw down the tablets and seized his brother's head, pulling him to him. He said: 'Son of my mother, the people did indeed weaken me, and were near killing me. So let not the enemy rejoice over me, nor count me among the unjust people.'
