interpretation: The verse highlights the emotional state of Moses, who is not only angry but also grieved, emphasizing the depth of his emotional pain and sense of betrayal, which serves as a reminder of the human side of prophets.
orig: ولما رجع موسى إلى قومه غضبان أسفا قال بئسما خلفتموني من بعدي أعجلتم أمر ربكم وألقى الألواح وأخذ برأس أخيه يجره إليه قال ابن أم إن القوم استضعفوني وكادوا يقتلونني فلا تشمت بي الأعداء ولا تجعلني مع القوم الظالمين

translation: He said: 'My Lord, forgive me and my brother, and admit us into Your mercy, for You are the Most Merciful of the merciful.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of seeking forgiveness and mercy from God, and the role of prophets and righteous individuals in interceding on behalf of others, demonstrating their compassion and concern for their well-being.
orig: قال رب اغفر لي ولأخي وأدخلنا في رحمتك وأنت أرحم الراحمين

translation: Indeed, those who took the calf will be overtaken by the wrath of their Lord and humiliation in this life, and thus We recompense the inventors [of falsehood].
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who engage in idolatry and reject the truth will not only face punishment in the afterlife, but will also suffer humiliation and loss of dignity in this life, serving as a warning to others who would follow in their footsteps.
orig: إن الذين اتخذوا العجل سينالهم غضب من ربهم وذلة في الحياة الدنيا وكذلك نجزي المفترين

translation: And those who do evil, then afterwards repent and believe, indeed your Lord, after that, is Forgiving, Merciful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the mercy of God, emphasizing that even those who have committed evil deeds can still find forgiveness and mercy if they repent and turn to God, demonstrating the boundless compassion of the Divine.
orig: والذين عملوا السيئات ثم تابوا من بعدها وآمنوا إن ربك من بعدها لغفور رحيم

translation: And when the anger departed from Moses, he took up the tablets, and in their inscription was guidance and mercy for those who fear their Lord.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of self-control and forgiveness, as exemplified by Moses, who was able to overcome his anger and then receive guidance and mercy from God, serving as a model for believers to emulate in their own struggles with negative emotions.
orig: ولما سكت عن موسى الغضب أخذ الألواح وفي نسختها هدى ورحمة للذين هم لربهم يرهبون

translation: And Moses chose from his people seventy men for Our appointment, and when the earthquake seized them, he said: 'My Lord, if You had willed, You would have destroyed them and me before; will You destroy us for what the foolish among us have done? It is only Your trial, by which You lead astray whom You will, and guide whom You will. You are our Protector, so forgive us and have mercy on us, and You are the best of those who forgive.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of recognizing God's sovereignty and mercy, and the need for humility and repentance in the face of divine power, emphasizing that God's will is the ultimate reality that guides human destiny.
orig: واختار موسى قومه سبعين رجلا لميقاتنا فلما أخذتهم الرجفة قال رب لو شئت أهلكتهم من قبل وإياي أتهلكنا بما فعل السفهاء منا إن هي إلا فتنتك تضل بها من تشاء وتهدي من تشاء أنت ولينا فاغفر لنا وارحمنا وأنت خير الغافرين

translation: And ordain for us good in this world and in the Hereafter. Indeed, we have turned to You. He said, 'My punishment - I afflict with it whom I will, but My mercy encompasses all things. So I will ordain it for those who fear God and give zakat and those who believe in Our verses.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of combining good deeds in this life with faith in the Hereafter, as those who do so will be deserving of God's mercy, which encompasses all things.
orig: واكتب لنا في هذه الدنيا حسنة وفي الآخرة إنا هدنا إليك قال عذابي أصيب به من أشاء ورحمتي وسعت كل شيء فسأكتبها للذين يتقون ويؤتون الزكاة والذين هم بآياتنا يؤمنون

translation: Those who follow the Messenger, the Prophet who can neither read nor write, whom they find written in the Torah and the Gospel, he enjoins them to do good and forbids them from evil, and makes lawful to them the good things and prohibits for them the impure, and removes from them their burdens and the shackles that were upon them. So those who believe in him and honor him and help him and follow the light which has been sent down with him, they are the successful ones.
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of following the Prophet Muhammad, who is described as unlettered, and whose characteristics are mentioned in the Torah and the Gospel, and emphasizes that those who believe in him and support him will be the ones who achieve success and salvation.
orig: الذين يتبعون الرسول النبي الأمي الذي يجدونه مكتوبا عندهم في التوراة والإنجيل يأمرهم بالمعروف وينهاهم عن المنكر ويحل لهم الطيبات ويحرم عليهم الخبائث ويضع عنهم إصرهم والأغلال التي كانت عليهم فالذين آمنوا به وعزروه ونصروه واتبعوا النور الذي أنزل معه أولئك هم المفلحون

translation: Say, 'O mankind, indeed I am the Messenger of Allah to you all, [from] the One to whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. There is no deity except Him. He gives life and causes death. So believe in Allah and His Messenger, the unlettered prophet, who believes in Allah and His words and follow him that you may be guided.'
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of believing in the Prophet Muhammad, who is a messenger sent by God, and following his teachings in order to attain guidance and righteousness.
orig: قل يا أيها الناس إني رسول الله إليكم جميعا الذي له ملك السماوات والأرض لا إله إلا هو يحيي ويميت فآمنوا بالله ورسوله النبي الأمي الذي يؤمن بالله وكلماته واتبعوه لعلكم تهتدون

translation: And among the people of Moses is a nation that guides with the truth and with it does justice.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of justice and fairness in the community, emphasizing that a righteous nation is one that not only believes in the truth but also actively works to establish justice and fairness in all aspects of life.
orig: ومن قوم موسى أمة يهدون بالحق وبه يعدلون

translation: And We divided them into twelve tribes, nations. And We inspired to Moses when his people asked him for water: 'Strike with your staff the rock,' and there gushed from it twelve springs. Every people knew its drinking place. And We shaded them with clouds and sent down upon them manna and quails: 'Eat of the good things We have provided for you.' And they did not wrong Us, but they were wronging themselves.
interpretation: The verse highlights the blessings and provisions that God has bestowed upon His people, but also serves as a reminder that despite these blessings, people tend to wrong themselves by their own actions and choices, ultimately leading to their own downfall.
orig: وقطعناهم اثنتي عشرة أسباطا أمما وأوحينا إلى موسى إذ استسقاه قومه أن اضرب بعصاك الحجر فانبجست منه اثنتا عشرة عينا قد علم كل أناس مشربهم وظللنا عليهم الغمام وأنزلنا عليهم المن والسلوى كلوا من طيبات ما رزقناكم وما ظلمونا ولكن كانوا أنفسهم يظلمون

translation: And when it was said to them: 'Dwell in this town and eat therefrom as you wish, and say: 'Relief' and enter the gate prostrating, We shall forgive you your past sins, We shall increase the doers of good'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of humility and gratitude in seeking forgiveness and blessings from God, emphasizing that those who approach Him with a humble and contrite heart will not only be forgiven their past mistakes, but also granted additional blessings and rewards.
orig: وإذ قيل لهم اسكنوا هذه القرية وكلوا منها حيث شئتم وقولوا حطة وادخلوا الباب سجدا نغفر لكم خطيئاتكم سنزيد المحسنين

translation: But those who did wrong among them changed the word that had been told to them, so We sent upon them a torment from the sky for the wrong they were doing.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of adhering to the original message and not altering it to suit one's own desires, lest one faces the wrath of God, which can manifest in various forms, including natural calamities.
orig: فبدل الذين ظلموا منهم قولا غير الذي قيل لهم فأرسلنا عليهم رجزا من السماء بما كانوا يظلمون

translation: And ask them about the town which was by the sea, when they transgressed in the Sabbath, when their fish came to them on their Sabbath day, made visible, and on a day when they did not keep the Sabbath, it did not come to them. Thus We were testing them because they used to transgress.
interpretation: The verse is highlighting the importance of obedience to God's commands and the consequences of disobedience, using the example of a town that was punished for violating the Sabbath, and how they were tested by God to distinguish between those who obey and those who disobey.
orig: واسألهم عن القرية التي كانت حاضرة البحر إذ يعدون في السبت إذ تأتيهم حيتانهم يوم سبتهم شرعا ويوم لا يسبتون لا تأتيهم كذلك نبلوهم بما كانوا يفسقون

translation: And when a community among them said, 'Why do you warn people whom Allah is about to destroy or punish with a severe punishment?' They said, 'To be excused before your Lord, and perhaps they may fear Him.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of conveying the message of God to others, even if it seems futile, as it is a way of discharging one's responsibility and clearing oneself of blame before God, and it may also lead to the recipients of the message to develop a sense of fear and reverence for God.
orig: وإذ قالت أمة منهم لم تعظون قوما الله مهلكهم أو معذبهم عذابا شديدا قالوا معذرة إلى ربكم ولعلهم يتقون

translation: But when they forgot that by which they had been reminded, We saved those who forbade evil and seized those who wronged with a painful punishment for what they used to commit of evil.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of remembering and heeding the warnings and reminders from God, as those who forget and ignore them will ultimately face punishment, while those who strive to do good and prevent evil will be saved and rewarded.
orig: فلما نسوا ما ذكروا به أنجينا الذين ينهون عن السوء وأخذنا الذين ظلموا بعذاب بئيس بما كانوا يفسقون

translation: So when they rebelled against what they were forbidden, We said to them: 'Be apes, despised!'
interpretation: The verse suggests that when people deliberately disobey God's commands, they will be reduced to a state of humiliation and degradation, losing their dignity and honor, and becoming like apes, which are known for their mischievous and ignoble behavior.
orig: فلما عتوا عن ما نهوا عنه قلنا لهم كونوا قردة خاسئين

translation: And remember when your Lord proclaimed that He would send against them, until the Day of Resurrection, those who would afflict them with evil torment. Indeed, your Lord is swift in punishment and indeed, He is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the dual nature of God's justice, where He is swift in punishing the wrongdoers, but also merciful and forgiving to those who repent and turn to Him.
orig: وإذ تأذن ربك ليبعثن عليهم إلى يوم القيامة من يسومهم سوء العذاب إن ربك لسريع العقاب وإنه لغفور رحيم

translation: And We divided them throughout the earth into nations, some of them are righteous, and some are otherwise, and We tested them with good and evil that perhaps they may return.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of moral accountability, where God creates opportunities for humans to choose between good and evil, in order to test their moral character and ultimately guide them towards repentance and spiritual growth.
orig: وقطعناهم في الأرض أمما منهم الصالحون ومنهم دون ذلك وبلوناهم بالحسنات والسيئات لعلهم يرجعون

translation: Then, after them, an evil generation succeeded them, who inherited the Book, taking the fleeting gain of this lower life, and saying, 'It will be forgiven us.' And if a similar gain comes to them, they will take it. Did they not take a covenant on the basis of the Book that they would not say about Allah except the truth? And they studied what is in it. And the Hereafter is better for those who fear Allah. Do you not understand?
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to prioritize worldly gains and material benefits over spiritual values, and how this can lead to moral compromise and hypocrisy, ultimately causing them to lose sight of the importance of the Hereafter.
orig: فخلف من بعدهم خلف ورثوا الكتاب يأخذون عرض هذا الأدنى ويقولون سيغفر لنا وإن يأتهم عرض مثله يأخذوه ألم يؤخذ عليهم ميثاق الكتاب أن لا يقولوا على الله إلا الحق ودرسوا ما فيه والدار الآخرة خير للذين يتقون أفلا تعقلون

translation: And those who hold fast to the Book and establish prayer, indeed We do not allow the reward of the reformers to be lost.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of adhering to the divine guidance and performing acts of worship, specifically prayer, as a means of achieving spiritual reform and earning a lasting reward from God.
orig: والذين يمسكون بالكتاب وأقاموا الصلاة إنا لا نضيع أجر المصلحين

translation: And when We raised the mountain above them as if it was a canopy, and they thought it was going to fall on them, take what We have given you with determination and remember what is in it, so that you may become righteous.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of taking divine guidance with determination and conviction, and not just mere intellectual understanding, in order to achieve true righteousness.
orig: وإذ نتقنا الجبل فوقهم كأنه ظلة وظنوا أنه واقع بهم خذوا ما آتيناكم بقوة واذكروا ما فيه لعلكم تتقون

translation: And when your Lord took from the children of Adam, from their backs, their descendants and made them testify against themselves, 'Am I not your Lord?' They said, 'Yes, we have testified.' Lest you should say on the Day of Resurrection, 'Indeed, we were of this unaware.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of a pre-eternal covenant between God and humanity, where God took an oath from the descendants of Adam, making them acknowledge His lordship, and they accepted, thereby implying that humans are accountable for their actions and cannot claim ignorance on the Day of Judgment.
orig: وإذ أخذ ربك من بني آدم من ظهورهم ذريتهم وأشهدهم على أنفسهم ألست بربكم قالوا بلى شهدنا أن تقولوا يوم القيامة إنا كنا عن هذا غافلين

translation: Or do you say that our forefathers were idolaters from before, and we were their descendants after them? Will You destroy us for what the falsifiers did?
interpretation: The verse highlights the futile attempt of those who try to shift the blame of their own wrongdoing to their ancestors, and the futility of using ancestral mistakes as an excuse for their own misdeeds.
orig: أو تقولوا إنما أشرك آباؤنا من قبل وكنا ذرية من بعدهم أفتهلكنا بما فعل المبطلون

translation: And thus We explain the verses, so that they may return.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of explaining and clarifying the divine message, with the ultimate goal of guiding people back to the right path and encouraging them to repent and reform.
orig: وكذلك نفصل الآيات ولعلهم يرجعون

translation: And recite to them the news of him to whom We gave Our signs, but he sloughed them off, so Satan followed him, and he became of those who went astray.
interpretation: The verse highlights the danger of abandoning faith and being led astray by Satan, implying that those who reject God's signs will inevitably fall prey to Satan's whispers and guidance, leading them further down the path of error and misguidance.
orig: واتل عليهم نبأ الذي آتيناه آياتنا فانسلخ منها فأتبعه الشيطان فكان من الغاوين

translation: And if We had willed, We would have elevated him therewith, but he clung to the earth and followed his own vain desires. His likeness is as a dog, if you attack him he lolls out his tongue, and if you leave him alone he lolls out his tongue. That is the likeness of the people who reject Our signs. So relate the stories that they might reflect.
interpretation: The verse is highlighting the consequences of one's attachment to worldly desires and neglect of spiritual growth, likening such a person to a dog that is only concerned with its immediate desires, regardless of the circumstances, and is unable to reflect on its actions or consider the consequences.
orig: ولو شئنا لرفعناه بها ولكنه أخلد إلى الأرض واتبع هواه فمثله كمثل الكلب إن تحمل عليه يلهث أو تتركه يلهث ذلك مثل القوم الذين كذبوا بآياتنا فاقصص القصص لعلهم يتفكرون

translation: Evil is the example of the people who denied Our signs and used to wrong their own souls.
interpretation: The verse highlights the self-destructive nature of those who reject God's signs and messages, as they ultimately harm themselves through their own disobedience and arrogance.
orig: ساء مثلا القوم الذين كذبوا بآياتنا وأنفسهم كانوا يظلمون

translation: He whom Allah guides is the one who is guided, and he whom He leads astray, those are the losers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of divine guidance and misguidance, emphasizing that only Allah has the power to guide or misguide, and that those who are misguided are ultimately doomed to failure and loss.
orig: من يهد الله فهو المهتدي ومن يضلل فأولئك هم الخاسرون

translation: And indeed, We have created for Hell many of the jinn and mankind. They have hearts wherewith they understand not, and they have eyes wherewith they see not, and they have ears wherewith they hear not. Those are like cattle, nay, they are even more astray. Those are the heedless.
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that those who reject faith and guidance are not only physically blind, deaf, and dumb, but also spiritually so, and are therefore more misguided than even animals, as they have been given the faculties of perception but choose not to use them to recognize the truth.
orig: ولقد ذرأنا لجهنم كثيرا من الجن والإنس لهم قلوب لا يفقهون بها ولهم أعين لا يبصرون بها ولهم آذان لا يسمعون بها أولئك كالأنعام بل هم أضل أولئك هم الغافلون

translation: And to Allah belong the Most Beautiful Names, so invoke Him by them, and leave those who deviate concerning His Names. They will be recompensed for what they used to do.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of using the beautiful names of Allah in prayer and worship, and warns against those who deviate from the true meaning of these names, implying that they will be held accountable for their actions and will face the consequences of their deviations.
orig: ولله الأسماء الحسنى فادعوه بها وذروا الذين يلحدون في أسمائه سيجزون ما كانوا يعملون

translation: And among those We created are a nation that guides with the truth and with it establishes justice.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of justice and truth in the establishment of a harmonious society, implying that a community that upholds these values is a reflection of God's will and a model for others to follow.
orig: وممن خلقنا أمة يهدون بالحق وبه يعدلون

translation: And those who reject Our signs, We will gradually seize them from whence they do not know.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who reject God's signs and revelations will be punished in a gradual and subtle manner, perhaps through a series of small calamities or difficulties that will eventually lead to their downfall, and that this punishment will come from an unexpected direction or source.
orig: والذين كذبوا بآياتنا سنستدرجهم من حيث لا يعلمون

translation: And I will give them respite, indeed they are in a strong scheme.
interpretation: This verse highlights the patience and delay of God's punishment, allowing the wrongdoers to continue in their schemes, but ultimately, their plots will be of no avail against God's justice.
orig: وأملي لهم إن كيدي متين

translation: Do they not reflect on their companion, in whose heart Allah has instilled faith, that he is only a warner, plain to see?
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of contemplation and reflection on the prophetic mission, emphasizing that the Prophet's message is clear and evident, and that those who reject it do so out of obstinacy and not due to any lack of clarity in the message.
orig: أولم يتفكروا ما بصاحبهم من جنة إن هو إلا نذير مبين

translation: Do they not look at the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and everything that Allah has created, and that it may be that their term is near, so in what statement after this will they believe?
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of reflecting on God's creation and the signs in the universe, as a means of recognizing God's power and authority, and ultimately, the approaching end of one's life, which should prompt individuals to turn to faith and righteousness.
orig: أولم ينظروا في ملكوت السماوات والأرض وما خلق الله من شيء وأن عسى أن يكون قد اقترب أجلهم فبأي حديث بعده يؤمنون

translation: He whom Allah sends astray, there is no guide for him; and He leaves them to wander blindly in their transgression.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of divine abandonment, where God withdraws His guidance from those who have consistently rejected the truth, leaving them to wander in their ignorance and sin, further entrenching themselves in their misguidance.
orig: من يضلل الله فلا هادي له ويذرهم في طغيانهم يعمهون

translation: They ask you about the Hour, when it will occur. Say: 'Its knowledge is only with my Lord; none but He will reveal it at its time. It is a weighty thing in the heavens and the earth; it will not come to you except suddenly.' They ask you as if you were well-informed about it. Say: 'Its knowledge is only with Allah, but most people do not know.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the limitations of human knowledge and the importance of humility in the face of the unknown, emphasizing that only God has complete knowledge of the Hour and its timing, and that humans should not pretend to have knowledge that they do not possess.
orig: يسألونك عن الساعة أيان مرساها قل إنما علمها عند ربي لا يجليها لوقتها إلا هو ثقلت في السماوات والأرض لا تأتيكم إلا بغتة يسألونك كأنك حفي عنها قل إنما علمها عند الله ولكن أكثر الناس لا يعلمون

translation: Say, 'I do not possess for myself [power to bring] benefit or harm, except what Allah has willed. And if I knew the unseen, I would have acquired much good, and no evil would have touched me. Indeed, I am only a warner and a bringer of good tidings to a people who believe.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the humility and dependence of the Prophet on God's will, emphasizing that even the Prophet himself does not have the power to bring benefit or harm to himself, let alone to others, and that everything is in the hands of God.
orig: قل لا أملك لنفسي نفعا ولا ضرا إلا ما شاء الله ولو كنت أعلم الغيب لاستكثرت من الخير وما مسني السوء إن أنا إلا نذير وبشير لقوم يؤمنون

translation: It is He who created you from one soul, and made from it its mate, that he might dwell in her. And when he covered her, she carried a light burden, and passed by with it, but when it became heavy, they both invoked Allah, their Lord, saying: 'If You give us a righteous child, we shall indeed be among the grateful.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of gratitude in one's relationship with God, emphasizing that true gratitude is demonstrated through one's actions and behavior, rather than just words, and that it is a continuous process that requires effort and dedication.
orig: هو الذي خلقكم من نفس واحدة وجعل منها زوجها ليسكن إليها فلما تغشاها حملت حملا خفيفا فمرت به فلما أثقلت دعوا الله ربهما لئن آتيتنا صالحا لنكونن من الشاكرين

translation: But when He gives them a good one, they ascribe partners to Him in what He has given them. Exalted is Allah above what they associate
interpretation: This verse highlights the ingratitude of humans, who, when blessed with good things, attribute their blessings to false deities or idols, thereby rejecting the sole authority of God, and thus inviting His wrath.
orig: فلما آتاهما صالحا جعلا له شركاء فيما آتاهما فتعالى الله عما يشركون

translation: Do they associate that which does not create anything, and they are created?
interpretation: The verse highlights the absurdity of idol worship, where humans create idols that are powerless to create anything, yet they worship them as if they have the power to create.
orig: أيشركون ما لا يخلق شيئا وهم يخلقون

translation: And they cannot help them, nor can they help themselves.
interpretation: The verse highlights the complete powerlessness of the polytheists and their idols in the face of God's justice, emphasizing that they are unable to provide any assistance to one another, let alone to themselves, in the face of divine retribution.
orig: ولا يستطيعون لهم نصرا ولا أنفسهم ينصرون

translation: And if you invite them to guidance, they will not follow you. It is all the same for you whether you invite them or remain silent.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of trying to guide those who are not willing to listen, and that one should not be overly concerned with trying to convince them, as it is ultimately up to God to guide whom He wills.
orig: وإن تدعوهم إلى الهدى لا يتبعوكم سواء عليكم أدعوتموهم أم أنتم صامتون

translation: Those whom you worship besides Allah are only servants like you, so call upon them, then let them answer you if you are truthful.
interpretation: The verse is a challenge to the idolaters, implying that if they truly believe in the power of their idols, they should call upon them for help, and if they are truthful in their claims, their idols should respond to their invocation.
orig: إن الذين تدعون من دون الله عباد أمثالكم فادعوهم فليستجيبوا لكم إن كنتم صادقين

translation: Or have they feet wherewith they walk, or have they hands wherewith they hold, or have they eyes wherewith they see, or have they ears wherewith they hear? Say: 'Call your associates, then plot against me, and give me no respite.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the absurdity of idolatry by emphasizing the inability of idols to perform even the most basic human functions, implying that they are powerless and useless, and that those who worship them are foolish and misguided.
orig: ألهم أرجل يمشون بها أم لهم أيد يبطشون بها أم لهم أعين يبصرون بها أم لهم آذان يسمعون بها قل ادعوا شركاءكم ثم كيدون فلا تنظرون

translation: Indeed, my protector is Allah, who has sent down the Book, and He takes care of the righteous.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of trusting in God's protection and care, especially for those who are righteous, emphasizing that God is the ultimate guardian and supporter of those who are pious and virtuous.
orig: إن وليي الله الذي نزل الكتاب وهو يتولى الصالحين

translation: And those whom you invoke besides Him do not have the power to help you, nor can they help themselves.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of seeking help from idols or false deities, emphasizing that they are powerless to assist their devotees, and are in fact helpless themselves, implying that only the One True God is capable of providing true aid and protection.
orig: والذين تدعون من دونه لا يستطيعون نصركم ولا أنفسهم ينصرون

translation: And if you call them to guidance, they do not hear; and you see them looking at you, yet they do not see.
interpretation: This verse highlights the stubbornness and ignorance of those who reject the truth, as they are unable to see the guidance being offered to them, despite being physically present and appearing to look, their hearts and minds are closed to the truth.
orig: وإن تدعوهم إلى الهدى لا يسمعوا وتراهم ينظرون إليك وهم لا يبصرون

translation: Show forgiveness, enjoin what is right, and turn away from the ignorant.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of patience, tolerance, and wisdom in dealing with others, especially when faced with ignorance or hostility, and encourages the believer to focus on promoting good and justice rather than engaging with foolish or malicious people.
orig: خذ العفو وأمر بالعرف وأعرض عن الجاهلين

translation: And if an evil suggestion comes to you from Satan, then seek refuge in Allah. Indeed, He is Hearing, Knowing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of seeking God's protection when faced with evil whispers from Satan, emphasizing that God is all-knowing and all-hearing, and therefore, is the ultimate refuge from Satan's temptations.
orig: وإما ينزغنك من الشيطان نزغ فاستعذ بالله إنه سميع عليم

translation: Indeed, those who fear Allah, when a visitation from Satan touches them, they remember and then they have insight.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of mindfulness and self-reflection in the face of temptation, suggesting that those who are God-conscious are able to recognize and overcome the whispers of Satan, thereby gaining a deeper understanding of themselves and the world around them.
orig: إن الذين اتقوا إذا مسهم طائف من الشيطان تذكروا فإذا هم مبصرون

translation: And their brethren increase them in error, then they do not cease.
interpretation: The verse highlights the role of bad companions and peers in leading individuals further astray, implying that the company one keeps can have a profound impact on one's moral and spiritual well-being.
orig: وإخوانهم يمدونهم في الغي ثم لا يقصرون

translation: And when they do not bring you a sign, they say: 'Why do you not invent one?' Say: 'I only follow what is revealed to me from my Lord. This is enlightenment and guidance and mercy from your Lord for a people who believe.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of obedience to God's revelation and the futility of human attempts to create miracles, emphasizing that true guidance and mercy come from God alone.
orig: وإذا لم تأتهم بآية قالوا لولا اجتبيتها قل إنما أتبع ما يوحى إلي من ربي هذا بصائر من ربكم وهدى ورحمة لقوم يؤمنون

translation: And when the Quran is recited, then listen to it and be silent, that you may receive mercy.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of giving undivided attention to the recitation of the Quran, and the need to approach it with humility and reverence, in order to receive God's mercy and blessings.
orig: وإذا قرئ القرآن فاستمعوا له وأنصتوا لعلكم ترحمون

translation: And remember your Lord in yourself, humbly and fearfully, and in a voice not loud, in the morning and the afternoon, and do not be of the neglectful.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of remembering God in a humble and fearful state, not just outwardly but also inwardly, and in all aspects of one's life, from morning to afternoon, in order to avoid being among those who are neglectful of their spiritual obligations.
orig: واذكر ربك في نفسك تضرعا وخيفة ودون الجهر من القول بالغدو والآصال ولا تكن من الغافلين

translation: Indeed, those who are with your Lord do not disdain from His worship, and they glorify Him, and to Him they prostrate.
interpretation: The verse highlights the humility and devotion of the angels who are closest to God, emphasizing that they do not consider themselves too great to worship God, and instead, they constantly glorify and prostrate themselves before Him.
orig: إن الذين عند ربك لا يستكبرون عن عبادته ويسبحونه وله يسجدون

translation: They ask you about the spoils of war. Say: 'The spoils of war are for Allah and the Messenger.' So fear Allah and adjust the matters of your mutual [affairs], and obey Allah and His Messenger, if you are believers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obedience to Allah and His Messenger, and the need for believers to settle their disputes and differences in accordance with Allah's commands, in order to maintain unity and strength within the community.
orig: يسألونك عن الأنفال قل الأنفال لله والرسول فاتقوا الله وأصلحوا ذات بينكم وأطيعوا الله ورسوله إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: The believers are only those who, when Allah is mentioned, their hearts tremble and when His verses are recited to them, it increases them in faith, and upon their Lord they rely.
interpretation: This verse highlights the characteristics of true believers, who are deeply moved and humbled by the mere mention of Allah's name, and whose faith is strengthened when they hear His revelations, ultimately placing their trust in Him alone.
orig: إنما المؤمنون الذين إذا ذكر الله وجلت قلوبهم وإذا تليت عليهم آياته زادتهم إيمانا وعلى ربهم يتوكلون

translation: Those who establish prayer and spend out of what We have provided them
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of gratitude and generosity, as those who are truly grateful to God for His blessings will naturally be inclined to share their resources with others, demonstrating their trust in God's provision.
orig: الذين يقيمون الصلاة ومما رزقناهم ينفقون

translation: Those are the believers in truth. For them are degrees with their Lord and forgiveness and noble provision.
interpretation: This verse highlights the rewards awaiting true believers in the afterlife, emphasizing that their faith will be recognized and rewarded by God, and that they will be granted a high status in paradise.
orig: أولئك هم المؤمنون حقا لهم درجات عند ربهم ومغفرة ورزق كريم

translation: Just as your Lord caused you to leave your home for the truth, and indeed a party of the believers were unhappy
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of obeying God's commands, even if it means leaving one's comfort zone or facing opposition from others, as the Prophet Muhammad had to leave his home in Mecca to migrate to Medina, and some believers were unhappy with this decision, but ultimately it was for the greater good and in accordance with God's plan.
orig: كما أخرجك ربك من بيتك بالحق وإن فريقا من المؤمنين لكارهون

translation: They argue with you about the truth after it has become clear, as if they were being driven to death while they looked on.
interpretation: This verse highlights the stubbornness of those who reject the truth even when it is clear, and how they will be forced to confront the reality of their own mortality, which they try to avoid and deny.
orig: يجادلونك في الحق بعدما تبين كأنما يساقون إلى الموت وهم ينظرون

translation: And when Allah promised you one of the two groups that it would be yours, and you wished that the unarmed one would be yours, and Allah willed to establish the truth by His words and cut off the roots of the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of trusting in God's plan and judgment, even when it goes against human desires or expectations, as God's wisdom and justice ultimately prevail.
orig: وإذ يعدكم الله إحدى الطائفتين أنها لكم وتودون أن غير ذات الشوكة تكون لكم ويريد الله أن يحق الحق بكلماته ويقطع دابر الكافرين

translation: The truth has come and falsehood has vanished, and it is certain that falsehood will perish.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate triumph of truth over falsehood, emphasizing that truth is eternal and indestructible, while falsehood is fleeting and will eventually disappear, regardless of how strongly it is defended or promoted by its advocates.
orig: ليحق الحق ويبطل الباطل ولو كره المجرمون

translation: When you sought help from your Lord, He answered you, 'I will reinforce you with a thousand angels, riding behind you.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the direct and personal response of God to the prayers of His faithful servants in times of distress, demonstrating His power and willingness to intervene on their behalf.
orig: إذ تستغيثون ربكم فاستجاب لكم أني ممدكم بألف من الملائكة مردفين

translation: And Allah has not made it except as a good news and to reassure your hearts, and victory is not but from Allah. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: The verse highlights that the ultimate source of victory and triumph is God alone, and that believers should not rely on their own strength or abilities, but rather have faith in God's power and wisdom to achieve success.
orig: وما جعله الله إلا بشرى ولتطمئن به قلوبكم وما النصر إلا من عند الله إن الله عزيز حكيم

translation: When drowsiness overtakes you, a security from Him, and He sends down upon you water from the sky to purify you with it, and to remove from you the impurity of Satan, and to strengthen your hearts, and to make firm your footsteps.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of spiritual purification and the role of God's blessings in achieving it, emphasizing that true strength and firmness come from God's guidance and protection.
orig: إذ يغشيكم النعاس أمنة منه وينزل عليكم من السماء ماء ليطهركم به ويذهب عنكم رجز الشيطان وليربط على قلوبكم ويثبت به الأقدام

translation: When your Lord revealed to the angels, 'I am with you, so make firm those who believe. I will cast terror into the hearts of those who disbelieve, so strike above the necks and strike from them every fingertip.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of faith and conviction in the face of adversity, as God's support and protection are reserved for those who remain steadfast in their belief, while those who reject faith will be filled with fear and uncertainty.
orig: إذ يوحي ربك إلى الملائكة أني معكم فثبتوا الذين آمنوا سألقي في قلوب الذين كفروا الرعب فاضربوا فوق الأعناق واضربوا منهم كل بنان

translation: That is because they defied Allah and His Messenger. And whoever defies Allah and His Messenger, then indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of defying Allah and His Messenger, implying that such an act is a serious offense that will incur severe punishment from Allah.
orig: ذلك بأنهم شاقوا الله ورسوله ومن يشاقق الله ورسوله فإن الله شديد العقاب

translation: That is so; but let them taste it, and for the unbelievers is the punishment of the Fire.
interpretation: The verse suggests that the punishment of hellfire is a direct consequence of one's actions, and that those who reject faith will inevitably face the wrath of God, emphasizing the idea that the punishment is a natural consequence of their disbelief.
orig: ذلكم فذوقوه وأن للكافرين عذاب النار

translation: O you who have believed, when you meet those who disbelieve [in battle] in a battlefield, do not turn your backs to them.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of courage and perseverance in the face of adversity, urging believers to stand firm and not flee from battle, as it is a test of their faith and a means of distinguishing the true believers from the hypocrites.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إذا لقيتم الذين كفروا زحفا فلا تولوهم الأدبار

translation: And whoever turns his back to them on that day, except one who is retreating to a group or turning aside to a group, has indeed incurred wrath from Allah, and his refuge is Hell, and wretched is the destination.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of standing firm and not fleeing from the battlefield, emphasizing that those who do so without a valid reason will incur God's wrath and will ultimately end up in Hell.
orig: ومن يولهم يومئذ دبره إلا متحرفا لقتال أو متحيزا إلى فئة فقد باء بغضب من الله ومأواه جهنم وبئس المصير

translation: You did not kill them, but it was Allah who killed them. And you did not throw when you threw, but it was Allah who threw, that He might test the believers with a good test. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of Tawhid, or the oneness of God, by emphasizing that all actions, including those that seem to be performed by humans, are ultimately under the control and will of Allah, and that human beings are merely instruments of Allah's power.
orig: فلم تقتلوهم ولكن الله قتلهم وما رميت إذ رميت ولكن الله رمى وليبلي المؤمنين منه بلاء حسنا إن الله سميع عليم

translation: That is so, and Allah will weaken the plot of the disbelievers.
interpretation: The verse suggests that God is always in control and that He will ultimately undermine the plans and strategies of those who reject faith, implying that their efforts will be futile and that God's will will prevail.
orig: ذلكم وأن الله موهن كيد الكافرين

translation: If you asked for a judgment, the judgment has come to you; and if you desist, it will be better for you; and if you turn back, We will return, and your group will not avail you at all, even if they are many; and Allah is with the believers.
interpretation: The verse conveys a sense of urgency and warning to those who are opposing the Prophet and the believers, implying that they are running out of time and opportunities to repent and change their ways, and that God's support is with those who believe.
orig: إن تستفتحوا فقد جاءكم الفتح وإن تنتهوا فهو خير لكم وإن تعودوا نعد ولن تغني عنكم فئتكم شيئا ولو كثرت وأن الله مع المؤمنين

translation: O you who have believed, obey Allah and His Messenger and do not turn away from him while you are listening.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of obedience to God and His Messenger, highlighting the significance of being attentive and responsive to divine guidance, and warning against turning away from it, even when one is aware of it.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا أطيعوا الله ورسوله ولا تولوا عنه وأنتم تسمعون

translation: And be not like those who said, 'We have heard,' but they do not hear.
interpretation: The verse is warning believers against being hypocrites who pretend to have faith but do not truly listen to or understand the message of God, and instead are driven by their own desires and whims.
orig: ولا تكونوا كالذين قالوا سمعنا وهم لا يسمعون

translation: Indeed, the worst of beasts in the sight of Allah are the deaf, the dumb, those who do not use their intellect.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of spiritual ignorance, implying that those who neglect to use their God-given faculties of perception and understanding are likened to beasts, stripped of their human dignity and moral agency.
orig: إن شر الدواب عند الله الصم البكم الذين لا يعقلون

translation: And if Allah knew any good in them, He would have made them hear, and if He had made them hear, they would have turned away, being obstinate.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of trying to guide those who are obstinate and unwilling to listen to the truth, as they would only turn away even if they were made to hear and understand.
orig: ولو علم الله فيهم خيرا لأسمعهم ولو أسمعهم لتولوا وهم معرضون

translation: O you who have believed, respond to Allah and the Messenger when he calls you to that which gives you life. And know that Allah comes between a man and his heart, and that to Him you will be gathered.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of obeying Allah and His Messenger, and that this obedience is what gives true life to believers, as it brings them closer to Allah and helps them to distinguish right from wrong, ultimately leading to their spiritual growth and salvation.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا استجيبوا لله وللرسول إذا دعاكم لما يحييكم واعلموا أن الله يحول بين المرء وقلبه وأنه إليه تحشرون

translation: Fear a trial that will not only affect the unjust among you, and know that Allah is severe in punishment.
interpretation: The verse is a warning to believers to be cautious of a trial or test that will affect not only the unjust but also the believers, and to remember that God's punishment is severe and will not discriminate between the righteous and the wicked.
orig: واتقوا فتنة لا تصيبن الذين ظلموا منكم خاصة واعلموا أن الله شديد العقاب

translation: And remember when you were few and oppressed in the land, fearing that people might kidnap you, He sheltered you, supported you with His victory, and provided you with good things that you might be grateful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of gratitude by reminding the believers of their humble and vulnerable past, and how God's intervention and blessings transformed their situation, implying that they should always be thankful for God's favors.
orig: واذكروا إذ أنتم قليل مستضعفون في الأرض تخافون أن يتخطفكم الناس فآواكم وأيدكم بنصره ورزقكم من الطيبات لعلكم تشكرون

translation: O you who have believed, do not betray Allah and the Messenger and betray your trusts while you know.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of trustworthiness and faithfulness, warning believers against betraying the trust placed in them, and highlights the seriousness of breaking trust, especially when it involves Allah and His Messenger.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تخونوا الله والرسول وتخونوا أماناتكم وأنتم تعلمون

translation: And know that your properties and your children are but a trial, and that with Allah is a great reward.
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that the blessings and possessions we have in life, including our families and wealth, can sometimes distract us from our spiritual growth and devotion to God, and that true reward and fulfillment come from our relationship with Him.
orig: واعلموا أنما أموالكم وأولادكم فتنة وأن الله عنده أجر عظيم

translation: O you who have believed, if you fear Allah, He will grant you a criterion and will remove from you your evil deeds and will forgive you. And Allah is the possessor of great bounty.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of having a strong fear of God, as it leads to spiritual growth and purification, and ultimately, God's forgiveness and mercy.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إن تتقوا الله يجعل لكم فرقانا ويكفر عنكم سيئاتكم ويغفر لكم والله ذو الفضل العظيم

translation: And [remember] when those who disbelieved plotted against you to restrain you or kill you or expel you, and they plotted, and Allah plotted, and Allah is the best of plotters.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of human plans and schemes against the will of God, emphasizing that God's plan is always superior and will ultimately prevail, regardless of the efforts of those who oppose Him.
orig: وإذ يمكر بك الذين كفروا ليثبتوك أو يقتلوك أو يخرجوك ويمكرون ويمكر الله والله خير الماكرين

translation: And when Our verses are recited to them, they say: 'We have heard. If we wished, we could say the like of this. This is nothing but the tales of the ancients.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and stubbornness of those who reject the message of God, as they claim that they could easily produce something similar to the Quran, implying that it is nothing but a collection of old stories and myths, rather than a divine revelation.
orig: وإذا تتلى عليهم آياتنا قالوا قد سمعنا لو نشاء لقلنا مثل هذا إن هذا إلا أساطير الأولين

translation: And when they said: 'O Allah, if this is indeed the truth from You, then rain down on us stones from the sky or bring us a painful punishment.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and defiance of those who reject the truth, as they dare to challenge God to punish them immediately, not realizing that their request may be granted, and they may face a severe punishment that they cannot bear.
orig: وإذ قالوا اللهم إن كان هذا هو الحق من عندك فأمطر علينا حجارة من السماء أو ائتنا بعذاب أليم

translation: And Allah would not punish them while you were among them, and Allah would not punish them as they were seeking forgiveness.
interpretation: This verse highlights the mercy and compassion of Allah, who withholds punishment from those who are seeking forgiveness, emphasizing the importance of repentance and the possibility of redemption.
orig: وما كان الله ليعذبهم وأنت فيهم وما كان الله معذبهم وهم يستغفرون

translation: And why should it be that they should not be punished by Allah when they hinder men from the Sacred Mosque, and they are not its guardians? None should be guardians thereof except the pious, but most of them know not.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of protecting and respecting sacred places, and that only those who are pious and righteous are worthy of being their guardians, implying that those who hinder others from accessing these places are not fit to be their caretakers.
orig: وما لهم ألا يعذبهم الله وهم يصدون عن المسجد الحرام وما كانوا أولياءه إن أولياؤه إلا المتقون ولكن أكثرهم لا يعلمون

translation: And their prayer at the House was only whistling and clapping of hands; so taste the punishment for what you used to disbelieve.
interpretation: The verse highlights the superficiality of the idolaters' worship, which was characterized by meaningless rituals and lack of sincerity, and serves as a warning that their disbelief will ultimately lead to their downfall.
orig: وما كان صلاتهم عند البيت إلا مكاء وتصدية فذوقوا العذاب بما كنتم تكفرون

translation: Those who disbelieve spend their wealth to hinder (men) from the path of Allah, so they will spend it; then it will be for them a regret. Then they will be overcome. And those who disbelieve will be gathered to Hell.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of those who spend their wealth to hinder people from following the path of God, as their efforts will ultimately lead to their own downfall and regret, and they will be punished in Hell.
orig: إن الذين كفروا ينفقون أموالهم ليصدوا عن سبيل الله فسينفقونها ثم تكون عليهم حسرة ثم يغلبون والذين كفروا إلى جهنم يحشرون

translation: He separates the bad from the good, and He piles the bad on top of each other, and He throws them all into Hell. Those are the losers.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's justice and wisdom in separating the wicked from the righteous, and how the wicked are ultimately punished in Hell, emphasizing that their fate is a direct consequence of their own actions.
orig: ليميز الله الخبيث من الطيب ويجعل الخبيث بعضه على بعض فيركمه جميعا فيجعله في جهنم أولئك هم الخاسرون

translation: Say to those who disbelieve: If they cease, what has passed will be forgiven them, and if they return, the examples of the ancients have passed away.
interpretation: This verse highlights the mercy of God, offering forgiveness to those who abandon their disbelief and wrongdoing, emphasizing that God's forgiveness is always available to those who repent and change their ways.
orig: قل للذين كفروا إن ينتهوا يغفر لهم ما قد سلف وإن يعودوا فقد مضت سنت الأولين

translation: And fight them until there is no more tumult or oppression, and there prevail justice and faith in Allah altogether. If they cease, let there be no hostility except to those who practice oppression. Verily, Allah is All-Seer of what they do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of striving to establish a just and peaceful society where the worship of God is unobstructed, and oppression is eliminated, and it is only when this goal is achieved that hostility can cease, and God's justice and wisdom prevail.
orig: وقاتلوهم حتى لا تكون فتنة ويكون الدين كله لله فإن انتهوا فإن الله بما يعملون بصير

translation: And if they turn away, then know that Allah is your Protector, an excellent Protector and an excellent Helper.
interpretation: The verse is a message of comfort and reassurance to the believers, reminding them that if they are rejected or opposed by others, they should not be discouraged, for they have Allah as their Protector and Helper, who is the best of all protectors and helpers.
orig: وإن تولوا فاعلموا أن الله مولاكم نعم المولى ونعم النصير

translation: And know that whatever spoils you may gain, a fifth of it is assigned to Allah, and to the Messenger, and to the near relatives, and the orphans, and the needy, and the wayfarer, if you believe in Allah and what We revealed to Our servant on the day of distinction, the day the two armies met. And Allah has power over all things.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of recognizing the divine right of Allah and the Prophet in the spoils of war, and the responsibility of believers to distribute the spoils in a just and equitable manner, highlighting the principles of social justice and welfare that are central to the Islamic system.
orig: واعلموا أنما غنمتم من شيء فأن لله خمسه وللرسول ولذي القربى واليتامى والمساكين وابن السبيل إن كنتم آمنتم بالله وما أنزلنا على عبدنا يوم الفرقان يوم التقى الجمعان والله على كل شيء قدير

translation: When you were on the near side of the valley, and they were on the farther side, and the caravan was below you. If you had made a mutual appointment, you would have disagreed on the time, but Allah was to bring about what was decreed, that he who was to perish might perish with clear proof, and he who was to live might live with clear proof. And indeed, Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's omnipotence and omniscience, as He is the one who brings about what is decreed, and His judgment is always just and based on clear evidence, leaving no room for doubt or ambiguity.
orig: إذ أنتم بالعدوة الدنيا وهم بالعدوة القصوى والركب أسفل منكم ولو تواعدتم لاختلفتم في الميعاد ولكن ليقضي الله أمرا كان مفعولا ليهلك من هلك عن بينة ويحيى من حي عن بينة وإن الله لسميع عليم

translation: When Allah showed them to you in your dream as few, and if He had shown them to you as many, you would have lost courage and would have disagreed about the matter, but Allah saved you; He is All-Knower of what is in the breasts.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of trust in God's plan, as He knows what is in people's hearts and knows how to guide them to success, even if it means showing them a reduced number of enemies in a dream, in order to boost their confidence and avoid disagreements.
orig: إذ يريكهم الله في منامك قليلا ولو أراكهم كثيرا لفشلتم ولتنازعتم في الأمر ولكن الله سلم إنه عليم بذات الصدور

translation: And when He shows them to you, when you met, as few in your eyes, and He made you few in their eyes, so that Allah may accomplish a matter already ordained, and to Allah return all matters.
interpretation: The verse suggests that the perception of strength and numbers can be deceptive, and that God's plans and decisions are not influenced by human perceptions, but rather are based on a higher divine wisdom.
orig: وإذ يريكموهم إذ التقيتم في أعينكم قليلا ويقللكم في أعينهم ليقضي الله أمرا كان مفعولا وإلى الله ترجع الأمور

translation: O you who have believed, when you meet [an enemy] force, stand firm and remember Allah much, that you may succeed.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of spiritual preparedness and remembrance of God in times of adversity, suggesting that true strength and success come not from military might, but from a strong faith and connection with the divine.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إذا لقيتم فئة فاثبتوا واذكروا الله كثيرا لعلكم تفلحون

translation: And obey Allah and His Messenger, and do not dispute lest you lose courage and your strength departs, and be patient, indeed Allah is with the patient ones.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of obedience to Allah and His Messenger, and warns against disputes and disagreements that can lead to loss of courage and strength, and instead encourages patience, which is a key virtue in the Islamic faith, as it is a means of earning Allah's support and companionship.
orig: وأطيعوا الله ورسوله ولا تنازعوا فتفشلوا وتذهب ريحكم واصبروا إن الله مع الصابرين

translation: And do not be like those who came out of their homes boastfully and to be seen of men and hinder from the path of Allah, and Allah is encompassing of what they do.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of sincerity in one's actions, warning against performing good deeds merely to show off or gain admiration from others, for such actions are ultimately futile and may even hinder one's spiritual growth and hinder others from following the right path.
orig: ولا تكونوا كالذين خرجوا من ديارهم بطرا ورئاء الناس ويصدون عن سبيل الله والله بما يعملون محيط

translation: And when Satan made their deeds seem fair to them and said, 'No one can overcome you today from among the people, and I am your neighbor.' But when the two forces saw each other, he turned back on his heels and said, 'I am clear of you, I see what you do not see, I fear Allah, and Allah is severe in punishment.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the deceitful nature of Satan, who initially encourages people to engage in sinful behavior but abandons them when they need his support, revealing his true cowardly nature and fear of God's punishment.
orig: وإذ زين لهم الشيطان أعمالهم وقال لا غالب لكم اليوم من الناس وإني جار لكم فلما تراءت الفئتان نكص على عقبيه وقال إني بريء منكم إني أرى ما لا ترون إني أخاف الله والله شديد العقاب

translation: When the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is a disease say: 'Their religion has deceived them', but whoever puts his trust in Allah, then Allah is All-Mighty, All-Wise.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of relying on one's own strength or material power, and instead emphasizes the importance of putting one's trust in God, who is all-powerful and all-wise, and is the only one who can provide true security and guidance.
orig: إذ يقول المنافقون والذين في قلوبهم مرض غر هؤلاء دينهم ومن يتوكل على الله فإن الله عزيز حكيم

translation: And if you could see when those who disbelieved are seized by the angels, they strike their faces and their backs, and taste the punishment of the Blaze.
interpretation: The verse highlights the intense suffering and humiliation that awaits those who reject faith, as they are seized by angels and subjected to physical and emotional torment, foreshadowing the eternal punishment that awaits them in the afterlife.
orig: ولو ترى إذ يتوفى الذين كفروا الملائكة يضربون وجوههم وأدبارهم وذوقوا عذاب الحريق

translation: That is because of what your hands have sent forth, and that Allah is not unjust to the servants.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of personal responsibility, emphasizing that the consequences of one's actions are a direct result of their own deeds, and that God does not wrong or oppress His servants, implying that they have the power to change their circumstances through their choices and actions.
orig: ذلك بما قدمت أيديكم وأن الله ليس بظلام للعبيد

translation: Like the people of Pharaoh and those before them, they denied the signs of Allah, so Allah seized them for their sins. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and severe in punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of rejecting divine guidance, emphasizing that those who deny God's signs will inevitably face His wrath, which will be severe and inescapable.
orig: كدأب آل فرعون والذين من قبلهم كفروا بآيات الله فأخذهم الله بذنوبهم إن الله قوي شديد العقاب

translation: That is because Allah will not change a favor which He has bestowed upon a people until they change what is in themselves, and Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the idea that God's blessings and favors are conditional upon the people's behavior and actions, and that if the people do not change their ways and rectify their mistakes, God will withdraw His blessings and favors from them.
orig: ذلك بأن الله لم يك مغيرا نعمة أنعمها على قوم حتى يغيروا ما بأنفسهم وأن الله سميع عليم

translation: As did the people of Pharaoh and those before them, they denied the signs of their Lord, so We destroyed them for their sins, and We drowned the people of Pharaoh, and all of them were wrongdoers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of rejecting divine guidance and warnings, leading to destruction and punishment, emphasizing that those who persist in their wrongdoing will ultimately face the wrath of God.
orig: كدأب آل فرعون والذين من قبلهم كذبوا بآيات ربهم فأهلكناهم بذنوبهم وأغرقنا آل فرعون وكل كانوا ظالمين

translation: Indeed, the worst of beasts in the sight of Allah are those who disbelieve, and they will not believe.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of disbelief, implying that those who reject faith are not only cut off from divine guidance but are also morally degraded, becoming like beasts in their behavior and character.
orig: إن شر الدواب عند الله الذين كفروا فهم لا يؤمنون

translation: Those with whom you made a treaty, but they break their covenant every time, and they do not fear.
interpretation: This verse highlights the untrustworthiness of those who consistently break their agreements and do not have a sense of accountability or fear of God, implying that they are driven by self-interest rather than a sense of moral obligation.
orig: الذين عاهدت منهم ثم ينقضون عهدهم في كل مرة وهم لا يتقون

translation: So if you, O Muhammad, punish them in war, punish them with severity, and if you take them as captives, then either free them with favor or ransom, until the war lays down its burdens, and you have punished them severely, then you have scattered them, scattering them behind them, that they may remember.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of firmness and severity in dealing with enemies in war, as a means of deterring them and preventing future aggression, and ultimately leading them to reflect and remember the consequences of their actions.
orig: فإما تثقفنهم في الحرب فشرد بهم من خلفهم لعلهم يذكرون

translation: And if you fear from a people betrayal, throw back to them on equal terms. Indeed, Allah does not like the treacherous.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of fairness and reciprocity in dealing with others, even if it means responding to their betrayal with similar measures, as a means of self-defense and maintaining dignity, rather than allowing oneself to be taken advantage of.
orig: وإما تخافن من قوم خيانة فانبذ إليهم على سواء إن الله لا يحب الخائنين

translation: And let not those who disbelieve think that they have escaped; indeed, they will not be able to frustrate (God's plan).
interpretation: The verse is a warning to the disbelievers that they may think they have outsmarted God, but ultimately they will not be able to escape His plan and will be held accountable for their actions.
orig: ولا يحسبن الذين كفروا سبقوا إنهم لا يعجزون

translation: And prepare against them whatever you are able of [military] power and of war-horses, tying knots. You frighten thereby the enemy of Allah and your enemy, and others besides them, whom you do not know [but] Allah knows. And whatever you spend in the cause of Allah will be fully repaid to you, and you will not be wronged.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of being prepared to defend one's faith and community, and that such preparation is a form of worship and devotion to God, as it is done for His sake and to uphold His cause.
orig: وأعدوا لهم ما استطعتم من قوة ومن رباط الخيل ترهبون به عدو الله وعدوكم وآخرين من دونهم لا تعلمونهم الله يعلمهم وما تنفقوا من شيء في سبيل الله يوف إليكم وأنتم لا تظلمون

translation: And if they incline to peace, then incline to it and put your trust in Allah, indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of being open to peaceful resolutions and trusting in God's wisdom and knowledge, even in the face of conflict or adversity.
orig: وإن جنحوا للسلم فاجنح لها وتوكل على الله إنه هو السميع العليم

translation: And if they intend to deceive you, then sufficient for you is Allah, He who supported you with His victory and with the believers.
interpretation: This verse conveys the idea that when faced with deceit or betrayal, a believer can find solace and strength in the knowledge that Allah is their ultimate protector and supporter, and that His help and the support of fellow believers are sufficient to overcome any challenge.
orig: وإن يريدوا أن يخدعوك فإن حسبك الله هو الذي أيدك بنصره وبالمؤمنين

translation: And if you had spent all that is in the earth, you could not have united their hearts, but Allah has united them. Indeed, He is Exalted in Might, Wise.
interpretation: The verse highlights the power of God in bringing people together, emphasizing that even the most extravagant material efforts cannot replace the divine ability to unite hearts and create harmony among people.
orig: وألف بين قلوبهم لو أنفقت ما في الأرض جميعا ما ألفت بين قلوبهم ولكن الله ألف بينهم إنه عزيز حكيم

translation: O Prophet, Allah is sufficient for you and for whoever follows you among the believers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of trusting in God's power and support, and that He is sufficient for the Prophet and his followers, implying that they should not fear or rely on anyone else.
orig: يا أيها النبي حسبك الله ومن اتبعك من المؤمنين

translation: O Prophet, urge the believers to fight. If there are twenty steadfast persons amongst you, they will overcome two hundred, and if there are a hundred, they will overcome a thousand of those who disbelieve, for they are a people who do not understand.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of perseverance and faith in the face of overwhelming odds, emphasizing that a small group of dedicated believers can overcome a much larger force of disbelievers, as long as they remain steadfast and trusting in God.
orig: يا أيها النبي حرض المؤمنين على القتال إن يكن منكم عشرون صابرون يغلبوا مائتين وإن يكن منكم مائة يغلبوا ألفا من الذين كفروا بأنهم قوم لا يفقهون

translation: Now, Allah has lightened [your burden], and He knows that there is weakness in you. So if there are of you a hundred [who are] steadfast, they will overcome two hundred, and if there are of you a thousand, they will overcome two thousand, by permission of Allah. And Allah is with the steadfast.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of perseverance and steadfastness in the face of adversity, emphasizing that even a small group of believers who remain steadfast can overcome a much larger force, as long as they have the permission and support of Allah.
orig: الآن خفف الله عنكم وعلم أن فيكم ضعفا فإن يكن منكم مائة صابرة يغلبوا مائتين وإن يكن منكم ألف يغلبوا ألفين بإذن الله والله مع الصابرين

translation: It is not for a Prophet that he should have prisoners of war until he has thoroughly subdued the land. You desire the fleeting gains of this world, but Allah desires the Hereafter. And Allah is Exalted in Power, Wise.
interpretation: The verse highlights the contrast between the short-term goals of humans, who prioritize worldly gains, and the long-term goals of God, who prioritizes the Hereafter, emphasizing the need to focus on eternal rewards rather than temporary benefits.
orig: ما كان لنبي أن يكون له أسرى حتى يثخن في الأرض تريدون عرض الدنيا والله يريد الآخرة والله عزيز حكيم

translation: If it were not for a Book from Allah that had come before, you would have certainly been touched by a great punishment for what you took.
interpretation: This verse highlights the mercy of God in sending revelations to guide humanity, for without divine guidance, people would have been subject to severe punishment for their misdeeds, emphasizing the significance of God's guidance in preventing chaos and destruction.
orig: لولا كتاب من الله سبق لمسكم فيما أخذتم عذاب عظيم

translation: So eat of what you have gained, lawful and good, and be conscious of Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of gratitude and mindfulness, encouraging believers to acknowledge and appreciate the blessings they have received, and to use them in a way that is pleasing to Allah, in order to maintain a strong spiritual connection with Him.
orig: فكلوا مما غنمتم حلالا طيبا واتقوا الله إن الله غفور رحيم

translation: O Prophet, say to those captives who are in your hands: If God knows any good in your hearts, He will give you better than what has been taken from you and will forgive you, and God is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse speaks to the importance of mercy and forgiveness, even in times of conflict and war, and highlights God's ability to see into the hearts of individuals and reward good intentions.
orig: يا أيها النبي قل لمن في أيديكم من الأسرى إن يعلم الله في قلوبكم خيرا يؤتكم خيرا مما أخذ منكم ويغفر لكم والله غفور رحيم

translation: And if they intend to deceive you, then indeed they deceived Allah before, so He gave you power over them. And Allah is Knowing, Wise.
interpretation: The verse suggests that if someone tries to deceive or betray you, it is actually a sign of their own deceitfulness and lack of faith, as they have already deceived Allah, and therefore Allah will give you the upper hand over them.
orig: وإن يريدوا خيانتك فقد خانوا الله من قبل فأمكن منهم والله عليم حكيم

translation: Indeed, those who have believed and emigrated and striven with their wealth and their lives in the cause of Allah, and those who gave them shelter and aided them - those are allies of one another. And as for those who believed but did not emigrate, you owe them no duty of protection until they emigrate. And if they seek help from you in the matter of religion, it is your duty to assist them, except against a people with whom you have a treaty. And Allah is Seeing of what you do.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of mutual support and solidarity among believers, emphasizing that those who have emigrated and struggled in the cause of Allah, as well as those who have provided them with shelter and aid, are allies of one another, and that believers have a duty to assist one another in times of need.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا وهاجروا وجاهدوا بأموالهم وأنفسهم في سبيل الله والذين آووا ونصروا أولئك بعضهم أولياء بعض والذين آمنوا ولم يهاجروا ما لكم من ولايتهم من شيء حتى يهاجروا وإن استنصروكم في الدين فعليكم النصر إلا على قوم بينكم وبينهم ميثاق والله بما تعملون بصير

translation: And those who disbelieve are allies of one another, unless you do it, there would be turmoil on earth and great corruption.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of unity and cooperation among believers, implying that if they do not stand together, the disbelievers will unite and spread chaos and corruption on earth.
orig: والذين كفروا بعضهم أولياء بعض إلا تفعلوه تكن فتنة في الأرض وفساد كبير

translation: And those who believe and emigrate and strive in the way of Allah, and those who give them shelter and support, those are the believers in truth. For them is forgiveness and a noble provision.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of not only believing in God, but also taking action to support the cause of faith, such as emigrating, striving, and providing shelter and support to those who are fighting for the same cause, emphasizing that only those who take such actions are true believers and will be rewarded with forgiveness and a noble provision.
orig: والذين آمنوا وهاجروا وجاهدوا في سبيل الله والذين آووا ونصروا أولئك هم المؤمنون حقا لهم مغفرة ورزق كريم

translation: And those who believed afterwards and migrated and strove hard along with you, they are of you; and those who are tied by blood relationships are nearer to each other in the ordinance of Allah; Allah is All-Knowing of everything.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of spiritual bonds over blood ties, emphasizing that the bonds of faith are stronger than those of kinship, and that those who share a common faith and strive together are closer to one another than those related by blood.
orig: والذين آمنوا من بعد وهاجروا وجاهدوا معكم فأولئك منكم وأولو الأرحام بعضهم أولى ببعض في كتاب الله إن الله بكل شيء عليم

translation: A declaration of immunity from Allah and His Messenger to those of the polytheists with whom you had made a treaty.
interpretation: The verse signifies the severance of all ties and agreements with the polytheists, marking a decisive turning point in the relationship between Muslims and non-believers, and emphasizing the irreconcilability of Islam with idolatry.
orig: براءة من الله ورسوله إلى الذين عاهدتم من المشركين

translation: So travel freely in the land for four months, and know that you cannot frustrate Allah, and that Allah will humiliate the disbelievers.
interpretation: The verse is emphasizing the futility of trying to escape or defy God's decree, as even if one tries to flee or resist, God's will will ultimately prevail, and those who reject faith will ultimately be humiliated.
orig: فسيحوا في الأرض أربعة أشهر واعلموا أنكم غير معجزي الله وأن الله مخزي الكافرين

translation: And a proclamation from Allah and His Messenger to the people on the greater pilgrimage that Allah and His Messenger are free from obligation to the polytheists. And if you repent, it is better for you, but if you turn away, then know that you will not escape Allah. And give good tidings to those who disbelieve of a painful punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of breaking free from the influence of polytheists and those who reject the truth, emphasizing that one's salvation lies in repenting and turning to Allah, and that those who refuse to do so will face a severe punishment.
orig: وأذان من الله ورسوله إلى الناس يوم الحج الأكبر أن الله بريء من المشركين ورسوله فإن تبتم فهو خير لكم وإن توليتم فاعلموا أنكم غير معجزي الله وبشر الذين كفروا بعذاب أليم

translation: Except those of the polytheists with whom you have made a treaty, then they did not fail you in anything, nor did they support anyone against you. So fulfill your treaty with them to the end of their term. Indeed, Allah loves the righteous.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of honoring agreements and treaties with non-Muslims, as long as they uphold their end of the bargain, and highlights the value of being true to one's word as a key characteristic of righteousness.
orig: إلا الذين عاهدتم من المشركين ثم لم ينقصوكم شيئا ولم يظاهروا عليكم أحدا فأتموا إليهم عهدهم إلى مدتهم إن الله يحب المتقين

translation: Then when the sacred months have passed, slay the idolaters wherever you find them, and take them, and besiege them, and lie in wait for them at every ambush. But if they repent and establish prayer and give zakah, then leave their way free. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of forgiveness and mercy, highlighting that even in the midst of conflict, Allah's ultimate goal is to guide humanity towards repentance and righteousness, rather than mere punishment or destruction.
orig: فإذا انسلخ الأشهر الحرم فاقتلوا المشركين حيث وجدتموهم وخذوهم واحصروهم واقعدوا لهم كل مرصد فإن تابوا وأقاموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة فخلوا سبيلهم إن الله غفور رحيم

translation: And if any of the polytheists seek your protection, grant him protection so that he may hear the words of Allah, then escort him to a place of safety. That is because they are a people who do not know.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of giving people the opportunity to learn about Islam and its teachings, even if they are initially hostile, as they may not have had the chance to understand the true nature of the religion.
orig: وإن أحد من المشركين استجارك فأجره حتى يسمع كلام الله ثم أبلغه مأمنه ذلك بأنهم قوم لا يعلمون

translation: How can there be a covenant with the polytheists for Allah and His Messenger, except for those with whom you made a treaty at al-Masjid al-Haram? So as long as they are upright with you, be upright with them. Indeed, Allah loves the righteous.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of honoring agreements and treaties with others, even if they are polytheists, as long as they are faithful to their commitments, and emphasizes that being upright and faithful is a key characteristic of the righteous.
orig: كيف يكون للمشركين عهد عند الله وعند رسوله إلا الذين عاهدتم عند المسجد الحرام فما استقاموا لكم فاستقيموا لهم إن الله يحب المتقين

translation: And how they will appear to be friendly to you, but they do not observe any covenant with you, nor do they restrain themselves in their talk, and they are pleased with what you dislike, and their hearts deny, and most of them are defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who pretend to be friendly and loyal, but in reality, they have no intention of keeping their promises or respecting any agreements, and their words are empty and insincere, revealing their true nature of disobedience and rebellion.
orig: كيف وإن يظهروا عليكم لا يرقبوا فيكم إلا ولا ذمة يرضونكم بأفواههم وتأبى قلوبهم وأكثرهم فاسقون

translation: They have purchased with the Signs of Allah a little gain, so they hinder (men) from His Path. Verily, evil is that which they used to do.
interpretation: The verse highlights the selfish and short-sighted nature of those who prioritize worldly gains over spiritual guidance, and in doing so, they hinder others from following the path of righteousness, ultimately leading to their own downfall.
orig: اشتروا بآيات الله ثمنا قليلا فصدوا عن سبيله إنهم ساء ما كانوا يعملون

translation: They do not respect the believers in their oaths, and there is no blame on those who take revenge.
interpretation: The verse highlights the treachery of those who do not honor their commitments and oaths, and how it is justified for the believers to take revenge against such people who have broken their trust.
orig: لا يرقبون في مؤمن إلا ولا ذمة وأولئك هم المعتدون

translation: But if they repent and establish prayer and give zakah, then they are your brothers in religion; and We explain the verses for a people who know.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of spiritual transformation and the adoption of righteous deeds as a prerequisite for spiritual brotherhood, emphasizing that true brotherhood is not based on blood ties or social relationships, but rather on shared values and commitment to the principles of faith.
orig: فإن تابوا وأقاموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة فإخوانكم في الدين ونفصل الآيات لقوم يعلمون

translation: And if they break their oaths after their agreement and revile your religion, then fight the leaders of disbelief - there is no oath for them - that they may desist.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the importance of taking a strong stance against those who break their agreements and mock the religion, as they cannot be trusted and their actions must be met with firm resistance in order to protect the faith and its followers.
orig: وإن نكثوا أيمانهم من بعد عهدهم وطعنوا في دينكم فقاتلوا أئمة الكفر إنهم لا أيمان لهم لعلهم ينتهون

translation: Do you not fight a people who broke their oaths and intended to expel the Messenger, and they began with you the first time? Do you fear them? Allah has more right that you should fear Him, if you are believers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of prioritizing one's fear and obedience to God over fear of worldly enemies, emphasizing that true believers should fear God more than they fear their human adversaries.
orig: ألا تقاتلون قوما نكثوا أيمانهم وهموا بإخراج الرسول وهم بدءوكم أول مرة أتخشونهم فالله أحق أن تخشوه إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: Fight them, Allah will punish them by your hands, and bring them to disgrace, and give you victory over them, and heal the breasts of a believing people.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of taking a stand against evil and injustice, and that God will ultimately give victory to those who fight for the truth, bringing comfort and healing to the believers.
orig: قاتلوهم يعذبهم الله بأيديكم ويخزهم وينصركم عليهم ويشف صدور قوم مؤمنين

translation: And He will remove the rage from their hearts, and Allah will accept the repentance of whom He wills, and Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's mercy and willingness to forgive, emphasizing that true forgiveness can only come from Him, and that He alone has the power to heal the hearts of those who have sinned.
orig: ويذهب غيظ قلوبهم ويتوب الله على من يشاء والله عليم حكيم

translation: Or do you think that you will be left [as you are] while Allah has not yet made evident those among you who strive [for the cause of Allah] and have not taken besides Allah, His Messenger, and the believers [any] allies? And Allah is [fully] Aware of what you do.
