interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of sincerity and loyalty to Allah, His Messenger, and the believers, implying that true faith requires a complete detachment from worldly alliances and a total submission to the divine will.
orig: أم حسبتم أن تتركوا ولما يعلم الله الذين جاهدوا منكم ولم يتخذوا من دون الله ولا رسوله ولا المؤمنين وليجة والله خبير بما تعملون

translation: It is not for the polytheists to maintain the mosques of Allah, witnessing against themselves with disbelief. Those - their deeds have been nullified, and in the Fire they will abide forever.
interpretation: This verse highlights the hypocrisy of polytheists who try to associate themselves with the sacred rituals of Islam, while in reality, they are disbelievers, and their actions are ultimately futile and deserving of eternal punishment.
orig: ما كان للمشركين أن يعمروا مساجد الله شاهدين على أنفسهم بالكفر أولئك حبطت أعمالهم وفي النار هم خالدون

translation: The mosques of Allah are only to be maintained by those who believe in Allah and the Last Day, and establish the prayer, and give the zakah, and fear none but Allah. Perhaps these may be among the guided ones.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of sincerity and purity of intention in one's worship, implying that only those who are truly devoted to Allah and free from worldly attachments are worthy of maintaining His sacred spaces.
orig: إنما يعمر مساجد الله من آمن بالله واليوم الآخر وأقام الصلاة وآتى الزكاة ولم يخش إلا الله فعسى أولئك أن يكونوا من المهتدين

translation: Have you made the providing of water for the pilgrim and the maintenance of Al-Masjid al-Haram equal to the one who believed in Allah and the Last Day and strove hard in the way of Allah? They are not equal in the sight of Allah. And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of intentions and sincerity in one's actions, as it distinguishes between those who perform good deeds for show and those who do so out of genuine faith and devotion, emphasizing that only the latter will be rewarded by God.
orig: أجعلتم سقاية الحاج وعمارة المسجد الحرام كمن آمن بالله واليوم الآخر وجاهد في سبيل الله لا يستوون عند الله والله لا يهدي القوم الظالمين

translation: Those who believe, and have emigrated, and have struggled in the way of Allah with their wealth and their lives, are of a higher degree in the sight of Allah, and those are the successful ones.
interpretation: The verse highlights the superiority of those who not only believe in God, but also take action by emigrating from a place of oppression and struggling in the path of God, sacrificing their wealth and lives, for they are the ones who will ultimately achieve true success and salvation.
orig: الذين آمنوا وهاجروا وجاهدوا في سبيل الله بأموالهم وأنفسهم أعظم درجة عند الله وأولئك هم الفائزون

translation: Their Lord gives them good tidings of a mercy from Him and His pleasure, and for them are Gardens with everlasting delight.
interpretation: This verse conveys the idea that the believers will be rewarded with God's mercy and pleasure in the afterlife, and that they will experience eternal bliss and happiness in the Gardens of Paradise.
orig: يبشرهم ربهم برحمة منه ورضوان وجنات لهم فيها نعيم مقيم

translation: They will abide therein forever; indeed, with Allah is a great reward.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of eternal bliss and reward in the afterlife, emphasizing that those who are righteous will be granted an eternal and immense reward from God, free from any suffering or hardship.
orig: خالدين فيها أبدا إن الله عنده أجر عظيم

translation: O you who have believed, do not take your fathers or your brothers as allies if they have preferred disbelief over belief. And whoever does so from among you - then those are the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of prioritizing one's faith over familial ties, emphasizing that loyalty to God and His Messenger takes precedence over loyalty to family members who may be opposed to the faith.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تتخذوا آباءكم وإخوانكم أولياء إن استحبوا الكفر على الإيمان ومن يتولهم منكم فأولئك هم الظالمون

translation: Say, 'If your fathers and your sons and your brothers and your wives and your kindred and the wealth you have acquired and the commerce you fear may decline and the dwellings you delight in are dearer to you than Allah and His Messenger and jihad in His way, then wait until Allah brings about His command. And Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of prioritizing one's relationship with Allah and the Prophet over worldly attachments, emphasizing that true devotion requires sacrifice and willingness to put the divine above personal interests and desires.
orig: قل إن كان آباؤكم وأبناؤكم وإخوانكم وأزواجكم وعشيرتكم وأموال اقترفتموها وتجارة تخشون كسادها ومساكن ترضونها أحب إليكم من الله ورسوله وجهاد في سبيله فتربصوا حتى يأتي الله بأمره والله لا يهدي القوم الفاسقين

translation: Allah has already helped you in many a location, and on the Day of Hunayn, when your great numbers delighted you, but they availed you not at all, and the earth, for all its breadth, was straitened for you, and you turned back, fleeing.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of humility and dependence on God, as even a large number of soldiers did not guarantee victory, and it was only God's help that led to success, emphasizing that true strength comes from God alone.
orig: لقد نصركم الله في مواطن كثيرة ويوم حنين إذ أعجبتكم كثرتكم فلم تغن عنكم شيئا وضاقت عليكم الأرض بما رحبت ثم وليتم مدبرين

translation: Then Allah sent down His calmness upon His Messenger and upon the believers, and sent down armies which you did not see, and punished those who disbelieved, and that is the recompense of the disbelievers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of faith and trust in God, as it is the believers who receive God's calmness and support, leading to their ultimate victory, while the disbelievers are punished and defeated.
orig: ثم أنزل الله سكينته على رسوله وعلى المؤمنين وأنزل جنودا لم تروها وعذب الذين كفروا وذلك جزاء الكافرين

translation: Then Allah relents towards whom He wills; and Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's absolute authority and mercy, emphasizing that He forgives whom He wills, and that His forgiveness is a manifestation of His infinite mercy and compassion.
orig: ثم يتوب الله من بعد ذلك على من يشاء والله غفور رحيم

translation: O you who have believed, indeed the polytheists are unclean, so let them not approach al-Masjid al-Haram after this year. And if you fear poverty, Allah will enrich you from His bounty if He wills. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the spiritual impurity of polytheists, implying that their presence in the sacred mosque would profane it, and that Muslims must maintain the sanctity of the mosque by excluding them.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إنما المشركون نجس فلا يقربوا المسجد الحرام بعد عامهم هذا وإن خفتم عيلة فسوف يغنيكم الله من فضله إن شاء إن الله عليم حكيم

translation: Fight those who do not believe in Allah or in the Last Day and who do not consider unlawful what Allah and His Messenger have made unlawful and who do not adopt the religion of truth from those who were given the Scripture until they pay the jizyah willingly while they are humbled.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of standing up against those who reject the truth and refuse to submit to God's laws, and that Muslims should be prepared to defend their faith and way of life against those who seek to undermine it.
orig: قاتلوا الذين لا يؤمنون بالله ولا باليوم الآخر ولا يحرمون ما حرم الله ورسوله ولا يدينون دين الحق من الذين أوتوا الكتاب حتى يعطوا الجزية عن يد وهم صاغرون

translation: The Jews say: 'Ezra is the son of Allah,' and the Christians say: 'The Messiah is the son of Allah.' That is their statement from their mouths; they imitate the saying of those who disbelieved before. May Allah destroy them, how they are deluded away from the truth!
interpretation: This verse highlights the gravity of attributing divine qualities to human beings, as it amounts to a rejection of the fundamental principle of God's unity and uniqueness, and thus constitutes a grave form of polytheism.
orig: وقالت اليهود عزير ابن الله وقالت النصارى المسيح ابن الله ذلك قولهم بأفواههم يضاهئون قول الذين كفروا من قبل قاتلهم الله أنى يؤفكون

translation: They have taken their scholars and monks as lords besides Allah, and the Messiah, son of Maryam. And they were not commanded except to worship one God; there is no deity except Him. Exalted is He above what they associate with Him.
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to elevate human beings, such as scholars and monks, to a divine status, thereby committing shirk, or associating partners with God, which is a grave sin in Islam.
orig: اتخذوا أحبارهم ورهبانهم أربابا من دون الله والمسيح ابن مريم وما أمروا إلا ليعبدوا إلها واحدا لا إله إلا هو سبحانه عما يشركون

translation: They wish to extinguish Allah's light with their mouths, but Allah refuses except to perfect His light, even if the disbelievers dislike it.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of the efforts of those who try to suppress the truth and the message of God, emphasizing that God's light and guidance will ultimately prevail, regardless of the opposition from those who reject faith.
orig: يريدون أن يطفئوا نور الله بأفواههم ويأبى الله إلا أن يتم نوره ولو كره الكافرون

translation: He is the One who has sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth, that He may make it prevail over all religions, even if the polytheists detest it.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the divine origin and authority of the Prophet Muhammad's mission, implying that the truth and guidance brought by him will ultimately prevail over all other beliefs and systems, regardless of the opposition and resentment of those who reject the truth.
orig: هو الذي أرسل رسوله بالهدى ودين الحق ليظهره على الدين كله ولو كره المشركون

translation: O you who have believed, indeed many of the scholars and the monks devour the wealth of people unjustly and avert [them] from the way of Allah. And those who hoard gold and silver and do not spend it in the way of Allah, give them tidings of a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse highlights the corruption of religious leaders who misuse their power and wealth, and instead of guiding people to the right path, they lead them astray for their own selfish interests, and warns them of a severe punishment.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إن كثيرا من الأحبار والرهبان ليأكلون أموال الناس بالباطل ويصدون عن سبيل الله والذين يكنزون الذهب والفضة ولا ينفقونها في سبيل الله فبشرهم بعذاب أليم

translation: A day will come when it will be heated in the fire of Hell, and with it will be branded their foreheads, sides, and backs. This is what you had sent forth for yourselves, so taste what you had been hoarding.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of accountability, where individuals will be punished for their own actions, and the punishment will be a direct consequence of their own deeds, emphasizing the idea that one reaps what one sows.
orig: يوم يحمى عليها في نار جهنم فتكوى بها جباههم وجنوبهم وظهورهم هذا ما كنزتم لأنفسكم فذوقوا ما كنتم تكنزون

translation: Indeed, the number of months with Allah is twelve in the book of Allah, on the day He created the heavens and the earth. Of these, four are sacred. That is the upright religion, so do not wrong yourselves during them. And fight the polytheists all together as they fight you all together. And know that Allah is with the righteous.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of adhering to the sacred months and respecting their sanctity, and also serves as a call to Muslims to unite against their enemies, the polytheists, who are fighting against them, with the assurance that Allah is with those who are righteous and steadfast in their faith.
orig: إن عدة الشهور عند الله اثنا عشر شهرا في كتاب الله يوم خلق السماوات والأرض منها أربعة حرم ذلك الدين القيم فلا تظلموا فيهن أنفسكم وقاتلوا المشركين كافة كما يقاتلونكم كافة واعلموا أن الله مع المتقين

translation: Verily, the postponing of the sacred month is but an addition in unbelief, whereby those who disbelieve are led astray, they allow it one year and forbid it another, so that they may make up the number of months which Allah has made sacred, and thus make lawful what Allah has forbidden, and make unlawful what Allah has made lawful, the evil of their deeds is made to seem good to them, and Allah does not guide the unbelieving people.
interpretation: The verse highlights how the manipulation of sacred months by the pagans is a manifestation of their unbelief, and how it leads them further into error, making them perceive evil deeds as good and vice versa, ultimately leading to their spiritual misguidance.
orig: إنما النسيء زيادة في الكفر يضل به الذين كفروا يحلونه عاما ويحرمونه عاما ليواطئوا عدة ما حرم الله فيحلوا ما حرم الله زين لهم سوء أعمالهم والله لا يهدي القوم الكافرين

translation: O you who have believed, what is [the matter] with you that when you are told to go forth in the cause of Allah, you adhere heavily to the earth? Are you content with the life of this world rather than the Hereafter? But little is the enjoyment of the life of this world compared to the Hereafter.
interpretation: The verse is a rebuke to believers who are hesitant to take action in the cause of Allah, preferring the comforts and attractions of this worldly life over the rewards of the Hereafter, and serves as a reminder that the fleeting pleasures of this life are insignificant compared to the eternal blessings of the next.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا ما لكم إذا قيل لكم انفروا في سبيل الله اثاقلتم إلى الأرض أرضيتم بالحياة الدنيا من الآخرة فما متاع الحياة الدنيا في الآخرة إلا قليل

translation: If you do not go forth, He will punish you with a painful punishment, and will replace you with another people, and you will not harm Him at all, and Allah is All-Powerful over everything.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of taking action in the path of God, warning that if believers fail to do so, they will be replaced by others who are more worthy, and God's plan will still be fulfilled, emphasizing God's omnipotence and control over all things.
orig: إلا تنفروا يعذبكم عذابا أليما ويستبدل قوما غيركم ولا تضروه شيئا والله على كل شيء قدير

translation: If you do not aid him, then Allah has already aided him when those who disbelieved had driven him out, the second of the two, when they were in the cave, and he said to his companion, 'Do not grieve; indeed, Allah is with us.' So Allah sent down His tranquility upon him and supported him with soldiers you did not see, and made the word of those who disbelieved the lowest, while the word of Allah is the highest, and Allah is Exalted in Might, Wise.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of trusting in God's plan and His ability to provide aid and support, even in the most difficult of circumstances, as exemplified by the story of the Prophet Muhammad's escape from his enemies, demonstrating that faith in God can bring about unexpected victories and triumphs.
orig: إلا تنصروه فقد نصره الله إذ أخرجه الذين كفروا ثاني اثنين إذ هما في الغار إذ يقول لصاحبه لا تحزن إن الله معنا فأنزل الله سكينته عليه وأيده بجنود لم تروها وجعل كلمة الذين كفروا السفلى وكلمة الله هي العليا والله عزيز حكيم

translation: Go forth, light-armed and heavy-armed, and strive with your wealth and your lives in the way of Allah. That is better for you, if you only knew.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of sacrifice and striving in the way of God, highlighting that true devotion requires not only spiritual effort but also physical and material sacrifice, and that such sacrifice is ultimately beneficial for the believer.
orig: انفروا خفافا وثقالا وجاهدوا بأموالكم وأنفسكم في سبيل الله ذلكم خير لكم إن كنتم تعلمون

translation: If it were a near advantage and a journey easy, they would have followed you, but the distance seemed too far for them. And they will swear by Allah: 'If we could, we would have gone forth with you.' They destroy themselves, and Allah knows that they are liars.
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who make excuses for not taking part in a righteous endeavor, as they are more concerned with their own comfort and convenience than with fulfilling their moral obligations.
orig: لو كان عرضا قريبا وسفرا قاصدا لاتبعوك ولكن بعدت عليهم الشقة وسيحلفون بالله لو استطعنا لخرجنا معكم يهلكون أنفسهم والله يعلم إنهم لكاذبون

translation: May Allah pardon you (O Muhammad)! Why did you grant them permission (to stay behind)? Until it becomes clear to you who are the truthful and until you know who are the liars.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of testing and verifying the intentions and actions of individuals, rather than taking them at face value, as Allah is aware of the true nature of people and will ultimately distinguish between the truthful and the deceitful.
orig: عفا الله عنك لم أذنت لهم حتى يتبين لك الذين صدقوا وتعلم الكاذبين

translation: Those who believe in Allah and the Last Day do not ask your leave to strive with their wealth and their lives, and Allah is All-Knowing of the pious.
interpretation: The verse highlights the willingness of true believers to sacrifice their material possessions and even their lives for the sake of their faith, without needing permission or encouragement from others, demonstrating their unwavering commitment to Allah and the Hereafter.
orig: لا يستأذنك الذين يؤمنون بالله واليوم الآخر أن يجاهدوا بأموالهم وأنفسهم والله عليم بالمتقين

translation: Only those who do not believe in Allah and the Last Day ask your permission, and their hearts are in doubt, so they waver in their doubts.
interpretation: The verse highlights the characteristic of hypocrites who, despite their outward appearance of faith, are plagued by internal doubts and uncertainty, which is reflected in their wavering behavior.
orig: إنما يستأذنك الذين لا يؤمنون بالله واليوم الآخر وارتابت قلوبهم فهم في ريبهم يترددون

translation: And if they had intended to come out, they would have made some preparation for it, but Allah was averse to their being sent, so He made them lag behind, and it was said (to them): 'Sit among those who sit.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of sincerity and intention in one's actions, as those who claimed to want to fight alongside the Prophet but were held back by Allah, were actually lacking in their commitment and resolve, and were therefore prevented from participating.
orig: ولو أرادوا الخروج لأعدوا له عدة ولكن كره الله انبعاثهم فثبطهم وقيل اقعدوا مع القاعدين

translation: If they were to get the better of you, they would not increase you except in confusion, and they would stir up strife among you, and some of you would listen to them. And Allah is All-Knowing of the wrongdoers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the deceptive nature of the enemies of faith, who, if they gain power, would only increase chaos and strife, and would secretly manipulate others to achieve their goals, but God is fully aware of their evil intentions.
orig: لو خرجوا فيكم ما زادوكم إلا خبالا ولأوضعوا خلالكم يبغونكم الفتنة وفيكم سماعون لهم والله عليم بالظالمين

translation: They had sought to stir up sedition before, and had sought to upset matters for you until the Truth came and God's command prevailed, while they were averse.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of human attempts to resist or oppose the divine plan, as God's will ultimately prevails despite the efforts of those who seek to undermine it.
orig: لقد ابتغوا الفتنة من قبل وقلبوا لك الأمور حتى جاء الحق وظهر أمر الله وهم كارهون

translation: And among them is he who says, 'Grant me permission and do not tempt me.' Unquestionably, into temptation they have fallen. And indeed, Hell will encompass the disbelievers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who claim to be believers but are afraid to take a stand for their faith, and instead ask for permission to stay behind, revealing their weakness and lack of conviction.
orig: ومنهم من يقول ائذن لي ولا تفتني ألا في الفتنة سقطوا وإن جهنم لمحيطة بالكافرين

translation: If good befalls you, it grieves them, and if a calamity befalls you, they say: 'We have taken our precaution beforehand,' and they turn away, and they are joyful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocritical behavior of those who claim to be believers but are secretly pleased when misfortune befalls the true believers, revealing their underlying enmity and lack of faith.
orig: إن تصبك حسنة تسؤهم وإن تصبك مصيبة يقولوا قد أخذنا أمرنا من قبل ويتولوا وهم فرحون

translation: Say, 'Nothing will afflict us except what Allah has decreed for us; He is our Protector, and upon Allah let the believers rely.'
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the idea of 'tawakkul' or reliance on God, where believers are encouraged to put their trust in God and accept that everything that happens to them is part of God's plan, and that they should not worry or fear anything except what God has ordained for them.
orig: قل لن يصيبنا إلا ما كتب الله لنا هو مولانا وعلى الله فليتوكل المؤمنون

translation: Do you wait for us except one of the two best things, and we wait for you that Allah will afflict you with punishment from Him or at our hands. So wait, indeed we are waiting with you.
interpretation: The verse highlights the confidence and patience of the believers in the face of persecution, as they await the justice of God, which may come directly from Him or through the believers' own efforts, emphasizing the inevitability of divine retribution.
orig: قل هل تربصون بنا إلا إحدى الحسنيين ونحن نتربص بكم أن يصيبكم الله بعذاب من عنده أو بأيدينا فتربصوا إنا معكم متربصون

translation: Say, 'Spend willingly or unwillingly, it will not be accepted from you. You have been a defiantly disobedient people.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of sincerity in one's actions, emphasizing that even obligatory acts of charity can be rejected by God if they are not performed with a willing and pure heart.
orig: قل أنفقوا طوعا أو كرها لن يتقبل منكم إنكم كنتم قوما فاسقين

translation: And what prevented them from spending their charities is that they disbelieved in Allah and His Messenger, and they do not come to prayer except in a lazy manner, and they do not spend except reluctantly.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of disbelief and laziness in one's spiritual life, where even acts of charity and worship become burdensome and lacking in sincerity, ultimately leading to a decline in one's relationship with God.
orig: وما منعهم أن تقبل منهم نفقاتهم إلا أنهم كفروا بالله وبرسوله ولا يأتون الصلاة إلا وهم كسالى ولا ينفقون إلا وهم كارهون

translation: So let not their wealth or their children impress you. Allah only intends to punish them through them in [this] worldly life, and that they will die while they are disbelievers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that worldly possessions and family are not a guarantee of a person's righteousness, and that those who are wealthy and have many children can still be punished by God if they are unrighteous, and ultimately die in a state of disbelief.
orig: فلا تعجبك أموالهم ولا أولادهم إنما يريد الله ليعذبهم بها في الحياة الدنيا وتزهق أنفسهم وهم كافرون

translation: And they swear by Allah that they are indeed of you, and they are not of you, but they are a people who are afraid (of the truth).
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who claim to be part of the Muslim community, but in reality, they are not, and their actions and intentions are driven by fear of the truth and its consequences.
orig: ويحلفون بالله إنهم لمنكم وما هم منكم ولكنهم قوم يفرقون

translation: If they found a place of refuge or caves or a place to enter, they would turn to it and rush towards it.
interpretation: This verse highlights the desperation and panic that sets in when people are faced with a crisis or punishment, and how they would seek any means of escape, no matter how futile, in order to avoid accountability.
orig: لو يجدون ملجأ أو مغارات أو مدخلا لولوا إليه وهم يجمحون

translation: And among them are some who criticize you in the matter of the charities. If they are given from it, they are pleased, but if they are not given from it, behold, they are angry.
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who pretend to be pious and charitable, but in reality, they are motivated by personal gain and self-interest, and their anger and dissatisfaction are a reflection of their true nature.
orig: ومنهم من يلمزك في الصدقات فإن أعطوا منها رضوا وإن لم يعطوا منها إذا هم يسخطون

translation: And if they had been content with what Allah and His Messenger gave them and said, 'Sufficient for us is Allah; Allah will give us of His bounty, and so will His Messenger; to Allah do we eagerly turn in hope.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of being content with the blessings and provisions given by God, and trusting in His plan, rather than seeking worldly gains or material possessions, and instead, focusing on the hereafter and seeking God's mercy and forgiveness.
orig: ولو أنهم رضوا ما آتاهم الله ورسوله وقالوا حسبنا الله سيؤتينا الله من فضله ورسوله إنا إلى الله راغبون

translation: The charities are only for the poor, the needy, those who work on them, those whose hearts are to be reconciled, the captives, the debtors, in the way of Allah, and the traveler. It is an obligation from Allah, and Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of using charity as a means of social welfare, emphasizing that it should be used to uplift the most vulnerable members of society, and that it is an obligation decreed by Allah, emphasizing His infinite wisdom and knowledge in guiding humanity towards justice and compassion.
orig: إنما الصدقات للفقراء والمساكين والعاملين عليها والمؤلفة قلوبهم وفي الرقاب والغارمين وفي سبيل الله وابن السبيل فريضة من الله والله عليم حكيم

translation: And among them are those who hurt the Prophet and say, 'He is (only) an ear.' Say, 'An ear of goodness for you, he believes in Allah and believes in the believers, and is a mercy to those who believe among you.' And those who hurt the Messenger of Allah will have a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of respecting and honoring the Prophet, and serves as a warning to those who ridicule or harm him, emphasizing that such actions will be met with severe punishment, while those who believe in him and follow his teachings will receive mercy and guidance.
orig: ومنهم الذين يؤذون النبي ويقولون هو أذن قل أذن خير لكم يؤمن بالله ويؤمن للمؤمنين ورحمة للذين آمنوا منكم والذين يؤذون رسول الله لهم عذاب أليم

translation: They swear by Allah to you (Muslims) to please you, but Allah and His Messenger have more right that they should please Him if they are believers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who try to deceive Muslims by making false oaths, while in reality, their actions and intentions are far from pleasing to God.
orig: يحلفون بالله لكم ليرضوكم والله ورسوله أحق أن يرضوه إن كانوا مؤمنين

translation: Do they not know that whoever opposes Allah and His Messenger, he will have the Fire of Hell, wherein he will abide forever. That is the great humiliation.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of opposing Allah and His Messenger, emphasizing that such opposition will lead to eternal damnation and humiliation in the hereafter.
orig: ألم يعلموا أنه من يحادد الله ورسوله فأن له نار جهنم خالدا فيها ذلك الخزي العظيم

translation: The hypocrites fear lest a Surah should be sent down concerning them, informing them of what is in their hearts. Say: 'Mock! Allah will bring to light what you fear.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the fear of the hypocrites that their true intentions and hidden motives will be exposed, and that they will be held accountable for their deceitful behavior, emphasizing that God is all-knowing and will reveal their secrets.
orig: يحذر المنافقون أن تنزل عليهم سورة تنبئهم بما في قلوبهم قل استهزئوا إن الله مخرج ما تحذرون

translation: And if you ask them, they will say: 'We were only talking idly and playing.' Say: 'Were you mocking Allah, His verses, and His Messenger?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who pretend to be innocent, but are actually guilty of mocking and ridiculing the divine message and its messenger, revealing the true nature of their actions.
orig: ولئن سألتهم ليقولن إنما كنا نخوض ونلعب قل أبالله وآياته ورسوله كنتم تستهزئون

translation: Do not apologize. You have disbelieved after your belief. If We pardon some of you, We will punish another group, for they were criminals.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of apostasy and the consequences of abandoning one's faith, emphasizing that those who have turned away from God after having believed will face punishment, and that God's mercy towards some does not mean that others will be spared if they continue to engage in wrongdoing.
orig: لا تعتذروا قد كفرتم بعد إيمانكم إن نعف عن طائفة منكم نعذب طائفة بأنهم كانوا مجرمين

translation: The hypocrites, men and women, are from one another; they enjoin what is wrong and forbid what is right, and they are close-fisted. They have forgotten Allah, so He has forgotten them. Indeed, the hypocrites - it is they who are the defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse highlights the characteristics of hypocrites, who pretend to be believers but in reality, they are the opposite, and their actions and behaviors are a reflection of their internal state, which is one of disobedience and defiance towards God.
orig: المنافقون والمنافقات بعضهم من بعض يأمرون بالمنكر وينهون عن المعروف ويقبضون أيديهم نسوا الله فنسيهم إن المنافقين هم الفاسقون

translation: God has promised the hypocrite men and the hypocrite women and the disbelievers the fire of Hell, wherein they will abide. It is their due, and God has cursed them, and for them is a lasting punishment.
interpretation: This verse highlights the gravity of hypocrisy and disbelief, emphasizing that those who pretend to be believers but secretly harbor disbelief, as well as those who openly reject faith, will ultimately face eternal punishment in Hell, and that this is a fitting recompense for their actions, demonstrating the severity of God's justice.
orig: وعد الله المنافقين والمنافقات والكفار نار جهنم خالدين فيها هي حسبهم ولعنهم الله ولهم عذاب مقيم

translation: Like those who were before you, they were stronger than you in power and more abundant in wealth and children, so they enjoyed their portion, and you enjoy your portion, just as those who were before you enjoyed their portion. And you were like those who indulged, and they indulged. Those, their deeds have become worthless in this world and the Hereafter, and those, they are the losers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the fleeting nature of worldly pleasures and the consequences of indulging in them, emphasizing that those who prioritize material gains and temporary enjoyments will ultimately end up as losers in the grand scheme of existence.
orig: كالذين من قبلكم كانوا أشد منكم قوة وأكثر أموالا وأولادا فاستمتعوا بخلاقهم فاستمتعتم بخلاقكم كما استمتع الذين من قبلكم بخلاقهم وخضتم كالذي خاضوا أولئك حبطت أعمالهم في الدنيا والآخرة وأولئك هم الخاسرون

translation: Has there not come to them the news of those before them, the people of Nuh, and 'Ad, and Thamud, and the people of Ibrahim, and the dwellers of Madyan, and the overturned cities? Their Messengers came to them with clear proofs, but it was not Allah Who wronged them, but they used to wrong themselves.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of learning from the mistakes of past nations that were destroyed due to their disobedience and rejection of God's messages, and serves as a warning to the current generation to avoid repeating the same mistakes and suffering a similar fate.
orig: ألم يأتهم نبأ الذين من قبلهم قوم نوح وعاد وثمود وقوم إبراهيم وأصحاب مدين والمؤتفكات أتتهم رسلهم بالبينات فما كان الله ليظلمهم ولكن كانوا أنفسهم يظلمون

translation: And the believers, men and women, are allies of one another. They enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong, and they establish prayer and give zakah, and obey Allah and His Messenger. Those - Allah will have mercy upon them. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of mutual support and cooperation among believers in promoting good and preventing evil, and emphasizes that this collective effort is a key factor in earning God's mercy.
orig: والمؤمنون والمؤمنات بعضهم أولياء بعض يأمرون بالمعروف وينهون عن المنكر ويقيمون الصلاة ويؤتون الزكاة ويطيعون الله ورسوله أولئك سيرحمهم الله إن الله عزيز حكيم

translation: Allah has promised the believing men and believing women gardens underneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever, and goodly dwellings in gardens of perpetual bliss, and Allah's pleasure is the greatest bliss.
interpretation: The verse highlights the ultimate reward of Paradise, where believers will experience eternal bliss and joy, and the greatest of all is the pleasure of Allah, implying that the ultimate goal of a believer's life is to attain Allah's pleasure and approval.
orig: وعد الله المؤمنين والمؤمنات جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها ومساكن طيبة في جنات عدن ورضوان من الله أكبر ذلك هو الفوز العظيم

translation: O Prophet, strive against the disbelievers and the hypocrites, and be harsh against them, and their refuge is Hell, and wretched is the destination.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of spiritual struggle against those who reject faith and those who pretend to be believers but are actually hypocrites, highlighting the need for firmness and severity in dealing with them.
orig: يا أيها النبي جاهد الكفار والمنافقين واغلظ عليهم ومأواهم جهنم وبئس المصير

translation: They swear by Allah that they said nothing, but they did say the word of disbelief and disbelieved after their Islam, and they intended what they did not attain, and they were not punished except because Allah and His Messenger enriched them from His bounty. If they repent, it is better for them, and if they turn away, Allah will punish them with a painful punishment in this world and the Hereafter, and they will have neither a protector nor a helper on earth.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of apostasy, emphasizing that those who renounce their faith after embracing Islam will face severe punishment in this life and the next, unless they repent and return to the right path, in which case they will be forgiven and rewarded.
orig: يحلفون بالله ما قالوا ولقد قالوا كلمة الكفر وكفروا بعد إسلامهم وهموا بما لم ينالوا وما نقموا إلا أن أغناهم الله ورسوله من فضله فإن يتوبوا يك خيرا لهم وإن يتولوا يعذبهم الله عذابا أليما في الدنيا والآخرة وما لهم في الأرض من ولي ولا نصير

translation: And among them are those who made a covenant with Allah: 'If He bestows upon us of His bounty, we will surely give charity and be of the righteous.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the insincerity of those who make promises to God, but only intend to fulfill them if their conditions are met, revealing a lack of true devotion and commitment to their faith.
orig: ومنهم من عاهد الله لئن آتانا من فضله لنصدقن ولنكونن من الصالحين

translation: But when He gave them out of His bounty, they hoarded it and turned away, while they were averse.
interpretation: The verse highlights the ingratitude of humanity, who when blessed with abundance, instead of being thankful, respond with arrogance and rejection of God's favors, demonstrating a lack of humility and appreciation.
orig: فلما آتاهم من فضله بخلوا به وتولوا وهم معرضون

translation: So He punished them with hypocrisy in their hearts until the day they meet Him, because they broke their covenant with Allah and because they used to lie.
interpretation: The verse highlights the spiritual consequence of breaking one's covenant with God, which is the growth of hypocrisy in one's heart, leading to a state of double-mindedness and dishonesty, where one's words and actions no longer align with one's true intentions.
orig: فأعقبهم نفاقا في قلوبهم إلى يوم يلقونه بما أخلفوا الله ما وعدوه وبما كانوا يكذبون

translation: Do they not know that Allah knows their secrets and their whispers, and that Allah is the Knower of the unseen?
interpretation: This verse highlights the all-encompassing knowledge of God, emphasizing that He is aware of even the most intimate and hidden aspects of human thought and behavior, and that nothing escapes His notice.
orig: ألم يعلموا أن الله يعلم سرهم ونجواهم وأن الله علام الغيوب

translation: Those who defame the freewill offerings of the believers, and those who cannot afford [to give] except with difficulty, so they ridicule [the believers], Allah ridicules them, and for them is a painful punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of mocking the charitable acts of believers, implying that such behavior is a serious offense against God and will be met with severe punishment in the hereafter.
orig: الذين يلمزون المطوعين من المؤمنين في الصدقات والذين لا يجدون إلا جهدهم فيسخرون منهم سخر الله منهم ولهم عذاب أليم

translation: Whether you ask forgiveness for them (hypocrites) or do not ask forgiveness for them, even if you ask forgiveness for them seventy times, Allah will not forgive them. That is because they disbelieved in Allah and His Messenger. And Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.
interpretation: This verse highlights the gravity of hypocrisy and disobedience, implying that those who reject Allah and His Messenger are beyond redemption, and even the Prophet's intercession would be futile, emphasizing the consequences of deliberate and persistent defiance of Allah's will.
orig: استغفر لهم أو لا تستغفر لهم إن تستغفر لهم سبعين مرة فلن يغفر الله لهم ذلك بأنهم كفروا بالله ورسوله والله لا يهدي القوم الفاسقين

translation: The hypocrites are concerned about their seats, differing from the Messenger of Allah, and they hate to strive with their wealth and their lives in the way of Allah, and they say, 'Do not march out in the heat.' Hellfire is more severe in heat. If only they understood.
interpretation: This verse highlights the laziness and hypocrisy of those who claim to be believers but are unwilling to make sacrifices and strive in the way of Allah, instead preferring the comfort and security of their daily lives, and warns them of the severe punishment that awaits them in the hereafter.
orig: فرح المخلفون بمقعدهم خلاف رسول الله وكرهوا أن يجاهدوا بأموالهم وأنفسهم في سبيل الله وقالوا لا تنفروا في الحر قل نار جهنم أشد حرا لو كانوا يفقهون

translation: So let them laugh a little and weep much, as a recompense for what they used to earn.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who have lived a life of sin and disobedience will ultimately face a reversal of their fortunes, where their moments of joy will be fleeting and their sorrow will be abundant, as a direct consequence of their own actions.
orig: فليضحكوا قليلا وليبكوا كثيرا جزاء بما كانوا يكسبون

translation: If Allah returns you to a party of them, and they ask your permission for going out, say: Never shall you go out with me, nor fight an enemy with me. You were pleased to sit (at home) the first time, then sit with those who lag behind.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of being committed to one's duties and responsibilities, especially in times of war or conflict. It emphasizes that those who abandon their duties and stay behind will not be given a second chance to redeem themselves, and will be left to suffer the consequences of their inaction.
orig: فإن رجعك الله إلى طائفة منهم فاستأذنوك للخروج فقل لن تخرجوا معي أبدا ولن تقاتلوا معي عدوا إنكم رضيتم بالقعود أول مرة فاقعدوا مع الخالفين

translation: And do not pray [funeral prayer] over any of them who have died, nor stand over their graves. Indeed, they disbelieved in Allah and His Messenger and died while they were defiantly disobeying.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the severity of the punishment for those who died in a state of disobedience and disbelief, by prohibiting the believers from praying for their forgiveness or showing respect at their graves, implying that they are beyond redemption and deserve no sympathy.
orig: ولا تصل على أحد منهم مات أبدا ولا تقم على قبره إنهم كفروا بالله ورسوله وماتوا وهم فاسقون

translation: And let not their wealth and their children impress you. Allah only intends to punish them therewith in the world, and that their souls shall expire while they are disbelievers.
interpretation: The verse suggests that the wealth and children of the disbelievers are not a sign of God's favor, but rather a means of testing them and ultimately leading them to their own downfall, as they become more arrogant and entrenched in their disbelief.
orig: ولا تعجبك أموالهم وأولادهم إنما يريد الله أن يعذبهم بها في الدنيا وتزهق أنفسهم وهم كافرون

translation: And when a Surah is revealed: 'Believe in Allah and strive along with His Messenger,' those of them who are wealthy ask your permission and say, 'Leave us to be with those who sit.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who claim to be believers but are unwilling to take action and make sacrifices for the cause of Allah, instead preferring a life of comfort and ease.
orig: وإذا أنزلت سورة أن آمنوا بالله وجاهدوا مع رسوله استأذنك أولو الطول منهم وقالوا ذرنا نكن مع القاعدين

translation: They are pleased to be with those who stay behind, and their hearts are sealed, so they do not understand.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of deliberately choosing to ignore the truth and instead embracing ignorance and misguidance, which ultimately leads to a spiritual numbness and inability to comprehend the reality of one's situation.
orig: رضوا بأن يكونوا مع الخوالف وطبع على قلوبهم فهم لا يفقهون

translation: But the Messenger and those who believed with him, struggled with their wealth and their lives; and those, for them are the good things, and those, they are the successful ones.
interpretation: The verse highlights the selfless dedication and sacrifice of the Prophet and his followers, who risked their lives and spent their wealth in the path of God, and in return, they will be rewarded with eternal bliss and success in the Hereafter.
orig: لكن الرسول والذين آمنوا معه جاهدوا بأموالهم وأنفسهم وأولئك لهم الخيرات وأولئك هم المفلحون

translation: God has prepared for them gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide, and that is the great success.
interpretation: The verse suggests that the ultimate reward for the righteous is a state of eternal bliss and happiness, where they will be in a state of perpetual peace and contentment, free from the worries and troubles of the world.
orig: أعد الله لهم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها ذلك الفوز العظيم

translation: And there came those who made excuses from the bedouins to ask permission, and those who denied Allah and His Messenger sat down; a painful punishment will soon afflict those of them who disbelieved.
interpretation: The verse highlights the contrast between those who sincerely sought to make amends and those who refused to take responsibility for their actions, and warns that the latter will face severe consequences for their disobedience and denial of the truth.
orig: وجاء المعذرون من الأعراب ليؤذن لهم وقعد الذين كذبوا الله ورسوله سيصيب الذين كفروا منهم عذاب أليم

translation: There is no blame on the weak, nor on the sick, nor on those who find nothing to spend, if they are sincere to Allah and His Messenger. There is no way against the doers of good, and Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of intention and sincerity in one's actions, emphasizing that it is not the physical ability to perform an action that matters, but rather the willingness and commitment to do good, and that Allah's mercy and forgiveness are available to those who act with good intentions.
orig: ليس على الضعفاء ولا على المرضى ولا على الذين لا يجدون ما ينفقون حرج إذا نصحوا لله ورسوله ما على المحسنين من سبيل والله غفور رحيم

translation: And there is not upon those who, when they came to you, that you should carry them, you said: 'I do not find what I can carry you upon.' They turned back while their eyes overflowed with tears, grieving that they could not find what they could spend.
interpretation: The verse highlights the emotional struggle of those who are unable to contribute financially to a noble cause, and the empathy and understanding that should be shown towards them, rather than turning them away or making them feel guilty.
orig: ولا على الذين إذا ما أتوك لتحملهم قلت لا أجد ما أحملكم عليه تولوا وأعينهم تفيض من الدمع حزنا ألا يجدوا ما ينفقون

translation: The way is only against those who ask your permission while they are rich, they are pleased to be with those who stay behind, and Allah has sealed their hearts, so they do not know.
interpretation: This verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who claim to be believers but are unwilling to make sacrifices, as they are more concerned with their worldly wealth and comforts, and are thus sealed off from true faith and understanding.
orig: إنما السبيل على الذين يستأذنونك وهم أغنياء رضوا بأن يكونوا مع الخوالف وطبع الله على قلوبهم فهم لا يعلمون

translation: They will excuse themselves to you, when you return to them. Say: 'Make no excuse, we will not believe you. Allah has informed us of your news, and Allah will observe your deeds and His Messenger, then you will be returned to the Knower of the Unseen and the Witnessed, then He will inform you of what you used to do.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of attempting to deceive or excuse oneself from accountability, as God is all-knowing and aware of every individual's actions, and will ultimately hold them accountable for their deeds.
orig: يعتذرون إليكم إذا رجعتم إليهم قل لا تعتذروا لن نؤمن لكم قد نبأنا الله من أخباركم وسيرى الله عملكم ورسوله ثم تردون إلى عالم الغيب والشهادة فينبئكم بما كنتم تعملون

translation: They will swear by Allah to you, when you turn back to them, to excuse you, but you should excuse them; they are impure and their refuge is Hell, a recompense for what they used to earn.
interpretation: This verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who swear allegiance to Allah, but in reality, they are impure and deserve punishment, emphasizing the importance of not being deceived by their outward appearances or words, but rather judging them by their actions.
orig: سيحلفون بالله لكم إذا انقلبتم إليهم لتعرضوا عنهم فأعرضوا عنهم إنهم رجس ومأواهم جهنم جزاء بما كانوا يكسبون

translation: They swear to you that you may be pleased with them; but if you are pleased with them, Allah is not pleased with the defiantly disobedient people.
interpretation: This verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who try to deceive others by making false oaths, and warns that even if they succeed in deceiving humans, they will not be able to deceive God, who sees through their deceit and disobedience.
orig: يحلفون لكم لترضوا عنهم فإن ترضوا عنهم فإن الله لا يرضى عن القوم الفاسقين

translation: The Arabs are more in disbelief and hypocrisy, and more likely not to know the boundaries of what Allah has revealed to His Messenger. And Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of spiritual guidance and the need for a prophet or spiritual leader to guide people in understanding the boundaries and limits set by God, emphasizing that without such guidance, people are more likely to fall into disbelief and hypocrisy.
orig: الأعراب أشد كفرا ونفاقا وأجدر ألا يعلموا حدود ما أنزل الله على رسوله والله عليم حكيم

translation: And among the Bedouins are those who take what they spend as a loss, and await ill turns for you, on you is the turn of evil, and Allah is Hearing, Knowing.
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocritical behavior of some Bedouins who pretend to be generous in their spending, but in reality, they consider it a loss and wait for opportunities to harm the believers, unaware that Allah is aware of their intentions and will ultimately bring evil upon them.
orig: ومن الأعراب من يتخذ ما ينفق مغرما ويتربص بكم الدوائر عليهم دائرة السوء والله سميع عليم

translation: And among the desert Arabs there are those who believe in Allah and the Last Day, and consider what they spend as means of nearness to Allah, and the prayers of the Messenger. Lo! It is a means of nearness for them. Allah will admit them to His Mercy. Lo! Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of combining faith with righteous deeds, as the desert Arabs mentioned in the verse believe in Allah and the Last Day, and they also spend their wealth in the path of Allah, which is considered a means of nearness to Him, and thus they will be admitted to His Mercy.
orig: ومن الأعراب من يؤمن بالله واليوم الآخر ويتخذ ما ينفق قربات عند الله وصلوات الرسول ألا إنها قربة لهم سيدخلهم الله في رحمته إن الله غفور رحيم

translation: And the first forerunners among the Muhajirun and the Ansar and those who followed them in goodness, Allah is pleased with them and they are pleased with Him, and He has prepared for them gardens beneath which rivers flow, to dwell therein forever. That is the great success.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of the early Muslims who set a noble example of faith and righteousness, and suggests that their selfless devotion to Allah and His Messenger earned them a special place in Paradise, where they will enjoy eternal bliss and happiness.
orig: والسابقون الأولون من المهاجرين والأنصار والذين اتبعوهم بإحسان رضي الله عنهم ورضوا عنه وأعد لهم جنات تجري تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها أبدا ذلك الفوز العظيم

translation: And there are some of the desert Arabs around you who are hypocrites, and among the people of Medina (there are some who) are stubborn upon hypocrisy, you do not know them, We know them, We will punish them twice, then they will be returned to a great punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the presence of hypocrites among the desert Arabs and the people of Medina, who pretend to be believers but secretly harbor disbelief, and warns that God is aware of their true nature and will punish them accordingly, emphasizing the certainty of divine justice.
orig: وممن حولكم من الأعراب منافقون ومن أهل المدينة مردوا على النفاق لا تعلمهم نحن نعلمهم سنعذبهم مرتين ثم يردون إلى عذاب عظيم

translation: And others have confessed their faults, they have mixed a righteous deed with another that was evil; perchance Allah will turn unto them; Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of self-reflection and acknowledging one's mistakes, as those who confess their faults and mix good deeds with bad ones may still be eligible for God's forgiveness and mercy.
orig: وآخرون اعترفوا بذنوبهم خلطوا عملا صالحا وآخر سيئا عسى الله أن يتوب عليهم إن الله غفور رحيم

translation: Take from their wealth a charity to purify them and bless them, and pray for them. Indeed, your prayer is a source of comfort for them, and Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of charity in purifying and blessing the believers, and the role of the Prophet's prayer in bringing comfort to them, emphasizing God's omniscience and omnipotence.
orig: خذ من أموالهم صدقة تطهرهم وتزكيهم بها وصل عليهم إن صلاتك سكن لهم والله سميع عليم

translation: Does it not occur to them that Allah accepts repentance from His servants and takes charities, and that Allah is the Accepter of repentance, the Merciful?
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of seeking forgiveness and repentance, emphasizing that God is always willing to accept repentance and forgive His servants, and that He is merciful and compassionate towards those who turn to Him.
orig: ألم يعلموا أن الله هو يقبل التوبة عن عباده ويأخذ الصدقات وأن الله هو التواب الرحيم

translation: And say, 'Act, for Allah will see your deeds, and His Messenger, and the believers. And you will be brought back to the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, then He will inform you of what you used to do.'
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the idea that God is all-knowing and all-seeing, and that He is aware of every action and intention of human beings, and will ultimately hold them accountable for their deeds.
orig: وقل اعملوا فسيرى الله عملكم ورسوله والمؤمنون وستردون إلى عالم الغيب والشهادة فينبئكم بما كنتم تعملون

translation: And others are left to await Allah's decree, whether He will punish them or turn to them in mercy, and Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's omniscience and wisdom in dealing with those who have sinned, leaving their fate uncertain, and thus instilling a sense of hope and fear in them, which can lead to repentance and reform.
orig: وآخرون مرجون لأمر الله إما يعذبهم وإما يتوب عليهم والله عليم حكيم

translation: And those who have taken a mosque for harm and disbelief and division among the believers, and a place of ambush for those who fought against Allah and His Messenger before, and they will indeed swear that they intended only good, and Allah bears witness that they are liars.
interpretation: This verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who pretend to do good but in reality are causing harm and division among the believers, and their true intentions are to oppose Allah and His Messenger, demonstrating that their actions are a manifestation of their inner deceit and dishonesty.
orig: والذين اتخذوا مسجدا ضرارا وكفرا وتفريقا بين المؤمنين وإرصادا لمن حارب الله ورسوله من قبل وليحلفن إن أردنا إلا الحسنى والله يشهد إنهم لكاذبون

translation: Never stand you therein. Verily, the mosque whose foundation was laid from the first day on piety is more worthy that you stand therein. In it are men who love to purify themselves; and Allah loves those who purify themselves.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of spiritual purity and cleanliness, suggesting that those who strive to purify themselves are beloved by God, and are more deserving of His blessings and mercy.
orig: لا تقم فيه أبدا لمسجد أسس على التقوى من أول يوم أحق أن تقوم فيه فيه رجال يحبون أن يتطهروا والله يحب المطهرين

translation: Is he who founded his building on fear of Allah and His pleasure, better or he who founded his building on the edge of a cliff, which is about to collapse, and it collapses with him into the fire of Hell? And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
interpretation: The verse highlights the contrast between those who build their lives on a foundation of faith and righteousness, and those who build on shaky grounds of sin and corruption, emphasizing that the latter will ultimately lead to downfall and destruction.
orig: أفمن أسس بنيانه على تقوى من الله ورضوان خير أم من أسس بنيانه على شفا جرف هار فانهار به في نار جهنم والله لا يهدي القوم الظالمين

translation: Their buildings which they built will not cease to be a source of unease in their hearts, unless their hearts are torn apart, and Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
interpretation: The verse highlights the psychological impact of one's actions, suggesting that the consequences of their deeds will continue to haunt them, causing inner turmoil and anxiety, unless they completely abandon their old ways and undergo a profound transformation.
orig: لا يزال بنيانهم الذي بنوا ريبة في قلوبهم إلا أن تقطع قلوبهم والله عليم حكيم

translation: Indeed, Allah has purchased from the believers their lives and their properties in exchange for Paradise. They fight in the cause of Allah, so they kill and are killed. It is a true promise binding on Him in the Torah and the Gospel and the Qur'an. And who is truer to his covenant than Allah? Then rejoice in the bargain which you have made with Him. And that is the great achievement.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of martyrdom, where believers sacrifice their lives and wealth in the path of Allah, and in return, they are promised Paradise. This bargain is not a one-sided deal, but rather a mutual agreement between Allah and the believers, where Allah is bound by His promise to grant them Paradise, and the believers are bound by their commitment to fight in His cause.
orig: إن الله اشترى من المؤمنين أنفسهم وأموالهم بأن لهم الجنة يقاتلون في سبيل الله فيقتلون ويقتلون وعدا عليه حقا في التوراة والإنجيل والقرآن ومن أوفى بعهده من الله فاستبشروا ببيعكم الذي بايعتم به وذلك هو الفوز العظيم

translation: The repentant, the worshippers, the praisers, the wayfarers, the bowers, the prostrators, the enjoiners of good, the forbidders of evil, and the observers of the bounds set by Allah. And give good tidings to the believers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of a believer's character, emphasizing the need to cultivate a sense of humility and devotion to God, while also taking an active role in promoting good and preventing evil, and ultimately, adhering to the boundaries set by God.
orig: التائبون العابدون الحامدون السائحون الراكعون الساجدون الآمرون بالمعروف والناهون عن المنكر والحافظون لحدود الله وبشر المؤمنين

translation: It is not for the Prophet and those who believed to ask forgiveness for the polytheists, even if they were relatives, after it has become clear to them that they are companions of the Fire.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that there comes a point when it is no longer appropriate to pray for the forgiveness of those who have rejected faith, even if they are close relatives, as their fate is sealed and they are destined for Hell.
orig: ما كان للنبي والذين آمنوا أن يستغفروا للمشركين ولو كانوا أولي قربى من بعد ما تبين لهم أنهم أصحاب الجحيم

translation: And Ibrahim's asking forgiveness for his father was only because of a promise he had made to him. So when it became clear to him that he was an enemy of Allah, he dissociated himself from him. Indeed, Ibrahim was compassionate and forbearing.
interpretation: The verse highlights Ibrahim's strong sense of justice and morality, as he was willing to dissociate himself from his own father when he realized he was an enemy of Allah, demonstrating that one's loyalty to Allah takes precedence over all other relationships.
orig: وما كان استغفار إبراهيم لأبيه إلا عن موعدة وعدها إياه فلما تبين له أنه عدو لله تبرأ منه إن إبراهيم لأواه حليم

translation: And Allah would not let a people go astray after He has guided them until He makes clear to them what they should avoid. Indeed, Allah is All-Knowing of all things.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of personal responsibility, implying that once individuals have been guided towards the truth, they are accountable for their actions and will be judged accordingly, and it is their own responsibility to avoid sinful behavior.
orig: وما كان الله ليضل قوما بعد إذ هداهم حتى يبين لهم ما يتقون إن الله بكل شيء عليم

translation: Indeed, to Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He gives life and causes death, and you have not besides Allah any protector or helper.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the absolute sovereignty of Allah over the universe, highlighting His power to give life and take it away, and reminding humans that they have no one to turn to for help or protection except Allah, implying a sense of total dependence on Him.
orig: إن الله له ملك السماوات والأرض يحيي ويميت وما لكم من دون الله من ولي ولا نصير

translation: Allah has already forgiven the Prophet, the Muhajirin, and the Ansar who followed him in the hour of difficulty after the hearts of a party of them were about to deviate, then He turned to them. Indeed, He is to them Compassionate, Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's mercy and compassion towards the Prophet and his companions, who remained loyal and steadfast in their faith despite the difficulties and challenges they faced, demonstrating God's appreciation for their perseverance and devotion.
orig: لقد تاب الله على النبي والمهاجرين والأنصار الذين اتبعوه في ساعة العسرة من بعد ما كاد يزيغ قلوب فريق منهم ثم تاب عليهم إنه بهم رءوف رحيم

translation: And to the three who were left behind, until when the earth became constricted for them, and their own souls became constricted, and they thought that there was no refuge from Allah except to Him, then He turned to them, so that they might turn. Indeed, Allah is the Accepting of Repentance, the Merciful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of sincere repentance, as it is never too late to turn back to God, and that God's mercy and forgiveness are always available to those who truly repent and turn back to Him.
orig: وعلى الثلاثة الذين خلفوا حتى إذا ضاقت عليهم الأرض بما رحبت وضاقت عليهم أنفسهم وظنوا أن لا ملجأ من الله إلا إليه ثم تاب عليهم ليتوبوا إن الله هو التواب الرحيم

translation: O you who have believed, fear Allah and be with the truthful.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of living a life of integrity, where one's words and actions are in harmony, and one is truthful in all dealings, as a means of achieving closeness to Allah and earning His pleasure.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اتقوا الله وكونوا مع الصادقين

translation: It was not for the people of Medina and those around them from the Bedouins to stay behind the Messenger of Allah, nor to prefer themselves over him, for they do not suffer from thirst or fatigue or hunger in the path of Allah, nor do they take a step that enrages the disbelievers, nor do they inflict upon an enemy any infliction, but it is written for them as a good deed, for Allah does not waste the reward of the doers of good.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of selflessness and sacrifice in the path of Allah, emphasizing that true believers should be willing to put the needs of the community and the Messenger of Allah above their own, even if it means facing hardship and difficulty.
orig: ما كان لأهل المدينة ومن حولهم من الأعراب أن يتخلفوا عن رسول الله ولا يرغبوا بأنفسهم عن نفسه ذلك بأنهم لا يصيبهم ظمأ ولا نصب ولا مخمصة في سبيل الله ولا يطئون موطئا يغيظ الكفار ولا ينالون من عدو نيلا إلا كتب لهم به عمل صالح إن الله لا يضيع أجر المحسنين

translation: And they do not spend a small expenditure or a large one, nor do they cross a valley, but it is registered for them, that Allah may reward them with the best of what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse highlights the meticulous nature of God's justice, where even the smallest acts of kindness and charity are taken into account, and will be rewarded in the afterlife, emphasizing the importance of performing good deeds, no matter how small they may seem.
orig: ولا ينفقون نفقة صغيرة ولا كبيرة ولا يقطعون واديا إلا كتب لهم ليجزيهم الله أحسن ما كانوا يعملون

translation: And why should not a party from among the believers go forth to gain understanding in the religion, and warn their people when they return to them, that they may beware?
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of seeking knowledge and understanding in religion, and the responsibility of those who have gained this knowledge to warn and guide others, so that they may be aware of the consequences of their actions and strive to live a righteous life.
orig: وما كان المؤمنون لينفروا كافة فلولا نفر من كل فرقة منهم طائفة ليتفقهوا في الدين ولينذروا قومهم إذا رجعوا إليهم لعلهم يحذرون

translation: O you who have believed, fight those adjacent to you of the disbelievers and let them find harshness from you and know that Allah is with the righteous.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of standing up against oppression and injustice, and that believers must be willing to take a strong stance against those who seek to harm them, trusting that God is with those who are righteous and just.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا قاتلوا الذين يلونكم من الكفار وليجدوا فيكم غلظة واعلموا أن الله مع المتقين

translation: And when a Surah is revealed, there are some of them who say: 'Which of you has this increased faith in?' As for those who believe, it has increased them in faith, and they rejoice.
interpretation: The verse highlights the difference in reaction between the believers and the non-believers when they hear a revelation from God, with the believers increasing in faith and rejoicing, while the non-believers are skeptical and unaffected.
orig: وإذا ما أنزلت سورة فمنهم من يقول أيكم زادته هذه إيمانا فأما الذين آمنوا فزادتهم إيمانا وهم يستبشرون

translation: And as for those in whose hearts is disease, it added uncleanness to their uncleanness, and they died while they were disbelievers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the spiritual decay and corruption that results from harboring hatred, hypocrisy, and disbelief, ultimately leading to spiritual death, where one becomes completely disconnected from God and His guidance.
orig: وأما الذين في قلوبهم مرض فزادتهم رجسا إلى رجسهم وماتوا وهم كافرون

translation: The first [punishment] - do they see that they will be tried every year once or twice, then they will not repent, nor will they remember.
interpretation: The verse highlights the stubbornness and ignorance of those who are repeatedly tested and punished, yet they fail to learn from their experiences, refusing to repent and change their ways, and neglecting to remember the lessons of the past.
orig: أولا يرون أنهم يفتنون في كل عام مرة أو مرتين ثم لا يتوبون ولا هم يذكرون

translation: And when a surah is revealed, some of them look at each other, as if asking, 'Is anyone watching?' Then they slip away, Allah has made their hearts neglectful, for they are a people who do not understand.
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrites' lack of sincerity and their tendency to pretend to be believers, but when they are alone, they reveal their true nature and abandon their faith, demonstrating their superficial understanding of the divine message.
orig: وإذا ما أنزلت سورة نظر بعضهم إلى بعض هل يراكم من أحد ثم انصرفوا صرف الله قلوبهم بأنهم قوم لا يفقهون

translation: There has certainly come to you a Messenger from among yourselves. Grievous to him is what you suffer, [and] he is anxious over you, [and] towards the believers, kind and merciful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the unique connection between the Prophet Muhammad and his people, emphasizing his deep concern and compassion for them, as well as his desire to guide them towards righteousness and salvation.
orig: لقد جاءكم رسول من أنفسكم عزيز عليه ما عنتم حريص عليكم بالمؤمنين رءوف رحيم

translation: But if they turn away, say: 'Hasbiy Allahu la ilaha illa Huwa 'alayhi tawakkaltu wa Huwa Rabbul-'Arshil-'Azim.'
interpretation: The verse is a declaration of complete trust in God's power and wisdom, and a rejection of the unbelief and opposition of others, emphasizing the believer's reliance on God alone, and their confidence in His ultimate triumph.
orig: فإن تولوا فقل حسبي الله لا إله إلا هو عليه توكلت وهو رب العرش العظيم

translation: Those are the verses of the Wise Book.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the importance and significance of the Quran, implying that it is a source of wisdom and guidance, and that its verses are a manifestation of God's infinite wisdom.
orig: الر تلك آيات الكتاب الحكيم

translation: Is it wonder for mankind that We have inspired to a man among them, saying: Warn mankind and give good tidings to those who believe, that they will have a foothold of truth with their Lord. The disbelievers say: Indeed, this is a clear magician.
interpretation: The verse highlights the skepticism and rejection of the disbelievers towards the Prophet's message, implying that they considered the Prophet to be a magician, rather than a true messenger of God, and that they failed to recognize the truth and authenticity of his divine inspiration.
orig: أكان للناس عجبا أن أوحينا إلى رجل منهم أن أنذر الناس وبشر الذين آمنوا أن لهم قدم صدق عند ربهم قال الكافرون إن هذا لساحر مبين

translation: Indeed, your Lord is Allah, who created the heavens and the earth in six days, then He established Himself above the Throne, managing the affair. There is no intercessor except after His permission. That is Allah, your Lord, so worship Him. Will you not remember?
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the omnipotence and uniqueness of God, highlighting His role as the sole creator and manager of the universe, and reminds humans of their obligation to worship Him alone, implying that they should be grateful and humble before Him.
orig: إن ربكم الله الذي خلق السماوات والأرض في ستة أيام ثم استوى على العرش يدبر الأمر ما من شفيع إلا من بعد إذنه ذلكم الله ربكم فاعبدوه أفلا تذكرون

translation: To Him is your return all together; the promise of Allah is true; indeed, He originates the creation, then He will repeat it that He may reward those who have believed and done righteous deeds in justice; and as for those who disbelieved, for them is a drink of boiling water and a painful punishment for what they used to reject.
interpretation: The verse highlights the inevitability of accountability to God, emphasizing that believers will be rewarded for their good deeds, while those who rejected faith will face severe punishment, implying that one's actions have consequences in the afterlife.
orig: إليه مرجعكم جميعا وعد الله حقا إنه يبدأ الخلق ثم يعيده ليجزي الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات بالقسط والذين كفروا لهم شراب من حميم وعذاب أليم بما كانوا يكفرون

translation: He is the One who made the sun a shining light and the moon a derived light, and He ordained for it mansions so that you may know the number of years and the reckoning. God did not create that except with the truth. He explains the signs for a people who know.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's precision and wisdom in creating the universe, emphasizing that the intricate systems and patterns in the celestial bodies are not just random occurrences, but rather a manifestation of God's truth and wisdom, designed to guide humanity towards knowledge and understanding.
orig: هو الذي جعل الشمس ضياء والقمر نورا وقدره منازل لتعلموا عدد السنين والحساب ما خلق الله ذلك إلا بالحق يفصل الآيات لقوم يعلمون

translation: Indeed, in the alternation of night and day and what Allah has created in the heavens and the earth are signs for a people who fear.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of introspection and self-reflection, suggesting that those who are mindful of God's signs in the natural world will develop a sense of reverence and fear of God, leading them to live a righteous life.
orig: إن في اختلاف الليل والنهار وما خلق الله في السماوات والأرض لآيات لقوم يتقون

translation: Indeed, those who do not hope for Our meeting and are satisfied with the life of this world and feel secure in it, and those who are heedless of Our signs
interpretation: The verse highlights the characteristics of those who are neglectful of their spiritual well-being, being content with the fleeting pleasures of this world and ignoring the signs of God's presence, which ultimately leads to their spiritual downfall.
orig: إن الذين لا يرجون لقاءنا ورضوا بالحياة الدنيا واطمأنوا بها والذين هم عن آياتنا غافلون

translation: Those, their refuge is the Fire, for what they used to earn.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of accountability, where individuals will be held responsible for their actions, and those who have earned evil deeds will be punished with the Fire, implying that their evil actions have led them to their downfall.
orig: أولئك مأواهم النار بما كانوا يكسبون

translation: Those who believe and do righteous deeds, their Lord will guide them because of their faith; rivers will flow beneath them in Gardens of Delight.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that faith and good deeds are intertwined, and that those who possess both will be guided by God and rewarded with eternal bliss in Paradise, where they will experience unimaginable joy and contentment.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات يهديهم ربهم بإيمانهم تجري من تحتهم الأنهار في جنات النعيم

translation: Their cry in it will be: 'Glory be to You, O Allah!' and their greeting in it will be: 'Peace!' And the last of their cry will be: 'Praise be to Allah, the Lord of the Worlds.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the spiritual state of believers in Paradise, where they will be in a state of constant praise and gratitude to God, glorifying Him and acknowledging His lordship, and their greetings to each other will be one of peace, reflecting the harmony and tranquility that pervades the afterlife.
orig: دعواهم فيها سبحانك اللهم وتحيتهم فيها سلام وآخر دعواهم أن الحمد لله رب العالمين

translation: And if Allah were to hasten for the people the evil as they hasten for the good, He would have hastened for them their doom, but We leave those who do not expect to meet Us in their transgression, wandering blindly.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's mercy and patience in delaying punishment, giving people time to repent and correct their ways, unlike humans who are quick to seek good things for themselves, and serves as a warning to those who are reckless and do not expect to be held accountable for their actions.
orig: ولو يعجل الله للناس الشر استعجالهم بالخير لقضي إليهم أجلهم فنذر الذين لا يرجون لقاءنا في طغيانهم يعمهون

translation: And when harm touches man, he calls upon Us, lying on his side, or sitting, or standing. But when We have removed his harm, he passes on as if he had never called upon Us for a harm that touched him. Thus it is made fair-seeming to the wasteful of their deeds.
interpretation: The verse highlights human hypocrisy, where people turn to God only in times of need, but once their problems are solved, they forget about God and return to their wasteful and sinful ways, as if they had never sought God's help in the first place.
orig: وإذا مس الإنسان الضر دعانا لجنبه أو قاعدا أو قائما فلما كشفنا عنه ضره مر كأن لم يدعنا إلى ضر مسه كذلك زين للمسرفين ما كانوا يعملون

translation: And indeed, We destroyed the towns that wronged before you, when their messengers came to them with clear proofs, but they would not believe. Thus, We punish the guilty people.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of accountability, where those who reject the truth and continue to oppress others will ultimately face the consequences of their actions, emphasizing that God's justice is inescapable and will be meted out to those who deserve it.
orig: ولقد أهلكنا القرون من قبلكم لما ظلموا وجاءتهم رسلهم بالبينات وما كانوا ليؤمنوا كذلك نجزي القوم المجرمين

translation: Then We made you successors upon the earth after them to see how you would do.
interpretation: The verse highlights humanity's responsibility as stewards of the earth, implying that God is observing and evaluating human actions, and that their deeds will have consequences.
orig: ثم جعلناكم خلائف في الأرض من بعدهم لننظر كيف تعملون

translation: And when Our clear signs are recited to them, those who do not expect to meet Us say, 'Bring a Quran other than this or change it.' Say, 'It is not for me to change it of my own accord. I follow only what is revealed to me. If I were to disobey my Lord, I fear the punishment of a tremendous Day.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the Prophet's humility and obedience to God's command, as he refuses to alter the revelation according to the desires of his opponents, and instead emphasizes his complete reliance on divine guidance, demonstrating his unwavering commitment to conveying the message of God.
orig: وإذا تتلى عليهم آياتنا بينات قال الذين لا يرجون لقاءنا ائت بقرآن غير هذا أو بدله قل ما يكون لي أن أبدله من تلقاء نفسي إن أتبع إلا ما يوحى إلي إني أخاف إن عصيت ربي عذاب يوم عظيم

translation: Say, 'If Allah had willed, I would not have recited it to you, nor would you have known it. A considerable time has passed from before it. Do you not then understand?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of reflection and contemplation, emphasizing that understanding and knowledge can only be achieved through introspection and self-awareness, rather than mere recitation or transmission of information.
orig: قل لو شاء الله ما تلوته عليكم ولا أدراكم به فقد لبثت فيكم عمرا من قبله أفلا تعقلون

translation: And who is more unjust than he who invents a lie against Allah or denies His verses? Indeed, the criminals will not succeed.
interpretation: This verse highlights the gravity of fabricating lies against God or rejecting His signs, emphasizing that those who engage in such actions will ultimately face failure and disappointment in this life and the hereafter.
orig: فمن أظلم ممن افترى على الله كذبا أو كذب بآياته إنه لا يفلح المجرمون

translation: And they worship besides Allah that which does not harm them nor benefit them, and they say: 'These are our intercessors with Allah.' Say: 'Do you inform Allah of what He does not know in the heavens and the earth? Glorified and Exalted is He from what they associate.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the absurdity of polytheism, where people worship idols and false deities, thinking they can intercede on their behalf, when in reality, these idols have no power to harm or benefit them, and are completely unaware of the true nature of God's power and wisdom.
orig: ويعبدون من دون الله ما لا يضرهم ولا ينفعهم ويقولون هؤلاء شفعاؤنا عند الله قل أتنبئون الله بما لا يعلم في السماوات ولا في الأرض سبحانه وتعالى عما يشركون

translation: And mankind was not but one community, then they differed, and if not for a word that preceded from your Lord, it would have been judged between them regarding what they differed in.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that humanity was initially united, but later divided due to their differences, and it is only God's mercy and patience that have delayed their judgment, giving them time to correct their ways.
orig: وما كان الناس إلا أمة واحدة فاختلفوا ولولا كلمة سبقت من ربك لقضي بينهم فيما فيه يختلفون

translation: And they say: 'Why is not a sign sent down to him from his Lord?' Say: 'The Unseen is only for Allah, so wait; I am waiting with you among those who wait.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of patience and trust in God's plan, emphasizing that the timing and nature of divine intervention are known only to God, and that humans must wait and trust in His wisdom.
orig: ويقولون لولا أنزل عليه آية من ربه فقل إنما الغيب لله فانتظروا إني معكم من المنتظرين

translation: And when We let people taste a mercy after some adversity has afflicted them, behold, they forthwith devise a plot against Our signs. Say: 'God is swifter in plotting.' Indeed, Our messengers record what you plot.
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of humans to take God's mercy for granted and to plot against Him, thinking they can outsmart Him, but ultimately, God is always one step ahead, knowing and recording their every move.
orig: وإذا أذقنا الناس رحمة من بعد ضراء مستهم إذا لهم مكر في آياتنا قل الله أسرع مكرا إن رسلنا يكتبون ما تمكرون
