interpretation: The verse highlights the complete destruction of the people of Thamud, implying that their existence was erased from the face of the earth, and serving as a warning to those who reject God's signs and messages.
orig: كأن لم يغنوا فيها ألا إن ثمود كفروا ربهم ألا بعدا لثمود

translation: And indeed, Our messengers came to Abraham with good tidings. They said, 'Peace.' He said, 'Peace,' and did not delay in bringing a roasted calf.
interpretation: The verse highlights Abraham's exemplary hospitality, as he immediately offers a generous gift to his unexpected guests, demonstrating his trust in God's messengers and his willingness to serve others.
orig: ولقد جاءت رسلنا إبراهيم بالبشرى قالوا سلاما قال سلام فما لبث أن جاء بعجل حنيذ

translation: So when he saw their hands did not reach to it, he felt a dislike for them and felt a fear of them. They said: 'Fear not, indeed we have been sent to the people of Lot'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of hospitality and generosity, as the angels' reluctance to accept the food offered by Abraham is a test of his character, and his passing of this test is a sign of his righteousness and worthiness to receive divine messengers.
orig: فلما رأى أيديهم لا تصل إليه نكرهم وأوجس منهم خيفة قالوا لا تخف إنا أرسلنا إلى قوم لوط

translation: And his wife was standing, and she laughed, so We gave her good tidings of Isaac, and after Isaac, Jacob.
interpretation: The verse highlights the sudden and unexpected nature of divine blessings, as exemplified by the sudden good tidings of Isaac's birth to a barren and aged Sarah, and the subsequent blessing of Jacob, emphasizing God's power to bring about the unexpected and the miraculous.
orig: وامرأته قائمة فضحكت فبشرناها بإسحاق ومن وراء إسحاق يعقوب

translation: She said, 'Woe is me! Shall I bear a child when I am an old woman, and this, my husband, is an old man? Indeed, this is a strange thing.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the astonishment and incredulity of the wife of the old man at the news of her pregnancy, emphasizing the miraculous nature of the event and the power of God to bring about unexpected and extraordinary occurrences.
orig: قالت يا ويلتى أألد وأنا عجوز وهذا بعلي شيخا إن هذا لشيء عجيب

translation: They say: 'Do you wonder at the mercy of Allah?' Allah's mercy and His blessings are upon you, O people of the house. Indeed, He is worthy of praise, full of glory.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of recognizing and appreciating the blessings and mercy of God, which are often overlooked or taken for granted, and emphasizes the need to acknowledge and express gratitude for these favors.
orig: قالوا أتعجبين من أمر الله رحمت الله وبركاته عليكم أهل البيت إنه حميد مجيد

translation: And when the fear had left Abraham and the good news had come to him, he began to argue with Us for the people of Lot.
interpretation: The verse highlights Abraham's selfless and compassionate nature, as he immediately starts to plead with God for the salvation of the people of Lot, despite having just received the good news of a son, demonstrating his concern for the welfare of others.
orig: فلما ذهب عن إبراهيم الروع وجاءته البشرى يجادلنا في قوم لوط

translation: Indeed, Ibrahim was a nation, obedient, and turning back [to Allah].
interpretation: The verse highlights Ibrahim's exceptional character, emphasizing his obedience to Allah and his ability to turn back to Him in repentance, making him a role model for believers to emulate.
orig: إن إبراهيم لحليم أواه منيب

translation: O Ibrahim, leave this, the command of your Lord has come, and indeed, they will be brought a punishment that cannot be repelled.
interpretation: The verse highlights the inevitability of God's punishment, emphasizing that once His decree has been issued, it cannot be averted or delayed, and those who have earned His wrath will surely face the consequences.
orig: يا إبراهيم أعرض عن هذا إنه قد جاء أمر ربك وإنهم آتيهم عذاب غير مردود

translation: And when Our messengers came to Lot, he was distressed and felt straitened because of them, and said: 'This is a distressful day.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the emotional state of Prophet Lot, who felt anxious and distressed when the angels came to him, indicating the weight of responsibility he felt in protecting his guests from the evil intentions of his people.
orig: ولما جاءت رسلنا لوطا سيء بهم وضاق بهم ذرعا وقال هذا يوم عصيب

translation: And his people came rushing towards him, and they had been doing evil deeds before. He said, 'O my people, these are my daughters, they are purer for you, so fear Allah and do not shame me in my guests. Is there not among you a right-minded man?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of protecting guests and treating them with respect, as the host takes responsibility for their safety and well-being, and expects his people to behave with dignity and integrity in their presence.
orig: وجاءه قومه يهرعون إليه ومن قبل كانوا يعملون السيئات قال يا قوم هؤلاء بناتي هن أطهر لكم فاتقوا الله ولا تخزون في ضيفي أليس منكم رجل رشيد

translation: They said: 'You know that we have no right to your daughters, and indeed you know what we want.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the audacity and shamelessness of the people who are making demands, as they openly acknowledge that they have no legitimate claim, yet still insist on getting what they want, revealing their arrogance and disregard for what is right.
orig: قالوا لقد علمت ما لنا في بناتك من حق وإنك لتعلم ما نريد

translation: He said: 'If only I had the strength or could take refuge in a strong stronghold.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the human tendency to seek refuge in worldly powers or material strength when faced with difficulties, rather than turning to God, emphasizing the limitations and inadequacies of human efforts in the face of adversity.
orig: قال لو أن لي بكم قوة أو آوي إلى ركن شديد

translation: They said, 'O Lot, we are the messengers of your Lord; they will not reach you, so set out with your family during a part of the night, and let not anyone of you look back, except your wife; indeed, she will be struck by what strikes them. Indeed, their appointment is for the morning. Is not the morning near?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the urgency and swiftness of God's punishment, emphasizing that it can come at any moment, even in the morning, and that those who are warned should take immediate action to save themselves.
orig: قالوا يا لوط إنا رسل ربك لن يصلوا إليك فأسر بأهلك بقطع من الليل ولا يلتفت منكم أحد إلا امرأتك إنه مصيبها ما أصابهم إن موعدهم الصبح أليس الصبح بقريب

translation: And when Our command came, We turned it upside down and rained upon it stones of baked clay, one upon another.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's absolute power and control over the universe, where He can turn a thriving city into a desolate wasteland, and unleash a devastating punishment in the form of a rain of stones, demonstrating His ability to transform and destroy with ease.
orig: فلما جاء أمرنا جعلنا عاليها سافلها وأمطرنا عليها حجارة من سجيل منضود

translation: Reserved with your Lord, and it is not far from the wrongdoers.
interpretation: The verse implies that the punishment for the wrongdoers is already decreed and recorded with God, and it will inevitably come to pass, emphasizing the inevitability and certainty of God's justice.
orig: مسومة عند ربك وما هي من الظالمين ببعيد

translation: And to Midian, their brother Shu'aib. He said: 'O my people! Worship Allah, you have no god other than Him. And do not decrease the measure and the scale. I see you in prosperity, and I fear for you the punishment of a surrounding Day.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of fairness and justice in trade and commerce, as emphasized by Prophet Shu'aib, who warned his people against cheating and exploiting others, and instead, encouraged them to worship Allah and follow the principles of justice and fairness.
orig: وإلى مدين أخاهم شعيبا قال يا قوم اعبدوا الله ما لكم من إله غيره ولا تنقصوا المكيال والميزان إني أراكم بخير وإني أخاف عليكم عذاب يوم محيط

translation: O my people! Give just measure and weight, nor withhold from the people the things that are their due, and do not mischief on the earth, causing corruption.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of fairness and justice in all aspects of life, encouraging individuals to be honest and truthful in their dealings with others, and to avoid causing harm or corruption to the natural world or to other people.
orig: ويا قوم أوفوا المكيال والميزان بالقسط ولا تبخسوا الناس أشياءهم ولا تعثوا في الأرض مفسدين

translation: The bounty of Allah is better for you, if you are believers. And I am not a keeper over you.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the idea that God's guidance and protection are far more valuable than any human guidance or protection, and that one should rely solely on God's mercy and trust in His plan.
orig: بقيت الله خير لكم إن كنتم مؤمنين وما أنا عليكم بحفيظ

translation: They said: 'O Shu'aib! Does your prayer command you that we give up what our fathers used to worship, or that we give up doing what we like with our property? You are indeed a wise and noble advisor.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the reluctance of the people to abandon their idolatrous practices and their selfish desires, and how they try to justify their actions by questioning the motives of the prophet Shu'aib, implying that he is trying to impose his own will on them, rather than following the divine guidance.
orig: قالوا يا شعيب أصلاتك تأمرك أن نترك ما يعبد آباؤنا أو أن نفعل في أموالنا ما نشاء إنك لأنت الحليم الرشيد

translation: He said, 'O my people, have you considered if I am on clear proof from my Lord and He has provided me with good provision from Him, and I do not wish to differ from you to that which you reject of it. I only intend reform as much as I am able, and my success is not but through Allah. Upon Him I have relied, and to Him I turn.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of staying true to one's conviction and faith, even in the face of opposition and rejection from others, and trusting in God's guidance and support in the pursuit of reform and righteousness.
orig: قال يا قوم أرأيتم إن كنت على بينة من ربي ورزقني منه رزقا حسنا وما أريد أن أخالفكم إلى ما أنهاكم عنه إن أريد إلا الإصلاح ما استطعت وما توفيقي إلا بالله عليه توكلت وإليه أنيب

translation: O my people, let not my dissent be a cause of your destruction, as it was with the people of Noah, or the people of Hud, or the people of Salih; and the people of Lot are not far from you.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of learning from the mistakes of previous nations that were punished by God for their disobedience, and serves as a warning to the current generation to avoid the same fate by heeding the warnings and commands of the prophets.
orig: ويا قوم لا يجرمنكم شقاقي أن يصيبكم مثل ما أصاب قوم نوح أو قوم هود أو قوم صالح وما قوم لوط منكم ببعيد

translation: And ask forgiveness of your Lord, then turn to Him; indeed, my Lord is Merciful, Loving.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of seeking forgiveness from God and turning to Him in repentance, emphasizing that God's mercy and love are always available to those who sincerely seek forgiveness and return to Him.
orig: واستغفروا ربكم ثم توبوا إليه إن ربي رحيم ودود

translation: They said: 'O Shu'aib! We do not understand much of what you say, and we see you as weak among us, and were it not for your family, we would have stoned you, and you are not powerful against us.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the way people often respond to prophetic messages, rejecting the truth and instead focusing on the perceived weaknesses of the messenger, in this case, Shu'aib's lack of power and influence among his people.
orig: قالوا يا شعيب ما نفقه كثيرا مما تقول وإنا لنراك فينا ضعيفا ولولا رهطك لرجمناك وما أنت علينا بعزيز

translation: He said: O my people, have I not forbidden you from worshiping anything except Allah? And I fear for you the punishment of a mighty day. My Lord encompasses what you do.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of accountability and the all-encompassing nature of God's knowledge, emphasizing that God is fully aware of human actions and will hold them accountable for their deeds.
orig: قال يا قوم أرهطي أعز عليكم من الله واتخذتموه وراءكم ظهريا إن ربي بما تعملون محيط

translation: O my people, act according to your ability, I am acting, soon you will know who will be punished with a punishment that will humiliate him, and who is a liar, and wait, I am waiting with you.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of accountability, emphasizing that both the prophet and his people will be held accountable for their actions, and that the consequences of their deeds will soon become apparent, serving as a warning to those who reject the truth and a reassurance to those who believe.
orig: ويا قوم اعملوا على مكانتكم إني عامل سوف تعلمون من يأتيه عذاب يخزيه ومن هو كاذب وارتقبوا إني معكم رقيب

translation: And when Our command came, We saved Shu'aib and those who believed with him, by a mercy from Us, and the unjust were seized by the cry, and they became, in their homes, fallen on their knees.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of obedience to God's prophets, as those who believed in Shu'aib were saved, while those who disobeyed were punished, emphasizing the contrast between the fate of the righteous and the wicked.
orig: ولما جاء أمرنا نجينا شعيبا والذين آمنوا معه برحمة منا وأخذت الذين ظلموا الصيحة فأصبحوا في ديارهم جاثمين

translation: As if they had not dwelled therein, (it is) as if Thamud had not dwelled in it.
interpretation: The verse highlights the complete destruction of a town, emphasizing that it was left in a state as if it had never been inhabited, just like the town of Thamud which was also destroyed by God's wrath.
orig: كأن لم يغنوا فيها ألا بعدا لمدين كما بعدت ثمود

translation: And indeed We sent Moses with Our signs and a clear authority.
interpretation: This verse highlights the significance of Moses' prophethood, emphasizing that he was sent by God with clear signs and authority, implying that his message was not a personal opinion, but a divinely ordained mission.
orig: ولقد أرسلنا موسى بآياتنا وسلطان مبين

translation: To Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they followed the command of Pharaoh, and the command of Pharaoh was not rightly guided.
interpretation: The verse highlights the blind obedience of Pharaoh's followers, who prioritized their loyalty to their ruler over the guidance of God, and thus fell prey to Pharaoh's misguided leadership.
orig: إلى فرعون وملئه فاتبعوا أمر فرعون وما أمر فرعون برشيد

translation: He will precede his people on the Day of Resurrection, and will lead them into the Fire, and evil is the place to which they are led.
interpretation: The verse highlights the accountability of leaders and guides who mislead their followers, and how they will be held responsible for their actions on the Day of Judgment, leading their people to the Fire, emphasizing the gravity of their wrongdoings.
orig: يقدم قومه يوم القيامة فأوردهم النار وبئس الورد المورود

translation: And they will be followed by a curse in this world and on the Day of Resurrection. Evil is the gift that will be given.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of rejecting God's message, where those who do so will not only suffer in this world but also in the Hereafter, emphasizing the gravity of their mistake and the terrible fate that awaits them.
orig: وأتبعوا في هذه لعنة ويوم القيامة بئس الرفد المرفود

translation: That is of the news of the towns which We recount to you, some of them are standing and some have been mown down.
interpretation: The verse suggests that the stories of the destroyed towns serve as a lesson and a warning to the current generation, implying that the fate of those towns can be repeated if they do not learn from their mistakes.
orig: ذلك من أنباء القرى نقصه عليك منها قائم وحصيد

translation: And We wronged them not, but they wronged themselves; and their gods, which they called upon besides Allah, did not avail them aught when the Commandment of your Lord came, and they added to them nothing but ruin.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of personal responsibility, emphasizing that individuals are accountable for their own actions and cannot blame others or their circumstances for their downfall.
orig: وما ظلمناهم ولكن ظلموا أنفسهم فما أغنت عنهم آلهتهم التي يدعون من دون الله من شيء لما جاء أمر ربك وما زادوهم غير تتبيب

translation: And thus your Lord seized (punished) when He seized the towns, while they were unjust, indeed His seizure is painful, severe.
interpretation: The verse highlights the severity and intensity of God's punishment when He decides to seize or punish a town or a community that has become unjust and corrupt, implying that those who are guilty of injustice should be prepared to face the wrath of God.
orig: وكذلك أخذ ربك إذا أخذ القرى وهي ظالمة إن أخذه أليم شديد

translation: Indeed, in that is a sign for whoever fears the punishment of the Hereafter. That is a Day for which people will be gathered, and that is a Day which will be witnessed.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of remembering the Day of Judgment, when all humanity will be gathered and witness the consequences of their actions, and serves as a reminder to those who fear God's punishment to reflect on their deeds and strive for righteousness.
orig: إن في ذلك لآية لمن خاف عذاب الآخرة ذلك يوم مجموع له الناس وذلك يوم مشهود

translation: And We only delay it for a specified term.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's mercy and patience, giving humanity a limited time to repent and change their ways before facing the consequences of their actions.
orig: وما نؤخره إلا لأجل معدود

translation: A day will come when no soul will speak except by His permission, so some will be miserable and others happy
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that on the Day of Judgment, only those who have been granted permission by God will be able to speak, implying that the righteous will be able to present their case and the wicked will be silenced, leading to their misery and the happiness of the believers.
orig: يوم يأت لا تكلم نفس إلا بإذنه فمنهم شقي وسعيد

translation: But as for those who are wretched, they will be in the Fire, wherein there will be for them a groaning and a wailing.
interpretation: The verse highlights the contrast between the bliss of the righteous and the torment of the wicked, emphasizing that the suffering of the latter is not just physical, but also emotional, as they will be overwhelmed by feelings of despair and regret.
orig: فأما الذين شقوا ففي النار لهم فيها زفير وشهيق

translation: Abiding therein so long as the heavens and the earth endure, except what your Lord wills. Your Lord is the Doer of what He intends.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's absolute power and authority, emphasizing that His will is unstoppable and inevitable, and that He will accomplish what He intends, regardless of any obstacles or opposition.
orig: خالدين فيها ما دامت السماوات والأرض إلا ما شاء ربك إن ربك فعال لما يريد

translation: And as for those who were [destined to be] fortunate, they will be in Paradise, abiding therein as long as the heavens and the earth endure, except what your Lord wills - a gift unceasing.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that the ultimate reward for the righteous is not just a temporary pleasure, but a permanent and eternal bliss in Paradise, where they will reside as long as the universe exists, emphasizing the boundless and endless nature of God's favor and generosity.
orig: وأما الذين سعدوا ففي الجنة خالدين فيها ما دامت السماوات والأرض إلا ما شاء ربك عطاء غير مجذوذ

translation: So be not thou in doubt of that which these people worship; they worship now as their fathers worshipped aforetime; and We shall certainly give them their full share, not diminishing to them anything.
interpretation: The verse highlights the cyclical nature of human behavior, where people tend to follow the same patterns of worship and behavior as their ancestors, without questioning or reflecting on the truth, and that God will ultimately hold them accountable for their actions.
orig: فلا تك في مرية مما يعبد هؤلاء ما يعبدون إلا كما يعبد آباؤهم من قبل وإنا لموفوهم نصيبهم غير منقوص

translation: And indeed We gave Moses the Book, but it was disputed, and if not for a word that preceded from your Lord, it would have been judged between them, and indeed they are in grave doubt about it.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of divine guidance in resolving disputes and uncertainties, suggesting that without God's intervention, people would be left in a state of confusion and doubt, unable to come to a consensus or find clarity.
orig: ولقد آتينا موسى الكتاب فاختلف فيه ولولا كلمة سبقت من ربك لقضي بينهم وإنهم لفي شك منه مريب

translation: And indeed, your Lord is going to take them to task for their deeds, for He is All-Aware of what they do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes God's omniscience and His ability to hold people accountable for their actions, implying that no deed, no matter how small, will go unnoticed or unpunished.
orig: وإن كلا لما ليوفينهم ربك أعمالهم إنه بما يعملون خبير

translation: So stand you firm as you are commanded and those who turn (to Allah) with you, and do not transgress. Indeed, He is All-Seer of what you do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of perseverance and steadfastness in one's faith and actions, and serves as a reminder that God is always watching and aware of everything that individuals do.
orig: فاستقم كما أمرت ومن تاب معك ولا تطغوا إنه بما تعملون بصير

translation: And do not incline towards those who do wrong, lest the Fire should touch you, and you have none to protect you from Allah, then you would not be helped.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of not befriending or supporting those who engage in wrongdoing, as it can lead to spiritual harm and even damnation, emphasizing the idea that association with evil can have severe consequences.
orig: ولا تركنوا إلى الذين ظلموا فتمسكم النار وما لكم من دون الله من أولياء ثم لا تنصرون

translation: And establish the prayer at the two ends of the day and at the approach of the night, indeed the good deeds remove the evil deeds, that is a reminder for the mindful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of prayer in wiping out the effects of sinful actions, implying that a strong spiritual connection with God can erase the negative consequences of one's mistakes, and serves as a reminder for those who are mindful and reflective.
orig: وأقم الصلاة طرفي النهار وزلفا من الليل إن الحسنات يذهبن السيئات ذلك ذكرى للذاكرين

translation: And be patient, indeed Allah will not allow to be lost the reward of the doers of good.
interpretation: The verse is encouraging believers to be patient in the face of adversity, promising that their good deeds will not go unrewarded, and that God will ultimately compensate them for their efforts.
orig: واصبر فإن الله لا يضيع أجر المحسنين

translation: Why were there not among the generations before you, persons possessed of understanding, prohibiting mischief on the earth, except a few among them whom We saved? And those who were unjust pursued what they were given, and they were criminals.
interpretation: The verse highlights the rarity of individuals who possess understanding and wisdom, and how they are often unable to prevent the spread of evil and corruption, emphasizing the importance of individual responsibility in promoting justice and righteousness.
orig: فلولا كان من القرون من قبلكم أولو بقية ينهون عن الفساد في الأرض إلا قليلا ممن أنجينا منهم واتبع الذين ظلموا ما أترفوا فيه وكانوا مجرمين

translation: And your Lord would not destroy the towns unjustly while their people are reformers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes God's justice and mercy, implying that He would not punish a town that has righteous people in it, as their presence would prevent the destruction of the town, highlighting the importance of the righteous individuals in a society.
orig: وما كان ربك ليهلك القرى بظلم وأهلها مصلحون

translation: And if your Lord had willed, He would have made mankind one nation, but they will continue to differ.
interpretation: The verse highlights the inevitability of human diversity and disagreement, implying that God's will is not to impose uniformity, but rather to allow humanity to exercise its free will, leading to a multitude of beliefs, opinions, and perspectives.
orig: ولو شاء ربك لجعل الناس أمة واحدة ولا يزالون مختلفين

translation: Except for those on whom your Lord has bestowed His mercy, and for that He did create them, and the Word of your Lord is fulfilled: 'I will fill Hell with jinn and humans all together.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that God's mercy is the only thing that can save individuals from the punishment of Hell, implying that those who are not recipients of God's mercy are doomed to suffer eternal punishment.
orig: إلا من رحم ربك ولذلك خلقهم وتمت كلمة ربك لأملأن جهنم من الجنة والناس أجمعين

translation: And We relate to you some of the news of the Messengers, that We may make your heart firm thereby, and there has come to you in this truth and an admonition and a reminder to the believers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of learning from the stories of the prophets, as they serve as a source of comfort, guidance, and inspiration for believers, helping them to stay firm in their faith and reminding them of the truth and wisdom of God's message.
orig: وكلا نقص عليك من أنباء الرسل ما نثبت به فؤادك وجاءك في هذه الحق وموعظة وذكرى للمؤمنين

translation: And say to those who do not believe, 'Act according to your ability; indeed, we are acting.'
interpretation: The verse is a call to action, urging those who do not believe to take responsibility for their actions, implying that they will be held accountable for their deeds, just as believers will be rewarded for theirs.
orig: وقل للذين لا يؤمنون اعملوا على مكانتكم إنا عاملون

translation: And wait, indeed We are waiting.
interpretation: The verse conveys a sense of mutual anticipation between God and humanity, where God is waiting for humanity to turn to Him, and humanity is waiting for God's judgment or mercy, emphasizing the reciprocal nature of the relationship between God and humanity.
orig: وانتظروا إنا منتظرون

translation: And to Allah belongs the unseen of the heavens and the earth, and to Him return all matters, so worship Him and put your trust in Him, and your Lord is not unaware of what you do.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the all-encompassing knowledge and power of God, highlighting that nothing escapes His awareness, and that He is the ultimate authority who will hold humanity accountable for their actions.
orig: ولله غيب السماوات والأرض وإليه يرجع الأمر كله فاعبده وتوكل عليه وما ربك بغافل عما تعملون

translation: Those are the verses of the Clear Book.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the clarity and transparency of the divine message, implying that the guidance and wisdom contained in the Quran are unmistakable and easy to understand, leaving no excuse for those who reject or ignore it.
orig: الر تلك آيات الكتاب المبين

translation: Indeed, We have sent it down as an Arabic Quran so that you may understand.
interpretation: This verse highlights the significance of the Quran being revealed in the Arabic language, emphasizing that this was a deliberate choice made by God to facilitate the understanding of the message by the people it was initially addressed to, and by extension, to all humanity.
orig: إنا أنزلناه قرآنا عربيا لعلكم تعقلون

translation: We relate to you the best of the stories, with its inspiration We have revealed to you this Quran, and indeed you were of the unaware.
interpretation: The verse highlights the unique nature of the Quran as a divine revelation, emphasizing that it is a gift from God to humanity, and that its message is a blessing that can awaken even those who were previously unaware or ignorant of the truth.
orig: نحن نقص عليك أحسن القصص بما أوحينا إليك هذا القرآن وإن كنت من قبله لمن الغافلين

translation: When Joseph said to his father, 'O my father, indeed I saw eleven stars and the sun and the moon - I saw them prostrating to me.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the innocence and purity of Joseph's heart, as he shares his dream with his father, demonstrating his humility and lack of arrogance, despite being the central figure in the dream, and foreshadowing his future role as a leader.
orig: إذ قال يوسف لأبيه يا أبت إني رأيت أحد عشر كوكبا والشمس والقمر رأيتهم لي ساجدين

translation: He said, 'O my son, do not relate your vision to your brothers, lest they plot against you. Indeed, Satan is to man a clear enemy.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of discretion and caution when sharing personal matters, especially with those who may harbor jealousy or ill intentions, as they may use that information to harm or plot against you.
orig: قال يا بني لا تقصص رؤياك على إخوتك فيكيدوا لك كيدا إن الشيطان للإنسان عدو مبين

translation: And thus will your Lord choose you and teach you the interpretation of narratives and complete His favor upon you and upon the family of Jacob, as He completed it upon your two forefathers before, Abraham and Isaac. Indeed, your Lord is Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: The verse highlights the special status of the Prophet Muhammad, who was chosen by God and taught the deeper meaning of the stories of the past, and emphasizes that God's favor upon him and his family is a continuation of the same favor bestowed upon his noble ancestors, Abraham and Isaac, underscoring God's infinite wisdom and knowledge.
orig: وكذلك يجتبيك ربك ويعلمك من تأويل الأحاديث ويتم نعمته عليك وعلى آل يعقوب كما أتمها على أبويك من قبل إبراهيم وإسحاق إن ربك عليم حكيم

translation: Indeed, in the story of Joseph and his brothers there were signs for those who ask.
interpretation: The verse suggests that the story of Joseph and his brothers contains valuable lessons and moral guidance for those who seek knowledge and wisdom.
orig: لقد كان في يوسف وإخوته آيات للسائلين

translation: When they said: 'Joseph and his brother are loved by our father more than us, and we are a strong group, indeed our father is in clear error.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the jealousy and resentment that can arise in families when one sibling is favored over others, and how this can lead to feelings of injustice and rebellion.
orig: إذ قالوا ليوسف وأخوه أحب إلى أبينا منا ونحن عصبة إن أبانا لفي ضلال مبين

translation: Kill Joseph or cast him out to some land, so that your father's face will be free for you, and you will be a righteous people after him.
interpretation: The verse highlights the selfish and shortsighted nature of human beings, who are willing to sacrifice the well-being of others, even a loved one, in order to gain temporary benefits or relief, without considering the long-term consequences of their actions.
orig: اقتلوا يوسف أو اطرحوه أرضا يخل لكم وجه أبيكم وتكونوا من بعده قوما صالحين

translation: One from among them said: 'Do not kill Joseph, but throw him into the darkness of the well; some caravan will pick him up, if you must do something.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the role of a compassionate and wise individual who tries to prevent a greater evil by suggesting an alternative, which, although still harmful, is less severe than the original plan, demonstrating the importance of mercy and compassion in human decision-making.
orig: قال قائل منهم لا تقتلوا يوسف وألقوه في غيابت الجب يلتقطه بعض السيارة إن كنتم فاعلين

translation: They said: 'O our father, why do you not trust us with Yusuf, and we are indeed his well-wishers?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the brothers' attempt to deceive their father by appearing to be concerned about Yusuf's well-being, while in reality, they were plotting against him, demonstrating the subtle yet significant distinction between outward appearances and inner intentions.
orig: قالوا يا أبانا ما لك لا تأمنا على يوسف وإنا له لناصحون

translation: Send him with us tomorrow that he may enjoy himself and play, and indeed, We will be his guardians.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concern and care that God has for His prophets, as exemplified in the story of Moses, where God ensures his safety and protection.
orig: أرسله معنا غدا يرتع ويلعب وإنا له لحافظون

translation: He said: 'I fear that if you take him away, the wolf will eat him while you are unaware.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of taking responsibility and being vigilant in protecting those in our care, lest they fall prey to the dangers and evils that lurk in the world.
orig: قال إني ليحزنني أن تذهبوا به وأخاف أن يأكله الذئب وأنتم عنه غافلون

translation: They said: 'If a wolf devours him while we are a group, we are indeed losers.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the cowardice and lack of responsibility among the brothers, as they try to shift the blame and consequences of their actions onto fate or external circumstances, rather than taking accountability for their own decisions and actions.
orig: قالوا لئن أكله الذئب ونحن عصبة إنا إذا لخاسرون

translation: And when they went away with him and agreed to put him in the pit, and We revealed to him that he would inform them of their affair, and they did not perceive.
interpretation: The verse highlights the theme of divine guidance and protection, where God intervenes to help His prophet, despite the malicious intentions of others, and ultimately allows him to uncover the truth and reveal it to those who sought to harm him.
orig: فلما ذهبوا به وأجمعوا أن يجعلوه في غيابت الجب وأوحينا إليه لتنبئنهم بأمرهم هذا وهم لا يشعرون

translation: And they came to their father in the evening, weeping.
interpretation: The verse conveys the idea that the sons of Jacob, who had deceived their father, are now filled with remorse and regret, and are seeking forgiveness and reconciliation, which highlights the significance of seeking forgiveness and making amends for past mistakes.
orig: وجاءوا أباهم عشاء يبكون

translation: They said, 'O our father, we went to race and left Joseph with our belongings, and the wolf ate him, and you will not believe us even if we are truthful.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the deceitful nature of humans, as the brothers of Joseph are trying to deceive their father by lying about the circumstances of Joseph's disappearance, and at the same time, they are aware that their father will not believe them, implying that they have a history of dishonesty.
orig: قالوا يا أبانا إنا ذهبنا نستبق وتركنا يوسف عند متاعنا فأكله الذئب وما أنت بمؤمن لنا ولو كنا صادقين

translation: And they brought his shirt with false blood. He said: 'Nay, but your own selves have made up a tale. So (I will bear) beautiful patience. And Allah is He Whom I seek for help against that which you describe.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of patience and trust in God in the face of false accusations and trials, as exemplified by the story of Prophet Yusuf.
orig: وجاءوا على قميصه بدم كذب قال بل سولت لكم أنفسكم أمرا فصبر جميل والله المستعان على ما تصفون

translation: And a caravan came, and they sent their water-drawer, and he let down his bucket. He said, 'Good news! This is a boy.' And they hid him as merchandise. And Allah is All-Aware of what they do.
interpretation: The verse highlights the contrast between the superficial good news of finding a valuable commodity and the moral darkness of treating a human being as merchandise, implying that true goodness and awareness can only come from recognizing the inherent value and dignity of human life.
orig: وجاءت سيارة فأرسلوا واردهم فأدلى دلوه قال يا بشرى هذا غلام وأسروه بضاعة والله عليم بما يعملون

translation: And they sold him for a low price, a few dirhams, and they were, concerning him, among those who were not concerned.
interpretation: The verse highlights the devaluation of a precious asset, in this case, a human being, and how those who should have been concerned about his well-being were instead indifferent, revealing a society that has lost its moral compass.
orig: وشروه بثمن بخس دراهم معدودة وكانوا فيه من الزاهدين

translation: And the one who bought him in Egypt said to his wife, 'Honor his residence, perhaps he may benefit us or we may adopt him as a son.' And thus We established Joseph in the land and to teach him the interpretation of events. And Allah is predominant over His affair, but most people do not know.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of recognizing and appreciating the value of those who have been marginalized or overlooked, as Joseph was, and giving them the opportunity to flourish and reach their full potential, leading to benefits for all.
orig: وقال الذي اشتراه من مصر لامرأته أكرمي مثواه عسى أن ينفعنا أو نتخذه ولدا وكذلك مكنا ليوسف في الأرض ولنعلمه من تأويل الأحاديث والله غالب على أمره ولكن أكثر الناس لا يعلمون

translation: And when he reached his full strength, We granted him wisdom and knowledge, and thus We reward the doers of good.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of spiritual maturity and the reward that comes with it, suggesting that those who strive to do good will be granted wisdom, knowledge, and spiritual growth, which are essential for a fulfilling life.
orig: ولما بلغ أشده آتيناه حكما وعلما وكذلك نجزي المحسنين

translation: And he entered the house in which she was, and bolted the doors and said: 'Refuge with Allah. Indeed, it is he who has given me a goodly residence. Indeed, the wrongdoers will not succeed.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of seeking refuge in God and trusting in His providence, especially in times of crisis or temptation, as Joseph did when he was faced with the seductive advances of his master's wife.
orig: وراودته التي هو في بيتها عن نفسه وغلقت الأبواب وقالت هيت لك قال معاذ الله إنه ربي أحسن مثواي إنه لا يفلح الظالمون

translation: And indeed, he had resolved to kill him, and he would have killed him, but for that he saw the proof of his Lord. Thus We turned away from him evil and indecency. Indeed, he was of Our sincere servants.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of faith and trust in God, as it was the divine intervention that saved the prophet from being killed, demonstrating that true believers are under God's protection.
orig: ولقد همت به وهم بها لولا أن رأى برهان ربه كذلك لنصرف عنه السوء والفحشاء إنه من عبادنا المخلصين

translation: And they both hastened to the door, and she tore his shirt from behind, and they found her lord near the door. She said: 'What is the recompense of him who intended evil to your people, except that he should be imprisoned or a painful torment?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the cunning and resourcefulness of the woman, who not only outwits her would-be seducer but also turns the tables on him, threatening him with punishment and humiliation, thereby protecting her honor and dignity.
orig: واستبقا الباب وقدت قميصه من دبر وألفيا سيدها لدى الباب قالت ما جزاء من أراد بأهلك سوءا إلا أن يسجن أو عذاب أليم

translation: She said: He solicited me against myself, and a witness from her family testified: 'If his shirt is torn from the front, then she has told the truth and he is of the liars.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of preserving one's dignity and protecting oneself from false accusations, emphasizing the need for witnesses and evidence in establishing the truth.
orig: قال هي راودتني عن نفسي وشهد شاهد من أهلها إن كان قميصه قد من قبل فصدقت وهو من الكاذبين

translation: And if his shirt is torn from behind, then he has lied, and he is of the truthful.
interpretation: The verse suggests that a person who is accused of a crime or wrongdoing will often show signs of guilt or nervousness, such as torn clothing, and this can be an indication of their deception, whereas a truthful person would not exhibit such behavior.
orig: وإن كان قميصه قد من دبر فكذبت وهو من الصادقين

translation: And when he saw his shirt torn from the back, he said: 'Indeed, it is from your guile, indeed, your guile is great.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the wisdom and discernment of Prophet Yusuf, who was able to see through the deceitful plan of his brothers and recognize their cunning and cleverness.
orig: فلما رأى قميصه قد من دبر قال إنه من كيدكن إن كيدكن عظيم

translation: Joseph, turn away from this, and ask forgiveness for your sin, indeed you were of the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse suggests that even the righteous and pious individuals, like Joseph, can make mistakes and err, but it is their ability to recognize and seek forgiveness that sets them apart, and serves as a model for others to follow.
orig: يوسف أعرض عن هذا واستغفري لذنبك إنك كنت من الخاطئين

translation: And women in the city said, 'The wife of al-'Aziz is seeking to seduce her slave boy, he has smitten her heart with love; indeed, we see her in manifest error.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the gossip and slander that can spread quickly in a community, often fueled by jealousy and ignorance, and how it can lead to false accusations and misunderstandings.
orig: وقال نسوة في المدينة امرأت العزيز تراود فتاها عن نفسه قد شغفها حبا إنا لنراها في ضلال مبين

translation: And when she heard of their plot, she sent for them and prepared a banquet for them, and gave each of them a knife, and said: 'Get out to them!' So when they saw him, they were amazed by him and cut their hands, and said: 'Glory be to Allah! This is not a human being, but a noble angel!'
interpretation: The verse highlights the reaction of the women who were amazed by the beauty of Prophet Yusuf, and their subsequent loss of self-control, which led them to cut their hands in astonishment, demonstrating the extraordinary nature of his physical appearance and the impact it had on those who saw him.
orig: فلما سمعت بمكرهن أرسلت إليهن وأعتدت لهن متكأ وآتت كل واحدة منهن سكينا وقالت اخرج عليهن فلما رأينه أكبرنه وقطعن أيديهن وقلن حاش لله ما هذا بشرا إن هذا إلا ملك كريم

translation: She said: 'This is he about whom you have doubted my chastity! I had sought to seduce him, but he preserved himself. Yet had he not already refused, he would have been imprisoned, and would have been of the humbled.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of self-control and moral integrity, as exemplified by the character of Joseph, who resisted the temptation and preserved his chastity, and thus avoided the consequences of sin.
orig: قالت فذلكن الذي لمتنني فيه ولقد راودته عن نفسه فاستعصم ولئن لم يفعل ما آمره ليسجنن وليكونا من الصاغرين

translation: He said: My Lord, the prison is dearer to me than that to which they invite me. Unless You turn away their guile from me, I may incline towards them and become of the ignorant.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of seeking spiritual guidance and protection from God in the face of temptation and deception, as Joseph did in this story, and the need to remain vigilant and humble in the pursuit of righteousness.
orig: قال رب السجن أحب إلي مما يدعونني إليه وإلا تصرف عني كيدهن أصب إليهن وأكن من الجاهلين

translation: So his Lord responded to him and turned away from him their guile; indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that God is always attentive to the prayers and cries of His faithful servants, and He responds to them by protecting them from the evil plans of their enemies.
orig: فاستجاب له ربه فصرف عنه كيدهن إنه هو السميع العليم

translation: Then it became clear to them, after they had seen the signs, that they would be imprisoned until the Hour.
interpretation: The verse highlights the irony of people who, despite witnessing clear signs and evidence of God's power, still refuse to believe and instead become even more entrenched in their disbelief, ultimately sealing their own fate and ensuring their punishment on the Day of Judgment.
orig: ثم بدا لهم من بعد ما رأوا الآيات ليسجننه حتى حين

translation: And he entered the prison with him two young men. One of them said: 'I see myself pressing wine.' The other said: 'I see myself carrying bread on my head, and the birds eating from it.' Inform us of its interpretation, for indeed we see you of the doers of good.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of spiritual guidance and the role of righteous individuals in providing insight and wisdom to those who seek it, emphasizing the value of seeking knowledge and understanding from those who possess it.
orig: ودخل معه السجن فتيان قال أحدهما إني أراني أعصر خمرا وقال الآخر إني أراني أحمل فوق رأسي خبزا تأكل الطير منه نبئنا بتأويله إنا نراك من المحسنين

translation: He said: 'No food will come to you, which is provided for you, unless I inform you of its interpretation before it comes to you; that is of what my Lord has taught me, for I have abandoned the religion of a people who do not believe in Allah and the Hereafter, and they reject.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of spiritual knowledge and insight, emphasizing that true understanding and interpretation of events can only come from divine guidance and revelation, and not from human wisdom or intellect alone.
orig: قال لا يأتيكما طعام ترزقانه إلا نبأتكما بتأويله قبل أن يأتيكما ذلكما مما علمني ربي إني تركت ملة قوم لا يؤمنون بالله وهم بالآخرة هم كافرون

translation: I followed the religion of my fathers, Abraham and Isaac and Jacob; it is not for us to associate anything with Allah, that is of the favor of Allah upon us and upon the people, but most of the people do not give thanks.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of gratitude and recognizing the blessings and favors bestowed upon humanity by God, emphasizing that most people fail to acknowledge and appreciate these blessings.
orig: واتبعت ملة آبائي إبراهيم وإسحاق ويعقوب ما كان لنا أن نشرك بالله من شيء ذلك من فضل الله علينا وعلى الناس ولكن أكثر الناس لا يشكرون

translation: O my companion of the prison, are many different lords better, or Allah, the One, the Irresistible?
interpretation: The verse highlights the contrast between the false sense of security and power that comes from relying on multiple earthly lords, versus the absolute and irresistible power of the One true God, Allah.
orig: يا صاحبي السجن أأرباب متفرقون خير أم الله الواحد القهار

translation: You do not worship besides Him except names that you and your fathers have named, for which Allah has sent down no authority. The command is only for Allah. Has He not commanded that you worship not except Him? That is the straight religion, but most of the people do not know.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of worshiping only Allah, the one true God, and not associating partners with Him, as the worship of idols or false deities is a result of human innovation and has no divine authority.
orig: ما تعبدون من دونه إلا أسماء سميتموها أنتم وآباؤكم ما أنزل الله بها من سلطان إن الحكم إلا لله أمر ألا تعبدوا إلا إياه ذلك الدين القيم ولكن أكثر الناس لا يعلمون

translation: O two companions of the prison, as for one of you, he will pour wine for his lord, and as for the other, he will be crucified, and the birds will eat from his head, the matter has been decreed concerning which you both inquire.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of fate and the inevitability of one's destiny, as the two prisoners are told that their futures are already predetermined and cannot be changed, emphasizing the idea that God's will is unalterable.
orig: يا صاحبي السجن أما أحدكما فيسقي ربه خمرا وأما الآخر فيصلب فتأكل الطير من رأسه قضي الأمر الذي فيه تستفتيان

translation: And he said to the one whom he thought would be saved: 'Mention me to your lord.' But Satan made him forget to mention him to his lord, so he stayed in prison for a few years.
interpretation: The verse highlights the cunning nature of Satan, who can manipulate even the best of intentions, causing individuals to forget their obligations to God, leading to prolonged periods of spiritual darkness and confinement.
orig: وقال للذي ظن أنه ناج منهما اذكرني عند ربك فأنساه الشيطان ذكر ربه فلبث في السجن بضع سنين

translation: The king said: I see seven fat cows being eaten by seven lean ones, and seven green ears of corn and others withered. O assembly, explain to me the meaning of my dream if you are interpreters of dreams.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of seeking guidance and wisdom from those who possess knowledge and understanding, as the king recognizes his own limitations in interpreting his dream and seeks the expertise of others.
orig: وقال الملك إني أرى سبع بقرات سمان يأكلهن سبع عجاف وسبع سنبلات خضر وأخر يابسات يا أيها الملأ أفتوني في رؤياي إن كنتم للرؤيا تعبرون

translation: They said: 'Confused dreams! And we are not skilled in the interpretation of dreams, nor do we know.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the ignorance and arrogance of those who dismiss the divine message, claiming that the Prophet's revelations are mere fantasies, and that they are not capable of understanding the truth, thereby revealing their own lack of spiritual insight and wisdom.
orig: قالوا أضغاث أحلام وما نحن بتأويل الأحلام بعالمين

translation: And the one who was saved from them both said afterwards, 'I will inform you of its interpretation, so send me.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of seeking knowledge and understanding, as the one who was saved is eager to share his insight with others, emphasizing the value of sharing wisdom and guidance with those who seek it.
orig: وقال الذي نجا منهما وادكر بعد أمة أنا أنبئكم بتأويله فأرسلون

translation: Joseph, O truthful one, interpret for us about seven fat cows that seven lean ones devour, and seven green ears of corn and others withered, that I may return to the people, that they may know.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of seeking knowledge and understanding from those who possess it, as Joseph is being asked to interpret the dream, emphasizing the value of wisdom and insight in uncovering the truth and guiding people towards the right path.
orig: يوسف أيها الصديق أفتنا في سبع بقرات سمان يأكلهن سبع عجاف وسبع سنبلات خضر وأخر يابسات لعلي أرجع إلى الناس لعلهم يعلمون

translation: He said: 'You shall plant for seven years continuously, then what you harvest, leave it in its ear, except a little of which you eat.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of patience and perseverance, as the people are instructed to plant and harvest for seven years without consuming the entire crop, symbolizing the need to balance short-term needs with long-term goals and to prioritize saving for the future.
orig: قال تزرعون سبع سنين دأبا فما حصدتم فذروه في سنبله إلا قليلا مما تأكلون

translation: Then, after that, will come seven lean years, which will consume what you have set aside for them, except a little of what you will have stored.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of the fleeting nature of worldly gains and the importance of spiritual preparedness, as even the most diligent efforts to accumulate wealth and resources can be rendered useless in the face of unforeseen circumstances.
orig: ثم يأتي من بعد ذلك سبع شداد يأكلن ما قدمتم لهن إلا قليلا مما تحصنون

translation: Then a year comes in which people are given relief, and in it they press [grapes].
interpretation: The verse suggests that after a period of hardship and difficulty, a time of relief and abundance will come, symbolizing the cyclical nature of human experience, where periods of hardship are followed by periods of ease and prosperity.
orig: ثم يأتي من بعد ذلك عام فيه يغاث الناس وفيه يعصرون

translation: The king said, 'Bring him to me.' But when the messenger came to him, he said, 'Return to your lord and ask him, what about the women whose hands were cut off? Indeed, my Lord is knowledgeable about their guile.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the king's curiosity and skepticism about the women who were accused of theft, and his willingness to investigate and uncover the truth, rather than blindly accepting the accusations.
orig: وقال الملك ائتوني به فلما جاءه الرسول قال ارجع إلى ربك فاسأله ما بال النسوة اللاتي قطعن أيديهن إن ربي بكيدهن عليم

translation: They said, 'What is the matter with you, women? When Joseph's masters were asked about him, they said, 'God forbid! We know no evil of him.' The wife of the Aziz said, 'Now the truth has come to light. I tried to seduce him, and he is indeed of the truthful.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of acknowledging one's mistakes and taking responsibility for one's actions, as exemplified by the wife of the Aziz, who finally confesses to her guilt and recognizes Joseph's innocence, demonstrating a key aspect of personal growth and moral development.
orig: قال ما خطبكن إذ راودتن يوسف عن نفسه قلن حاش لله ما علمنا عليه من سوء قالت امرأت العزيز الآن حصحص الحق أنا راودته عن نفسه وإنه لمن الصادقين

translation: That He may know that I did not betray the trust in secret, and that Allah does not guide the plan of the deceitful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of accountability and transparency, emphasizing that one's actions and intentions are not hidden from God, and that those who are deceitful will not be guided or supported by Him.
orig: ذلك ليعلم أني لم أخنه بالغيب وأن الله لا يهدي كيد الخائنين

translation: And I do not acquit myself - indeed, the soul is a persistent enjoiner of evil, except inasmuch as my Lord has mercy. Indeed, my Lord is Forgiving, Merciful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the human tendency to be inclined towards evil, and the need for God's mercy and forgiveness to overcome this inclination, emphasizing the importance of humility and recognition of one's own weaknesses in seeking divine guidance.
orig: وما أبرئ نفسي إن النفس لأمارة بالسوء إلا ما رحم ربي إن ربي غفور رحيم

translation: And the king said: 'Bring him to me that I may attach him to myself. Then, when he spoke to him, he said: 'Verily, today you are with us, trusted and well-established.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of humility and recognizing one's limitations, as even a powerful king like Solomon recognizes the value of wisdom and knowledge that Joseph possesses, and is willing to learn from him, showing that true greatness lies in being open to learning and growth.
orig: وقال الملك ائتوني به أستخلصه لنفسي فلما كلمه قال إنك اليوم لدينا مكين أمين

translation: He said: 'Place me in charge of the treasures of the earth, I am a keeper, knowing well.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and pride of a person who claims to be capable of managing the treasures of the earth, demonstrating a sense of self-importance and overconfidence in one's abilities, which can lead to a downfall.
orig: قال اجعلني على خزائن الأرض إني حفيظ عليم

translation: And thus We established Joseph in the land to settle therein wherever he willed, out of Our mercy, to whom We willed, and We do not waste the reward of the doers of good.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's sovereignty and mercy in granting success and prosperity to those who are righteous and faithful, as exemplified in the story of Joseph, who was able to settle and thrive in a foreign land due to God's favor and benevolence.
orig: وكذلك مكنا ليوسف في الأرض يتبوأ منها حيث يشاء نصيب برحمتنا من نشاء ولا نضيع أجر المحسنين

translation: And the reward of the Hereafter is better for those who believe and were fearing.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that the rewards of the afterlife are reserved for those who not only believed in God but also demonstrated their faith through righteous actions, implying that true faith is accompanied by a sense of accountability and moral responsibility.
orig: ولأجر الآخرة خير للذين آمنوا وكانوا يتقون

translation: And the brothers of Joseph came and entered upon him, so he recognized them, but they were unaware of him.
interpretation: This verse highlights the theme of recognition and self-awareness, suggesting that true understanding and recognition can only come from within, and that even those who are closest to us may not truly know or understand us.
orig: وجاء إخوة يوسف فدخلوا عليه فعرفهم وهم له منكرون

translation: And when he had furnished them with their furnishing, he said: 'Bring me a brother of yours from your father; do you not see that I give full measure and that I am the best of hosts?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the exceptional hospitality and generosity of the prophet Joseph, who not only provided for his brothers' physical needs but also showed them kindness and respect, demonstrating the importance of treating guests with dignity and compassion.
orig: ولما جهزهم بجهازهم قال ائتوني بأخ لكم من أبيكم ألا ترون أني أوفي الكيل وأنا خير المنزلين

translation: If you do not bring it to me, then there is no claim upon me for you, nor will you approach me.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of accountability and responsibility, emphasizing that one cannot make demands or claims without fulfilling their own obligations, and that proximity to God or spiritual growth is contingent upon fulfilling one's duties.
orig: فإن لم تأتوني به فلا كيل لكم عندي ولا تقربون

translation: They said: 'We will avenge him or his father, and indeed we are truthful.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and boasting of those who think they can take revenge on someone, but ultimately, their claims are empty and they are unable to fulfill their threats, demonstrating their lack of power and control.
orig: قالوا سنراود عنه أباه وإنا لفاعلون

translation: And he said to his servants, 'Put their merchandise in their saddlebags, perhaps they will recognize it when they return to their families, and thus they will return.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the cleverness and wisdom of Joseph in dealing with his brothers, as he tries to bring about a reconciliation between them by making them realize their wrongdoing and prompting them to return to their families with a sense of remorse and accountability.
orig: وقال لفتيانه اجعلوا بضاعتهم في رحالهم لعلهم يعرفونها إذا انقلبوا إلى أهلهم لعلهم يرجعون

translation: And when they returned to their father, they said: 'O our father, the measure is forbidden to us, so send with us our brother, and we will be his guardians.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the sense of responsibility and guardianship that the brothers feel towards their younger brother, and their willingness to take care of him, which reflects their moral character and sense of duty.
orig: فلما رجعوا إلى أبيهم قالوا يا أبانا منع منا الكيل فأرسل معنا أخانا نكتل وإنا له لحافظون

translation: He said, 'Did I not entrust you with him except as I entrusted you with his brother before? And Allah is the best of guardians, and He is the most merciful of the merciful.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of trust and responsibility, emphasizing that one's actions will be held accountable by Allah, who is the ultimate guardian and protector, and that He is the most merciful of all.
orig: قال هل آمنكم عليه إلا كما أمنتكم على أخيه من قبل فالله خير حافظا وهو أرحم الراحمين

translation: And when they opened their merchandise, they found their goods returned to them. They said, 'O our father, what is this? Our goods have been returned to us. We will provision our family and take care of our brother and increase our measure of a camel's load, that will be a small measure.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the sense of wonder and gratitude of the brothers when they discover that their goods have been returned to them, symbolizing the restoration of their dignity and prosperity, and their renewed sense of responsibility towards their family and brother.
orig: ولما فتحوا متاعهم وجدوا بضاعتهم ردت إليهم قالوا يا أبانا ما نبغي هذه بضاعتنا ردت إلينا ونمير أهلنا ونحفظ أخانا ونزداد كيل بعير ذلك كيل يسير

translation: He said: I will not send him with you until you give me a solemn promise in the name of Allah that you will bring him back to me, unless you are surrounded. So when they gave him the solemn promise, he said: Allah is Witness to what we say.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of keeping promises and covenants, emphasizing that God is a Witness to all agreements and commitments, and that He will hold people accountable for their actions and words.
orig: قال لن أرسله معكم حتى تؤتون موثقا من الله لتأتنني به إلا أن يحاط بكم فلما آتوه موثقهم قال الله على ما نقول وكيل

translation: And he said, 'O my sons, do not enter by one gate, but enter by different gates, and I cannot avail you against Allah at all. The command is not but from Allah. Upon Him I have relied, and upon Him let those who rely [upon Him] rely.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of putting one's trust in God, as Prophet Jacob did, and not relying on human efforts or means to achieve success or protection, for ultimately, it is God who has the power to decide the outcome of all matters.
orig: وقال يا بني لا تدخلوا من باب واحد وادخلوا من أبواب متفرقة وما أغني عنكم من الله من شيء إن الحكم إلا لله عليه توكلت وعليه فليتوكل المتوكلون

translation: And when they entered from where their father had commanded them, it did not avail them at all against Allah, except a need in the soul of Jacob, which he fulfilled. And indeed, he was a possessor of knowledge because We had taught him, but most of the people do not know.
interpretation: The verse highlights the limitations of human efforts and the ultimate reliance on God's will, as even the wise and knowledgeable Jacob's efforts could not change the course of events, and it was only God's will that prevailed.
orig: ولما دخلوا من حيث أمرهم أبوهم ما كان يغني عنهم من الله من شيء إلا حاجة في نفس يعقوب قضاها وإنه لذو علم لما علمناه ولكن أكثر الناس لا يعلمون

translation: And when they entered upon Joseph, he took his brother to himself, saying: 'I am your brother, so do not grieve for what they used to do.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the theme of forgiveness and mercy, as Joseph, despite being wronged by his brothers, chooses to show compassion and comfort to his brother, rather than seeking revenge or harboring resentment.
orig: ولما دخلوا على يوسف آوى إليه أخاه قال إني أنا أخوك فلا تبتئس بما كانوا يعملون

translation: And when he had furnished them with their furnishing, he put the water bottle in his brother's saddlebag, then a crier cried out, 'O you people of the caravan, you are thieves!'
interpretation: The verse highlights the cleverness and cunning of Joseph, who, in order to test his brothers and to bring about a reconciliation, resorts to a clever trick, accusing them of theft and thus setting in motion a chain of events that will ultimately lead to their repentance and forgiveness.
orig: فلما جهزهم بجهازهم جعل السقاية في رحل أخيه ثم أذن مؤذن أيتها العير إنكم لسارقون

translation: They said, 'And they turned away from them, what is it that you are waiting for?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the attitude of people who are so entrenched in their ways that they deliberately turn a blind eye to the truth, and then mockingly ask the believers what they are waiting for, implying that they will never see the consequences of their actions.
orig: قالوا وأقبلوا عليهم ماذا تفقدون

translation: They said: 'The royal cup is missing, and for him who produces it is a camel's load, and I am answerable for it.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of taking responsibility and being accountable for one's actions, as the speaker takes full responsibility for the missing royal cup, promising a significant reward for its return and guaranteeing its safekeeping.
orig: قالوا نفقد صواع الملك ولمن جاء به حمل بعير وأنا به زعيم

translation: They said: 'By Allah, you know that we did not come to make mischief in the land, and we are not thieves.'
interpretation: The statement of the accused is a testament to their innocence, and their oath by Allah is a demonstration of their conviction that they are telling the truth, highlighting the importance of honesty and integrity in one's words and actions.
orig: قالوا تالله لقد علمتم ما جئنا لنفسد في الأرض وما كنا سارقين

translation: They say: 'What is the penalty, if you are truthful?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the skepticism and arrogance of those who doubt the prophets and messengers, implying that they are not afraid of any consequences and are willing to challenge the divine warning, which ultimately reveals their lack of faith and understanding.
orig: قالوا فما جزاؤه إن كنتم كاذبين

translation: They said: 'The reward of this is that which is in his saddlebag, and thus we reward the wrongdoers.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of 'like for like' in the way God deals with wrongdoers, implying that the punishment or reward is often a direct consequence of one's actions, and that God's justice is fair and fitting.
orig: قالوا جزاؤه من وجد في رحله فهو جزاؤه كذلك نجزي الظالمين

translation: So he began with their bags before the bag of his brother, then he brought it out from the bag of his brother. Thus We planned for Joseph, for he was not to take his brother in the king's law except that Allah willed. We raise the degrees of whom We will, and above every possessor of knowledge is the All-Knowing.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that God's will and plan can supersede human laws and norms, and that His wisdom and justice are not limited by human understanding or conventions.
orig: فبدأ بأوعيتهم قبل وعاء أخيه ثم استخرجها من وعاء أخيه كذلك كدنا ليوسف ما كان ليأخذ أخاه في دين الملك إلا أن يشاء الله نرفع درجات من نشاء وفوق كل ذي علم عليم

translation: They said: 'He was a thief before, a brother of his stole, so Joseph kept it within himself and did not reveal it to them. He said: 'You are in a bad position, and Allah knows what you describe.'
interpretation: The verse highlights Joseph's wisdom and self-control in not revealing the truth about his brothers' past misdeeds, instead choosing to focus on the present situation, thereby avoiding conflict and maintaining family harmony.
orig: قالوا إن يسرق فقد سرق أخ له من قبل فأسرها يوسف في نفسه ولم يبدها لهم قال أنتم شر مكانا والله أعلم بما تصفون

translation: They said: 'O Aziz, indeed he has an old father, so take one of us in his place, indeed we see you as one of the doers of good'.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of empathy and compassion, as the people are willing to sacrifice one of their own to spare the old man's son, demonstrating a sense of community and care for one another.
orig: قالوا يا أيها العزيز إن له أبا شيخا كبيرا فخذ أحدنا مكانه إنا نراك من المحسنين

translation: Mo'adh said: 'Allah forbid that we should take (anything) except what we find with him; indeed, if we did, we would be unjust.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of fairness and justice in all aspects of life, including trade and commerce, as Mo'adh refuses to take anything that does not rightfully belong to him, demonstrating a strong moral character and a commitment to righteousness.
orig: قال معاذ الله أن نأخذ إلا من وجدنا متاعنا عنده إنا إذا لظالمون

translation: And when they despaired of him, they secluded themselves. Their eldest said, 'Did you not know that your father had taken a covenant from you in the name of Allah, and before that you failed in your duty with Joseph? I will not depart from this land until my father permits me or Allah judges for me, and He is the Best of Judges.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of fulfilling one's promises and covenants, as the eldest brother is determined to stay in the land until he is allowed to leave by his father or until God decides his fate, showing his commitment to his oath and his trust in God's justice.
orig: فلما استيأسوا منه خلصوا نجيا قال كبيرهم ألم تعلموا أن أباكم قد أخذ عليكم موثقا من الله ومن قبل ما فرطتم في يوسف فلن أبرح الأرض حتى يأذن لي أبي أو يحكم الله لي وهو خير الحاكمين

translation: Return to your father and say: O our father! Indeed, your son has stolen, and we testify not except to what we know, and we are not guardians of the unseen.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of honesty and taking responsibility for one's actions, as the brothers of Joseph are willing to confess their brother's wrongdoing and acknowledge the limits of their knowledge, demonstrating their commitment to truthfulness and humility.
orig: ارجعوا إلى أبيكم فقولوا يا أبانا إن ابنك سرق وما شهدنا إلا بما علمنا وما كنا للغيب حافظين

translation: And ask the town in which we were, and the caravan in which we came, and indeed we are truthful.
interpretation: The verse is encouraging the listener to verify the authenticity of the Prophet's message by inquiring about his past, specifically the town where he lived and the caravan in which he traveled, implying that the truth of his prophethood can be confirmed through the testimony of those who knew him.
orig: واسأل القرية التي كنا فيها والعير التي أقبلنا فيها وإنا لصادقون

translation: He said, 'No, I have conveyed to you the message with which I was sent, and I have advised you, so be patient. It may be that Allah will bring them all to me. Indeed, He is the All-Knowing, the All-Wise.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of patience and trust in God's plan, as the prophet is confident that God will ultimately bring the truth to light and deal with those who reject the message.
orig: قال بل سولت لكم أنفسكم أمرا فصبر جميل عسى الله أن يأتيني بهم جميعا إنه هو العليم الحكيم

translation: And he turned away from them and said, 'Oh, my sorrow for Joseph!' And his eyes became white from grief, for he was a suppressor of his grief.
interpretation: The verse highlights the emotional restraint and self-control of the Prophet Jacob, who was able to hide his deep sorrow and grief over the loss of his son Joseph, demonstrating his extraordinary patience and trust in God's plan.
orig: وتولى عنهم وقال يا أسفى على يوسف وابيضت عيناه من الحزن فهو كظيم

translation: They said: 'By Allah, you will not cease to remember Joseph until you are exhausted or you are of those who are perished.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the people's perception that the Prophet's constant remembrance of Joseph is a sign of his weakness and that he will eventually give up or perish, which in reality is a testament to the Prophet's unwavering faith and perseverance.
orig: قالوا تالله تفتأ تذكر يوسف حتى تكون حرضا أو تكون من الهالكين

translation: He said, 'I only complain of my grief and sorrow to Allah, and I know from Allah what you do not know.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of trusting in God's wisdom and justice, and seeking comfort and solace in Him alone, especially in times of distress and hardship.
orig: قال إنما أشكو بثي وحزني إلى الله وأعلم من الله ما لا تعلمون

translation: O my sons, go and inquire about Joseph and his brother, and do not give up hope of Allah's mercy. Indeed, no one despairs of Allah's mercy except the disbelieving people.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of maintaining hope and faith in Allah's mercy, even in the face of adversity, and that only those who reject faith lose hope in Allah's mercy.
orig: يا بني اذهبوا فتحسسوا من يوسف وأخيه ولا تيأسوا من روح الله إنه لا ييأس من روح الله إلا القوم الكافرون

translation: So when they entered upon him, they said, 'O mighty one, harm has afflicted us and our family, and we have brought poor goods, so fulfill the measure for us and show charity to us. Indeed, Allah rewards the charitable.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the humility and courtesy of the brothers when they approached the powerful ruler, acknowledging their own difficulties and limitations, and politely requesting his generosity and charity, demonstrating their trust in God's reward for the charitable.
orig: فلما دخلوا عليه قالوا يا أيها العزيز مسنا وأهلنا الضر وجئنا ببضاعة مزجاة فأوف لنا الكيل وتصدق علينا إن الله يجزي المتصدقين

translation: Did you know what you did with Joseph and his brother when you were ignorant?
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of self-reflection and accountability, as it questions the people's awareness of their past mistakes and wrongdoing, emphasizing the need for introspection and remorse.
orig: قال هل علمتم ما فعلتم بيوسف وأخيه إذ أنتم جاهلون

translation: They said: 'Are you indeed Joseph?' He said: 'I am Joseph, and this is my brother, Allah has indeed been gracious to us. Verily, he who fears Allah and is patient, then surely, Allah wastes not the reward of the Muhsinun (good-doers).'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of patience and fear of Allah in the face of adversity, as exemplified by Joseph's story, and assures that Allah will reward those who exhibit these virtues.
orig: قالوا أإنك لأنت يوسف قال أنا يوسف وهذا أخي قد من الله علينا إنه من يتق ويصبر فإن الله لا يضيع أجر المحسنين

translation: They said: 'By Allah, indeed Allah has preferred you over us, and indeed we were wrongdoers.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the humility and acknowledgment of past mistakes, as the people recognize the favor of God upon the prophet and admit their own wrongdoing, demonstrating a crucial step towards repentance and seeking forgiveness.
orig: قالوا تالله لقد آثرك الله علينا وإن كنا لخاطئين

translation: He said: 'No reproach on you today. May Allah forgive you, and He is the most merciful of those who show mercy.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the merciful nature of God, who is willing to forgive even the most grievous of sins, and emphasizes the importance of seeking forgiveness and showing compassion to others.
orig: قال لا تثريب عليكم اليوم يغفر الله لكم وهو أرحم الراحمين

translation: Go with this shirt of mine, and cast it over my father's face, and he will regain his sight, and come to me with all your family.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of the bond between family members and the role of faith in restoring relationships, as the shirt serves as a symbol of the prophet's love and compassion, which ultimately brings healing and unity to the family.
orig: اذهبوا بقميصي هذا فألقوه على وجه أبي يأت بصيرا وأتوني بأهلكم أجمعين

translation: And when the caravan departed, their father said: 'I indeed sense the smell of Joseph, unless you think me dotard.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the strong emotional bond between Jacob and his son Joseph, as Jacob is able to sense the smell of his son even when he is far away, demonstrating the deep love and connection between them.
orig: ولما فصلت العير قال أبوهم إني لأجد ريح يوسف لولا أن تفندون

translation: They said: 'By Allah, you are indeed in your old error.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the response of the disbelievers who rejected the prophets and accused them of being in error, implying that the prophets were stuck in their old ways and refused to change, when in reality, it was the disbelievers who were misguided and refused to accept the truth.
orig: قالوا تالله إنك لفي ضلالك القديم

translation: And when the bringer of good tidings came, he cast it on his face, so he returned seeing. He said: 'Did I not tell you that I know from Allah what you do not know?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of trust in God's plan and the role of divine knowledge in human affairs, emphasizing that those who have faith in God's wisdom will ultimately be vindicated and their trust will be rewarded.
orig: فلما أن جاء البشير ألقاه على وجهه فارتد بصيرا قال ألم أقل لكم إني أعلم من الله ما لا تعلمون

translation: They said: O our father, ask forgiveness for our sins, indeed we were wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of seeking forgiveness from God and acknowledging one's mistakes, as the sons of Jacob recognize their wrongdoing and ask their father to pray for their forgiveness, demonstrating a sense of remorse and responsibility for their actions.
orig: قالوا يا أبانا استغفر لنا ذنوبنا إنا كنا خاطئين

translation: He said: I will ask forgiveness of my Lord, He is the Oft-Forgiving, the Merciful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the humility and submission of the prophet, who despite being a messenger of God, seeks forgiveness from his Lord, demonstrating the importance of humility and recognition of one's own limitations and mistakes.
orig: قال سوف أستغفر لكم ربي إنه هو الغفور الرحيم

translation: And when they entered upon Joseph, he took his parents to himself and said, 'Enter Egypt, if Allah wills, in safety.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of seeking refuge in God's will, as Joseph's invitation to his parents to enter Egypt is conditional on God's permission, emphasizing the need for humility and recognition of God's sovereignty in all aspects of life.
orig: فلما دخلوا على يوسف آوى إليه أبويه وقال ادخلوا مصر إن شاء الله آمنين

translation: And he raised his parents to the throne, and they fell down in prostration to him, and he said: 'O my father, this is the interpretation of my dream of old. My Lord has made it true, and He has been good to me, when He took me out of the prison, and brought you from the Bedouins, after Satan had stirred up enmity between me and my brothers. Verily, my Lord is Gentle with whom He wills, for He is the All-Knowing, the All-Wise.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of gratitude and humility in the face of God's blessings, as exemplified by Prophet Yusuf's actions towards his parents, and serves as a reminder to believers to acknowledge and appreciate God's favors and mercy in their lives.
orig: ورفع أبويه على العرش وخروا له سجدا وقال يا أبت هذا تأويل رؤياي من قبل قد جعلها ربي حقا وقد أحسن بي إذ أخرجني من السجن وجاء بكم من البدو من بعد أن نزغ الشيطان بيني وبين إخوتي إن ربي لطيف لما يشاء إنه هو العليم الحكيم

translation: My Lord, You have given me some power and taught me the interpretation of dreams. You are the Creator of the heavens and the earth. You are my Guardian in this world and the Hereafter. Cause me to die a Muslim and join me with the righteous.
interpretation: The verse is a supplication to God, expressing gratitude for the blessings and knowledge received, and seeking God's protection and guidance in this life and the next, ultimately seeking to die in a state of faith and be reunited with the righteous in the afterlife.
orig: رب قد آتيتني من الملك وعلمتني من تأويل الأحاديث فاطر السماوات والأرض أنت وليي في الدنيا والآخرة توفني مسلما وألحقني بالصالحين

translation: That is of the news of the unseen which We reveal to you, and you were not with them when they resolved their plan and they were scheming.
interpretation: This verse highlights the significance of prophetic revelation, where God shares knowledge of unseen events with His prophets, emphasizing the divine origin of the message and the prophet's lack of involvement in the events being described.
orig: ذلك من أنباء الغيب نوحيه إليك وما كنت لديهم إذ أجمعوا أمرهم وهم يمكرون

translation: And most of the people, even if you strive with all your might, will not believe.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of human effort in guiding people to the path of faith, emphasizing that even the most sincere and diligent efforts may not be enough to bring people to belief.
orig: وما أكثر الناس ولو حرصت بمؤمنين
