interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of personal responsibility, emphasizing that individuals will be accountable for their own actions, and that their deeds will have consequences for their own souls, rather than affecting others.
orig: إن أحسنتم أحسنتم لأنفسكم وإن أسأتم فلها فإذا جاء وعد الآخرة ليسوءوا وجوهكم وليدخلوا المسجد كما دخلوه أول مرة وليتبروا ما علوا تتبيرا

translation: It may be that your Lord will have mercy on you, and if you return, We will return, and We have made Hell a prison for the disbelievers.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes God's infinite mercy and His willingness to forgive those who repent and return to the path of righteousness, while also warning the disbelievers of the severe punishment that awaits them in Hell.
orig: عسى ربكم أن يرحمكم وإن عدتم عدنا وجعلنا جهنم للكافرين حصيرا

translation: Indeed, this Quran guides to that which is most upright, and gives good news to the believers who do good deeds that they shall have a great reward.
interpretation: The Quran is a source of guidance for those who seek the straight path, and it brings glad tidings to believers who perform good deeds, promising them a magnificent reward in the Hereafter, emphasizing the direct connection between righteous actions and a blissful afterlife.
orig: إن هذا القرآن يهدي للتي هي أقوم ويبشر المؤمنين الذين يعملون الصالحات أن لهم أجرا كبيرا

translation: And those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have prepared for them a painful punishment.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who deny the existence of the Hereafter will be punished severely, implying that their rejection of the afterlife is a sign of their ignorance of the consequences of their actions, and that they will ultimately be held accountable for their deeds.
orig: وأن الذين لا يؤمنون بالآخرة أعتدنا لهم عذابا أليما

translation: And man prays for evil as he prays for good, and man is ever hasty.
interpretation: The verse highlights humanity's tendency to rush into things without considering the consequences, and how this haste can lead to praying for things that might ultimately bring harm, rather than good.
orig: ويدع الإنسان بالشر دعاءه بالخير وكان الإنسان عجولا

translation: And We have made the night and the day two signs, then We have obliterated the sign of the night and made the sign of the day visible, that you may seek bounty from your Lord and know the number of the years and the reckoning, and everything We have explained in detail.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's power and wisdom in creating the natural world, using the example of day and night to illustrate the idea that everything in the universe is a sign or a lesson from God, and that humans have a responsibility to learn from and appreciate these signs in order to cultivate a deeper understanding of God's creation and their place within it.
orig: وجعلنا الليل والنهار آيتين فمحونا آية الليل وجعلنا آية النهار مبصرة لتبتغوا فضلا من ربكم ولتعلموا عدد السنين والحساب وكل شيء فصلناه تفصيلا

translation: And every man We have fastened to him a bird of omen on his neck, and We shall bring forth for him, on the Day of Resurrection, a book which he will find wide open.
interpretation: The verse speaks about the idea that every individual's actions are being recorded and will be presented to them on the Day of Judgment, serving as a reminder that our deeds will be accounted for and we will be held responsible for them.
orig: وكل إنسان ألزمناه طائره في عنقه ونخرج له يوم القيامة كتابا يلقاه منشورا

translation: Read your book, it is sufficient as an accountant against you today.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the idea that on the Day of Judgment, every individual will be accountable for their own deeds, and their own book of actions will be sufficient to judge them, implying that each person has the responsibility to keep track of their own actions and will be held accountable for them.
orig: اقرأ كتابك كفى بنفسك اليوم عليك حسيبا

translation: He who is guided is guided only for his own soul, and he who goes astray does so to his own loss. No bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another, and We would never punish until We have sent a Messenger.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of personal responsibility, emphasizing that an individual's guidance or misguidance is a personal choice that affects only themselves, and that no one can take the blame or burden of another's actions.
orig: من اهتدى فإنما يهتدي لنفسه ومن ضل فإنما يضل عليها ولا تزر وازرة وزر أخرى وما كنا معذبين حتى نبعث رسولا

translation: And when We decide to destroy a town, We command its affluent people, but they commit excesses in it, and thus the Word is justified about it, so We destroy it utterly.
interpretation: The verse highlights the role of the elite and leaders in a society, suggesting that their corruption and excesses can lead to the downfall of their entire community, emphasizing the importance of moral responsibility among those in power.
orig: وإذا أردنا أن نهلك قرية أمرنا مترفيها ففسقوا فيها فحق عليها القول فدمرناها تدميرا

translation: And how many a generation We have destroyed after Noah! And your Lord is sufficient as an accountant of the sins of His servants, All-Aware, All-Seeing.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's absolute knowledge and awareness of the actions of His servants, emphasizing that He is sufficient to account for their sins, implying that no one can escape God's judgment and that all will be held accountable for their deeds.
orig: وكم أهلكنا من القرون من بعد نوح وكفى بربك بذنوب عباده خبيرا بصيرا

translation: Whoever desires the hastened (punishment) We hasten for him what We will, then We have made for him Hell, he will burn therein, despised and rejected.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of hastening one's punishment in this life, suggesting that those who seek to hasten their rewards or punishments in this world will ultimately be punished in the Hereafter, emphasizing the idea that patience and righteousness are essential for a good end.
orig: من كان يريد العاجلة عجلنا له فيها ما نشاء لمن نريد ثم جعلنا له جهنم يصلاها مذموما مدحورا

translation: And whoever desires the Hereafter and strives for it with sincerity, being a believer, - these, their striving shall be appreciated.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of sincerity in one's efforts to attain a good standing in the Hereafter, implying that only those who strive with a genuine and pure intention will be rewarded and appreciated by God.
orig: ومن أراد الآخرة وسعى لها سعيها وهو مؤمن فأولئك كان سعيهم مشكورا

translation: Nay, We give these and those from the gift of your Lord. And the gift of your Lord is not restricted.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's generosity and abundance, implying that God's blessings are not limited and can be bestowed upon anyone, regardless of their background or status.
orig: كلا نمد هؤلاء وهؤلاء من عطاء ربك وما كان عطاء ربك محظورا

translation: See how We have preferred some of them over others. And indeed, the Hereafter - it has greater degrees and a greater preference.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that God's justice is not limited to this life, but will be fully manifested in the Hereafter, where the righteous will be rewarded and the wicked will be punished, and the differences in their ranks and rewards will be even greater.
orig: انظر كيف فضلنا بعضهم على بعض وللآخرة أكبر درجات وأكبر تفضيلا

translation: Do not set up rivals to Allah, lest you be thrown into hell, blamed and rejected.
interpretation: This verse is a stern warning against polytheism, emphasizing that associating partners with God will lead to eternal damnation and rejection by God.
orig: لا تجعل مع الله إلها آخر فتقعد مذموما مخذولا

translation: And your Lord has decreed that you worship none but Him, and that you be dutiful to your parents. If one of them or both of them attain old age with you, say not to them a word of disrespect, nor repel them, but address them in terms of honour.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of showing respect and kindness to one's parents, especially in their old age, and warns against speaking harshly or repelling them, instead encouraging gentle and honourable speech towards them.
orig: وقضى ربك ألا تعبدوا إلا إياه وبالوالدين إحسانا إما يبلغن عندك الكبر أحدهما أو كلاهما فلا تقل لهما أف ولا تنهرهما وقل لهما قولا كريما

translation: And lower to them the wing of humility out of mercy and say: 'My Lord, have mercy on them as they brought me up when I was small.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of showing humility and mercy towards one's parents, especially in their old age, as a way of expressing gratitude for the care and nurturing they provided during one's childhood.
orig: واخفض لهما جناح الذل من الرحمة وقل رب ارحمهما كما ربياني صغيرا

translation: Your Lord is most knowing of what is in your minds. If you are righteous, then indeed He is Forgiving to the penitent.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's omniscience and His ability to know the innermost thoughts and intentions of individuals, emphasizing that He is merciful and forgiving to those who repent and turn to Him with a sincere heart.
orig: ربكم أعلم بما في نفوسكم إن تكونوا صالحين فإنه كان للأوابين غفورا

translation: And give the relative his right, and the needy, and the traveler, and do not waste excessively.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of being responsible and mindful in one's charitable giving, ensuring that one's generosity is directed towards those who are truly in need, rather than being wasteful or excessive.
orig: وآت ذا القربى حقه والمسكين وابن السبيل ولا تبذر تبذيرا

translation: Indeed, the wasteful are brothers of the devils, and the Devil was ever ungrateful to his Lord.
interpretation: The verse highlights the spiritual connection between those who waste and squander God's blessings and the devils, implying that they are influenced by satanic forces that promote ingratitude and disobedience to God.
orig: إن المبذرين كانوا إخوان الشياطين وكان الشيطان لربه كفورا

translation: And if they turn away, seeking mercy from your Lord, hoping for it, then say to them a gentle word.
interpretation: The verse advises the Prophet to approach his opponents with kindness and gentleness, even if they reject his message, as this may soften their hearts and lead them to seek God's mercy.
orig: وإما تعرضن عنهم ابتغاء رحمة من ربك ترجوها فقل لهم قولا ميسورا

translation: And do not make your hand chained to your neck, nor stretch it forth to its utmost reach, lest you become rebuked and destitute.
interpretation: This verse is advising against being overly stingy or overly generous, as both extremes can lead to negative consequences, and instead, it is encouraging a balanced and moderate approach to wealth and generosity.
orig: ولا تجعل يدك مغلولة إلى عنقك ولا تبسطها كل البسط فتقعد ملوما محسورا

translation: Verily, your Lord expands the provision for whom He wills and straitens (it for whom He wills). Indeed, He is Ever-Knowing, All-Seer of His slaves.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's absolute authority over the distribution of provision and resources, emphasizing that He is all-knowing and all-seeing, and that His decisions are based on His infinite wisdom and justice.
orig: إن ربك يبسط الرزق لمن يشاء ويقدر إنه كان بعباده خبيرا بصيرا

translation: And do not kill your children for fear of poverty. We will provide for them and for you. Indeed, their killing is a great sin.
interpretation: The verse is emphasizing the importance of valuing human life, and condemning the practice of infanticide, which was prevalent in pre-Islamic Arabia. By prohibiting the killing of children, the verse is highlighting the sanctity of human life and the responsibility of parents to protect and provide for their offspring.
orig: ولا تقتلوا أولادكم خشية إملاق نحن نرزقهم وإياكم إن قتلهم كان خطئا كبيرا

translation: And do not approach unlawful sexual intercourse. Indeed, it was a immoral and an evil way.
interpretation: The verse serves as a strong warning against illegal sexual relations, implying that such acts are not only morally reprehensible but also lead to spiritual corruption and moral decay, ultimately causing harm to individuals and society as a whole.
orig: ولا تقربوا الزنا إنه كان فاحشة وساء سبيلا

translation: And do not take the life which Allah has forbidden except in the course of justice, and whoever is killed unjustly, We have certainly given his heir authority, but let him not exceed the limits in taking life, indeed he is helped.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of upholding justice and the rule of law, and that the right to take life is reserved for the state, highlighting the need for a fair and just system to prevent arbitrary killing and ensure that those who are responsible for unjust killing are held accountable.
orig: ولا تقتلوا النفس التي حرم الله إلا بالحق ومن قتل مظلوما فقد جعلنا لوليه سلطانا فلا يسرف في القتل إنه كان منصورا

translation: And do not approach the orphan's property except in the best way until he reaches his maturity, and fulfill the covenant, indeed the covenant will be asked about.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of fulfilling one's obligations and commitments, particularly in regard to the vulnerable, such as orphans, and highlights the accountability that comes with making promises or covenants with God.
orig: ولا تقربوا مال اليتيم إلا بالتي هي أحسن حتى يبلغ أشده وأوفوا بالعهد إن العهد كان مسئولا

translation: And fulfill the measure when you measure, and weigh with the balance that is straight, that is better and fairer in the end.
interpretation: The verse is emphasizing the importance of fairness and honesty in all aspects of life, including trade and commerce, and that being truthful and just in our dealings with others is a fundamental aspect of a righteous and virtuous life.
orig: وأوفوا الكيل إذا كلتم وزنوا بالقسطاس المستقيم ذلك خير وأحسن تأويلا

translation: And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge. Indeed, the hearing, the sight and the heart - about all that, one will be questioned.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of being responsible for one's actions and avoiding reckless behavior, as one will be held accountable for every thought, word, and deed, and will be questioned about them on the Day of Judgment.
orig: ولا تقف ما ليس لك به علم إن السمع والبصر والفؤاد كل أولئك كان عنه مسئولا

translation: And do not walk upon the earth exultantly. Indeed, you will never tear the earth [apart], nor will you reach the mountains in height.
interpretation: The verse is cautioning against arrogance and pride, warning that no matter how powerful or mighty one may feel, they are still limited and cannot surpass the creations of God, exemplified by the earth and mountains.
orig: ولا تمش في الأرض مرحا إنك لن تخرق الأرض ولن تبلغ الجبال طولا

translation: All that was evil in the sight of your Lord was hateful.
interpretation: The verse highlights that God detests and abhors all forms of evil, implying that believers should also reject and avoid such behaviors and attitudes, and instead strive for righteousness and goodness.
orig: كل ذلك كان سيئه عند ربك مكروها

translation: That is part of what your Lord has revealed to you of wisdom. And do not assign to Allah any rival god, lest you be thrown into Hell, blamed and rejected.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of maintaining the unity of God and avoiding polytheism, as it is the key to salvation and avoiding eternal punishment in Hell.
orig: ذلك مما أوحى إليك ربك من الحكمة ولا تجعل مع الله إلها آخر فتلقى في جهنم ملوما مدحورا

translation: Has your Lord then favoured you with sons, and taken for Himself from among the angels daughters? Indeed, you are saying a mighty saying.
interpretation: The verse highlights the absurdity of the pagan Arabs' claim that Allah has daughters, implying that they are elevating the status of females, while simultaneously degrading the status of females in their own society by preferring sons.
orig: أفأصفاكم ربكم بالبنين واتخذ من الملائكة إناثا إنكم لتقولون قولا عظيما

translation: And indeed, We have diversified in this Quran so they may remember, but it only increases them in aversion.
interpretation: The verse highlights the phenomenon where people, despite being exposed to the divine guidance and wisdom of the Quran, still choose to reject and turn away from it, and instead, become even more averse to the truth.
orig: ولقد صرفنا في هذا القرآن ليذكروا وما يزيدهم إلا نفورا

translation: Say, 'If there were with Him other gods, as they say, then they would have sought a way to the Possessor of the Throne'
interpretation: This verse highlights the absurdity of polytheism, implying that if there were multiple gods, they would have competed with each other to reach the ultimate power, but since there is only one God, there is no need for such competition, emphasizing the uniqueness and supremacy of Allah.
orig: قل لو كان معه آلهة كما يقولون إذا لابتغوا إلى ذي العرش سبيلا

translation: Glorified is He and Exalted above what they say, a great Exaltation.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes God's transcendence and majesty, implying that human language and understanding are insufficient to describe God's true nature, and that any attempts to do so would be inadequate and even blasphemous.
orig: سبحانه وتعالى عما يقولون علوا كبيرا

translation: The seven heavens and the earth and whatever is in them glorify Him. And there is not a thing but glorifies Him with praise, but you do not understand their glorification. Indeed, He is Ever-Patient, Oft-Forgiving.
interpretation: This verse highlights the universal nature of worship, where all of creation, from the heavens to the earth and everything in between, is in a state of constant glorification of God, emphasizing the unity and interconnectedness of the universe in its devotion to the Divine.
orig: تسبح له السماوات السبع والأرض ومن فيهن وإن من شيء إلا يسبح بحمده ولكن لا تفقهون تسبيحهم إنه كان حليما غفورا

translation: And when you recite the Quran, We put between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter a hidden barrier.
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that the recitation of the Quran serves as a spiritual barrier or a shield that separates believers from non-believers, protecting the former from the negative influences of the latter.
orig: وإذا قرأت القرآن جعلنا بينك وبين الذين لا يؤمنون بالآخرة حجابا مستورا

translation: And We have placed coverings over their hearts lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness; and when you mention your Lord alone in the Quran, they turn their backs in aversion.
interpretation: This verse suggests that those who reject the message of the Quran have a spiritual deafness and blindness, which prevents them from understanding and accepting the truth, and that their aversion to the message is a deliberate choice, rather than a lack of understanding.
orig: وجعلنا على قلوبهم أكنة أن يفقهوه وفي آذانهم وقرا وإذا ذكرت ربك في القرآن وحده ولوا على أدبارهم نفورا

translation: We know what they listen for when they listen to you, and when they converse in secret, when the wrongdoers say: 'You follow only a man bewitched.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that God is all-knowing and aware of the whispers and secret conversations of those who reject the message of the Prophet, and that their accusations of the Prophet being bewitched are a manifestation of their own ignorance and arrogance.
orig: نحن أعلم بما يستمعون به إذ يستمعون إليك وإذ هم نجوى إذ يقول الظالمون إن تتبعون إلا رجلا مسحورا

translation: See how they strike for you examples, but they are deluded, so they cannot find a way.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of those who try to find fault with the Prophet's message, as they are blinded by their own arrogance and ignorance, and are ultimately unable to find a way to refute the truth.
orig: انظر كيف ضربوا لك الأمثال فضلوا فلا يستطيعون سبيلا

translation: And they say: 'What! When we are bones and fragments, shall we really be raised up into a new creation?'
interpretation: This verse reveals the skepticism and arrogance of those who deny the possibility of resurrection, implying that it is impossible for God to recreate them after they have decomposed into mere bones and fragments, and highlights their lack of understanding of God's power and ability to recreate and resurrect.
orig: وقالوا أإذا كنا عظاما ورفاتا أإنا لمبعوثون خلقا جديدا

translation: Say: 'Be you stones or iron'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the impossibility of humans changing their inherent nature, as stones and iron cannot be changed, and similarly, humans cannot change their inherent nature, which is to worship and obey God.
orig: قل كونوا حجارة أو حديدا

translation: Or a creation that is yet more massive in your breasts? They will say: 'Who will revive us?' Say: 'He Who created you the first time.' Then they will shake their heads at you and say: 'When will that be?' Say: 'Perhaps it is near.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance of those who deny the possibility of resurrection, implying that they are so confident in their own abilities that they think they can recreate themselves, but ultimately they will be humbled and forced to acknowledge the power of God.
orig: أو خلقا مما يكبر في صدوركم فسيقولون من يعيدنا قل الذي فطركم أول مرة فسينغضون إليك رءوسهم ويقولون متى هو قل عسى أن يكون قريبا

translation: The Day He will call you, and you will respond with His praise, and you will think that you remained not but a little while.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that on the Day of Judgment, people will be forced to acknowledge God's power and justice, and they will realize that their time on earth was extremely short, despite feeling like they had lived a long life, emphasizing the fleeting nature of human existence.
orig: يوم يدعوكم فتستجيبون بحمده وتظنون إن لبثتم إلا قليلا

translation: And say to My servants that they should speak that which is best; surely the Shaitan sows dissensions among them; surely the Shaitan is an open enemy to man.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of using gentle and respectful language in our interactions with others, as it can help to prevent the devil from sowing discord and strife among people, and ultimately lead to a more harmonious and peaceful community.
orig: وقل لعبادي يقولوا التي هي أحسن إن الشيطان ينزغ بينهم إن الشيطان كان للإنسان عدوا مبينا

translation: Your Lord is most knowing of you; if He will, He will have mercy on you, or if He will, He will punish you. And We have not sent you as a guardian over them.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's absolute authority and control over humanity, and reminds the Prophet that he is not responsible for guiding people, but rather his role is to convey the message, and it is God who decides who will be guided or punished.
orig: ربكم أعلم بكم إن يشأ يرحمكم أو إن يشأ يعذبكم وما أرسلناك عليهم وكيلا

translation: And your Lord knows best who is in the heavens and the earth, and certainly We have favored some of the prophets over others, and We gave David the Psalms.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's omniscience and His ability to distinguish between the righteous and the wicked, and His favoritism towards certain prophets, implying that God's judgment is not based on human standards, but on His infinite wisdom and knowledge.
orig: وربك أعلم بمن في السماوات والأرض ولقد فضلنا بعض النبيين على بعض وآتينا داوود زبورا

translation: Say, 'Invoke those you claim [as gods] besides Him, for they do not possess the removal of harm from you nor [can they] divert [it].'
interpretation: The verse highlights the impotence of false deities and the futility of seeking help from them in times of distress, emphasizing that only the One True God has the power to alleviate suffering and hardship.
orig: قل ادعوا الذين زعمتم من دونه فلا يملكون كشف الضر عنكم ولا تحويلا

translation: Those who pray to their Lord, seeking a means of nearness to Him, which of them is nearest, and they hope for His mercy and fear His punishment. Indeed, the punishment of your Lord is something to be dreaded.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of sincerity and humility in one's prayer, as those who truly seek nearness to God are those who are driven by a desire to please Him, rather than seeking to impress others or gain worldly benefits.
orig: أولئك الذين يدعون يبتغون إلى ربهم الوسيلة أيهم أقرب ويرجون رحمته ويخافون عذابه إن عذاب ربك كان محذورا

translation: And there is not a town, but We will destroy it before the Day of Resurrection, or punish it with a severe punishment. That is written in the Book.
interpretation: This verse highlights the inevitability of divine justice, emphasizing that every town or community will ultimately face destruction or severe punishment unless they reform and turn to righteousness, serving as a warning to those who reject God's message and refuse to change their ways.
orig: وإن من قرية إلا نحن مهلكوها قبل يوم القيامة أو معذبوها عذابا شديدا كان ذلك في الكتاب مسطورا

translation: And nothing prevents Us from sending signs except that the former people denied them. And We gave Thamud the she-camel as a visible sign, but they wronged her. And We do not send signs except to instill fear.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of heeding divine signs and warnings, as those who reject them will ultimately face punishment, and the provision of signs is not to convince or please people, but rather to instill fear and caution in them.
orig: وما منعنا أن نرسل بالآيات إلا أن كذب بها الأولون وآتينا ثمود الناقة مبصرة فظلموا بها وما نرسل بالآيات إلا تخويفا

translation: And when We said to you, 'Indeed, your Lord has encompassed the people.' And We did not make the vision which We showed you except as a trial for the people, and [also] the cursed tree in the Quran. And We frighten them, but it does not increase them except in great transgression.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of trial and test in one's life, where God presents challenges and difficulties to distinguish those who are faithful and obedient from those who are arrogant and disobedient, and to ultimately separate the righteous from the wicked.
orig: وإذ قلنا لك إن ربك أحاط بالناس وما جعلنا الرؤيا التي أريناك إلا فتنة للناس والشجرة الملعونة في القرآن ونخوفهم فما يزيدهم إلا طغيانا كبيرا

translation: And when We said to the angels, 'Prostrate to Adam,' so they prostrated, except for Iblis. He said, 'Should I prostrate to one You created from clay?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and pride of Iblis, who refused to obey God's command to prostrate to Adam, demonstrating his disobedience and lack of humility, which ultimately led to his downfall and expulsion from heaven.
orig: وإذ قلنا للملائكة اسجدوا لآدم فسجدوا إلا إبليس قال أأسجد لمن خلقت طينا

translation: Did I not say to you, 'I have been honored by Allah, and I will certainly take revenge on your descendants, except for a few?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of humility and gratitude, as the speaker's boastful claim to have been honored by Allah is actually a sign of arrogance and a lack of recognition of one's true place before God.
orig: قال أرأيتك هذا الذي كرمت علي لئن أخرتن إلى يوم القيامة لأحتنكن ذريته إلا قليلا

translation: Say, 'Go! And whoever among them follows you, then Hell will be your recompense, a full compensation.'
interpretation: This verse is a warning to those who reject the message of God, implying that if they choose to follow their own desires and reject the truth, they will ultimately face the consequences of their actions, which will be a severe punishment in Hell.
orig: قال اذهب فمن تبعك منهم فإن جهنم جزاؤكم جزاء موفورا

translation: And instigate whoever you can among them with your voice, and rally against them your cavalry and infantry, and share with them in wealth and children, and make promises to them. But Satan promises them only to deceive.
interpretation: This verse highlights the deceitful nature of Satan, who promises his followers power and success, but ultimately leads them to destruction and disappointment, as his promises are empty and misleading.
orig: واستفزز من استطعت منهم بصوتك وأجلب عليهم بخيلك ورجلك وشاركهم في الأموال والأولاد وعدهم وما يعدهم الشيطان إلا غرورا

translation: Indeed, My servants - there is for you no authority over them, and sufficient is your Lord as a Guardian.
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that God is the ultimate protector and guardian of those who are oppressed and persecuted, and that He is sufficient for them, implying that they should put their trust in Him and not rely on human means for deliverance.
orig: إن عبادي ليس لك عليهم سلطان وكفى بربك وكيلا

translation: Your Lord is He Who makes the ship go smoothly for you through the sea, that you may seek of His Bounty, verily He is Ever-Merciful to you.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's mercy and benevolence towards humanity, as He provides the means for humans to travel and seek sustenance, emphasizing His role as a nurturer and provider.
orig: ربكم الذي يزجي لكم الفلك في البحر لتبتغوا من فضله إنه كان بكم رحيما

translation: And when harm touches you at sea, those that you call upon besides Him are forgotten, but when He brings you safe to land, you turn away; and man is ever ungrateful.
interpretation: The verse highlights humanity's tendency to forget God's blessings and favors as soon as they are out of a difficult situation, and instead take credit for their own successes, demonstrating their ingratitude towards God.
orig: وإذا مسكم الضر في البحر ضل من تدعون إلا إياه فلما نجاكم إلى البر أعرضتم وكان الإنسان كفورا

translation: Do you feel secure that He who is in the heaven will not cause the earth to swallow you up, or that He who is in the heaven will not send against you a hurricane?
interpretation: The verse highlights the powerlessness of humans against the wrath of God, emphasizing that no one is safe from His punishment, and that He can strike at any moment, catching people off guard.
orig: أفأمنتم أن يخسف بكم جانب البر أو يرسل عليكم حاصبا ثم لا تجدوا لكم وكيلا

translation: Or do you feel secure that He Who is in the heaven will not cause the earth to swallow you, then suddenly it would sway? Or do you feel secure that He Who is in the heaven will not send against you a storm of stones, then you would not find a guardian for yourselves?
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that humans are not in control of their lives and that God's power can strike at any moment, emphasizing the importance of humility and submission to God's will.
orig: أم أمنتم أن يعيدكم فيه تارة أخرى فيرسل عليكم قاصفا من الريح فيغرقكم بما كفرتم ثم لا تجدوا لكم علينا به تبيعا

translation: And We have certainly honored the children of Adam and carried them on land and sea and provided for them of the good things and preferred them over much of what We have created, with definite preference.
interpretation: The verse highlights the unique status and dignity bestowed upon human beings by God, emphasizing their superiority over other creations and the special favors and blessings they receive from Him.
orig: ولقد كرمنا بني آدم وحملناهم في البر والبحر ورزقناهم من الطيبات وفضلناهم على كثير ممن خلقنا تفضيلا

translation: The Day We will call every people with their leader, then whoever is given his record in his right hand, then these will read their record, and they will not be wronged, [even] a whit.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea of accountability and justice on the Day of Judgment, where every individual will be held responsible for their actions, and their records will be presented to them, symbolizing the transparency and fairness of God's judgment.
orig: يوم ندعو كل أناس بإمامهم فمن أوتي كتابه بيمينه فأولئك يقرءون كتابهم ولا يظلمون فتيلا

translation: And whoever is blind in this, he will be blind in the Hereafter, and more astray from the Path.
interpretation: The verse suggests that one's spiritual blindness in this life will lead to even greater spiritual confusion and disorientation in the afterlife, implying that one's spiritual state in this life has consequences for one's spiritual state in the next.
orig: ومن كان في هذه أعمى فهو في الآخرة أعمى وأضل سبيلا

translation: And indeed, they were about to tempt you away from what We have revealed to you, in order to substitute something else, and then they would have taken you as a friend.
interpretation: This verse highlights the cunning nature of those who try to divert the Prophet from his mission, and the subtle ways in which they attempt to corrupt the message, emphasizing the need for vigilance and loyalty to the divine revelation.
orig: وإن كادوا ليفتنونك عن الذي أوحينا إليك لتفتري علينا غيره وإذا لاتخذوك خليلا

translation: And if We had not strengthened you, you would have nearly inclined to them a little.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of spiritual strength and guidance from God in times of temptation and trial, emphasizing that without it, even the strongest of believers can be swayed by the influences of evil.
orig: ولولا أن ثبتناك لقد كدت تركن إليهم شيئا قليلا

translation: If We let him taste mercy from Us after hardship has afflicted him, he will surely say: 'This is due to my deeds.' But he will not be grateful. Then he will not find for himself any helper against Us.
interpretation: This verse highlights humanity's tendency to attribute their successes to their own efforts, while blaming God for their failures, demonstrating a lack of gratitude and humility in the face of divine blessings.
orig: إذا لأذقناك ضعف الحياة وضعف الممات ثم لا تجد لك علينا نصيرا

translation: And indeed, they were close to driving you out of the land to expel you from it, but they would not have stayed afterwards except for a little while.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of the enemies' efforts to harm the Prophet and the believers, as even if they were to succeed in driving them out, their victory would be short-lived and ultimately futile.
orig: وإن كادوا ليستفزونك من الأرض ليخرجوك منها وإذا لا يلبثون خلافك إلا قليلا

translation: For a long time We have sent before you some of Our messengers, and you will not find any alteration in Our system.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consistency and reliability of God's system of sending prophets and messengers to guide humanity, implying that God's way of communicating with humans has remained unchanged throughout history.
orig: سنة من قد أرسلنا قبلك من رسلنا ولا تجد لسنتنا تحويلا

translation: Establish the prayer at the decline of the sun to the dark of the night, and the recitation of the dawn. Indeed, the recitation of the dawn is witnessed.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of establishing a strong connection with God through prayer and recitation of the Quran, especially during the early morning hours when the world is still quiet and one's heart is most receptive to spiritual guidance.
orig: أقم الصلاة لدلوك الشمس إلى غسق الليل وقرآن الفجر إن قرآن الفجر كان مشهودا

translation: And during the night, pray to Him, an additional prayer, for your Lord may raise you to a praised position.
interpretation: The verse is encouraging the Prophet Muhammad to perform additional prayers at night, as a means of spiritual growth and self-purification, which may ultimately lead to his exalted status and recognition by God.
orig: ومن الليل فتهجد به نافلة لك عسى أن يبعثك ربك مقاما محمودا

translation: And say, 'My Lord, cause me to enter a sound entrance and cause me to exit a sound exit and grant me from Yourself a supporting authority.'
interpretation: The verse is a prayer for a believer to enter into a situation or a new phase of life with righteousness and integrity, and to exit it with the same, while also seeking divine support and guidance throughout the journey.
orig: وقل رب أدخلني مدخل صدق وأخرجني مخرج صدق واجعل لي من لدنك سلطانا نصيرا

translation: And say, 'Truth has come, and falsehood has vanished. Indeed, falsehood, by its nature, is bound to perish.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the eternal and universal nature of truth, emphasizing that it will always prevail over falsehood, which is inherently ephemeral and destined to disappear, implying that truth is a fundamental aspect of God's creation and will ultimately triumph.
orig: وقل جاء الحق وزهق الباطل إن الباطل كان زهوقا

translation: And We send down in the Quran that which is a healing and a mercy to the believers, and it does not increase the wrongdoers except in loss.
interpretation: The verse highlights the dual nature of the Quran, where it brings comfort and guidance to those who believe, while it only leads to further deviation and destruction for those who reject its message and continue to do wrong.
orig: وننزل من القرآن ما هو شفاء ورحمة للمؤمنين ولا يزيد الظالمين إلا خسارا

translation: And when We bestow favor upon man, he turns away and distances himself; and when evil touches him, he is full of despair.
interpretation: The verse highlights the human tendency to take blessings for granted and to become arrogant when things are going well, but to become despondent and lose hope when faced with difficulties.
orig: وإذا أنعمنا على الإنسان أعرض ونأى بجانبه وإذا مسه الشر كان يئوسا

translation: Say, 'Each works according to his form. Your Lord knows best who it is that is guided in the way.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that every individual is responsible for their own actions and will be judged according to their own deeds, and that God is the ultimate judge who knows who is truly guided on the right path.
orig: قل كل يعمل على شاكلته فربكم أعلم بمن هو أهدى سبيلا

translation: And they ask you about the soul. Say, 'The soul is of the affair of my Lord, and you have not been given of knowledge except a little.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the limitations of human knowledge, emphasizing that humans have only been given a small amount of knowledge about the nature of the soul, and that the full understanding of it belongs to God.
orig: ويسألونك عن الروح قل الروح من أمر ربي وما أوتيتم من العلم إلا قليلا

translation: And if We had willed, We would have taken away that which We revealed to you, then you would not find for yourself any guardian against Us and any defender.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's absolute authority and control over the revelation, implying that if God so willed, the revelation could be taken back, leaving the Prophet and humanity without any recourse or protection.
orig: ولئن شئنا لنذهبن بالذي أوحينا إليك ثم لا تجد لك به علينا وكيلا

translation: Except for a mercy from your Lord, indeed, His favor to you was great.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that the blessings and favors received from God are a result of His mercy and compassion, emphasizing that it is not a result of one's own actions or deserving, but rather a divine gift.
orig: إلا رحمة من ربك إن فضله كان عليك كبيرا

translation: Say, 'If mankind and the jinn gathered in order to produce the like of this Qur'an, they would not produce the like of it, even if they were assistants to each other.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the unique and miraculous nature of the Qur'an, emphasizing that even if all human and supernatural beings were to collaborate, they would be unable to produce a work of similar literary and spiritual excellence, underscoring the divine origin of the revelation.
orig: قل لئن اجتمعت الإنس والجن على أن يأتوا بمثل هذا القرآن لا يأتون بمثله ولو كان بعضهم لبعض ظهيرا

translation: And indeed, We have repeated for the people in this Quran from every example, but most people refused except to be ungrateful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that the Quran has been revealed in a way that is accessible and relatable to people, using various examples and anecdotes, yet many people still choose to reject its message and instead show ingratitude towards God's guidance.
orig: ولقد صرفنا للناس في هذا القرآن من كل مثل فأبى أكثر الناس إلا كفورا

translation: And they said: 'We will not believe in you until you cause a spring to burst forth from the earth for us'
interpretation: This verse highlights the stubbornness and arrogance of those who demand miracles and signs from the prophets, testing their patience and faith, and refusing to accept the truth unless their impossible demands are met.
orig: وقالوا لن نؤمن لك حتى تفجر لنا من الأرض ينبوعا

translation: Or you have a garden of date-palms and grapes, and rivers burst forth in its midst with a marvelous bursting forth.
interpretation: The verse symbolizes the abundance and fertility of paradise, where the righteous will be rewarded with lush gardens and overflowing rivers, signifying the ultimate fulfillment of human desires and the pinnacle of happiness.
orig: أو تكون لك جنة من نخيل وعنب فتفجر الأنهار خلالها تفجيرا

translation: Or the heaven is about to split asunder, as you have claimed, or the angels come down to you, or your Lord comes, or there comes some sign from your Lord?
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of the disbelievers' demands for a miracle, as they are not prepared to accept the truth even if it were to manifest in the most dramatic and extraordinary ways, and that their rejection is not due to a lack of evidence, but rather due to their stubborn refusal to submit to the will of God.
orig: أو تسقط السماء كما زعمت علينا كسفا أو تأتي بالله والملائكة قبيلا

translation: Or you have a house of ornaments or you ascend into the sky, and we will not believe in your ascension until you bring down to us a book that we can read. Say: 'Glory be to my Lord! Am I anything but a mortal messenger?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the skepticism of the people who demanded a miraculous sign from the Prophet, and the Prophet's humble response, emphasizing his humanity and the limitations of his role as a messenger, implying that he is not capable of performing miracles on his own, but rather, his role is to convey the message of God.
orig: أو يكون لك بيت من زخرف أو ترقى في السماء ولن نؤمن لرقيك حتى تنزل علينا كتابا نقرؤه قل سبحان ربي هل كنت إلا بشرا رسولا

translation: And nothing prevented people from believing when guidance came to them, except that they said, 'Has Allah sent a human messenger?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and pride of people who refuse to accept the truth, not because they do not understand or have doubts, but because they cannot accept that a mere human, like them, can be chosen by God as a messenger, revealing their prejudice and bias against the idea of a human prophet.
orig: وما منع الناس أن يؤمنوا إذ جاءهم الهدى إلا أن قالوا أبعث الله بشرا رسولا

translation: Say, 'If there were angels walking securely on the earth, We would have sent down to them from the heaven an angel as a messenger.'
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the importance of human messengers and prophets, implying that if angels were living on earth, God would still have sent a messenger from heaven to guide them, highlighting the significance of prophethood and divine guidance in human affairs.
orig: قل لو كان في الأرض ملائكة يمشون مطمئنين لنزلنا عليهم من السماء ملكا رسولا

translation: Say, 'Sufficient is Allah as a Witness between me and you. Indeed, He is Ever-Knowing, All-Seeing of His slaves.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the idea that God is always aware of human actions and intentions, and that He is the ultimate Witness to all that happens, making it unnecessary for humans to seek witnesses or proof from others.
orig: قل كفى بالله شهيدا بيني وبينكم إنه كان بعباده خبيرا بصيرا

translation: And whoever Allah guides, he is the guided one, and whoever He leaves astray, you will never find for them protectors besides Him. And We will gather them on the Day of Resurrection on their faces, blind, dumb, and deaf. Their abode is Hell; whenever it subsides, We increase them in blazing fire.
interpretation: The verse highlights the absolute authority of God in guiding or misleading individuals, emphasizing that those who are misguided will ultimately face the consequences of their actions, and will be punished in Hell, where their suffering will be intensified whenever they try to find relief.
orig: ومن يهد الله فهو المهتد ومن يضلل فلن تجد لهم أولياء من دونه ونحشرهم يوم القيامة على وجوههم عميا وبكما وصما مأواهم جهنم كلما خبت زدناهم سعيرا

translation: That is their recompense, because they disbelieved in Our signs and said, 'When we are bones and dust, will we indeed be resurrected into a new creation?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and skepticism of those who reject the signs of God, thinking that resurrection is impossible, and that they will not be held accountable for their actions, but ultimately, they will be punished for their disbelief.
orig: ذلك جزاؤهم بأنهم كفروا بآياتنا وقالوا أإذا كنا عظاما ورفاتا أإنا لمبعوثون خلقا جديدا

translation: Do they not see that Allah, Who created the heavens and the earth, is able to create the like of them, and has appointed for them a term about which there is no doubt? But the wrongdoers refuse except to deny.
interpretation: This verse implies that those who deny God's power and existence are ignoring the obvious signs of creation, and are instead choosing to reject the truth, despite having the capacity to recognize it.
orig: أولم يروا أن الله الذي خلق السماوات والأرض قادر على أن يخلق مثلهم وجعل لهم أجلا لا ريب فيه فأبى الظالمون إلا كفورا

translation: Say, 'If you possessed the treasures of the mercy of my Lord, you would surely withhold them, fearing to spend.' And man is stingy.
interpretation: This verse highlights the inherent human tendency to be miserly and hesitant to spend one's resources, even when it comes to acts of charity and kindness, revealing a deep-seated fear of poverty and scarcity.
orig: قل لو أنتم تملكون خزائن رحمة ربي إذا لأمسكتم خشية الإنفاق وكان الإنسان قتورا

translation: And indeed We gave Moses nine clear signs, so ask the Children of Israel when he came to them, then Pharaoh said to him, 'Indeed, I think you, O Moses, are bewitched.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the miraculous nature of Moses' signs, which were so clear and convincing that even Pharaoh, who was determined to reject Moses, was forced to acknowledge their power, albeit by attributing it to magic rather than divine intervention.
orig: ولقد آتينا موسى تسع آيات بينات فاسأل بني إسرائيل إذ جاءهم فقال له فرعون إني لأظنك يا موسى مسحورا

translation: He said: 'I know that these have been sent down by the Lord of the heavens and the earth; and, I consider you, O Pharaoh, to be doomed.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the conviction of the believer in the divine origin of the message, and the certainty of the punishment that awaits the disbeliever, in this case Pharaoh, who has refused to acknowledge the truth.
orig: قال لقد علمت ما أنزل هؤلاء إلا رب السماوات والأرض بصائر وإني لأظنك يا فرعون مثبورا

translation: So he intended to frighten them from the land, but We drowned him and those with him altogether.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of human attempts to defy God's will, as even the most powerful individuals can be brought down by God's power, and their schemes can ultimately lead to their own downfall.
orig: فأراد أن يستفزهم من الأرض فأغرقناه ومن معه جميعا

translation: And We said after him to the Children of Israel, 'Dwell in the land, then when the promise of the Hereafter comes, We will bring you all together'
interpretation: The verse is emphasizing God's promise to gather all people on the Day of Judgment, where they will be held accountable for their deeds, and it serves as a reminder to the Children of Israel, and by extension to all humanity, that their actions have consequences that will be judged by God.
orig: وقلنا من بعده لبني إسرائيل اسكنوا الأرض فإذا جاء وعد الآخرة جئنا بكم لفيفا

translation: And with the truth We have sent it down, and with the truth it has been sent down, and We have not sent you except as a bringer of good news and a warner.
interpretation: This verse highlights the significance of the Prophet Muhammad's role as a messenger, emphasizing that his mission is not only to warn people of the consequences of their actions, but also to bring good news and hope to those who are righteous and faithful.
orig: وبالحق أنزلناه وبالحق نزل وما أرسلناك إلا مبشرا ونذيرا

translation: And We have divided the Quran that you may recite it to the people at intervals, and We have sent it down in stages.
interpretation: This verse highlights the unique nature of the Quran's revelation, emphasizing that it was revealed in stages to facilitate its understanding and memorization by the Prophet Muhammad and the early Muslim community.
orig: وقرآنا فرقناه لتقرأه على الناس على مكث ونزلناه تنزيلا

translation: Say, 'Believe in it or do not believe. Indeed, those who were given knowledge before it - when it is recited to them, they fall upon their faces in prostration.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the impact of the revelation of the Qur'an on those who have previously received divine guidance, implying that the truth and beauty of the Qur'an is so profound that it inspires humility and submission to God's will, even among those who have been blessed with prior knowledge and understanding.
orig: قل آمنوا به أو لا تؤمنوا إن الذين أوتوا العلم من قبله إذا يتلى عليهم يخرون للأذقان سجدا

translation: And they say: 'Glory to our Lord! Truly, the promise of our Lord must be fulfilled.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the humility and submission of the believers, who acknowledge the power and promise of God, and express their conviction that His promise will undoubtedly come to pass, without any doubt or hesitation.
orig: ويقولون سبحان ربنا إن كان وعد ربنا لمفعولا

translation: And they fall upon their faces weeping, and it increases them in humble submission.
interpretation: The verse highlights the emotional and spiritual state of believers when they are in a state of humility and reverence, where they are overcome with emotion and tears, and their humility and submission to God increases as a result of their spiritual experience.
orig: ويخرون للأذقان يبكون ويزيدهم خشوعا

translation: Say: 'Call upon Allah or call upon the Most Gracious; whichever you call, to Him belong the Beautiful Names.' And offer your prayers neither aloud nor in a low tone, but seek a way between.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of humility in prayer, advising believers to find a middle ground between loud and quiet prayer, symbolizing the need for balance and moderation in one's spiritual practice.
orig: قل ادعوا الله أو ادعوا الرحمن أيا ما تدعوا فله الأسماء الحسنى ولا تجهر بصلاتك ولا تخافت بها وابتغ بين ذلك سبيلا

translation: And say: 'Praise be to Allah, who has not taken a son, and has no partner in His kingdom, and has no protector from humiliation, and magnify Him with a grand magnification.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the uniqueness and grandeur of Allah, highlighting His independence and self-sufficiency, and encouraging the believer to acknowledge and glorify Him in the most magnificent way possible.
orig: وقل الحمد لله الذي لم يتخذ ولدا ولم يكن له شريك في الملك ولم يكن له ولي من الذل وكبره تكبيرا

translation: Praise be to Allah, who has sent down to His servant the Book, and has not placed therein any crookedness.
interpretation: This verse highlights the purity and perfection of the Quran, implying that it is free from any contradictions, inconsistencies, or flaws, and is a direct revelation from God, unaltered by human interference or bias.
orig: الحمد لله الذي أنزل على عبده الكتاب ولم يجعل له عوجا

translation: A messenger reciting the pure pages, that he may warn of a severe punishment from Him, and give good news to the believers who do good deeds that they shall have a good reward.
interpretation: The verse highlights the role of the Prophet as a warner and a bearer of good news, emphasizing that those who do good deeds will be rewarded, implying that faith and good deeds are intertwined and inseparable.
orig: قيما لينذر بأسا شديدا من لدنه ويبشر المؤمنين الذين يعملون الصالحات أن لهم أجرا حسنا

translation: Abiding therein forever.
interpretation: The verse highlights the eternal nature of the consequences of one's actions, implying that the punishment or reward in the afterlife is permanent and irreversible.
orig: ماكثين فيه أبدا

translation: And warn those who say: 'Allah has taken a son.'
interpretation: This verse is a call to warn those who attribute divinity to Jesus or any other prophet, emphasizing the Oneness of God and the rejection of any form of polytheism.
orig: وينذر الذين قالوا اتخذ الله ولدا

translation: They have no knowledge of it, nor had their fathers. Grave is the word that comes out of their mouths. They say nothing but a lie.
interpretation: The verse highlights the ignorance and arrogance of those who speak without knowledge, and how their words are empty and false, revealing their own lack of understanding and insight.
orig: ما لهم به من علم ولا لآبائهم كبرت كلمة تخرج من أفواههم إن يقولون إلا كذبا

translation: Perhaps you will kill yourself with grief, that they do not believe in this narration, out of sorrow.
interpretation: The verse highlights the emotional struggle of the Prophet Muhammad, who was deeply distressed by the rejection of his message by the unbelievers, and warns against the dangers of despair and hopelessness in the face of adversity.
orig: فلعلك باخع نفسك على آثارهم إن لم يؤمنوا بهذا الحديث أسفا

translation: Verily, We have made all that is on the earth an adornment for it, that We may test them, which of them is best in deed.
interpretation: The verse suggests that God has created the beauty and attractions of the world as a test for humanity, to see who will use these gifts wisely and for the betterment of themselves and others, and who will be corrupted by them.
orig: إنا جعلنا ما على الأرض زينة لها لنبلوهم أيهم أحسن عملا

translation: And We will make what is on it (the earth) a barren soil.
interpretation: The verse symbolizes the destructive power of God, where He can turn a fertile land into a barren one, implying that God has the ability to render useless and ineffective the means and resources that people rely on, leaving them helpless and dependent solely on Him.
orig: وإنا لجاعلون ما عليها صعيدا جرزا

translation: Or do you think that the companions of the Cave and the Inscription were among Our wonderful signs?
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of the story of the Companions of the Cave, emphasizing that it is one of the most remarkable signs of God's power and mercy, serving as a reminder of God's ability to protect and care for His faithful servants.
orig: أم حسبت أن أصحاب الكهف والرقيم كانوا من آياتنا عجبا

translation: When the youths took refuge in the cave, they said: Our Lord, grant us mercy from Yourself and provide for us guidance in our affair.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of seeking divine guidance and mercy in times of crisis, and how this can lead to a resolution of one's problems and a way out of darkness and uncertainty.
orig: إذ أوى الفتية إلى الكهف فقالوا ربنا آتنا من لدنك رحمة وهيئ لنا من أمرنا رشدا

translation: And We sealed their hearing in the cave for a number of years.
interpretation: The verse highlights the miraculous preservation of the believers who took refuge in the cave, where God protected them from the outside world, sealing their hearing and senses, allowing them to remain in a state of suspended animation for a prolonged period of time, unaware of the passage of time.
orig: فضربنا على آذانهم في الكهف سنين عددا

translation: Then We raised them up, so that We might know which of the two parties was best able to calculate the period of their stay.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's power and wisdom in testing people's faith and patience, and that only those who are truly faithful and obedient will be able to accurately perceive and appreciate the passage of time.
orig: ثم بعثناهم لنعلم أي الحزبين أحصى لما لبثوا أمدا

translation: We recite to you some of their news in truth; indeed, they were youths who believed in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of faith and guidance in the journey towards spiritual growth and self-improvement, suggesting that having faith in God is essential for receiving divine guidance and wisdom.
orig: نحن نقص عليك نبأهم بالحق إنهم فتية آمنوا بربهم وزدناهم هدى

translation: And We have bound upon their hearts when they stood up and said, 'Our Lord, Lord of the heavens and the earth, we will never call upon any god beside Him.' We had certainly said, 'If we should be expelled, we will not worship any god other than Him.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the irony of those who claim to be monotheists, yet continue to engage in idolatry, demonstrating a clear disconnect between their words and actions, and a lack of commitment to their professed faith.
orig: وربطنا على قلوبهم إذ قاموا فقالوا ربنا رب السماوات والأرض لن ندعو من دونه إلها لقد قلنا إذا شططا

translation: These, our people, have taken besides Him other gods. Why do they not bring for them a clear authority? Who is more unjust than one who invents a lie against Allah?
interpretation: The verse highlights the absurdity of idol worship, where people attribute divine qualities to created beings, and emphasizes that such false beliefs are a form of injustice against God's oneness and uniqueness.
orig: هؤلاء قومنا اتخذوا من دونه آلهة لولا يأتون عليهم بسلطان بين فمن أظلم ممن افترى على الله كذبا

translation: And when you have withdrawn from them and that which they worship besides Allah, then seek refuge in the Cave; your Lord will unfold some of His mercy unto you, and will provide for you a gentle relief in your affair.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of distancing oneself from those who reject the truth and seeking refuge in a place of spiritual solace, where one can find comfort and guidance from God, leading to a gentle and peaceful resolution to one's difficulties.
orig: وإذ اعتزلتموهم وما يعبدون إلا الله فأووا إلى الكهف ينشر لكم ربكم من رحمته ويهيئ لكم من أمركم مرفقا

translation: And you see the sun, when it rises, declining to the right of their cave, and when it sets, passing them on the left, while they are in a hollow thereof. That is among the signs of Allah. He whom Allah guides is the guided one, and he whom He leaves astray, you will not find for him a guiding patron.
interpretation: The verse highlights the miracle of the sleepers in the cave, where the sun's movement around their cave is a sign of God's power and guidance, and serves as a reminder that only God can guide those who are lost, and those who are misguided will not find anyone to guide them.
orig: وترى الشمس إذا طلعت تزاور عن كهفهم ذات اليمين وإذا غربت تقرضهم ذات الشمال وهم في فجوة منه ذلك من آيات الله من يهد الله فهو المهتد ومن يضلل فلن تجد له وليا مرشدا

translation: And you would think them awake, but they are asleep, and We turn them over to the right and the left, and their dog stretches his forelegs at the threshold. If you were to look at them, you would turn away from them in flight, and you would be filled with terror from them.
interpretation: The verse highlights the illusion of the Companions of the Cave, who appeared to be awake but were actually in a state of deep sleep, and the dog that guarded them. The verse emphasizes the miraculous nature of this event, which would evoke fear and awe in anyone who witnessed it, highlighting God's power and control over all things.
orig: وتحسبهم أيقاظا وهم رقود ونقلبهم ذات اليمين وذات الشمال وكلبهم باسط ذراعيه بالوصيد لو اطلعت عليهم لوليت منهم فرارا ولملئت منهم رعبا

translation: And thus We have raised them, that they might question among themselves. A speaker from among them said, 'How long did you remain?' They said, 'We remained a day or part of a day.' They said, 'Your Lord knows best how long you remained, so send one of you with this silver coin of yours to the city, and let him see which of them has the purest food, and let him bring you provision from it, and let him be gentle, and let no one sense that you are there.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of humility and caution when interacting with others, as the people in the story are instructed to be gentle and not to reveal their presence, demonstrating the value of humility and discretion in one's dealings with others.
orig: وكذلك بعثناهم ليتساءلوا بينهم قال قائل منهم كم لبثتم قالوا لبثنا يوما أو بعض يوم قالوا ربكم أعلم بما لبثتم فابعثوا أحدكم بورقكم هذه إلى المدينة فلينظر أيها أزكى طعاما فليأتكم برزق منه وليتلطف ولا يشعرن بكم أحدا

translation: If they come to power, they will stone you or turn you back to their religion, and you will never succeed.
interpretation: The verse highlights the danger of allowing those who oppose Islam to gain power, as they will not hesitate to persecute and harm believers, and even try to force them to abandon their faith.
orig: إنهم إن يظهروا عليكم يرجموكم أو يعيدوكم في ملتهم ولن تفلحوا إذا أبدا

translation: And thus We made them stumble upon them, that they might know that Allah's promise is true and that the Hour is coming, about which there is no doubt. When they disputed among themselves about their affair, they said, 'Build over them a structure. Their Lord knows best about them.' Those who prevailed in the matter said, 'We will certainly take a place of worship over them.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of remembering and learning from the past, specifically the stories of previous nations, as a means of strengthening one's faith and trust in God's promises and warnings, including the inevitability of the Day of Judgment.
orig: وكذلك أعثرنا عليهم ليعلموا أن وعد الله حق وأن الساعة لا ريب فيها إذ يتنازعون بينهم أمرهم فقالوا ابنوا عليهم بنيانا ربهم أعلم بهم قال الذين غلبوا على أمرهم لنتخذن عليهم مسجدا

translation: They will say, 'There were three, the fourth of them being their dog,' and they will say, 'There were five, the sixth of them being their dog,' guessing at the unseen. They will say, 'There were seven, and the eighth of them was their dog.' Say, 'My Lord knows best their number, none knows them but a few.' So do not argue with them except in a visible manner, and do not seek information about them from any of them.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of human speculation and guesswork in matters that are beyond human knowledge, emphasizing the limitations of human understanding and the importance of humility in the face of the unknown.
orig: سيقولون ثلاثة رابعهم كلبهم ويقولون خمسة سادسهم كلبهم رجما بالغيب ويقولون سبعة وثامنهم كلبهم قل ربي أعلم بعدتهم ما يعلمهم إلا قليل فلا تمار فيهم إلا مراء ظاهرا ولا تستفت فيهم منهم أحدا

translation: And never say of anything, 'Indeed, I will do that tomorrow'
interpretation: This verse warns against procrastination and encourages believers to take immediate action, rather than putting things off until tomorrow, as it may never come, and emphasizes the importance of living in the present moment.
orig: ولا تقولن لشيء إني فاعل ذلك غدا

translation: Except if Allah wills. And remember your Lord when you forget and say: 'Perhaps my Lord will guide me to a nearer guidance than this'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of humility and recognition of one's limitations, as even the Prophet Muhammad had to acknowledge that his guidance and knowledge were dependent on Allah's will, and that he needed to constantly seek Allah's guidance to stay on the right path.
orig: إلا أن يشاء الله واذكر ربك إذا نسيت وقل عسى أن يهدين ربي لأقرب من هذا رشدا

translation: And they stayed in their cave for three hundred years, and added nine.
interpretation: The verse highlights the miraculous nature of the Companions of the Cave's experience, where they were able to sleep for an extended period of time, unaware of the passage of time, and were awakened to continue their lives as if no time had passed, emphasizing God's power and control over time and human existence.
orig: ولبثوا في كهفهم ثلاث مائة سنين وازدادوا تسعا

translation: Allah knows what they hide for Him in the unseen of the heavens and the earth, He sees and hears all, and they have no guardian or intercessor besides Him, and He does not share His judgment with anyone.
interpretation: The verse highlights the absolute authority and omniscience of God, emphasizing that no one can hide anything from Him, and that He has complete control over all matters, with no need for intercession or consultation with anyone.
orig: قل الله أعلم بما لبثوا له غيب السماوات والأرض أبصر به وأسمع ما لهم من دونه من ولي ولا يشرك في حكمه أحدا

translation: Recite what has been revealed to you from the Book of your Lord, no one can change His words, and you will not find any refuge besides Him.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the finality and inalterability of the Quran, implying that any attempt to modify or distort its message is futile, and that ultimately, one will have to return to God for judgment, with no escape or refuge from His justice.
orig: واتل ما أوحي إليك من كتاب ربك لا مبدل لكلماته ولن تجد من دونه ملتحدا

translation: And keep yourself patient with those who call their Lord in the morning and the evening, seeking His Face, and let not your eyes pass beyond them, desiring the pomp and glitter of the life of the world, and obey not him whose heart We have made heedless of Our remembrance, and who follows his own whims, and whose affair has become all excess.
interpretation: The verse advises the Prophet Muhammad to remain patient and steadfast in the face of rejection and persecution, and to focus on those who truly seek God, rather than being distracted by the allure of worldly wealth and status, which can lead to spiritual neglect and excess.
orig: واصبر نفسك مع الذين يدعون ربهم بالغداة والعشي يريدون وجهه ولا تعد عيناك عنهم تريد زينة الحياة الدنيا ولا تطع من أغفلنا قلبه عن ذكرنا واتبع هواه وكان أمره فرطا

translation: And say, 'The truth is from your Lord. Whoever wills, let him believe; and whoever wills, let him disbelieve.' Indeed, We have prepared for the wrongdoers a fire whose walls will surround them. And if they call for relief, they will be relieved with water like molten copper, which scalds the faces. Wretched is the drink, and evil is the resting place.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of free will, where individuals have the choice to believe or disbelieve, and emphasizes that the consequences of their choices will be faced in the afterlife, where the wrongdoers will be punished in a fiery hell, and the believers will be rewarded in paradise.
orig: وقل الحق من ربكم فمن شاء فليؤمن ومن شاء فليكفر إنا أعتدنا للظالمين نارا أحاط بهم سرادقها وإن يستغيثوا يغاثوا بماء كالمهل يشوي الوجوه بئس الشراب وساءت مرتفقا

translation: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - We will not allow to be lost the reward of any one who does good.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes God's justice and fairness, reassuring believers that their good deeds will not go unrewarded, and that God will ultimately compensate them for their efforts, no matter how small they may seem.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات إنا لا نضيع أجر من أحسن عملا

translation: Those will have gardens of Eden, beneath them rivers will flow, they will be adorned with bracelets of gold and wear green garments of fine silk and brocade, reclining therein on couches, excellent is the reward, and goodly the resting place.
interpretation: The verse describes the eternal bliss and comfort of the righteous in paradise, where they will be adorned with gold and fine garments, and recline on couches, emphasizing the idea that true happiness and contentment can only be achieved through a life of righteousness and obedience to God's will.
orig: أولئك لهم جنات عدن تجري من تحتهم الأنهار يحلون فيها من أساور من ذهب ويلبسون ثيابا خضرا من سندس وإستبرق متكئين فيها على الأرائك نعم الثواب وحسنت مرتفقا

translation: And present to them an example: two men, to one of whom We gave two gardens of grapes, and We surrounded them with palm trees and placed between them a crop.
interpretation: The verse is highlighting the importance of gratitude and appreciation for the blessings one receives from God, as the person who is given the two gardens is expected to be thankful and humble, rather than taking the blessings for granted.
orig: واضرب لهم مثلا رجلين جعلنا لأحدهما جنتين من أعناب وحففناهما بنخل وجعلنا بينهما زرعا

translation: Both gardens yielded their produce and did not withhold anything thereof, and We caused a river to flow through them.
interpretation: The verse symbolizes the abundance and blessings that come from living a righteous life, where one's efforts yield maximum results and are accompanied by an abundance of resources, just like a river flowing through the gardens, nourishing and sustaining them.
orig: كلتا الجنتين آتت أكلها ولم تظلم منه شيئا وفجرنا خلالهما نهرا

translation: And he had fruit, so he said to his companion while conversing with him: I am greater than you in wealth and have a mightier family.
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and pride of a wealthy person who believes that his wealth and family are the measures of his superiority, and that he looks down upon others who are less fortunate, not realizing that true worth is not measured by material possessions or family connections.
orig: وكان له ثمر فقال لصاحبه وهو يحاوره أنا أكثر منك مالا وأعز نفرا

translation: And he entered his garden, while he was unjust to himself. He said: 'I do not think that this will ever perish.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and ignorance of the person, who despite being unjust to himself, is convinced that his wealth and possessions will last forever, unaware of the transience of worldly things and the inevitability of accountability.
orig: ودخل جنته وهو ظالم لنفسه قال ما أظن أن تبيد هذه أبدا

translation: And I do not think the Hour will occur, and even if I am returned to my Lord, I will surely find better than this return.
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and overconfidence of those who reject the concept of the Day of Judgment, thinking they can escape accountability and instead will find a better fate than the one they are currently in.
orig: وما أظن الساعة قائمة ولئن رددت إلى ربي لأجدن خيرا منها منقلبا

translation: His companion said to him, as he conversed with him, 'Have you disbelieved in the One who created you from dust, then from a drop of sperm, then proportioned you as a man?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the miraculous nature of human creation, from the humble beginnings of dust and a drop of sperm, to the formation of a fully formed human being, emphasizing God's power and wisdom in creation.
orig: قال له صاحبه وهو يحاوره أكفرت بالذي خلقك من تراب ثم من نطفة ثم سواك رجلا

translation: He said, 'I have taken Allah as my Lord, and I do not associate anyone with my Lord.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of maintaining a pure and sincere devotion to Allah, free from any form of polytheism or idolatry, and serves as a testament to the believer's unwavering commitment to the oneness of God.
orig: لكنا هو الله ربي ولا أشرك بربي أحدا

translation: And why, when you entered your garden, did you not say, 'As Allah wills, there is no power except with Allah.' If I had less wealth and children than you.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of acknowledging God's sovereignty and accepting His will, rather than relying on one's own power and resources, and that true strength and power come only from God.
orig: ولولا إذ دخلت جنتك قلت ما شاء الله لا قوة إلا بالله إن ترن أنا أقل منك مالا وولدا

translation: Perhaps my Lord will give me better than your garden and send upon it a calamity from the sky, and it will become a slippery plain.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that God's power and will can suddenly and unexpectedly change the course of events, turning a seemingly prosperous and flourishing situation into a desolate and barren one, serving as a reminder of God's omnipotence and the transience of worldly gains.
orig: فعسى ربي أن يؤتين خيرا من جنتك ويرسل عليها حسبانا من السماء فتصبح صعيدا زلقا

translation: Or its water becomes Mawr, then you will not be able to seek it.
interpretation: This verse highlights the fleeting nature of worldly possessions and resources, implying that even the most abundant and reliable sources can suddenly disappear, leaving one helpless and unable to recover them.
orig: أو يصبح ماؤها غورا فلن تستطيع له طلبا

translation: And he surrounded its fruit, and it became like that, he turned his hands upon what he had spent on it, and it was ruined on its trellises, and he said, 'Oh, I wish I had not associated anyone with my Lord'
interpretation: The verse highlights the regret and remorse of a person who had devoted himself to worldly gains and material possessions, only to lose everything and realize too late that his pursuit of wealth and power was futile and misguided, and that he should have instead focused on his relationship with God.
orig: وأحيط بثمره فأصبح يقلب كفيه على ما أنفق فيها وهي خاوية على عروشها ويقول يا ليتني لم أشرك بربي أحدا

translation: And he did not have a party to help him besides Allah, nor could he defend himself.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of relying on worldly powers and alliances in the face of God's will, emphasizing that true strength and protection can only come from Allah.
orig: ولم تكن له فئة ينصرونه من دون الله وما كان منتصرا

translation: To Him belongs the kingdom of the truth, He is the best rewarder and the best final outcome.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's absolute sovereignty and emphasizes that He is the ultimate source of all rewards and outcomes, implying that one should strive to please Him alone, as He is the only one who can provide the best and most enduring rewards.
orig: هنالك الولاية لله الحق هو خير ثوابا وخير عقبا

translation: And strike for them the example of the life of this world: it is like the water which We send down from the sky, then the plants of the earth mingle with it, then it becomes dry and scattered by the winds, and Allah is over all things competent.
interpretation: The verse uses the metaphor of the fleeting nature of a plant's life cycle to illustrate the transience and impermanence of worldly life, emphasizing that everything in this life is subject to change and decay, and ultimately, only God's power and authority endure.
orig: واضرب لهم مثل الحياة الدنيا كماء أنزلناه من السماء فاختلط به نبات الأرض فأصبح هشيما تذروه الرياح وكان الله على كل شيء مقتدرا

translation: Wealth and children are the adornment of the life of this world, but the enduring good deeds are better in the sight of your Lord and better in hope.
interpretation: The verse highlights the impermanence of worldly possessions and relationships, emphasizing that it is the good deeds done in this life that will bring true and lasting value in the hereafter.
orig: المال والبنون زينة الحياة الدنيا والباقيات الصالحات خير عند ربك ثوابا وخير أملا

translation: And [remember] the Day when We will remove the mountains, and you will see the earth as a levelled plain, and We will gather them, not leaving behind anyone of them.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that on the Day of Judgment, all people will be gathered together, regardless of their social status, power or wealth, and will be held accountable for their actions, emphasizing the equality and fairness of God's justice.
orig: ويوم نسير الجبال وترى الأرض بارزة وحشرناهم فلم نغادر منهم أحدا

translation: And they will be presented before your Lord in rows: 'You have come to Us as We created you at first. Nay, you thought that We would not fulfill the appointment made to you.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the accountability of humanity before God on the Day of Judgment, where they will be gathered in rows, and reminded of their initial creation, implying that they will be held responsible for their actions and will not be able to escape the consequences of their deeds.
orig: وعرضوا على ربك صفا لقد جئتمونا كما خلقناكم أول مرة بل زعمتم ألن نجعل لكم موعدا

translation: And the book will be placed, and you will see the criminals fearful of what is in it, and they will say: 'Woe to us! What is this book that does not leave out anything, small or large, but has taken account of it?' And they will find what they did present, and your Lord does not wrong anyone.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that on the Day of Judgment, people will be held accountable for their actions, and the book of deeds will reveal everything, leaving no detail unaccounted for, and thus, people will be forced to confront the reality of their own actions, and will be unable to deny or escape their responsibilities.
orig: ووضع الكتاب فترى المجرمين مشفقين مما فيه ويقولون يا ويلتنا مال هذا الكتاب لا يغادر صغيرة ولا كبيرة إلا أحصاها ووجدوا ما عملوا حاضرا ولا يظلم ربك أحدا

translation: And when We said to the angels, 'Prostrate to Adam,' they prostrated, except Iblis; he was of the jinn and disobeyed the command of his Lord. Do you take him and his offspring as allies instead of Me, while they are your enemies? Wretched is the exchange for the wrongdoers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of obedience to God's commands and the dangers of pride and disobedience, as exemplified by Iblis' refusal to prostrate to Adam, and serves as a warning to those who would choose to follow Satan and his ways instead of obeying God's will.
orig: وإذ قلنا للملائكة اسجدوا لآدم فسجدوا إلا إبليس كان من الجن ففسق عن أمر ربه أفتتخذونه وذريته أولياء من دوني وهم لكم عدو بئس للظالمين بدلا

translation: And I did not testify to them at the creation of the heavens and the earth, nor at the creation of their own souls, and I was not taking the misleaders as assistants.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's independence and self-sufficiency in creation, emphasizing that He did not need the assistance of anyone, not even the misguided, in creating the universe and humanity.
orig: ما أشهدتهم خلق السماوات والأرض ولا خلق أنفسهم وما كنت متخذ المضلين عضدا

translation: And the Day He will say, 'Call your associates' - those you claimed - and they will call them, but they will not respond to them, and We will put a barrier between them.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of associating partners with God, as on the Day of Judgment, those who claimed to have partners with God will be unable to get any response or help from them, and will be separated from them, emphasizing the uniqueness and exclusivity of God's power and authority.
orig: ويوم يقول نادوا شركائي الذين زعمتم فدعوهم فلم يستجيبوا لهم وجعلنا بينهم موبقا

translation: And the criminals will see the Fire and will think they are about to fall into it, and they will find no escape from it.
interpretation: The verse highlights the horror and despair of the sinners when they finally realize the reality of Hell, and their desperation to escape it, only to find that there is no way out, emphasizing the gravity of their mistakes and the inevitability of their punishment.
orig: ورأى المجرمون النار فظنوا أنهم مواقعوها ولم يجدوا عنها مصرفا
