interpretation: This verse highlights God's repeated blessings and favours upon the Prophet Muhammad, emphasizing God's continuous support and guidance throughout his mission.
orig: ولقد مننا عليك مرة أخرى

translation: When We revealed to your mother what was revealed
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of the revelation received by the Prophet's mother, emphasizing the divine origin and importance of the message.
orig: إذ أوحينا إلى أمك ما يوحى

translation: That I should cast him into the ark, and cast it into the river, then the river shall bring it to the bank, and he shall take him, an enemy to me and an enemy to him, and I cast upon you love from Me, and that you might be brought up under My eye.
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of God's protection and care for His chosen ones, as exemplified in the story of Moses, where God's love and guidance ensured his safety and upbringing, despite being in a hostile environment.
orig: أن اقذفيه في التابوت فاقذفيه في اليم فليلقه اليم بالساحل يأخذه عدو لي وعدو له وألقيت عليك محبة مني ولتصنع على عيني

translation: When your sister walked, saying, 'Shall I direct you to someone who can take care of him?' So We returned you to your mother, that she might be comforted and not grieve. And you killed someone, but We saved you from distress. And We tried you with a severe trial, but you stayed for many years among the people of Midian. Then you came [here] at the appointed time, O Moses.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of the role of family and caregivers in providing comfort and care to those in need, as exemplified by Moses' sister's efforts to find a caregiver for him and his mother's joy at being reunited with him.
orig: إذ تمشي أختك فتقول هل أدلكم على من يكفله فرجعناك إلى أمك كي تقر عينها ولا تحزن وقتلت نفسا فنجيناك من الغم وفتناك فتونا فلبثت سنين في أهل مدين ثم جئت على قدر يا موسى

translation: And I have chosen you for Myself
interpretation: This verse highlights the special relationship between God and the Prophet Ibrahim, indicating a sense of intimacy and closeness, where God has chosen Ibrahim for a unique purpose, setting him apart from others and entrusting him with a sacred mission.
orig: واصطنعتك لنفسي

translation: Go, you and your brother, with My signs, and do not slacken in My remembrance.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of perseverance and consistency in one's duties, especially when it comes to spreading God's message, emphasizing that one should not become complacent or neglectful in their responsibilities.
orig: اذهب أنت وأخوك بآياتي ولا تنيا في ذكري

translation: Go, both of you, to Pharaoh, indeed he has transgressed.
interpretation: This verse is a call to action, urging the prophets to take a stand against Pharaoh's tyranny and oppression, emphasizing the urgency of the situation and the need for immediate intervention.
orig: اذهبا إلى فرعون إنه طغى

translation: Speak to him a gentle word, perhaps he may take heed or fear.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of gentle and compassionate communication in conveying the message of God, as it is more likely to inspire reflection and reverence in the listener.
orig: فقولا له قولا لينا لعله يتذكر أو يخشى

translation: They said: 'Our Lord, indeed we fear that he may hasten against us, or that he may transgress.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the fear and anxiety of the righteous when faced with the wrath of a tyrant, emphasizing their vulnerability and helplessness in the face of oppression.
orig: قالا ربنا إننا نخاف أن يفرط علينا أو أن يطغى

translation: He said: 'Fear not, indeed I am with you both, I hear and I see.'
interpretation: The verse conveys a sense of reassurance and divine guidance, emphasizing God's omnipresence and omniscience, and serves as a reminder that believers are never alone, for God is always with them, witnessing and guiding their actions.
orig: قال لا تخافا إنني معكما أسمع وأرى

translation: So go to him and say, 'Indeed, we are messengers of your Lord, so send with us the Children of Israel and do not punish them. We have come to you with a sign from your Lord. And peace be upon he who follows the guidance.'
interpretation: The verse is emphasizing the importance of following divine guidance, and that those who do so will be granted peace and protection from God's punishment.
orig: فأتياه فقولا إنا رسولا ربك فأرسل معنا بني إسرائيل ولا تعذبهم قد جئناك بآية من ربك والسلام على من اتبع الهدى

translation: Indeed, We have revealed to you that the torment is for him who denies and turns away.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of accepting the truth and the consequences of rejecting it, emphasizing that those who deny and turn away from the message of God will ultimately face punishment.
orig: إنا قد أوحي إلينا أن العذاب على من كذب وتولى

translation: He said: 'Who is your Lord, O Musa?'
interpretation: This verse highlights Pharaoh's arrogance and ignorance of God's power, as he questions Moses about his Lord, implying that he himself is the ultimate authority and power.
orig: قال فمن ربكما يا موسى

translation: Our Lord is He who gave to each thing its form and then guided it.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's role as the Creator who not only brings things into existence but also guides them towards their purpose, implying that God's creation is not a random or chaotic process, but rather a deliberate and intentional act that is infused with wisdom and direction.
orig: قال ربنا الذي أعطى كل شيء خلقه ثم هدى

translation: He said: 'What about the towns of old?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of learning from history and the consequences of past nations that disobeyed God, serving as a reminder to the current generation to avoid repeating the same mistakes.
orig: قال فما بال القرون الأولى

translation: He said: 'The knowledge is with my Lord in a Book, my Lord neither errs nor forgets.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that God's knowledge and power are infinite and flawless, implying that God's judgment and decisions are always just and accurate, and that God's memory is perfect and never forgets.
orig: قال علمها عند ربي في كتاب لا يضل ربي ولا ينسى

translation: Who has made the earth a resting place for you, and has made for you paths therein, and has sent down water from the sky, and We have brought forth pairs of diverse plants?
interpretation: The verse highlights God's benevolence and provision for humanity, emphasizing how God has created the earth as a comfortable habitat for humans, provided pathways for their ease of movement, and sent down water to nourish the plants, which in turn provide sustenance for humans, thus demonstrating God's care and concern for humanity's well-being.
orig: الذي جعل لكم الأرض مهدا وسلك لكم فيها سبلا وأنزل من السماء ماء فأخرجنا به أزواجا من نبات شتى

translation: Eat and pasture your cattle, indeed in that are signs for people of intelligence.
interpretation: The verse is encouraging humans to reflect on the natural world, as it holds signs and lessons for those who are intelligent and perceptive, implying that they will be able to discern the wisdom and power of God through the natural order.
orig: كلوا وارعوا أنعامكم إن في ذلك لآيات لأولي النهى

translation: Therefrom We created you, and thereunto We return you, and therefrom We bring you forth another time.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of the cyclical nature of human existence, where humans originate from the earth, return to it, and will be resurrected from it again, emphasizing the connection between human existence and the natural world.
orig: منها خلقناكم وفيها نعيدكم ومنها نخرجكم تارة أخرى

translation: And indeed We showed him Our signs, all of them, but he denied and refused.
interpretation: The verse highlights the stubbornness and arrogance of those who reject the truth, even when they are shown clear signs and evidence of God's existence and power, and instead of accepting the truth, they deny and refuse to submit to God's will.
orig: ولقد أريناه آياتنا كلها فكذب وأبى

translation: He said: 'Have you come to drive us out of our land with your magic, O Moses?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and stubbornness of Pharaoh, who instead of acknowledging the miraculous signs shown by Moses, attributes them to magic, and refuses to accept the truth, demonstrating his determination to maintain his power and control over his people.
orig: قال أجئتنا لتخرجنا من أرضنا بسحرك يا موسى

translation: We will certainly bring you magic like theirs, so make an appointment between us and you, a place where neither we nor you will fail.
interpretation: This verse highlights the confidence of the magicians in their abilities, as they propose a public competition with Moses, demonstrating their skills and challenging Moses to match them, thereby showcasing their arrogance and overestimation of their powers.
orig: فلنأتينك بسحر مثله فاجعل بيننا وبينك موعدا لا نخلفه نحن ولا أنت مكانا سوى

translation: He said, 'Your appointment is on the Day of Decoration, and let the people be gathered at noon.'
interpretation: The verse indicates that the appointment or reckoning of the people will take place on the Day of Judgment, which is likened to a day of decoration or adornment, implying a sense of grandeur and majesty, and that the gathering of people will occur at noon, symbolizing a moment of clarity and revelation.
orig: قال موعدكم يوم الزينة وأن يحشر الناس ضحى

translation: So Pharaoh turned away, then he gathered his guile, then he came.
interpretation: The verse highlights Pharaoh's arrogance and stubbornness, as he refuses to accept the truth and instead resorts to his cunning and deceitful tactics to counter the message of God.
orig: فتولى فرعون فجمع كيده ثم أتى

translation: Musa said to them, 'Woe to you! Do not invent a lie against Allah, lest He destroy you with a punishment. And he who invents a lie will surely fail.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of honesty and sincerity in one's relationship with God, warning that fabricating lies against Him will lead to destruction and failure, emphasizing the consequences of dishonesty and deceit.
orig: قال لهم موسى ويلكم لا تفتروا على الله كذبا فيسحتكم بعذاب وقد خاب من افترى

translation: They disputed among themselves about the affair and conversed in private.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of human efforts to conceal or secretly discuss their evil plans, as God is always aware of their intentions and actions, and will ultimately hold them accountable.
orig: فتنازعوا أمرهم بينهم وأسروا النجوى

translation: They said: 'Verily, these two are magicians who intend to drive you out of your land with their magic and take away your exemplary way.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to deny the truth and instead attribute extraordinary events to magic or trickery, rather than acknowledging the power of God.
orig: قالوا إن هذان لساحران يريدان أن يخرجاكم من أرضكم بسحرهما ويذهبا بطريقتكم المثلى

translation: So assemble your scheme, then come in a line, and he who is victorious today will be successful.
interpretation: The verse is a call to those who oppose God's messengers to gather their strength and come forward to confront them, but it is also a declaration of the ultimate triumph of the righteous, implying that the victory of God's side is inevitable and those who stand with God will be successful in the end.
orig: فأجمعوا كيدكم ثم ائتوا صفا وقد أفلح اليوم من استعلى

translation: They said: O Moses, either you throw or we will be the first to throw.
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and defiance of Pharaoh's magicians, who, despite witnessing the miraculous signs of Moses, still refused to submit to God's will, instead opting to challenge Moses to a magical duel.
orig: قالوا يا موسى إما أن تلقي وإما أن نكون أول من ألقى

translation: They said: 'Nay, they have cast a spell upon us, and behold, their ropes and their staves, it seems to him, by their magic, that they are moving.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the illusionary nature of magic, where the observers are deceived into believing that inanimate objects are moving, when in reality, it is just a clever trick of the magician, demonstrating the power of human perception and how it can be manipulated.
orig: قال بل ألقوا فإذا حبالهم وعصيهم يخيل إليه من سحرهم أنها تسعى

translation: Then Moses felt a sense of fear within himself.
interpretation: This verse highlights the human side of a prophet, showing that even a great leader like Moses can experience fear, emphasizing that prophets are not immune to human emotions, but rather, their trust in God helps them overcome their fears and doubts.
orig: فأوجس في نفسه خيفة موسى

translation: We said: 'Fear not, you are the uppermost'
interpretation: The verse signifies the trust and confidence that believers should have in God, who is the highest and most supreme, and that this trust will bring them peace and protection from fear.
orig: قلنا لا تخف إنك أنت الأعلى

translation: And throw what is in your right hand; it will devour what they have made. What they have made is the trick of a sorcerer, and the sorcerer will not be successful wherever he goes.
interpretation: The verse suggests that the truth and power of God will ultimately prevail over the deceitful and manipulative tactics of those who oppose Him, and that no matter how skilled or cunning they may be, they will ultimately fail in their endeavors.
orig: وألق ما في يمينك تلقف ما صنعوا إنما صنعوا كيد ساحر ولا يفلح الساحر حيث أتى

translation: Then the magicians fell down prostrate. They said: 'We believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the immediate and sincere response of the magicians who, despite being tasked by Pharaoh to counter the miracles of Moses, were convinced of the truth of God's message and surrendered to it, acknowledging the Lordship of the God of Aaron and Moses.
orig: فألقي السحرة سجدا قالوا آمنا برب هارون وموسى

translation: Did you believe him before I gave you permission? Indeed, he is your leader who taught you magic. Then I will definitely cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, and I will crucify you on the trunks of palm trees, and you will know which of us is more severe and more lasting in punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of blindly following a leader who misguides people, and the punishment that awaits those who disobey God's commands and indulge in evil practices.
orig: قال آمنتم له قبل أن آذن لكم إنه لكبيركم الذي علمكم السحر فلأقطعن أيديكم وأرجلكم من خلاف ولأصلبنكم في جذوع النخل ولتعلمن أينا أشد عذابا وأبقى

translation: They said: 'We will not be affected by you, despite the clear signs that have come to us, and despite the One who created us. So decree what you will decree, for you can only decree concerning this life of the world.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and defiance of those who reject the truth, as they think they can escape the consequences of their actions and that the punishment is limited to this worldly life, unaware of the greater judgment that awaits them in the hereafter.
orig: قالوا لن نؤثرك على ما جاءنا من البينات والذي فطرنا فاقض ما أنت قاض إنما تقضي هذه الحياة الدنيا

translation: Indeed, we believe in our Lord that He may forgive us our sins and what you compelled us to do of magic, and Allah is better and more enduring.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of acknowledging and seeking forgiveness for past mistakes, and recognizing the supremacy and eternity of God's power and wisdom.
orig: إنا آمنا بربنا ليغفر لنا خطايانا وما أكرهتنا عليه من السحر والله خير وأبقى

translation: Indeed, he who comes to his Lord a criminal, then for him is Hell, wherein he shall not die nor live.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that those who come before God with a criminal record, i.e., having committed sins and injustices, will be punished in Hell, where they will be in a state of perpetual torment, unable to find relief in death or respite in life.
orig: إنه من يأت ربه مجرما فإن له جهنم لا يموت فيها ولا يحيى

translation: And whoever comes to Him as a believer, having done righteous deeds, then those are the ones for whom are the high ranks.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of combining faith with good deeds, as those who do so will be rewarded with elevated spiritual ranks in the afterlife, indicating a close proximity to God.
orig: ومن يأته مؤمنا قد عمل الصالحات فأولئك لهم الدرجات العلى

translation: Gardens of Eden, from beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide, and that is the reward of those who purify themselves.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that spiritual purification is a prerequisite for attaining eternal bliss and paradise, implying that those who strive to purify their souls will be rewarded with eternal life in the Gardens of Eden.
orig: جنات عدن تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها وذلك جزاء من تزكى

translation: And indeed, We inspired to Moses, 'Travel with My servants and strike for them a path through the sea, a dry path, fearing not to be overtaken, nor be afraid.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of trusting in God's guidance and protection, even in the face of seemingly insurmountable challenges, as exemplified by Moses' miraculous crossing of the Red Sea.
orig: ولقد أوحينا إلى موسى أن أسر بعبادي فاضرب لهم طريقا في البحر يبسا لا تخاف دركا ولا تخشى

translation: So Pharaoh pursued them with his armies, then the sea overwhelmed them, covering them with that which covered them.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of human power and arrogance when faced with the mighty power of God, as exemplified by the drowning of Pharaoh's army in the sea, serving as a powerful symbol of God's justice and protection of the righteous.
orig: فأتبعهم فرعون بجنوده فغشيهم من اليم ما غشيهم

translation: And Pharaoh misled his people, and did not guide them.
interpretation: The verse highlights Pharaoh's responsibility for leading his people astray, implying that leaders have a significant influence on their followers and will be held accountable for their actions.
orig: وأضل فرعون قومه وما هدى

translation: O Children of Israel, We have saved you from your enemy, and We made a covenant with you on the right side of the mountain, and We sent down to you manna and quails.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's benevolence and care for the Children of Israel, emphasizing His role as their protector and provider, and reminding them of the covenant He made with them, which serves as a reminder of their responsibilities towards God.
orig: يا بني إسرائيل قد أنجيناكم من عدوكم وواعدناكم جانب الطور الأيمن ونزلنا عليكم المن والسلوى

translation: Eat of the good things We have provided for you, and do not exceed [the limits], lest My anger descend upon you. And he upon whom My anger descends has certainly perished.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of moderation and gratitude in the use of God's blessings, warning that excess and ingratitude can lead to God's wrath and ultimately, destruction.
orig: كلوا من طيبات ما رزقناكم ولا تطغوا فيه فيحل عليكم غضبي ومن يحلل عليه غضبي فقد هوى

translation: And indeed, I am ever forgiving to one who repents, believes and does righteousness and then remains guided.
interpretation: The verse highlights the boundless mercy of God, who is always willing to forgive those who sincerely repent, turn to faith, and perform good deeds, and then continue to follow the right path, emphasizing the importance of perseverance in one's spiritual journey.
orig: وإني لغفار لمن تاب وآمن وعمل صالحا ثم اهتدى

translation: And what hastened thee from thy people, O Moses?
interpretation: The verse suggests that Moses' hasty departure from his people was a sign of his trust in God's plan and his willingness to obey His command, even if it meant leaving behind the comfort and familiarity of his community.
orig: وما أعجلك عن قومك يا موسى

translation: He said: 'These are my sons and this is my flock, and I hastened to you, my Lord, that you may be pleased.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of prioritizing one's spiritual duties and responsibilities towards God, as exemplified by the speaker's hastening to please God, over worldly concerns and material possessions, symbolized by the sons and flock.
orig: قال هم أولاء على أثري وعجلت إليك رب لترضى

translation: He said: Indeed, We have tried your people after you, and the Samiri has led them astray.
interpretation: The verse highlights the role of the Samiri in leading the Israelites astray, implying that he was the catalyst for their deviation from the right path, and that his influence was a test for the community.
orig: قال فإنا قد فتنا قومك من بعدك وأضلهم السامري

translation: And Moses returned to his people, angry and grieved. He said, 'O my people, did not your Lord promise you a good promise? Did the promise seem too long to you, or did you want the wrath from your Lord to descend upon you, so you broke your promise?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of fulfilling one's promises and covenants with God, as breaking them can lead to God's wrath and punishment, emphasizing the responsibility of individuals and communities to uphold their commitments to God.
orig: فرجع موسى إلى قومه غضبان أسفا قال يا قوم ألم يعدكم ربكم وعدا حسنا أفطال عليكم العهد أم أردتم أن يحل عليكم غضب من ربكم فأخلفتم موعدي

translation: They said: 'We did not break our promise to you of our own free will, but we were laden with burdens of the ornaments of the people, so we cast them away, and thus did the Samiri throw'
interpretation: The verse suggests that the people are trying to shift the blame for their actions onto external circumstances, rather than taking responsibility for their own mistakes, and that this tendency to make excuses is a common human weakness.
orig: قالوا ما أخلفنا موعدك بملكنا ولكنا حملنا أوزارا من زينة القوم فقذفناها فكذلك ألقى السامري

translation: So he brought forth for them a calf, a bodily form which lowed, so they said: This is your god and the god of Moses, but he forgot.
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of humans to forget their covenant with God and instead turn to idolatry, even when they have witnessed miracles and have been given guidance, as in the case of the Israelites who forgot their covenant with God and worshipped the calf.
orig: فأخرج لهم عجلا جسدا له خوار فقالوا هذا إلهكم وإله موسى فنسي

translation: Do they not see that they are not returned to them a word, nor has power to harm them or benefit them?
interpretation: The verse highlights the idolaters' ignorance of the fact that the idols they worship are mere inanimate objects, unable to provide any benefit or harm to them, and ultimately powerless to respond to their prayers.
orig: أفلا يرون ألا يرجع إليهم قولا ولا يملك لهم ضرا ولا نفعا

translation: And indeed Aaron had said to them before, 'O my people, you are being tested through it, and indeed your Lord is the Most Merciful, so follow me and obey my command.'
interpretation: The verse highlights Aaron's role as a leader and guide, emphasizing the importance of obedience to his commands as a means of avoiding temptation and staying on the path of righteousness.
orig: ولقد قال لهم هارون من قبل يا قوم إنما فتنتم به وإن ربكم الرحمن فاتبعوني وأطيعوا أمري

translation: They said: 'We will not cease to remain stationed till Moses returns to us'
interpretation: The verse highlights the people's dependence on their leader Moses and their reluctance to take action without his guidance, indicating a lack of faith and trust in God's plan.
orig: قالوا لن نبرح عليه عاكفين حتى يرجع إلينا موسى

translation: He (Musa) said: 'O Harun, what prevented you when you saw them going astray?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of taking a firm stance against wrongdoing, even if it means going against those close to you, as Musa is questioning Harun's inaction in the face of idolatry.
orig: قال يا هارون ما منعك إذ رأيتهم ضلوا

translation: Do you not then obey my order?
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of obedience to God's commands, emphasizing that disobedience is a form of rebellion against God's authority, and that those who refuse to obey will be held accountable for their actions.
orig: ألا تتبعن أفعصيت أمري

translation: He said, 'O son of my mother, do not seize me by my beard or my head; I fear that you may say, 'You have caused division among the Children of Israel and did not wait for my command.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the concern of a leader or a person of authority to maintain unity and avoid causing division among his people, and the importance of waiting for guidance or instruction before taking action.
orig: قال يا ابن أم لا تأخذ بلحيتي ولا برأسي إني خشيت أن تقول فرقت بين بني إسرائيل ولم ترقب قولي

translation: He said: 'What ails you, O Samiri?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the accountability and questioning that will take place in the presence of God, where individuals will be asked to explain their actions and decisions, and the consequences of their choices will be revealed.
orig: قال فما خطبك يا سامري

translation: He said: I have seen what they did not see, so I took a handful of the Apostle's footprint, then I threw it away, and thus I deceived my soul.
interpretation: The verse highlights the deceitful nature of the one who claims to have seen something that others did not, and how this false sense of superiority can lead to self-deception and spiritual downfall.
orig: قال بصرت بما لم يبصروا به فقبضت قبضة من أثر الرسول فنبذتها وكذلك سولت لي نفسي

translation: He said: 'Go, for you are spared to say "No contact" and you have an appointment that you will not fail, and look at your god that you remained devoted to, we will certainly burn it, then we will scatter it in the sea, a scattering.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and ignorance of the idolaters, who think they can defy God's commands and continue to worship their false gods, but ultimately, their idols will be destroyed and scattered, symbolizing the futility of their worship and the triumph of God's power.
orig: قال فاذهب فإن لك في الحياة أن تقول لا مساس وإن لك موعدا لن تخلفه وانظر إلى إلهك الذي ظلت عليه عاكفا لنحرقنه ثم لننسفنه في اليم نسفا

translation: Your God is Allah, there is no god but He, and He encompasses all things in knowledge.
interpretation: The verse highlights Allah's omnipotence and omniscience, emphasizing that He is the sole deity worthy of worship, and that His knowledge encompasses all things, implying that He is fully aware of every aspect of the universe and human affairs.
orig: إنما إلهكم الله الذي لا إله إلا هو وسع كل شيء علما

translation: Thus do We relate to you some of the news of what has gone before, and We have given you a reminder from Us.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of learning from history and the experiences of previous generations, implying that the stories and events of the past serve as a reminder and a guidance for those who come later.
orig: كذلك نقص عليك من أنباء ما قد سبق وقد آتيناك من لدنا ذكرا

translation: From whom it is averted on that day, he indeed bears on the Day of Resurrection a burden
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of personal responsibility, emphasizing that each individual will bear the consequences of their own actions on the Day of Judgment, and no one will be able to shift the burden of their sins to someone else.
orig: من أعرض عنه فإنه يحمل يوم القيامة وزرا

translation: They will abide therein, and evil will be their load on the Day of Resurrection.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of accountability, where the weight of one's misdeeds will be a burden that they will carry on the Day of Judgment, emphasizing the idea that our actions have consequences that will be reckoned with in the afterlife.
orig: خالدين فيه وساء لهم يوم القيامة حملا

translation: The day when the trumpet is blown, and We gather the criminals on that day, blue-eyed.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that on the Day of Judgment, the guilty will be gathered and punished, and their physical appearance will be altered, symbolizing their spiritual corruption, and serving as a manifestation of their inner state.
orig: يوم ينفخ في الصور ونحشر المجرمين يومئذ زرقا

translation: They will whisper among themselves: 'You have tarried but ten [days]'
interpretation: This verse highlights the tendency of people to underestimate the passage of time and the brevity of human life, as they will be surprised on the Day of Judgment to find that their time on earth was much shorter than they had imagined.
orig: يتخافتون بينهم إن لبثتم إلا عشرا

translation: We know best what they say, when they say: 'These people have stayed but a day'
interpretation: The verse highlights God's omniscience and His awareness of the thoughts and opinions of people, even when they think they are hiding their true beliefs, emphasizing God's all-knowing nature and ability to uncover the truth.
orig: نحن أعلم بما يقولون إذ يقول أمثلهم طريقة إن لبثتم إلا يوما

translation: And they ask you about the mountains, so say: 'My Lord will blast them away.'
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the omnipotence of God, emphasizing that even the mighty mountains, which seem so permanent and unshakeable, are ultimately under God's control and can be reduced to nothing with a mere command from Him.
orig: ويسألونك عن الجبال فقل ينسفها ربي نسفا

translation: And We have certainly honored the children of Adam and borne them over land and sea and provided for them of the good things and preferred them with a preference over much of what We have created, with a preference.
interpretation: The verse highlights the exceptional status of human beings in the eyes of God, emphasizing their dignity and the favors bestowed upon them, which sets them apart from other creations, and serves as a reminder of their responsibility to live up to their noble nature.
orig: فيذرها قاعا صفصفا

translation: You do not see in it any deviation or irregularity
interpretation: The verse highlights the perfection and harmony of the universe, suggesting that God's creation is flawless and free from any defects or contradictions, which is a testament to His infinite wisdom and power.
orig: لا ترى فيها عوجا ولا أمتا

translation: On that day, they will follow the Caller, there being no deviation therefrom, and the voices will be hushed before the Most Merciful, so that you will not hear but a faint whisper.
interpretation: The verse highlights the humility and reverence that will be shown to God on the Day of Judgment, where even the voices of the people will be hushed in awe and reverence, and only a faint whisper will be audible, emphasizing the majesty and power of God.
orig: يومئذ يتبعون الداعي لا عوج له وخشعت الأصوات للرحمن فلا تسمع إلا همسا

translation: That day, no intercession will be of any use, except for him for whom the Most Gracious has given permission and whose word He has approved.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that on the Day of Judgment, no one will be able to intercede on behalf of another unless God has given them permission, emphasizing the absolute authority and justice of God.
orig: يومئذ لا تنفع الشفاعة إلا من أذن له الرحمن ورضي له قولا

translation: He knows what is before them and what is behind them, and they do not comprehend it with knowledge.
interpretation: The verse highlights the infinite knowledge and wisdom of God, emphasizing that humans are limited in their understanding and cannot fully comprehend God's power and plan.
orig: يعلم ما بين أيديهم وما خلفهم ولا يحيطون به علما

translation: And faces shall be humbled before the Ever-Living, the Self-Subsisting, and he will be frustrated who carries iniquity.
interpretation: The verse highlights the ultimate submission of all creation to God's power and authority, where even those who have lived a life of injustice will be humbled and brought to account for their actions.
orig: وعنت الوجوه للحي القيوم وقد خاب من حمل ظلما

translation: And whoever does righteousness and is a believer, he will neither fear injustice nor deprivation.
interpretation: The verse conveys the idea that those who do good deeds and have faith in God will be protected from injustice and want, and will have a sense of security and tranquility in this life and the next.
orig: ومن يعمل من الصالحات وهو مؤمن فلا يخاف ظلما ولا هضما

translation: And thus We have sent it down as an Arabic Quran, and have turned in it the threats that they may fear or it may cause them to remember.
interpretation: This verse highlights the significance of the Quran being revealed in the Arabic language, making it accessible and relatable to the people, so that they may be warned and motivated to change their ways, and ultimately, remember and return to their Lord.
orig: وكذلك أنزلناه قرآنا عربيا وصرفنا فيه من الوعيد لعلهم يتقون أو يحدث لهم ذكرا

translation: Exalted is Allah, the True King. And do not hasten with the Quran before its revelation is completed to you, and say, 'My Lord, increase me in knowledge.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of patience and humility in seeking knowledge and understanding, as the Prophet Muhammad is instructed not to hasten the revelation of the Quran, but rather to wait for its completion, and to ask for increased knowledge from God, highlighting the significance of humility and trust in the divine plan.
orig: فتعالى الله الملك الحق ولا تعجل بالقرآن من قبل أن يقضى إليك وحيه وقل رب زدني علما

translation: And indeed, We made a covenant with Adam before, but he forgot, and We did not find in him determination.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that even the noblest of creations, such as Adam, can be prone to forgetfulness and weakness, emphasizing the importance of humility and the need for constant reminders and guidance from God.
orig: ولقد عهدنا إلى آدم من قبل فنسي ولم نجد له عزما

translation: And when We said to the angels, 'Prostrate to Adam,' so they prostrated, except for Iblis, he refused.
interpretation: The verse highlights Iblis's arrogance and disobedience, which led to his fall from God's grace, serving as a cautionary tale about the dangers of pride and the importance of humility.
orig: وإذ قلنا للملائكة اسجدوا لآدم فسجدوا إلا إبليس أبى

translation: And We said: 'O Adam, indeed this (Satan) is an enemy to you and your wife, so do not let him expel you both from Paradise, lest you suffer.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of being aware of the cunning nature of Satan, who constantly tries to deceive and mislead humanity, and warns against allowing him to lead us away from the path of righteousness and into suffering.
orig: فقلنا يا آدم إن هذا عدو لك ولزوجك فلا يخرجنكما من الجنة فتشقى

translation: That you shall not be hungry therein, nor naked.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the idea that in Paradise, believers will be free from the basic human needs and struggles, such as hunger and nakedness, emphasizing the comfort and luxury that awaits them in the afterlife.
orig: إن لك ألا تجوع فيها ولا تعرى

translation: And that you will not be thirsty therein nor suffer from the heat of the sun
interpretation: This verse is describing the comfort and tranquility of Paradise, where believers will be free from the physical discomforts and hardships of the worldly life, and will enjoy eternal peace and bliss.
orig: وأنك لا تظمأ فيها ولا تضحى

translation: Then Satan whispered to him, saying, 'Adam, shall I show you the tree of eternity and a kingdom that will never decay?'
interpretation: The verse highlights Satan's cunning nature and his ability to deceive even the noblest of creations, Adam, by promising him eternal power and grandeur, which ultimately led to Adam's downfall.
orig: فوسوس إليه الشيطان قال يا آدم هل أدلك على شجرة الخلد وملك لا يبلى

translation: So they both ate from it, and their nakedness appeared to them, and they began to sew together leaves from the Garden to cover themselves, and Adam disobeyed his Lord, and he went astray.
interpretation: The verse highlights the loss of innocence and the consequence of disobedience, as Adam and Eve's actions led to their expulsion from the Garden, symbolizing the human tendency to disobey divine commands and the subsequent loss of divine favor.
orig: فأكلا منها فبدت لهما سوآتهما وطفقا يخصفان عليهما من ورق الجنة وعصى آدم ربه فغوى

translation: Then his Lord chose him and turned to him in forgiveness and guided him.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of repentance and forgiveness, where an individual, after being chosen by God, is granted forgiveness and guidance, indicating that God's mercy and forgiveness are always available to those who turn to Him in sincerity.
orig: ثم اجتباه ربه فتاب عليه وهدى

translation: He said: Get you down from it all of you, some of you are enemies to others. Then if there comes to you guidance from Me, whoever follows My guidance, he shall not go astray nor fall into distress.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of following God's guidance in order to avoid going astray and falling into distress, implying that those who disobey God's commands will face difficulties and confusion.
orig: قال اهبطا منها جميعا بعضكم لبعض عدو فإما يأتينكم مني هدى فمن اتبع هداي فلا يضل ولا يشقى

translation: And whoever turns away from My remembrance, indeed, he will have a difficult life, and We will gather him on the Day of Resurrection blind.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who neglect their spiritual growth and ignore God's signs and reminders will be punished with a life of hardship and difficulties, and ultimately, they will be resurrected on the Day of Judgment in a state of spiritual blindness, unable to see the truth.
orig: ومن أعرض عن ذكري فإن له معيشة ضنكا ونحشره يوم القيامة أعمى

translation: He said: My Lord! Why have You raised me blind, while I had sight?
interpretation: The verse highlights the theme of accountability and the concept of personal responsibility, suggesting that individuals will be held accountable for their actions in this life, and that their physical and spiritual faculties will be restored on the Day of Judgment, allowing them to fully comprehend the consequences of their choices.
orig: قال رب لم حشرتني أعمى وقد كنت بصيرا

translation: Thus did We show Our signs, but you forgot them, and thus today you will be forgotten.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of ignoring God's signs and messages, which ultimately leads to being forgotten and neglected by God.
orig: قال كذلك أتتك آياتنا فنسيتها وكذلك اليوم تنسى

translation: And thus We punish him who transgresses and believes not in the Signs of his Lord; and the torment of the Hereafter is more severe and more lasting.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of accountability, where those who exceed the limits set by God and reject His signs will be punished, and their punishment in the Hereafter will be more severe and long-lasting, implying that their actions have consequences that extend beyond this life.
orig: وكذلك نجزي من أسرف ولم يؤمن بآيات ربه ولعذاب الآخرة أشد وأبقى

translation: Do they not get guidance from their example how many generations We destroyed before them, amidst whose dwellings they walk? Indeed, in that are signs for the people of intellect.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of learning from the mistakes of previous generations, as a means of avoiding similar consequences, and instead, following the path of righteousness and wisdom.
orig: أفلم يهد لهم كم أهلكنا قبلهم من القرون يمشون في مساكنهم إن في ذلك لآيات لأولي النهى

translation: And if there had not been a word that had already gone forth from your Lord, it would have been necessary, and a term would have been fixed.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of God's prior decree and the inevitability of a predetermined course of events, emphasizing that the unfolding of events is already set in motion and cannot be altered.
orig: ولولا كلمة سبقت من ربك لكان لزاما وأجل مسمى

translation: So be patient over what they say and exalt [God] with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting, and [in] some hours of the night and at the ends of the day, that you may be satisfied.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of patience and gratitude in the face of adversity, encouraging the believer to focus on their spiritual growth and connection with God rather than being distracted by the negativity of others.
orig: فاصبر على ما يقولون وسبح بحمد ربك قبل طلوع الشمس وقبل غروبها ومن آناء الليل فسبح وأطراف النهار لعلك ترضى

translation: And do not extend your glance to what We have given to some of them to enjoy - the splendor of the worldly life - to test them thereby. And the provision of your Lord is better and more lasting.
interpretation: The verse cautions against envying the material wealth and luxuries that others may possess, as these are merely a test from God, and reminds the believer that true and lasting provision comes from God alone.
orig: ولا تمدن عينيك إلى ما متعنا به أزواجا منهم زهرة الحياة الدنيا لنفتنهم فيه ورزق ربك خير وأبقى

translation: And enjoin your family to pray, and be patient in it. We do not ask you for provision; We provide for you, and the good end is for the righteous.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of patience and perseverance in one's spiritual journey, emphasizing that true fulfillment and provision come from God, and that those who remain righteous and steadfast will ultimately be rewarded with a good end.
orig: وأمر أهلك بالصلاة واصطبر عليها لا نسألك رزقا نحن نرزقك والعاقبة للتقوى

translation: And they say: 'Why does he not bring us a sign from his Lord?' Has not a clear proof come to them in the former pages?
interpretation: This verse highlights the tendency of people to demand miracles and signs from prophets, while ignoring the clear evidence and guidance that has already been provided to them through previous scriptures and revelations.
orig: وقالوا لولا يأتينا بآية من ربه أولم تأتهم بينة ما في الصحف الأولى

translation: And if We had destroyed them with a punishment before him, they would have said: 'Our Lord, why did You not send us a messenger, so we could have followed Your signs before we were humiliated and disgraced?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to blame God for not sending them a messenger or guidance, when in reality they are responsible for their own disobedience and refusal to follow the truth, and that they would have rejected the messenger even if one was sent to them.
orig: ولو أنا أهلكناهم بعذاب من قبله لقالوا ربنا لولا أرسلت إلينا رسولا فنتبع آياتك من قبل أن نذل ونخزى

translation: Say, 'Each is waiting, so wait; you will come to know who is on the straight path and who is guided.'
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the idea that everyone will eventually know the truth and the righteous will be distinguished from the misguided, implying that patience and waiting are necessary to see the ultimate outcome.
orig: قل كل متربص فتربصوا فستعلمون من أصحاب الصراط السوي ومن اهتدى

translation: The reckoning of the people draws near to them, while they are in heedlessness, turning away.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that people are often oblivious to their own accountability to God, and are instead distracted by worldly pursuits, ignoring the impending judgment that awaits them.
orig: اقترب للناس حسابهم وهم في غفلة معرضون

translation: What comes to them of the reminder from their Lord, they turn away from it, and they are playing.
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to ignore and dismiss divine guidance and warning signs, choosing instead to indulge in frivolous and worldly pursuits, thereby demonstrating their lack of seriousness and responsibility towards their spiritual well-being.
orig: ما يأتيهم من ذكر من ربهم محدث إلا استمعوه وهم يلعبون

translation: Do their minds command them to do this, or are they a people transgressing beyond bounds? Is this not, with Allah, but a human being like yourselves? Do you then use magic while you see?
interpretation: The verse highlights the absurdity of the disbelievers' accusations against the Prophet Muhammad, implying that they are trying to attribute supernatural powers to him, when in reality he is just a human being like them, and that they are the ones who are guilty of transgressing the bounds of reason and morality.
orig: لاهية قلوبهم وأسروا النجوى الذين ظلموا هل هذا إلا بشر مثلكم أفتأتون السحر وأنتم تبصرون

translation: My Lord knows what is spoken in the heaven and the earth, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's omniscience and omnipresence, emphasizing that He is aware of every conversation and thought, whether it takes place in the spiritual realm or the physical world, and that He possesses infinite knowledge and understanding.
orig: قال ربي يعلم القول في السماء والأرض وهو السميع العليم

translation: But they say: 'Confused dreams!' - Nay, he has invented it! - Nay, he is a poet! Let him bring us a sign as the former ones were sent.
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and skepticism of those who reject the Prophet's message, demanding a miraculous sign as proof of his prophethood, while ignoring the clear signs and warnings that have already been revealed to them.
orig: بل قالوا أضغاث أحلام بل افتراه بل هو شاعر فليأتنا بآية كما أرسل الأولون

translation: How many a town have We destroyed before them, will they not believe?
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of learning from the mistakes of others, as God has destroyed many towns before for their disobedience, and yet people still refuse to believe and take heed.
orig: ما آمنت قبلهم من قرية أهلكناها أفهم يؤمنون

translation: And We did not send before you except men to whom We revealed. So ask the people of the Reminder if you do not know.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of seeking knowledge and guidance from those who have been entrusted with the message of God, implying that one should not rely solely on personal opinions or assumptions, but rather seek wisdom and understanding from those who have been divinely guided.
orig: وما أرسلنا قبلك إلا رجالا نوحي إليهم فاسألوا أهل الذكر إن كنتم لا تعلمون

translation: And We did not make them bodies that did not eat food, and they were not immortal.
interpretation: The verse highlights the humanness of the people referred to, emphasizing that they were mortal beings with physical needs, which makes their punishment more understandable and justified.
orig: وما جعلناهم جسدا لا يأكلون الطعام وما كانوا خالدين

translation: Then We fulfilled for them the promise, and We saved them and those We willed, and We destroyed the transgressors.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's justice and mercy, where He saves those who are faithful and obedient, but punishes those who are transgressors and exceed the limits set by Him.
orig: ثم صدقناهم الوعد فأنجيناهم ومن نشاء وأهلكنا المسرفين

translation: We have indeed sent down to you a Book in which is your Reminder, will you not then understand?
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of reflecting on the revelation sent by God, implying that the key to understanding and wisdom lies in contemplation and introspection, rather than mere recitation or superficial reading.
orig: لقد أنزلنا إليكم كتابا فيه ذكركم أفلا تعقلون

translation: And how many a town have We destroyed, which was unjust, and We established after it other people.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's power and authority in dealing with unjust societies, demonstrating that He can destroy and rebuild at will, replacing one group of people with another, implying that no nation or civilization is indispensable.
orig: وكم قصمنا من قرية كانت ظالمة وأنشأنا بعدها قوما آخرين

translation: And when they felt Our punishment, behold, they took to their heels.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futile attempt of those who try to escape God's punishment, emphasizing the futility of human efforts to avoid the consequences of their actions.
orig: فلما أحسوا بأسنا إذا هم منها يركضون

translation: Do not flee, and return to what you were given and to your dwellings; perhaps you will be questioned.
interpretation: This verse advises people to return to their normal lives and homes after a period of chaos or turmoil, and to reflect on their actions, as they will be held accountable for them.
orig: لا تركضوا وارجعوا إلى ما أترفتم فيه ومساكنكم لعلكم تسألون

translation: They will say: 'Oh, woe to us! Indeed, we were wrongdoers.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the regret and remorse that people will express on the Day of Judgment when they realize their past mistakes and injustices, acknowledging that they were wrongdoers and wishing they had taken a different path.
orig: قالوا يا ويلنا إنا كنا ظالمين

translation: So their cry did not cease until We made them as a harvest, utterly cut off.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that the punishment of God is swift and merciless, leaving no remnants or leftovers, just like a harvest that is completely cut off, implying a complete and utter destruction.
orig: فما زالت تلك دعواهم حتى جعلناهم حصيدا خامدين

translation: And We did not create the heaven and the earth and what is between them in vain.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the idea that the creation of the universe was not a pointless or aimless act, but rather it was created with a purpose and a plan, and that God has a wise and just reason behind it.
orig: وما خلقنا السماء والأرض وما بينهما لاعبين

translation: If We had wished to take a pastime, We would have taken it from Ourselves, if We were to do so.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's absolute sovereignty and self-sufficiency, implying that He does not need or seek entertainment or distractions, as He is complete and perfect in Himself.
orig: لو أردنا أن نتخذ لهوا لاتخذناه من لدنا إن كنا فاعلين

translation: Nay, We will cast the truth at falsehood, and it shall overcome it, and lo, it shall vanish away. And woe unto you for what you ascribe.
interpretation: The verse suggests that the truth will ultimately prevail over falsehood, and that the false beliefs and idols will be destroyed, leaving only the truth of God's existence and power.
orig: بل نقذف بالحق على الباطل فيدمغه فإذا هو زاهق ولكم الويل مما تصفون

translation: And to Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and the earth, and those who are with Him are not too proud to worship Him, nor do they tire.
interpretation: The verse highlights the humility and devotion of the angels and other celestial beings in their worship of God, emphasizing that they do not feel too proud or arrogant to worship Him, nor do they ever get tired or bored with their worship, which serves as a model for human beings to follow.
orig: وله من في السماوات والأرض ومن عنده لا يستكبرون عن عبادته ولا يستحسرون

translation: They glorify [Him] night and day; they never slack.
interpretation: The verse highlights the constant and uninterrupted worship of the angels, emphasizing their unwavering devotion to God and their unrelenting praise of Him.
orig: يسبحون الليل والنهار لا يفترون

translation: Or have they taken gods from the earth who can resurrect?
interpretation: The verse is a rhetorical question that highlights the absurdity of idol worship, implying that the idols they have taken from the earth are powerless and unable to bring the dead back to life, let alone have any control over the universe.
orig: أم اتخذوا آلهة من الأرض هم ينشرون

translation: If there were in them (the heavens and the earth) gods besides Allah, they would have been ruined. So exalted is Allah, the Lord of the Throne, above what they attribute.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the uniqueness and unity of God, implying that if there were multiple gods, the universe would be in chaos and disorder, but since God is one, the universe is in harmony and balance, reflecting the perfection of God's creation.
orig: لو كان فيهما آلهة إلا الله لفسدتا فسبحان الله رب العرش عما يصفون

translation: He is not questioned about what He does, and they are questioned.
interpretation: This verse highlights the absolute authority and sovereignty of God, emphasizing that He is not accountable to anyone for His actions, whereas humans are accountable to Him for theirs.
orig: لا يسأل عما يفعل وهم يسألون

translation: Or have they taken gods besides Him? Say: 'Bring your proof.' This is a reminder from those with me and a reminder from those before me. But most of them do not know the truth, so they turn away.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of evidence-based faith, emphasizing that claims of idolatry must be supported by tangible proof, and that blind following or ignorance is not acceptable in matters of faith.
orig: أم اتخذوا من دونه آلهة قل هاتوا برهانكم هذا ذكر من معي وذكر من قبلي بل أكثرهم لا يعلمون الحق فهم معرضون

translation: And We did not send before you any messenger except that We revealed to him that there is no deity except Me, so worship Me.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the core message of all prophets, which is the oneness of God, and that worship is only due to Him, highlighting the significance of Tawhid, the foundation of Islam.
orig: وما أرسلنا من قبلك من رسول إلا نوحي إليه أنه لا إله إلا أنا فاعبدون

translation: And they say, 'The Most Merciful has taken a son.' Exalted is He! Rather, they are honored servants.
interpretation: This verse highlights the polytheistic beliefs of the pagan Arabs, who attributed a son to Allah, which is a grave misconception. The verse corrects this notion by emphasizing the transcendence of Allah, who is far above having a son, and instead, the angels and prophets are honored servants of Allah, not His offspring.
orig: وقالوا اتخذ الرحمن ولدا سبحانه بل عباد مكرمون

translation: They cannot precede Him in speech, and they act by His command.
interpretation: The verse highlights the absolute authority of God, emphasizing that humans are incapable of initiating any action or decision without His prior will and permission, and that all their actions are ultimately a manifestation of His divine command.
orig: لا يسبقونه بالقول وهم بأمره يعملون

translation: He knows what is before them and what is behind them, and they do not intercede except for him whom He approves, and they, from fear of Him, are apprehensive.
interpretation: The verse highlights the absolute authority and omniscience of God, emphasizing that even the angels and prophets, who are closest to Him, are in a state of awe and reverence, and only intercede on behalf of those who have earned God's approval, demonstrating the fear and reverence that all creation has for the Almighty.
orig: يعلم ما بين أيديهم وما خلفهم ولا يشفعون إلا لمن ارتضى وهم من خشيته مشفقون

translation: And whoever of them says: 'I am a god besides Him,' We shall recompense him with Hell. Thus We recompense the wrongdoers.
interpretation: The verse is a warning to those who claim divinity or partnership with God, emphasizing that such a claim will lead to eternal punishment in Hell, and serves as a reminder of the gravity of polytheism and the consequences of rejecting the oneness of God.
orig: ومن يقل منهم إني إله من دونه فذلك نجزيه جهنم كذلك نجزي الظالمين

translation: Do those who disbelieve not see that the heavens and the earth were a closed-up mass, then We split them apart, and We made from water every living thing, will they not believe?
interpretation: The verse is emphasizing the miraculous nature of creation, highlighting the transformation of a single, unified entity into diverse and complex forms of life, all originating from water, and thus serving as a testament to God's power and wisdom, and a call to faith.
orig: أولم ير الذين كفروا أن السماوات والأرض كانتا رتقا ففتقناهما وجعلنا من الماء كل شيء حي أفلا يؤمنون

translation: And We have placed in the earth firm mountains lest it should shake with them, and We have placed in it ravines as roads, that they may be guided.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's wisdom and power in creating a balanced and harmonious universe, where mountains and ravines are placed in a way that maintains order and allows for guidance and direction, symbolizing the need for humans to find balance and harmony in their own lives.
orig: وجعلنا في الأرض رواسي أن تميد بهم وجعلنا فيها فجاجا سبلا لعلهم يهتدون

translation: And We have made the sky a protected ceiling, while they are turning away from its signs.
interpretation: The verse highlights humanity's tendency to ignore the signs and wonders of God's creation, specifically the sky, which is a remarkable and complex system that is both fragile and resilient, and yet people take it for granted and fail to appreciate its beauty and significance.
orig: وجعلنا السماء سقفا محفوظا وهم عن آياتها معرضون

translation: And He is the One who created the night and the day, and the sun and the moon, each in an orbit, swimming.
interpretation: The verse highlights the majestic and harmonious nature of God's creation, where each element, whether it be the night and day or the sun and moon, is in a state of perfect balance and movement, reflecting the beauty and order of God's design.
orig: وهو الذي خلق الليل والنهار والشمس والقمر كل في فلك يسبحون

translation: And We did not grant eternal life to any human being before you. If you die, will they be immortal?
interpretation: This verse highlights the mortal nature of all human beings, including prophets, and that no one is exempt from death, which is a natural part of life, and that even if the Prophet Muhammad were to die, it would not mean that the message of Islam would die with him.
orig: وما جعلنا لبشر من قبلك الخلد أفإن مت فهم الخالدون

translation: Every soul will taste death, and We will test you with evil and with good, as a trial; and to Us you will be returned.
interpretation: The verse highlights the inevitability of death and the testing of human beings through both hardships and blessings, implying that true faith is demonstrated through perseverance and gratitude in the face of adversity.
orig: كل نفس ذائقة الموت ونبلوكم بالشر والخير فتنة وإلينا ترجعون

translation: And when those who disbelieve see you, they take you not except in mockery. Is this the one who mentions your gods, and they are deniers of the Most Merciful?
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and mockery of the disbelievers towards the Prophet Muhammad and the Message of God, showing how they belittle and ridicule the idea of worshiping the One True God, and instead cling to their false idols and gods.
orig: وإذا رآك الذين كفروا إن يتخذونك إلا هزوا أهذا الذي يذكر آلهتكم وهم بذكر الرحمن هم كافرون

translation: He created man from haste, I will show you My signs, so do not hasten.
interpretation: The verse highlights humanity's tendency to be impatient and hasty, and serves as a reminder to slow down and have faith in God's plan, trusting that His signs and wisdom will be revealed in due time.
orig: خلق الإنسان من عجل سأريكم آياتي فلا تستعجلون

translation: And they say: 'When will this promise be, if you are truthful?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the skepticism and mockery of those who reject the message of the prophets, demanding to know when the promised punishment or reckoning will come, implying that it will never happen.
orig: ويقولون متى هذا الوعد إن كنتم صادقين

translation: If only those who disbelieved knew, when they will not be able to ward off the Fire from their faces, nor from their backs, nor will they be helped.
interpretation: The verse highlights the helplessness of those who disbelieve on the Day of Judgment, when they will be unable to escape the Fire that will surround them from all sides, emphasizing the severity of their punishment and the futility of their attempts to seek help or protection.
orig: لو يعلم الذين كفروا حين لا يكفون عن وجوههم النار ولا عن ظهورهم ولا هم ينصرون

translation: It will come to them suddenly, and bewilder them, so they will not be able to repel it, nor will they be given a respite.
interpretation: The verse highlights the sudden and unexpected nature of God's punishment, emphasizing that it will catch people off guard and leave them helpless, unable to defend themselves or seek refuge.
orig: بل تأتيهم بغتة فتبهتهم فلا يستطيعون ردها ولا هم ينظرون

translation: And indeed, many a messenger before you was mocked, but those who mocked them were surrounded by what they used to mock.
interpretation: This verse highlights the irony of those who mock God's messengers, as they will ultimately be surrounded by the very punishment they initially ridiculed, implying that their mockery will backfire and lead to their own downfall.
orig: ولقد استهزئ برسل من قبلك فحاق بالذين سخروا منهم ما كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: Say, 'Who can protect you from the Most Merciful in the night and the day?' They turn away from the remembrance of their Lord.
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that humans often take God's protection and mercy for granted, and instead of being grateful, they turn away from remembering and worshiping Him, which ultimately leads to their downfall.
orig: قل من يكلؤكم بالليل والنهار من الرحمن بل هم عن ذكر ربهم معرضون

translation: Or have they gods that can defend them against Us? They are not able to help themselves, nor can they be protected from Us.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of relying on false gods or idols for protection, emphasizing that they are powerless to help their devotees and cannot shield them from God's wrath.
orig: أم لهم آلهة تمنعهم من دوننا لا يستطيعون نصر أنفسهم ولا هم منا يصحبون

translation: But We bore with these and their fathers until life became too long for them. Do they not see that We are coming to the earth, reducing it from its borders? Will the victors not take heed?
interpretation: The verse highlights the patience of God towards the wrongdoers, allowing them a long life, but ultimately, God's justice will prevail, and the wrongdoers will be punished, serving as a warning to those who think they can escape God's wrath.
orig: بل متعنا هؤلاء وآباءهم حتى طال عليهم العمر أفلا يرون أنا نأتي الأرض ننقصها من أطرافها أفهم الغالبون

translation: Say, 'I only warn you by revelation, and the deaf do not hear the call when they are warned.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the limitations of human effort in guiding others, emphasizing that true guidance comes only from God's revelation, and that those who are spiritually deaf or hardened in their hearts will not respond to warnings or calls to righteousness.
orig: قل إنما أنذركم بالوحي ولا يسمع الصم الدعاء إذا ما ينذرون

translation: And if a breath of the torment of your Lord touches them, they would certainly say: 'O woe to us! Indeed, we were wrongdoers.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the inevitability of regret and remorse that will be felt by those who have been wrongdoers, when they are faced with the consequences of their actions, and it will be too late for them to change their ways.
orig: ولئن مستهم نفحة من عذاب ربك ليقولن يا ويلنا إنا كنا ظالمين

translation: And We place the scales of justice for the Day of Resurrection, so no soul will be wronged in anything, even if it were the weight of a mustard seed. We have brought it, and sufficient are We as reckoners.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's absolute justice and fairness on the Day of Judgment, where every individual will be held accountable for their actions, no matter how small or insignificant they may seem.
orig: ونضع الموازين القسط ليوم القيامة فلا تظلم نفس شيئا وإن كان مثقال حبة من خردل أتينا بها وكفى بنا حاسبين

translation: And indeed We gave Musa and Harun the Criterion, and a shining light, and a reminder for the righteous.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of divine guidance and revelation in distinguishing right from wrong, and the significance of remembering and reflecting on God's signs and messages, which serve as a beacon of light for those who are righteous and seek to live a virtuous life.
orig: ولقد آتينا موسى وهارون الفرقان وضياء وذكرا للمتقين

translation: Those who fear their Lord in the unseen, and they are anxious about the Hour.
interpretation: The verse highlights the characteristics of the righteous believers who are mindful of God's presence even in private, and are constantly worried about the accountability they will face on the Day of Judgment, which is a sign of their strong faith and piety.
orig: الذين يخشون ربهم بالغيب وهم من الساعة مشفقون

translation: And this is a blessed reminder which We have sent down, are you then denying it?
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of accepting the divine guidance and revelation, and warns against rejecting the truth and refusing to acknowledge the blessings and favors bestowed by God.
orig: وهذا ذكر مبارك أنزلناه أفأنتم له منكرون

translation: And indeed We gave Ibrahim (Abraham) his guidance before, and We were well-acquainted with him.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's direct involvement in guiding Abraham, implying a special relationship between them, and suggesting that Abraham's faith and righteousness were a result of God's guidance and knowledge of his inner self.
orig: ولقد آتينا إبراهيم رشده من قبل وكنا به عالمين

translation: When he said to his father and his people, 'What are these statues to which you are devoted?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the moment of awakening and questioning of the idolatrous practices of the people by a righteous individual, marking the beginning of a journey towards the truth and a rejection of the false gods.
orig: إذ قال لأبيه وقومه ما هذه التماثيل التي أنتم لها عاكفون

translation: They said: 'We found our fathers practising it'
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to follow blindly in the footsteps of their ancestors, even if it means perpetuating false beliefs and practices, rather than seeking the truth and guidance from Allah.
orig: قالوا وجدنا آباءنا لها عابدين

translation: He said: 'Indeed, you and your fathers were in manifest error.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of recognizing and acknowledging one's own mistakes and those of one's ancestors, and how this recognition can lead to a path of correction and guidance.
orig: قال لقد كنتم أنتم وآباؤكم في ضلال مبين

translation: They say: 'Have you brought the truth, or are you one of those who jest?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the skepticism and mockery of the disbelievers towards the prophets and their message, implying that they did not take the prophets' warnings seriously and instead viewed them as mere entertainers or jokers.
orig: قالوا أجئتنا بالحق أم أنت من اللاعبين

translation: He said: 'Nay, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, Who created them, and I am of those who bear witness to that.'
interpretation: The speaker is affirming the oneness of God and His role as the Creator of the universe, and by doing so, he is proclaiming his own faith and conviction in the divine truth.
orig: قال بل ربكم رب السماوات والأرض الذي فطرهن وأنا على ذلكم من الشاهدين

translation: And by Allah, I will certainly plan against your idols after you turn your backs, departing.
interpretation: The verse highlights the determination and confidence of the Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) in his mission to destroy the idols, emphasizing his unwavering commitment to the cause of monotheism and his willingness to take bold action against the forces of polytheism.
orig: وتالله لأكيدن أصنامكم بعد أن تولوا مدبرين

translation: And We made them as rubbish of scattered date stones, except a few of them, so that they might turn to Him.
interpretation: The verse highlights the devastating consequences of rejecting God's message, where the disobedient people are left in a state of utter destruction and chaos, with only a few survivors remaining, serving as a warning to others to turn back to God.
orig: فجعلهم جذاذا إلا كبيرا لهم لعلهم إليه يرجعون

translation: They said: 'Who has done this to our gods? Indeed, he is of the wrongdoers.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the ignorance and arrogance of the idolaters, who instead of recognizing the divine power that destroyed their idols, blamed a human being and accused him of wrongdoing, demonstrating their refusal to accept the truth and their stubborn adherence to their false beliefs.
orig: قالوا من فعل هذا بآلهتنا إنه لمن الظالمين

translation: They said: 'We have heard a youth mention them, who is called Ibrahim.'
interpretation: This verse suggests that the people of the town were not familiar with the concept of monotheism and were surprised to hear a young man, Ibrahim, speaking about the one true God, indicating that the idea of monotheism was novel and unfamiliar to them.
orig: قالوا سمعنا فتى يذكرهم يقال له إبراهيم

translation: They said: 'Bring him before the eyes of the people, so that they may bear witness.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of public accountability and transparency, as the people demanding to bring the accused before the eyes of the people, ensuring that justice is not only done, but also seen to be done, and that the witnesses can testify to the truth.
orig: قالوا فأتوا به على أعين الناس لعلهم يشهدون

translation: They said: 'Have you done this to our gods, O Ibrahim?'
interpretation: The verse reveals the arrogance and ignorance of the idolaters, who instead of reflecting on their own wrongdoing, blamed Ibrahim for destroying their idols, showing their attachment to their false gods and their refusal to accept the truth.
orig: قالوا أأنت فعلت هذا بآلهتنا يا إبراهيم

translation: He said: 'Nay, their eldest said this!' So ask them, if they can speak.
interpretation: The verse highlights the innocence and honesty of the prophets, as they do not take credit for the miracles performed through them, instead attributing them to God, and challenging others to verify the truth.
orig: قال بل فعله كبيرهم هذا فاسألوهم إن كانوا ينطقون

translation: They will return to themselves, then they will say: 'Indeed, you yourselves were the unjust ones.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the moment of realization and regret that will occur when people are held accountable for their actions, and they will acknowledge their own mistakes and injustices, rather than blaming others or making excuses.
orig: فرجعوا إلى أنفسهم فقالوا إنكم أنتم الظالمون

translation: Then they were struck upon their heads: 'Indeed, We are aware of what they are saying.'
interpretation: This verse highlights God's omniscience and His awareness of the thoughts and intentions of those who reject the truth, implying that no secret remains hidden from Him.
orig: ثم نكسوا على رءوسهم لقد علمت ما هؤلاء ينطقون

translation: Do you worship besides Allah that which does not benefit you at all nor harm you?
interpretation: This verse highlights the futility of idol worship, emphasizing that the idols being worshipped are powerless to bring any benefit or harm, and therefore, it is irrational to attribute divine powers to them.
orig: قال أفتعبدون من دون الله ما لا ينفعكم شيئا ولا يضركم

translation: Then do you wonder that a reminder from your Lord has come to you through a man from among you, that he may warn you and that you may fear God and that you may receive mercy.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of the Prophet Muhammad's role as a warner and a reminder to his people, emphasizing that his message is a mercy from God, and that those who reject it are not only disobeying the Prophet but also rejecting God's mercy.
orig: أف لكم ولما تعبدون من دون الله أفلا تعقلون

translation: They said: 'Burn him and help your gods, if you are going to do something.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and defiance of those who reject the message of God, as they challenge the prophet to take action, believing that their false gods will protect them from any harm.
orig: قالوا حرقوه وانصروا آلهتكم إن كنتم فاعلين

translation: We said: O fire, be coolness and safety for Ibrahim!
interpretation: The verse highlights the miraculous nature of God's intervention in the affairs of His prophets, where even the elements of nature are commanded to obey and submit to His will, demonstrating the limitless power and authority of God over the universe.
orig: قلنا يا نار كوني بردا وسلاما على إبراهيم

translation: And they intended to harm him, but We made them the losers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of divine justice, where those who intend harm towards others ultimately end up being the ones who suffer loss and defeat, emphasizing God's power and control over the outcome of events.
orig: وأرادوا به كيدا فجعلناهم الأخسرين

translation: And We saved him and Lot to the land which We had blessed for the worlds.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that God's blessings are not limited to a specific group of people, but are rather universal and can benefit all of humanity, as indicated by the phrase 'for the worlds'.
orig: ونجيناه ولوطا إلى الأرض التي باركنا فيها للعالمين

translation: And We bestowed upon him Isaac and Jacob, and We made them both righteous.
interpretation: The verse highlights the blessings and favors bestowed upon the prophets and their families, emphasizing God's special care and guidance for those who are chosen to fulfill a sacred mission.
orig: ووهبنا له إسحاق ويعقوب نافلة وكلا جعلنا صالحين

translation: And We made them Imams guiding by Our command, and We revealed to them to do good deeds and to establish prayer and to give zakah, and they were devoted to Us.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of spiritual leadership, emphasizing that true leaders are those who guide others by following God's command, and that their guidance is accompanied by a strong sense of social responsibility, as reflected in their commitment to prayer, charity, and good deeds.
orig: وجعلناهم أئمة يهدون بأمرنا وأوحينا إليهم فعل الخيرات وإقام الصلاة وإيتاء الزكاة وكانوا لنا عابدين

translation: And to Lot, We gave judgment and knowledge, and We saved him from the town that was committing vile deeds. Indeed, they were an evil people, defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of having knowledge and wisdom in order to distinguish between right and wrong, and to make righteous judgments, as exemplified by the character of Lot, who was blessed with these qualities by God.
orig: ولوطا آتيناه حكما وعلما ونجيناه من القرية التي كانت تعمل الخبائث إنهم كانوا قوم سوء فاسقين

translation: And We admitted him to Our mercy; indeed, he was of the righteous.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that God's mercy is not limited to this life, but extends to the hereafter, where the righteous will be rewarded and admitted to God's mercy, emphasizing the importance of living a righteous life to attain salvation.
orig: وأدخلناه في رحمتنا إنه من الصالحين

translation: And Noah, when he called out to Us before, so We responded to him and saved him and his family from the great distress.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's mercy and responsiveness to those who call out to Him, as exemplified in the story of Noah, where God not only saved him but also his family from the great distress, emphasizing the importance of prayer and trust in God's salvation.
orig: ونوحا إذ نادى من قبل فاستجبنا له فنجيناه وأهله من الكرب العظيم

translation: And We saved him from the people who denied Our signs, indeed they were an evil people, so We drowned them all.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of obedience to God's signs and messengers, and the severe consequences of rejecting them, as exemplified by the destruction of the people who refused to believe.
orig: ونصرناه من القوم الذين كذبوا بآياتنا إنهم كانوا قوم سوء فأغرقناهم أجمعين

translation: And Dawud and Sulaiman, when they judged concerning the field when the people's sheep had pastured in it, and We were witnesses to their judgment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the wisdom and fairness of Dawud and Sulaiman in their judgment, suggesting that they were guided by divine wisdom and justice, and that their decisions were in accordance with God's will.
orig: وداوود وسليمان إذ يحكمان في الحرث إذ نفشت فيه غنم القوم وكنا لحكمهم شاهدين

translation: And We made Solomon understand, and to each We gave wisdom and knowledge, and We subjected the mountains and the birds to David, and We were the doers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the special favors and blessings bestowed upon the prophets Solomon and David, emphasizing God's role in granting them wisdom, knowledge, and power, and demonstrating God's ability to subject even the natural world to their will.
orig: ففهمناها سليمان وكلا آتينا حكما وعلما وسخرنا مع داوود الجبال يسبحن والطير وكنا فاعلين

translation: And We have taught him the art of making coats of mail to protect you in your battles, so are you grateful?
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of recognizing and appreciating the blessings and skills that God has bestowed upon humanity, as a reminder to cultivate gratitude and humility in the face of divine favors.
orig: وعلمناه صنعة لبوس لكم لتحصنكم من بأسكم فهل أنتم شاكرون

translation: And to Solomon (We subjected) the wind, it blew by his command to the land which We had blessed, and We were aware of everything.
interpretation: The verse highlights the extraordinary power and wisdom granted to Prophet Solomon, who was able to control the wind and harness its power to achieve his goals, demonstrating God's favor and trust in him.
orig: ولسليمان الريح عاصفة تجري بأمره إلى الأرض التي باركنا فيها وكنا بكل شيء عالمين

translation: And of the devils were some who dived for him and did other work apart from that, and We were guardians over them.
interpretation: This verse suggests that even the devils, who are typically seen as rebellious and disobedient, were submissive to King Solomon's authority, highlighting the extraordinary nature of his power and wisdom.
orig: ومن الشياطين من يغوصون له ويعملون عملا دون ذلك وكنا لهم حافظين

translation: And Job, when he called to his Lord, 'Indeed, I have been touched by hardship, and You are the Most Merciful of the merciful.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of humility and sincerity in prayer, as Job, despite being a righteous prophet, acknowledges his weakness and vulnerability, and seeks God's mercy, demonstrating that true strength lies in recognizing one's limitations and dependence on God.
orig: وأيوب إذ نادى ربه أني مسني الضر وأنت أرحم الراحمين

translation: So We responded to him, and We removed from him the harm that was upon him, and We gave him back his family, and along with them, a similar number, as a mercy from Us, and a reminder to the worshippers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of patience and trust in God, as the Prophet Ayyub's (Job's) story demonstrates that God's mercy and relief can come suddenly and unexpectedly, and that those who remain faithful will ultimately be rewarded and relieved of their suffering.
orig: فاستجبنا له فكشفنا ما به من ضر وآتيناه أهله ومثلهم معهم رحمة من عندنا وذكرى للعابدين

translation: And Ishmael and Idris and Dhul-Kifl, all were of the patient ones.
