interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of patience in the lives of righteous individuals, including prophets, suggesting that their ability to persevere through difficulties was a key factor in their success and closeness to God.
orig: وإسماعيل وإدريس وذا الكفل كل من الصابرين

translation: And We admitted them to Our mercy; indeed, they were of the righteous.
interpretation: The verse highlights the reward of the righteous in the afterlife, where they will be admitted to God's mercy, indicating a state of eternal bliss and happiness.
orig: وأدخلناهم في رحمتنا إنهم من الصالحين

translation: And the man of the fish, when he went away in anger, thinking that We would not be able to do anything to him, he called out in the darknesses, 'There is no god but You, glory be to You, I was indeed among the wrongdoers.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the moment of spiritual awakening and repentance of Prophet Yunus, when he realized his mistake and acknowledged the power and mercy of God, seeking forgiveness and deliverance from his distress.
orig: وذا النون إذ ذهب مغاضبا فظن أن لن نقدر عليه فنادى في الظلمات أن لا إله إلا أنت سبحانك إني كنت من الظالمين

translation: So We responded to him, and We saved him from the distress. And thus We save the believers.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's mercy and responsiveness to the prayers of His faithful servants, promising to deliver them from their difficulties and troubles, just as He did with the prophets and righteous individuals of the past.
orig: فاستجبنا له ونجيناه من الغم وكذلك ننجي المؤمنين

translation: And Zachariah, when he called to his Lord, 'My Lord, do not leave me alone, and You are the best of inheritors.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the humility and dependence of the prophet Zachariah on God, as he recognizes that he is in need of God's help and guidance, and that God is the ultimate provider and sustainer of all things.
orig: وزكريا إذ نادى ربه رب لا تذرني فردا وأنت خير الوارثين

translation: So We responded to him, and We gave him John, and We cured his wife for him. Indeed, they used to hasten to good deeds and supplicate Us in hope and fear, and they were humble to Us.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of humility and sincerity in one's relationship with God, as exemplified by the prophets, who were characterized by their eagerness to do good, their hope in God's mercy, and their fear of His punishment, leading to a deep sense of humility and submission to Him.
orig: فاستجبنا له ووهبنا له يحيى وأصلحنا له زوجه إنهم كانوا يسارعون في الخيرات ويدعوننا رغبا ورهبا وكانوا لنا خاشعين

translation: And she who guarded her chastity, so We breathed into her of Our spirit, and We made her and her son a sign for the worlds.
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of Mary's purity and obedience to God, which made her worthy of being chosen to bear a child without a father, and her story serves as a symbol of God's power and mercy for all humanity.
orig: والتي أحصنت فرجها فنفخنا فيها من روحنا وجعلناها وابنها آية للعالمين

translation: Indeed, this community of yours is one community, and I am your Lord, so worship Me.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the unity of humanity under one God, highlighting the importance of recognizing and submitting to the one and only Creator, and thus, promoting a sense of brotherhood and equality among all people.
orig: إن هذه أمتكم أمة واحدة وأنا ربكم فاعبدون

translation: And they have broken their affair among them, all will return to Us.
interpretation: The verse suggests that humanity has a tendency to divide and disagree among themselves, but ultimately, all individuals will be accountable to God and will return to Him, emphasizing the unity and oneness of humanity under God's authority.
orig: وتقطعوا أمرهم بينهم كل إلينا راجعون

translation: And whoever does righteousness and he is a believer, there will be no rejection of his effort, and indeed, We will record it.
interpretation: The verse conveys that God acknowledges and rewards the efforts of believers who do good deeds, and that their actions will not go unnoticed or unrewarded.
orig: فمن يعمل من الصالحات وهو مؤمن فلا كفران لسعيه وإنا له كاتبون

translation: And it is forbidden to a town that We have destroyed that they will not return
interpretation: The verse highlights the finality of God's punishment, implying that once a town is destroyed due to its injustice, there is no going back, and its fate is sealed, serving as a lesson to others.
orig: وحرام على قرية أهلكناها أنهم لا يرجعون

translation: Until when Ya'jooj and Ma'jooj are let loose, and they will come out from every elevated place.
interpretation: The verse speaks about the apocalyptic event when Ya'jooj and Ma'jooj, the destructive tribes, are unleashed and will swarm out from every high ground, signaling the end of the world as we know it.
orig: حتى إذا فتحت يأجوج ومأجوج وهم من كل حدب ينسلون

translation: And the true promise drew near, so behold, the eyes of those who disbelieved will stare in horror, 'Woe to us, we were indeed heedless of this, nay, we were wrongdoers.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the shock and regret that will be felt by those who rejected faith when they realize the truth of God's promise, emphasizing that their past ignorance and wrongdoing will be of no avail in the face of God's judgment.
orig: واقترب الوعد الحق فإذا هي شاخصة أبصار الذين كفروا يا ويلنا قد كنا في غفلة من هذا بل كنا ظالمين

translation: You and what you worship besides Allah will be fuel for Hellfire, you are to enter it.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of idol worship, implying that those who worship false deities will ultimately be consumed by the very idols they revered, and will be cast into Hellfire, emphasizing the consequences of polytheism.
orig: إنكم وما تعبدون من دون الله حصب جهنم أنتم لها واردون

translation: If these had been gods, they would not have reached it, and all in it would have been eternal dwellers.
interpretation: The verse is highlighting the absurdity of idolatry, implying that if the idols were truly gods, they would have had the power to protect themselves and their worshippers, but since they are not, they are helpless and ephemeral.
orig: لو كان هؤلاء آلهة ما وردوها وكل فيها خالدون

translation: They will have a blast [of fire] there, and they will not hear.
interpretation: The verse highlights the intensity of the punishment in Hell, where the screams of the tormented will be drowned out by the deafening blasts of fire, leaving them unable to hear even their own cries of despair.
orig: لهم فيها زفير وهم فيها لا يسمعون

translation: Those who were given good from Us beforehand, they are removed far from it.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who were blessed with good deeds and faith in their previous life will be protected from the evil and temptation of this life, and will be kept away from the harm that it brings.
orig: إن الذين سبقت لهم منا الحسنى أولئك عنها مبعدون

translation: They will not hear its faint sound, and they will abide in what their souls desire, forever.
interpretation: This verse suggests that those who are consumed by their desires and worldly pleasures will be oblivious to the warnings and signs of God, and will continue to indulge in their selfish desires, ultimately leading to their downfall.
orig: لا يسمعون حسيسها وهم في ما اشتهت أنفسهم خالدون

translation: The Greatest Terror shall not grieve them, and the angels shall receive them with the greeting: 'This is your Day, which you were promised.'
interpretation: The verse suggests that the righteous will be spared from the fear and terror of the Day of Judgment, and instead, they will be welcomed by the angels, who will congratulate them on achieving their ultimate goal, which is eternal bliss in Paradise.
orig: لا يحزنهم الفزع الأكبر وتتلقاهم الملائكة هذا يومكم الذي كنتم توعدون

translation: The Day We roll up the heaven like the rolling up of a scroll for writings, as We originated the first creation, We shall repeat it, a promise binding on Us, surely We shall bring it about.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the Day of Judgment, when the universe will be rolled up like a scroll, and all creations will be brought back to life to face their Creator, emphasizing God's power and control over the universe and the certainty of accountability on that Day.
orig: يوم نطوي السماء كطي السجل للكتب كما بدأنا أول خلق نعيده وعدا علينا إنا كنا فاعلين

translation: And indeed, We have written in the Psalms, after the Reminder, that the earth will be inherited by My righteous servants.
interpretation: This verse implies that the righteous servants of God are the true heirs of the earth, and that they will ultimately prevail and inherit the earth, suggesting that their goodness and righteousness will be rewarded with dominion and authority.
orig: ولقد كتبنا في الزبور من بعد الذكر أن الأرض يرثها عبادي الصالحون

translation: Indeed, in this is a message for a people who worship.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the importance of the message of the Quran, emphasizing that it is a reminder and a warning for those who are devoted to God, and that they should take heed of its teachings and warnings.
orig: إن في هذا لبلاغا لقوم عابدين

translation: And We have not sent you except as a mercy to the worlds.
interpretation: This verse highlights the profound impact of the Prophet Muhammad's mission, emphasizing that his role was not limited to a specific community or region, but rather was a universal blessing for all humanity, bringing guidance, compassion, and redemption to all people.
orig: وما أرسلناك إلا رحمة للعالمين

translation: Say, 'It is only revealed to me that your god is one God; will you then be Muslims?'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of the oneness of God and the need for people to submit to Him, highlighting the simplicity and clarity of the message of Islam, and inviting people to surrender to the will of the one and only God.
orig: قل إنما يوحى إلي أنما إلهكم إله واحد فهل أنتم مسلمون

translation: But if they turn away, then say: 'I have warned you in equal terms; and I know not whether the punishment which you are promised is near or far.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the role of the Prophet as a warner, emphasizing that he has fulfilled his responsibility of conveying the message of God, and now it is up to the people to accept or reject it, while also reminding them that the consequences of their actions will inevitably follow.
orig: فإن تولوا فقل آذنتكم على سواء وإن أدري أقريب أم بعيد ما توعدون

translation: He knows the subtlety of speech, and He knows what you conceal.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's omniscience, emphasizing that He is aware of not only our spoken words but also our innermost thoughts and intentions, which we may try to conceal from others.
orig: إنه يعلم الجهر من القول ويعلم ما تكتمون

translation: And if I knew, perhaps it is a trial for you and enjoyment for a time.
interpretation: The verse highlights the temporary nature of worldly pleasures and material possessions, suggesting that they may be a test of one's character and faith, and that their enjoyment is fleeting and short-lived.
orig: وإن أدري لعله فتنة لكم ومتاع إلى حين

translation: He said: 'My Lord, judge with truth. And our Lord is the Most Merciful, Whom we seek help against what you describe.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of seeking God's help and guidance in the face of adversity, and the need to rely on His mercy and justice in the face of oppression or persecution.
orig: قال رب احكم بالحق وربنا الرحمن المستعان على ما تصفون

translation: O mankind, fear your Lord. Indeed, the earthquake of the Hour is a tremendous thing.
interpretation: The verse is a call to humanity to be mindful of their Creator and to be aware of the impending doom of the Day of Judgment, which will be a catastrophic event that will shake the very foundations of the earth, emphasizing the importance of living a righteous life in preparation for that day.
orig: يا أيها الناس اتقوا ربكم إن زلزلة الساعة شيء عظيم

translation: The day you see it, every nursing mother will be distracted from that which she was nursing, and every pregnant woman will drop her load, and you will see the people as if they are drunk, but they are not drunk, but the punishment of Allah is severe.
interpretation: The verse paints a vivid picture of the Day of Judgment, where the usual bonds of human relationships and natural instincts will be disrupted, and people will be overwhelmed by the severity of God's punishment, leaving them in a state of utter helplessness and confusion.
orig: يوم ترونها تذهل كل مرضعة عما أرضعت وتضع كل ذات حمل حملها وترى الناس سكارى وما هم بسكارى ولكن عذاب الله شديد

translation: And among people are those who dispute about Allah without knowledge and follow every rebellious devil.
interpretation: The verse highlights the danger of arguing about God without proper understanding, which can lead to following the whispers of Satan, thus straying from the right path.
orig: ومن الناس من يجادل في الله بغير علم ويتبع كل شيطان مريد

translation: It is decreed for him that whoever takes him as a friend, He will lead him astray and guide him to the punishment of the Blaze.
interpretation: The verse suggests that Satan's influence is so powerful that once a person befriends him, Satan will lead them further away from the truth and ultimately to eternal damnation, emphasizing the grave consequences of succumbing to Satan's whispers.
orig: كتب عليه أنه من تولاه فأنه يضله ويهديه إلى عذاب السعير

translation: O people, if you are in doubt about the Resurrection, then [consider that] We created you from dust, then from a drop of sperm, then from a clinging clot, then from a lump of flesh, formed and unformed, so that We may make clear to you. And We settle in the wombs what We will for a specified term, then We bring you out as infants, then [We nurture you] that you may reach your full strength. And among you is he who is taken in death, and among you is he who is returned to the weakest [old age], so that he knows nothing after having known. And you see the earth barren, but when We send down upon it rain, it quivers and swells and grows of every beautiful kind.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the power and majesty of God by highlighting the miracle of human creation, from the initial stages of conception to birth and growth, and the cyclical nature of life and death, to instill faith and trust in the Resurrection and the afterlife.
orig: يا أيها الناس إن كنتم في ريب من البعث فإنا خلقناكم من تراب ثم من نطفة ثم من علقة ثم من مضغة مخلقة وغير مخلقة لنبين لكم ونقر في الأرحام ما نشاء إلى أجل مسمى ثم نخرجكم طفلا ثم لتبلغوا أشدكم ومنكم من يتوفى ومنكم من يرد إلى أرذل العمر لكيلا يعلم من بعد علم شيئا وترى الأرض هامدة فإذا أنزلنا عليها الماء اهتزت وربت وأنبتت من كل زوج بهيج

translation: That is because Allah, He is the Truth, and it is He Who gives life to the dead, and it is He Who is Able to do all things.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes God's absolute power and control over all things, including life and death, and thus, He is the ultimate authority and source of truth.
orig: ذلك بأن الله هو الحق وأنه يحيي الموتى وأنه على كل شيء قدير

translation: And that the Hour is coming, there is no doubt in it, and that Allah will resurrect those in the graves.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the inevitability of the Day of Judgment, where the resurrection of the dead will take place, and serves as a reminder to humanity of their accountability to God for their deeds in this life.
orig: وأن الساعة آتية لا ريب فيها وأن الله يبعث من في القبور

translation: And among people are those who dispute about Allah without knowledge, nor guidance, nor an illuminating Book.
interpretation: This verse highlights the futility of arguing about God or spiritual matters without proper understanding, guidance, or scriptural authority, implying that such disputes are often based on ignorance and lack of spiritual insight.
orig: ومن الناس من يجادل في الله بغير علم ولا هدى ولا كتاب منير

translation: Whoever turns away from the remembrance of Allah, He will cause for him to suffer humiliation in this world, and He will make him taste the punishment of burning on the Day of Resurrection.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of deliberately ignoring the guidance and signs of Allah, leading to a life of humiliation and shame in this world, and ultimately, a severe punishment of burning in the Hereafter.
orig: ثاني عطفه ليضل عن سبيل الله له في الدنيا خزي ونذيقه يوم القيامة عذاب الحريق

translation: That is for what your hands have sent forth, and because Allah is not unjust to the servants.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of personal responsibility, emphasizing that an individual's fate is a direct consequence of their own actions, and that God is just and fair in meting out rewards or punishments.
orig: ذلك بما قدمت يداك وأن الله ليس بظلام للعبيد

translation: And among people is he who worships Allah on an edge. If good befalls him, he is reassured by it; but if a trial befalls him, he turns on his face. He loses this world and the Hereafter. That is the manifest loss.
interpretation: The verse highlights the superficial nature of faith in those who only turn to God in times of ease, but abandon their faith when faced with trials, revealing a lack of genuine commitment to their faith.
orig: ومن الناس من يعبد الله على حرف فإن أصابه خير اطمأن به وإن أصابته فتنة انقلب على وجهه خسر الدنيا والآخرة ذلك هو الخسران المبين

translation: He calls upon one who cannot harm him and cannot benefit him, that is the distant error.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of idolatry, where humans worship and call upon false gods that have no power to bring them harm or benefit, leading them further away from the truth and into deeper ignorance.
orig: يدعو من دون الله ما لا يضره وما لا ينفعه ذلك هو الضلال البعيد

translation: He invites him whose harm is closer than his profit. Evil is the patron, and evil is the associate.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of a misguided alliance, where one chooses to associate with those who bring harm rather than benefit, emphasizing the flawed judgment of such individuals and the negative consequences that follow.
orig: يدعو لمن ضره أقرب من نفعه لبئس المولى ولبئس العشير

translation: Indeed, Allah will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow. Indeed, Allah does what He wills.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of Tawhid, emphasizing God's absolute power and authority, implying that His will is not bound by any external factors, and His decisions are not subject to question or appeal.
orig: إن الله يدخل الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار إن الله يفعل ما يريد

translation: Whoever thinks that Allah will not help him in this world and the Hereafter, let him stretch a means to the sky and cut off, then let him see whether his plan will remove that which enrages him.
interpretation: The verse is a call to those who doubt God's power and help to reflect on their own limitations and the futility of their plans, emphasizing that their schemes will ultimately fail to achieve their goals and alleviate their frustrations.
orig: من كان يظن أن لن ينصره الله في الدنيا والآخرة فليمدد بسبب إلى السماء ثم ليقطع فلينظر هل يذهبن كيده ما يغيظ

translation: And thus We have sent it down as clear signs, and Allah guides whom He wills.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's sovereignty in guiding those who are worthy of guidance, implying that divine guidance is not a universal right, but rather a privilege granted to those whom God chooses.
orig: وكذلك أنزلناه آيات بينات وأن الله يهدي من يريد

translation: Verily, those who believe, and those who are Jews, and the Sabians, and the Christians, and the Magi, and those who associate (others with Allah), verily, Allah will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection. Verily, Allah is Witness over all things.
interpretation: The verse highlights Allah's omniscience and omnipotence, emphasizing that He is aware of all human actions and will judge everyone fairly on the Day of Resurrection, regardless of their religious affiliations or beliefs.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا والذين هادوا والصابئين والنصارى والمجوس والذين أشركوا إن الله يفصل بينهم يوم القيامة إن الله على كل شيء شهيد

translation: Do you not see that to Allah prostrates whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth, and the sun, and the moon, and the stars, and the mountains, and the trees, and the moving creatures, and many of the people, and many will have the punishment justified upon them, and whoever Allah humiliates, none can honor, indeed Allah does what He wills.
interpretation: The verse highlights the omnipotence of God, emphasizing that everything in the universe, from the heavens to the smallest creatures, prostrates to Him, and that He has the ultimate power to punish or honor whomever He wills.
orig: ألم تر أن الله يسجد له من في السماوات ومن في الأرض والشمس والقمر والنجوم والجبال والشجر والدواب وكثير من الناس وكثير حق عليه العذاب ومن يهن الله فما له من مكرم إن الله يفعل ما يشاء

translation: These two adversaries dispute with their Lord; then for those who disbelieved, garments from fire will be cut out for them, boiling water will be poured down over their heads.
interpretation: The verse highlights the contrast between the believers and the disbelievers, emphasizing that those who reject God's message will be punished with intense heat and burning, symbolizing the severity of their rejection and the consequences of their actions.
orig: هذان خصمان اختصموا في ربهم فالذين كفروا قطعت لهم ثياب من نار يصب من فوق رءوسهم الحميم

translation: He will purify them and what is in their wombs and their skins.
interpretation: The verse suggests that God's purification process is not limited to the external aspects of a person, but also extends to the deepest and most intimate aspects of their being, including their thoughts, intentions, and even the unborn life within them, indicating a comprehensive and profound transformation.
orig: يصهر به ما في بطونهم والجلود

translation: And for them are maces of iron.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the severity of the punishment that awaits those who reject God's message, likening the punishment to a heavy iron mace that will crush them.
orig: ولهم مقامع من حديد

translation: Every time they want to get out of it from distress, they are returned to it, and they are made to taste the punishment of the blaze.
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that those who are trapped in their sinful ways will repeatedly try to escape the consequences of their actions, but will ultimately be forced back into their miserable state, only to face the intense suffering and torment of hellfire.
orig: كلما أرادوا أن يخرجوا منها من غم أعيدوا فيها وذوقوا عذاب الحريق

translation: Indeed, Allah will admit those who have believed and done righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will be adorned with bracelets of gold and pearl, and their garments therein will be silk.
interpretation: The verse describes the ultimate reward and bliss that awaits the believers who have lived a righteous life, where they will be adorned with the finest things in paradise, symbolizing their spiritual growth and closeness to God.
orig: إن الله يدخل الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار يحلون فيها من أساور من ذهب ولؤلؤا ولباسهم فيها حرير

translation: And guided to the good word and guided to the path of the Praiseworthy.
interpretation: The verse suggests that divine guidance is not only about being on the right path, but also about being guided towards good speech and noble character, which is a key aspect of being on the path of God, the Praiseworthy.
orig: وهدوا إلى الطيب من القول وهدوا إلى صراط الحميد

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve and prevent [people] from the way of Allah and [from] the Sacred Mosque, which We have made for all people, being equal [in opportunity] to those who settle near it and those who come from far away, and whoever intends to deviate from it with injustice, We will make him taste a painful punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of preventing others from following the path of God and denying them access to the Sacred Mosque, emphasizing that this sacred space is meant to be inclusive and equal for all, regardless of their geographical distance or social status.
orig: إن الذين كفروا ويصدون عن سبيل الله والمسجد الحرام الذي جعلناه للناس سواء العاكف فيه والباد ومن يرد فيه بإلحاد بظلم نذقه من عذاب أليم

translation: And when We assigned to Ibrahim the site of the House, saying: 'Do not associate anything with Me, and purify My House for those who circumambulate, and those who stand, and those who bow, and those who prostrate'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of maintaining the purity and sanctity of the House of God, emphasizing the need to rid it of idolatry and polytheism, and instead, to dedicate it to the worship of the One God, where believers can come together to perform their devotions and prayers.
orig: وإذ بوأنا لإبراهيم مكان البيت أن لا تشرك بي شيئا وطهر بيتي للطائفين والقائمين والركع السجود

translation: And proclaim to the people the Hajj; they will come to you on foot and on every lean camel, they will come from every deep valley.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of the Hajj pilgrimage, emphasizing that people will come from far and wide, overcoming physical obstacles to fulfill this sacred duty, demonstrating their devotion and commitment to God.
orig: وأذن في الناس بالحج يأتوك رجالا وعلى كل ضامر يأتين من كل فج عميق

translation: That they may witness benefits for themselves, and mention the name of Allah on known days over what He has provided for them from the cattle quadrupeds, then eat of it and feed the miserable poor.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of gratitude and sharing one's blessings with others, particularly the poor and needy, as a way of expressing thankfulness to God for His provisions.
orig: ليشهدوا منافع لهم ويذكروا اسم الله في أيام معلومات على ما رزقهم من بهيمة الأنعام فكلوا منها وأطعموا البائس الفقير

translation: Then let them complete their prescribed duties, and fulfill their vows, and circumambulate the Ancient House.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of fulfilling one's spiritual obligations and commitments, highlighting the connection between personal devotion and communal worship, and underscoring the significance of the Kaaba as a symbol of unity and spiritual convergence.
orig: ثم ليقضوا تفثهم وليوفوا نذورهم وليطوفوا بالبيت العتيق

translation: That and whoever honors the sacred rites of Allah, it is better for him with his Lord. And the cattle have been made lawful to you, except what has been recited to you, so avoid the abomination of idols and avoid false speech.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of honoring and respecting the sacred rites and laws ordained by God, and warns against indulging in idolatry and false speech, emphasizing the need for sincerity and truthfulness in one's worship and dealings.
orig: ذلك ومن يعظم حرمات الله فهو خير له عند ربه وأحلت لكم الأنعام إلا ما يتلى عليكم فاجتنبوا الرجس من الأوثان واجتنبوا قول الزور

translation: Turning to Him, not associating anything with Him, and whoever associates with Allah, it is as if he had fallen from the sky and the birds had snatched him or the wind had thrown him to a far-off place.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of associating partners with God, suggesting that it is a catastrophic mistake that can lead to a complete loss of spiritual direction and guidance, leaving the individual helpless and lost, like a person who has fallen from the sky and is at the mercy of the wind or birds.
orig: حنفاء لله غير مشركين به ومن يشرك بالله فكأنما خر من السماء فتخطفه الطير أو تهوي به الريح في مكان سحيق

translation: That and whoever honors the symbols of Allah, indeed it is from the piety of the hearts.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of showing respect and reverence to the rituals and symbols of Allah, indicating that such actions are a manifestation of the piety and devotion that resides in one's heart.
orig: ذلك ومن يعظم شعائر الله فإنها من تقوى القلوب

translation: You have benefits in them for a specified term, then their place is to the Ancient House.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the benefits and blessings that one receives in this life are temporary and will eventually return to their source, which is God, symbolized by the 'Ancient House', emphasizing the transitory nature of worldly gains and the eternal nature of one's relationship with the Divine.
orig: لكم فيها منافع إلى أجل مسمى ثم محلها إلى البيت العتيق

translation: And for every nation We have appointed a rite, that they may mention the name of Allah over the beast of cattle that He has given them for sustenance. Your God is One God, so to Him submit. And give good tidings to the humble.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the universal nature of worship and the unity of humanity, highlighting that every nation has been given a unique way to worship and connect with God, and that ultimately, there is only One God who is worthy of submission and devotion.
orig: ولكل أمة جعلنا منسكا ليذكروا اسم الله على ما رزقهم من بهيمة الأنعام فإلهكم إله واحد فله أسلموا وبشر المخبتين

translation: Those who, when Allah is mentioned, their hearts tremble, and those who are patient under the afflictions that befall them, and those who establish the prayer and spend out of what We have provided them.
interpretation: The verse highlights the characteristics of true believers, who are deeply moved by the remembrance of God, patiently persevere through trials, maintain a strong connection with Him through prayer, and demonstrate their gratitude by sharing their blessings with others, thereby reflecting their trust in God's providence.
orig: الذين إذا ذكر الله وجلت قلوبهم والصابرين على ما أصابهم والمقيمي الصلاة ومما رزقناهم ينفقون

translation: And We have made camels a part of Allah's rituals for you, in which you have benefits, so mention Allah's name upon them when they are lined up, then when they fall down on their sides, eat from them and feed the contented and the beggar. Thus We have made them subservient to you, so that you may be grateful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of gratitude and recognition of God's blessings, as exemplified by the provision of camels as a means of sustenance and benefit, emphasizing the need to acknowledge and appreciate God's favors.
orig: والبدن جعلناها لكم من شعائر الله لكم فيها خير فاذكروا اسم الله عليها صواف فإذا وجبت جنوبها فكلوا منها وأطعموا القانع والمعتر كذلك سخرناها لكم لعلكم تشكرون

translation: It is not their meat nor their blood that reaches Allah, but it is the piety from you that reaches Him. Thus have We made them subject to you that you may magnify Allah for His Guidance to you. And give good tidings to the doers of good.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that it is not the physical acts of worship, such as sacrificing animals, that truly matter to God, but rather the sincerity and devotion behind those acts, which is what truly reaches Him.
orig: لن ينال الله لحومها ولا دماؤها ولكن يناله التقوى منكم كذلك سخرها لكم لتكبروا الله على ما هداكم وبشر المحسنين

translation: Indeed, Allah defends those who have believed. Indeed, Allah does not like everyone who is treacherous and ungrateful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the special relationship between Allah and the believers, where Allah becomes their protector and defender, implying that the believers are under Allah's care and guidance, and that Allah will always come to their aid in times of need.
orig: إن الله يدافع عن الذين آمنوا إن الله لا يحب كل خوان كفور

translation: Permission to fight is given to those who are fought against, because they were oppressed, and indeed, Allah is competent to give them victory.
interpretation: This verse gives legitimacy to the struggle for self-defense and fighting against oppression, emphasizing that God is capable of granting victory to those who are oppressed and fought against.
orig: أذن للذين يقاتلون بأنهم ظلموا وإن الله على نصرهم لقدير

translation: Those who have been expelled from their homes in defiance of right, except that they say: 'Our Lord is Allah.' If Allah had not repelled some people by others, monasteries, churches, synagogues, and mosques would have been demolished, where the name of Allah is frequently mentioned. Allah will certainly help those who help Him, for Allah is All-Powerful, All-Mighty.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of protecting and supporting those who are fighting for the cause of Allah, as they are the ones who will ultimately bring victory to the righteous and ensure the survival of places of worship where Allah's name is frequently mentioned.
orig: الذين أخرجوا من ديارهم بغير حق إلا أن يقولوا ربنا الله ولولا دفع الله الناس بعضهم ببعض لهدمت صوامع وبيع وصلوات ومساجد يذكر فيها اسم الله كثيرا ولينصرن الله من ينصره إن الله لقوي عزيز

translation: Those who, if We establish them in the land, will establish prayer, give zakah, enjoin what is right, and forbid what is wrong, and to Allah belongs the outcome of all matters.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of establishing a just and righteous society, where the principles of prayer, charity, and moral guidance are upheld, and where people are encouraged to do good and discouraged from doing evil, ultimately leading to a society that is pleasing to God.
orig: الذين إن مكناهم في الأرض أقاموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة وأمروا بالمعروف ونهوا عن المنكر ولله عاقبة الأمور

translation: And if they deny you, indeed, before them, the people of Noah and 'Ad and Thamud denied
interpretation: The verse is a message of comfort and reassurance to the Prophet Muhammad, telling him that he is not alone in facing rejection and denial, as other prophets before him, including Noah, Hud, and Salih, also faced similar rejection from their people.
orig: وإن يكذبوك فقد كذبت قبلهم قوم نوح وعاد وثمود

translation: The people of Ibrahim and the people of Lut
interpretation: The verse is highlighting the importance of learning from the examples of the past, specifically the stories of the prophets Ibrahim and Lut, whose people were punished for their disobedience and corruption, serving as a warning to future generations.
orig: وقوم إبراهيم وقوم لوط

translation: And the companions of Midian, and Moses was denied, so I gave respite to the disbelievers, then I seized them, and how [terrible] was My punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's patience and mercy towards those who reject Him, giving them time to repent and change their ways, but ultimately exacting a terrible punishment on those who persist in their disbelief.
orig: وأصحاب مدين وكذب موسى فأمليت للكافرين ثم أخذتهم فكيف كان نكير

translation: How many a town have We destroyed, and it was unjust, so it lies vacant upon its foundations, and its wells are abandoned, and its lofty palaces!
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of injustice and oppression, where a once thriving town is now left in ruins, a testament to the destruction that follows when people ignore the principles of justice and righteousness.
orig: فكأين من قرية أهلكناها وهي ظالمة فهي خاوية على عروشها وبئر معطلة وقصر مشيد

translation: Have they not travelled in the land, so that they should have had hearts that understand with, or ears that hear with? For indeed, it is not the eyes that are blind, but it is the hearts in the breasts that are blind.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of spiritual insight and understanding, suggesting that the problem lies not with the physical senses, but with the heart's inability to perceive and understand the signs of God.
orig: أفلم يسيروا في الأرض فتكون لهم قلوب يعقلون بها أو آذان يسمعون بها فإنها لا تعمى الأبصار ولكن تعمى القلوب التي في الصدور

translation: And they ask you to hasten the punishment, and Allah will not fail in His promise. And indeed, a day with your Lord is like a thousand years of what you count.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that God's promise of punishment is inevitable and will come at a time that is beyond human comprehension, emphasizing the vast difference between human and divine perceptions of time.
orig: ويستعجلونك بالعذاب ولن يخلف الله وعده وإن يوما عند ربك كألف سنة مما تعدون

translation: And how many a town have We destroyed while it was unjust, so We seized it, and to Us is the return.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's absolute authority and control over the fate of nations, emphasizing that ultimately, everything returns to Him, and He is the one who holds the power to destroy or preserve.
orig: وكأين من قرية أمليت لها وهي ظالمة ثم أخذتها وإلي المصير

translation: Say, 'O people, I am only a clear warner to you.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the role of the Prophet as a warner, highlighting the importance of his message as a warning to humanity, and underscoring the clarity and transparency of his prophetic mission.
orig: قل يا أيها الناس إنما أنا لكم نذير مبين

translation: But those who believe and do righteous deeds, for them is forgiveness and a noble provision.
interpretation: The verse highlights the reward for those who combine faith with good deeds, implying that true faith is not just a matter of belief, but also of actions that reflect that belief, and that such individuals will be granted not only forgiveness for their sins, but also a noble and generous provision in the hereafter.
orig: فالذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات لهم مغفرة ورزق كريم

translation: And those who strive against Our signs to frustrate them, those will be the companions of the Blazing Fire.
interpretation: This verse highlights the gravity of deliberately rejecting or opposing God's signs and revelations, and warns that those who do so will ultimately face severe punishment in the hereafter.
orig: والذين سعوا في آياتنا معاجزين أولئك أصحاب الجحيم

translation: And We did not send before you any messenger or prophet except that when he recited, Satan threw into his recitation, but Allah abolishes what Satan throws, then Allah establishes His verses, and Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
interpretation: The verse highlights the struggle between good and evil, where Satan tries to intervene in the revelation process, but Allah's power and wisdom always prevail, ensuring the authenticity and integrity of the divine message.
orig: وما أرسلنا من قبلك من رسول ولا نبي إلا إذا تمنى ألقى الشيطان في أمنيته فينسخ الله ما يلقي الشيطان ثم يحكم الله آياته والله عليم حكيم

translation: That He may make what Satan throws a trial for those in whose hearts is a disease, and certainly the unjust are in a great schism.
interpretation: The verse suggests that Satan's temptations are a test for those whose hearts are diseased with hypocrisy and evil intentions, and that those who are unjust will ultimately be divided and separated from the righteous, implying that their evil deeds will lead to their own downfall.
orig: ليجعل ما يلقي الشيطان فتنة للذين في قلوبهم مرض والقاسية قلوبهم وإن الظالمين لفي شقاق بعيد

translation: And those who have been given knowledge see that it is the truth from their Lord, so they believe in it, and their hearts are humble to Him. And indeed, Allah guides those who believe to a straight path.
interpretation: The verse highlights the humility and openness of those who possess knowledge, as they recognize the truth revealed by God and respond with faith and humility, demonstrating their willingness to submit to God's guidance.
orig: وليعلم الذين أوتوا العلم أنه الحق من ربك فيؤمنوا به فتخبت له قلوبهم وإن الله لهاد الذين آمنوا إلى صراط مستقيم

translation: And those who disbelieve will not cease to be in doubt about it until the Hour comes upon them suddenly, or there comes to them the punishment of a barren day.
interpretation: The verse highlights the state of confusion and uncertainty that will persist among the disbelievers until the sudden and unexpected arrival of the Day of Judgment, which will bring an end to their doubts and ignorance.
orig: ولا يزال الذين كفروا في مرية منه حتى تأتيهم الساعة بغتة أو يأتيهم عذاب يوم عقيم

translation: The Sovereignty on that Day will be for Allah, He will judge between them; and those who believed and did righteous deeds will be in Gardens of Delight.
interpretation: The verse highlights the ultimate authority of God on the Day of Judgment, where He will judge all humanity, and those who lived a righteous life, believing in God and doing good deeds, will be rewarded with eternal bliss in Paradise.
orig: الملك يومئذ لله يحكم بينهم فالذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات في جنات النعيم

translation: And those who disbelieve and deny Our signs, those will have a humiliating punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of deliberately rejecting God's signs and revelations, which will lead to a shameful and degrading punishment, implying a loss of dignity and honor in the hereafter.
orig: والذين كفروا وكذبوا بآياتنا فأولئك لهم عذاب مهين

translation: And those who emigrated in the cause of Allah, then were killed or died, Allah will surely provide for them a good provision, and indeed, it is Allah who is the best of providers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of sacrifice and martyrdom in the path of God, promising a great reward in the afterlife for those who give their lives for the cause of Allah, emphasizing that God is the ultimate provider and sustainer of all.
orig: والذين هاجروا في سبيل الله ثم قتلوا أو ماتوا ليرزقنهم الله رزقا حسنا وإن الله لهو خير الرازقين

translation: He will admit them an entrance which they will be pleased with, and indeed, Allah is All-Knowing, Most Forbearing.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's infinite mercy and patience, as He welcomes believers into a state of eternal bliss, where they will be completely satisfied, and emphasizes that God's knowledge and wisdom are the foundation of His gentle and merciful treatment of humanity.
orig: ليدخلنهم مدخلا يرضونه وإن الله لعليم حليم

translation: That, and he who has retaliated with the like of that which he was made to suffer, then was oppressed, Allah will surely aid him. Indeed, Allah is Ever-Accepting, Oft-Forgiving.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's justice and mercy, assuring those who have been oppressed and retaliated against their oppressors that God will ultimately aid them, demonstrating His infinite forgiveness and acceptance.
orig: ذلك ومن عاقب بمثل ما عوقب به ثم بغي عليه لينصرنه الله إن الله لعفو غفور

translation: That is because Allah merges the night into the day and merges the day into the night, and Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's power and control over the universe, demonstrating His ability to merge opposites, such as night and day, and His complete awareness of all things, emphasizing His omniscience and omnipotence.
orig: ذلك بأن الله يولج الليل في النهار ويولج النهار في الليل وأن الله سميع بصير

translation: That is because Allah, He is the Truth, and what they invoke besides Him, it is the falsehood, and that Allah, He is the High, the Great.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the absolute truth and supremacy of Allah, implying that any deity or entity worshipped besides Him is false and inferior, and that Allah's power and greatness surpass all else.
orig: ذلك بأن الله هو الحق وأن ما يدعون من دونه هو الباطل وأن الله هو العلي الكبير

translation: Do you not see that Allah sends down water from the sky, then the earth becomes green? Indeed, Allah is Subtle and Acquainted.
interpretation: This verse highlights the subtle yet powerful nature of God's actions, using the example of how He brings life to the earth through rain, illustrating how He can transform barrenness into fertility, and how His power and knowledge are intertwined.
orig: ألم تر أن الله أنزل من السماء ماء فتصبح الأرض مخضرة إن الله لطيف خبير

translation: To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is on the earth, and indeed, Allah is Free of need, the Praiseworthy.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's absolute sovereignty and independence, emphasizing that everything in the universe belongs to Him, and that He is not in need of anything or anyone, but rather it is humanity that is in need of Him.
orig: له ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وإن الله لهو الغني الحميد

translation: Do you not see that Allah has subjected to your use all that is in the earth and the ships that sail through the sea by His command? And He withholds the sky from falling on the earth, except by His permission. Indeed, Allah is ever gracious and merciful to the people.
interpretation: This verse highlights the delicate balance of the universe and the interconnectedness of all things, emphasizing God's sovereignty and mercy in maintaining the order of creation, and reminding humans of their dependence on Him.
orig: ألم تر أن الله سخر لكم ما في الأرض والفلك تجري في البحر بأمره ويمسك السماء أن تقع على الأرض إلا بإذنه إن الله بالناس لرءوف رحيم

translation: And it is He who has created you from dust, then from a drop of sperm, then from a clinging clot, then He brings you forth as a child, then that you may reach your full strength, then that you may be old, though some of you are taken in death before that, and that you may reach an appointed term, and that you may know.
interpretation: The verse highlights the power and control of God over human life, emphasizing that He is the one who brings humans into existence, sustains them, and ultimately takes their lives, reminding humans of their mortality and the transience of life.
orig: وهو الذي أحياكم ثم يميتكم ثم يحييكم إن الإنسان لكفور

translation: For every nation We have appointed a rite, that they may mention the name of Allah over the beast of cattle that He has given them for food. And your God is One God, so to Him submit. And give good tidings to the humble, who, when Allah is mentioned, their hearts are fearful, and who patiently bear whatever befell them, and who observe the prayer and spend out of what We have provided them.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of humility and submission to God, emphasizing that true believers are those whose hearts are fearful when Allah is mentioned, and who patiently bear trials and difficulties, demonstrating their trust in God's plan.
orig: لكل أمة جعلنا منسكا هم ناسكوه فلا ينازعنك في الأمر وادع إلى ربك إنك لعلى هدى مستقيم

translation: And if they argue with you, say: 'Allah knows best what you do.'
interpretation: The verse is encouraging believers to remain confident in their faith and actions, and to respond to critics and opposers by stating that Allah is fully aware of their intentions and actions, implying that ultimately, it is Allah's judgment that matters, not human criticism or opposition.
orig: وإن جادلوك فقل الله أعلم بما تعملون

translation: Allah will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection about that in which you used to differ.
interpretation: The verse highlights the ultimate authority of God in settling disputes and disagreements among people, emphasizing that on the Day of Judgment, God will render a final verdict on the matters that people disagreed about during their worldly lives.
orig: الله يحكم بينكم يوم القيامة فيما كنتم فيه تختلفون

translation: Do you not know that Allah knows what is in the heaven and the earth? Indeed, that is in a Record. Indeed, that is easy for Allah.
interpretation: The verse highlights the omniscience of God, emphasizing that He has complete knowledge of everything in the universe, and that this knowledge is recorded in a divine book, implying that God's knowledge is not only complete but also documented and preserved.
orig: ألم تعلم أن الله يعلم ما في السماء والأرض إن ذلك في كتاب إن ذلك على الله يسير

translation: And they worship besides Allah that for which He has not sent down authority, and that of which they have no knowledge, and for the wrongdoers there is no helper.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of idol worship, where people blindly follow false deities without any divine authority or knowledge, and warns that such wrongdoers will ultimately be left without any support or protection.
orig: ويعبدون من دون الله ما لم ينزل به سلطانا وما ليس لهم به علم وما للظالمين من نصير

translation: And when Our clear signs are recited to them, you will notice a denial in the faces of those who disbelieve. They almost attack those who recite Our signs to them. Say, 'Shall I inform you of something worse than that? The Fire, and Allah has promised it to those who disbelieve, and it is an evil destination.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the intense hatred and aggression that non-believers exhibit towards those who recite the words of God, and this reaction is a clear indication of their inner turmoil and guilt, which ultimately leads them to their own downfall.
orig: وإذا تتلى عليهم آياتنا بينات تعرف في وجوه الذين كفروا المنكر يكادون يسطون بالذين يتلون عليهم آياتنا قل أفأنبئكم بشر من ذلكم النار وعدها الله الذين كفروا وبئس المصير

translation: O people, a parable is being set forth, so listen to it. Indeed, those whom you invoke besides Allah will never create a fly, even if they gather together for it. And if a fly were to snatch something away from them, they would not be able to recover it from it. Weak are both the seeker and the sought.
interpretation: This verse highlights the powerlessness of idols and false gods, emphasizing that they are incapable of creating even the smallest of creatures, a fly, let alone having any control over the universe or human affairs, and that those who worship them are equally powerless and dependent on God's mercy.
orig: يا أيها الناس ضرب مثل فاستمعوا له إن الذين تدعون من دون الله لن يخلقوا ذبابا ولو اجتمعوا له وإن يسلبهم الذباب شيئا لا يستنقذوه منه ضعف الطالب والمطلوب

translation: They have not esteemed Allah with the esteem that is due to Him. Indeed, Allah is All-Strong, All-Mighty.
interpretation: The verse highlights humanity's tendency to underestimate God's power and majesty, and serves as a reminder of God's infinite strength and authority, emphasizing the importance of recognizing and submitting to His will.
orig: ما قدروا الله حق قدره إن الله لقوي عزيز

translation: Allah chooses from the angels messengers and from the people. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Seeing.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's absolute authority and wisdom in selecting His messengers, whether they are angels or humans, emphasizing that He is all-knowing and all-seeing in His choices.
orig: الله يصطفي من الملائكة رسلا ومن الناس إن الله سميع بصير

translation: He knows what is before them and what is behind them, and to Allah return all matters.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's omniscience and total awareness of all things, emphasizing that nothing escapes His knowledge, and that ultimately, all matters will return to Him for judgment.
orig: يعلم ما بين أيديهم وما خلفهم وإلى الله ترجع الأمور

translation: O you who have believed, bow down and prostrate and worship your Lord and do good, that you may succeed.
interpretation: The verse is an exhortation to believers to demonstrate their faith through physical acts of worship, such as bowing and prostrating, and to focus on doing good deeds in order to attain spiritual success and salvation.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اركعوا واسجدوا واعبدوا ربكم وافعلوا الخير لعلكم تفلحون

translation: And strive in Allah's cause as He deserves, He has chosen you and has not laid upon you in religion any hardship, the religion of your father Ibrahim, He named you Muslims before and in this, that the Messenger may be a witness over you and you may be witnesses over mankind, so establish the prayer and give zakah and hold fast to Allah, He is your Protector, what an excellent Protector and what an excellent Helper.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of striving in Allah's cause and following the religion of Ibrahim, which is free from hardship, and that Muslims have a responsibility to be witnesses over mankind, and that they should hold fast to Allah, who is their Protector and Helper.
orig: وجاهدوا في الله حق جهاده هو اجتباكم وما جعل عليكم في الدين من حرج ملة أبيكم إبراهيم هو سماكم المسلمين من قبل وفي هذا ليكون الرسول شهيدا عليكم وتكونوا شهداء على الناس فأقيموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة واعتصموا بالله هو مولاكم فنعم المولى ونعم النصير

translation: Certainly will prosper the believers
interpretation: The verse is a declaration of the ultimate triumph of those who have faith and live a righteous life, implying that their success is not limited to the worldly life, but also in the hereafter.
orig: قد أفلح المؤمنون

translation: Those who in their prayer are humble
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of humility in prayer, emphasizing that true believers are those who approach their prayers with humility, recognizing their dependence on God and their own limitations.
orig: الذين هم في صلاتهم خاشعون

translation: And those who turn away from Al-Laghw (evil, falsehood, and vain talk)
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of avoiding frivolous and sinful speech, and instead, focusing on the truth and righteousness, as those who indulge in vain talk will be held accountable for their words and actions.
orig: والذين هم عن اللغو معرضون

translation: And those who are faithful to their trusts
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of fulfilling one's responsibilities and keeping one's promises, emphasizing that a person's reliability and trustworthiness are essential aspects of their character.
orig: والذين هم للزكاة فاعلون

translation: And those who guard their private parts
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of self-control and chastity, emphasizing that true believers are those who are able to restrain their desires and maintain their modesty, reflecting their strong faith and moral character.
orig: والذين هم لفروجهم حافظون

translation: Except from their spouses or their right-hand possessions, for then they are not blameworthy.
interpretation: This verse highlights the exception to the general rule of not gazing or having sexual thoughts about anyone, which is the spouses and slaves, emphasizing the importance of chastity and modesty in relationships.
orig: إلا على أزواجهم أو ما ملكت أيمانهم فإنهم غير ملومين

translation: So whoever desires to go beyond that, then those are the transgressors.
interpretation: The verse warns against exceeding the limits and boundaries set by God, emphasizing that those who do so will be considered transgressors and will face the consequences of their actions.
orig: فمن ابتغى وراء ذلك فأولئك هم العادون

translation: And those who are guardians of their trusts and their covenant.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of being trustworthy and faithful to one's commitments, emphasizing that those who are responsible and reliable in their dealings with others will be rewarded and respected.
orig: والذين هم لأماناتهم وعهدهم راعون

translation: And those who are guardians of their prayers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of being consistent and diligent in one's prayers, implying that those who are faithful in their worship will be rewarded and protected by God.
orig: والذين هم على صلواتهم يحافظون

translation: Those are the inheritors
interpretation: The verse highlights the reward of the righteous believers who will inherit the highest level of paradise, emphasizing their elevated status and closeness to God.
orig: أولئك هم الوارثون

translation: Those who inherit Paradise will dwell therein forever.
interpretation: This verse conveys the idea that those who attain Paradise will enjoy eternal bliss and happiness, free from any fear of loss or separation, emphasizing the concept of eternal reward for the righteous.
orig: الذين يرثون الفردوس هم فيها خالدون

translation: And indeed, We created man from an extract of clay.
interpretation: The verse highlights the humble origins of humanity, emphasizing that humans were created from a lowly and humble substance, namely clay, which serves as a reminder of human beings' inherent vulnerability and dependence on God.
orig: ولقد خلقنا الإنسان من سلالة من طين

translation: Then We placed him as a drop of sperm in a firm lodging.
interpretation: This verse highlights the humble and vulnerable origins of human life, emphasizing God's power and control over the development of human beings from the earliest stages of conception.
orig: ثم جعلناه نطفة في قرار مكين

translation: Then We created the drop of fluid as a clinging form, then We created the clinging form as a lump, then We created the lump as bones, then We clothed the bones with flesh, then We brought forth a new creation, so blessed is Allah, the Best of Creators.
interpretation: The verse highlights the miraculous and intricate process of human creation, emphasizing God's power and wisdom in shaping human beings from a single drop of fluid to a fully formed being, and reminding us of the awe-inspiring nature of God's creative abilities.
orig: ثم خلقنا النطفة علقة فخلقنا العلقة مضغة فخلقنا المضغة عظاما فكسونا العظام لحما ثم أنشأناه خلقا آخر فتبارك الله أحسن الخالقين

translation: Then indeed you will die.
interpretation: The verse is a reminder of the inevitability of death, emphasizing the transience of human life and the futility of worldly pursuits, and thus encouraging believers to focus on their spiritual development and accountability before God.
orig: ثم إنكم بعد ذلك لميتون

translation: Then indeed you will be resurrected on the Day of Resurrection.
interpretation: The verse highlights the inevitability of the Day of Judgment, emphasizing that every individual will be brought back to life to face the consequences of their actions, and that no one can escape this ultimate accountability.
orig: ثم إنكم يوم القيامة تبعثون

translation: And indeed, We have created above you seven layers, and We were not unaware of the creation.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's omnipotence and omniscience, emphasizing that He is not only the Creator but also the Sustainer, with full knowledge and control over His creation, implying that He is always aware of human actions and intentions.
orig: ولقد خلقنا فوقكم سبع طرائق وما كنا عن الخلق غافلين

translation: And We sent down from the sky water in due measure, and We gave it a place in the earth, and indeed, We are Able to take it away.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's complete control over the natural world, emphasizing His ability to provide and withhold sustenance, and reminding humanity of their dependence on Him for survival.
orig: وأنزلنا من السماء ماء بقدر فأسكناه في الأرض وإنا على ذهاب به لقادرون

translation: And We have created for you, therewith, gardens of date-palms and grapes, wherein are abundant fruits for you, and of which you eat.
interpretation: The verse highlights the blessings of God in providing sustenance and nourishment to humanity, emphasizing the abundance and variety of fruits that are available for human consumption, and implying that humans have a responsibility to appreciate and utilize these blessings wisely.
orig: فأنشأنا لكم به جنات من نخيل وأعناب لكم فيها فواكه كثيرة ومنها تأكلون

translation: And a tree issuing from Mount Sinai, producing oil, and a relish for those who eat.
interpretation: The verse symbolizes the blessing and provision of God, as the tree represents abundance and nourishment, and its oil and relish signify the richness and delight that come from obedience to God's will.
orig: وشجرة تخرج من طور سيناء تنبت بالدهن وصبغ للآكلين

translation: And indeed, for you in cattle is a lesson; We give you to drink from what is in their bellies, and for you in them are many benefits, and from them you eat.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of gratitude and appreciation for the blessings and provisions that God has provided for humanity, using the example of cattle, which provide multiple benefits, including food, milk, and other essential resources, emphasizing the need to recognize and acknowledge God's favors.
orig: وإن لكم في الأنعام لعبرة نسقيكم مما في بطونها ولكم فيها منافع كثيرة ومنها تأكلون

translation: And upon it and upon the ship you are carried.
interpretation: The verse highlights humanity's dependence on God's creation and provision, emphasizing that even our transportation and mobility are ultimately dependent on God's will and power.
orig: وعليها وعلى الفلك تحملون

translation: And indeed, We sent Noah to his people, and he said, 'O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. Will you not fear [Him]?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of having a direct and personal relationship with God, free from any intermediaries or false deities, and the need for individuals to take responsibility for their own spiritual well-being and salvation.
orig: ولقد أرسلنا نوحا إلى قومه فقال يا قوم اعبدوا الله ما لكم من إله غيره أفلا تتقون

translation: And the chiefs of those who disbelieved among his people said, 'This is nothing but a human being like yourselves, who desires to gain superiority over you, and if Allah had willed, He would have sent down angels, we have not heard of this among our forefathers of old.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and ignorance of the disbelievers, who rejected the prophet's message and attributed his warnings to a desire for personal gain and superiority, rather than recognizing the divine origin of the message and the prophet's sincerity.
orig: فقال الملأ الذين كفروا من قومه ما هذا إلا بشر مثلكم يريد أن يتفضل عليكم ولو شاء الله لأنزل ملائكة ما سمعنا بهذا في آبائنا الأولين

translation: He is only a man, in him there is a disease, so wait for a while.
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to dismiss and doubt the Prophet Muhammad's message, attributing his revelations to a supposed mental or physical illness, and advises patience and waiting for the truth to unfold.
orig: إن هو إلا رجل به جنة فتربصوا به حتى حين

translation: He said: My Lord! Help me because they deny me.
interpretation: The verse highlights the desperation and helplessness of a prophet who is being rejected and denied by his people, and is crying out to God for support and assistance in the face of their rejection.
orig: قال رب انصرني بما كذبون

translation: So We inspired him (Noah): 'Construct the Ark under Our observation and guidance. And when Our command comes and the oven starts boiling, put in it two pairs of every kind, and your family, except those against whom the Word has already gone forth, and do not address Me concerning those who have done wrong, indeed they will be drowned.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of obeying God's commands and following His guidance, as exemplified by Noah's obedience in building the Ark, and serves as a reminder that those who disobey God's commands will ultimately face destruction.
orig: فأوحينا إليه أن اصنع الفلك بأعيننا ووحينا فإذا جاء أمرنا وفار التنور فاسلك فيها من كل زوجين اثنين وأهلك إلا من سبق عليه القول منهم ولا تخاطبني في الذين ظلموا إنهم مغرقون

translation: So when you and those with you are settled in the ship, say: Praise be to Allah who has saved us from the people who were unjust.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of gratitude and recognition of God's blessings, especially in times of safety and deliverance from oppression, and serves as a reminder to always acknowledge God's power and mercy.
orig: فإذا استويت أنت ومن معك على الفلك فقل الحمد لله الذي نجانا من القوم الظالمين

translation: And say, 'My Lord, cause me to land a blessed landing, and You are the best of those who bring to land.'
interpretation: This verse is a prayer for a safe and blessed return, seeking God's guidance and protection, and acknowledging God's power and sovereignty over all things.
orig: وقل رب أنزلني منزلا مباركا وأنت خير المنزلين

translation: Indeed, in that are signs, and indeed, We were not put to trial.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of learning from the experiences of others, as the stories of the past serve as signs and warnings for those who are willing to learn and take heed.
orig: إن في ذلك لآيات وإن كنا لمبتلين

translation: Then We raised up other generations after them.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's power and control over human history, as He brings forth new generations to replace those that have passed, emphasizing the cycle of life, death, and renewal under God's sovereignty.
orig: ثم أنشأنا من بعدهم قرنا آخرين

translation: So We sent among them a messenger from themselves, (saying), 'Worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. Will you not fear (Him)?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of recognizing and submitting to the one true God, emphasizing that the messenger sent by God is from among the people themselves, making the message more relatable and accessible, and thus there is no excuse for not heeding the warning to fear and worship God alone.
orig: فأرسلنا فيهم رسولا منهم أن اعبدوا الله ما لكم من إله غيره أفلا تتقون

translation: And the chiefs of his people, who disbelieved and denied the meeting of the Hereafter, and were too proud in the life of this world, said: 'This is nothing but a human being like yourselves, eating of that whereof you eat, and drinking of what you drink.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and ignorance of the disbelievers, who refused to acknowledge the prophethood of the messenger and instead saw him as an ordinary human being, just like themselves, with no special status or authority from God.
orig: وقال الملأ من قومه الذين كفروا وكذبوا بلقاء الآخرة وأترفناهم في الحياة الدنيا ما هذا إلا بشر مثلكم يأكل مما تأكلون منه ويشرب مما تشربون

translation: And if you obey a human being like yourselves, indeed you would surely be losers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of seeking guidance from divine revelation rather than human opinion, as following the latter can lead to spiritual loss and misguidance.
orig: ولئن أطعتم بشرا مثلكم إنكم إذا لخاسرون

translation: Do you promise yourselves that, when you are dust and bones, you will be brought forth?
interpretation: This verse highlights the absurdity of humans thinking they can escape accountability before God, pointing to the impossibility of escaping judgment even after death, when the body has decomposed into dust and bones.
orig: أيعدكم أنكم إذا متم وكنتم ترابا وعظاما أنكم مخرجون

translation: Far astray, far astray, from what you are promised!
interpretation: The verse is a declaration of the utter futility of the disbelievers' hopes and expectations, implying that they are delusional in their beliefs and will ultimately be disappointed in the Hereafter.
orig: هيهات هيهات لما توعدون

translation: Nay, this is our life of the world; we die and live, and nothing destroys us except our death.
interpretation: The verse highlights the misconception of the disbelievers who thought that this worldly life is the only life and that there is no resurrection or accountability after death, and that death is the ultimate end, with no possibility of revival or punishment.
orig: إن هي إلا حياتنا الدنيا نموت ونحيا وما نحن بمبعوثين

translation: Nay, he forged a lie against Allah, and we are not believers in him.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of attributing falsehood to God, and how such an action is a clear indication of one's disbelief, as it demonstrates a complete disregard for the truth and a willingness to distort the divine message.
orig: إن هو إلا رجل افترى على الله كذبا وما نحن له بمؤمنين

translation: He said, 'My Lord, help me because they deny me.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the prophet's reliance on God's help and support in the face of rejection and denial by his people, emphasizing the importance of seeking divine assistance in times of hardship and persecution.
orig: قال رب انصرني بما كذبون

translation: They will say, when they have little time left, 'We regret it'
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of regret when it comes too late, implying that people often realize their mistakes only when it is too late and they are on the brink of death, but by then it is of no use.
orig: قال عما قليل ليصبحن نادمين

translation: So the shriek seized them in truth, and We made them as rubbish of plant remnants. Far removal for the unjust people.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that those who reject the truth and persist in their wrongdoing will ultimately face a devastating and humiliating destruction, leaving them in a state of utter worthlessness and abandonment.
orig: فأخذتهم الصيحة بالحق فجعلناهم غثاء فبعدا للقوم الظالمين

translation: Then We raised after them other generations.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's power and control over human history, as He brings about the rise and fall of civilizations, with new generations emerging after the previous ones have passed away.
orig: ثم أنشأنا من بعدهم قرونا آخرين

translation: Whatsoever is in advance of its term, and whatsoever is delayed.
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that everything in life has its predetermined time and course, and that humans have no control over the timing of events, whether they come sooner or later than expected.
orig: ما تسبق من أمة أجلها وما يستأخرون

translation: Then We sent Our messengers one after another. Every time there came to a nation its messenger, they denied him, so We made them follow one another [in punishment], and We made them narrations [of cautionary tales]. Far removed [from mercy] are the people who do not believe.
interpretation: This verse highlights the pattern of God's messengers being rejected by their people, leading to their subsequent punishment, and how these stories serve as cautionary tales for future generations, emphasizing the consequences of disbelief and the importance of heeding the divine message.
orig: ثم أرسلنا رسلنا تترى كل ما جاء أمة رسولها كذبوه فأتبعنا بعضهم بعضا وجعلناهم أحاديث فبعدا لقوم لا يؤمنون

translation: Then We sent Musa and his brother Harun with Our signs and a clear authority.
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of Musa and Harun's mission, emphasizing that they were sent by God with clear signs and authority, implying that their message was not just a human endeavor, but a divinely ordained one, and that they were empowered by God to fulfill their prophetic role.
orig: ثم أرسلنا موسى وأخاه هارون بآياتنا وسلطان مبين

translation: To Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they were arrogant and were a haughty people.
interpretation: The verse highlights the pride and arrogance of Pharaoh and his people, which led them to reject the message of God and ultimately led to their downfall, serving as a lesson to those who refuse to humble themselves before God.
orig: إلى فرعون وملئه فاستكبروا وكانوا قوما عالين

translation: And they said: 'Shall we believe in two men like ourselves, and their people are our slaves?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and pride of the unbelievers, who refused to accept the message of the prophets because they were from a similar social background, implying that they were not superior or special enough to be believed.
orig: فقالوا أنؤمن لبشرين مثلنا وقومهما لنا عابدون

translation: So they denied them, and thus they were of those who were destroyed.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of rejecting the truth and the prophets, which ultimately leads to destruction and perdition.
orig: فكذبوهما فكانوا من المهلكين

translation: And indeed We gave Moses the Book, that they may be guided.
interpretation: This verse highlights the significance of divine guidance and the importance of following the revelation sent by God, as embodied in the Book given to Moses, which serves as a source of guidance for those who seek it.
orig: ولقد آتينا موسى الكتاب لعلهم يهتدون

translation: And We made the son of Maryam and his mother a sign, and We gave them refuge to a high ground having a hollow with a spring.
interpretation: The verse highlights the divine protection and care for the holy family of Mary and Jesus, providing them with a safe and peaceful refuge, symbolizing God's mercy and providence.
orig: وجعلنا ابن مريم وأمه آية وآويناهما إلى ربوة ذات قرار ومعين

translation: O messengers, eat of the good things and work righteousness; surely I am Knowing of what you do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of leading a virtuous life, not only in words but also in actions, as God is fully aware of everything that humans do, and will hold them accountable for their deeds.
orig: يا أيها الرسل كلوا من الطيبات واعملوا صالحا إني بما تعملون عليم

translation: And indeed this, your religion, is one religion, and I am your Lord, so fear Me.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the unity of faith and the oneness of God, implying that there is only one true religion, and that is the one revealed by God, and that God is the only Lord worthy of worship and obedience.
orig: وإن هذه أمتكم أمة واحدة وأنا ربكم فاتقون

translation: And they have broken their affair among themselves into factions, every party rejoicing in what is with them.
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to divide themselves into factions, each group rejoicing in their own beliefs and practices, and ignoring the truth, leading to a state of disunity and ignorance.
orig: فتقطعوا أمرهم بينهم زبرا كل حزب بما لديهم فرحون

translation: Leave them to wander in their insolence for a while.
interpretation: This verse is urging patience and restraint in the face of opposition, allowing the arrogant to continue in their ways for a time, but implying that they will ultimately face accountability for their actions.
orig: فذرهم في غمرتهم حتى حين

translation: Do they think that because We have granted them abundance of wealth and sons
interpretation: The verse highlights the misconception of those who believe that their wealth and abundance of children are a sign of God's favor, when in reality, these worldly possessions are merely a test of their faith and obedience.
orig: أيحسبون أنما نمدهم به من مال وبنين

translation: We hasten for them in good things, but they do not perceive.
interpretation: This verse suggests that God is constantly bestowing blessings and favors upon humanity, but people are often oblivious to these blessings and take them for granted, failing to recognize and appreciate the good things in their lives.
orig: نسارع لهم في الخيرات بل لا يشعرون

translation: Indeed, those who are apprehensive from fear of their Lord
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of having a sense of accountability and fear of God's judgment, which motivates individuals to lead a righteous life and avoid sinful behavior.
orig: إن الذين هم من خشية ربهم مشفقون

translation: And those who believe in the signs of their Lord
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of having faith in the signs and revelations sent by God, which is a fundamental aspect of a believer's character, as it demonstrates their trust and surrender to God's will and guidance.
orig: والذين هم بآيات ربهم يؤمنون

translation: And those who do not associate anything with their Lord
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of monotheism, emphasizing that true believers are those who do not associate any partners with God, and instead, maintain a pure and unadulterated faith in the one and only Creator.
orig: والذين هم بربهم لا يشركون

translation: And those who give what they give, while their hearts are fearful, because they are to return to their Lord.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of sincerity in one's actions, as those who perform good deeds with a sense of accountability to God, fearing His judgment, will ultimately be rewarded.
orig: والذين يؤتون ما آتوا وقلوبهم وجلة أنهم إلى ربهم راجعون

translation: Those who hasten to good deeds, and they are foremost in them.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of taking initiative in doing good deeds, and those who do so will be rewarded and recognized for their efforts, indicating that they will be among the first to enter Paradise.
orig: أولئك يسارعون في الخيرات وهم لها سابقون

translation: And we do not burden any soul beyond its capacity, and with Us is a record that speaks the truth, and they will not be wronged.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's justice and fairness, emphasizing that He does not burden individuals with responsibilities beyond their capabilities, and that a true and accurate record of their deeds is kept, ensuring that they will not be treated unfairly on the Day of Judgment.
orig: ولا نكلف نفسا إلا وسعها ولدينا كتاب ينطق بالحق وهم لا يظلمون

translation: Nay, their hearts are in ignorance of this, and they have deeds besides that; they are workers of that.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who reject the truth are not only ignorant of the reality of their situation, but are also actively engaged in perpetuating their own misguidance, and are thus responsible for their own downfall.
orig: بل قلوبهم في غمرة من هذا ولهم أعمال من دون ذلك هم لها عاملون

translation: Until when We seize their affluent ones with punishment, then behold, they cry out.
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to only turn to God when they are in distress, having previously ignored His warnings and neglected their responsibilities, and how their cries for help come too late, as the punishment has already been decreed.
orig: حتى إذا أخذنا مترفيهم بالعذاب إذا هم يجأرون

translation: Do not cry out today, indeed you will not be helped by Us.
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that those who are punished by God will not be able to escape or be rescued, and that their cries for help will be in vain, as they will be abandoned by God.
orig: لا تجأروا اليوم إنكم منا لا تنصرون

translation: My verses were recited to you, but you used to turn back on your heels.
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to turn away from the truth and ignore the guidance of God, even when it is presented to them in a clear and convincing manner, and this turning away is often accompanied by a sense of arrogance and stubbornness.
orig: قد كانت آياتي تتلى عليكم فكنتم على أعقابكم تنكصون

translation: Those who were arrogant must be driven out, and they will be driven out.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who are arrogant and refuse to submit to God's will will ultimately be humbled and punished, implying that their arrogance will be their downfall.
orig: مستكبرين به سامرا تهجرون

translation: Do they not ponder over the Quran, or has it become inaccessible to them, or has there come to them what did not come to their forefathers of old?
interpretation: The verse is a criticism of those who reject the Quran, suggesting that they are not reflecting on its message and are instead stuck in their old ways, just like their ancestors who also rejected divine guidance.
orig: أفلم يدبروا القول أم جاءهم ما لم يأت آباءهم الأولين

translation: Or do they not recognize their Messenger, so they are denying him from you?
