interpretation: This verse highlights the futility of trying to guide those who refuse to listen, as they are driven by their own whims and desires, and are therefore incapable of receiving guidance from Allah, emphasizing the idea that those who reject the truth will be left to their own misguided ways.
orig: فإن لم يستجيبوا لك فاعلم أنما يتبعون أهواءهم ومن أضل ممن اتبع هواه بغير هدى من الله إن الله لا يهدي القوم الظالمين

translation: And indeed, We have conveyed the Word to them, so that they may remember.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of reminding people about the message of God, as it has the potential to awaken their conscience and bring them back to the right path.
orig: ولقد وصلنا لهم القول لعلهم يتذكرون

translation: Those to whom We have given the Book before it, they are believers in it.
interpretation: The verse suggests that the people who were given the previous scripture, such as the Jews and Christians, will recognize and believe in the truth of the Quran, implying that the Quran is a confirmation and fulfillment of the previous revelations.
orig: الذين آتيناهم الكتاب من قبله هم به يؤمنون

translation: And when it is recited to them, they say: 'We believe in it, verily it is the truth from our Lord. Indeed, we were Muslims before.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of the people who claim to be believers, but their actions and behavior contradict their claims, implying that they are not truly committed to their faith.
orig: وإذا يتلى عليهم قالوا آمنا به إنه الحق من ربنا إنا كنا من قبله مسلمين

translation: Those will be given their reward twice because they were patient, and they repel evil with good, and from what We have provided them, they spend.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of patience and kindness in the face of adversity, and how these virtues can lead to spiritual growth and multiplied rewards from God.
orig: أولئك يؤتون أجرهم مرتين بما صبروا ويدرءون بالحسنة السيئة ومما رزقناهم ينفقون

translation: And when they hear vain talk, they turn away from it and say: 'For us our deeds, and for you your deeds. Peace be to you. We do not seek the ignorant.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of ignoring futile and meaningless speech, and instead, focusing on one's own actions and deeds, rather than getting entangled in unnecessary and fruitless discussions.
orig: وإذا سمعوا اللغو أعرضوا عنه وقالوا لنا أعمالنا ولكم أعمالكم سلام عليكم لا نبتغي الجاهلين

translation: Indeed, you do not guide whom you love, but Allah guides whom He wills, and He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.
interpretation: The verse highlights the limitation of human ability to guide others, emphasizing that only Allah has the power to guide those who are willing to be guided, and that He has complete knowledge of those who are truly guided.
orig: إنك لا تهدي من أحببت ولكن الله يهدي من يشاء وهو أعلم بالمهتدين

translation: And they say: If we follow the guidance with you, we will be snatched from our land. Have we not made it a sanctuary, secure and prosperous, to which are brought the fruits of all kinds, a provision from Us? But most of them do not know.
interpretation: The verse highlights the ignorance of those who reject the message of the prophets, thinking that following the guidance of God would lead to their destruction, when in reality, it is their disobedience that puts them in danger, and it is God's provision that sustains them.
orig: وقالوا إن نتبع الهدى معك نتخطف من أرضنا أولم نمكن لهم حرما آمنا يجبى إليه ثمرات كل شيء رزقا من لدنا ولكن أكثرهم لا يعلمون

translation: And how many a town have We destroyed, whose life was evil, so those are their dwellings, which have not been inhabited after them except a little, and We are the inheritors.
interpretation: The verse highlights the transience of human civilizations and the inevitability of God's judgment, emphasizing that even the most powerful and prosperous societies can be brought down by their own corruption and injustice, leaving behind only remnants of their existence.
orig: وكم أهلكنا من قرية بطرت معيشتها فتلك مساكنهم لم تسكن من بعدهم إلا قليلا وكنا نحن الوارثين

translation: And your Lord would not destroy the towns until He sends a messenger to their mother town, reciting to them Our verses. And We would not destroy the towns unless their people were wrongdoers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of prophetic guidance and the opportunity for repentance, emphasizing that God's justice is not arbitrary, but rather a response to the rejection of divine guidance and the persistence in wrongdoing.
orig: وما كان ربك مهلك القرى حتى يبعث في أمها رسولا يتلو عليهم آياتنا وما كنا مهلكي القرى إلا وأهلها ظالمون

translation: And whatever you have been given is but enjoyment of the life of this world and its adornment, and what is with Allah is better and more lasting. Do you not then understand?
interpretation: The verse highlights the impermanence of worldly possessions and the fleeting nature of earthly pleasures, urging believers to prioritize the eternal rewards of the Hereafter over the transitory allurements of this life.
orig: وما أوتيتم من شيء فمتاع الحياة الدنيا وزينتها وما عند الله خير وأبقى أفلا تعقلون

translation: Is he to whom We have promised a good promise which he will meet, like him whom We have provided with the goods of the life of this world, then on the Day of Resurrection he will be among those brought (to account)?
interpretation: The verse highlights the contrast between those who have been promised a good outcome in the Hereafter and those who are enjoying the fleeting pleasures of this worldly life, only to be held accountable on the Day of Judgment.
orig: أفمن وعدناه وعدا حسنا فهو لاقيه كمن متعناه متاع الحياة الدنيا ثم هو يوم القيامة من المحضرين

translation: And the Day He will call to them, saying: 'Where are My partners, those whom you used to claim?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the futility of associating partners with God, as on the Day of Judgment, those who claimed to have partners with God will be unable to produce them, and will be left to face the consequences of their idolatry alone.
orig: ويوم يناديهم فيقول أين شركائي الذين كنتم تزعمون

translation: Those against whom the word has been fulfilled will say: 'Our Lord, these are the ones who led us astray, we led them astray just as we were led astray; we declare our innocence before You, they did not worship us.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the futile attempt of the misled to shift the blame onto their leaders, claiming they were led astray by them, while in reality, they are equally responsible for their own misguidance.
orig: قال الذين حق عليهم القول ربنا هؤلاء الذين أغوينا أغويناهم كما غوينا تبرأنا إليك ما كانوا إيانا يعبدون

translation: And it will be said, 'Call your associates,' and they will call them, but they will not respond to them, and they will see the punishment. If only they had been guided.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of seeking help from false deities or associates in times of distress, and the ultimate realization of their powerlessness, which will lead to a deeper understanding of the true nature of God's power and justice.
orig: وقيل ادعوا شركاءكم فدعوهم فلم يستجيبوا لهم ورأوا العذاب لو أنهم كانوا يهتدون

translation: And the day He will call to them, saying: 'What was the response you gave to the Messengers?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the accountability of humans on the Day of Judgment, where they will be questioned about their response to the message of the prophets and messengers sent by God, emphasizing the importance of accepting and following divine guidance.
orig: ويوم يناديهم فيقول ماذا أجبتم المرسلين

translation: And the news will come to them on that day, so they will not ask each other.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that on the Day of Judgment, people will be so overwhelmed by the reality of their situation that they will not even bother to ask each other about their fate, implying a state of utter shock and despair.
orig: فعميت عليهم الأنباء يومئذ فهم لا يتساءلون

translation: But he who repents, believes, and does righteous deeds, then perhaps he will be among the successful ones.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of sincere repentance, faith, and good deeds in achieving success in the hereafter, implying that these actions can lead to a person's salvation and felicity.
orig: فأما من تاب وآمن وعمل صالحا فعسى أن يكون من المفلحين

translation: And your Lord creates what He wills and chooses; they have no right to choose. Glorified is Allah and exalted above what they associate with Him.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes God's absolute authority and power, highlighting that He is the sole creator and decider, and that humans have no say in the matter, which serves as a reminder of the futility of idolatry and the importance of submitting to God's will.
orig: وربك يخلق ما يشاء ويختار ما كان لهم الخيرة سبحان الله وتعالى عما يشركون

translation: And your Lord knows what their breasts conceal and what they declare.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's omniscience, emphasizing that He is aware of both the hidden thoughts and feelings of individuals, as well as their outward declarations and actions, implying that one cannot hide their true intentions or deceive God.
orig: وربك يعلم ما تكن صدورهم وما يعلنون

translation: And He is Allah, there is no deity except Him. To Him belongs praise in the first and the last, and to Him is the judgment, and to Him you will be returned.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute sovereignty of Allah, implying that He is the sole creator and sustainer of the universe, and that all praise and judgment belong to Him, and ultimately, all things will return to Him.
orig: وهو الله لا إله إلا هو له الحمد في الأولى والآخرة وله الحكم وإليه ترجعون

translation: Say, 'Have you considered: if Allah were to make the night perpetual over you until the Day of Resurrection, is there a deity besides Allah who could bring you light? Then will you not hear?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the absolute dependence of humanity on Allah's mercy and provision, emphasizing that if Allah were to withdraw His blessings, even for a moment, humanity would be plunged into darkness, and no other deity or power could bring relief or light.
orig: قل أرأيتم إن جعل الله عليكم الليل سرمدا إلى يوم القيامة من إله غير الله يأتيكم بضياء أفلا تسمعون

translation: Say, 'Do you see? If Allah were to make the day perpetual over you until the Day of Resurrection, is there a deity besides Allah who could bring you night so that you may rest therein? Will you not then see?'
interpretation: The verse is encouraging humans to reflect on the nature of God's power and their own dependence on Him, highlighting that even the most fundamental aspects of our lives, like the cycle of day and night, are under His control and mercy.
orig: قل أرأيتم إن جعل الله عليكم النهار سرمدا إلى يوم القيامة من إله غير الله يأتيكم بليل تسكنون فيه أفلا تبصرون

translation: And out of His mercy, He made for you the night and the day, that you may rest therein and seek of His bounty, and that you may be grateful.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's mercy and benevolence in creating the cycles of day and night, allowing humans to rest and pursue their livelihood, and ultimately, to acknowledge and appreciate God's favors.
orig: ومن رحمته جعل لكم الليل والنهار لتسكنوا فيه ولتبتغوا من فضله ولعلكم تشكرون

translation: And the Day He will call to them, He will say, 'Where are those you used to claim as partners?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of idolatry and the false sense of security that comes with it, as on the Day of Judgment, those who worshipped false deities will be forced to confront the reality of their actions and realize that their supposed 'partners' are nowhere to be found.
orig: ويوم يناديهم فيقول أين شركائي الذين كنتم تزعمون

translation: And We took from every nation a witness, and We said, 'Bring your proof.' Then they knew that the truth belonged to Allah, and lost from them what they were inventing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that every nation has a witness or a prophet who testifies to the truth of God's message, and that ultimately, the truth of God's existence and power will be revealed, rendering all human inventions and false beliefs useless.
orig: ونزعنا من كل أمة شهيدا فقلنا هاتوا برهانكم فعلموا أن الحق لله وضل عنهم ما كانوا يفترون

translation: Indeed, Qarun was from the people of Moses, but he oppressed them. And We gave him of the treasures that which would have burdened a company of men possessed of strength. When his people said to him, 'Do not exult [in your riches]; indeed, Allah does not like the exultant.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the dangers of arrogance and pride that come with wealth and power, and serves as a warning to those who let their riches and status consume them, leading them to forget their humble beginnings and their accountability to God.
orig: إن قارون كان من قوم موسى فبغى عليهم وآتيناه من الكنوز ما إن مفاتحه لتنوء بالعصبة أولي القوة إذ قال له قومه لا تفرح إن الله لا يحب الفرحين

translation: And seek, [in that which Allah has given you,] the home of the Hereafter, and do not forget your share of the world. And do good as Allah has done good to you. And do not seek corruption in the earth. Indeed, Allah does not love the corruptors.
interpretation: The verse is encouraging believers to balance their pursuit of spiritual growth and eternal reward with their worldly responsibilities, emphasizing that one should not neglect their duties in this life while striving for the next, and that doing good to others is a key aspect of a virtuous life.
orig: وابتغ فيما آتاك الله الدار الآخرة ولا تنس نصيبك من الدنيا وأحسن كما أحسن الله إليك ولا تبغ الفساد في الأرض إن الله لا يحب المفسدين

translation: He said: 'I was given it because of knowledge I possess.' Did he not know that Allah had destroyed before him generations of people who were stronger than him in power and had gathered more in multitude? And the criminals will not be questioned about their sins.
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and ignorance of those who attribute their success and achievements to their own abilities and knowledge, rather than acknowledging the blessings and favors of God, and serves as a warning to those who think they are self-sufficient and above accountability.
orig: قال إنما أوتيته على علم عندي أولم يعلم أن الله قد أهلك من قبله من القرون من هو أشد منه قوة وأكثر جمعا ولا يسأل عن ذنوبهم المجرمون

translation: So he came out to his people in his finery. Those who desire the life of this world said, 'Oh, would that we had been given something like what Qarun was given. Indeed, he has been given a great share.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to be envious of others' material possessions and wealth, and to desire what others have, rather than being content with what they have been given by God.
orig: فخرج على قومه في زينته قال الذين يريدون الحياة الدنيا يا ليت لنا مثل ما أوتي قارون إنه لذو حظ عظيم

translation: And those who were given knowledge said, 'Woe to you! The reward of Allah is best for him who believes and does righteousness, and none shall attain it except the patient ones.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of patience as a prerequisite for attaining Allah's reward, implying that only those who persevere and remain steadfast in their faith and good deeds will be granted Allah's blessings and mercy.
orig: وقال الذين أوتوا العلم ويلكم ثواب الله خير لمن آمن وعمل صالحا ولا يلقاها إلا الصابرون

translation: So We seized him and his armies, and We cast them into the earth, and there was no group to help him against Allah, and he was not of those who were helped.
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that no one can escape God's punishment, not even the most powerful individuals, and that ultimately, only God's help is reliable and trustworthy.
orig: فخسفنا به وبداره الأرض فما كان له من فئة ينصرونه من دون الله وما كان من المنتصرين

translation: And those who were envying his position the day before say, 'And as if Allah expands the provision for whom He wills of His servants and restricts it. If not that Allah had conferred favour on us, He would have made us sink therewith. And indeed, the disbelievers will not succeed.
interpretation: The verse highlights the realization of those who were envious of the blessings of others, that it is God who bestows His favours upon whom He wills, and that their own prosperity is a result of God's mercy, which they had taken for granted, and that without it, they would have been doomed.
orig: وأصبح الذين تمنوا مكانه بالأمس يقولون ويكأن الله يبسط الرزق لمن يشاء من عباده ويقدر لولا أن من الله علينا لخسف بنا ويكأنه لا يفلح الكافرون

translation: That Home of the Hereafter, We shall assign it to those who do not intend to exalt themselves in the earth nor to cause corruption, and the good end is for the righteous.
interpretation: The verse implies that those who are humble and do not seek to dominate or corrupt others will be rewarded with a good end in the Hereafter, emphasizing the importance of humility and righteousness in achieving eternal success.
orig: تلك الدار الآخرة نجعلها للذين لا يريدون علوا في الأرض ولا فسادا والعاقبة للمتقين

translation: Whoever brings a good deed, he shall have ten times as much; and whoever brings an evil deed, he shall be punished only for what he has done; and they shall not be wronged.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of moral reciprocity, where good deeds are rewarded manifold, while evil deeds are punished in proportion to the wrongdoing, emphasizing the principle of fairness and justice in God's judgment.
orig: من جاء بالحسنة فله خير منها ومن جاء بالسيئة فلا يجزى الذين عملوا السيئات إلا ما كانوا يعملون

translation: Indeed, [the one] who has obligated upon you the Quran will surely take you back to a return. Say, 'My Lord knows best who has come with guidance and who is in clear error.'
interpretation: The verse is reassuring the Prophet Muhammad that God, who has entrusted him with the Quran, will guide him and ultimately bring him back to a place of triumph, and that God is fully aware of those who are guided and those who are misguided.
orig: إن الذي فرض عليك القرآن لرادك إلى معاد قل ربي أعلم من جاء بالهدى ومن هو في ضلال مبين

translation: And you did not expect that the Book would be given to you, except as a mercy from your Lord, so do not be a supporter of the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder to the Prophet Muhammad that the revelation of the Quran is a blessing from God and that he should not compromise with the disbelievers, but instead maintain his independence and autonomy as a messenger of God.
orig: وما كنت ترجو أن يلقى إليك الكتاب إلا رحمة من ربك فلا تكونن ظهيرا للكافرين

translation: And let not those who disbelieve in the Signs of Allah turn you aside after the Truth has come to you, and invoke your Lord and be not of the polytheists.
interpretation: The verse is a warning to the believers to remain steadfast in their faith and not be swayed by those who reject the signs of Allah, emphasizing the importance of maintaining one's conviction in the face of opposition and temptation.
orig: ولا يصدنك عن آيات الله بعد إذ أنزلت إليك وادع إلى ربك ولا تكونن من المشركين

translation: And do not invoke besides Allah any other god. There is no deity except Him. Everything will perish except His Face. To Him is the judgment, and to Him you will be returned.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the exclusivity of Allah's divinity, implying that any form of polytheism or idolatry is a rejection of Allah's sovereignty, and that ultimately, only Allah's existence will endure, and to Him, all creation will return for judgment.
orig: ولا تدع مع الله إلها آخر لا إله إلا هو كل شيء هالك إلا وجهه له الحكم وإليه ترجعون

translation: These are the verses of the clear Book.
interpretation: The verse is an affirmation of the authenticity and clarity of the Quran, emphasizing that its verses are a source of guidance and wisdom for those who seek it.
orig: الم

translation: Do the people think that they will be left to say 'We believe' and they will not be tried?
interpretation: The verse highlights the misconception that one can claim to have faith without being tested or tried, and that true faith is only proven through trials and tribulations.
orig: أحسب الناس أن يتركوا أن يقولوا آمنا وهم لا يفتنون

translation: And indeed, We have tried those who were before them, so that Allah will know those who are truthful, and He will know those who are liars.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that God tests people to distinguish between those who are truthful and those who are deceitful, implying that God's knowledge is not limited to outward appearances, but rather penetrates to the inner intentions and sincerity of individuals.
orig: ولقد فتنا الذين من قبلهم فليعلمن الله الذين صدقوا وليعلمن الكاذبين

translation: Or do those who commit evil deeds think that they will outstrip Us? Evil is what they judge.
interpretation: The verse highlights the misconception of those who commit evil deeds, thinking they can outsmart God and escape His justice, when in reality they are only deceiving themselves.
orig: أم حسب الذين يعملون السيئات أن يسبقونا ساء ما يحكمون

translation: Whoever hopes to meet Allah, then Allah's term is surely coming, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of living a righteous life, as one's ultimate goal should be to meet Allah, and that meeting will inevitably occur, emphasizing the certainty of accountability and judgment.
orig: من كان يرجو لقاء الله فإن أجل الله لآت وهو السميع العليم

translation: And whoever strives, strives only for his own soul; verily, Allah is Self-Sufficient, Independent of all the worlds.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that an individual's efforts and struggles in the path of righteousness are ultimately for their own spiritual growth and salvation, as God is not in need of human efforts, emphasizing the concept of personal responsibility and accountability.
orig: ومن جاهد فإنما يجاهد لنفسه إن الله لغني عن العالمين

translation: And those who believe and do righteous deeds, We shall remit from them their evil deeds and shall reward them according to the best of what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of forgiveness and reward in Islam, where believers who perform good deeds will have their past mistakes forgiven and will be rewarded with something even better than what they deserve, emphasizing the mercy and generosity of God.
orig: والذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات لنكفرن عنهم سيئاتهم ولنجزينهم أحسن الذي كانوا يعملون

translation: And We have enjoined upon man, to be good to his parents, and if they strive to make you associate with Me that of which you have no knowledge, do not obey them. To Me is your return, and I will inform you about what you used to do.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of obeying God over obeying one's parents, emphasizing that one's ultimate accountability is to God, and that one should not compromise their faith and values to please their parents or anyone else.
orig: ووصينا الإنسان بوالديه حسنا وإن جاهداك لتشرك بي ما ليس لك به علم فلا تطعهما إلي مرجعكم فأنبئكم بما كنتم تعملون

translation: And those who believe and do good deeds, We will admit them among the righteous.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of not only believing in God, but also doing good deeds, as a prerequisite for being considered righteous in the eyes of God.
orig: والذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات لندخلنهم في الصالحين

translation: And among people is he who says, 'We believe in Allah,' but when he is harmed in Allah, he considers the trial of the people as a punishment from Allah. And if victory comes from your Lord, he says, 'Indeed, we were with you.' Is not Allah most knowing of what is in the breasts of the worlds?
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who claim to believe in God but falter when faced with trials and hardships, revealing their lack of true faith and commitment to their professed beliefs.
orig: ومن الناس من يقول آمنا بالله فإذا أوذي في الله جعل فتنة الناس كعذاب الله ولئن جاء نصر من ربك ليقولن إنا كنا معكم أوليس الله بأعلم بما في صدور العالمين

translation: And Allah will suffice those who have believed and will expose the hypocrites.
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that God is the ultimate protector and supporter of those who have faith, and that He will expose and deal with those who are hypocrites, implying that believers can trust in God's justice and protection.
orig: وليعلمن الله الذين آمنوا وليعلمن المنافقين

translation: And those who disbelieved said to those who believed, 'Follow our way and we will carry your sins.' But they will not carry anything of their sins. Indeed, they are liars.
interpretation: The verse highlights the deceitful nature of those who reject faith, as they attempt to deceive believers into following their path, promising to take on their sins, when in reality they are incapable of doing so and are only driven by their own self-interest.
orig: وقال الذين كفروا للذين آمنوا اتبعوا سبيلنا ولنحمل خطاياكم وما هم بحاملين من خطاياهم من شيء إنهم لكاذبون

translation: And they will bear their own burdens, and other burdens besides their own; and they will be questioned on the Day of Resurrection about what they used to invent.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of personal responsibility, where individuals will be held accountable for their own actions and the influence they had on others, emphasizing the idea that one's actions have consequences and will be judged accordingly.
orig: وليحملن أثقالهم وأثقالا مع أثقالهم وليسألن يوم القيامة عما كانوا يفترون

translation: And indeed, We sent Noah to his people, and he remained among them for a thousand years minus fifty years, then the flood took them while they were wrongdoers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the patience and perseverance of Prophet Noah, who preached to his people for nearly a thousand years, and it was only when they refused to listen and continued in their wrongdoing that the flood was sent as a punishment, emphasizing the mercy and justice of God.
orig: ولقد أرسلنا نوحا إلى قومه فلبث فيهم ألف سنة إلا خمسين عاما فأخذهم الطوفان وهم ظالمون

translation: So We saved him and the companions of the ship, and made it a sign for the worlds.
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of the event of saving the prophet and his companions as a symbol of God's power and mercy, serving as a reminder and a lesson for all humanity.
orig: فأنجيناه وأصحاب السفينة وجعلناها آية للعالمين

translation: And Ibrahim said to his people: 'Worship Allah and fear Him, that is better for you if you know.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of having a personal relationship with God, emphasizing that true worship and fear of God is the key to a better life, and that this understanding is only possible through spiritual knowledge and awareness.
orig: وإبراهيم إذ قال لقومه اعبدوا الله واتقوه ذلكم خير لكم إن كنتم تعلمون

translation: You worship besides Allah idols and invent a lie. Indeed, those you worship besides Allah do not possess for you [any] provision. So seek from Allah provision and worship Him and be grateful to Him. To Him you will be returned.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of idol worship and the importance of recognizing Allah as the sole provider of sustenance, emphasizing that true believers should seek provision and gratitude from Allah alone.
orig: إنما تعبدون من دون الله أوثانا وتخلقون إفكا إن الذين تعبدون من دون الله لا يملكون لكم رزقا فابتغوا عند الله الرزق واعبدوه واشكروا له إليه ترجعون

translation: And if you deny, then nations before you have denied. And on the Messenger is only the clear conveyance.
interpretation: This verse highlights the responsibility of the Prophet, which is limited to conveying the message of God clearly, and that he is not responsible for the acceptance or rejection of the message by the people, as it is a matter between them and God.
orig: وإن تكذبوا فقد كذب أمم من قبلكم وما على الرسول إلا البلاغ المبين

translation: Do they not see how Allah originates the creation, then repeats it? Indeed, that is easy for Allah.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and omnipotence of God, emphasizing that the act of creation is not a difficult task for Him, and that He can repeat it with ease, implying that just as God can create, He can also recreate and resurrect.
orig: أولم يروا كيف يبدئ الله الخلق ثم يعيده إن ذلك على الله يسير

translation: Say, 'Travel in the land and see how He originated creation. Then Allah will produce the next creation. Indeed, Allah, over all things, is Powerful.'
interpretation: This verse is an invitation to reflect on the signs of God's power and wisdom in the creation of the universe, and to recognize that the same power that brought the universe into being will also bring about its transformation and renewal in the hereafter.
orig: قل سيروا في الأرض فانظروا كيف بدأ الخلق ثم الله ينشئ النشأة الآخرة إن الله على كل شيء قدير

translation: He punishes whom He wills and has mercy on whom He wills, and to Him you will be returned.
interpretation: This verse highlights the absolute authority of God, emphasizing that His will is not bound by any external factors, and that He exercises His power and mercy as He sees fit, without being accountable to anyone.
orig: يعذب من يشاء ويرحم من يشاء وإليه تقلبون

translation: And you will not be able to escape in the earth or in the heaven, and you have not besides Allah any guardian or helper.
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that humans are completely dependent on God and have no one else to turn to for help or protection, emphasizing the absolute nature of God's power and authority over all creation.
orig: وما أنتم بمعجزين في الأرض ولا في السماء وما لكم من دون الله من ولي ولا نصير

translation: And those who disbelieve in the signs of Allah and His meeting, those have despaired of My mercy, and those - for them is a painful punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of rejecting God's signs and the consequences of disbelieving in the ultimate meeting with Him, implying that those who do so have lost all hope of God's mercy and will instead face a severe punishment.
orig: والذين كفروا بآيات الله ولقائه أولئك يئسوا من رحمتي وأولئك لهم عذاب أليم

translation: But the only answer of his people was that they said, 'Kill him or burn him.' But Allah saved him from the fire. Indeed, in that are signs for a people who believe.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of faith in God's power and intervention, even in the face of extreme persecution and danger, as demonstrated by the story of the prophet Ibrahim, who was saved by God from the fire.
orig: فما كان جواب قومه إلا أن قالوا اقتلوه أو حرقوه فأنجاه الله من النار إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يؤمنون

translation: And he said: 'You have taken besides Allah idols, out of mutual love and respect in the life of this world. Then on the Day of Resurrection, you will deny each other and curse each other, and your abode will be the Fire, and you will have no helpers.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of idol worship and the fleeting nature of worldly relationships, which will ultimately lead to mutual denial and curses on the Day of Judgment, emphasizing the gravity of the consequences of such actions.
orig: وقال إنما اتخذتم من دون الله أوثانا مودة بينكم في الحياة الدنيا ثم يوم القيامة يكفر بعضكم ببعض ويلعن بعضكم بعضا ومأواكم النار وما لكم من ناصرين

translation: So Lot believed in him (Abraham). He (Abraham) said: 'I will emigrate to my Lord, for He is the Mighty, the Wise.'
interpretation: The verse highlights Abraham's trust in God's power and wisdom, which gives him the courage to migrate to a new land, leaving behind the familiar and the comfortable, and embark on a journey of faith, trusting that God will guide and protect him.
orig: فآمن له لوط وقال إني مهاجر إلى ربي إنه هو العزيز الحكيم

translation: And We bestowed upon him Isaac and Jacob, and We ordained among his progeny prophethood and the Scripture, and We gave him his reward in this world, and indeed, in the Hereafter, he will be among the righteous.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of spiritual inheritance, where the blessings and virtues of the righteous ancestors are passed down to their progeny, emphasizing the importance of family and lineage in the spiritual development of individuals.
orig: ووهبنا له إسحاق ويعقوب وجعلنا في ذريته النبوة والكتاب وآتيناه أجره في الدنيا وإنه في الآخرة لمن الصالحين

translation: And Lot, when he said to his people, 'Indeed, you commit an indecency which none of the worlds has preceded you with'
interpretation: The verse highlights the boldness and courage of Prophet Lot in condemning the sinful behavior of his people, implying that their actions were not only immoral but also unprecedented in human history, and that they were setting a dangerous precedent for future generations.
orig: ولوطا إذ قال لقومه إنكم لتأتون الفاحشة ما سبقكم بها من أحد من العالمين

translation: Why do you come to the men, and you cut off the road, and you bring shame in your gatherings? The only answer of his people was that they said: 'Bring us the punishment of Allah if you are of the truthful.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the audacity of the people of Lot who, despite being aware of their sinful acts, dared to challenge the prophet to bring upon them the wrath of God, demonstrating their arrogance and lack of remorse for their actions.
orig: أئنكم لتأتون الرجال وتقطعون السبيل وتأتون في ناديكم المنكر فما كان جواب قومه إلا أن قالوا ائتنا بعذاب الله إن كنت من الصادقين

translation: He said: 'My Lord, help me against the corrupt people.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of seeking God's help and support in the face of corruption and injustice, emphasizing the believer's reliance on divine assistance in the struggle against evil.
orig: قال رب انصرني على القوم المفسدين

translation: And when Our messengers came to Abraham with the good news, they said, 'We are going to destroy the people of this town, for its people were wrongdoers.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of accountability, where the wrongdoers are held responsible for their actions, and the righteous are rewarded, emphasizing the idea that God's justice is inevitable and will be carried out in due time.
orig: ولما جاءت رسلنا إبراهيم بالبشرى قالوا إنا مهلكو أهل هذه القرية إن أهلها كانوا ظالمين

translation: He said: 'Verily, Lot is there.' They said: 'We know better who is there, we will certainly save him and his family - except his wife: she was of those who lagged behind.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of spiritual purification and the consequences of being left behind in terms of faith and righteousness, as exemplified by Lot's wife who, despite being part of a righteous family, failed to attain salvation due to her own shortcomings.
orig: قال إن فيها لوطا قالوا نحن أعلم بمن فيها لننجينه وأهله إلا امرأته كانت من الغابرين

translation: And when Our messengers came to Lot, he was distressed and worried about them, and said, 'Do not fear, nor grieve; indeed, we will save you and your family, except your wife; she is of those who will remain behind.'
interpretation: The verse highlights Lot's selflessness and concern for his guests' safety, as he prioritizes their well-being over his own, demonstrating the importance of hospitality and protecting one's guests in Islamic ethics.
orig: ولما أن جاءت رسلنا لوطا سيء بهم وضاق بهم ذرعا وقالوا لا تخف ولا تحزن إنا منجوك وأهلك إلا امرأتك كانت من الغابرين

translation: Indeed, We are about to unleash upon the people of this town a torment from the sky because they were defiant.
interpretation: The verse highlights the direct connection between the evil deeds of a community and the punishment that follows, emphasizing that the punishment is a direct result of their defiance and disobedience to God's commands.
orig: إنا منزلون على أهل هذه القرية رجزا من السماء بما كانوا يفسقون

translation: And indeed, We have left a clear sign for people who understand.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of reflection and contemplation, implying that the signs and miracles left by God are not just physical events, but also require intellectual and spiritual effort to comprehend and appreciate.
orig: ولقد تركنا منها آية بينة لقوم يعقلون

translation: And to Midian their brother Shu'aib, he said: 'O my people, worship Allah and fear the Last Day and do not commit abuse on the earth, spreading corruption.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of accountability and moral responsibility, emphasizing that individuals have a duty to worship Allah and refrain from corrupting the earth, implying that humans are entrusted with the stewardship of the earth and will be held accountable for their actions.
orig: وإلى مدين أخاهم شعيبا فقال يا قوم اعبدوا الله وارجوا اليوم الآخر ولا تعثوا في الأرض مفسدين

translation: So they denied him, and the earthquake seized them, and they became in their homes fallen prone.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of rejecting God's messengers and disobeying His commands, which can lead to sudden and catastrophic events that leave people helpless and humbled.
orig: فكذبوه فأخذتهم الرجفة فأصبحوا في دارهم جاثمين

translation: And 'Ad and Thamud, and it has been shown to you from their dwellings; and Satan has made their deeds fair-seeming to them, so he barred them from the way, though they were endowed with insight.
interpretation: The verse highlights the theme of deception, where Satan's influence can lead even those with insight and knowledge to stray from the right path, illustrating the subtle yet powerful nature of evil.
orig: وعادا وثمود وقد تبين لكم من مساكنهم وزين لهم الشيطان أعمالهم فصدهم عن السبيل وكانوا مستبصرين

translation: Qarun and Pharaoh and Haman; and indeed Moses came to them with clear signs, but they were arrogant in the land, and they were not the first ones (to do so).
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and stubbornness of those who reject the truth, even when faced with clear signs and evidence, and serves as a reminder that such behavior is not unique to a particular individual or group, but rather a recurring pattern throughout history.
orig: وقارون وفرعون وهامان ولقد جاءهم موسى بالبينات فاستكبروا في الأرض وما كانوا سابقين

translation: So We seized them for their sins, and among them were those on whom We sent a storm, and among them were those who were overtaken by the awful cry, and among them were those whom We caused the earth to swallow, and among them were those whom We drowned. And Allah did not wrong them, but they wronged themselves.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of self-inflicted suffering, emphasizing that the punishment inflicted upon the wrongdoers is a direct consequence of their own actions, and not a result of God's injustice, implying that individuals have the power to change their fate by making righteous choices.
orig: فكلا أخذنا بذنبه فمنهم من أرسلنا عليه حاصبا ومنهم من أخذته الصيحة ومنهم من خسفنا به الأرض ومنهم من أغرقنا وما كان الله ليظلمهم ولكن كانوا أنفسهم يظلمون

translation: The likeness of those who take allies other than Allah is like the spider who takes a house, and indeed, the weakest of houses is the spider's house, if they but knew.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of relying on anyone or anything other than God, likening it to the fragile and weak nature of a spider's web, implying that such reliance is bound to fail and collapse.
orig: مثل الذين اتخذوا من دون الله أولياء كمثل العنكبوت اتخذت بيتا وإن أوهن البيوت لبيت العنكبوت لو كانوا يعلمون

translation: Verily, Allah knows what they invoke besides Him, and He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's omniscience and His awareness of the idolatrous practices of those who associate partners with Him, emphasizing His power and wisdom in dealing with such deviations.
orig: إن الله يعلم ما يدعون من دونه من شيء وهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: And these examples We strike for the people, and none will understand them except the learned.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of spiritual insight and wisdom in understanding the deeper meanings and symbolism in the Quran, implying that only those who are knowledgeable and wise can grasp the full significance of the examples and parables presented in the scripture.
orig: وتلك الأمثال نضربها للناس وما يعقلها إلا العالمون

translation: Allah created the heavens and the earth with the truth. Indeed, in that is a sign for the believers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of reflecting on the creation of the universe as a means of increasing one's faith, emphasizing that the intricate design and balance in the heavens and the earth are a testament to God's power and wisdom, serving as a reminder to believers of the existence and majesty of their Creator.
orig: خلق الله السماوات والأرض بالحق إن في ذلك لآية للمؤمنين

translation: Recite what has been revealed to you from the Book and establish prayer. Indeed, prayer prohibits immorality and wrongdoing, and the remembrance of Allah is greater. And Allah knows what you do.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of prayer as a means of preventing individuals from engaging in immoral and unjust behavior, and instead, cultivating a sense of awareness and remembrance of God, which is the greatest and most profound aspect of human existence.
orig: اتل ما أوحي إليك من الكتاب وأقم الصلاة إن الصلاة تنهى عن الفحشاء والمنكر ولذكر الله أكبر والله يعلم ما تصنعون

translation: And do not argue with the People of the Book except in a way that is best, except with those who are unjust among them, and say: 'We believe in what has been revealed to us and what has been revealed to you, and our God and your God is one, and to Him we submit.'
interpretation: The verse advises Muslims to engage in respectful and constructive dialogue with the People of the Book, such as Jews and Christians, and to avoid argumentation, except with those who are unjust and oppressive, emphasizing the commonality of faith and the oneness of God.
orig: ولا تجادلوا أهل الكتاب إلا بالتي هي أحسن إلا الذين ظلموا منهم وقولوا آمنا بالذي أنزل إلينا وأنزل إليكم وإلهنا وإلهكم واحد ونحن له مسلمون

translation: And thus We have sent down to you the Book, those to whom We have given the Book believe in it, and among them are those who believe in it, and none reject Our signs except the disbelievers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of the revelation of the Quran, emphasizing that it is a source of guidance and faith for those who have been given the scripture, and that only those who reject faith altogether will deny its signs and messages.
orig: وكذلك أنزلنا إليك الكتاب فالذين آتيناهم الكتاب يؤمنون به ومن هؤلاء من يؤمن به وما يجحد بآياتنا إلا الكافرون

translation: And you did not recite before it from any book, nor did you write it with your right hand, for then the falsifiers would have doubted.
interpretation: This verse highlights the miraculous nature of the revelation of the Quran, emphasizing that the Prophet Muhammad did not have any prior knowledge or writing skills, which would have been necessary to produce such a book, thus authenticating the divine origin of the Quran.
orig: وما كنت تتلو من قبله من كتاب ولا تخطه بيمينك إذا لارتاب المبطلون

translation: Nay, it is clear signs in the breasts of those who have been given the knowledge, and none denies Our signs except the wrongdoers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that those who have been given knowledge and understanding of the divine message will recognize the clear signs and evidence of God's existence and power, whereas only those who are unjust and rebellious will reject and deny these signs.
orig: بل هو آيات بينات في صدور الذين أوتوا العلم وما يجحد بآياتنا إلا الظالمون

translation: And they say: 'Why are not signs sent down to him from his Lord?' Say: 'The signs are indeed with Allah, and I am only a clear warner.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of faith and trust in God's plan, emphasizing that the Prophet Muhammad was not responsible for producing miraculous signs, but rather his role was to clearly convey God's message and warn people of the consequences of their actions.
orig: وقالوا لولا أنزل عليه آيات من ربه قل إنما الآيات عند الله وإنما أنا نذير مبين

translation: Is it not sufficient for them that We have sent down to you the Book which is recited to them? Indeed, in that is a mercy and a reminder to a people who believe.
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of the revelation of the Quran as a mercy and a reminder to those who believe, implying that it is a blessing and a guidance for the faithful.
orig: أولم يكفهم أنا أنزلنا عليك الكتاب يتلى عليهم إن في ذلك لرحمة وذكرى لقوم يؤمنون

translation: Say, 'Sufficient is Allah between me and you as a Witness. He knows what is in the heavens and the earth. And those who believe in falsehood and disbelieve in Allah - those are the losers.'
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of accountability before God, implying that God's knowledge of all things is sufficient to judge humanity, and that those who reject God's signs and believe in falsehood will ultimately be the losers.
orig: قل كفى بالله بيني وبينكم شهيدا يعلم ما في السماوات والأرض والذين آمنوا بالباطل وكفروا بالله أولئك هم الخاسرون

translation: And they urge you to hasten the punishment, but if not for a specified term, the punishment would have come to them. Rather, it will come to them suddenly while they are unaware.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that those who reject faith and morality are eager to see the punishment, but they are unaware that it is already predetermined and will come to them unexpectedly, catching them off guard.
orig: ويستعجلونك بالعذاب ولولا أجل مسمى لجاءهم العذاب وليأتينهم بغتة وهم لا يشعرون

translation: They ask you to hasten the punishment, and indeed, Hell will be encompassing of the disbelievers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the irony of those who challenge God to bring about the punishment, unaware that they are only hastening their own downfall, and that Hell is already awaiting them, ready to engulf them.
orig: يستعجلونك بالعذاب وإن جهنم لمحيطة بالكافرين

translation: The day He will cover them from above them and from beneath their feet, and it will be said, 'Taste what you used to do.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that on the Day of Judgment, people will be surrounded by their own deeds, and will be forced to confront the consequences of their actions, with no escape or refuge from the punishment that they have brought upon themselves.
orig: يوم يغشاهم العذاب من فوقهم ومن تحت أرجلهم ويقول ذوقوا ما كنتم تعملون

translation: O My servants who have believed, indeed, My earth is spacious, so worship only Me.
interpretation: The verse is an invitation to believers to migrate to a place where they can freely practice their faith, emphasizing that the earth is vast and that they should worship God alone, free from persecution and oppression.
orig: يا عبادي الذين آمنوا إن أرضي واسعة فإياي فاعبدون

translation: Every soul shall taste death, then to Us you shall be returned.
interpretation: The verse highlights the inevitability of death and the ultimate return to God, emphasizing the accountability of human beings to their Creator, and implying that death is not the end, but rather a transition to another realm where one will face judgment for their deeds.
orig: كل نفس ذائقة الموت ثم إلينا ترجعون

translation: And those who believe and do righteous deeds, We will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever; excellent is the reward of the doers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that those who believe and do good deeds will be rewarded with eternal bliss in Paradise, where they will experience a state of perpetual happiness and contentment, free from any sorrow or pain.
orig: والذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات لنبوئنهم من الجنة غرفا تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها نعم أجر العاملين

translation: Those who are patient and put their trust in their Lord.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of patience and trust in God as a key to overcoming life's challenges and achieving spiritual growth, emphasizing that true strength and resilience come from faith and trust in a higher power.
orig: الذين صبروا وعلى ربهم يتوكلون

translation: And how many a creature that does not carry its provision, Allah provides for it and for you. He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's omnipotence and benevolence, emphasizing that even creatures that are unable to provide for themselves are sustained by God's providence, just as He sustains human beings, demonstrating His infinite power and knowledge.
orig: وكأين من دابة لا تحمل رزقها الله يرزقها وإياكم وهو السميع العليم

translation: And if you were to ask them, 'Who created the heavens and the earth and subjected the sun and the moon?' They would surely say, 'Allah.' Then how are they deluded?
interpretation: The verse highlights the inherent contradiction in the mindset of those who acknowledge God's power in creating the universe, yet deviate from the path of righteousness, implying that their deviation is a result of their own ignorance and arrogance.
orig: ولئن سألتهم من خلق السماوات والأرض وسخر الشمس والقمر ليقولن الله فأنى يؤفكون

translation: Allah enlarges the provision for whom He wills of His servants and restricts for him. Indeed, Allah is, of all things, Knowing.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's absolute control over the distribution of resources, implying that true prosperity and wealth come from Him alone, and that He can grant or withhold them as He sees fit, demonstrating His infinite wisdom and knowledge.
orig: الله يبسط الرزق لمن يشاء من عباده ويقدر له إن الله بكل شيء عليم

translation: And if you were to ask them, 'Who sends down water from the sky, giving life thereby to the earth after its death?' They will surely say, 'Allah.' Say, 'Praise to Allah'; but most of them do not understand.
interpretation: The verse highlights the contrast between the people's acknowledgment of God's power in providing life-giving rain and their failure to recognize His role in guiding them morally, implying that they are intellectually and spiritually inconsistent.
orig: ولئن سألتهم من نزل من السماء ماء فأحيا به الأرض من بعد موتها ليقولن الله قل الحمد لله بل أكثرهم لا يعقلون

translation: And this worldly life is not but amusement and play, and indeed, the Hereafter - that is the [true] life, if only they knew.
interpretation: The verse highlights the fleeting nature of worldly life, which is often spent in frivolous pursuits, and contrasts it with the eternal and true life of the Hereafter, implying that if people truly understood the nature of reality, they would prioritize their actions and focus on the eternal life.
orig: وما هذه الحياة الدنيا إلا لهو ولعب وإن الدار الآخرة لهي الحيوان لو كانوا يعلمون

translation: And when they board the ship, they call upon Allah, being sincere to Him in their faith, but when He saves them to the land, behold! they associate (others with Him).
interpretation: The verse highlights the human tendency to turn away from God once they are safe and comfortable, and instead, associate partners with Him, despite having sincerely called upon Him in times of distress.
orig: فإذا ركبوا في الفلك دعوا الله مخلصين له الدين فلما نجاهم إلى البر إذا هم يشركون

translation: Let them deny what We have given them, and let them enjoy, for they will soon know.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who reject the truth and blessings bestowed upon them by God will eventually come to realize their mistake, and will be held accountable for their actions, implying that their temporary enjoyment is short-lived and will ultimately lead to regret and remorse.
orig: ليكفروا بما آتيناهم وليتمتعوا فسوف يعلمون

translation: Have they not seen that We have made a sanctuary secure, while people are being snatched away from all around them? So will they believe in falsehood and reject the favor of Allah?
interpretation: The verse highlights the contrast between the safety and security of the sacred precincts of Makkah, and the turmoil and violence that exists outside, suggesting that those who reject the blessings of God and instead put their trust in false idols will ultimately be led astray.
orig: أولم يروا أنا جعلنا حرما آمنا ويتخطف الناس من حولهم أفبالباطل يؤمنون وبنعمة الله يكفرون

translation: And who is more unjust than he who invents a lie against Allah or rejects the truth when it comes to him? Is not the abode of the disbelievers in Hell?
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of fabricating lies against God or rejecting the truth, emphasizing that such actions are the epitome of injustice and will ultimately lead to eternal punishment in Hell.
orig: ومن أظلم ممن افترى على الله كذبا أو كذب بالحق لما جاءه أليس في جهنم مثوى للكافرين

translation: And those who strive for Us, We will surely guide them to Our ways. And indeed, Allah is with the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of striving and making an effort to follow the path of God, and in return, God will guide those who make such an effort, leading them to the right path and ultimately to salvation.
orig: والذين جاهدوا فينا لنهدينهم سبلنا وإن الله لمع المحسنين

translation: These are the verses of the Wise Book.
interpretation: The verse is an affirmation of the divine origin and wisdom of the Quran, emphasizing its sacred and authoritative nature.
orig: الم

translation: The Romans have been defeated
interpretation: This verse is a reminder that even the strongest and most powerful empires can fall, and that victory and defeat are in the hands of God, emphasizing the transience of worldly power and the eternal nature of God's power.
orig: غلبت الروم

translation: They were oppressed on earth, and they will soon be victorious.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who are oppressed and persecuted will ultimately triumph and gain the upper hand, implying that God's justice will prevail in the end.
orig: في أدنى الأرض وهم من بعد غلبهم سيغلبون

translation: In a few years, to Allah belongs the command before and after, and on that day the believers will rejoice.
interpretation: The verse conveys the idea that Allah's decree and plan will ultimately prevail, and that the believers will rejoice when they see the fulfillment of Allah's promise and the triumph of truth over falsehood.
orig: في بضع سنين لله الأمر من قبل ومن بعد ويومئذ يفرح المؤمنون

translation: With the help of Allah, He helps whom He wills, and He is the Mighty, the Merciful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of divine intervention, where Allah's help is not limited to the deserving, but is bestowed upon those He chooses, emphasizing His absolute power and mercy.
orig: بنصر الله ينصر من يشاء وهو العزيز الرحيم

translation: The promise of Allah, Allah does not break His promise, but most of the people do not know.
interpretation: This verse highlights the reliability and trustworthiness of God's promises, emphasizing that God is faithful to His word, and that human ignorance is the only obstacle to understanding and appreciating this divine attribute.
orig: وعد الله لا يخلف الله وعده ولكن أكثر الناس لا يعلمون

translation: They know an outward appearance of the life of the world, and they are heedless of the Hereafter.
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to focus on the superficial aspects of worldly life, while neglecting their spiritual well-being and their accountability in the Hereafter.
orig: يعلمون ظاهرا من الحياة الدنيا وهم عن الآخرة هم غافلون

translation: Do they not reflect within themselves: God has not created the heavens and the earth and what is between them except with truth and for a specified term, and indeed many of the people are, to the meeting of their Lord, disbelievers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of introspection and self-reflection, encouraging individuals to contemplate the creation of the universe and the purpose behind it, which is to ultimately meet their Lord, and to recognize the truth and reality of their existence.
orig: أولم يتفكروا في أنفسهم ما خلق الله السماوات والأرض وما بينهما إلا بالحق وأجل مسمى وإن كثيرا من الناس بلقاء ربهم لكافرون

translation: Did they not travel through the land and see what was the end of those who were before them? They were stronger than them in power and they ploughed the earth and built on it more than they have built. Their messengers came to them with clear signs, yet it was not Allah who wronged them, but they used to wrong themselves.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of learning from history and the consequences of ignoring the signs of God, emphasizing that those who ignore the signs will ultimately be responsible for their own downfall.
orig: أولم يسيروا في الأرض فينظروا كيف كان عاقبة الذين من قبلهم كانوا أشد منهم قوة وأثاروا الأرض وعمروها أكثر مما عمروها وجاءتهم رسلهم بالبينات فما كان الله ليظلمهم ولكن كانوا أنفسهم يظلمون

translation: Then the end of those who committed evil was that they denied the signs of Allah and they used to mock at them.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate consequence of those who reject God's signs and mock them, which is a downward spiral into greater evil and ultimately, destruction.
orig: ثم كان عاقبة الذين أساءوا السوأى أن كذبوا بآيات الله وكانوا بها يستهزئون

translation: Allah begins the creation, then He repeats it, then to Him you will be returned.
interpretation: This verse highlights the cyclical nature of human existence, emphasizing that just as God creates and recreates, human beings will ultimately return to Him, implying a sense of accountability and responsibility for one's actions.
orig: الله يبدأ الخلق ثم يعيده ثم إليه ترجعون

translation: And the day the Hour is established, the guilty will be in despair.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that on the Day of Judgment, those who have committed crimes and injustices will be overwhelmed with regret and remorse, realizing too late the gravity of their actions, and it will be too late for them to make amends.
orig: ويوم تقوم الساعة يبلس المجرمون

translation: And they will not have from their partners any intercessors, and they will be disbelievers in their partners.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of polytheism, emphasizing that the idols and false deities that people worshipped will not be able to intercede on their behalf on the Day of Judgment, leaving them to face the consequences of their disbelief alone.
orig: ولم يكن لهم من شركائهم شفعاء وكانوا بشركائهم كافرين

translation: And the day the Hour is established, that day they shall be scattered.
interpretation: The verse speaks about the Day of Judgment, when all humanity will be scattered and gathered before God, emphasizing the idea that on that day, all people will be held accountable for their deeds and will be judged accordingly.
orig: ويوم تقوم الساعة يومئذ يتفرقون

translation: And as for those who believed and did good deeds, they are in a garden, rejoicing.
interpretation: The verse highlights the ultimate reward for believers who have lived a righteous life, where they will experience eternal joy and bliss in Paradise, free from the worries and troubles of the worldly life.
orig: فأما الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات فهم في روضة يحبرون

translation: And as for those who disbelieved and denied Our signs and the meeting of the Hereafter, those will be brought forth for the punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of rejecting faith and the hereafter, emphasizing that those who deny the truth will ultimately face punishment, implying that their rejection will not save them from accountability on the Day of Judgment.
orig: وأما الذين كفروا وكذبوا بآياتنا ولقاء الآخرة فأولئك في العذاب محضرون

translation: So exalted be Allah when you reach the evening and when you reach the morning.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of glorifying and praising God at all times, specifically during the transitions from day to night and night to day, emphasizing the constant need for humility and gratitude towards the Creator.
orig: فسبحان الله حين تمسون وحين تصبحون

translation: And to Him belongs all praise in the heavens and the earth, and [also during] the afternoon and when you come forth [for prayer].
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of acknowledging and glorifying God at all times, in all aspects of life, whether in the spiritual realm of the heavens or the physical realm of the earth, and at all hours of the day, including the afternoon and during prayer times, highlighting the constant and all-encompassing nature of God's presence and power.
orig: وله الحمد في السماوات والأرض وعشيا وحين تظهرون

translation: He brings forth the living from the dead and brings forth the dead from the living, and He revives the earth after its death; and thus you will be brought forth.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's power to transform and resurrect, not only in the natural world, but also in the spiritual realm, implying that just as God can bring life to the dead earth, He can also bring spiritual life to humanity.
orig: يخرج الحي من الميت ويخرج الميت من الحي ويحيي الأرض بعد موتها وكذلك تخرجون

translation: And among His signs is that He created you from dust, then behold, you are human beings scattered.
interpretation: The verse highlights the humble origin of human beings, emphasizing that they were created from dust, which symbolizes the fragility and vulnerability of human existence, and that despite this humble beginning, humans have been able to spread and thrive across the earth.
orig: ومن آياته أن خلقكم من تراب ثم إذا أنتم بشر تنتشرون

translation: And of His signs is that He created for you from yourselves mates that you may find tranquility in them, and He placed between you affection and mercy. Indeed, in that are signs for a people who reflect.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of marriage and the bond between spouses, suggesting that the love and compassion between them is a manifestation of God's mercy and a sign of His presence in the world.
orig: ومن آياته أن خلق لكم من أنفسكم أزواجا لتسكنوا إليها وجعل بينكم مودة ورحمة إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يتفكرون

translation: And among His signs are the creation of the heavens and the earth and the diversity of your languages and colors. Indeed, in that are signs for the worlds.
interpretation: This verse highlights the diversity of humanity as a sign of God's power and wisdom, emphasizing that the differences in languages and skin colors are not a source of division, but rather a manifestation of God's creative power and a reminder of the unity of humanity under one Creator.
orig: ومن آياته خلق السماوات والأرض واختلاف ألسنتكم وألوانكم إن في ذلك لآيات للعالمين

translation: And among His signs is your sleep by night and your seeking of His bounty by day, indeed in that are signs for a people who listen.
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of the natural human experiences of sleep and seeking sustenance as signs of God's existence and benevolence, emphasizing the importance of being mindful and grateful for these everyday blessings.
orig: ومن آياته منامكم بالليل والنهار وابتغاؤكم من فضله إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يسمعون

translation: And among His signs is that He shows you the lightning, causing fear and hope, and sends down water from the sky, and with it gives life to the earth after its death. Indeed, in that are signs for a people who understand.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of recognizing and appreciating the signs of God's power and mercy in the natural world, such as the provision of rain that brings life to the earth, and the emotions of fear and hope that come with the lightning, as a way to cultivate a deeper understanding and connection with the divine.
orig: ومن آياته يريكم البرق خوفا وطمعا وينزل من السماء ماء فيحيي به الأرض بعد موتها إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يعقلون

translation: And among His signs is that the heaven and the earth stand firm by His command. Then when He calls you with a single call from the earth, behold, you will come out.
interpretation: This verse highlights the omnipotence of God, emphasizing that even the mighty heaven and earth are sustained by His command, and that He has the power to summon all creation, including humans, back to life with a single call, implying the inevitability of the Day of Resurrection.
orig: ومن آياته أن تقوم السماء والأرض بأمره ثم إذا دعاكم دعوة من الأرض إذا أنتم تخرجون

translation: And to Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and the earth; all are obedient to Him.
interpretation: The verse highlights the absolute authority and dominion of God over all creation, emphasizing that every being in the heavens and the earth is under His control and submits to His will, whether voluntarily or involuntarily.
orig: وله من في السماوات والأرض كل له قانتون

translation: And He it is who originates the creation, then reproduces it, and it is easier for Him. And to Him belongs the loftiest similitude in the heavens and the earth. And He is the Mighty, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's absolute power and wisdom in creating and recreating the universe, emphasizing that it is easier for Him to do so, and that His power and wisdom are unmatched in the heavens and the earth.
orig: وهو الذي يبدأ الخلق ثم يعيده وهو أهون عليه وله المثل الأعلى في السماوات والأرض وهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: He presents to you an example from yourselves: Do you consider them as partners in what We have provided for you, so that you share equally with them? Do you fear them as you fear each other? Thus We explain the verses for a people who understand.
interpretation: This verse highlights the absurdity of associating partners with God, by comparing it to a situation where one would share their own wealth and possessions with their slaves, which is unthinkable, and thus emphasizes the uniqueness and oneness of God.
orig: ضرب لكم مثلا من أنفسكم هل لكم من ما ملكت أيمانكم من شركاء في ما رزقناكم فأنتم فيه سواء تخافونهم كخيفتكم أنفسكم كذلك نفصل الآيات لقوم يعقلون

translation: Nay, they follow those who have gone astray, and Allah has sent them astray; and there will be no helpers for them.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of spiritual blindness, where those who reject the truth are led further astray by their own desires and ignorance, and ultimately, they will have no one to rescue them from the consequences of their actions.
orig: بل اتبع الذين ظلموا أهواءهم بغير علم فمن يهدي من أضل الله وما لهم من ناصرين

translation: So set your face towards the religion, upright, the nature made by Allah upon which He has created mankind. There is no altering the creation of Allah. That is the upright religion, but most people do not know.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of embracing the natural and innate disposition towards the upright religion, which is in harmony with the nature created by Allah, and warns against deviating from this natural path, highlighting the ignorance of those who fail to recognize this fundamental truth.
orig: فأقم وجهك للدين حنيفا فطرت الله التي فطر الناس عليها لا تبديل لخلق الله ذلك الدين القيم ولكن أكثر الناس لا يعلمون

translation: Turn to Him, and fear Him, and establish the prayer, and do not be of the polytheists.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of turning to God and fearing Him as a means of avoiding polytheism, and highlights the establishment of prayer as a key aspect of this devotion, implying that a strong connection with God is necessary to avoid falling into idolatry.
orig: منيبين إليه واتقوه وأقيموا الصلاة ولا تكونوا من المشركين

translation: Among those who have divided their religion and become sects, each party rejoicing in what is with them.
interpretation: The verse highlights the dangers of sectarianism and division within a religious community, where each group becomes so enamored with their own beliefs and practices that they lose sight of the greater truth and unity.
orig: من الذين فرقوا دينهم وكانوا شيعا كل حزب بما لديهم فرحون

translation: And when the people are touched by a harm, they call their Lord, turning to Him. Then, when He gives them a taste of mercy from Him, a party of them associate partners with their Lord.
interpretation: The verse highlights the human tendency to turn to God in times of distress, but to forget Him in times of comfort, and instead associate partners with Him, implying a lack of gratitude and a failure to recognize God's sovereignty.
orig: وإذا مس الناس ضر دعوا ربهم منيبين إليه ثم إذا أذاقهم منه رحمة إذا فريق منهم بربهم يشركون

translation: That they may disbelieve in what We have given them, so let them enjoy, but they will soon know.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who have been given blessings and favors from God will eventually be punished for their ingratitude and disobedience, and that their current enjoyment of these blessings is only temporary.
orig: ليكفروا بما آتيناهم فتمتعوا فسوف تعلمون

translation: Or have We sent down to them an authority, so he speaks of that which they were associating?
interpretation: The verse suggests that the idols and false deities worshipped by the polytheists have no divine authority or power, and that their supposed 'revelations' are mere fabrications and lies.
orig: أم أنزلنا عليهم سلطانا فهو يتكلم بما كانوا به يشركون

translation: And when We let people taste mercy, they rejoice in it, but if evil befalls them for what their hands have sent forth, behold, they despair.
interpretation: The verse highlights the human tendency to be grateful and joyful when they experience blessings and mercy from God, but to become despondent and lose hope when they face difficulties or punishment for their own misdeeds.
orig: وإذا أذقنا الناس رحمة فرحوا بها وإن تصبهم سيئة بما قدمت أيديهم إذا هم يقنطون

translation: Do they not see that Allah enlarges the provision for whom He wills and straitens (it for whom He wills). Verily, in that are signs for a people who believe.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of trust in God's providence, emphasizing that believers should have faith in God's ability to provide for them, regardless of their circumstances, as He is the One who controls and distributes resources according to His wisdom.
orig: أولم يروا أن الله يبسط الرزق لمن يشاء ويقدر إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يؤمنون

translation: So give the relative his right, and the needy, and the wayfarer. That is best for those who desire the Face of Allah, and those are the successful ones.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of fulfilling one's social and moral obligations, such as taking care of relatives, the needy, and travelers, as a means of seeking Allah's pleasure and achieving spiritual success.
orig: فآت ذا القربى حقه والمسكين وابن السبيل ذلك خير للذين يريدون وجه الله وأولئك هم المفلحون

translation: And whatever you give as usury to increase the people's wealth, it will not increase with Allah; but what you give in charity, seeking Allah's Face, then those are the multipliers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the difference between giving to gain worldly benefits and giving to please God, emphasizing that only the latter leads to true spiritual growth and multiplication of rewards.
orig: وما آتيتم من ربا ليربو في أموال الناس فلا يربو عند الله وما آتيتم من زكاة تريدون وجه الله فأولئك هم المضعفون

translation: It is Allah who created you, then provided for you, then will cause you to die, and then will give you life. Is there any of your 'partners' who does that? Glorified and Exalted is He above all that they associate with Him.
interpretation: The verse highlights the uniqueness of Allah's power and authority by emphasizing His role in creating, sustaining, and resurrecting humanity, implying that no other being or idol can claim to have such capabilities, thus emphasizing the absurdity of associating partners with Allah.
orig: الله الذي خلقكم ثم رزقكم ثم يميتكم ثم يحييكم هل من شركائكم من يفعل من ذلكم من شيء سبحانه وتعالى عما يشركون

translation: Corruption has appeared in the land and the sea for what the hands of people have earned, so that He may make them taste some of what they have done, in order that they may return.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of human actions on the environment, suggesting that the corruption and pollution of the land and sea are a direct result of human greed and selfishness, and that this corruption serves as a warning to humanity to change their ways and return to a path of righteousness.
orig: ظهر الفساد في البر والبحر بما كسبت أيدي الناس ليذيقهم بعض الذي عملوا لعلهم يرجعون

translation: Say, [O Muhammad], 'Travel through the land and observe how was the end of those who were before; most of them were polytheists.'
interpretation: The verse is encouraging people to learn from history and observe the consequences of those who rejected God's message and were polytheists, so that they can avoid a similar fate and turn to the straight path.
orig: قل سيروا في الأرض فانظروا كيف كان عاقبة الذين من قبل كان أكثرهم مشركين

translation: So set your face towards the straight religion, before there comes a day that cannot be put off from Allah; on that day they shall be separated.
interpretation: The verse is urging believers to remain steadfast in their faith and to stay committed to the straight path, free from any deviation or corruption, in order to avoid being separated from God's mercy on the Day of Judgment.
orig: فأقم وجهك للدين القيم من قبل أن يأتي يوم لا مرد له من الله يومئذ يصدعون

translation: Whoever disbelieves, his disbelief will be against himself; and whoever does righteousness, they prepare it for their own souls.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of personal responsibility, emphasizing that an individual's actions, whether good or bad, ultimately affect only themselves, and that no one else can bear the consequences of their choices.
orig: من كفر فعليه كفره ومن عمل صالحا فلأنفسهم يمهدون

translation: That He may reward those who believe and do righteous deeds out of His Bounty. Verily, He loves not the disbelievers.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's favor towards believers who perform good deeds, implying that their good actions are a means of gaining His pleasure and reward, whereas those who reject faith will not receive His love or approval.
orig: ليجزي الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات من فضله إنه لا يحب الكافرين

translation: And among His signs is that He sends the winds as bearers of good tidings, and that He may give you a taste of His mercy, and that the ships may sail at His command, and that you may seek of His bounty, and that you may be grateful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of recognizing and appreciating the blessings and favors of God, which are often overlooked in daily life, and emphasizes the need for gratitude towards God for the numerous benefits and provisions that He provides.
orig: ومن آياته أن يرسل الرياح مبشرات وليذيقكم من رحمته ولتجري الفلك بأمره ولتبتغوا من فضله ولعلكم تشكرون

translation: And indeed, We sent before you messengers to their people, and they came to them with clear signs, then We took revenge on those who committed crimes, and it was an obligation upon Us to aid the believers.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's consistent pattern of sending prophets to guide humanity, and His commitment to punishing the wicked and supporting the faithful, emphasizing the inevitability of divine justice and retribution.
orig: ولقد أرسلنا من قبلك رسلا إلى قومهم فجاءوهم بالبينات فانتقمنا من الذين أجرموا وكان حقا علينا نصر المؤمنين

translation: It is Allah who sends the winds, and they raise a cloud, then He spreads it in the sky as He wills, and makes it a mass of fragments, and you see the rain coming out from within it. And when He causes it to fall on whom He wills of His servants, then they rejoice.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's power and control over the natural world, demonstrating His ability to bring life-giving rain to those who need it, and in doing so, brings joy and gratitude to His servants.
orig: الله الذي يرسل الرياح فتثير سحابا فيبسطه في السماء كيف يشاء ويجعله كسفا فترى الودق يخرج من خلاله فإذا أصاب به من يشاء من عباده إذا هم يستبشرون

translation: And even if they had been before that Our punishment had been sent down upon them, they would have said:
interpretation: This verse highlights the inherent nature of humans to make excuses and blame external circumstances for their own failures, rather than taking responsibility for their actions and acknowledging their mistakes.
orig: وإن كانوا من قبل أن ينزل عليهم من قبله لمبلسين

translation: Then look at the signs of Allah's mercy, how He gives life to the earth after its death. Indeed, that is the one who gives life to the dead, and He is capable of everything.
interpretation: The verse is urging the believers to reflect on the signs of God's mercy and power in reviving the earth, which is a metaphor for spiritual revival, and to recognize that the same power that brings life to the earth can also bring spiritual life to humanity, emphasizing God's omnipotence.
orig: فانظر إلى آثار رحمت الله كيف يحيي الأرض بعد موتها إن ذلك لمحيي الموتى وهو على كل شيء قدير

translation: And if We had sent a wind and they had seen it turn yellow, they would have remained thereafter in disbelief.
interpretation: The verse highlights the stubbornness of those who reject faith, suggesting that even if they were to witness a miraculous event, such as a wind that turns everything yellow, they would still refuse to believe and instead cling to their disbelief.
orig: ولئن أرسلنا ريحا فرأوه مصفرا لظلوا من بعده يكفرون

translation: Then indeed, you will not make the dead hear, nor will you make the deaf hear the call when they turn their backs, retreating.
interpretation: The verse highlights the limitations of human ability to guide or reform others, emphasizing that even the Prophet himself cannot make those who are spiritually dead or stubbornly resistant to the truth listen or respond to the call of faith.
orig: فإنك لا تسمع الموتى ولا تسمع الصم الدعاء إذا ولوا مدبرين

translation: And you are not a guide for the blind out of their error. You will not guide except him who believes in Our verses, and they are the Muslims.
interpretation: This verse highlights the limitation of the Prophet's role in guiding people, emphasizing that only those who are willing to believe in God's signs and verses will be guided, and they are the true Muslims.
orig: وما أنت بهاد العمي عن ضلالتهم إن تسمع إلا من يؤمن بآياتنا فهم مسلمون

translation: It is Allah who created you in a state of weakness, then gave you strength after weakness, then gave you weakness and old age after strength; He creates what He wills, and He is the All-Knowing, the All-Powerful.
