interpretation: The verse highlights God's absolute power and control over human life, emphasizing that our strength and weakness are both from Him, and that our lives are subject to His will, reminding us of our dependence on Him and the transience of human life.
orig: الله الذي خلقكم من ضعف ثم جعل من بعد ضعف قوة ثم جعل من بعد قوة ضعفا وشيبة يخلق ما يشاء وهو العليم القدير

translation: And the day the Hour is established, the criminals will swear they did not remain but for an hour, thus they were deluded.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of time distortion in the afterlife, where the criminals will be shocked to discover that their worldly pursuits, which seemed to last for a long time, were in reality very brief, and that their delusions about time and reality will ultimately lead to their downfall.
orig: ويوم تقوم الساعة يقسم المجرمون ما لبثوا غير ساعة كذلك كانوا يؤفكون

translation: And those who were given knowledge and faith will say: 'Indeed, you have stayed in Allah's book until the Day of Resurrection, so this is the Day of Resurrection, but you were not aware.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of spiritual awareness and recognition of the Day of Judgment, emphasizing that those who possess knowledge and faith will be able to recognize the Day of Resurrection when it arrives, while others will be caught off guard.
orig: وقال الذين أوتوا العلم والإيمان لقد لبثتم في كتاب الله إلى يوم البعث فهذا يوم البعث ولكنكم كنتم لا تعلمون

translation: Then no excuse will benefit those who were unjust, nor will they be allowed to make amends.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of accountability, emphasizing that on the Day of Judgment, those who were unjust will not be able to talk their way out of their wrongdoing, and neither will they be given a second chance to make things right.
orig: فيومئذ لا ينفع الذين ظلموا معذرتهم ولا هم يستعتبون

translation: And indeed, We have presented for the people in this Quran from every kind of example, and if We had brought them an ayah, those who disbelieve would say, 'You are only falsifiers.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the futility of trying to convince those who have already rejected the truth, as they will always find a way to deny and falsify the signs and evidence presented to them.
orig: ولقد ضربنا للناس في هذا القرآن من كل مثل ولئن جئتهم بآية ليقولن الذين كفروا إن أنتم إلا مبطلون

translation: Thus Allah seals the hearts of those who do not know.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who are ignorant of the truth and refuse to acknowledge it will have their hearts sealed by God, implying that they will be spiritually blinded and unable to comprehend the truth, and thus will be further led astray.
orig: كذلك يطبع الله على قلوب الذين لا يعلمون

translation: So be patient, indeed the promise of Allah is truth, and let not those who have no certainty make you impatient
interpretation: The verse is encouraging the believers to remain steadfast in their faith and not to be swayed by the doubts and criticisms of those who lack conviction, emphasizing that God's promise is true and will ultimately prevail.
orig: فاصبر إن وعد الله حق ولا يستخفنك الذين لا يوقنون

translation: These are the verses of the clear Book.
interpretation: The verse is an affirmation of the divine origin and clarity of the Quran, emphasizing its role as a guide for humanity.
orig: الم

translation: Those are the verses of the Wise Book.
interpretation: The verse is emphasizing the wisdom and divine origin of the Quran, implying that the verses are a manifestation of God's infinite wisdom and a guide for humanity.
orig: تلك آيات الكتاب الحكيم

translation: Guidance and mercy for the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that those who do good deeds will receive guidance and mercy from God, implying that their good actions will be rewarded with spiritual guidance and divine compassion.
orig: هدى ورحمة للمحسنين

translation: Those who establish the prayer, and pay the alms, and they are certain of the Hereafter.
interpretation: The verse highlights the characteristics of true believers, who not only observe the fundamental practices of Islam, such as prayer and charity, but also have unwavering faith in the Hereafter, demonstrating their commitment to a higher moral and spiritual standard.
orig: الذين يقيمون الصلاة ويؤتون الزكاة وهم بالآخرة هم يوقنون

translation: Those are upon guidance from their Lord, and those are the successful ones.
interpretation: The verse implies that the guidance from God is the key factor that leads to success and prosperity in this life and the hereafter, and those who follow it will ultimately achieve true success.
orig: أولئك على هدى من ربهم وأولئك هم المفلحون

translation: And among people is he who buys the idle talk to lead astray from the path of Allah without knowledge, and takes it in ridicule. Those - for them is a humiliating punishment.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of mocking and ridiculing the truth, and instead, indulging in frivolous and misleading talk, which leads people astray from the path of God, emphasizing that such individuals will ultimately face a humiliating punishment.
orig: ومن الناس من يشتري لهو الحديث ليضل عن سبيل الله بغير علم ويتخذها هزوا أولئك لهم عذاب مهين

translation: And when Our verses are recited to him, he turns away in pride, as if he had not heard them, as if there was a deafness in his ears. So give him tidings of a painful punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and stubbornness of those who reject the divine message, and how they will ultimately face a severe punishment for their refusal to listen and heed the warning.
orig: وإذا تتلى عليه آياتنا ولى مستكبرا كأن لم يسمعها كأن في أذنيه وقرا فبشره بعذاب أليم

translation: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds will have the Gardens of Delight.
interpretation: The verse implies that faith and good deeds are interconnected and that true believers are those who not only have faith but also manifest it through their actions, and as a result, they will be rewarded with eternal bliss in the Hereafter.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات لهم جنات النعيم

translation: They will abide therein, and the promise of Allah is true, and He is Exalted in Power, Wise.
interpretation: The verse highlights the eternal nature of paradise, where believers will reside forever, and emphasizes God's promise as a guarantee of this eternal bliss, which is a manifestation of God's power and wisdom.
orig: خالدين فيها وعد الله حقا وهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: He created the heavens without any pillars that you see and cast into the earth firmly set mountains lest it should shake with you, and He dispersed therein from every kind of crawling creature, and We sent down from the heaven water, then We brought forth with it every kind of noble pair.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's omnipotence and creative power, emphasizing that He created the universe and all its wonders without any external support, and that His creation is a testament to His greatness and wisdom.
orig: خلق السماوات بغير عمد ترونها وألقى في الأرض رواسي أن تميد بكم وبث فيها من كل دابة وأنزلنا من السماء ماء فأنبتنا فيها من كل زوج كريم

translation: This is the creation of Allah, so show me what those besides Him have created. Nay, the wrongdoers are in manifest error.
interpretation: The verse highlights the uniqueness and exclusivity of Allah's creative power, implying that no one else can create or rival His creation, and that those who reject this truth are in a state of clear and obvious error.
orig: هذا خلق الله فأروني ماذا خلق الذين من دونه بل الظالمون في ضلال مبين

translation: And indeed We had given Luqman the wisdom: 'Be grateful to Allah.' And whoever is grateful, he is only grateful for the benefit of his own self, and whoever is ungrateful, then indeed Allah is Free of need, Worthy of all praise.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of gratitude, emphasizing that being thankful to God ultimately benefits the individual themselves, while ingratitude has no impact on God's majesty and perfection.
orig: ولقد آتينا لقمان الحكمة أن اشكر لله ومن يشكر فإنما يشكر لنفسه ومن كفر فإن الله غني حميد

translation: And when Luqman said to his son, while advising him, 'O my son, do not associate anything with Allah. Indeed, associating partners with Allah is a great injustice.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of sincerity and purity of faith, emphasizing that associating partners with God is a grave injustice, not only to God but also to oneself, as it undermines one's own dignity and autonomy.
orig: وإذ قال لقمان لابنه وهو يعظه يا بني لا تشرك بالله إن الشرك لظلم عظيم

translation: And We have enjoined on man to be good to his parents, his mother bears him in weakness and hardship, and his weaning takes two years, be grateful to Me and to your parents, unto Me is the final return.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of gratitude and respect towards one's parents, emphasizing the sacrifices they make for their children, particularly the mother who bears the child in weakness and hardship, and the lengthy process of weaning, thus reminding the individual of their obligation to show appreciation and kindness towards them.
orig: ووصينا الإنسان بوالديه حملته أمه وهنا على وهن وفصاله في عامين أن اشكر لي ولوالديك إلي المصير

translation: And if they both strive to make you associate with Me that of which you have no knowledge, then do not obey them, but accompany them in this world with kindness and follow the path of him who turns to Me, then to Me is your return, and I will inform you about what you used to do.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of not compromising one's faith and values, even when faced with pressure from loved ones, and instead, following the path of righteousness and obedience to God.
orig: وإن جاهداك على أن تشرك بي ما ليس لك به علم فلا تطعهما وصاحبهما في الدنيا معروفا واتبع سبيل من أناب إلي ثم إلي مرجعكم فأنبئكم بما كنتم تعملون

translation: O son, indeed if it be the weight of a mustard seed, and though it be in a rock, or in the heavens, or in the earth, Allah will bring it forth. Indeed, Allah is Subtle, Acquainted.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's omnipotence and omniscience, emphasizing that even the smallest and seemingly insignificant acts will be accounted for, and that nothing can escape God's knowledge and justice.
orig: يا بني إنها إن تك مثقال حبة من خردل فتكن في صخرة أو في السماوات أو في الأرض يأت بها الله إن الله لطيف خبير

translation: O my son, establish prayer, and enjoin what is right, and forbid what is wrong, and be patient over what befalls you. Indeed, [all] that is of the matters [requiring] determination.
interpretation: The verse is urging the believers to cultivate a strong sense of moral character, by not only performing their religious duties, but also actively promoting good and preventing evil, and to develop the quality of patience in the face of adversity, which is a hallmark of a true believer.
orig: يا بني أقم الصلاة وأمر بالمعروف وانه عن المنكر واصبر على ما أصابك إن ذلك من عزم الأمور

translation: And do not turn your cheek to people, nor walk in the earth exultantly; indeed, Allah does not like everyone self-deluded and boastful.
interpretation: The verse is warning against arrogance and pride, emphasizing that one should not show off to others or walk with an air of superiority, as this is disliked by God, who sees through the pretenses of those who are self-deluded and boastful.
orig: ولا تصعر خدك للناس ولا تمش في الأرض مرحا إن الله لا يحب كل مختال فخور

translation: And be moderate in your pace, and lower your voice; indeed, the most unpleasant of sounds is the voice of donkeys.
interpretation: The verse is emphasizing the importance of humility and modesty, warning against arrogance and loudness, as it can be compared to the unpleasant sound of donkeys, implying that one should speak softly and moderately to be heard and understood.
orig: واقصد في مشيك واغضض من صوتك إن أنكر الأصوات لصوت الحمير

translation: Do you not see that Allah has subjected to your use all that is in the heavens and on earth, and has showered His blessings upon you, both visible and unseen? And yet, among men there are those who dispute about Allah without knowledge, without guidance, and without an illuminating Book.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ingratitude and ignorance of those who reject God's signs and blessings, despite being surrounded by His favors, and instead rely on their own limited understanding to dispute His existence and power.
orig: ألم تروا أن الله سخر لكم ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وأسبغ عليكم نعمه ظاهرة وباطنة ومن الناس من يجادل في الله بغير علم ولا هدى ولا كتاب منير

translation: And when it is said to them: 'Follow what Allah has sent down', they say: 'Nay, we shall follow what we found our fathers following.' Even though it is Satan who invites them to the punishment of the Blazing Fire.
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to blindly follow their ancestors' traditions and customs, even if they are misguided, rather than following the divine guidance, and how this blind following can lead them to reject the truth and ultimately to hellfire.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم اتبعوا ما أنزل الله قالوا بل نتبع ما وجدنا عليه آباءنا أولو كان الشيطان يدعوهم إلى عذاب السعير

translation: And whoever submits his face to Allah while being a doer of good has grasped the most trustworthy handhold. And to Allah is the outcome of all matters.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of submitting oneself to God's will, emphasizing that those who do so while doing good deeds will have a firm grasp on the most reliable and unshakeable support, which is their faith in God, and ultimately, it is God who determines the outcome of all affairs.
orig: ومن يسلم وجهه إلى الله وهو محسن فقد استمسك بالعروة الوثقى وإلى الله عاقبة الأمور

translation: And whoever disbelieves, let not his disbelief grieve you. Their return is to Us, then We will inform them of what they did. Indeed, Allah is All-Knower of what is in the breasts.
interpretation: The verse is a message of comfort to the Prophet and believers, telling them not to be saddened by the disbelief of others, as God is fully aware of their inner intentions and will ultimately hold them accountable for their actions.
orig: ومن كفر فلا يحزنك كفره إلينا مرجعهم فننبئهم بما عملوا إن الله عليم بذات الصدور

translation: We let them enjoy themselves for a little, then We shall oblige them to a severe torment.
interpretation: The verse suggests that God allows people to enjoy their worldly pleasures for a short time, but ultimately holds them accountable for their actions, and punishes them severely if they have been disobedient or unjust.
orig: نمتعهم قليلا ثم نضطرهم إلى عذاب غليظ

translation: And if you ask them, 'Who created the heavens and the earth?' They will surely say, 'Allah.' Say, 'Praise be to Allah.' But most of them do not know.
interpretation: This verse highlights the irony that despite acknowledging Allah as the Creator, most people do not truly understand or appreciate the significance of this fact, and therefore do not live their lives in accordance with Allah's will.
orig: ولئن سألتهم من خلق السماوات والأرض ليقولن الله قل الحمد لله بل أكثرهم لا يعلمون

translation: To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth; indeed, Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes God's absolute ownership and dominion over all things, implying that humanity's existence and possessions are merely a trust from God, and that true freedom and independence can only be achieved by recognizing and submitting to God's sovereignty.
orig: لله ما في السماوات والأرض إن الله هو الغني الحميد

translation: And if there were as many trees on earth as pens, and the sea, extending with seven more seas, the words of Allah would not come to an end. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights the infinite nature of God's wisdom and power, suggesting that even if all the trees on earth were pens and all the seas were ink, they would still be insufficient to record the vastness of God's knowledge and wisdom, emphasizing God's limitless power and wisdom.
orig: ولو أنما في الأرض من شجرة أقلام والبحر يمده من بعده سبعة أبحر ما نفدت كلمات الله إن الله عزيز حكيم

translation: He has created you and resurrected you, not but as a single soul. Indeed, Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.
interpretation: The verse highlights the unity and oneness of humanity, emphasizing that all humans originate from a single soul, and are therefore equal in the eyes of God, and that God is aware of every individual's actions and intentions.
orig: ما خلقكم ولا بعثكم إلا كنفس واحدة إن الله سميع بصير

translation: Do you not see that Allah merges the night into the day and merges the day into the night, and has subjected the sun and the moon, each running its course for a term appointed, and that Allah is All-Aware of what you do?
interpretation: This verse highlights the omnipotence and omniscience of Allah, emphasizing His control over the natural world and His awareness of human actions, implying that He will hold humans accountable for their deeds.
orig: ألم تر أن الله يولج الليل في النهار ويولج النهار في الليل وسخر الشمس والقمر كل يجري إلى أجل مسمى وأن الله بما تعملون خبير

translation: That is because Allah, He is the Truth, and what they invoke besides Him is falsehood, and Allah, He is the High, the Great.
interpretation: The verse highlights the absolute supremacy of Allah, emphasizing that He is the ultimate reality and truth, while all other objects of worship are false and inferior, and that Allah's greatness and power are unmatched.
orig: ذلك بأن الله هو الحق وأن ما يدعون من دونه الباطل وأن الله هو العلي الكبير

translation: Have you not seen that the ships sail in the sea by the favor of Allah, that He may show you some of His signs? Indeed, in that are signs for every patient, grateful person.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of recognizing and appreciating the blessings and favors of God, as exemplified by the ships sailing smoothly in the sea, and encourages believers to be patient and grateful in the face of life's challenges.
orig: ألم تر أن الفلك تجري في البحر بنعمت الله ليريكم من آياته إن في ذلك لآيات لكل صبار شكور

translation: And when a wave like a canopy covers them, they call upon Allah, sincere to Him in their faith. But when He saves them to the land, there emerges from them one who is moderate, and as for him who rejects Our signs, then he is arrogant and ungrateful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the human tendency to turn to God in times of distress, but often forgetting Him once the crisis has passed, and instead becoming arrogant and ungrateful for the blessings received.
orig: وإذا غشيهم موج كالظلل دعوا الله مخلصين له الدين فلما نجاهم إلى البر فمنهم مقتصد وما يجحد بآياتنا إلا كل ختار كفور

translation: O mankind, fear your Lord and fear a Day when no father will avail his son, nor will a son avail his father at all. Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth, so let not the life of this world deceive you, and let not the Deceiver deceive you about Allah.
interpretation: The verse is a call to humanity to be mindful of their actions and to fear the Day of Judgment, where no one will be able to help another, not even family members, emphasizing the importance of individual accountability and responsibility.
orig: يا أيها الناس اتقوا ربكم واخشوا يوما لا يجزي والد عن ولده ولا مولود هو جاز عن والده شيئا إن وعد الله حق فلا تغرنكم الحياة الدنيا ولا يغرنكم بالله الغرور

translation: Indeed, Allah has [knowledge of] the Hour and sends down the rain and knows what is in the wombs. And no soul knows what it will earn tomorrow, and no soul knows in what land it will die. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Acquainted.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's omniscience and His complete awareness of all things, including the timing of the Hour, the secrets of the womb, and the unknown futures of individuals, emphasizing that only God has complete knowledge of the unseen, and humans are limited in their understanding.
orig: إن الله عنده علم الساعة وينزل الغيث ويعلم ما في الأرحام وما تدري نفس ماذا تكسب غدا وما تدري نفس بأي أرض تموت إن الله عليم خبير

translation: These are the verses of the Wise Book.
interpretation: This verse is an affirmation of the divine origin and wisdom of the Quran, emphasizing its sacred and authoritative nature.
orig: الم

translation: The revelation of the Book, wherein there is no doubt, from the Lord of the Worlds.
interpretation: This verse asserts the divine origin of the Quran, emphasizing that it is a revelation from the Creator of the universe, and that its authenticity and authority are beyond doubt, serving as a source of guidance and wisdom for all humanity.
orig: تنزيل الكتاب لا ريب فيه من رب العالمين

translation: Or do they say, 'He has invented it'? Rather, it is the truth from your Lord, that you may warn a people to whom no warner has come before you, so that they may be guided.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of the Prophet Muhammad's role as a warner, bringing guidance to people who had not received any divine message before, emphasizing the authenticity and truthfulness of the revelation he received from God.
orig: أم يقولون افتراه بل هو الحق من ربك لتنذر قوما ما أتاهم من نذير من قبلك لعلهم يهتدون

translation: Allah is the One who created the heavens and the earth and what is between them in six days, then He established Himself on the Throne. You have none besides Him as a Guardian or an Intercessor. Will you not be reminded?
interpretation: The verse highlights God's absolute authority and power, emphasizing that He is the sole Creator and Ruler of the universe, and that humans are completely dependent on Him, with no one else to turn to for protection or intercession.
orig: الله الذي خلق السماوات والأرض وما بينهما في ستة أيام ثم استوى على العرش ما لكم من دونه من ولي ولا شفيع أفلا تتذكرون

translation: He directs the affair from the heaven to the earth, then it will ascend to Him in a day, the measure of which is a thousand years of what you count.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's absolute control and dominion over the universe, where He effortlessly manages the affairs of the world, and ultimately, all things will return to Him, emphasizing His power and sovereignty.
orig: يدبر الأمر من السماء إلى الأرض ثم يعرج إليه في يوم كان مقداره ألف سنة مما تعدون

translation: That is the Knower of the unseen and the seen, the Exalted in Power, the Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's omniscience, emphasizing that He is aware of all things, both visible and invisible, and that His power and mercy are beyond human comprehension.
orig: ذلك عالم الغيب والشهادة العزيز الرحيم

translation: Who perfected everything He created, and began the creation of man from clay.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's infinite wisdom and power in creating the universe, emphasizing that He created humans from a humble beginning, implying that humans should remain humble and grateful to their Creator.
orig: الذي أحسن كل شيء خلقه وبدأ خلق الإنسان من طين

translation: Then We made his offspring from a extract of despised water.
interpretation: This verse highlights the humble and weak origin of human beings, emphasizing that despite this humble beginning, humans have the potential to become great and noble, but only if they recognize and acknowledge their Creator.
orig: ثم جعل نسله من سلالة من ماء مهين

translation: Then He fashioned him and blew into him of His Spirit and made for you hearing and sight and hearts, little is it that you give thanks.
interpretation: The verse highlights humanity's ingratitude towards God's blessings, implying that despite being endowed with the faculties of hearing, sight, and intellect, humans often fail to acknowledge and appreciate these gifts from God.
orig: ثم سواه ونفخ فيه من روحه وجعل لكم السمع والأبصار والأفئدة قليلا ما تشكرون

translation: And they say: 'What! When we are dust in the earth, shall we indeed be in a new creation?' Nay, they are disbelievers in the meeting with their Lord.
interpretation: The verse highlights the stubborn refusal of disbelievers to accept the reality of the afterlife, and their arrogance in thinking that they can escape accountability to God, demonstrating a profound lack of understanding of the nature of God's power and their own mortality.
orig: وقالوا أإذا ضللنا في الأرض أإنا لفي خلق جديد بل هم بلقاء ربهم كافرون

translation: Say: The Angel of Death, who is entrusted with you, will take your lives, then to your Lord you will be returned.
interpretation: The verse highlights the inevitability of death and the return to God, emphasizing that every individual will be held accountable for their actions in the hereafter, and that death is not an end, but rather a transition to the ultimate judgment.
orig: قل يتوفاكم ملك الموت الذي وكل بكم ثم إلى ربكم ترجعون

translation: And if you see the criminals, their heads bowed before their Lord, (saying) 'Our Lord, we have seen and heard, so send us back that we may do righteous deeds, indeed we are certain.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the regret and remorse of the sinful individuals in the afterlife, who will acknowledge their mistakes and express their desire to return to the worldly life to make amends, but it will be too late, and their pleas will be in vain.
orig: ولو ترى إذ المجرمون ناكسو رءوسهم عند ربهم ربنا أبصرنا وسمعنا فارجعنا نعمل صالحا إنا موقنون

translation: And if We had willed, We would have guided every soul, but the Word from Me has gone forth: 'I will surely fill Hell with jinn and men, all together.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of divine justice, where God's decision to guide or misguide is not based on human merit, but rather on His own wisdom and justice, and that those who are misguided will ultimately face the consequences in Hell.
orig: ولو شئنا لآتينا كل نفس هداها ولكن حق القول مني لأملأن جهنم من الجنة والناس أجمعين

translation: Taste now, for you forgot the meeting of this your day. We have forgotten you. Taste the eternal punishment for what you used to do.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of accountability, where individuals are made to face the consequences of their actions on the Day of Judgment, and are forced to confront the reality of their own forgetfulness of their accountability to God.
orig: فذوقوا بما نسيتم لقاء يومكم هذا إنا نسيناكم وذوقوا عذاب الخلد بما كنتم تعملون

translation: Only those believe in Our signs who, when they are reminded of them, fall down in prostration and glorify the praise of their Lord, and they are not proud.
interpretation: The verse highlights the humble and submissive nature of true believers, who are moved to prostration and praise when reminded of God's signs, and are characterized by their lack of arrogance and pride.
orig: إنما يؤمن بآياتنا الذين إذا ذكروا بها خروا سجدا وسبحوا بحمد ربهم وهم لا يستكبرون

translation: Their sides forsake their beds, they call their Lord in fear and aspiration, and from what We have provided them, they spend.
interpretation: The verse highlights the true believers who are willing to sacrifice their comfort and worldly desires in order to seek a closer connection with God, demonstrating their fear of God's punishment and their hope for His reward, and who also use their wealth and resources for the sake of God, thereby demonstrating their true devotion to Him.
orig: تتجافى جنوبهم عن المضاجع يدعون ربهم خوفا وطمعا ومما رزقناهم ينفقون

translation: So let man not think that he will be left neglected, for what he has sent ahead of good deeds will be seen, a reward for what they used to do.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the idea that our good deeds are not wasted, but are being recorded and will be rewarded, and that we should not think that our efforts will go unnoticed or unrewarded.
orig: فلا تعلم نفس ما أخفي لهم من قرة أعين جزاء بما كانوا يعملون

translation: Is, then, one who was a believer like one who was a transgressor? They are not equal.
interpretation: The verse highlights the fundamental difference between a believer and a transgressor, emphasizing that they cannot be considered equal, as one has chosen the path of righteousness and the other has chosen the path of disobedience.
orig: أفمن كان مؤمنا كمن كان فاسقا لا يستوون

translation: But those who believe and do righteous deeds, for them are Gardens of Refuge, as hospitality, for what they used to do.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who have faith and perform good deeds will be rewarded with eternal bliss in Paradise, where they will be treated as honored guests, and their good deeds will be the reason for their admission to this eternal abode of peace and happiness.
orig: أما الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات فلهم جنات المأوى نزلا بما كانوا يعملون

translation: And as for those who defiantly disobeyed, their refuge is the Fire. Every time they try to escape from it, they will be returned to it, and it will be said to them: 'Taste the torment of the Fire, which you used to deny.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that those who deliberately choose to disbelieve and disobey God's commandments will ultimately be trapped in their own misdeeds, unable to escape the consequences of their actions, and will be forced to confront the reality of their own denial.
orig: وأما الذين فسقوا فمأواهم النار كلما أرادوا أن يخرجوا منها أعيدوا فيها وقيل لهم ذوقوا عذاب النار الذي كنتم به تكذبون

translation: And We will surely let them taste the nearer punishment before the greater punishment, so that they might return.
interpretation: The verse suggests that God's punishment is a gradual process, where the smaller punishment serves as a warning and an opportunity for people to repent and change their ways, before the more severe punishment is inflicted, emphasizing God's mercy and willingness to give people a chance to reform.
orig: ولنذيقنهم من العذاب الأدنى دون العذاب الأكبر لعلهم يرجعون

translation: And who is more unjust than he who is reminded of the Signs of his Lord, then turns aside from them? Indeed, We shall take revenge from the criminals.
interpretation: The verse highlights the extreme injustice of those who are reminded of God's signs and revelations, yet deliberately turn away from them, implying a deep-seated rejection of the truth, and thus deserving of divine retribution.
orig: ومن أظلم ممن ذكر بآيات ربه ثم أعرض عنها إنا من المجرمين منتقمون

translation: And indeed We gave Moses the Book, so do not be in doubt about meeting Him, and We made it a guide for the Children of Israel.
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of the Book given to Moses, which serves as a guide for the Children of Israel, and its revelation is a testament to the certainty of God's promise, dispelling any doubts about the meeting with God.
orig: ولقد آتينا موسى الكتاب فلا تكن في مرية من لقائه وجعلناه هدى لبني إسرائيل

translation: And We made from them leaders guiding by Our command when they were patient and when they were certain of Our signs.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of patience and certainty in faith, as it is only when one has achieved these qualities that they can become leaders and guides for others, and are able to fulfill God's command.
orig: وجعلنا منهم أئمة يهدون بأمرنا لما صبروا وكانوا بآياتنا يوقنون

translation: Indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.
interpretation: The verse highlights the ultimate authority of God in settling disputes and disagreements among people, emphasizing that on the Day of Judgment, God will be the final arbiter of truth and justice, resolving all differences and disputes that people had in this world.
orig: إن ربك هو يفصل بينهم يوم القيامة فيما كانوا فيه يختلفون

translation: Does it not guide them, how many a generation We have destroyed before them, in whose dwellings they walk? Indeed, in that are signs; do they not hear?
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of learning from the mistakes of the past, as many civilizations before us have been destroyed due to their disobedience and ignorance, leaving behind only remnants and signs of their existence, which serve as a warning to those who come after them.
orig: أولم يهد لهم كم أهلكنا من قبلهم من القرون يمشون في مساكنهم إن في ذلك لآيات أفلا يسمعون

translation: Do they not see that We drive rainwater to the barren land and produce with it crops that their cattle and they themselves eat? Do they not see?
interpretation: The verse highlights the miracle of agriculture and the provision of food as a manifestation of God's power and mercy, inviting humans to reflect on the natural world and recognize the blessings they receive from God.
orig: أولم يروا أنا نسوق الماء إلى الأرض الجرز فنخرج به زرعا تأكل منه أنعامهم وأنفسهم أفلا يبصرون

translation: And they say: 'When will this victory come, if you are truthful?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the skepticism and mockery of those who doubt the Prophet's promise of victory, implying that they are testing his credibility and challenging him to prove his claims.
orig: ويقولون متى هذا الفتح إن كنتم صادقين

translation: The day of victory, their faith will not benefit those who disbelieved, nor will they be given a respite.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of a point of no return, where one's past actions and choices have led to a state of irreversible consequences, and no amount of faith or repentance can change the outcome.
orig: قل يوم الفتح لا ينفع الذين كفروا إيمانهم ولا هم ينظرون

translation: So turn away from them and wait; indeed, they are waiting.
interpretation: The verse is advising the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to turn away from the disbelievers who were rejecting his message, and to wait patiently, as they too are waiting for an opportunity to pounce on him, implying that the Prophet should not be provoked into reacting hastily, but rather maintain his dignity and composure in the face of opposition.
orig: فأعرض عنهم وانتظر إنهم منتظرون

translation: O Prophet, fear Allah and do not obey the disbelievers and the hypocrites. Indeed, Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: The verse is a reminder to the Prophet Muhammad, and by extension to all believers, to remain steadfast in their faith and not to be swayed by the opinions or actions of those who reject God's message, emphasizing the importance of trusting in God's infinite wisdom and knowledge.
orig: يا أيها النبي اتق الله ولا تطع الكافرين والمنافقين إن الله كان عليما حكيما

translation: And follow what is revealed to you from your Lord. Indeed, Allah is Ever-Acquainted with what you do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obedience to God's commands and following the guidance revealed through the Prophet, as God is fully aware of all human actions and will hold individuals accountable for their deeds.
orig: واتبع ما يوحى إليك من ربك إن الله كان بما تعملون خبيرا

translation: And put your trust in Allah, if you are believers indeed. Allah is enough as a Wakil (trustee).
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of having complete trust in God, implying that those who truly believe in Him should have faith in His plan and rely solely on Him, for He is sufficient as a guardian and protector.
orig: وتوكل على الله وكفى بالله وكيلا

translation: Allah has not made for any man two hearts within him; and He has not made your wives whom you declare to be your mothers' backs, your mothers, and He has not made your adopted sons your sons. That is your saying by your mouths, but Allah speaks the truth, and He guides to the way.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of honesty and truthfulness in one's words and actions, highlighting the distinction between what people claim or say and what Allah has ordained, and guiding people towards the right path.
orig: ما جعل الله لرجل من قلبين في جوفه وما جعل أزواجكم اللائي تظاهرون منهن أمهاتكم وما جعل أدعياءكم أبناءكم ذلكم قولكم بأفواهكم والله يقول الحق وهو يهدي السبيل

translation: Call them after their fathers; that is more just with Allah; but if you do not know their fathers, then they are your brothers in the religion and your freedmen; and there is no blame on you in what you do by mistake, but what your hearts intend; and Allah is Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of attributing adopted children to their biological fathers, but also acknowledges the reality of uncertainty in such cases, and provides a way to address them with kindness and respect, highlighting the value of compassion and forgiveness in Islamic ethics.
orig: ادعوهم لآبائهم هو أقسط عند الله فإن لم تعلموا آباءهم فإخوانكم في الدين ومواليكم وليس عليكم جناح فيما أخطأتم به ولكن ما تعمدت قلوبكم وكان الله غفورا رحيما

translation: The Prophet is closer to the believers than their own selves, and his wives are their mothers, and blood relatives are closer to each other in the Book of Allah than the believers and the emigrants, except that you do kindness to your friends, it is written in the Book.
interpretation: The verse highlights the exceptional status of the Prophet and his family in the eyes of Allah, emphasizing their closeness to the believers and their role as a symbol of unity and guidance for the Muslim community.
orig: النبي أولى بالمؤمنين من أنفسهم وأزواجه أمهاتهم وأولو الأرحام بعضهم أولى ببعض في كتاب الله من المؤمنين والمهاجرين إلا أن تفعلوا إلى أوليائكم معروفا كان ذلك في الكتاب مسطورا

translation: And when We took from the prophets their covenant, and from you, and from Noah, and Abraham, and Moses, and Jesus, the son of Mary, and We took from them a solemn covenant.
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of the covenant between God and the prophets, emphasizing the responsibility and accountability that comes with receiving divine revelation, and serving as a reminder to the prophets and their followers to remain faithful to their sacred trust.
orig: وإذ أخذنا من النبيين ميثاقهم ومنك ومن نوح وإبراهيم وموسى وعيسى ابن مريم وأخذنا منهم ميثاقا غليظا

translation: He will question the truthful about their truthfulness, and has prepared a painful punishment for the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of sincerity in one's faith, as even those who are truthful will be held accountable for their actions, and serves as a warning to those who reject faith that they will face severe punishment.
orig: ليسأل الصادقين عن صدقهم وأعد للكافرين عذابا أليما

translation: O you who have believed, remember the favor of Allah upon you when the people determined to extend their hands [in aggression] against you, but He withheld their hands from you; and fear Allah. And upon Allah let the believers rely.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of gratitude and reliance on God, reminding believers of a specific instance where God's intervention protected them from harm, and emphasizing that true reliance should be on God alone.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اذكروا نعمة الله عليكم إذ جاءتكم جنود فأرسلنا عليهم ريحا وجنودا لم تروها وكان الله بما تعملون بصيرا

translation: When they came upon you from above you and from below you, and when the eyes grew dim and the hearts reached the throats, and you assumed about Allah the worst assumptions.
interpretation: The verse highlights the psychological and emotional state of the believers during a critical moment of crisis, where they were surrounded by enemies and their senses were overwhelmed, and yet, despite the chaos, they were still able to maintain their trust in Allah's plan and wisdom.
orig: إذ جاءوكم من فوقكم ومن أسفل منكم وإذ زاغت الأبصار وبلغت القلوب الحناجر وتظنون بالله الظنونا

translation: There were the believers tested and shaken with a mighty shaking.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that true believers are not exempt from trials and tribulations, but rather they are tested and purified through them, and it is in these times of hardship that their faith is strengthened and their character is refined.
orig: هنالك ابتلي المؤمنون وزلزلوا زلزالا شديدا

translation: And when the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is a disease say: 'Allah and His Messenger promised us nothing but delusion.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the mentality of the hypocrites who reject the promise of Allah and His Messenger, instead believing that they were deceived, which reveals their lack of faith and trust in Allah's plan.
orig: وإذ يقول المنافقون والذين في قلوبهم مرض ما وعدنا الله ورسوله إلا غرورا

translation: And when a group of them said, 'O people of Yathrib, there is no place to stand for you, so go back!' And a party of them asked permission of the Prophet, saying, 'Our houses are exposed,' but they were not exposed; they only intended to flee.
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of some people who, despite claiming to be believers, were actually planning to flee from the battlefield, using false excuses and pretending to be concerned about their homes, when in reality they lacked the courage to stand up for their faith.
orig: وإذ قالت طائفة منهم يا أهل يثرب لا مقام لكم فارجعوا ويستأذن فريق منهم النبي يقولون إن بيوتنا عورة وما هي بعورة إن يريدون إلا فرارا

translation: And if an entry had been made to them from the sides of the city, and they had been asked to rebel, they would have done so, but they would not have remained in it for a long time.
interpretation: The verse highlights the fleeting nature of human commitment to a cause, suggesting that even if people are initially enthusiastic about a rebellion or a revolution, their enthusiasm will soon wane and they will lose interest.
orig: ولو دخلت عليهم من أقطارها ثم سئلوا الفتنة لآتوها وما تلبثوا بها إلا يسيرا

translation: And indeed they had made a covenant with Allah before not to turn their backs, and Allah's covenant is a responsibility.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of fulfilling one's commitments and covenants, emphasizing that breaking a promise to God is a serious matter that incurs responsibility and accountability.
orig: ولقد كانوا عاهدوا الله من قبل لا يولون الأدبار وكان عهد الله مسئولا

translation: Say, 'Fleeing will not benefit you. If you flee from death or killing, and you will not be allowed to enjoy (this life) except for a little.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of trying to escape death or martyrdom, implying that one's time on this earth is limited and that eventually, everyone will face their mortality, regardless of their attempts to flee or avoid it.
orig: قل لن ينفعكم الفرار إن فررتم من الموت أو القتل وإذا لا تمتعون إلا قليلا

translation: Say, 'Who is it that can protect you from Allah if He intends for you harm or intends for you mercy?' And they will not find for themselves besides Allah any protector or helper.
interpretation: This verse highlights the absolute power and authority of Allah, emphasizing that no one can protect or help anyone against Allah's will, and that ultimately, all humans are dependent on Allah's mercy and will.
orig: قل من ذا الذي يعصمكم من الله إن أراد بكم سوءا أو أراد بكم رحمة ولا يجدون لهم من دون الله وليا ولا نصيرا

translation: Perhaps Allah will acquaint you with those who are weak among you, and those who say to their brothers, 'Come to us,' but they do not come except a little.
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who claim to be brave and strong, but in reality, they are cowards who only show up for battle when it is convenient for them, leaving the weak and vulnerable to bear the brunt of the struggle.
orig: قد يعلم الله المعوقين منكم والقائلين لإخوانهم هلم إلينا ولا يأتون البأس إلا قليلا

translation: Be careful of them, so when fear comes, you see them looking at you, their eyes revolving like one who faints from death; then when fear departs, they lash at you with sharp tongues, stingy with good; those never believed, so Allah made their deeds worthless, and that was easy for Allah.
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of people who pretend to be loyal and supportive in times of fear or crisis, but as soon as the danger passes, they reveal their true nature by speaking harshly and being stingy with their resources, demonstrating that their loyalty was never genuine in the first place.
orig: أشحة عليكم فإذا جاء الخوف رأيتهم ينظرون إليك تدور أعينهم كالذي يغشى عليه من الموت فإذا ذهب الخوف سلقوكم بألسنة حداد أشحة على الخير أولئك لم يؤمنوا فأحبط الله أعمالهم وكان ذلك على الله يسيرا

translation: They think the confederates have not withdrawn; and if the confederates come, they would wish they were in the desert among the Bedouins, asking about your news, and if they were among you, they would not fight except a little.
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who claim to be allies, but in reality, they are hesitant to take a stand and fight for the cause, preferring to remain neutral and observe from a safe distance, only to criticize and question the actions of those who are actively fighting.
orig: يحسبون الأحزاب لم يذهبوا وإن يأت الأحزاب يودوا لو أنهم بادون في الأعراب يسألون عن أنبائكم ولو كانوا فيكم ما قاتلوا إلا قليلا

translation: Indeed, in the Messenger of Allah you have a good example for whoever hopes for Allah and the Last Day and remembers Allah much.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of emulating the Prophet Muhammad's character and behavior, as he is the perfect role model for those who hope for God's mercy and fear the Day of Judgment, and who constantly remember and invoke God in their daily lives.
orig: لقد كان لكم في رسول الله أسوة حسنة لمن كان يرجو الله واليوم الآخر وذكر الله كثيرا

translation: And when the believers saw the companies, they said: 'This is what Allah and His Messenger had promised us, and Allah and His Messenger had spoken the truth.' And it only added to their faith and submission.
interpretation: The verse highlights the unwavering trust and faith of the believers in God's promises, even in the face of overwhelming odds, and how this trust only increases their faith and submission to God's will.
orig: ولما رأى المؤمنون الأحزاب قالوا هذا ما وعدنا الله ورسوله وصدق الله ورسوله وما زادهم إلا إيمانا وتسليما

translation: Among the believers are men who have been true to their covenant with Allah, of them some have fulfilled their vow, and some of them are still waiting, but they have never changed.
interpretation: The verse highlights the unwavering commitment and loyalty of the believers, who have remained steadfast in their promise to Allah, and have not wavered in their devotion, even in the face of challenges and hardships.
orig: من المؤمنين رجال صدقوا ما عاهدوا الله عليه فمنهم من قضى نحبه ومنهم من ينتظر وما بدلوا تبديلا

translation: That Allah may reward the truthful for their truthfulness, and punish the hypocrites if He wills, or accept their repentance if He wills. Indeed, Allah is Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of sincerity and truthfulness, as those who are truthful will be rewarded, while hypocrites will be punished, unless they repent and seek forgiveness, emphasizing God's mercy and forgiveness for those who turn to Him.
orig: ليجزي الله الصادقين بصدقهم ويعذب المنافقين إن شاء أو يتوب عليهم إن الله كان غفورا رحيما

translation: God has restrained the unbelievers in their rage, they were not able to do any good, and God sufficed the believers in fighting, and God is Strong, Mighty.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's power and control over the affairs of humanity, where He can restrain the evil intentions of the unbelievers and provide sufficiency to the believers in times of conflict, demonstrating His omnipotence and might.
orig: ورد الله الذين كفروا بغيظهم لم ينالوا خيرا وكفى الله المؤمنين القتال وكان الله قويا عزيزا

translation: And those who supported them from among the People of the Book, He brought down from their strongholds, and cast terror into their hearts, a group you killed and a group you took captive.
interpretation: The verse highlights the divine intervention in the battle, where God's help led to the defeat of the enemy, striking fear into their hearts, and ultimately leading to their capture or death, demonstrating God's power and control over the outcome of events.
orig: وأنزل الذين ظاهروهم من أهل الكتاب من صياصيهم وقذف في قلوبهم الرعب فريقا تقتلون وتأسرون فريقا

translation: And We caused you to inherit their land, and their houses, and their properties, and a land you had not trodden; and God has been All-Powerful over everything.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of divine providence, where God's power and authority are demonstrated through the transfer of wealth and property from one group to another, emphasizing that all things are under God's control and that He is capable of changing the course of events according to His will.
orig: وأورثكم أرضهم وديارهم وأموالهم وأرضا لم تطئوها وكان الله على كل شيء قديرا

translation: O Prophet, say to your wives: If you desire the life of this world and its adornment, then come, I will provide for you and release you with a handsome release.
interpretation: This verse is an expression of the Prophet's willingness to divorce his wives if they prioritize worldly life and its luxuries over their spiritual well-being, implying that he values their spiritual growth and salvation over his personal relationships.
orig: يا أيها النبي قل لأزواجك إن كنتن تردن الحياة الدنيا وزينتها فتعالين أمتعكن وأسرحكن سراحا جميلا

translation: And if you obey Allah and His Messenger and strive for the Hereafter, then indeed, Allah has prepared for the doers of good among you a great reward.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of obedience to Allah and His Messenger, as well as striving for the Hereafter, as a means to attain a great reward, emphasizing that the motivation for righteous deeds should be driven by the desire for Allah's pleasure and the reward in the Hereafter.
orig: وإن كنتن تردن الله ورسوله والدار الآخرة فإن الله أعد للمحسنات منكن أجرا عظيما

translation: O wives of the Prophet, whoever among you commits a manifestly indecent deed, the punishment will be doubled for her, and that is easy for Allah.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the higher moral standards expected from the wives of the Prophet, and serves as a warning to them that any indecent behavior will be severely punished, implying that they are role models for the Muslim community and are held to a higher level of accountability.
orig: يا نساء النبي من يأت منكن بفاحشة مبينة يضاعف لها العذاب ضعفين وكان ذلك على الله يسيرا

translation: And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger and does righteousness, We will give her her reward twice over, and We have prepared for her a noble provision.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of obedience to God and His Messenger, and the reward that comes with it, emphasizing that women, in particular, will receive a double reward for their righteousness, indicating that their efforts will not go unnoticed and will be recognized and valued by God.
orig: ومن يقنت منكن لله ورسوله وتعمل صالحا نؤتها أجرها مرتين وأعتدنا لها رزقا كريما

translation: O wives of the Prophet, you are not like anyone among the women. If you fear Allah, then do not be soft in speech, lest he in whose heart is a disease should be moved with desire, but speak a word that is just.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of modesty and discretion in the speech of the Prophet's wives, warning them against speaking in a way that might be misinterpreted by those with impure intentions, and instead encouraging them to speak in a clear and respectful manner.
orig: يا نساء النبي لستن كأحد من النساء إن اتقيتن فلا تخضعن بالقول فيطمع الذي في قلبه مرض وقلن قولا معروفا

translation: And stay in your homes and do not display your finery like the former days of ignorance, and establish prayer and give zakah and obey Allah and His Messenger. Indeed, Allah only intends to remove impurity from you, O people of the house, and to purify you with a thorough purification.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of spiritual purification and moral cleansing, highlighting the need for believers to distance themselves from the corrupt and ignorant practices of the past and instead focus on establishing a strong spiritual foundation through prayer, charity, and obedience to Allah and His Messenger.
orig: وقرن في بيوتكن ولا تبرجن تبرج الجاهلية الأولى وأقمن الصلاة وآتين الزكاة وأطعن الله ورسوله إنما يريد الله ليذهب عنكم الرجس أهل البيت ويطهركم تطهيرا

translation: And remember what is being recited in your homes of the verses of Allah and the wisdom. Indeed, Allah is Ever-Subtle, All-Aware.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of reflecting on the verses of the Qur'an and the wisdom that is imparted through them, highlighting God's subtle yet all-aware nature, which suggests that He is intimately involved in the lives of believers, guiding and directing them.
orig: واذكرن ما يتلى في بيوتكن من آيات الله والحكمة إن الله كان لطيفا خبيرا

translation: Indeed, the Muslim men and Muslim women, the believing men and believing women, the obedient men and obedient women, the truthful men and truthful women, the patient men and patient women, the humble men and humble women, the charitable men and charitable women, the fasting men and fasting women, the guardians of their chastity and the guardians of their chastity, the men who remember Allah much and the women who remember Allah much, Allah has prepared for them forgiveness and a great reward.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of individual characteristics and actions that lead to forgiveness and a great reward from God, emphasizing that these virtues are not limited to one gender, but are attainable by both men and women who strive to please God.
orig: إن المسلمين والمسلمات والمؤمنين والمؤمنات والقانتين والقانتات والصادقين والصادقات والصابرين والصابرات والخاشعين والخاشعات والمتصدقين والمتصدقات والصائمين والصائمات والحافظين فروجهم والحافظات والذاكرين الله كثيرا والذاكرات أعد الله لهم مغفرة وأجرا عظيما

translation: It is not for a believing man or a believing woman, when Allah and His Messenger have decreed a matter, that they should have any option in their decision. And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger, he indeed strays into a manifest error.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the absolute obedience to God and His Messenger, implying that believers have no choice but to follow their decrees, and any disobedience would lead to clear and evident deviation from the right path.
orig: وما كان لمؤمن ولا مؤمنة إذا قضى الله ورسوله أمرا أن يكون لهم الخيرة من أمرهم ومن يعص الله ورسوله فقد ضل ضلالا مبينا

translation: And [remember] when you said to the one on whom Allah had bestowed favour and you had favoured, 'Retain your wife for yourself and fear Allah, and conceal within yourself what Allah is going to disclose, and you feared the people, while Allah has a greater right that you should fear Him. So when Zayd had fulfilled his desire from her, We gave her to you in marriage, so that there would be no blame on the believers in respect of the wives of their adopted sons when they have fulfilled their desire from them, and the command of Allah was fulfilled.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of fearing God over the fear of people, as the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) was more concerned about what people would say than about pleasing God, and this verse serves as a reminder to prioritize one's duty to God above the opinions of others.
orig: وإذ تقول للذي أنعم الله عليه وأنعمت عليه أمسك عليك زوجك واتق الله وتخفي في نفسك ما الله مبديه وتخشى الناس والله أحق أن تخشاه فلما قضى زيد منها وطرا زوجناكها لكي لا يكون على المؤمنين حرج في أزواج أدعيائهم إذا قضوا منهن وطرا وكان أمر الله مفعولا

translation: There is no restriction on the Prophet in what Allah has ordained for him as a duty, as a practice of Allah among those who have gone before; and the command of Allah is a decree that is predetermined.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the idea that the Prophet Muhammad was not bound by the same restrictions as his followers, and that his actions and decisions were divinely guided, making him a model for humanity to follow.
orig: ما كان على النبي من حرج فيما فرض الله له سنة الله في الذين خلوا من قبل وكان أمر الله قدرا مقدورا

translation: Those who convey the messages of Allah and fear Him, and fear none but Allah, and Allah is sufficient as a Reckoner.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of having a deep sense of accountability to God, where one's actions are guided by the fear of God's judgment, rather than the fear of human beings or worldly consequences.
orig: الذين يبلغون رسالات الله ويخشونه ولا يخشون أحدا إلا الله وكفى بالله حسيبا

translation: Muhammad is not the father of any of your men, but the Messenger of Allah and the Seal of the Prophets; and Allah is All-Aware of everything.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the unique status of the Prophet Muhammad, distinguishing him from ordinary men and highlighting his role as the final prophet sent by God, implying that his message and teachings are the culmination of divine revelation.
orig: ما كان محمد أبا أحد من رجالكم ولكن رسول الله وخاتم النبيين وكان الله بكل شيء عليما

translation: O you who believe, remember Allah with much remembrance.
interpretation: The verse is an exhortation to believers to engage in constant and abundant remembrance of Allah, emphasizing the importance of cultivating a close and intimate relationship with Him through continuous mindfulness and devotion.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اذكروا الله ذكرا كثيرا

translation: And they glorify Him morning and evening.
interpretation: The verse highlights the continuous and unbroken nature of the angels' worship and glorification of God, which is not limited to specific times or occasions, but is rather an ongoing and perpetual process.
orig: وسبحوه بكرة وأصيلا

translation: It is He who blesses you, and His angels too, to bring you out of the darkness into the light, and He is ever Merciful to the believers.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's mercy and care for believers, where He, along with His angels, guides them from darkness to light, symbolizing the spiritual journey from ignorance to knowledge and faith.
orig: هو الذي يصلي عليكم وملائكته ليخرجكم من الظلمات إلى النور وكان بالمؤمنين رحيما

translation: Their greeting on the day they meet Him will be 'Peace', and He has prepared for them a noble reward.
interpretation: The verse highlights the joy and tranquility that the believers will experience on the Day of Judgment, where they will be greeted with the ultimate peace and rewarded with a noble reward, signifying the culmination of their faith and righteous deeds.
orig: تحيتهم يوم يلقونه سلام وأعد لهم أجرا كريما

translation: O Prophet, indeed We have sent you as a witness and a bringer of good tidings and a warner.
interpretation: This verse highlights the multifaceted role of the Prophet Muhammad, emphasizing his responsibility to bear witness to the truth, to bring hope and good news to the faithful, and to warn those who reject the message of God.
orig: يا أيها النبي إنا أرسلناك شاهدا ومبشرا ونذيرا

translation: And a summoner to Allah by His permission, and a lamp spreading light.
interpretation: The verse highlights the role of the Prophet Muhammad as a caller to the path of Allah, and a source of spiritual illumination, guiding people to the truth and enlightening their way.
orig: وداعيا إلى الله بإذنه وسراجا منيرا

translation: And give good tidings to the believers that they shall have from Allah a great bounty.
interpretation: The verse is a message of hope and reassurance to believers, promising them a great reward from God, which will be a source of comfort and motivation for them to continue on the path of righteousness.
orig: وبشر المؤمنين بأن لهم من الله فضلا كبيرا

translation: And obey not the disbelievers and the hypocrites, and disregard their annoyance, and put your trust in Allah, if you are believers. Allah is Sufficient as a Protector.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of trusting in God's protection and not being swayed by the opinions or criticisms of those who do not believe or are hypocrites, as God is sufficient to protect and take care of the believers.
orig: ولا تطع الكافرين والمنافقين ودع أذاهم وتوكل على الله وكفى بالله وكيلا

translation: O you who have believed, when you marry believing women and then divorce them before you have touched them, then there is no waiting period for you to observe with regard to them, so give them a gift and release them with a gracious release.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of treating divorced women with kindness and generosity, even if the marriage was short-lived, and encourages believers to maintain a sense of compassion and respect in their dealings with each other, even in the face of separation.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إذا نكحتم المؤمنات ثم طلقتموهن من قبل أن تمسوهن فما لكم عليهن من عدة تعتدونها فمتعوهن وسرحوهن سراحا جميلا

translation: O Prophet, indeed We have made lawful to you your wives to whom you have given their due compensation and those your right hand possesses of what Allah has returned to you [from captives] and the daughters of your paternal uncles and the daughters of your paternal aunts and the daughters of your maternal uncles and the daughters of your maternal aunts who emigrated with you, and a believing woman if she gives herself to the Prophet and if the Prophet wishes to marry her, exclusively for you, not for the believers. We know what We have made obligatory upon them concerning their wives and those whom their right hands possess, that there would be no difficulty upon you. And Allah is ever Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the unique marital privileges granted to the Prophet Muhammad, emphasizing God's mercy and forgiveness in allowing the Prophet to marry certain women, including those who emigrated with him, while also exempting him from the usual restrictions on polygamy, thus alleviating any potential difficulty or hardship for him.
orig: يا أيها النبي إنا أحللنا لك أزواجك اللاتي آتيت أجورهن وما ملكت يمينك مما أفاء الله عليك وبنات عمك وبنات عماتك وبنات خالك وبنات خالاتك اللاتي هاجرن معك وامرأة مؤمنة إن وهبت نفسها للنبي إن أراد النبي أن يستنكحها خالصة لك من دون المؤمنين قد علمنا ما فرضنا عليهم في أزواجهم وما ملكت أيمانهم لكيلا يكون عليك حرج وكان الله غفورا رحيما

translation: You may defer whom you will of them or take in unto you whom you will, and whoever you desire of those who have been set aside, it is no sin for you; that makes it likelier they will be content and not grieve, and that they should be pleased with what you have given them all; and Allah knows what is in your hearts, and Allah is All-Knowing, All-Forbearing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of fairness and justice in marital relationships, emphasizing that a husband should treat all his wives equally and not show favoritism, as this can lead to contentment and happiness among all parties involved.
orig: ترجي من تشاء منهن وتؤوي إليك من تشاء ومن ابتغيت ممن عزلت فلا جناح عليك ذلك أدنى أن تقر أعينهن ولا يحزن ويرضين بما آتيتهن كلهن والله يعلم ما في قلوبكم وكان الله عليما حليما

translation: It is not lawful for you to take women thereafter, nor that you should exchange them for other wives, even though their beauty pleases you, except what your right hand possesses; and Allah is Ever-Watcher over all things.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of treating all wives with fairness and justice, and not to replace them with new wives, except for those who are slaves, emphasizing the accountability of human actions before God.
orig: لا يحل لك النساء من بعد ولا أن تبدل بهن من أزواج ولو أعجبك حسنهن إلا ما ملكت يمينك وكان الله على كل شيء رقيبا

translation: O you who have believed, do not enter the houses of the Prophet unless you are given permission to eat, not waiting for its preparation. But when you are invited, then enter, and when you have eaten, disperse without lingering in conversation. That was troubling the Prophet, and he was shy of [dismissing] you. And Allah is not shy of the truth. And when you ask [his wives] for something, ask them from behind a screen. That is purer for your hearts and their hearts. And it is not for you to harm the Messenger of Allah or to marry his wives after him ever. Indeed, that would be great [sin] with Allah.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of respecting the privacy of the Prophet and his wives, and the need for believers to maintain a healthy distance from them, avoiding any behavior that could be perceived as intrusive or disrespectful, in order to preserve the dignity and sanctity of their relationships.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تدخلوا بيوت النبي إلا أن يؤذن لكم إلى طعام غير ناظرين إناه ولكن إذا دعيتم فادخلوا فإذا طعمتم فانتشروا ولا مستأنسين لحديث إن ذلكم كان يؤذي النبي فيستحيي منكم والله لا يستحيي من الحق وإذا سألتموهن متاعا فاسألوهن من وراء حجاب ذلكم أطهر لقلوبكم وقلوبهن وما كان لكم أن تؤذوا رسول الله ولا أن تنكحوا أزواجه من بعده أبدا إن ذلكم كان عند الله عظيما

translation: Whether you reveal anything or conceal it, indeed Allah is All-Knower of everything.
interpretation: This verse highlights the omniscience of God, emphasizing that He is aware of all human thoughts and actions, whether they are openly expressed or secretly concealed, and that nothing can be hidden from His knowledge.
orig: إن تبدوا شيئا أو تخفوه فإن الله كان بكل شيء عليما

translation: There is no blame upon them concerning their fathers or their sons or their brothers or their brothers' sons or their sisters' sons or their women or their slave girls, and fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is ever, over all things, a Witness.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of women's freedom to make choices and act independently, without being restricted by their family ties or relationships, as long as they fear Allah and are mindful of their responsibilities towards Him.
orig: لا جناح عليهن في آبائهن ولا أبنائهن ولا إخوانهن ولا أبناء إخوانهن ولا أبناء أخواتهن ولا نسائهن ولا ما ملكت أيمانهن واتقين الله إن الله كان على كل شيء شهيدا

translation: Indeed, Allah and His angels bless the Prophet. O you who have believed, ask [Allah to] bless him and grant him safe conduct.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of sending blessings and salutations to the Prophet Muhammad, emphasizing the significance of showing respect and reverence to him as a messenger of God.
orig: إن الله وملائكته يصلون على النبي يا أيها الذين آمنوا صلوا عليه وسلموا تسليما

translation: Those who annoy Allah and His Messenger, Allah has cursed them in this world and in the Hereafter, and has prepared for them a humiliating punishment.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the gravity of annoying or harming Allah and His Messenger, and serves as a warning that those who do so will face severe consequences, not only in the Hereafter, but also in this life, and that their punishment will be humiliating and degrading.
orig: إن الذين يؤذون الله ورسوله لعنهم الله في الدنيا والآخرة وأعد لهم عذابا مهينا

translation: And those who harm believing men and believing women for other than what they have earned have certainly taken upon themselves a slander and manifest sin.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of falsely accusing and harming innocent believers, which is considered a grave sin that will have severe consequences, emphasizing the importance of justice and fairness in dealing with others.
orig: والذين يؤذون المؤمنين والمؤمنات بغير ما اكتسبوا فقد احتملوا بهتانا وإثما مبينا

translation: O Prophet, tell your wives and your daughters and the women of the believers to draw their cloaks (veils) over themselves, that is more proper, that they may be recognized and not molested. And Allah is Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of modesty and dignity for women, instructing them to wear veils as a means of protection from harassment and mistreatment, while also highlighting God's mercy and forgiveness for those who follow this guidance.
orig: يا أيها النبي قل لأزواجك وبناتك ونساء المؤمنين يدنين عليهن من جلابيبهن ذلك أدنى أن يعرفن فلا يؤذين وكان الله غفورا رحيما

translation: If the hypocrites, and those in whose hearts is a disease, and those who spread rumors in the city, do not cease, We will surely stir you up against them, then they will not be your neighbors in it, except for a little while.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of dealing firmly with those who spread corruption and corruption, as their presence can be a threat to the stability of the community, and that the Prophet and believers should take a strong stance against them to maintain peace and order.
orig: لئن لم ينته المنافقون والذين في قلوبهم مرض والمرجفون في المدينة لنغرينك بهم ثم لا يجاورونك فيها إلا قليلا

translation: They were condemned; wherever they were found, they were seized and murdered, a massacre.
interpretation: This verse suggests that those who were condemned by God were utterly destroyed, with no chance of escape or mercy, and serves as a warning to those who reject God's message and persist in their evil ways.
orig: ملعونين أينما ثقفوا أخذوا وقتلوا تقتيلا

translation: The way of Allah is for those who have passed away before, and you will not find any change in the way of Allah.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the natural order of the universe, as ordained by God, has been consistent throughout history, and that the laws of nature and the consequences of human actions have remained unchanged since the beginning of time.
orig: سنة الله في الذين خلوا من قبل ولن تجد لسنة الله تبديلا

translation: The people ask you about the Hour. Say, 'Knowledge of it is only with Allah, and what will make you know? Maybe the Hour is near.'
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the exclusivity of God's knowledge about the Hour of Judgment, implying that humans are not capable of knowing the exact timing of the end of the world, and that it may come unexpectedly, at any moment.
orig: يسألك الناس عن الساعة قل إنما علمها عند الله وما يدريك لعل الساعة تكون قريبا

translation: Indeed, Allah has cursed the disbelievers and prepared for them a Blaze.
interpretation: This verse highlights the gravity of rejecting faith and the severe consequences that await those who deliberately choose to disbelieve, emphasizing that their fate is sealed and their punishment is inevitable.
orig: إن الله لعن الكافرين وأعد لهم سعيرا

translation: They will abide in it forever, they will not find a guardian or a helper.
interpretation: The verse highlights the eternal nature of punishment in the afterlife, emphasizing that the condemned individuals will be utterly alone and helpless, having no one to turn to for protection or support.
orig: خالدين فيها أبدا لا يجدون وليا ولا نصيرا

translation: The Day their faces will be turned about in the Fire, they will say: 'Would that we had obeyed Allah and obeyed the Messenger.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the regret and remorse that sinners will experience on the Day of Judgment, when they will realize their mistakes and wish they had obeyed Allah and His Messenger, but it will be too late for them.
orig: يوم تقلب وجوههم في النار يقولون يا ليتنا أطعنا الله وأطعنا الرسولا

translation: And they will say: 'Our Lord, we obeyed our leaders and our great ones, and they misled us from the way'
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to blame their leaders and those in positions of authority for their own misguidance, rather than taking personal responsibility for their actions, and serves as a warning against blindly following others without questioning their guidance.
orig: وقالوا ربنا إنا أطعنا سادتنا وكبراءنا فأضلونا السبيلا

translation: Our Lord, we have wronged ourselves, and if You do not forgive us and have mercy upon us, we will surely be among the losers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of acknowledging one's mistakes and seeking forgiveness from God, emphasizing that without His mercy, one is doomed to failure and loss.
orig: ربنا آتهم ضعفين من العذاب والعنهم لعنا كبيرا

translation: O you who have believed, be not like those who harmed Moses, then Allah cleared him of what they said, and he, in the sight of Allah, was dignified.
interpretation: The verse serves as a warning to believers not to repeat the mistakes of those who mistreated Moses, and instead, strive to attain a high level of dignity and respect in the eyes of God, just as Moses did.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تكونوا كالذين آذوا موسى فبرأه الله مما قالوا وكان عند الله وجيها

translation: O you who have believed, fear Allah and speak a word that is upright.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of speaking truthfully and justly, as it is a reflection of one's fear of Allah, and that a believer's words should be a reflection of their inner righteousness.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اتقوا الله وقولوا قولا سديدا

translation: He will reform your deeds and forgive your sins, and whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger has certainly attained a great attainment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of obedience to Allah and His Messenger, promising that those who do so will be rewarded with a great attainment, implying a state of spiritual fulfillment and closeness to Allah.
orig: يصلح لكم أعمالكم ويغفر لكم ذنوبكم ومن يطع الله ورسوله فقد فاز فوزا عظيما

translation: Indeed, We offered the Trust to the heavens and the earth and the mountains, but they declined to bear it, and were afraid of it, and man bore it. Indeed, he was unjust and ignorant.
interpretation: The verse highlights humanity's tendency to take on responsibilities that they are not equipped to handle, and their subsequent failure to live up to the moral standards expected of them, leading to injustice and ignorance.
orig: إنا عرضنا الأمانة على السماوات والأرض والجبال فأبين أن يحملنها وأشفقن منها وحملها الإنسان إنه كان ظلوما جهولا

translation: May Allah punish the hypocrite men and the hypocrite women, and the polytheist men and the polytheist women, and may Allah turn in mercy to the believing men and the believing women, and Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the distinction between the hypocrites and the believers, emphasizing that Allah's mercy is reserved for those who are sincere in their faith, while the hypocrites will face punishment, implying that true faith is what earns one Allah's forgiveness and mercy.
orig: ليعذب الله المنافقين والمنافقات والمشركين والمشركات ويتوب الله على المؤمنين والمؤمنات وكان الله غفورا رحيما

translation: Praise be to Allah, to Whom belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth, and to Him belongs praise in the Hereafter, and He is the Wise, the Aware.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's complete ownership and control over the universe, emphasizing His power and wisdom, and implying that humans should acknowledge and submit to His will, recognizing His infinite wisdom and knowledge.
orig: الحمد لله الذي له ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وله الحمد في الآخرة وهو الحكيم الخبير

translation: He knows what penetrates into the earth and what comes out of it, and what descends from the sky and what ascends into it, and He is the Merciful, the Forgiving.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's complete knowledge and control over the natural world, emphasizing His omnipotence and ability to forgive humanity's mistakes, implying that His mercy is always available to those who seek it.
orig: يعلم ما يلج في الأرض وما يخرج منها وما ينزل من السماء وما يعرج فيها وهو الرحيم الغفور

translation: And those who disbelieve say, 'The Hour will not come to us.' Say, 'Yes, by my Lord, it will surely come to you. The Knower of the unseen, not an atom's weight in the heavens or in the earth or what is smaller than that or greater escapes Him. All is in a clear record.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the certainty of the Day of Judgment, emphasizing that nothing, no matter how small or large, escapes God's knowledge and will be accounted for on that day, serving as a warning to those who deny its coming.
orig: وقال الذين كفروا لا تأتينا الساعة قل بلى وربي لتأتينكم عالم الغيب لا يعزب عنه مثقال ذرة في السماوات ولا في الأرض ولا أصغر من ذلك ولا أكبر إلا في كتاب مبين

translation: Those who believe and do good deeds, for them is forgiveness and a noble provision.
interpretation: The verse highlights the reward of those who combine faith with righteous actions, promising them not only forgiveness for their past mistakes, but also a noble and generous provision in the hereafter, emphasizing the importance of deeds in addition to faith.
orig: ليجزي الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات أولئك لهم مغفرة ورزق كريم

translation: And those who strive against Our signs to frustrate (them), for them is a punishment of painful wrath.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of actively working against God's signs and revelations, emphasizing that those who do so will face a severe and intense punishment, implying that their actions are a deliberate and arrogant rejection of God's authority.
orig: والذين سعوا في آياتنا معاجزين أولئك لهم عذاب من رجز أليم

translation: And those who have been given knowledge see that what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth, and it guides to the Path of the Exalted in Power, the One Worthy of all Praise.
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of spiritual knowledge and its impact on the believer, as it enables them to recognize the truth and guidance of God's revelation, leading them to the path of righteousness and closeness to God.
orig: ويرى الذين أوتوا العلم الذي أنزل إليك من ربك هو الحق ويهدي إلى صراط العزيز الحميد

translation: And those who disbelieved said: 'Shall we direct you to a man who will inform you that when you have been torn into pieces, you will be in a new creation?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the mockery and skepticism of the disbelievers towards the concept of resurrection and the afterlife, implying that they found it absurd and unbelievable.
orig: وقال الذين كفروا هل ندلكم على رجل ينبئكم إذا مزقتم كل ممزق إنكم لفي خلق جديد

translation: Or do they invent about Allah a lie or in him is madness? Nay, those who do not believe in the Hereafter are in punishment and far error.
interpretation: This verse highlights the gravity of fabricating lies about God, implying that such an act is a grave offense that leads to severe punishment and deep confusion.
orig: أفترى على الله كذبا أم به جنة بل الذين لا يؤمنون بالآخرة في العذاب والضلال البعيد

translation: Do they not look at what is before them and what is behind them of the heaven and the earth? If We will, We can sink them into the earth or drop pieces of the sky upon them. Indeed, in that is a sign for every servant who turns [to Allah].
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of recognizing and reflecting on the signs of God's power and majesty in the universe, and how this reflection can lead to a turning point in one's life, where one begins to turn to Allah in repentance and obedience.
