translation: And take in your hand a bundle of thin grass, and strike with it, and do not break your oath. Indeed, We found him patient, excellent indeed were the servant, he was penitent.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of patience and repentance, as exemplified by the prophet Ayyub, who remained steadfast in the face of trials and tribulations, and ultimately turned to God in humility and submission.
orig: وخذ بيدك ضغثا فاضرب به ولا تحنث إنا وجدناه صابرا نعم العبد إنه أواب

translation: And remember Our servants, Ibrahim, Ishaq and Yaqub, those of strength and vision.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of remembering and learning from the examples of the great prophets of the past, such as Ibrahim, Ishaq, and Yaqub, who were blessed with physical and spiritual strength, as well as insight and wisdom, and whose stories serve as a source of guidance and inspiration for believers.
orig: واذكر عبادنا إبراهيم وإسحاق ويعقوب أولي الأيدي والأبصار

translation: Indeed, We have purified them with a pure remembrance of the Home.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the righteous believers are purified and refined through their devotion to God and their longing for the Hereafter, which is referred to as 'the Home', implying a state of spiritual growth and closeness to God.
orig: إنا أخلصناهم بخالصة ذكرى الدار

translation: And indeed, they are among the chosen excellent ones with Us.
interpretation: This verse highlights the special status of the prophets and righteous individuals in the eyes of God, implying that they have been selected and favored by Him for their extraordinary virtues and devotion.
orig: وإنهم عندنا لمن المصطفين الأخيار

translation: And mention Ismail and Al-Yasa', and Dhul-Kifl, among the good ones.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of remembering and honoring the righteous individuals of the past, who have set an exemplary model of faith and obedience to God, and serves as a reminder to strive towards similar virtues and moral excellence.
orig: واذكر إسماعيل واليسع وذا الكفل وكل من الأخيار

translation: This is a reminder, and indeed, for the righteous, there will be a good place of return.
interpretation: The verse is emphasizing the importance of remembering and learning from the stories of previous nations and prophets, as it serves as a guidance for the righteous, who will ultimately be rewarded with a good place in the hereafter.
orig: هذا ذكر وإن للمتقين لحسن مآب

translation: Gardens of Eden, whose gates will be opened for them
interpretation: The verse is describing the ultimate reward for the righteous, where they will be granted access to the highest level of paradise, symbolizing a state of eternal bliss and proximity to God.
orig: جنات عدن مفتحة لهم الأبواب

translation: Reclining therein, they will call therein for abundant fruit and drinks.
interpretation: The verse is describing the state of bliss and luxury in Paradise, where the believers will be reclining in comfort, enjoying an abundance of delicious fruits and refreshing drinks, symbolizing the ultimate reward and satisfaction of their souls.
orig: متكئين فيها يدعون فيها بفاكهة كثيرة وشراب

translation: And with them are those who restrain their gaze, and modest.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of modesty and self-control, emphasizing that true believers are those who can control their desires and gaze, and instead focus on spiritual growth and development.
orig: وعندهم قاصرات الطرف أتراب

translation: This is what you were promised for the Day of Reckoning.
interpretation: The verse highlights the fulfillment of God's promise of reckoning, implying that the Day of Judgment has finally arrived, and the consequences of one's actions will be faced.
orig: هذا ما توعدون ليوم الحساب

translation: Indeed, this is Our provision, which will never exhaust.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes God's boundless mercy and generosity, implying that His provision is infinite and will never run out, reassuring believers of His constant support and care.
orig: إن هذا لرزقنا ما له من نفاد

translation: This, and indeed, for the transgressors is an evil destination.
interpretation: The verse warns that those who have exceeded the bounds of morality and righteousness will ultimately face a terrible consequence, implying that their evil deeds will lead them to a dreadful end, where they will face the wrath of God.
orig: هذا وإن للطاغين لشر مآب

translation: Hell, they will reach it, and wretched is the resting place.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who reject God's message will ultimately end up in Hell, which will be their eternal abode, a place of eternal suffering and torment, emphasizing the gravity of their mistake and the consequences of their rejection.
orig: جهنم يصلونها فبئس المهاد

translation: So let him taste the burning and the bitter cold.
interpretation: The verse is describing the punishment of hellfire, where the sinners will experience extreme temperatures, both burning heat and bitter cold, emphasizing the severity and intensity of the punishment.
orig: هذا فليذوقوه حميم وغساق

translation: And of his signs is that He created for you from yourselves mates
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of the institution of marriage and the companionship between spouses, emphasizing that the creation of mates is a sign of God's wisdom and mercy, and that it is a fundamental aspect of human life and society.
orig: وآخر من شكله أزواج

translation: This is a troop rushing upon you, there is no welcome for them; indeed, they will enter the Fire.
interpretation: The verse is a warning to the believers that those who are rushing to attack them will ultimately end up in the Fire, implying that their evil intentions and actions will lead to their own downfall and punishment in the Hereafter.
orig: هذا فوج مقتحم معكم لا مرحبا بهم إنهم صالو النار

translation: They said: 'Nay, you have come to us in a state of fear, and we have no welcome for you, for you have brought this upon us, and that is a bad omen.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to reject and blame the messengers of God, instead of taking responsibility for their own actions and acknowledging the truth.
orig: قالوا بل أنتم لا مرحبا بكم أنتم قدمتموه لنا فبئس القرار

translation: They will say: 'Our Lord, whoever brought this upon us, add to him a double punishment in the Fire.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the regret and remorse of those in hell, who will blame others for leading them astray and will ask for an increased punishment for those who misled them, indicating that they have finally realized their mistakes and are now willing to acknowledge the truth.
orig: قالوا ربنا من قدم لنا هذا فزده عذابا ضعفا في النار

translation: And they say: 'What is the matter with us that we do not see men whom we used to count among the wicked?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and ignorance of the disbelievers who are surprised that they do not see the wicked people they used to associate with, implying that they expected to see them in the afterlife, but failed to realize that they were actually punished and destroyed by God.
orig: وقالوا ما لنا لا نرى رجالا كنا نعدهم من الأشرار

translation: Or did We take them in mockery, or have their eyes turned aside?
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that those who reject God's signs and messages are not doing so out of ignorance, but rather out of a deliberate choice to turn away from the truth, and that their rejection is a form of arrogance and pride.
orig: أتخذناهم سخريا أم زاغت عنهم الأبصار

translation: That is a certain truth, a quarrel of the people of the Fire.
interpretation: The verse highlights the eternal and futile disputes that will take place among the inhabitants of Hell, emphasizing the idea that their arguments and disagreements will persist even in the afterlife, serving as a form of punishment and torment.
orig: إن ذلك لحق تخاصم أهل النار

translation: Say, 'I am only a warner, and there is no deity except Allah, the One, the Prevailing.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the role of the Prophet as a warner, not a coercer, and highlights the unity and omnipotence of God, implying that the Prophet's message is not a personal agenda, but a divine warning to humanity.
orig: قل إنما أنا منذر وما من إله إلا الله الواحد القهار

translation: Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, the Mighty, the Forgiving.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes God's absolute power and control over the universe, highlighting His might and forgiveness, which serves as a reminder to humanity of their place in the grand scheme of creation and their need to seek forgiveness and mercy from their Creator.
orig: رب السماوات والأرض وما بينهما العزيز الغفار

translation: Say, 'It is a tremendous information'
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the significance and importance of the message being conveyed, implying that it is not just any ordinary information, but rather a crucial and weighty revelation that demands attention and consideration.
orig: قل هو نبأ عظيم

translation: You are turning away from him
interpretation: The verse suggests that people are deliberately ignoring or neglecting the message of the Prophet or the guidance of God, indicating a sense of rejection or disobedience.
orig: أنتم عنه معرضون

translation: I had no knowledge of the highest assembly when they disputed.
interpretation: This verse highlights the humility and honesty of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), as he acknowledges his lack of knowledge about the dispute among the higher assembly of angels, emphasizing his dependence on divine revelation and guidance.
orig: ما كان لي من علم بالملإ الأعلى إذ يختصمون

translation: It is not revealed to me except that I am a clear warner.
interpretation: The verse highlights the role of the Prophet as a clear and transparent warner, emphasizing that his only responsibility is to convey the message of God, and that he is not responsible for guiding people, as guidance is in God's hands.
orig: إن يوحى إلي إلا أنما أنا نذير مبين

translation: When your Lord said to the angels, 'I am creating a human being from clay.'
interpretation: This verse highlights God's sovereignty and creative power, emphasizing that the creation of humanity is a deliberate and intentional act of God, demonstrating His ability to shape and mold life from inanimate matter.
orig: إذ قال ربك للملائكة إني خالق بشرا من طين

translation: And when I have fashioned him (in due proportion) and breathed into him of My Spirit, fall down before him prostrate.
interpretation: This verse signifies the importance of humility and submission to God's creation, in this case, Adam, who was given a special status by God, and the angels were commanded to prostrate before him, emphasizing the dignity and honor bestowed upon him by God.
orig: فإذا سويته ونفخت فيه من روحي فقعوا له ساجدين

translation: Then the angels bowed, all of them entirely.
interpretation: The verse highlights the humility and obedience of the angels, demonstrating their complete submission to God's will, and serves as a model for human beings to emulate their example in surrendering to God's commandments.
orig: فسجد الملائكة كلهم أجمعون

translation: Except Iblis, he was proud and was of the disbelievers
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogant nature of Satan, who refused to obey God's command, and instead chose to follow his own pride, thus becoming a disbeliever.
orig: إلا إبليس استكبر وكان من الكافرين

translation: He said: O Iblis, what prevented you from prostrating to him whom I created with My Hands? Did you esteem yourself or were you one of the exalted ones?
interpretation: The verse highlights Iblis' arrogance and pride, which led him to disobey God's command, and serves as a reminder that pride and self-esteem can lead to disobedience and rebellion against God's will.
orig: قال يا إبليس ما منعك أن تسجد لما خلقت بيدي أستكبرت أم كنت من العالين

translation: He said, 'I am better than he; You created me from fire, and him You created from clay.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and pride of Iblis, who refused to obey God's command to prostrate to Adam, citing his perceived superiority due to his creation from fire, which he believed to be nobler than the clay from which Adam was created.
orig: قال أنا خير منه خلقتني من نار وخلقته من طين

translation: He said: 'Get out of it, for indeed, you are accursed.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of banishment and expulsion as a consequence of disobedience and sin, emphasizing the idea that those who disobey God's commands will be rejected and separated from His mercy.
orig: قال فاخرج منها فإنك رجيم

translation: And indeed, upon you is My curse until the Day of Judgment.
interpretation: The verse conveys a sense of urgency and gravity, emphasizing that God's curse will persistently follow the wrongdoer until the Day of Judgment, implying that there will be no escape from accountability and punishment.
orig: وإن عليك لعنتي إلى يوم الدين

translation: He said: 'My Lord! Respite me until the Day they are raised.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the Prophet Moses' request to be granted respite until the Day of Resurrection, indicating his strong desire to witness the ultimate accountability of his people and to see the fulfillment of God's promise of justice and retribution.
orig: قال رب فأنظرني إلى يوم يبعثون

translation: He said: 'Then indeed you will be of those who are looked upon'
interpretation: The verse suggests that Pharaoh's statement is a declaration of his own downfall, as he will be among those who will be punished and humiliated in the hereafter, a stark contrast to his current position of power and authority.
orig: قال فإنك من المنظرين

translation: Until the Day of the Appointed Time
interpretation: The verse is emphasizing the inevitability of the Day of Judgment, where humanity will be held accountable for their actions, and the appointed time is a reminder that God has set a specific time for this event, and it will occur without fail.
orig: إلى يوم الوقت المعلوم

translation: He said: 'By Your might, I will surely mislead them all'
interpretation: This verse highlights Satan's arrogance and defiance against God, as he vows to mislead all of humanity, demonstrating his pride and ignorance of God's power and wisdom.
orig: قال فبعزتك لأغوينهم أجمعين

translation: Except Your servants among them who are purified
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that even in a corrupt and sinful society, there are always a few righteous individuals who remain faithful to God and are protected from His wrath.
orig: إلا عبادك منهم المخلصين

translation: He said: 'The truth, and the truth I say.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of speaking the truth and being truthful, emphasizing that truthfulness is a fundamental principle in one's speech and actions.
orig: قال فالحق والحق أقول

translation: I will fill Hell with you and with those who follow you among them, all together.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of following Satan and his followers, implying that those who choose to follow the path of evil will ultimately end up in Hell, where they will suffer eternal punishment.
orig: لأملأن جهنم منك وممن تبعك منهم أجمعين

translation: Say, 'I do not ask you for it any reward, and I am not of the pretenders.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the selfless nature of the Prophet Muhammad, who did not seek personal gain or reward for his prophetic mission, and instead, was driven solely by a sense of duty and responsibility to convey the message of God.
orig: قل ما أسألكم عليه من أجر وما أنا من المتكلفين

translation: Indeed, it is not but a reminder to the worlds.
interpretation: The verse highlights the universal nature of the Quran's message, emphasizing that it is a reminder for all people, regardless of their background or geographical location, and serves as a call to return to the path of righteousness and faith.
orig: إن هو إلا ذكر للعالمين

translation: And you will know its information after a while.
interpretation: The verse suggests that the truth of a matter will eventually become clear, but only after a period of time has passed, emphasizing the importance of patience and trust in God's plan.
orig: ولتعلمن نبأه بعد حين

translation: The revelation of the Book is from Allah, the Mighty, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the divine origin of the Quran, highlighting Allah's power and wisdom in revealing the Book to humanity, implying that the Quran is a manifestation of Allah's infinite power and wisdom.
orig: تنزيل الكتاب من الله العزيز الحكيم

translation: Indeed, We have sent down to you the Book in truth, so worship Allah, making your devotion sincerely to Him.
interpretation: The verse is emphasizing the exclusivity of devotion to Allah, implying that the revelation of the Book is a reminder to prioritize and focus one's worship solely on Allah, without associating partners with Him.
orig: إنا أنزلنا إليك الكتاب بالحق فاعبد الله مخلصا له الدين

translation: Unto Allah is the pure religion, and those who take protectors beside Him say, 'We only worship them that they may bring us nearer to Allah in nearness.' Lo! Allah will judge between them concerning that wherein they differ. Lo! Allah guideth not him who is a liar, a disbeliever.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of idolatry and the importance of submitting to the one true God, Allah, emphasizing that those who take protectors or idols beside Him are misguided and will ultimately be judged by Allah for their polytheism.
orig: ألا لله الدين الخالص والذين اتخذوا من دونه أولياء ما نعبدهم إلا ليقربونا إلى الله زلفى إن الله يحكم بينهم في ما هم فيه يختلفون إن الله لا يهدي من هو كاذب كفار

translation: If Allah had intended to take a son, He would have chosen from what He creates what He wills. Glorified is He, the One, the Compeller.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes God's absolute sovereignty and power, implying that if God had wanted to take a son, He would have chosen one from among His creations, but since He is the One and Only, He does not need a son or any partner.
orig: لو أراد الله أن يتخذ ولدا لاصطفى مما يخلق ما يشاء سبحانه هو الله الواحد القهار

translation: He created the heavens and the earth in truth, He rolls the night over the day and He rolls the day over the night, and He has subjected the sun and the moon, each one runs for a specified term. Is He not the Exalted, the Forgiving?
interpretation: The verse highlights God's omnipotence and control over the universe, emphasizing that His power is not limited to creation, but also extends to the continuous sustenance and management of the universe, where day and night, sun and moon, all operate according to His predetermined plan, demonstrating His infinite wisdom and mercy.
orig: خلق السماوات والأرض بالحق يكور الليل على النهار ويكور النهار على الليل وسخر الشمس والقمر كل يجري لأجل مسمى ألا هو العزيز الغفار

translation: He created you from one soul, then made from it its mate, and sent down for you eight pairs of cattle. He creates you in the wombs of your mothers, creation after creation, in three darknesses. That is Allah, your Lord, to Him belongs the kingdom, there is no god but He, then where are you turning away?
interpretation: The verse highlights the absolute power and control of God over creation, emphasizing that He is the sole ruler of the universe and the only one worthy of worship, implying that humans should turn to Him alone and not be distracted by false idols or desires.
orig: خلقكم من نفس واحدة ثم جعل منها زوجها وأنزل لكم من الأنعام ثمانية أزواج يخلقكم في بطون أمهاتكم خلقا من بعد خلق في ظلمات ثلاث ذلكم الله ربكم له الملك لا إله إلا هو فأنى تصرفون

translation: If you disbelieve, then indeed, Allah is not in need of you, and He does not approve of disbelief for His servants. And if you are grateful, He approves it for you. No bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. Then to your Lord is your return, and He will inform you about what you used to do. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of gratitude and faithfulness, emphasizing that God is not in need of human obedience, but rather it is humans who benefit from their relationship with Him, and that He is aware of the innermost thoughts and intentions of individuals.
orig: إن تكفروا فإن الله غني عنكم ولا يرضى لعباده الكفر وإن تشكروا يرضه لكم ولا تزر وازرة وزر أخرى ثم إلى ربكم مرجعكم فينبئكم بما كنتم تعملون إنه عليم بذات الصدور

translation: And when harm touches man, he calls upon his Lord, turning to Him. Then, when He grants him a favor from Him, he forgets what he called upon before and sets up rivals to Allah to mislead from His path. Say: Enjoy your disbelief for a little, indeed you are of the companions of the Fire.
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of humans who turn to God only in times of need, but once their problems are solved, they forget their dependence on Him and start to associate partners with Him, ultimately leading them to stray from the right path and deserving of punishment in the Hereafter.
orig: وإذا مس الإنسان ضر دعا ربه منيبا إليه ثم إذا خوله نعمة منه نسي ما كان يدعو إليه من قبل وجعل لله أندادا ليضل عن سبيله قل تمتع بكفرك قليلا إنك من أصحاب النار

translation: Is one who is obedient during periods of the night, prostrating and standing, fearing the Hereafter and hoping for the mercy of his Lord, say: Are those who know equal to those who do not know? Only the possessors of intellect take heed.
interpretation: The verse highlights the distinction between those who possess knowledge and wisdom, and those who do not, emphasizing that true understanding and awareness can only be achieved by those who cultivate their intellect and are mindful of the Hereafter.
orig: أمن هو قانت آناء الليل ساجدا وقائما يحذر الآخرة ويرجو رحمة ربه قل هل يستوي الذين يعلمون والذين لا يعلمون إنما يتذكر أولو الألباب

translation: Say, 'O My servants who have believed, fear your Lord. For those who have done good in this world, there is good, and the earth of Allah is spacious. Only those who are patient will be paid their reward in full, without reckoning.'
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of patience as a key to achieving spiritual growth and receiving God's reward, suggesting that those who persevere in their faith and good deeds will be granted a full and unconditional reward in the afterlife.
orig: قل يا عباد الذين آمنوا اتقوا ربكم للذين أحسنوا في هذه الدنيا حسنة وأرض الله واسعة إنما يوفى الصابرون أجرهم بغير حساب

translation: Say, 'Indeed, I have been commanded to worship Allah, [being] sincere to Him in religion'
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of sincerity in one's devotion to God, highlighting the need to prioritize a genuine and pure relationship with the Divine, free from ulterior motives or worldly influences.
orig: قل إني أمرت أن أعبد الله مخلصا له الدين

translation: And I was commanded to be the first of the Muslims
interpretation: This verse highlights the Prophet Muhammad's humility and obedience to God's command, as he is instructed to be the first to submit to Allah's will, setting an example for his followers and demonstrating the importance of humility in one's relationship with God.
orig: وأمرت لأن أكون أول المسلمين

translation: Say, 'Indeed, I fear, if I disobey my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous Day.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of obedience to God's commands, as disobedience can lead to severe consequences, and the prophet is emphasizing his own fear of God's punishment, which serves as a reminder to others to remain obedient and avoid God's wrath.
orig: قل إني أخاف إن عصيت ربي عذاب يوم عظيم

translation: Say, 'Allah, I have devoted my worship to You, purifying it for You alone.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of sincerity in worship, highlighting the need to dedicate one's devotion to Allah alone, free from any polytheistic or idolatrous influences.
orig: قل الله أعبد مخلصا له ديني

translation: Worship what you will besides Him. Say: 'The losers are those who will lose themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection. Is not that a clear loss?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of idolatry, emphasizing that those who worship false gods will ultimately suffer loss, not only personally but also in terms of their relationships, on the Day of Judgment.
orig: فاعبدوا ما شئتم من دونه قل إن الخاسرين الذين خسروا أنفسهم وأهليهم يوم القيامة ألا ذلك هو الخسران المبين

translation: Above them are shades of fire, and below them are shades; thus Allah frightens His servants. O servants, fear Him.
interpretation: The verse is highlighting the severity of God's warning to His servants, emphasizing the consequences of disobedience by painting a vivid picture of hellfire, where the damned are surrounded by flames from above and below, serving as a stark reminder to fear and obey God.
orig: لهم من فوقهم ظلل من النار ومن تحتهم ظلل ذلك يخوف الله به عباده يا عباد فاتقون

translation: And those who avoid the Taghut, that they may worship it, and turn to Allah, for them are the good tidings. So give good tidings to the servants.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of avoiding false gods and idols, and instead turning to Allah, which is a prerequisite for receiving good tidings and blessings from God.
orig: والذين اجتنبوا الطاغوت أن يعبدوها وأنابوا إلى الله لهم البشرى فبشر عباد

translation: Those who listen to the statement and follow the best of it, those are the ones whom God has guided, and those are the ones possessing intellect.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of intellectual discernment in accepting guidance from God, implying that only those who possess intellect and wisdom are capable of recognizing and following the truth.
orig: الذين يستمعون القول فيتبعون أحسنه أولئك الذين هداهم الله وأولئك هم أولو الألباب

translation: Then, is one upon whom the word of punishment has been justified [to be saved]? Or do you save one who is in the Fire?
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that those who have been condemned to punishment by God's decree are beyond salvation, and that no one can rescue them from their fate, emphasizing the inevitability and finality of God's judgment.
orig: أفمن حق عليه كلمة العذاب أفأنت تنقذ من في النار

translation: But those who feared their Lord, for them are chambers with canopies built high, beneath which rivers flow, and Allah has promised, and Allah does not fail in His promise.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of spiritual ascension, where believers who have attained a high level of spiritual awareness and fear of God are rewarded with a state of eternal bliss, symbolized by the 'chambers with canopies built high', where they can experience the ultimate joy and contentment, with 'rivers flowing beneath them'.
orig: لكن الذين اتقوا ربهم لهم غرف من فوقها غرف مبنية تجري من تحتها الأنهار وعد الله لا يخلف الله الميعاد

translation: Do you not see that Allah sends down from the sky water, then it flows as springs on the earth, then brings forth with it crops of varying colors, then they wither, and you see them turn yellow, then He makes them debris. Indeed, in that is a reminder for those of understanding.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of reflecting on the natural world and recognizing the signs of God's power and wisdom, encouraging the development of a deeper understanding and appreciation of God's creation.
orig: ألم تر أن الله أنزل من السماء ماء فسلكه ينابيع في الأرض ثم يخرج به زرعا مختلفا ألوانه ثم يهيج فتراه مصفرا ثم يجعله حطاما إن في ذلك لذكرى لأولي الألباب

translation: Is one whose breast Allah has expanded for Islam, so he walks in the light of his Lord? So woe to those whose hearts are hardened against the remembrance of Allah, those are in manifest error.
interpretation: The verse highlights the contrast between the believer whose heart has been opened to Islam and is guided by God's light, and the hardened hearts that refuse to remember and obey God, emphasizing the clear distinction between those who are on the right path and those who are in manifest error.
orig: أفمن شرح الله صدره للإسلام فهو على نور من ربه فويل للقاسية قلوبهم من ذكر الله أولئك في ضلال مبين

translation: Allah has sent down the best statement, a Book consistent in its repetition, whereat shiver the skins of those who fear their Lord, then their skins and their hearts become soft to the remembrance of Allah; that is the guidance of Allah, with which He guides whom He wills, and whom Allah sends astray, there is no guide for him.
interpretation: The verse highlights the transformative power of the Quran, which has the ability to touch the hearts and souls of those who fear Allah, causing them to soften and become receptive to its guidance, and ultimately leading them to a path of righteousness.
orig: الله نزل أحسن الحديث كتابا متشابها مثاني تقشعر منه جلود الذين يخشون ربهم ثم تلين جلودهم وقلوبهم إلى ذكر الله ذلك هدى الله يهدي به من يشاء ومن يضلل الله فما له من هاد

translation: Then is one who wills to shield himself with his face against the evil of the punishment on the Day of Resurrection? And it will be said to the wrongdoers, 'Taste what you used to earn.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of trying to escape the consequences of one's actions on the Day of Judgment, emphasizing that everyone will ultimately face the repercussions of their deeds, and that the wrongdoers will be forced to confront the bitter fruits of their own actions.
orig: أفمن يتقي بوجهه سوء العذاب يوم القيامة وقيل للظالمين ذوقوا ما كنتم تكسبون

translation: Those who were before them belied, so the punishment came to them from where they did not perceive.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of sudden and unexpected punishment, where those who rejected the truth were caught off guard, emphasizing the idea that God's justice can strike at any moment, regardless of one's preparation or awareness.
orig: كذب الذين من قبلهم فأتاهم العذاب من حيث لا يشعرون

translation: So Allah made them taste the humiliation in the life of the world, and the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if only they knew.
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that those who are punished in this life are only getting a taste of the greater punishment that awaits them in the Hereafter, implying that the punishment in the Hereafter is far more severe and long-lasting.
orig: فأذاقهم الله الخزي في الحياة الدنيا ولعذاب الآخرة أكبر لو كانوا يعلمون

translation: And indeed, We have presented for the people in this Qur'an every kind of example, that they might remember.
interpretation: The verse highlights the comprehensive nature of the Quran, which provides guidance and wisdom through various examples and anecdotes, with the ultimate goal of reminding humanity of the importance of living a righteous life and remembering their accountability to God.
orig: ولقد ضربنا للناس في هذا القرآن من كل مثل لعلهم يتذكرون

translation: A Book, an Arabic Quran, not divergent that they may guard (against evil)
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of the Quran as a guide for humanity, emphasizing its Arabic origin and its role in promoting righteousness and preventing evil, thereby serving as a warning to those who stray from the path of virtue.
orig: قرآنا عربيا غير ذي عوج لعلهم يتقون

translation: Allah presents an example: a slave owned by quarrelsome partners and another belonging entirely to one man - are they equal in comparison? Praise be to Allah, but most of them do not know.
interpretation: The verse highlights the difference between those who are torn between multiple desires and loyalties, and those who are singularly devoted to one purpose, implying that a person who is fully committed to their faith is far superior to one who is divided in their allegiance.
orig: ضرب الله مثلا رجلا فيه شركاء متشاكسون ورجلا سلما لرجل هل يستويان مثلا الحمد لله بل أكثرهم لا يعلمون

translation: Verily, you will die, and verily, they will die.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the inevitability of death, reminding the Prophet and all humanity that they will eventually meet their end, and that their enemies will also face the same fate, thus putting things into perspective and encouraging the Prophet to remain steadfast in the face of adversity.
orig: إنك ميت وإنهم ميتون

translation: Then indeed you, on the Day of Resurrection, before your Lord, will dispute.
interpretation: The verse highlights the accountability of humanity before God on the Day of Judgment, where individuals will be held responsible for their actions and will dispute or argue with God about their deeds, implying a sense of regret and remorse for their past mistakes.
orig: ثم إنكم يوم القيامة عند ربكم تختصمون

translation: And who is more unjust than he who lies against Allah and rejects the truth when it comes to him? Is not in Hell a dwelling place for the disbelievers?
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of rejecting the truth and lying against God, implying that such an action is a fundamental form of injustice, and that those who do so will ultimately face the consequences of their actions in Hell.
orig: فمن أظلم ممن كذب على الله وكذب بالصدق إذ جاءه أليس في جهنم مثوى للكافرين

translation: And he who has brought the truth and those who believe therein, those are the righteous.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of accepting and believing in the truth, as it is only those who do so that can be considered truly righteous.
orig: والذي جاء بالصدق وصدق به أولئك هم المتقون

translation: They shall have what they wish for with their Lord; that is the reward of the doers of good.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who do good deeds will be granted their heart's desires in the hereafter, implying a sense of ultimate fulfillment and happiness in paradise.
orig: لهم ما يشاءون عند ربهم ذلك جزاء المحسنين

translation: That Allah may forgive them for the worst of what they did, and reward them with the best of what they used to do.
interpretation: The verse suggests that God's mercy and forgiveness can surpass even the worst of human actions, and that He can reward believers with a goodness that is greater than their own good deeds.
orig: ليكفر الله عنهم أسوأ الذي عملوا ويجزيهم أجرهم بأحسن الذي كانوا يعملون

translation: Is not Allah sufficient for His servant, and yet they try to frighten you with those besides Him! And if Allah should guide him, none can mislead him. Is not Allah Exalted in Power, Wise?
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the sufficiency of Allah's guidance and protection for His believers, and that no one can mislead them if Allah has guided them, implying that true believers should have complete trust in Allah's power and wisdom.
orig: أليس الله بكاف عبده ويخوفونك بالذين من دونه ومن يضلل الله فما له من هاد

translation: And he whom Allah guides, there is none to mislead, is not Allah Mighty in Power, Wise in Retribution?
interpretation: The verse highlights the absolute authority and power of God, emphasizing that whoever is guided by Him cannot be led astray, and that God's power and wisdom in exacting retribution are unmatched.
orig: ومن يهد الله فما له من مضل أليس الله بعزيز ذي انتقام

translation: And if you were to ask them, 'Who created the heavens and the earth?' They would say, 'Allah.' Say, 'Then do you see what you invoke besides Allah? If Allah should afflict me with harm, are they removers of the harm? Or if He should show me mercy, are they withholders of His mercy?' Say, 'Sufficient for me is Allah; upon Him the [true] believers rely.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the inconsistency of those who acknowledge Allah as the Creator of the universe, yet still invoke and rely on other entities besides Him, implying that true reliance and trust should be placed solely in Allah.
orig: ولئن سألتهم من خلق السماوات والأرض ليقولن الله قل أفرأيتم ما تدعون من دون الله إن أرادني الله بضر هل هن كاشفات ضره أو أرادني برحمة هل هن ممسكات رحمته قل حسبي الله عليه يتوكل المتوكلون

translation: Say, 'O my people, act according to your ability; I, too, am acting; and you will come to know'
interpretation: The verse conveys a sense of confidence and determination, where the prophet is challenging his people to do their best, while he is also doing his, and ultimately, the truth will prevail and the people will come to know the reality.
orig: قل يا قوم اعملوا على مكانتكم إني عامل فسوف تعلمون

translation: Whoever comes to him with a penalty, he will be humiliated, and a lasting punishment will be inflicted on him.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of rejecting the message of the prophets, where those who reject the truth will be met with humiliation and a perpetual punishment, emphasizing the gravity of rejecting divine guidance.
orig: من يأتيه عذاب يخزيه ويحل عليه عذاب مقيم

translation: Indeed, We have sent down to you the Book for mankind with the truth. So whoever is guided is guided for his own soul, and whoever goes astray only goes astray against himself. And you are not a guardian over them.
interpretation: This verse highlights the personal responsibility of each individual in their spiritual journey, emphasizing that guidance and misguidance are ultimately a matter of individual choice, and that no one can be held accountable for the actions of others.
orig: إنا أنزلنا عليك الكتاب للناس بالحق فمن اهتدى فلنفسه ومن ضل فإنما يضل عليها وما أنت عليهم بوكيل

translation: Allah takes the souls at the time of their death, and those that do not die, during their sleep. He withholds those on whom He has decreed death and releases the others for a specified term. Indeed, in that are signs for a people who reflect.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's absolute control over human life, demonstrating that He has the power to take souls at the moment of death, as well as during sleep, emphasizing the inevitability of death and the transience of human life.
orig: الله يتوفى الأنفس حين موتها والتي لم تمت في منامها فيمسك التي قضى عليها الموت ويرسل الأخرى إلى أجل مسمى إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يتفكرون

translation: Or have they taken besides Allah intercessors? Say: 'Even though they do not possess anything nor do they understand.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of seeking intercession from anyone or anything other than Allah, emphasizing that those to whom one turns for intercession are themselves powerless and lacking in understanding.
orig: أم اتخذوا من دون الله شفعاء قل أولو كانوا لا يملكون شيئا ولا يعقلون

translation: Say, 'To Allah belongs the intercession entirely; His is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and to Him you will be returned.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute authority and sovereignty of Allah, implying that only He has the power to intercede on behalf of humanity, and that ultimately, all things will return to Him, emphasizing His total control over the universe and human destiny.
orig: قل لله الشفاعة جميعا له ملك السماوات والأرض ثم إليه ترجعون

translation: And when Allah alone is mentioned, the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter are repelled, and when those besides Him are mentioned, behold, they rejoice.
interpretation: The verse highlights the contrast in the reactions of believers and non-believers when God is mentioned, with the former being filled with reverence and the latter being repelled, and how they instead rejoice at the mention of false gods, revealing their true allegiance.
orig: وإذا ذكر الله وحده اشمأزت قلوب الذين لا يؤمنون بالآخرة وإذا ذكر الذين من دونه إذا هم يستبشرون

translation: Say, [O Muhammad], 'O Allah, Creator of the heavens and the earth, Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, You judge between Your servants in that over which they used to differ.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the role of Allah as the ultimate Judge and Arbiter in the disputes and differences among humans, emphasizing His omniscience and ability to discern the truth, and thus, His judgment is the most authoritative and trustworthy.
orig: قل اللهم فاطر السماوات والأرض عالم الغيب والشهادة أنت تحكم بين عبادك في ما كانوا فيه يختلفون

translation: And if those who did wrong had all that is in the earth and as much again with it, they would offer it to ransom themselves from the evil of the punishment on the Day of Resurrection; and there will appear to them from Allah what they had not reckoned.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of the punishment on the Day of Resurrection, implying that even if the wrongdoers possessed all the wealth in the world, it would be insufficient to redeem them from the consequences of their actions, and that they will be faced with a reality that they had not anticipated.
orig: ولو أن للذين ظلموا ما في الأرض جميعا ومثله معه لافتدوا به من سوء العذاب يوم القيامة وبدا لهم من الله ما لم يكونوا يحتسبون

translation: And the evil of what they earned caught up with them, and that which they used to mock befell them.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of reaping what one sows, where the consequences of one's actions will ultimately catch up with them, and that which they once mocked or took lightly will become their own reality, serving as a form of divine retribution.
orig: وبدا لهم سيئات ما كسبوا وحاق بهم ما كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: And when harm touches man, he calls upon Us, then when We grant him a favor from Us, he says: 'I was given it only because of knowledge.' Nay, it is a trial, but most of them do not know.
interpretation: The verse highlights human hypocrisy, where people turn to God in times of need, but when their problems are solved, they attribute their success to their own abilities and knowledge, forgetting the role of God's mercy and ignoring the fact that their prosperity is a test of their gratitude and faith.
orig: فإذا مس الإنسان ضر دعانا ثم إذا خولناه نعمة منا قال إنما أوتيته على علم بل هي فتنة ولكن أكثرهم لا يعلمون

translation: Those who were before them said the same, but it did not avail them what they used to earn.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of worldly gains and achievements in the face of God's judgment, implying that even if one accumulates wealth and power, it will not be of any benefit on the Day of Reckoning.
orig: قد قالها الذين من قبلهم فما أغنى عنهم ما كانوا يكسبون

translation: So the evil consequences of what they earned caught up with them, and those who have wronged among these will be afflicted with the evil consequences of what they earned, and they will not be able to escape.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of personal responsibility, where individuals are held accountable for their actions, and the consequences of their wrongdoings will inevitably catch up with them, leaving them with no means of escape or avoidance.
orig: فأصابهم سيئات ما كسبوا والذين ظلموا من هؤلاء سيصيبهم سيئات ما كسبوا وما هم بمعجزين

translation: Did they not know that Allah enlarges the provision for whom He wills and straitens it (for whom He wills). Verily, in this are signs for a people who believe.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that God's provision is not based on human effort or material possessions, but rather on His divine will, and that those who believe in God's power and wisdom will trust in His provision, regardless of their circumstances.
orig: أولم يعلموا أن الله يبسط الرزق لمن يشاء ويقدر إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يؤمنون

translation: Say, 'O My servants who have transgressed against their own souls, do not despair of Allah's mercy. Indeed, Allah forgives all sins. Indeed, it is He who is the Forgiving, the Merciful.'
interpretation: This verse conveys the message of hope and forgiveness, reminding believers that no matter how great their sins, Allah's mercy and forgiveness are always within reach, and that one should never lose hope in Allah's compassion and pardon.
orig: قل يا عبادي الذين أسرفوا على أنفسهم لا تقنطوا من رحمة الله إن الله يغفر الذنوب جميعا إنه هو الغفور الرحيم

translation: And turn in repentance to your Lord, and submit to Him, before the punishment comes to you, then you will not be helped.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of seeking forgiveness and turning to God before it's too late, as once the punishment comes, it will be too late to seek help or forgiveness.
orig: وأنيبوا إلى ربكم وأسلموا له من قبل أن يأتيكم العذاب ثم لا تنصرون

translation: Follow the best of what has been revealed to you from your Lord before the punishment comes to you suddenly while you are unaware.
interpretation: The verse is urging people to follow the divine guidance and teachings revealed to them before it's too late, as God's punishment can come suddenly and unexpectedly, catching them off guard.
orig: واتبعوا أحسن ما أنزل إليكم من ربكم من قبل أن يأتيكم العذاب بغتة وأنتم لا تشعرون

translation: Oh, would that I had sent forth (good deeds) for (the life) in the Hereafter! Oh, woe is me! For I was among those who mocked.
interpretation: This verse highlights the regret and remorse that a person will feel on the Day of Judgment when they realize they had wasted their opportunities to do good deeds and instead spent their time in mockery and disbelief, and are now facing the consequences of their actions.
orig: أن تقول نفس يا حسرتا على ما فرطت في جنب الله وإن كنت لمن الساخرين

translation: Or say: 'If Allah had guided me, I would have been of the righteous.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the tendency of people to make excuses for their lack of faith and righteousness, blaming their circumstances and lack of guidance, rather than taking responsibility for their own actions and seeking guidance from God.
orig: أو تقول لو أن الله هداني لكنت من المتقين

translation: Or do you think - when you see the punishment - if only I had another turn, then I would be among the good-doers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the regret and remorse that comes with seeing the consequences of one's actions, and the realization that one should have lived a more virtuous life, but it's too late now.
orig: أو تقول حين ترى العذاب لو أن لي كرة فأكون من المحسنين

translation: Nay, there came to you My signs, but you denied them, and were proud, and were among the disbelievers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the stubborn refusal of individuals to accept the truth, despite being presented with clear signs and evidence, and instead, they chose to deny and reject the message, exemplifying their arrogance and disbelief.
orig: بلى قد جاءتك آياتي فكذبت بها واستكبرت وكنت من الكافرين

translation: And on the Day of Resurrection, you will see those who lied about Allah, their faces will be blackened. Is not in Hell a dwelling place for the arrogant?
interpretation: The verse highlights the humiliation and shame that will befall those who rejected God's signs and truths, and instead chose to follow their own desires and arrogance, and how they will be punished in Hell, which is a fitting abode for those who were too proud to submit to God's will.
orig: ويوم القيامة ترى الذين كذبوا على الله وجوههم مسودة أليس في جهنم مثوى للمتكبرين

translation: And Allah will deliver those who were God-fearing, by their victory; no evil will touch them, nor will they grieve.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who are God-fearing and righteous will ultimately be saved and protected by God, and will not be affected by evil or harm, and will not experience sorrow or grief.
orig: وينجي الله الذين اتقوا بمفازتهم لا يمسهم السوء ولا هم يحزنون

translation: Allah is the Creator of all things, and He is, over all things, a Guardian.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's absolute authority and control over all creation, emphasizing that He is the sole Creator and Guardian of everything, implying His omnipotence and omniscience.
orig: الله خالق كل شيء وهو على كل شيء وكيل

translation: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth, and those who disbelieve in the signs of Allah, those are the losers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the absolute power and control of God over the universe, emphasizing that those who reject the signs and revelations of God are ultimately doomed to failure and loss.
orig: له مقاليد السماوات والأرض والذين كفروا بآيات الله أولئك هم الخاسرون

translation: Say: 'Is it other than Allah that I should worship, O foolish ones?'
interpretation: The verse highlights the absurdity of worshiping anything other than Allah, emphasizing the foolishness of those who reject the oneness of God and instead turn to false idols or deities.
orig: قل أفغير الله تأمروني أعبد أيها الجاهلون

translation: And indeed, it has been revealed to you and to those before you: If you associate partners with Allah, your deeds will certainly come to nothing and you will surely be among the losers.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of maintaining the purity of faith, warning that associating partners with God will render one's deeds worthless and lead to spiritual loss.
orig: ولقد أوحي إليك وإلى الذين من قبلك لئن أشركت ليحبطن عملك ولتكونن من الخاسرين

translation: Then, [O Muhammad], worship Allah and be among the grateful.
interpretation: This verse is an exhortation to the Prophet Muhammad, and by extension to all believers, to focus on worshiping Allah and cultivating a sense of gratitude, recognizing the blessings and favors bestowed upon them.
orig: بل الله فاعبد وكن من الشاكرين

translation: And they have not esteemed Allah with the esteem that is due to Him. And the earth entirely will be in His grip on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens will be folded in His right hand. Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.
interpretation: The verse highlights the inadequacy of human perception of God's power and majesty, emphasizing that humans have consistently underestimated God's greatness, and that on the Day of Judgment, God's omnipotence will be manifest in His dominion over the entire universe.
orig: وما قدروا الله حق قدره والأرض جميعا قبضته يوم القيامة والسماوات مطويات بيمينه سبحانه وتعالى عما يشركون

translation: And the trumpet will be blown, so all those in the heavens and the earth will swoon, except whom Allah wills; then it will be blown again, and they will be standing, looking on.
interpretation: The verse describes the moment of resurrection, where the blowing of the trumpet marks the end of the world and the beginning of the judgment day, and highlights the sudden and dramatic transformation of all creatures, from a state of unconsciousness to one of awareness and accountability.
orig: ونفخ في الصور فصعق من في السماوات ومن في الأرض إلا من شاء الله ثم نفخ فيه أخرى فإذا هم قيام ينظرون

translation: And the earth shone with the light of its Lord, and the Book was placed, and the prophets and the witnesses were brought, and judgment was passed among them with truth, and they were not wronged.
interpretation: The verse describes the Day of Judgment, where the earth is illuminated with the light of God's justice, and the Book of Deeds is presented, and the prophets and witnesses testify, and God's judgment is rendered with absolute truth and fairness, ensuring that no one is wronged or oppressed.
orig: وأشرقت الأرض بنور ربها ووضع الكتاب وجيء بالنبيين والشهداء وقضي بينهم بالحق وهم لا يظلمون

translation: And every soul will be fully compensated for what it has earned, and He is most knowing of what they do.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes God's absolute justice and fairness, where every individual will receive exactly what they deserve based on their actions, and God's all-encompassing knowledge ensures that no deed goes unnoticed or unrewarded.
orig: ووفيت كل نفس ما عملت وهو أعلم بما يفعلون

translation: And those who disbelieved will be driven to Hell in groups, until, when they reach it, its gates will be opened. And its keepers will say, 'Did there not come to you messengers from among you, reciting to you the verses of your Lord and warning you of the meeting of this Day of yours?' They will say, 'Yes, but the word of punishment has been fulfilled against the disbelievers.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the accountability of those who reject faith, emphasizing that they will be held responsible for their actions and will face the consequences of their disbelief, implying that they had been warned and had the opportunity to change their ways, but chose not to.
orig: وسيق الذين كفروا إلى جهنم زمرا حتى إذا جاءوها فتحت أبوابها وقال لهم خزنتها ألم يأتكم رسل منكم يتلون عليكم آيات ربكم وينذرونكم لقاء يومكم هذا قالوا بلى ولكن حقت كلمة العذاب على الكافرين

translation: It will be said, 'Enter the gates of Hell, to dwell therein, and evil is the residence of the arrogant.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the ultimate fate of those who are arrogant, emphasizing that their pride and haughtiness will lead them to a terrible and eternal punishment in Hell, where they will be forced to dwell forever.
orig: قيل ادخلوا أبواب جهنم خالدين فيها فبئس مثوى المتكبرين

translation: And those who fear their Lord will be led to the Garden in groups, until, when they reach it, and its gates are opened, and its keepers say to them, 'Peace be upon you, you have been good, so enter it, abiding eternally.'
interpretation: The verse describes the welcoming of the righteous into Paradise, where they will be greeted with peace and blessings, and will enter into eternal bliss, free from all worries and troubles.
orig: وسيق الذين اتقوا ربهم إلى الجنة زمرا حتى إذا جاءوها وفتحت أبوابها وقال لهم خزنتها سلام عليكم طبتم فادخلوها خالدين

translation: And they will say: 'Praise be to Allah, Who has fulfilled His promise to us and has made us inherit the earth, so we may settle in Paradise wherever we will. How excellent is the reward of the workers!
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate triumph and satisfaction of the righteous believers in the Hereafter, where they will inherit the earth and enjoy the blessings of Paradise, emphasizing their hard work and dedication to their faith as the key to achieving this eternal reward.
orig: وقالوا الحمد لله الذي صدقنا وعده وأورثنا الأرض نتبوأ من الجنة حيث نشاء فنعم أجر العاملين

translation: And you will see the angels surrounding the Throne, glorifying their Lord with praise, and judgment will be made between them with truth, and it will be said, 'Praise to Allah, Lord of the Worlds.'
interpretation: The verse is describing the Day of Judgment, where the angels will be surrounding the Throne of God, glorifying Him with praise, and God's judgment will be revealed, emphasizing the ultimate authority and power of God as the Lord of the Worlds.
orig: وترى الملائكة حافين من حول العرش يسبحون بحمد ربهم وقضي بينهم بالحق وقيل الحمد لله رب العالمين

translation: Ha. Mim.
interpretation: The mysterious letters at the beginning of some chapters in the Quran, including this one, are a reminder of the divine origin of the scripture and a call to pay attention to the message that follows.
orig: حم

translation: The sending down of the Book is from Allah, the Mighty, the All-Knowing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the divine origin of the Quran, emphasizing that it is a revelation from an all-powerful and all-knowing God, implying that the Book is a trustworthy and authoritative guide for humanity.
orig: تنزيل الكتاب من الله العزيز العليم

translation: The Forgiver of sin, the Acceptor of repentance, Severe in punishment, Owner of abundance. There is no god except Him; to Him is the final return.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's merciful nature, emphasizing that He is willing to forgive and accept repentance, but also warning of His severe punishment, implying that one should not take His mercy for granted and should strive to live a righteous life.
orig: غافر الذنب وقابل التوب شديد العقاب ذي الطول لا إله إلا هو إليه المصير

translation: None argue concerning the Signs of Allah except those who disbelieve, so let not their movement to and fro in the land deceive you.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of arguing with those who reject the signs of God, as their denial is rooted in their disbelief, and their apparent freedom and movement in the land is no indication of their true spiritual state.
orig: ما يجادل في آيات الله إلا الذين كفروا فلا يغررك تقلبهم في البلاد

translation: Denied before them the people of Noah and the factions after them, and every nation plotted against their messenger to seize him, and disputed with falsehood to refute the truth, so I seized them, then how was My punishment?
interpretation: The verse highlights the pattern of disobedience and rejection of prophets by nations throughout history, which ultimately led to their downfall, emphasizing that God's punishment is inevitable for those who reject the truth.
orig: كذبت قبلهم قوم نوح والأحزاب من بعدهم وهمت كل أمة برسولهم ليأخذوه وجادلوا بالباطل ليدحضوا به الحق فأخذتهم فكيف كان عقاب

translation: And thus has the Word of your Lord been justified against the disbelievers, that they will be the inmates of the Fire.
interpretation: The verse highlights the inevitability of punishment for those who reject faith, emphasizing that their fate is sealed and they will ultimately end up in Hell, a consequence of their own choices and actions.
orig: وكذلك حقت كلمت ربك على الذين كفروا أنهم أصحاب النار

translation: Those who carry the Throne and those around it glorify their Lord with praise and believe in Him and ask forgiveness for those who believe: 'Our Lord, You have encompassed all things in mercy and knowledge, so forgive those who have repented and followed Your way and protect them from the punishment of Hell.'
interpretation: The verse suggests that even the highest angels and those closest to God's throne are humble enough to ask for forgiveness on behalf of believers, which highlights the importance of humility and intercession in the pursuit of God's mercy.
orig: الذين يحملون العرش ومن حوله يسبحون بحمد ربهم ويؤمنون به ويستغفرون للذين آمنوا ربنا وسعت كل شيء رحمة وعلما فاغفر للذين تابوا واتبعوا سبيلك وقهم عذاب الجحيم

translation: Our Lord, and admit them to Gardens of Eden which You have promised them, and also those who were righteous among their fathers, wives, and offspring. Indeed, You are the Exalted in Power, the Wise.
interpretation: The verse conveys the idea that the righteous individuals, along with their family members, will be rewarded with paradise, emphasizing the importance of family ties and the collective nature of salvation in Islam.
orig: ربنا وأدخلهم جنات عدن التي وعدتهم ومن صلح من آبائهم وأزواجهم وذرياتهم إنك أنت العزيز الحكيم

translation: And ward off the evil ( deeds) and whoever warded off the evil deeds on that day, then indeed, he has attained mercy, and that is the great success.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of self-reflection and self-purification, emphasizing that those who are able to overcome their own evil tendencies and desires on the Day of Judgment will be granted mercy and achieve great success.
orig: وقهم السيئات ومن تق السيئات يومئذ فقد رحمته وذلك هو الفوز العظيم

translation: Those who disbelieve will be addressed: 'God's hatred of you when you were called to the faith and you used to refuse, is greater than your hatred of yourselves when you were called to the faith and you used to refuse.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the irony of those who reject faith, as they will ultimately realize that God's displeasure towards them is far greater than their own self-loathing for not accepting the faith when they had the opportunity.
orig: إن الذين كفروا ينادون لمقت الله أكبر من مقتكم أنفسكم إذ تدعون إلى الإيمان فتكفرون

translation: They will say: Our Lord! We have wronged ourselves. If then Thou forgive us not and have not mercy on us, we shall certainly be of the losers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the realization of one's mistakes and the importance of seeking forgiveness, emphasizing the need for humility and acknowledgment of one's wrongdoings in order to receive mercy and avoid loss.
orig: قالوا ربنا أمتنا اثنتين وأحييتنا اثنتين فاعترفنا بذنوبنا فهل إلى خروج من سبيل

translation: That is because when Allah Alone was called to, you disbelieved, and when partners were associated with Him, you believed. The judgment is with Allah, the Most High, the Most Great.
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who reject the oneness of God when He is worshiped alone, but accept Him when He is associated with other deities, implying that they only accept God's power when it is shared with others, revealing their lack of faith in God's absolute authority.
orig: ذلكم بأنه إذا دعي الله وحده كفرتم وإن يشرك به تؤمنوا فالحكم لله العلي الكبير

translation: It is He who shows you His signs and sends down for you provision from the sky; and none remembers but he who turns back.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of gratitude and recognition of God's blessings, emphasizing that only those who are humble and receptive to God's guidance will truly appreciate and acknowledge His signs and provisions.
orig: هو الذي يريكم آياته وينزل لكم من السماء رزقا وما يتذكر إلا من ينيب

translation: Invoke Allah, making your devotion sincere to Him, even if the disbelievers dislike it.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of sincerity in one's devotion to Allah, even in the face of opposition or dislike from others, highlighting the need to prioritize one's relationship with Allah above all else.
orig: فادعوا الله مخلصين له الدين ولو كره الكافرون

translation: The Exalted One, the Owner of the Throne, sends down the Spirit from His Command upon whomever He wills of His servants to warn of the Day of Encounter.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's power and authority in guiding humanity, emphasizing that it is God who chooses who will receive His guidance and inspiration, and that this guidance is a warning to humanity of the Day of Judgment.
orig: رفيع الدرجات ذو العرش يلقي الروح من أمره على من يشاء من عباده لينذر يوم التلاق

translation: The Day they come forth, nothing concerning them will be hidden from Allah. To whom does the kingdom belong today? To Allah, the One, the Irresistible.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that on the Day of Judgment, all secrets will be revealed and nothing will be hidden from God, emphasizing God's absolute power and sovereignty over all creation.
orig: يوم هم بارزون لا يخفى على الله منهم شيء لمن الملك اليوم لله الواحد القهار

translation: Today every soul will be recompensed for what it has earned; no injustice today, indeed Allah is swift in account.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of individual accountability and that every person will be judged based on their own actions, emphasizing the idea that justice will be served and no one will be wronged, as Allah's reckoning is swift and accurate.
orig: اليوم تجزى كل نفس بما كسبت لا ظلم اليوم إن الله سريع الحساب

translation: And warn them of the Day of the Overwhelming, when the hearts will be choking the throats, grief-stricken. No intimate friend nor intercessor will be of any benefit to the wrongdoers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the severity of the Day of Judgment, where the wrongdoers will be overwhelmed with grief and despair, and their supposed allies and intercessors will be of no help to them, emphasizing the idea that on that day, only individual deeds will matter.
orig: وأنذرهم يوم الآزفة إذ القلوب لدى الحناجر كاظمين ما للظالمين من حميم ولا شفيع يطاع

translation: He knows the treachery of the eyes and what the breasts conceal.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's omniscience, emphasizing that He is aware of not only our outward actions, but also our innermost thoughts and intentions, even those we attempt to hide from others.
orig: يعلم خائنة الأعين وما تخفي الصدور

translation: And Allah judges with the truth, and those whom they invoke besides Him do not judge at all; indeed, Allah - He is the Hearing, the Seeing.
interpretation: The verse highlights the uniqueness of Allah's judgment, emphasizing that He is the only one who judges with absolute truth and justice, whereas false deities and idols are incapable of rendering any judgment, and Allah's omniscience and omnipotence are underscored by His attributes as the Hearing and the Seeing.
orig: والله يقضي بالحق والذين يدعون من دونه لا يقضون بشيء إن الله هو السميع البصير

translation: Did they not travel in the land and see what was the end of those who were before them? They were stronger than them in power and in traces on the earth, but Allah seized them for their sins, and they had none to protect them from Allah.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of learning from the past and the consequences of disobedience to God, highlighting that even the strongest and most powerful civilizations can fall, and that no one is above God's justice and punishment.
orig: أولم يسيروا في الأرض فينظروا كيف كان عاقبة الذين كانوا من قبلهم كانوا هم أشد منهم قوة وآثارا في الأرض فأخذهم الله بذنوبهم وما كان لهم من الله من واق

translation: That is because their messengers used to come to them with clear proofs, but they used to disbelieve, so God seized them. Indeed, He is Powerful and severe in punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of rejecting divine guidance and the prophets who brought clear signs and proofs, emphasizing that those who refuse to accept the truth will ultimately face God's wrath and punishment.
orig: ذلك بأنهم كانت تأتيهم رسلهم بالبينات فكفروا فأخذهم الله إنه قوي شديد العقاب

translation: And indeed We sent Moses with Our signs and a clear authority
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of authority and legitimacy in leadership, emphasizing that true leaders are those who are chosen by God and possess a clear mandate to guide humanity.
orig: ولقد أرسلنا موسى بآياتنا وسلطان مبين

translation: To Pharaoh, Haman and Qarun, so they said: 'A sorcerer, a liar'
interpretation: This verse highlights the tendency of those in power to reject the truth and instead slander and defame the prophets of God, exemplified by Pharaoh, Haman, and Qarun, who accused the prophets of being sorcerers and liars, demonstrating their arrogance and refusal to accept the divine message.
orig: إلى فرعون وهامان وقارون فقالوا ساحر كذاب

translation: But when there came to them the Truth from Us, they said: 'Slay the sons of those who believe with him, and spare their women.' But the guile of the Unbelievers is nothing but in error.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futile attempts of the disbelievers to thwart the spread of the Truth, as they resort to brutal means such as killing the sons of believers and sparing their women, only to ultimately fail in their endeavors due to their own misguided nature.
orig: فلما جاءهم بالحق من عندنا قالوا اقتلوا أبناء الذين آمنوا معه واستحيوا نساءهم وما كيد الكافرين إلا في ضلال

translation: And Pharaoh said, 'Leave me to kill Moses, and let him call upon his Lord. Indeed, I fear that he may change your religion, or that he may cause mischief to appear in the land.'
interpretation: The verse highlights Pharaoh's arrogance and tyranny, as he tries to justify his attempt to kill Moses, claiming that Moses' presence poses a threat to the established religious and social order, thus revealing Pharaoh's own insecurity and fear of losing power.
orig: وقال فرعون ذروني أقتل موسى وليدع ربه إني أخاف أن يبدل دينكم أو أن يظهر في الأرض الفساد

translation: And Moses said: 'I take refuge with my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant one who does not believe in the Day of Reckoning.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of seeking protection from God against those who are arrogant and reject the idea of accountability on the Day of Judgment, emphasizing the need for humility and faith in the face of divine justice.
orig: وقال موسى إني عذت بربي وربكم من كل متكبر لا يؤمن بيوم الحساب

translation: And a believing man from Pharaoh's family, who had concealed his faith, said: 'Will you kill a man because he says: "My Lord is Allah," and has come to you with clear signs from your Lord, and if he is a liar, his lie is upon him, and if he is truthful, some of that which he promises you will befall you. Indeed, Allah does not guide one who is extravagant and a liar.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of considering the consequences of one's actions, as the believing man is warning his people that if they kill the prophet, they will have to face the wrath of God, and if the prophet is truthful, they will suffer the consequences of their rejection.
orig: وقال رجل مؤمن من آل فرعون يكتم إيمانه أتقتلون رجلا أن يقول ربي الله وقد جاءكم بالبينات من ربكم وإن يك كاذبا فعليه كذبه وإن يك صادقا يصبكم بعض الذي يعدكم إن الله لا يهدي من هو مسرف كذاب

translation: 'O my people, yours is the kingdom today, you are dominant in the land, but who will save us from the wrath of Allah if it comes upon us?' Pharaoh said, 'I only show you what I see, and I guide you only to the path of right conduct'.
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and deceit of Pharaoh, who, despite being warned of God's wrath, pretends to be a benevolent leader guiding his people, while in reality, he is leading them further into sin and disobedience.
orig: يا قوم لكم الملك اليوم ظاهرين في الأرض فمن ينصرنا من بأس الله إن جاءنا قال فرعون ما أريكم إلا ما أرى وما أهديكم إلا سبيل الرشاد

translation: And he who believed said, 'O my people, I fear for you a fate like the day of the Confederates'
interpretation: The verse highlights the concern and warning of a believer to his people about the consequences of their actions, drawing a parallel with a past event, implying that the people are heading towards a similar catastrophe if they do not change their ways.
orig: وقال الذي آمن يا قوم إني أخاف عليكم مثل يوم الأحزاب

translation: Like the people of Noah, and 'Ad, and Thamud, and those who came after them, and Allah does not intend to wrong the servants.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of accountability and justice, emphasizing that God does not willfully oppress or wrong His servants, but rather, it is the people's own actions that lead to their downfall, as exemplified by the stories of the past nations.
orig: مثل دأب قوم نوح وعاد وثمود والذين من بعدهم وما الله يريد ظلما للعباد

translation: O my people, I fear for you the Day of Calling.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concern of the prophet for his people's fate on the Day of Judgment, emphasizing the urgency of repentance and reform.
orig: ويا قوم إني أخاف عليكم يوم التناد

translation: The Day We will say to Hell: 'Are you filled?' And it will say: 'Are there some more?' And from Allah, you have no protector and no guide, and he whom Allah sends astray - there is no guide for him.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of spiritual guidance, emphasizing that those who are misguided by God will never find a guide, implying that their fate is sealed and they are beyond redemption.
orig: يوم تولون مدبرين ما لكم من الله من عاصم ومن يضلل الله فما له من هاد

translation: And indeed, Joseph brought you clear proofs before, but you remained in doubt about what he brought until when he perished, you said, 'Never will Allah send a messenger after him.' Thus Allah leaves astray he who is excessive and doubting.
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to doubt and reject the truth even when it is clearly presented to them, and how this rejection can lead to further deviation and misguidance.
orig: ولقد جاءكم يوسف من قبل بالبينات فما زلتم في شك مما جاءكم به حتى إذا هلك قلتم لن يبعث الله من بعده رسولا كذلك يضل الله من هو مسرف مرتاب

translation: Those who dispute about the signs of Allah without authority having come to them, it is greatly hated by Allah and by those who believe. Thus does Allah seal every arrogant, obstinate heart.
interpretation: The verse highlights the danger of arrogance and obstinacy in the face of divine guidance, suggesting that those who reject the signs of Allah out of pride and stubbornness will have their hearts sealed, making them even more resistant to the truth.
orig: الذين يجادلون في آيات الله بغير سلطان أتاهم كبر مقتا عند الله وعند الذين آمنوا كذلك يطبع الله على كل قلب متكبر جبار

translation: And Pharaoh said, 'O Haman, build for me a lofty tower so that I may reach the ways'
interpretation: The verse highlights Pharaoh's arrogance and pride, as he seeks to build a tower to reach the heavens, demonstrating his defiance of God's power and his own self-importance.
orig: وقال فرعون يا هامان ابن لي صرحا لعلي أبلغ الأسباب

translation: The ways of the heavens, so I may look upon the God of Moses, but I think him a liar. And thus the evil deeds of Pharaoh were decorated, and he was hindered from the path, and the plotting of Pharaoh did not but end in destruction.
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and pride of Pharaoh, who despite witnessing the miracles of God, refused to believe in Him and instead thought Moses to be a liar, ultimately leading to his own downfall.
orig: أسباب السماوات فأطلع إلى إله موسى وإني لأظنه كاذبا وكذلك زين لفرعون سوء عمله وصد عن السبيل وما كيد فرعون إلا في تباب

translation: And he who believed said: 'O my people, follow me, I will guide you to the path of righteousness.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of leadership and guidance in the path of righteousness, emphasizing the role of a righteous individual in guiding others towards the truth and away from error.
orig: وقال الذي آمن يا قوم اتبعون أهدكم سبيل الرشاد

translation: O my people! This worldly life is only an enjoyment, and indeed, the Hereafter - that is the home of permanence.
interpretation: The verse highlights the transitory nature of worldly life, emphasizing that true permanence and stability can only be found in the Hereafter, implying that one's focus should be on the eternal life rather than the fleeting pleasures of the world.
orig: يا قوم إنما هذه الحياة الدنيا متاع وإن الآخرة هي دار القرار

translation: Whoever does evil will not be recompensed except with the like of it, and whoever does righteousness, whether male or female, and is a believer, those will enter Paradise, being provided for without account.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of moral reciprocity, where an individual's actions, good or bad, will have consequences that mirror their deeds, emphasizing the idea that one's fate in the afterlife is directly tied to their behavior in this life.
orig: من عمل سيئة فلا يجزى إلا مثلها ومن عمل صالحا من ذكر أو أنثى وهو مؤمن فأولئك يدخلون الجنة يرزقون فيها بغير حساب

translation: O my people, I call you to salvation, and you call me to the Fire.
interpretation: The verse highlights the contrast between the prophet's call to his people to follow the path of righteousness and salvation, and their response, which is to invite him to follow the path of destruction and hellfire, symbolizing the rejection of the prophet's message and the consequences of such rejection.
orig: ويا قوم ما لي أدعوكم إلى النجاة وتدعونني إلى النار

translation: You call me to disbelieve in Allah and associate with Him that of which I have no knowledge, and I call you to the Exalted in Power, the Oft-Forgiving.
interpretation: The verse highlights the contrast between the idolaters' call to reject Allah and the Prophet's call to worship the One True God, emphasizing the superiority of the latter and the forgiveness that comes with it.
orig: تدعونني لأكفر بالله وأشرك به ما ليس لي به علم وأنا أدعوكم إلى العزيز الغفار

translation: There is no doubt that what you call me to has no authority in this world or in the Hereafter, and our return will be to Allah, and the extravagant are the companions of the Fire.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of idol worship, emphasizing that the idols have no power or authority in this life or the next, and that ultimately, all will return to Allah, who will judge the extravagant and those who have exceeded the limits set by Him.
orig: لا جرم أنما تدعونني إليه ليس له دعوة في الدنيا ولا في الآخرة وأن مردنا إلى الله وأن المسرفين هم أصحاب النار

translation: So you will remember what I say to you, and I entrust my affair to Allah; indeed, Allah is Observant of the servants.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of entrusting one's affairs to God, emphasizing that God is always aware of His servants and their actions, and thus, one should have faith in God's justice and wisdom.
orig: فستذكرون ما أقول لكم وأفوض أمري إلى الله إن الله بصير بالعباد

translation: So Allah seized him for his past and present sins, and indeed, there was an evil punishment for the people of Pharaoh.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of accountability, where an individual is held responsible for their past and present actions, and will ultimately face the consequences of their deeds, whether good or bad.
orig: فوقاه الله سيئات ما مكروا وحاق بآل فرعون سوء العذاب

translation: They are exposed to the Fire morning and evening, and on the day when the Hour will be established, [it will be said], 'Admit the people of Pharaoh to the severest torment.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the eternal nature of punishment in the Hereafter, where the wicked will be constantly exposed to the torment of the Fire, with no respite, and ultimately, on the Day of Judgment, they will be consigned to the most severe punishment.
orig: النار يعرضون عليها غدوا وعشيا ويوم تقوم الساعة أدخلوا آل فرعون أشد العذاب

translation: And when they will dispute in the Fire, the weak will say to those who were arrogant, 'We were your followers, so can you avail us anything from the Fire?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the reversal of roles in the Hereafter, where the oppressed will confront their oppressors, and the meek will question those who had exploited them, seeking justice and accountability for their suffering.
orig: وإذ يتحاجون في النار فيقول الضعفاء للذين استكبروا إنا كنا لكم تبعا فهل أنتم مغنون عنا نصيبا من النار

translation: Those who were arrogant said: 'We are all in this, for Allah has judged between the servants'
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance of those who think they are above judgment, implying that they are equal to others in the eyes of God, and that God's judgment is not applicable to them, which is a grave mistake.
orig: قال الذين استكبروا إنا كل فيها إن الله قد حكم بين العباد

translation: And those in the Fire will say to the keepers of Hell, 'Call upon your Lord to lighten for us a day of the punishment.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the desperation and regret of those who are already in Hell, realizing too late that they should have sought relief from God when they had the chance, and now they are begging the keepers of Hell to intercede on their behalf, a futile attempt to escape the punishment that they are suffering.
orig: وقال الذين في النار لخزنة جهنم ادعوا ربكم يخفف عنا يوما من العذاب

translation: They say: 'Why did not your Lord send miracles to them?' They say: 'Yes, He did.' They say: 'Then call (on Him).' The invocation of the disbelievers is only in error.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of the disbelievers' demands for miracles as a condition for their belief, implying that even if they were to witness miracles, they would still refuse to believe, and their rejection of the truth would only lead to further confusion and error.
