interpretation: This verse highlights the flawed reasoning of idolaters who attribute their idolatry to God's will, implying that they are helpless against His decree, when in reality they are simply making excuses to justify their own sinful desires and lack of faith.
orig: وقالوا لو شاء الرحمن ما عبدناهم ما لهم بذلك من علم إن هم إلا يخرصون

translation: Or have We given them a book before this, so they hold fast to it?
interpretation: This verse suggests that people who reject the Quran may have already received guidance in the past, but they refused to adhere to it, implying that they are not open to new guidance or willing to change their ways.
orig: أم آتيناهم كتابا من قبله فهم به مستمسكون

translation: But they say: 'We found our fathers following a certain religion, and we are guided by their footsteps'
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to blindly follow their ancestors' beliefs and practices without questioning or critically evaluating them, and how this can lead to the perpetuation of ignorance and superstition.
orig: بل قالوا إنا وجدنا آباءنا على أمة وإنا على آثارهم مهتدون

translation: And similarly, We sent not a warner to a town before you, except that its affluent said: 'Indeed, we found our fathers upon a religion, and we are, in their footsteps, followers.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the tendency of people to blindly follow their ancestors' traditions and beliefs, rather than accepting the truth and guidance brought by the prophets, and it warns against this kind of stubbornness and refusal to change.
orig: وكذلك ما أرسلنا من قبلك في قرية من نذير إلا قال مترفوها إنا وجدنا آباءنا على أمة وإنا على آثارهم مقتدون

translation: Their chiefs said: 'You have come to us with that which we found our fathers doing, and we reject what you have been sent with.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the stubbornness of those who reject the truth, as they cling to the traditions and customs of their ancestors, even if they are wrong, and refuse to accept the guidance brought by the prophets.
orig: قال أولو جئتكم بأهدى مما وجدتم عليه آباءكم قالوا إنا بما أرسلتم به كافرون

translation: So We took revenge of them, now see how was the end of the deniers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of rejecting God's message and the fate that awaits those who deny the truth, serving as a warning to those who refuse to believe and a reminder of God's justice and power.
orig: فانتقمنا منهم فانظر كيف كان عاقبة المكذبين

translation: And when Ibrahim said to his father and his people, 'I am innocent of what you worship'
interpretation: The verse highlights Ibrahim's courage and conviction in rejecting the idolatry of his people, and his willingness to break away from the traditions and beliefs of his family and community, even if it meant standing alone.
orig: وإذ قال إبراهيم لأبيه وقومه إنني براء مما تعبدون

translation: Except him on whom I have bestowed favour, and he will guide him.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes God's mercy and guidance towards those who have been chosen by Him, implying that those who have been blessed by God will be guided towards the right path.
orig: إلا الذي فطرني فإنه سيهدين

translation: And We made it a word to remain in his posterity, so that they might turn back.
interpretation: The verse suggests that the legacy of a righteous person can serve as a reminder and a call to repentance for their descendants, inspiring them to return to the path of righteousness.
orig: وجعلها كلمة باقية في عقبه لعلهم يرجعون

translation: Nay, they were indulging in ease and luxury, and their fathers, until the truth came to them and a messenger making clear.
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to become complacent and indulgent in their worldly lives, ignoring the warnings of prophets and the truth, until it is too late and they are faced with the consequences of their actions.
orig: بل متعت هؤلاء وآباءهم حتى جاءهم الحق ورسول مبين

translation: And when the truth came to them, they said: 'This is magic,' and they rejected it.
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to reject the truth and instead attribute it to magic or illusion, demonstrating their stubborn refusal to accept the reality of God's message.
orig: ولما جاءهم الحق قالوا هذا سحر وإنا به كافرون

translation: And they say: 'Why was this Quran not sent down to some great man of the two towns?'
interpretation: This verse reveals the arrogance and ignorance of the pagans who doubted the prophethood of Muhammad, implying that a great man from a prominent tribe would have been a more suitable recipient of the revelation, rather than an ordinary man like Muhammad from a humble background.
orig: وقالوا لولا نزل هذا القرآن على رجل من القريتين عظيم

translation: Is it they who distribute the mercy of your Lord? We distribute among them their livelihood in the life of this world and We have raised some of them above others in degrees, that some of them may take others in service, and the mercy of your Lord is better than what they accumulate.
interpretation: The verse suggests that humans should not think they have control over the distribution of wealth and resources, but rather it is God who is the ultimate provider and distributor of mercy and sustenance, and that the apparent inequalities in wealth and status are a test for humanity to serve and take care of one another.
orig: أهم يقسمون رحمت ربك نحن قسمنا بينهم معيشتهم في الحياة الدنيا ورفعنا بعضهم فوق بعض درجات ليتخذ بعضهم بعضا سخريا ورحمت ربك خير مما يجمعون

translation: And if it were not that mankind would have been a single nation, We would have made for those who disbelieve in the Most Merciful roofs of silver for their houses and stairways upon which they ascend
interpretation: The verse highlights God's mercy and patience in not destroying the disbelievers immediately, instead giving them time to reflect and repent, and that if He had not done so, He would have showered them with luxuries and comforts, but that would not have changed their disbelief.
orig: ولولا أن يكون الناس أمة واحدة لجعلنا لمن يكفر بالرحمن لبيوتهم سقفا من فضة ومعارج عليها يظهرون

translation: And they have built upon them roofs, and they take rest upon them.
interpretation: The verse is highlighting the indulgent and complacent nature of those who have built luxurious homes with high roofs, symbolizing their pride and arrogance, and how they take rest and feel secure in their worldly possessions, unaware of the consequences of their actions.
orig: ولبيوتهم أبوابا وسررا عليها يتكئون

translation: And embellishments, and indeed all that is nothing but the enjoyment of the worldly life, and the Hereafter is with your Lord for the righteous.
interpretation: The verse highlights the transitory nature of worldly pleasures and material possessions, emphasizing that true and lasting reward is reserved for the righteous in the Hereafter.
orig: وزخرفا وإن كل ذلك لما متاع الحياة الدنيا والآخرة عند ربك للمتقين

translation: And whoever turns away from the remembrance of the Most Gracious, We appoint for him a devil to be a companion to him.
interpretation: The verse suggests that when an individual deliberately ignores the guidance and remembrance of God, they will be led astray by their own desires and whims, which are often inspired by Satan, and thus, they will be accompanied by their own evil inclinations.
orig: ومن يعش عن ذكر الرحمن نقيض له شيطانا فهو له قرين

translation: And indeed, they used to prevent them from the path, and they thought they were guided.
interpretation: This verse highlights the irony of those who think they are on the right path, but in reality, they are preventing others from following the true guidance, demonstrating a profound self-deception and a lack of self-awareness.
orig: وإنهم ليصدونهم عن السبيل ويحسبون أنهم مهتدون

translation: Until when he comes to Us, he says, 'Alas, would that between me and you were the distance of the two Easts.' Then what a terrible companion!
interpretation: The verse highlights the regret and remorse that will be felt by those who rejected the truth in this life, when they realize the consequences of their actions and the distance between them and their Lord, and the futility of their attempts to escape or undo the past.
orig: حتى إذا جاءنا قال يا ليت بيني وبينك بعد المشرقين فبئس القرين

translation: And it will not benefit you today, when you have been unjust, that you are partners in the punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of trying to escape or share the blame for one's misdeeds on the Day of Judgment, emphasizing that personal responsibility and accountability cannot be avoided or delegated.
orig: ولن ينفعكم اليوم إذ ظلمتم أنكم في العذاب مشتركون

translation: Can you make the deaf hear or guide the blind, or he who is in clear error?
interpretation: This verse highlights the limitations of human ability to guide or correct others, emphasizing that only God can truly guide those who are misguided, and that human efforts alone are insufficient to change the hearts and minds of those who are stubbornly opposed to the truth.
orig: أفأنت تسمع الصم أو تهدي العمي ومن كان في ضلال مبين

translation: So either We shall take you away, and indeed We are avengers from them.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's power and authority, stating that He can remove the Prophet from the situation and take revenge on his behalf, emphasizing God's role as the ultimate protector and avenger of His messengers.
orig: فإما نذهبن بك فإنا منهم منتقمون

translation: Or do We show you that which We have promised them, then indeed We are powerful over them.
interpretation: The verse indicates that God has the power to fulfill His promises and threats, and that He will ultimately prevail over those who disobey Him, implying that God's justice will be served.
orig: أو نرينك الذي وعدناهم فإنا عليهم مقتدرون

translation: So hold fast to that which is revealed to you; indeed, you are on a straight path.
interpretation: The verse is an encouragement to hold fast to the revelation from God, indicating that the prophet and believers are on a straight and guided path, and that they should remain steadfast and committed to the divine guidance.
orig: فاستمسك بالذي أوحي إليك إنك على صراط مستقيم

translation: And indeed, it is a reminder to you and your people, and you will be questioned.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of the Prophet Muhammad's message, emphasizing that it is a reminder not only to him but also to his people, and that they will be held accountable for their actions on the Day of Judgment.
orig: وإنه لذكر لك ولقومك وسوف تسألون

translation: Ask those We sent before you, from Our messengers, 'Has the Most Merciful taken gods besides Him to be worshipped?'
interpretation: The verse is encouraging the Prophet and the believers to seek knowledge and understanding from previous prophets and messengers, emphasizing the unity and uniqueness of God, and implying that God's oneness is a central message that has been consistently conveyed by all prophets throughout history.
orig: واسأل من أرسلنا من قبلك من رسلنا أجعلنا من دون الرحمن آلهة يعبدون

translation: And indeed We sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his nobles, so he said: "I am the messenger of the Lord of the Worlds"
interpretation: The verse highlights Moses' confidence and courage in proclaiming his prophethood and divine mission to Pharaoh and his nobles, demonstrating that true faith and conviction can empower individuals to stand up against oppressive authority.
orig: ولقد أرسلنا موسى بآياتنا إلى فرعون وملئه فقال إني رسول رب العالمين

translation: And when Our signs came to them, behold, they laughed at them.
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and ignorance of those who reject the signs of God, as they respond to the divine revelations with mockery and ridicule, demonstrating their lack of understanding and humility.
orig: فلما جاءهم بآياتنا إذا هم منها يضحكون

translation: And We did not show them a sign except that it was greater than its sister, and We seized them with punishment, perhaps they would return.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's mercy and patience in giving people multiple opportunities to repent and return to the right path, even when they have been shown numerous signs and warnings, but still choose to disobey and reject the truth.
orig: وما نريهم من آية إلا هي أكبر من أختها وأخذناهم بالعذاب لعلهم يرجعون

translation: And they said: O thou wizard, pray to thy Lord for us by the covenant that is between thee, for we are indeed guided.
interpretation: This verse highlights the irony of the Pharaoh's magicians, who after witnessing the miraculous signs of Moses, still address him as a wizard, implying that they have not fully surrendered to the truth, but rather are trying to use Moses' connection with God to their advantage, demonstrating their lack of genuine faith.
orig: وقالوا يا أيه الساحر ادع لنا ربك بما عهد عندك إننا لمهتدون

translation: But when We removed the punishment from them, behold! They broke (their covenant).
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of humans to forget their covenant with God and return to their sinful ways as soon as they are relieved of their difficulties, demonstrating their ingratitude and lack of faith.
orig: فلما كشفنا عنهم العذاب إذا هم ينكثون

translation: And Pharaoh called out to his people: 'O my people, does not the kingdom of Egypt belong to me, and these rivers flowing beneath me? Do you not then see?'
interpretation: The verse highlights Pharaoh's arrogance and ignorance, as he believes his power and wealth make him invincible, and he is blind to the signs of God's existence and power.
orig: ونادى فرعون في قومه قال يا قوم أليس لي ملك مصر وهذه الأنهار تجري من تحتي أفلا تبصرون

translation: Am I better than this, who is contemptible and can hardly express himself?
interpretation: The verse highlights the humility and modesty of the Prophet Muhammad, who despite being chosen by God, still considers himself equal to or even lower than others, and is willing to listen and learn from them, even if they are inferior in social status or eloquence.
orig: أم أنا خير من هذا الذي هو مهين ولا يكاد يبين

translation: And why did there not come to him a treasure of gold, or angels come with him?
interpretation: This verse highlights the unrealistic expectations of the disbelievers who demanded unreasonable proofs of prophethood from the Prophet Muhammad, implying that only extraordinary and impossible signs would convince them of his authenticity.
orig: فلولا ألقي عليه أسورة من ذهب أو جاء معه الملائكة مقترنين

translation: So he belittled his people, and they obeyed him. Indeed, they were a defiantly disobedient people.
interpretation: The verse highlights the corrupting influence of a leader who encourages his people to disobey God, and how they, in turn, blindly follow him, leading to their downfall.
orig: فاستخف قومه فأطاعوه إنهم كانوا قوما فاسقين

translation: So when they angered Us, We punished them, and We drowned them all.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of disobeying God's commands, emphasizing that God's wrath is swift and merciless, and that those who defy Him will ultimately meet a catastrophic end.
orig: فلما آسفونا انتقمنا منهم فأغرقناهم أجمعين

translation: And We made them a precedent and an example for the others
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of learning from the experiences of others, particularly those who have faced God's wrath, and serves as a reminder to future generations to avoid similar mistakes and consequences.
orig: فجعلناهم سلفا ومثلا للآخرين

translation: And when the son of Mary was cited as an example, your people turned away from it.
interpretation: This verse highlights the tendency of people to reject and turn away from the truth, even when it is presented to them in the form of a powerful example or sign, and it serves as a reminder that people's rejection of the truth is often rooted in their own prejudices and biases.
orig: ولما ضرب ابن مريم مثلا إذا قومك منه يصدون

translation: And they say: 'Are our gods better or is he? No, they did not bring it up except for argument. Nay, they are a contentious people.
interpretation: The verse highlights the stubbornness and arrogance of those who refuse to accept the truth, instead resorting to futile arguments and debates to justify their false beliefs and idols, revealing their contentious and quarrelsome nature.
orig: وقالوا أآلهتنا خير أم هو ما ضربوه لك إلا جدلا بل هم قوم خصمون

translation: He was not but a servant upon whom We bestowed favor and made him an example for the Children of Israel.
interpretation: The verse highlights the humility of a prophet, who despite being favored by God, remained a servant of God, and his exemplary life served as a model for others to follow.
orig: إن هو إلا عبد أنعمنا عليه وجعلناه مثلا لبني إسرائيل

translation: And if We had willed, We could have made from among you angels in the earth, successors.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's power and ability to create a new generation of righteous leaders or successors, implying that God can replace humanity with a new creation if He so wills, emphasizing His absolute authority and control over the universe.
orig: ولو نشاء لجعلنا منكم ملائكة في الأرض يخلفون

translation: And indeed, it is a knowledge of the Hour, so do not be in doubt about it, and follow this straight path.
interpretation: The verse is emphasizing the importance of following the straight path of righteousness, and having faith in the certainty of the Hour of Judgment, which will bring accountability for one's actions, and thus encouraging people to live a virtuous life.
orig: وإنه لعلم للساعة فلا تمترن بها واتبعون هذا صراط مستقيم

translation: And let not Satan hinder you, indeed he is to you a clear enemy.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of being aware of Satan's influence and not letting him distract us from the path of righteousness, emphasizing that he is a sworn enemy who seeks to mislead and corrupt humanity.
orig: ولا يصدنكم الشيطان إنه لكم عدو مبين

translation: And when Jesus came with clear proofs, he said: 'I have come to you with wisdom, and to clarify for you some of the matters in which you differ, so fear Allah and obey me.'
interpretation: The verse highlights Jesus' role as a messenger of God, emphasizing his authority and wisdom, and warning people to obey him and fear God, implying that disobedience will have consequences.
orig: ولما جاء عيسى بالبينات قال قد جئتكم بالحكمة ولأبين لكم بعض الذي تختلفون فيه فاتقوا الله وأطيعون

translation: Indeed, Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. This is a straight path.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of recognizing and submitting to the one true God, Allah, and following the straight path of righteousness, which is the path that leads to salvation and closeness to God.
orig: إن الله هو ربي وربكم فاعبدوه هذا صراط مستقيم

translation: The confederates have differed among themselves, so woe to those who were unjust, from a painful punishment on the Day.
interpretation: This verse highlights the futility of alliances and confederacies when they are built on injustice and oppression, as they will ultimately lead to division and destruction, and those responsible will face a severe punishment on the Day of Judgment.
orig: فاختلف الأحزاب من بينهم فويل للذين ظلموا من عذاب يوم أليم

translation: Do they await except the Hour that it should come to them suddenly, while they do not perceive?
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of suddenness and unexpectedness of the Day of Judgment, emphasizing that people are often unaware of the impending doom and will be caught off guard when it arrives.
orig: هل ينظرون إلا الساعة أن تأتيهم بغتة وهم لا يشعرون

translation: Friends on that Day will be foes, one to another, except the righteous.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that on the Day of Judgment, even the closest of friends will turn against each other, abandoning their worldly relationships, except for the righteous who will be spared from this turmoil due to their piety and good deeds.
orig: الأخلاء يومئذ بعضهم لبعض عدو إلا المتقين

translation: O My servants, there is no fear for you today, nor will you grieve.
interpretation: The verse conveys a sense of comfort and reassurance, emphasizing that those who have lived a righteous life and have remained faithful to God will not experience fear or grief on the Day of Judgment.
orig: يا عباد لا خوف عليكم اليوم ولا أنتم تحزنون

translation: Those who believe in Our signs and were Muslims.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of not only believing in God's signs and revelations, but also submitting to His will and living according to His commands, which is the essence of being a Muslim.
orig: الذين آمنوا بآياتنا وكانوا مسلمين

translation: Enter Paradise, you and your spouses, rejoicing.
interpretation: The verse conveys the joy and bliss of the righteous in Paradise, where they will be reunited with their spouses, free from the sufferings and trials of the worldly life, and will rejoice in the eternal happiness and peace of the afterlife.
orig: ادخلوا الجنة أنتم وأزواجكم تحبرون

translation: Circulated among them will be plates of gold and cups, and therein is what the souls desire and the eyes delight, and you will abide therein forever.
interpretation: This verse describes the eternal bliss and joy that believers will experience in Paradise, where they will be surrounded by abundance and luxury, and their deepest desires will be fulfilled, bringing them eternal happiness and contentment.
orig: يطاف عليهم بصحاف من ذهب وأكواب وفيها ما تشتهيه الأنفس وتلذ الأعين وأنتم فيها خالدون

translation: And that Paradise which you have been given for what you used to do.
interpretation: The verse suggests that the reward of Paradise is a direct result of one's good deeds and righteous actions, implying that the believers' entry into Paradise is a consequence of their own efforts and commitment to a virtuous life.
orig: وتلك الجنة التي أورثتموها بما كنتم تعملون

translation: Therein is fruit abundant, from which you eat.
interpretation: The verse highlights the abundance of blessings and provisions in paradise, emphasizing that believers will have access to an unlimited supply of fruits and delights, symbolizing the ultimate fulfillment of their desires and needs.
orig: لكم فيها فاكهة كثيرة منها تأكلون

translation: Indeed, the criminals will be in the punishment of Hell, abiding eternally.
interpretation: This verse indicates that those who commit crimes and injustice will be punished severely in the afterlife, and that their punishment will be eternal, with no escape or reprieve.
orig: إن المجرمين في عذاب جهنم خالدون

translation: They will not be absent from it, and they are in it, being punished.
interpretation: The verse is highlighting the idea that those who are being punished in hell will not be able to escape or take a break from their suffering, and that they will be constantly and perpetually punished.
orig: لا يفتر عنهم وهم فيه مبلسون

translation: And We did not wrong them, but they were the wrongdoers themselves.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of personal responsibility, emphasizing that individuals are accountable for their own actions and cannot blame others or God for their mistakes, as they are the ones who have committed the wrongdoings.
orig: وما ظلمناهم ولكن كانوا هم الظالمين

translation: And they will cry out: 'O Malik, let your Lord finish us off.' He will say: 'You will stay (here)!'
interpretation: The verse highlights the desperation and frustration of those in hell, who will beg for a swift end to their torment, only to be told that they will remain in their suffering indefinitely, emphasizing the eternal nature of their punishment.
orig: ونادوا يا مالك ليقض علينا ربك قال إنكم ماكثون

translation: We have come to you with the truth, but most of you are averse to the truth.
interpretation: This verse highlights the reluctance of people to accept the truth, even when it is presented to them clearly, and serves as a reminder that human nature often resists the truth, especially when it challenges their existing beliefs or lifestyles.
orig: لقد جئناكم بالحق ولكن أكثركم للحق كارهون

translation: Or have they determined a matter? Indeed, We are also determiners.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's power and control over the universe, implying that if humans think they have the power to make decisions or take actions, God has the ultimate authority to override or counter their plans.
orig: أم أبرموا أمرا فإنا مبرمون

translation: Or do they think that We do not hear their secrets and private conversations? Nay, Our messengers are with them, writing down.
interpretation: The verse highlights the omniscience of God, emphasizing that He is aware of even the most private and secret thoughts and conversations of individuals, and that He has appointed messengers to record their deeds, implying that nothing escapes God's knowledge and that individuals will be held accountable for their actions.
orig: أم يحسبون أنا لا نسمع سرهم ونجواهم بلى ورسلنا لديهم يكتبون

translation: Say, [O Muhammad], 'If the Most Merciful [who is God] had a son, I would be the first of worshippers [of him].'
interpretation: The verse highlights the absurdity of the idea that God, the Most Merciful, could have a son, implying that if such a son existed, the Prophet Muhammad would have been the first to worship him, which is an impossible scenario, thus emphasizing the oneness of God.
orig: قل إن كان للرحمن ولد فأنا أول العابدين

translation: Glory be to the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord of the Throne, from what they describe.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the uniqueness and transcendence of God, distinguishing Him from the false descriptions and attributes that humans may assign to Him, and affirming His glory and majesty as the Lord of the heavens, the earth, and the Throne.
orig: سبحان رب السماوات والأرض رب العرش عما يصفون

translation: So leave them to plunge and play until they meet their Day which they are promised.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who reject the truth and indulge in worldly pleasures will eventually face the consequences of their actions, and that God will not intervene to stop them from their ways, but rather let them continue on their path until they ultimately face judgment.
orig: فذرهم يخوضوا ويلعبوا حتى يلاقوا يومهم الذي يوعدون

translation: And He is the God in the heaven and the God in the earth, and He is the Wise, the Knowing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes God's omnipresence and omniscience, affirming that He is the sole deity worthy of worship, with complete knowledge and control over all aspects of the universe, from the heavens to the earth.
orig: وهو الذي في السماء إله وفي الأرض إله وهو الحكيم العليم

translation: And blessed is He to Whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, and with Him is the knowledge of the Hour, and to Him you will be returned.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the omnipotence and omniscience of God, emphasizing that He has complete knowledge of the Hour of Judgment and that all things will ultimately return to Him, implying that humans will be accountable to Him for their actions.
orig: وتبارك الذي له ملك السماوات والأرض وما بينهما وعنده علم الساعة وإليه ترجعون

translation: And those whom they call upon besides Him possess no power of intercession, except those who bear witness to the truth and they know.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of seeking intercession from false gods and idols, and emphasizes that only those who have true knowledge and bear witness to the truth will be able to intercede on behalf of others.
orig: ولا يملك الذين يدعون من دونه الشفاعة إلا من شهد بالحق وهم يعلمون

translation: And if you ask them who created them, they will surely say, 'Allah.' Then how are they deluded?
interpretation: The verse highlights the inconsistency of those who acknowledge Allah as their creator, yet refuse to submit to His will and commandments, implying that their actions are contradictory to their beliefs.
orig: ولئن سألتهم من خلقهم ليقولن الله فأنى يؤفكون

translation: And it will be said, 'O Lord, these are a people who did not believe.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the regret and remorse that will be felt by those who rejected faith and disobeyed God's commands, as they will ultimately acknowledge their mistakes and realize the truth, but it will be too late.
orig: وقيله يا رب إن هؤلاء قوم لا يؤمنون

translation: So turn away from them and say, 'Peace.' They will come to know.
interpretation: The verse advises the Prophet and believers to ignore the provocations of the unbelievers and instead respond with a blessing of peace, trusting that eventually the truth will prevail and the unbelievers will come to realize their mistakes.
orig: فاصفح عنهم وقل سلام فسوف يعلمون

translation: Ha. Mim.
interpretation: The verse is a mysterious and profound opening to a surah, and the letters 'Ha Mim' are considered one of the abbreviated letters that appear at the beginning of some surahs in the Quran, which are believed to be a symbol of divine wisdom and a testament to the miraculous nature of the Quran.
orig: حم

translation: And the Clear Book
interpretation: The verse is referring to the Quran, emphasizing its clarity and transparency in conveying the message of God, leaving no room for misinterpretation or confusion.
orig: والكتاب المبين

translation: Indeed, We sent it down on a blessed night. Indeed, We were warning.
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of the revelation of the Quran, emphasizing that it was sent down on a blessed night, implying a night of great importance and spiritual significance, and that the purpose of this revelation was to serve as a warning to humanity.
orig: إنا أنزلناه في ليلة مباركة إنا كنا منذرين

translation: Therein every wise command is made distinct.
interpretation: The verse highlights the clarity and precision of God's commands, implying that they are free from ambiguity and confusion, and are therefore easy to understand and follow.
orig: فيها يفرق كل أمر حكيم

translation: A command from Us, indeed We were sending
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the divine origin of the prophets and their messages, highlighting that they were sent by God's command and authority, and that their mission was a direct result of God's will and intervention.
orig: أمرا من عندنا إنا كنا مرسلين

translation: A mercy from your Lord. Indeed, He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of recognizing God's mercy and benevolence in our lives, and how He is always aware of our actions and intentions, emphasizing the need for humility and gratitude towards Him.
orig: رحمة من ربك إنه هو السميع العليم

translation: Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, if you are certain.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute authority and dominion of God over the entire universe, highlighting His power and control over all things, and serves as a reminder to humanity of their place in the grand scheme of creation.
orig: رب السماوات والأرض وما بينهما إن كنتم موقنين

translation: There is no deity except Him; He gives life and causes death, your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute power and authority of God over life and death, implying that humans are completely dependent on Him for their existence, and that He is the ultimate controller of their fate.
orig: لا إله إلا هو يحيي ويميت ربكم ورب آبائكم الأولين

translation: Nay, they are in doubt, playing.
interpretation: This verse suggests that those who reject the truth are not only ignorant, but also indulging in a reckless and frivolous attitude, 'playing' with their own destiny, rather than taking their responsibilities seriously.
orig: بل هم في شك يلعبون

translation: Then wait you for the Day when the sky will bring forth a visible smoke.
interpretation: The verse is warning humanity to be prepared for the Day of Judgment, when the sky will bring forth a visible smoke, symbolizing the chaos and turmoil that will engulf the world, and marking the beginning of the end of time as we know it.
orig: فارتقب يوم تأتي السماء بدخان مبين

translation: The people are being punished by a painful torment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the suffering and anguish that people will experience as a consequence of their disobedience and refusal to accept the truth, emphasizing the intense pain and distress that awaits them.
orig: يغشى الناس هذا عذاب أليم

translation: Our Lord, remove from us the torment, indeed we are believers.
interpretation: This verse shows that true believers are those who are willing to surrender to God's will and seek refuge in Him, acknowledging their mistakes and weaknesses, and seeking relief from the difficulties and hardships they face.
orig: ربنا اكشف عنا العذاب إنا مؤمنون

translation: How can they have a reminder, and there has come to them a clear messenger?
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that people have no excuse for not believing in God's message, as they have been clearly warned and guided by prophets and messengers, and thus they will be held accountable for their rejection of the truth.
orig: أنى لهم الذكرى وقد جاءهم رسول مبين

translation: Then they turned away from him and said: 'A teacher possessed!'
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to reject and ridicule those who bring them a message of truth and guidance, and instead of listening to the message, they focus on the personality of the messenger, in this case, accusing him of being possessed.
orig: ثم تولوا عنه وقالوا معلم مجنون

translation: Verily, We will remove the punishment for a little while, indeed you will revert.
interpretation: This verse suggests that God may temporarily withhold punishment from a sinful community, but this reprieve is not a sign of forgiveness, rather it is a test of their behavior, and if they do not change their ways, they will ultimately face the consequences of their actions.
orig: إنا كاشفو العذاب قليلا إنكم عائدون

translation: The day We shall strike with the greatest calamity, indeed, We will exact retribution.
interpretation: The verse signifies that God's retribution is inevitable and will be carried out with great force, emphasizing the idea that God is a just and powerful deity who will not let injustice go unpunished.
orig: يوم نبطش البطشة الكبرى إنا منتقمون

translation: And indeed, We tested those before them, the people of Pharaoh, and there came to them a noble messenger.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of learning from the mistakes of past nations, specifically the people of Pharaoh, who were punished for their disobedience and arrogance, and serves as a reminder to the current generation to heed the warnings and messages of God's prophets.
orig: ولقد فتنا قبلهم قوم فرعون وجاءهم رسول كريم

translation: Announce to My servants that I am indeed the Faithful, the Messenger of Allah to you.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the role of the Prophet as a trusted and faithful messenger of God, conveying the importance of obedience to God's commands and the authenticity of the divine message.
orig: أن أدوا إلي عباد الله إني لكم رسول أمين

translation: And do not be arrogant towards Allah. Indeed, I have come to you with a clear authority.
interpretation: This verse is a warning against arrogance and a reminder of the importance of humility, as it is a fundamental aspect of faith, and that one should always remain humble and submissive to God's will.
orig: وأن لا تعلوا على الله إني آتيكم بسلطان مبين

translation: And I take refuge with my Lord and your Lord from your stoning.
interpretation: The verse highlights the Prophet's reliance on God for protection from the persecution and harm inflicted by his opponents, demonstrating the Prophet's trust and faith in God's power and justice.
orig: وإني عذت بربي وربكم أن ترجمون

translation: And if you do not believe me, then leave me alone.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of respecting the messenger's autonomy and freedom to convey the divine message, emphasizing that those who reject the message should not hinder or harass the messenger, but rather leave them to their mission.
orig: وإن لم تؤمنوا لي فاعتزلون

translation: So he invoked his Lord that these are a criminal people.
interpretation: The verse highlights the prophet's urgent call for divine intervention against the oppressive and sinful people, indicating the gravity of their crimes and the prophet's helplessness in the face of their wickedness.
orig: فدعا ربه أن هؤلاء قوم مجرمون

translation: So travel with your followers by night, indeed you are surely being followed.
interpretation: The verse is emphasizing the importance of taking swift and secretive action in times of danger or persecution, as the believers are being pursued by their enemies and must take measures to ensure their safety and protection.
orig: فأسر بعبادي ليلا إنكم متبعون

translation: And leave the sea in its raging torrent, indeed they are a drowned army.
interpretation: The verse is emphasizing the idea that the Pharaoh's army was completely destroyed and overwhelmed by the sea, with no chance of escape or rescue, and serves as a reminder of God's power and authority.
orig: واترك البحر رهوا إنهم جند مغرقون

translation: How many gardens and springs they left behind
interpretation: The verse highlights the transience of worldly possessions and the fleeting nature of human achievements, emphasizing that even the most impressive and luxurious aspects of human civilization are ultimately left behind and abandoned.
orig: كم تركوا من جنات وعيون

translation: And a noble residence.
interpretation: The verse is highlighting the beauty and grandeur of Paradise, emphasizing that it is a place of noble and honorable dwelling, where the righteous will reside in comfort and luxury.
orig: وزروع ومقام كريم

translation: And they were indulging in it, and they were certain.
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to indulge in their sinful ways, feeling secure and certain in their actions, unaware of the impending punishment that awaits them.
orig: ونعمة كانوا فيها فاكهين

translation: Thus, and We caused another people to inherit
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of succession and the cyclical nature of human history, where one civilization rises and falls, making way for another to inherit and potentially repeat the same patterns of behavior, emphasizing the importance of learning from the past.
orig: كذلك وأورثناها قوما آخرين

translation: Then neither the heaven nor the earth wept for them, nor were they given a respite.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of the sinners' situation, implying that even the natural world, which is normally indifferent to human affairs, was so outraged by their actions that it refused to mourn their destruction, and instead, hastened their punishment.
orig: فما بكت عليهم السماء والأرض وما كانوا منظرين

translation: And We certainly saved the Children of Israel from the humiliating punishment
interpretation: The verse highlights God's mercy and power in saving the Children of Israel from a humiliating punishment, implying that God is capable of delivering His people from even the most desperate of situations, and that His mercy and protection are not limited by human circumstances.
orig: ولقد نجينا بني إسرائيل من العذاب المهين

translation: From Pharaoh, indeed he was haughty among the transgressors.
interpretation: The verse highlights Pharaoh's arrogance and transgression, implying that his haughty attitude led him to commit even greater sins, and ultimately, to his downfall.
orig: من فرعون إنه كان عاليا من المسرفين

translation: And indeed, We chose them by knowledge out of all the worlds.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's wisdom and justice in selecting prophets and messengers, implying that God's choices are based on His infinite knowledge and wisdom, and are not arbitrary or biased.
orig: ولقد اخترناهم على علم على العالمين

translation: And We gave them of the signs that which in it was a clear trial.
interpretation: The verse suggests that God provides people with clear signs and trials in life, which serve as tests of their faith, obedience, and character, ultimately leading to their spiritual growth and self-refinement.
orig: وآتيناهم من الآيات ما فيه بلاء مبين

translation: Indeed, these [people] are saying
interpretation: The verse suggests that the people being referred to are making false claims or accusations, and that their words are not to be trusted.
orig: إن هؤلاء ليقولون

translation: That is not but our first death, and we will not be resurrected.
interpretation: The verse highlights the ignorance and arrogance of the disbelievers who refuse to accept the concept of resurrection and the afterlife, believing that death is the end of human existence.
orig: إن هي إلا موتتنا الأولى وما نحن بمنشرين

translation: Then bring our fathers, if you are truthful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the challenge posed to the disbelievers to bring forth their ancestors or idols if they were truly powerful, emphasizing the futility of their claims and the powerlessness of their idols.
orig: فأتوا بآبائنا إن كنتم صادقين

translation: Are they better or the people of Tubba' and those before them? We destroyed them, for they were criminals.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of disobedience and sin, emphasizing that even the mighty and powerful civilizations of the past were destroyed by God due to their criminal behavior, and implying that the same fate awaits those who persist in their wrongdoing.
orig: أهم خير أم قوم تبع والذين من قبلهم أهلكناهم إنهم كانوا مجرمين

translation: And We have not created the heavens and the earth and what is between them in vain.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the idea that the creation of the universe and everything in it has a purpose and is not a random or futile act, implying that humanity has a responsibility to fulfill its role in the grand scheme of creation.
orig: وما خلقنا السماوات والأرض وما بينهما لاعبين

translation: We have not created them except with the truth, but most of them do not know.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ignorance of people regarding the purpose and nature of creation, which is rooted in truth and justice, and serves as a reminder to reflect on the true nature of existence.
orig: ما خلقناهما إلا بالحق ولكن أكثرهم لا يعلمون

translation: Indeed, the Day of Judgment is a time appointed for all of them.
interpretation: The verse highlights the inevitability of the Day of Judgment, emphasizing that it is an appointed time when all humanity will be gathered together to face accountability, implying that no one can escape the reckoning.
orig: إن يوم الفصل ميقاتهم أجمعين

translation: The Day when a near relative will not avail another near relative in aught, nor will they be helped.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that on the Day of Judgment, no one will be able to help or protect their loved ones, emphasizing the individual nature of accountability before God.
orig: يوم لا يغني مولى عن مولى شيئا ولا هم ينصرون

translation: Except for those on whom Allah has bestowed His mercy, for He is the Exalted in Power, the Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that God's mercy is not limited to any particular group or individual, but is available to all who seek it, regardless of their background or circumstances, and that God's power and mercy are intertwined.
orig: إلا من رحم الله إنه هو العزيز الرحيم

translation: Indeed, the tree of Zaqqum
interpretation: The verse is referring to the bitter and painful consequences of one's sinful actions, which will manifest in the Hereafter, and the 'tree of Zaqqum' serves as a symbol of the bitter fruits of evil deeds.
orig: إن شجرت الزقوم

translation: The food of the sinful
interpretation: This phrase suggests that the food being referred to is tainted by the sinful nature of those who prepared or consumed it, implying that the moral character of an individual can impact the spiritual purity of the food they handle.
orig: طعام الأثيم

translation: Like boiling water will be their bellies.
interpretation: This verse is describing the intense suffering and torment that the wicked will experience in the afterlife, where their bellies will be filled with boiling water, symbolizing the severity of their punishment.
orig: كالمهل يغلي في البطون

translation: And how many a town have We destroyed while it was unjust, so Our punishment came to it in the morning, or at noon.
interpretation: The verse speaks about the destruction of towns that were unjust and received their punishment from God. The verse emphasizes the sudden and unexpected nature of the 'punishment', which came either in the morning or at noon, indicating that the people were taken by surprise and had no time to prepare or repent. The verse serves as a warning to those who are living in sin and injustice, reminding them of the consequences of their actions and the certainty of God's punishment.
orig: كغلي الحميم

translation: Seize him and drag him into the midst of the Blazing Fire.
interpretation: This verse highlights the severity of God's punishment for those who reject His message, where the angels will forcefully take the sinner and throw them into the depths of hell, emphasizing the idea that those who refuse to follow God's guidance will face a terrible and humiliating fate.
orig: خذوه فاعتلوه إلى سواء الجحيم

translation: Then We poured upon his head from the torment of the scalding water.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's power and wrath, where He unleashes a severe punishment on the wrongdoers, pouring down a torment of scalding water upon them, emphasizing the intensity and severity of the divine retribution.
orig: ثم صبوا فوق رأسه من عذاب الحميم

translation: Indeed, You, You are the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
interpretation: This verse is a declaration of God's power and mercy, emphasizing that God's might is not limited by human understanding, and that His mercy is a manifestation of His infinite power.
orig: ذق إنك أنت العزيز الكريم

translation: Indeed, this is what you were eager for.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the consequences of one's actions will ultimately catch up with them, and that the punishment or reckoning that one feared or tried to avoid will inevitably arrive, serving as a reminder of one's own culpability.
orig: إن هذا ما كنتم به تمترون

translation: Indeed, the righteous will be in a secure position.
interpretation: The verse implies that those who are righteous and pious will ultimately be in a state of complete safety and security, free from the fears and anxieties of the world, and enjoying the blessings and rewards of the Hereafter.
orig: إن المتقين في مقام أمين

translation: In gardens and springs.
interpretation: The verse is describing the blissful and serene atmosphere of Paradise, where believers will be rewarded with eternal comfort and happiness, surrounded by beautiful gardens and refreshing springs.
orig: في جنات وعيون

translation: They will be adorned with sundus and istabraq, mutually facing each other.
interpretation: The verse describes the blissful state of the righteous in Paradise, where they will be adorned with the finest garments, symbolizing their honor and dignity, and will be able to enjoy each other's company in a state of perfect harmony and mutual respect.
orig: يلبسون من سندس وإستبرق متقابلين

translation: Thus We paired them off in pairs, in canals with flowing water.
interpretation: The verse suggests that God's creation is characterized by harmony and balance, where everything is paired and complementary, reflecting the beauty and perfection of God's design.
orig: كذلك وزوجناهم بحور عين

translation: They will be called in it, 'Eat of every fruit, [being] secure.'
interpretation: The verse suggests that in Paradise, believers will be invited to partake of all kinds of fruits without any fear of scarcity or restriction, symbolizing the abundance and freedom they will enjoy in the afterlife.
orig: يدعون فيها بكل فاكهة آمنين

translation: They will not taste death therein except the first death, and He will protect them from the punishment of Hell.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the righteous will not experience death in the afterlife, but will be shielded from the punishment of Hell, implying a state of eternal bliss and protection from God's wrath.
orig: لا يذوقون فيها الموت إلا الموتة الأولى ووقاهم عذاب الجحيم

translation: A favor from your Lord, that is the supreme success.
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that the greatest achievement in life is to receive God's favor, which is the ultimate goal and highest aspiration for believers, as it guarantees their eternal salvation and happiness.
orig: فضلا من ربك ذلك هو الفوز العظيم

translation: Thus We have made it easy in thy tongue, that they may take heed.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of the Prophet Muhammad's role in conveying the message of God, and how God has made the language of the Quran easy to understand, so that people may reflect and take heed of the message.
orig: فإنما يسرناه بلسانك لعلهم يتذكرون

translation: So wait, indeed they are waiting.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of mutual waiting, where the believers are waiting for the fulfillment of God's promise, and the disbelievers are waiting for the believers to falter, highlighting the ongoing struggle between good and evil.
orig: فارتقب إنهم مرتقبون

translation: Ha. Mim.
interpretation: The verse is a mysterious and symbolic introduction to the surah, with some interpreting it as a divine oath, emphasizing the importance and significance of the revelation that is about to follow.
orig: حم

translation: The revelation of the Book is from Allah, the Mighty, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the divine origin of the Quran, highlighting Allah's power and wisdom in revealing the Book to humanity, implying that the Quran is a manifestation of Allah's infinite wisdom and authority.
orig: تنزيل الكتاب من الله العزيز الحكيم

translation: Indeed, in the heavens and the earth are signs for the believers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that the natural world, including the heavens and the earth, contains signs and indicators that point to the existence and power of God, and that believers are able to recognize and understand these signs.
orig: إن في السماوات والأرض لآيات للمؤمنين

translation: And in your creation and in what He scattered of moving creatures are signs for a people who are certain.
interpretation: The verse highlights the intricate design and complexity of human creation and the diversity of living creatures as evidence of God's power and wisdom, serving as a reminder and a sign for those who possess certainty and faith.
orig: وفي خلقكم وما يبث من دابة آيات لقوم يوقنون

translation: And the difference of the night and the day, and what Allah has sent down from the sky of provision, so He gave life with it to the earth after its death, and the changing of the winds, are signs for a people who understand.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of recognizing and appreciating the signs of God's power and wisdom in the natural world, and how they should inspire a sense of awe, gratitude, and obedience to Him.
orig: واختلاف الليل والنهار وما أنزل الله من السماء من رزق فأحيا به الأرض بعد موتها وتصريف الرياح آيات لقوم يعقلون

translation: Those are the verses of Allah which We recite to you in truth. Then in what statement after Allah and His verses will they believe?
interpretation: This verse highlights the uniqueness and superiority of the Quran as the ultimate source of guidance, implying that once one has been exposed to the truth of Allah's words, there is no need to seek guidance from any other source.
orig: تلك آيات الله نتلوها عليك بالحق فبأي حديث بعد الله وآياته يؤمنون

translation: Woe to every sinful backbiter.
interpretation: This verse is a stern warning to those who engage in backbiting and slander, implying that such behavior is a grave sin that will incur divine punishment.
orig: ويل لكل أفاك أثيم

translation: He hears the verses of Allah recited to him, then he persists in pride as if he had not heard them, so give him tidings of a painful punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the stubbornness of those who reject the message of God, even after being exposed to the truth, and warns them of a severe punishment that awaits them in the hereafter.
orig: يسمع آيات الله تتلى عليه ثم يصر مستكبرا كأن لم يسمعها فبشره بعذاب أليم

translation: And when he learns something of Our signs, he takes it in mockery. Those - for them is a humiliating punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance of those who mock and ridicule the signs and revelations of God, and warns them of a humiliating punishment in the hereafter, implying that their mockery will ultimately lead to their own shame and degradation.
orig: وإذا علم من آياتنا شيئا اتخذها هزوا أولئك لهم عذاب مهين

translation: Behind them is Hell, and neither their earned wealth nor the intercessors they took besides Allah will avail them in anything, and for them is a great punishment.
interpretation: This verse highlights the futility of material wealth and worldly connections in the face of God's wrath, emphasizing that neither riches nor influential allies can protect one from divine punishment.
orig: من ورائهم جهنم ولا يغني عنهم ما كسبوا شيئا ولا ما اتخذوا من دون الله أولياء ولهم عذاب عظيم

translation: This is the guidance, and those who disbelieve in the signs of their Lord, for them is a painful punishment of a bitter kind.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of believing in the signs and revelations of God, warning that those who reject them will face a severe and bitter punishment, implying that the punishment is not only painful but also humiliating and degrading.
orig: هذا هدى والذين كفروا بآيات ربهم لهم عذاب من رجز أليم

translation: It is Allah who has made the sea subservient to you, so that the ships may sail through it by His command, and that you may seek of His Bounty, and that you may be grateful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of recognizing and appreciating the blessings and favors of God, in this case, the sea and its benefits, and to cultivate a sense of gratitude towards Him.
orig: الله الذي سخر لكم البحر لتجري الفلك فيه بأمره ولتبتغوا من فضله ولعلكم تشكرون

translation: And He has subjected to you all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth; it is all from Him. Indeed, in that are signs for a people who reflect.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of contemplation and reflection in understanding the signs of God's power and wisdom in the universe, emphasizing that those who think deeply will come to recognize the divine origin of all things.
orig: وسخر لكم ما في السماوات وما في الأرض جميعا منه إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يتفكرون

translation: Say to those who believe that they should forgive those who do not hope for the Days of Allah, that He may recompense a people for what they used to earn.
interpretation: This verse is encouraging believers to forgive those who do not believe in the Day of Judgment, as their actions will ultimately be judged by God, and they will be recompensed accordingly.
orig: قل للذين آمنوا يغفروا للذين لا يرجون أيام الله ليجزي قوما بما كانوا يكسبون

translation: Whoever does good, it is for himself, and whoever does evil, it is against himself, then to your Lord you will return.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of personal responsibility, emphasizing that an individual's actions, whether good or bad, have consequences that ultimately affect themselves, and that they will be accountable for their deeds on the Day of Judgment.
orig: من عمل صالحا فلنفسه ومن أساء فعليها ثم إلى ربكم ترجعون

translation: And We had certainly given the Children of Israel the Scripture and judgment and prophethood and provided for them of the good things and preferred them over the worlds.
interpretation: This verse highlights the special favors and blessings bestowed upon the Children of Israel, emphasizing their privileged position among all nations, and implying a corresponding responsibility to live up to the high moral standards expected of them.
orig: ولقد آتينا بني إسرائيل الكتاب والحكم والنبوة ورزقناهم من الطيبات وفضلناهم على العالمين

translation: And We have given them clear proofs from the matter, but they did not differ except after the knowledge had come to them, out of mutual envy among themselves. Indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of human disputes and disagreements, as they arise not from a lack of knowledge or understanding, but rather from envy and selfish desires, and that ultimately, it is God who will settle these disputes on the Day of Judgment.
orig: وآتيناهم بينات من الأمر فما اختلفوا إلا من بعد ما جاءهم العلم بغيا بينهم إن ربك يقضي بينهم يوم القيامة فيما كانوا فيه يختلفون

translation: Then We have put you on a clear way of the command, so follow it and do not follow the desires of those who do not know.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of following the guidance and commandments of God, rather than being swayed by personal desires or the whims of those who are ignorant of the truth.
orig: ثم جعلناك على شريعة من الأمر فاتبعها ولا تتبع أهواء الذين لا يعلمون

translation: Verily, they will not avail you against Allah at all. And indeed, the wrongdoers are allies to one another, while Allah is the ally of the righteous.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of seeking protection from anyone or anything except God, and reminds the believers that their true ally and protector is God, who stands with the righteous and the just.
orig: إنهم لن يغنوا عنك من الله شيئا وإن الظالمين بعضهم أولياء بعض والله ولي المتقين

translation: These are clear proofs unto men, and guidance and mercy unto a folk who are convinced.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of faith and conviction, suggesting that those who are truly convinced of God's existence and power will be guided towards the right path and receive God's mercy.
orig: هذا بصائر للناس وهدى ورحمة لقوم يوقنون

translation: Or do those who have earned evil deeds think that We will make them equal to those who have believed and done righteous deeds, in their lives and their deaths? Evil is that which they judge.
interpretation: The verse highlights the misconception of those who commit evil deeds, thinking they can escape accountability and be treated equally to those who believe and do good, emphasizing that their judgment is flawed and misguided.
orig: أم حسب الذين اجترحوا السيئات أن نجعلهم كالذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات سواء محياهم ومماتهم ساء ما يحكمون

translation: And Allah created the heavens and the earth with truth, and that every soul may be rewarded for what it has earned, and they will not be wronged.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the idea that God's creation is based on justice and truth, and that every individual will be held accountable for their actions, receiving a fair reward or punishment for their deeds, without any injustice or oppression.
orig: وخلق الله السماوات والأرض بالحق ولتجزى كل نفس بما كسبت وهم لا يظلمون

translation: Have you seen him who takes his own desire as his god, and Allah, knowing, has led him astray, and has set a seal upon his hearing and his heart and upon his vision is a veil, so who will guide him after Allah? Will you not then remember?
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of relying on one's own desires and whims, rather than submitting to the will of God, and how this can lead to spiritual blindness and misguidance, making it impossible for one to find guidance without God's intervention.
orig: أفرأيت من اتخذ إلهه هواه وأضله الله على علم وختم على سمعه وقلبه وجعل على بصره غشاوة فمن يهديه من بعد الله أفلا تذكرون

translation: And they say: 'There is nothing but our life of this world, we die and we live, and nothing destroys us except the passage of time.' And they have no knowledge of that, they only conjecture.
interpretation: The verse highlights the ignorance and arrogance of those who deny the existence of the Hereafter, thinking that life is limited to this world and that death is the ultimate end, and that the passage of time is the only force that affects human existence, without realizing that there is a higher power governing the universe.
orig: وقالوا ما هي إلا حياتنا الدنيا نموت ونحيا وما يهلكنا إلا الدهر وما لهم بذلك من علم إن هم إلا يظنون

translation: And when Our clear signs are recited to them, their argument is only that they say: 'Bring our fathers, if you are truthful.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the stubbornness and arrogance of those who reject the truth, as they demand impossible proofs and miracles, rather than accepting the clear signs and evidence presented to them.
orig: وإذا تتلى عليهم آياتنا بينات ما كان حجتهم إلا أن قالوا ائتوا بآبائنا إن كنتم صادقين

translation: Allah takes your souls at night, and has knowledge of what you have done by day, then He raises you to life again, till an appointed term is reached, then unto Him is your return, then He will inform you of what you used to do, on the Day of Resurrection, about which there is no doubt, but most people do not know.
interpretation: The verse highlights the omniscience of God, who is aware of all human actions, and will hold humans accountable for their deeds on the Day of Judgment, emphasizing the certainty of accountability and the ignorance of most people about this reality.
orig: قل الله يحييكم ثم يميتكم ثم يجمعكم إلى يوم القيامة لا ريب فيه ولكن أكثر الناس لا يعلمون

translation: And to Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and on the Day when the Hour is established, that Day the falsifiers will lose.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate triumph of God's justice and power, emphasizing that on the Day of Judgment, those who rejected the truth and followed falsehood will be the ultimate losers, facing the consequences of their actions.
orig: ولله ملك السماوات والأرض ويوم تقوم الساعة يومئذ يخسر المبطلون

translation: And you will see every nation kneeling, every nation will be called to its record, Today you will be recompensed for what you used to do.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of individual accountability, emphasizing that every person will be judged based on their own actions, and that no one can escape the consequences of their deeds, whether good or bad.
orig: وترى كل أمة جاثية كل أمة تدعى إلى كتابها اليوم تجزون ما كنتم تعملون

translation: This Our Book pronounces against you with truth; indeed, We were copying what you used to do.
interpretation: The verse suggests that the Quran is a witness to the actions of humanity, recording their deeds and serving as a testament to their accountability before God, emphasizing the idea that our actions will be judged and accounted for.
orig: هذا كتابنا ينطق عليكم بالحق إنا كنا نستنسخ ما كنتم تعملون

translation: As for those who believed and did righteous deeds, their Lord will admit them into His mercy; that is the clear triumph.
interpretation: The verse highlights the ultimate reward for those who have demonstrated faith and righteousness in their actions, which is to be admitted into God's mercy, signifying their triumph and salvation in the hereafter.
orig: فأما الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات فيدخلهم ربهم في رحمته ذلك هو الفوز المبين

translation: And as for those who disbelieved, did not My verses used to be recited to you, and you used to be proud and you were a criminal people?
interpretation: The verse highlights the role of pride in preventing individuals from accepting the truth, suggesting that those who reject God's message do so because of their arrogance and refusal to humble themselves before the divine.
orig: وأما الذين كفروا أفلم تكن آياتي تتلى عليكم فاستكبرتم وكنتم قوما مجرمين

translation: And when it is said, 'Indeed, the promise of Allah is true, and there is no doubt about the Hour,' you say, 'We do not know what the Hour is, we only speculate, and we are not convinced.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who claim to be uncertain about the Day of Judgment, despite being aware of the truth, and instead rely on speculation and conjecture, revealing their lack of conviction and faith in the divine promise.
orig: وإذا قيل إن وعد الله حق والساعة لا ريب فيها قلتم ما ندري ما الساعة إن نظن إلا ظنا وما نحن بمستيقنين

translation: And there appeared to them the evil consequences of what they did, and they were surrounded by what they used to mock.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of irony, where those who used to mock and belittle the truth and its messengers are now faced with the consequences of their own actions, and are surrounded by the very thing they used to mock, emphasizing the idea that God's justice is inescapable.
orig: وبدا لهم سيئات ما عملوا وحاق بهم ما كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: And it will be said, 'Today We will forget you as you forgot the meeting of this Day of yours and your abode is the Fire, and there are not for you any helpers.'
interpretation: The verse conveys the idea that those who neglected their spiritual growth and ignored the Day of Judgment will be forgotten by God on that day, and will be left to face the consequences of their actions, with no one to help them.
orig: وقيل اليوم ننساكم كما نسيتم لقاء يومكم هذا ومأواكم النار وما لكم من ناصرين

translation: That is because you took the verses of Allah in mockery, and the life of the world deceived you. Therefore, today they will not be taken out of it, nor will they be allowed to repent.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of taking God's signs and revelations lightly, and being deceived by the allurements of worldly life, which ultimately leads to a point of no return, where one's fate is sealed and repentance is no longer possible.
orig: ذلكم بأنكم اتخذتم آيات الله هزوا وغرتكم الحياة الدنيا فاليوم لا يخرجون منها ولا هم يستعتبون

translation: All praise is due to Allah, the Lord of the heavens and the Lord of the earth, the Lord of the worlds.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of Tawhid, or the oneness of God, by proclaiming that all praise belongs to Allah, who is the sole creator and sustainer of the universe, and the ruler of all existence.
orig: فلله الحمد رب السماوات ورب الأرض رب العالمين

translation: And to Him belongs all grandeur in the heavens and the earth, and He is the Exalted in Power, the Wise.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's absolute sovereignty and dominion over the entire universe, emphasizing His limitless power and wisdom that governs all aspects of existence.
orig: وله الكبرياء في السماوات والأرض وهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: Ha. Mim.
interpretation: The use of these two Arabic letters at the beginning of the chapter is a mystery, but it is believed to be a symbol of the divine revelation, a signature of the Quran, and a reminder of the miraculous nature of the holy book.
orig: حم

translation: Sending down the Book from Allah, the Mighty, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse signifies the divine origin of the Quran, emphasizing Allah's power and wisdom in revealing the sacred scripture to humanity, guiding them towards righteousness and virtue.
orig: تنزيل الكتاب من الله العزيز الحكيم

translation: We did not create the heavens and the earth and what is between them except with truth and for a specified term, and those who disbelieve turn away from what they are warned about.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of those who reject the message of God, as they are deliberately ignoring the signs and warnings that are evident in the creation of the universe, which is a testament to God's power and wisdom.
orig: ما خلقنا السماوات والأرض وما بينهما إلا بالحق وأجل مسمى والذين كفروا عما أنذروا معرضون

translation: Say, 'Have you considered what you invoke besides Allah? Show me what they have created of the earth or have they partnership in the heavens? Bring me a scripture before this or a remnant of knowledge if you are truthful.'
interpretation: The verse is a challenge to those who associate partners with God, implying that if they are truthful in their claims, they should be able to provide evidence of their idols' creative power, which they cannot, thus highlighting the absurdity of idol worship.
orig: قل أرأيتم ما تدعون من دون الله أروني ماذا خلقوا من الأرض أم لهم شرك في السماوات ائتوني بكتاب من قبل هذا أو أثارة من علم إن كنتم صادقين

translation: And who is more astray than one who invokes besides Allah, one who will not respond to him until the Day of Resurrection, and they are unaware of their calls?
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of invoking false gods and idols, emphasizing that they will not respond to the calls of their worshippers, and that the worshippers themselves are unaware of the futility of their actions, leaving them in a state of ignorance and confusion.
orig: ومن أضل ممن يدعو من دون الله من لا يستجيب له إلى يوم القيامة وهم عن دعائهم غافلون

translation: And when mankind is gathered, they will be enemies to them, and they will be deniers of their worship.
interpretation: The verse highlights the irony of idolaters who will ultimately reject and oppose the very idols they worshipped in the afterlife, realizing their false nature and the futility of their worship.
orig: وإذا حشر الناس كانوا لهم أعداء وكانوا بعبادتهم كافرين

translation: And when Our clear signs are recited to them, those who disbelieve in the truth say, 'This is obvious magic.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the stubbornness of those who reject the truth, as they attribute the divine signs and revelations to magic, refusing to accept the reality of God's message and the prophethood of His messengers.
orig: وإذا تتلى عليهم آياتنا بينات قال الذين كفروا للحق لما جاءهم هذا سحر مبين

translation: Or do they say, 'He has invented it'? Say, 'If I have invented it, then you do not possess any power for me against Allah. He is most knowing of what you constantly relate in it. Sufficient is He as a witness between me and you, and He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that the Prophet Muhammad's only role is to convey the message of God, and that he has no control over the revelation process, emphasizing the divine origin of the Quran and the Prophet's humility in his role as a messenger.
orig: أم يقولون افتراه قل إن افتريته فلا تملكون لي من الله شيئا هو أعلم بما تفيضون فيه كفى به شهيدا بيني وبينكم وهو الغفور الرحيم

translation: Say, 'I am not a novelty among the messengers, nor do I know what will be done with me or with you. I only follow what is revealed to me, and I am not but a clear warner.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the humility and obedience of the Prophet Muhammad, who is emphasizing that he is not introducing a new religion, but rather continuing the tradition of previous prophets, and that his only role is to convey the message of God, without any personal knowledge or control over the outcome.
orig: قل ما كنت بدعا من الرسل وما أدري ما يفعل بي ولا بكم إن أتبع إلا ما يوحى إلي وما أنا إلا نذير مبين

translation: Say, 'Have you considered: if it is from Allah and you disbelieve in it and a witness from the Children of Israel testifies to its like, and he has believed while you are arrogant? Indeed, Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance of those who reject the truth, even when they are faced with undeniable evidence, and how this arrogance prevents them from being guided by God, emphasizing that God does not guide those who insist on wrongdoing.
orig: قل أرأيتم إن كان من عند الله وكفرتم به وشهد شاهد من بني إسرائيل على مثله فآمن واستكبرتم إن الله لا يهدي القوم الظالمين

translation: And those who disbelieved said to those who believed: 'If it had been good, they would not have preceded us to it.' And when they were not guided by it, they will say: 'This is an ancient lie.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the psychological and intellectual dishonesty of the disbelievers, who reject the truth not because they have a valid reason, but because they are unwilling to accept that others have preceded them in embracing the faith, and instead, they resort to dismissing the truth as an old, fabricated lie.
orig: وقال الذين كفروا للذين آمنوا لو كان خيرا ما سبقونا إليه وإذ لم يهتدوا به فسيقولون هذا إفك قديم

translation: And before this, the Book of Moses was a guide and a mercy, and this is a Book that confirms, in the Arabic tongue, to warn those who do wrong and to bring good news to the doers of good.
interpretation: The verse highlights the continuity of the message of the Qur'an with the previous revelations, emphasizing that the new scripture is a confirmation and a reinforcement of the guidance and mercy that was present in the Book of Moses, and that it serves as a warning to the wrongdoers and a source of good news for those who do good.
orig: ومن قبله كتاب موسى إماما ورحمة وهذا كتاب مصدق لسانا عربيا لينذر الذين ظلموا وبشرى للمحسنين

translation: Verily, those who say, 'Our Lord is Allah,' and then are upright, there is no fear upon them, nor will they grieve.
interpretation: The verse conveys a sense of reassurance and comfort, implying that those who sincerely declare their faith in Allah and remain steadfast on the path of righteousness will be free from fear and anxiety, and will ultimately find peace and happiness in this life and the hereafter.
orig: إن الذين قالوا ربنا الله ثم استقاموا فلا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: Those are the companions of Paradise, they will abide therein, a reward for what they used to do.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that the righteous people will be rewarded with eternal life in Paradise, and that their good deeds will be the key to their eternal bliss.
orig: أولئك أصحاب الجنة خالدين فيها جزاء بما كانوا يعملون

translation: And We have enjoined upon man, to his parents, good treatment. His mother carried him with hardship and gave birth to him with hardship, and his gestation and weaning [period] is thirty months. Until, when he reaches full strength and reaches forty years, he says: 'My Lord, enable me to be grateful for Your favor which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents and that I may do righteousness that will please You and make righteous for me my offspring. Indeed, I have turned to You and indeed, I am of those who submit [to You].'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of gratitude and good deeds, highlighting the struggles and sacrifices made by parents, particularly mothers, in raising their children, and encourages individuals to recognize and appreciate these efforts, and to strive to lead a righteous life that pleases God.
orig: ووصينا الإنسان بوالديه إحسانا حملته أمه كرها ووضعته كرها وحمله وفصاله ثلاثون شهرا حتى إذا بلغ أشده وبلغ أربعين سنة قال رب أوزعني أن أشكر نعمتك التي أنعمت علي وعلى والدي وأن أعمل صالحا ترضاه وأصلح لي في ذريتي إني تبت إليك وإني من المسلمين

translation: Those are the ones from whom We will accept the best of what they did and overlook their evil deeds, [and they will be] among the companions of Paradise, in fulfillment of the true promise which they were promised.
interpretation: The verse highlights the mercy and forgiveness of God, where He accepts the good deeds of the righteous and overlooks their minor mistakes, ultimately rewarding them with Paradise, as promised.
orig: أولئك الذين نتقبل عنهم أحسن ما عملوا ونتجاوز عن سيئاتهم في أصحاب الجنة وعد الصدق الذي كانوا يوعدون

translation: And he who says to his parents: 'Fie upon you both! Do you threaten me that I shall be brought forth when generations have passed away before me? And they both seek Allah's help: 'Woe to you! Believe! Verily, the promise of Allah is true.' But he says: 'This is nothing but the tales of the ancients.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and skepticism of those who reject the truth, and how they dismiss the warnings of their parents and the promise of God's punishment, considering it to be mere ancient myths and legends, rather than a serious warning that requires their attention and repentance.
orig: والذي قال لوالديه أف لكما أتعدانني أن أخرج وقد خلت القرون من قبلي وهما يستغيثان الله ويلك آمن إن وعد الله حق فيقول ما هذا إلا أساطير الأولين

translation: Those are the ones upon whom the Word is justified from among the nations that have passed away before them of jinn and men; indeed, they were losers.
interpretation: The verse highlights the fate of those who reject the message of God, emphasizing that they will be among the losers in the Hereafter, just like the nations of jinn and men who have gone before them and rejected the divine guidance.
orig: أولئك الذين حق عليهم القول في أمم قد خلت من قبلهم من الجن والإنس إنهم كانوا خاسرين

translation: And for all are degrees from what they did, and He will fully compensate them for their deeds, and they will not be wronged.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the concept of justice and fairness in the Hereafter, where every individual will be judged based on their deeds, and will receive their rewards or punishments accordingly, without any injustice or oppression.
orig: ولكل درجات مما عملوا وليوفيهم أعمالهم وهم لا يظلمون

translation: And the Day when those who disbelieved will be exposed to the Fire: 'You received your good things in the life of the world, and you took pleasure in them; but today you will be rewarded with the punishment of humiliation for what you used to act arrogantly in the earth without right and for what you used to corrupt.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that those who disbelieved and lived a life of arrogance and corruption will be punished in the afterlife, and that their enjoyment of worldly pleasures will not save them from God's wrath.
orig: ويوم يعرض الذين كفروا على النار أذهبتم طيباتكم في حياتكم الدنيا واستمتعتم بها فاليوم تجزون عذاب الهون بما كنتم تستكبرون في الأرض بغير الحق وبما كنتم تفسقون

translation: And remember the brother of 'Ad, when he warned his people in Al-Ahqaf, and indeed warnings had passed away before him and behind him, saying: 'Do not worship except Allah. Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a tremendous Day.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of heeding the warnings of prophets and messengers, who are sent to guide humanity towards righteousness and save them from the wrath of God, emphasizing the urgency and gravity of the matter.
orig: واذكر أخا عاد إذ أنذر قومه بالأحقاف وقد خلت النذر من بين يديه ومن خلفه ألا تعبدوا إلا الله إني أخاف عليكم عذاب يوم عظيم

translation: They said: 'Have you come to turn us away from our gods? Bring us then what you threaten us with, if you are of the truthful.'
