interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and defiance of the unbelievers, who instead of listening to the message of the prophet, are challenging him to bring forth the punishment he is warning them of, showcasing their ignorance and lack of humility in the face of divine warning.
orig: قالوا أجئتنا لتأفكنا عن آلهتنا فأتنا بما تعدنا إن كنت من الصادقين

translation: He said: The knowledge is only with Allah, and I convey to you that with which I have been sent, but I see you are a people who are ignorant.
interpretation: The verse highlights the humility and awareness of the limitations of a messenger, who recognizes that true knowledge belongs only to God, and that his role is merely to convey the message, without claiming any authority or wisdom of his own.
orig: قال إنما العلم عند الله وأبلغكم ما أرسلت به ولكني أراكم قوما تجهلون

translation: And when they saw it as a cloud approaching their valleys, they said, 'This cloud is bringing us rain!' Nay, it is that which you were seeking to hasten - a wind wherein is a painful punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the ignorance and arrogance of those who reject the signs of God, as they mistake the approaching punishment for a blessing, and are thus caught off guard when it strikes them.
orig: فلما رأوه عارضا مستقبل أوديتهم قالوا هذا عارض ممطرنا بل هو ما استعجلتم به ريح فيها عذاب أليم

translation: It destroyed everything by the command of its Lord, so they became such that nothing was to be seen except their dwellings. Thus do We recompense the criminal people.
interpretation: The verse highlights the complete destruction of a town, leaving behind only empty dwellings, as a consequence of the sinful actions of its people, serving as a powerful example of God's justice and warning to those who disobey Him.
orig: تدمر كل شيء بأمر ربها فأصبحوا لا يرى إلا مساكنهم كذلك نجزي القوم المجرمين

translation: And We had certainly established them in what We had established you in, and We had given them hearing and vision and intellect, but their hearing did not benefit them, nor their vision, nor their intellects at all, when they were rejecting the signs of Allah, and they were enveloped by what they used to mock.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of human senses and intellect when one rejects the signs of God, implying that even if one is blessed with the faculties of hearing, vision, and intellect, they will not benefit from them if they refuse to acknowledge the truth.
orig: ولقد مكناهم فيما إن مكناكم فيه وجعلنا لهم سمعا وأبصارا وأفئدة فما أغنى عنهم سمعهم ولا أبصارهم ولا أفئدتهم من شيء إذ كانوا يجحدون بآيات الله وحاق بهم ما كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: And indeed, We have destroyed towns around you, and We have repeated the signs so that they might return.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's mercy and patience in giving people multiple chances to repent and reform, as He repeatedly sends signs and warnings to guide them back to the right path, but ultimately, it is up to humans to take heed and make a change.
orig: ولقد أهلكنا ما حولكم من القرى وصرفنا الآيات لعلهم يرجعون

translation: If only they had been supported by those who took besides Allah pious allies, (gods), indeed they would have strayed from them, and that was their lie, and what they used to invent.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who associate partners with Allah are deluded into thinking that their idols can provide them with support and protection, but in reality, these idols are powerless and can offer no help, leaving the idolaters to face the consequences of their own actions.
orig: فلولا نصرهم الذين اتخذوا من دون الله قربانا آلهة بل ضلوا عنهم وذلك إفكهم وما كانوا يفترون

translation: And when We directed to you a group of the jinn, listening to the Quran, and when they were in its presence, they said: 'Listen quietly'; and when it was concluded, they went back to their people, warning.
interpretation: The verse highlights the extraordinary attention and reverence with which the jinn listened to the Quran, and how they immediately went back to their people to warn them, implying that even supernatural beings recognized the significance and importance of the Quran's message.
orig: وإذ صرفنا إليك نفرا من الجن يستمعون القرآن فلما حضروه قالوا أنصتوا فلما قضي ولوا إلى قومهم منذرين

translation: They said, 'O our people, indeed we have heard a Book revealed after Moses, confirming what was before it, guiding to the truth and to a straight path.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the acknowledgement by the people of a new scripture that confirms and builds upon the previous revelations, and its role in guiding humanity towards the truth and the right path, emphasizing the continuity and consistency of divine guidance.
orig: قالوا يا قومنا إنا سمعنا كتابا أنزل من بعد موسى مصدقا لما بين يديه يهدي إلى الحق وإلى طريق مستقيم

translation: O our people! Respond to the caller of Allah and believe in him, He will forgive you from your sins and protect you from a painful punishment.
interpretation: The verse is an invitation to people to respond to the call of Allah and believe in Him, promising forgiveness from sins and protection from punishment, highlighting the mercy and benevolence of Allah.
orig: يا قومنا أجيبوا داعي الله وآمنوا به يغفر لكم من ذنوبكم ويجركم من عذاب أليم

translation: And whoever does not respond to Allah, there is no escape for him on earth, and he has no allies besides Him. Those are in manifest error.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of trying to escape or find refuge from God's wrath, emphasizing that those who reject God's call will ultimately be left alone and helpless, with no one to turn to for protection or support.
orig: ومن لا يجب داعي الله فليس بمعجز في الأرض وليس له من دونه أولياء أولئك في ضلال مبين

translation: Do they not see that Allah, Who created the heavens and the earth and was not tired by their creation, is able to give life to the dead? Yes, He is Able to do all things.
interpretation: The verse highlights the omnipotence of God, emphasizing that if He can create the vast universe, He can also resurrect the dead, implying that God's power is limitless and that He can accomplish anything He wills.
orig: أولم يروا أن الله الذي خلق السماوات والأرض ولم يعي بخلقهن بقادر على أن يحيي الموتى بلى إنه على كل شيء قدير

translation: And on the Day when those who disbelieved are exposed to the Fire, (it will be said), 'Is this not the truth?' They will say, 'Yes, by our Lord!' He will say, 'Then taste the punishment for what you used to disbelieve.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the moment of truth when the disbelievers will be confronted with the reality of their denial, and instead of being able to deny or escape, they will be forced to acknowledge the truth and face the consequences of their disbelief.
orig: ويوم يعرض الذين كفروا على النار أليس هذا بالحق قالوا بلى وربنا قال فذوقوا العذاب بما كنتم تكفرون

translation: So be patient, just as the Messengers of firm resolve were patient, and do not hasten for them; it is as if they see them on the day they will see what they were promised, they did not stay except for an hour of a day; will anyone be destroyed except the defiantly disobedient people?
interpretation: The verse is encouraging the Prophet Muhammad and believers to be patient in the face of persecution and hardship, just as previous prophets were patient, and to not hasten or seek immediate relief, as the punishment for the disobedient will come suddenly and unexpectedly, catching them off guard.
orig: فاصبر كما صبر أولو العزم من الرسل ولا تستعجل لهم كأنهم يوم يرون ما يوعدون لم يلبثوا إلا ساعة من نهار بلاغ فهل يهلك إلا القوم الفاسقون

translation: Those who disbelieve and hinder (men) from the Path of Allah, He will render their deeds vain.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of the efforts of those who reject faith and hinder others from following the path of God, implying that their actions will ultimately lead to nothing but loss and disappointment.
orig: الذين كفروا وصدوا عن سبيل الله أضل أعمالهم

translation: And those who believe and do righteous deeds and believe in what has been revealed to Muhammad, and it is the truth from their Lord, He will remove from them their evil deeds and improve their condition.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of combining faith with good deeds, emphasizing that true believers are those who not only believe in the revelation sent to the Prophet Muhammad, but also strive to live a righteous life, and as a result, God will forgive their past mistakes and improve their spiritual state.
orig: والذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات وآمنوا بما نزل على محمد وهو الحق من ربهم كفر عنهم سيئاتهم وأصلح بالهم

translation: That is because those who disbelieved followed falsehood, and those who believed followed the truth from their Lord. Thus does Allah strike their similitude for mankind.
interpretation: The verse highlights the fundamental difference between believers and non-believers, suggesting that the former are guided by divine truth, while the latter are misled by falsehood, and that this distinction is a universal principle that applies to all humanity.
orig: ذلك بأن الذين كفروا اتبعوا الباطل وأن الذين آمنوا اتبعوا الحق من ربهم كذلك يضرب الله للناس أمثالهم

translation: So when you meet those who disbelieve, smite their necks until when you have slain them, then bind a bond firmly, then either generosity after or ransom until the war lays down its burdens. That, and if Allah had willed, He would have taken vengeance on them, but He tests some of you by means of others. And those who are killed in the way of Allah, He will not let their deeds go to waste.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of self-purification and spiritual growth through the trials and challenges of life, suggesting that the difficulties and hardships faced by believers are a means of testing their faith and resolve, and ultimately leading to their spiritual refinement and growth.
orig: فإذا لقيتم الذين كفروا فضرب الرقاب حتى إذا أثخنتموهم فشدوا الوثاق فإما منا بعد وإما فداء حتى تضع الحرب أوزارها ذلك ولو يشاء الله لانتصر منهم ولكن ليبلو بعضكم ببعض والذين قتلوا في سبيل الله فلن يضل أعمالهم

translation: He will guide them and reform their condition.
interpretation: The verse suggests that God's guidance is not only a means of showing the right path, but also a transformative process that brings about inner reform and improvement in the individual's spiritual and moral state.
orig: سيهديهم ويصلح بالهم

translation: And He will admit them to Paradise, which He has made known to them.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of paradise being a place that is not only a physical reward, but also a spiritual destination that believers can envision and strive for, motivating them to live a righteous life.
orig: ويدخلهم الجنة عرفها لهم

translation: O you who have believed, if you support Allah, He will support you and plant firmly your feet.
interpretation: This verse is a promise from God to believers that if they support and obey Him, He will not only support them but also give them stability and firmness in their faith and actions, enabling them to overcome challenges and stay on the right path.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إن تنصروا الله ينصركم ويثبت أقدامكم

translation: And those who disbelieve, woe to them, and their deeds are in vain.
interpretation: The verse is a warning to those who reject faith, implying that they will face a terrible fate, and that their worldly efforts and achievements will ultimately be of no value or benefit to them in the Hereafter.
orig: والذين كفروا فتعسا لهم وأضل أعمالهم

translation: That is because they hated what Allah revealed, so He rendered their deeds worthless.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of rejecting God's revelation and guidance, which leads to the nullification of one's good deeds, rendering them worthless in the eyes of God.
orig: ذلك بأنهم كرهوا ما أنزل الله فأحبط أعمالهم

translation: Do they not travel through the land, so they may see how was the end of those who were before them? Allah destroyed them, and for the disbelievers is a similar fate.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of learning from history and the consequences of ignoring the signs of God, implying that those who refuse to learn from the past are doomed to repeat the mistakes of their predecessors.
orig: أفلم يسيروا في الأرض فينظروا كيف كان عاقبة الذين من قبلهم دمر الله عليهم وللكافرين أمثالها

translation: That is because Allah is the Maula of those who believe, and that those who disbelieve have no Maula.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of divine patronage, where Allah is the sole protector and guardian of believers, implying a deep sense of trust and reliance on Him, whereas those who reject faith are left without any protector or guardian, emphasizing their vulnerability and disconnection from divine guidance.
orig: ذلك بأن الله مولى الذين آمنوا وأن الكافرين لا مولى لهم

translation: Indeed, Allah will admit those who have believed and done righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow. But those who disbelieved will enjoy themselves and eat as the animals eat, and the Fire will be a dwelling place for them.
interpretation: The verse highlights the contrast between the eternal bliss of the righteous in Paradise and the eternal suffering of the disbelievers in Hell, emphasizing that the latter's indulgence in worldly pleasures will ultimately lead to their downfall.
orig: إن الله يدخل الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار والذين كفروا يتمتعون ويأكلون كما تأكل الأنعام والنار مثوى لهم

translation: And how many a town is stronger than your town which expelled you, We destroyed them, and there was no helper for them.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that God's power and justice are not limited by human strength or might, and that even the strongest of nations can fall victim to His wrath if they persist in their wrongdoing.
orig: وكأين من قرية هي أشد قوة من قريتك التي أخرجتك أهلكناهم فلا ناصر لهم

translation: Is he who is on clear proof from his Lord like him who is made to see his evil deeds and follows his own desires?
interpretation: The verse highlights the contrast between those who are guided by divine revelation and those who are misled by their own desires, implying that the latter are blind to the truth and will ultimately be responsible for their own downfall.
orig: أفمن كان على بينة من ربه كمن زين له سوء عمله واتبعوا أهواءهم

translation: A similitude of the Paradise which the righteous have been promised: therein are rivers of water unpolluted, and rivers of milk the taste of which does not change, and rivers of wine delicious to those who drink, and rivers of honey clarified and purified, and they will have therein of every fruit and forgiveness from their Lord, like one who abides in the Fire and is given to drink boiling water that cuts off his bowels.
interpretation: The verse highlights the contrast between the eternal bliss of Paradise and the eternal torment of Hell, emphasizing that the righteous will be rewarded with a life of abundance and joy, while the wicked will suffer unbearable punishment, implying that the choice between good and evil has consequences that will last forever.
orig: مثل الجنة التي وعد المتقون فيها أنهار من ماء غير آسن وأنهار من لبن لم يتغير طعمه وأنهار من خمر لذة للشاربين وأنهار من عسل مصفى ولهم فيها من كل الثمرات ومغفرة من ربهم كمن هو خالد في النار وسقوا ماء حميما فقطع أمعاءهم

translation: And among them are some who listen to you, until when they go out from your presence, they say to those who have been given knowledge: 'What did he just say?' Those are the ones whose hearts Allah has sealed, and they follow their own desires.
interpretation: This verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who pretend to be interested in the message, but have no intention of following it, and instead follow their own selfish desires, which ultimately leads to their spiritual downfall.
orig: ومنهم من يستمع إليك حتى إذا خرجوا من عندك قالوا للذين أوتوا العلم ماذا قال آنفا أولئك الذين طبع الله على قلوبهم واتبعوا أهواءهم

translation: And as for those who were guided, He increased them in guidance and gave them their righteousness.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that those who are already on the path of righteousness will be given even more guidance and spiritual strength, implying that God rewards those who are already making an effort to follow His will.
orig: والذين اهتدوا زادهم هدى وآتاهم تقواهم

translation: Do they wait except for the Hour that it should come to them suddenly? But some of its indications have already come, so what will be their reminder when it comes to them?
interpretation: The verse highlights the inevitability of the Day of Judgment and how people are unaware of its sudden arrival, despite the signs and warnings that have already been sent to them, emphasizing the importance of being prepared and mindful of one's actions.
orig: فهل ينظرون إلا الساعة أن تأتيهم بغتة فقد جاء أشراطها فأنى لهم إذا جاءتهم ذكراهم

translation: So know that there is no deity except Allah and ask forgiveness for your sin and for the believing men and believing women. And Allah knows your movement and your resting place.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of seeking forgiveness from Allah, not just for one's own sins, but also for the sins of others, specifically the believing men and women, highlighting the sense of community and collective responsibility in Islam.
orig: فاعلم أنه لا إله إلا الله واستغفر لذنبك وللمؤمنين والمؤمنات والله يعلم متقلبكم ومثواكم

translation: And those who believe say: 'Why is not a chapter revealed?' But when a precise chapter is revealed, and fighting is mentioned therein, you see those in whose hearts is a disease looking at you with a look of one fainting to death. Rather, it is more suitable for them
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of some people who claim to be believers but are actually afraid of taking a stand against injustice, and instead, they are more concerned with their own safety and well-being, even to the point of being willing to abandon their faith.
orig: ويقول الذين آمنوا لولا نزلت سورة فإذا أنزلت سورة محكمة وذكر فيها القتال رأيت الذين في قلوبهم مرض ينظرون إليك نظر المغشي عليه من الموت فأولى لهم

translation: Obedience and honorable talk, and when the matter is determined, then if they had been true to Allah, it would have been better for them
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of sincerity and loyalty to God, suggesting that if individuals had been truthful in their devotion to Allah, they would have been better off in the long run.
orig: طاعة وقول معروف فإذا عزم الأمر فلو صدقوا الله لكان خيرا لهم

translation: If you turn away, will you corrupt in the earth and sever your ties of kinship?
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of turning away from God's guidance, which would lead to corruption and chaos on earth, as well as the breakdown of family bonds and social cohesion.
orig: فهل عسيتم إن توليتم أن تفسدوا في الأرض وتقطعوا أرحامكم

translation: Those are the ones whom Allah has cursed, so He deafened them and blinded their sights.
interpretation: This verse suggests that those who have been cursed by God have lost their spiritual insight and ability to understand the truth, and are therefore unable to recognize the guidance and wisdom of God's revelation.
orig: أولئك الذين لعنهم الله فأصمهم وأعمى أبصارهم

translation: Do they not ponder on the Quran, or are there locks on their hearts?
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that some people are spiritually closed off and unable to truly understand and reflect on the message of the Quran, as if their hearts are locked and inaccessible to the truth.
orig: أفلا يتدبرون القرآن أم على قلوب أقفالها

translation: Those who reverted to their old ways after guidance had become clear to them, Satan beguiled them and prolonged their desires.
interpretation: The verse highlights the psychological struggle of those who turn away from faith, suggesting that Satan's influence can be so convincing that it can make them feel comfortable and justified in their apostasy, leading them to prolong their sinful desires.
orig: إن الذين ارتدوا على أدبارهم من بعد ما تبين لهم الهدى الشيطان سول لهم وأملى لهم

translation: That is because they said to those who hated what Allah has revealed: 'We will obey you in part of the matter', and Allah knows their secrets.
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who claim to be believers but secretly collaborate with the enemies of faith, hinting that their obedience is conditional and limited, and that Allah is fully aware of their hidden intentions and motives.
orig: ذلك بأنهم قالوا للذين كرهوا ما نزل الله سنطيعكم في بعض الأمر والله يعلم إسرارهم

translation: Then how will it be when the angels take them in death, striking their faces and their backs?
interpretation: The verse highlights the harsh reality of death, where even the most arrogant and stubborn individuals will be humbled, and their pride will be crushed, as they are taken by the angels of death, who will strike their faces and backs, symbolizing the complete loss of power and control.
orig: فكيف إذا توفتهم الملائكة يضربون وجوههم وأدبارهم

translation: That is because they followed what angered Allah and disliked His good pleasure, so He made their deeds worthless.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who incur God's wrath and reject His guidance will ultimately have their efforts and achievements rendered futile and worthless, implying that their disobedience and rebellion against God will lead to their own downfall.
orig: ذلك بأنهم اتبعوا ما أسخط الله وكرهوا رضوانه فأحبط أعمالهم

translation: Or do those in whose hearts is disease think that Allah will not bring to light their [inner] hatred?
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that those who harbor hatred or malice in their hearts cannot conceal it from God, who is all-knowing and all-seeing, and that their inner feelings will ultimately be exposed.
orig: أم حسب الذين في قلوبهم مرض أن لن يخرج الله أضغانهم

translation: And if We had willed, We would have shown them to you, and you would have known them by their marks, and you would have certainly known them by the tone of their speech, and Allah knows your deeds.
interpretation: The verse highlights Allah's omniscience and His ability to expose the hypocrites, implying that if Allah willed, He could have revealed their true identities to the Prophet, but instead, He chose to test the believers' faith and trust in Him.
orig: ولو نشاء لأريناكهم فلعرفتهم بسيماهم ولتعرفنهم في لحن القول والله يعلم أعمالكم

translation: And We will surely test you until We know those who strive among you and the patient, and We will test your news.
interpretation: The verse indicates that God's testing of believers is a means of distinguishing between those who are truly devoted to their faith and those who are not, and that this testing is a way of refining and purifying the believers' characters.
orig: ولنبلونكم حتى نعلم المجاهدين منكم والصابرين ونبلو أخباركم

translation: Those who disbelieve and hinder (men) from the path of Allah and oppose the Messenger after guidance has become clear to them, they will not harm Allah in the least, and He will render their deeds vain.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who reject faith and hinder others from following the path of God, despite having clear guidance, will ultimately be rendered powerless and their efforts will be in vain, implying that God's plan will prevail regardless of their opposition.
orig: إن الذين كفروا وصدوا عن سبيل الله وشاقوا الرسول من بعد ما تبين لهم الهدى لن يضروا الله شيئا وسيحبط أعمالهم

translation: O you who have believed, obey Allah and obey the Messenger and do not invalidate your deeds.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obedience to both Allah and the Prophet Muhammad, and warns against nullifying one's good deeds through disobedience or sinful behavior, highlighting the need for consistency in one's faith and actions.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا أطيعوا الله وأطيعوا الرسول ولا تبطلوا أعمالكم

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieved and averted [people] from the path of Allah and then died while they were disbelievers - never will Allah forgive them.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of leading others astray from the path of God, emphasizing that those who do so and die in a state of disbelief will be denied God's forgiveness, implying a severe punishment in the afterlife.
orig: إن الذين كفروا وصدوا عن سبيل الله ثم ماتوا وهم كفار فلن يغفر الله لهم

translation: So do not weaken and call for peace while you are superior, and Allah is with you and will not waste your efforts.
interpretation: This verse is encouraging believers to remain steadfast and not to seek a hasty peace that may compromise their values and principles, as they are in a position of strength and God is on their side, ensuring that their efforts will not be in vain.
orig: فلا تهنوا وتدعوا إلى السلم وأنتم الأعلون والله معكم ولن يتركم أعمالكم

translation: The life of this world is but play and amusement, and if you believe and fear Allah, He will give you your rewards, and will not ask you for your wealth.
interpretation: This verse highlights the fleeting nature of worldly life and its attractions, emphasizing that true fulfillment and reward come from believing in and fearing Allah, rather than accumulating wealth and material possessions.
orig: إنما الحياة الدنيا لعب ولهو وإن تؤمنوا وتتقوا يؤتكم أجوركم ولا يسألكم أموالكم

translation: If He asks you about it, you will deny, and you will reject, and your evil suggestions will emerge.
interpretation: The verse highlights humanity's tendency to deny and reject the truth when confronted with it, and how their inner evil intentions and suggestions will ultimately be revealed.
orig: إن يسألكموها فيحفكم تبخلوا ويخرج أضغانكم

translation: Here you are, calling to people to spend in the cause of Allah, but among you are those who withhold. And whoever withholds, only withholds from himself. And Allah is the Free of need, while you are the needy. And if you turn away, He will replace you with another people, then they will not be like you.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of self-reflection and accountability, suggesting that those who are stingy with their wealth and resources are ultimately harming themselves, not God, who is in no need of human charity.
orig: ها أنتم هؤلاء تدعون لتنفقوا في سبيل الله فمنكم من يبخل ومن يبخل فإنما يبخل عن نفسه والله الغني وأنتم الفقراء وإن تتولوا يستبدل قوما غيركم ثم لا يكونوا أمثالكم

translation: Indeed, We have granted you a clear conquest.
interpretation: The verse is a declaration of divine support and victory, signifying that God has granted the Prophet Muhammad a decisive and manifest triumph, which will be a turning point in his mission and a source of inspiration for his followers.
orig: إنا فتحنا لك فتحا مبينا

translation: May Allah forgive you what has preceded of your sin and what is to come, and complete His favor upon you and guide you to a straight path.
interpretation: The verse expresses the desire for Allah's forgiveness and guidance, emphasizing the importance of seeking forgiveness for past and future mistakes, and seeking Allah's guidance to remain on the straight path, free from sin and deviation.
orig: ليغفر لك الله ما تقدم من ذنبك وما تأخر ويتم نعمته عليك ويهديك صراطا مستقيما

translation: And Allah will help you with a mighty victory.
interpretation: The verse is a promise from God to the believers that He will grant them a glorious and mighty victory, which will be a manifestation of His power and might, and will bring honor and prestige to the believers.
orig: وينصرك الله نصرا عزيزا

translation: He it is Who sent down As-Sakinah (peace of reassurance) into the hearts of the believers, that they may add faith to their faith; and to Allah belong the hosts of the heavens and the earth, and Allah is Ever All-Knower, All-Wise.
interpretation: The verse highlights the unique relationship between God and the believers, where God's presence in their hearts brings them peace and reassurance, allowing them to increase their faith and trust in Him, and ultimately, to surrender to His will.
orig: هو الذي أنزل السكينة في قلوب المؤمنين ليزدادوا إيمانا مع إيمانهم ولله جنود السماوات والأرض وكان الله عليما حكيما

translation: He will admit the believing men and the believing women to Gardens underneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide eternally, and He will acquit them of their evil deeds, and that, with Allah, is a supreme success.
interpretation: The verse highlights the ultimate reward for believers, which is not only a physical paradise but also a spiritual one, where all past mistakes are forgiven, and they are granted eternal bliss, emphasizing the idea that true success lies in attaining God's pleasure and forgiveness.
orig: ليدخل المؤمنين والمؤمنات جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها ويكفر عنهم سيئاتهم وكان ذلك عند الله فوزا عظيما

translation: And He will punish the hypocrite men and the hypocrite women, and the polytheist men and the polytheist women who think an evil thought about Allah, upon them is the evil turn, and Allah's wrath is upon them, and He has cursed them, and has prepared for them Hell, and evil is the destination.
interpretation: This verse highlights the severe consequences that await those who harbor evil thoughts about God, including hypocrites and polytheists, emphasizing that their negative perceptions of God will ultimately lead to their own downfall and punishment in the afterlife.
orig: ويعذب المنافقين والمنافقات والمشركين والمشركات الظانين بالله ظن السوء عليهم دائرة السوء وغضب الله عليهم ولعنهم وأعد لهم جهنم وساءت مصيرا

translation: And to Allah belong the armies of the heavens and the earth. And ever is Allah Exalted in Power, Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes God's absolute power and wisdom, implying that everything in the universe, including the forces of nature, are under His control and command, and that He is the ultimate authority who exercises His power with wisdom and justice.
orig: ولله جنود السماوات والأرض وكان الله عزيزا حكيما

translation: Indeed, We have sent you as a witness, and a bearer of good news and a warner.
interpretation: This verse highlights the prophetic mission of the Prophet Muhammad, emphasizing his role as a witness to the truth, a bringer of good news to the believers, and a warner to those who reject the message, implying that the Prophet's message is a call to accountability and responsibility.
orig: إنا أرسلناك شاهدا ومبشرا ونذيرا

translation: That you believe in Allah and His Messenger, and honour him, and respect him, and glorify Him in the morning and the evening.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of having a deep reverence and respect for the Prophet Muhammad, which is a crucial aspect of a believer's faith, as it reflects their love and devotion to Allah.
orig: لتؤمنوا بالله ورسوله وتعزروه وتوقروه وتسبحوه بكرة وأصيلا

translation: Indeed, those who pledge allegiance to you, [O Muhammad], are pledging allegiance to Allah. The hand of Allah is over their hands. So whoever breaks his oath, only breaks it to his own loss. And whoever fulfills what he has promised to Allah, He will give him a great reward.
interpretation: The verse highlights the sacred nature of the pledge of allegiance to the Prophet, emphasizing that it is in fact a pledge to Allah, and that those who fulfill their oath will be rewarded, while those who break it will suffer the consequences.
orig: إن الذين يبايعونك إنما يبايعون الله يد الله فوق أيديهم فمن نكث فإنما ينكث على نفسه ومن أوفى بما عاهد عليه الله فسيؤتيه أجرا عظيما

translation: The desert Arabs who lagged behind will say to you, 'We were busied with our riches and our families, so ask forgiveness for us.' They say with their tongues what is not in their hearts. Say: 'Who is it that can hold back anything from Allah for you, if He should intend to do you harm or if He should intend to do you good. Nay, but Allah is well-acquainted with all that you do.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who make excuses to avoid fulfilling their responsibilities, and instead, try to deceive others with their words, while their hearts are devoid of sincerity. The verse serves as a reminder that Allah is fully aware of our intentions and actions, and no one can deceive Him.
orig: سيقول لك المخلفون من الأعراب شغلتنا أموالنا وأهلونا فاستغفر لنا يقولون بألسنتهم ما ليس في قلوبهم قل فمن يملك لكم من الله شيئا إن أراد بكم ضرا أو أراد بكم نفعا بل كان الله بما تعملون خبيرا

translation: Nay, you thought that the Messenger and the believers would never return to their families, and that was made fair-seeming to you, and you thought an evil thought and you were a people ruined.
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of people to think negatively and assume the worst-case scenario, which can lead to their downfall, emphasizing the importance of having a positive outlook and trusting in God's plan.
orig: بل ظننتم أن لن ينقلب الرسول والمؤمنون إلى أهليهم أبدا وزين ذلك في قلوبكم وظننتم ظن السوء وكنتم قوما بورا

translation: And whoever does not believe in Allah and His Messenger, then indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers a blazing fire.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of rejecting faith in God and His Messenger, which is considered a grave sin, and warns that those who do so will face severe punishment in the afterlife, symbolized by the blazing fire.
orig: ومن لم يؤمن بالله ورسوله فإنا أعتدنا للكافرين سعيرا

translation: And to Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills, and Allah is Ever-Ghaffar (the Forgiving), Ever-Rahim (the Merciful).
interpretation: The verse highlights the absolute authority and sovereignty of God, emphasizing that His mercy and forgiveness are not limited by human standards, but are instead an expression of His divine wisdom and justice.
orig: ولله ملك السماوات والأرض يغفر لمن يشاء ويعذب من يشاء وكان الله غفورا رحيما

translation: The laggards will say, when you set out to take the spoils, 'Allow us to follow you.' They wish to change the words of Allah. Say, 'You will not follow us. Thus Allah has said beforehand.' Then they will say, 'Rather, you envy us.' Nay, they did not understand except a little.
interpretation: The verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who claim to be believers but lack the courage to take action, instead seeking to benefit from the efforts of others, and then trying to justify their inaction by accusing others of envy, revealing their own lack of self-awareness and spiritual understanding.
orig: سيقول المخلفون إذا انطلقتم إلى مغانم لتأخذوها ذرونا نتبعكم يريدون أن يبدلوا كلام الله قل لن تتبعونا كذلكم قال الله من قبل فسيقولون بل تحسدوننا بل كانوا لا يفقهون إلا قليلا

translation: Say to those who lag behind among the Bedouins: 'You shall be called to a people of great might; you shall fight them, or they shall surrender. If you obey, God will give you a good reward, but if you turn away as you turned away before, He will punish you with a painful punishment.'
interpretation: The verse is a warning to the Bedouins who lag behind in their faith, that they will be forced to confront a powerful enemy, and they will have to fight or surrender, and if they obey God's command, they will be rewarded, but if they turn away, they will face severe punishment, implying that God is not tolerant of their disobedience and neglect.
orig: قل للمخلفين من الأعراب ستدعون إلى قوم أولي بأس شديد تقاتلونهم أو يسلمون فإن تطيعوا يؤتكم الله أجرا حسنا وإن تتولوا كما توليتم من قبل يعذبكم عذابا أليما

translation: There is no blame on the blind, nor is there blame on the lame, nor is there blame on the sick. And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger, He will admit him to Gardens under which rivers flow; and whoever turns away, He will punish him with a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of intention and effort in obeying God's commands, rather than mere physical ability, emphasizing that it is the willingness to obey that matters, not the physical capacity to do so.
orig: ليس على الأعمى حرج ولا على الأعرج حرج ولا على المريض حرج ومن يطع الله ورسوله يدخله جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار ومن يتول يعذبه عذابا أليما

translation: Allah was pleased with the believers when they swore allegiance to you under the tree, for He knew what was in their hearts, so He sent down tranquility upon them and rewarded them with a near victory.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of trust and faith in God, as the believers who swore allegiance to the Prophet under the tree demonstrated, and how this trust is rewarded with divine tranquility and victory.
orig: لقد رضي الله عن المؤمنين إذ يبايعونك تحت الشجرة فعلم ما في قلوبهم فأنزل السكينة عليهم وأثابهم فتحا قريبا

translation: And many a town that was unjust, We seized it, and Allah is Exalted in Power, Wise.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's power and wisdom in dealing with unjust societies, implying that His justice is not only punitive but also wise and discerning, taking into account the complexities of human societies.
orig: ومغانم كثيرة يأخذونها وكان الله عزيزا حكيما

translation: And Allah has promised you abundant spoils that you will take, and has hastened for you this, and restrained the hands of men from you, that it may be a sign for the believers, and guide you to a straight path.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of trusting in God's promise and having faith in His plan, as He is the one who guides and supports the believers, leading them to a path of righteousness and victory.
orig: وعدكم الله مغانم كثيرة تأخذونها فعجل لكم هذه وكف أيدي الناس عنكم ولتكون آية للمؤمنين ويهديكم صراطا مستقيما

translation: And other (favours) there are, which ye do not encompass - Allah compasseth them, and Allah hath power over all things.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's infinite power and ability to provide for humanity in ways that are beyond human comprehension, emphasizing that God's blessings and favors extend far beyond what humans can perceive or understand.
orig: وأخرى لم تقدروا عليها قد أحاط الله بها وكان الله على كل شيء قديرا

translation: And if those who disbelieve were to kill you, they would turn back, then they would not find any protector or helper.
interpretation: The verse highlights the futility of relying on earthly powers and alliances, for when the chips are down, even the most seemingly powerful enemies will abandon and betray each other, leaving the believer to rely solely on God.
orig: ولو قاتلكم الذين كفروا لولوا الأدبار ثم لا يجدون وليا ولا نصيرا

translation: The course of Allah, which has passed on before, and you will not find any alteration in the course of Allah.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the consistency and immutability of God's way of dealing with humanity, implying that God's laws and principles are eternal and unchanging, and that humans can expect the same consequences for their actions as those who came before them.
orig: سنة الله التي قد خلت من قبل ولن تجد لسنة الله تبديلا

translation: And He it is Who restrained their hands from you and your hands from them in the valley of Makkah, after He had given you victory over them. And Allah is Ever-All-Seer of what you do.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of gratitude and recognition of God's intervention in human affairs, as He is the One who restrained the hands of the enemy and granted victory to the believers, demonstrating His omniscience and power.
orig: وهو الذي كف أيديهم عنكم وأيديكم عنهم ببطن مكة من بعد أن أظفركم عليهم وكان الله بما تعملون بصيرا

translation: Those who disbelieved and hindered you from the Sacred Mosque and prevented the offering from reaching its place, and if not for believing men and believing women whom you did not know, you might have trampled them, and thus incurred blame unknowingly. That is so that Allah may admit to His mercy whom He wills. If they had been apart, We would have punished those who disbelieved among them with a painful punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of being mindful of the consequences of one's actions, as even unintentional harm to innocent believers can lead to blame and punishment from God, emphasizing the need for caution and consideration in all interactions.
orig: هم الذين كفروا وصدوكم عن المسجد الحرام والهدي معكوفا أن يبلغ محله ولولا رجال مؤمنون ونساء مؤمنات لم تعلموهم أن تطئوهم فتصيبكم منهم معرة بغير علم ليدخل الله في رحمته من يشاء لو تزيلوا لعذبنا الذين كفروا منهم عذابا أليما

translation: When those who disbelieved harbored in their hearts rage and pride of the time of ignorance, then Allah sent down His tranquility upon His Messenger and upon the believers and imposed upon them the word of righteousness, and they were more deserving of it and worthy of it, and Allah is All-Knowing of everything.
interpretation: This verse highlights the transformative power of faith, as it describes how God's tranquility descended upon the believers, replacing their initial rage and pride with righteousness, and emphasizing God's omniscience in guiding them towards the path of virtue.
orig: إذ جعل الذين كفروا في قلوبهم الحمية حمية الجاهلية فأنزل الله سكينته على رسوله وعلى المؤمنين وألزمهم كلمة التقوى وكانوا أحق بها وأهلها وكان الله بكل شيء عليما

translation: Allah has indeed fulfilled the vision for His Messenger in truth: You will surely enter the Sacred Mosque, if Allah wills, in safety, with your heads shaved or shortened, without any fear. He knew what you did not know, and He granted, besides that, a near victory.
interpretation: The verse is a testament to the fulfillment of God's promise to the Prophet Muhammad, and serves as a source of comfort and reassurance to the believers, reminding them that God's promises are always fulfilled, and that victory and success are always within reach, even in the face of adversity.
orig: لقد صدق الله رسوله الرؤيا بالحق لتدخلن المسجد الحرام إن شاء الله آمنين محلقين رءوسكم ومقصرين لا تخافون فعلم ما لم تعلموا فجعل من دون ذلك فتحا قريبا

translation: He is the One who has sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth, that He may make it prevail over all religions, and sufficient is Allah as a Witness.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate triumph of Islam, emphasizing that God has chosen to make it prevail over all other religions, implying that Islam will ultimately be the dominant faith, and that God's testimony is sufficient to guarantee its success.
orig: هو الذي أرسل رسوله بالهدى ودين الحق ليظهره على الدين كله وكفى بالله شهيدا

translation: Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah; and those who are with him are strong against Unbelievers, (but) compassionate amongst each other. You see them bowing down, prostrating themselves in prayer, seeking bounty from Allah and (His) Good Pleasure. Their mark is on their faces from the trace of prostration. That is their similitude in the Torah and their similitude in the Gospel; like a seed that sends forth its shoot, then makes it strong, then becomes thick, and it stands on its stem, (filling) the sowers with wonder and delight. As a result, it fills the Unbelievers with rage at them. Allah has promised those among them who believe and do righteous deeds forgiveness and a great Reward.
interpretation: The verse highlights the unique characteristics of the Prophet Muhammad and his companions, who are strong and firm against unbelievers, yet compassionate and kind towards one another, and it is this combination of strength and compassion that makes them stand out and earn them a great reward from God.
orig: محمد رسول الله والذين معه أشداء على الكفار رحماء بينهم تراهم ركعا سجدا يبتغون فضلا من الله ورضوانا سيماهم في وجوههم من أثر السجود ذلك مثلهم في التوراة ومثلهم في الإنجيل كزرع أخرج شطأه فآزره فاستغلظ فاستوى على سوقه يعجب الزراع ليغيظ بهم الكفار وعد الله الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات منهم مغفرة وأجرا عظيما

translation: O you who have believed, do not proceed [in prayer] before [the proceeding of] Allah and His Messenger, and fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is Hearing, Knowing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of respecting the authority and guidance of Allah and His Messenger, and warns against taking any action that may be considered disobedient or disrespectful, highlighting the all-encompassing knowledge and awareness of Allah.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تقدموا بين يدي الله ورسوله واتقوا الله إن الله سميع عليم

translation: O you who have believed, do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet or be loud to him in speech like some of you to others, lest your deeds become worthless while you perceive not.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of respecting the Prophet and maintaining a humble and reverent tone when speaking to him, as loud and boastful speech can lead to one's good deeds being rendered null and void, highlighting the significance of humility and modesty in one's interactions with the Prophet.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا ترفعوا أصواتكم فوق صوت النبي ولا تجهروا له بالقول كجهر بعضكم لبعض أن تحبط أعمالكم وأنتم لا تشعرون

translation: Indeed, those who lower their voices before the Messenger of Allah, those are the ones whose hearts Allah has tested for righteousness, for them is forgiveness and a great reward.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of humility and reverence in the presence of the Prophet Muhammad, and by extension, in the presence of sacred knowledge and spiritual guidance, as a key characteristic of those who are truly righteous and deserving of forgiveness and reward.
orig: إن الذين يغضون أصواتهم عند رسول الله أولئك الذين امتحن الله قلوبهم للتقوى لهم مغفرة وأجر عظيم

translation: Indeed, those who call you from behind the chambers, most of them do not understand.
interpretation: The verse highlights the ignorance and superficiality of those who claim to follow and support the Prophet, but in reality, they lack true understanding and sincerity in their faith.
orig: إن الذين ينادونك من وراء الحجرات أكثرهم لا يعقلون

translation: And if only they had patience until you came out to them, it would have been better for them, and Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of patience and trust in God's plan, suggesting that if people had waited for the Prophet's guidance, it would have been better for them, and that God's forgiveness and mercy are always available to those who turn to Him.
orig: ولو أنهم صبروا حتى تخرج إليهم لكان خيرا لهم والله غفور رحيم

translation: O you who have believed, if there comes to you a disobedient one with information, investigate, lest you harm a people out of ignorance and become, over what you have done, regretful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of verifying information before taking action, as hasty decisions based on unverified information can lead to regretful consequences, emphasizing the need for caution and diligence in decision-making.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إن جاءكم فاسق بنبإ فتبينوا أن تصيبوا قوما بجهالة فتصبحوا على ما فعلتم نادمين

translation: And know that among you is the Messenger of Allah. If he were to obey you in much of the matter, you would surely suffer. But Allah has endeared the Faith to you and has made it pleasing in your hearts, and has made hateful to you disbelief and defiance and disobedience. Those are the [rightly] guided.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of obeying the Prophet Muhammad, as disobeying him would lead to suffering, and emphasizes that faith has been made pleasing to the believers, while disbelief, defiance, and disobedience are hateful to them, indicating that true guidance is only attained through obedience to the Prophet.
orig: واعلموا أن فيكم رسول الله لو يطيعكم في كثير من الأمر لعنتم ولكن الله حبب إليكم الإيمان وزينه في قلوبكم وكره إليكم الكفر والفسوق والعصيان أولئك هم الراشدون

translation: Then We have guided him from Our favour and mercy, and Allah is Knowing, Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's role in guiding individuals towards the path of righteousness, emphasizing His infinite wisdom and knowledge in bestowing His favour and mercy upon them.
orig: فضلا من الله ونعمة والله عليم حكيم

translation: And if two groups of believers fight, then make peace between them. But if one of them oppresses the other, then fight against the one that oppresses until it returns to the command of Allah. Then if it returns, make peace between them with justice and be equitable. Indeed, Allah loves the equitable.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of justice and fairness in resolving conflicts between believers, emphasizing that Allah's command is to establish peace and equity, and that He loves those who are fair and just in their dealings.
orig: وإن طائفتان من المؤمنين اقتتلوا فأصلحوا بينهما فإن بغت إحداهما على الأخرى فقاتلوا التي تبغي حتى تفيء إلى أمر الله فإن فاءت فأصلحوا بينهما بالعدل وأقسطوا إن الله يحب المقسطين

translation: The believers are but brothers, so make reconciliation between your brothers and fear Allah that you may receive mercy.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of unity and reconciliation among believers, highlighting that they are all brothers and sisters in faith, and that resolving disputes and promoting harmony is essential to receiving God's mercy.
orig: إنما المؤمنون إخوة فأصلحوا بين أخويكم واتقوا الله لعلكم ترحمون

translation: O you who have believed, let not a group [of men] ridicule another group, it may be that the latter are better than them; nor let women [ridicule] women, it may be that the latter are better than them. And do not insult one another and do not call each other by [offensive] nicknames. Wretched is the name of disobedience after [one's] faith. And whoever does not repent, then it is those who are the wrongdoers.
interpretation: The verse teaches Muslims to avoid ridiculing or insulting one another, emphasizing that people's worth is not determined by their social status or appearance, and that true worth lies in their piety and character.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا يسخر قوم من قوم عسى أن يكونوا خيرا منهم ولا نساء من نساء عسى أن يكن خيرا منهن ولا تلمزوا أنفسكم ولا تنابزوا بالألقاب بئس الاسم الفسوق بعد الإيمان ومن لم يتب فأولئك هم الظالمون

translation: O you who have believed, avoid much [negative] assumption. Indeed, some assumption is sin. And do not spy or backbite each other. Would one of you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother? You would detest it. And fear Allah; indeed, Allah is Accepting of repentance and Merciful.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of avoiding negative assumptions and gossip, as they can lead to sin and harm to others, and instead encourages believers to cultivate a sense of respect and empathy towards one another.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اجتنبوا كثيرا من الظن إن بعض الظن إثم ولا تجسسوا ولا يغتب بعضكم بعضا أيحب أحدكم أن يأكل لحم أخيه ميتا فكرهتموه واتقوا الله إن الله تواب رحيم

translation: O mankind, indeed We have created you from male and female and made you peoples and tribes that you may know one another. Indeed, the most noble of you in the sight of Allah is the most righteous of you. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Acquainted.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of recognizing and respecting the diversity of human creation, emphasizing that true nobility is not based on racial, ethnic, or national identity, but rather on righteousness and God-consciousness.
orig: يا أيها الناس إنا خلقناكم من ذكر وأنثى وجعلناكم شعوبا وقبائل لتعارفوا إن أكرمكم عند الله أتقاكم إن الله عليم خبير

translation: The bedouins say: 'We believe.' Say: 'You do not believe, but rather say: 'We have submitted,' for faith has not yet entered your hearts. And if you obey Allah and His Messenger, He will not withhold from you anything of your deeds. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the distinction between mere verbal profession of faith and true faith that is rooted in the heart, emphasizing that true faith requires obedience to God and His Messenger, and that God is forgiving and merciful to those who truly repent and obey.
orig: قالت الأعراب آمنا قل لم تؤمنوا ولكن قولوا أسلمنا ولما يدخل الإيمان في قلوبكم وإن تطيعوا الله ورسوله لا يلتكم من أعمالكم شيئا إن الله غفور رحيم

translation: The believers are only those who have believed in Allah and His Messenger, then have not doubted, and have striven with their wealth and their lives in the way of Allah. Those are the truthful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of unwavering faith and commitment to the cause of Allah, emphasizing that true believers are those who not only profess faith but also demonstrate it through their actions, sacrificing their wealth and lives for the sake of Allah.
orig: إنما المؤمنون الذين آمنوا بالله ورسوله ثم لم يرتابوا وجاهدوا بأموالهم وأنفسهم في سبيل الله أولئك هم الصادقون

translation: Say, 'Do you instruct Allah about your religion? And Allah knows what is in the heavens and what is in the earth, and Allah is All-Knowing of everything.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes God's omniscience and that He is not in need of human beings' advice or instruction, implying that humans should humble themselves and acknowledge God's superior knowledge and wisdom.
orig: قل أتعلمون الله بدينكم والله يعلم ما في السماوات وما في الأرض والله بكل شيء عليم

translation: They regard it as a favour to you that they have embraced Islam. Say: 'Do not regard your embracing of Islam as a favour to me, rather Allah has conferred a favour upon you that He has guided you to the Faith, if you are truthful.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of humility and recognizing the true source of guidance, emphasizing that it is God who guides people to the right path, and that humans should not take credit for someone's conversion to Islam.
orig: يمنون عليك أن أسلموا قل لا تمنوا علي إسلامكم بل الله يمن عليكم أن هداكم للإيمان إن كنتم صادقين

translation: Indeed, Allah knows the unseen of the heavens and the earth, and Allah is All-Seer of what you do.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's omniscience, emphasizing that He is aware of not only the visible actions of humans, but also their hidden intentions and thoughts, and that He sees everything, even if it is concealed from human eyes.
orig: إن الله يعلم غيب السماوات والأرض والله بصير بما تعملون

translation: Qaf. By the glorious Quran.
interpretation: The verse is an oath, where God swears by the majesty and glory of the Quran, emphasizing its importance and significance, and preparing the reader for a profound and weighty message that is about to be revealed.
orig: ق والقرآن المجيد

translation: Nay, they wonder that a warner has come to them from among themselves, and the unbelievers say: This is a strange thing.
interpretation: The verse highlights the reaction of the unbelievers who are surprised and even shocked when a prophet or a warner emerges from among their own people, indicating that they are not used to receiving guidance or correction from someone who is one of them, and instead of listening to the message, they reject it as something unusual and unacceptable.
orig: بل عجبوا أن جاءهم منذر منهم فقال الكافرون هذا شيء عجيب

translation: When we have died and become dust, that would be a far-off return.
interpretation: The verse highlights the skepticism of those who deny the possibility of resurrection and the afterlife, suggesting that the idea of returning to life after death is unimaginable and far-fetched.
orig: أإذا متنا وكنا ترابا ذلك رجع بعيد

translation: We know what the earth takes away from them, and with Us is a preserving Book.
interpretation: The verse highlights God's omniscience and His ability to keep a record of all human actions, emphasizing that nothing escapes His knowledge or is lost, and that everything will be accounted for in the 'preserving Book', which serves as a reminder of the importance of accountability and responsibility.
orig: قد علمنا ما تنقص الأرض منهم وعندنا كتاب حفيظ

translation: Nay, they denied the truth when it came to them, so they are in a confused state.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of rejecting the truth, which leads to confusion and disorder in one's life, as the individual becomes disconnected from the guidance and clarity that the truth provides.
orig: بل كذبوا بالحق لما جاءهم فهم في أمر مريج

translation: Do they not look at the sky above them, how We built it and adorned it, and there are no fissures in it?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of reflection and contemplation, encouraging humans to ponder the wonders of creation, such as the sky, and recognize the power and majesty of God, the Creator.
orig: أفلم ينظروا إلى السماء فوقهم كيف بنيناها وزيناها وما لها من فروج

translation: And the earth, We have spread it out and cast into it firm mountains and made to grow in it every kind of beautiful pair.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's creative power and wisdom in shaping the earth, emphasizing the harmony and beauty that exist in the natural world, and inviting humans to reflect on the signs of God's existence and majesty.
orig: والأرض مددناها وألقينا فيها رواسي وأنبتنا فيها من كل زوج بهيج

translation: A reminder and an admonition for every servant who turns (to Allah).
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of spiritual guidance and moral awakening, emphasizing that the Quran is a source of inspiration and guidance for those who are willing to listen and reform.
orig: تبصرة وذكرى لكل عبد منيب

translation: And We sent down from the sky blessed water, so We caused to grow thereby gardens and grain of the harvest.
interpretation: The verse symbolizes spiritual growth and nourishment, where the 'blessed water' represents God's guidance and mercy, and the 'gardens and grain of the harvest' represent the flourishing of faith and righteous deeds in the hearts of believers.
orig: ونزلنا من السماء ماء مباركا فأنبتنا به جنات وحب الحصيد

translation: And the palm trees, laden with fruit, bending.
interpretation: The verse is describing the abundance and fertility of Paradise, where the palm trees are laden with fruit, symbolizing the believers' reward in the Hereafter, where they will enjoy eternal bliss and abundance.
orig: والنخل باسقات لها طلع نضيد

translation: And We gave abundance to the servants, and revived a dead land, thus is the resurrection.
interpretation: The verse suggests that God's power and mercy are not limited to this life, but will also be manifested in the afterlife, where He will revive the dead and bring them back to life, just as He revives a barren land with abundant water and fertility.
orig: رزقا للعباد وأحيينا به بلدة ميتا كذلك الخروج

translation: Denied before them the people of Noah and the companions of the Well and Thamud
interpretation: The verse highlights the pattern of disobedience and rejection of God's messengers throughout history, emphasizing that the people being addressed are not the first to reject the truth, but rather are following in the footsteps of previous nations that also refused to listen to the warnings of their prophets.
orig: كذبت قبلهم قوم نوح وأصحاب الرس وثمود

translation: And Aad and Pharaoh, and the brethren of Lut
interpretation: The verse is emphasizing the destruction of previous nations that rejected the prophets and messengers sent by God, serving as a warning to the people of Mecca and a reminder of the consequences of rejecting God's message.
orig: وعاد وفرعون وإخوان لوط

translation: And the companions of the thicket, and the people of Tubba'; every nation did deny their Messenger, so My threat came to pass.
interpretation: The verse highlights the consequences of rejecting God's messengers, emphasizing that every nation that denied their prophets ultimately faced God's wrath and punishment.
orig: وأصحاب الأيكة وقوم تبع كل كذب الرسل فحق وعيد

translation: Or do they say: 'There is nothing but our first creation.' So, they are in confusion about a new creation.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ignorance and arrogance of those who deny the possibility of resurrection and judgment, thinking that their initial creation is the only one, and they cannot comprehend the idea of being recreated and held accountable for their actions.
orig: أفعيينا بالخلق الأول بل هم في لبس من خلق جديد

translation: And indeed We created man and We know what his soul whispers to him, and We are closer to him than his jugular vein.
interpretation: This verse highlights the intimate and all-knowing nature of God, emphasizing that He is even closer to an individual than their own thoughts and desires, and that He is aware of their deepest concerns and motivations.
orig: ولقد خلقنا الإنسان ونعلم ما توسوس به نفسه ونحن أقرب إليه من حبل الوريد

translation: When the two receivers receive from the right and from the left, sitting.
interpretation: This verse is describing the moment when the angels responsible for recording human deeds, one sitting on the right and one on the left, receive the records of an individual's actions, emphasizing the idea that every person's actions are being constantly monitored and recorded.
orig: إذ يتلقى المتلقيان عن اليمين وعن الشمال قعيد

translation: Whatever he utters is observed by an observer ready.
interpretation: The verse highlights the concept of accountability, emphasizing that every individual's words and actions are being recorded and monitored by angels, who are ready to testify on the Day of Judgment.
orig: ما يلفظ من قول إلا لديه رقيب عتيد

translation: And the agony of death comes in truth; that is what you were trying to avoid.
interpretation: The verse highlights the inevitability of death, emphasizing that it is a reality that cannot be escaped, and that the human attempt to avoid or deny it is futile.
orig: وجاءت سكرة الموت بالحق ذلك ما كنت منه تحيد

translation: And the trumpet will be blown, that will be the Day of Threat.
interpretation: The verse highlights the significance of the Day of Judgment, where the blowing of the trumpet will signal the end of the world as we know it, and the beginning of the accountability of humanity before God, emphasizing the gravity and solemnity of that day.
orig: ونفخ في الصور ذلك يوم الوعيد

translation: And every soul comes, with it a driver and a witness.
interpretation: The verse suggests that on the Day of Judgment, every individual will be accompanied by their own conscience, which will serve as both a driving force, motivating them to acknowledge their past deeds, and a witness, testifying to the truth of their actions.
orig: وجاءت كل نفس معها سائق وشهيد

translation: Indeed, you were in a state of unawareness of this, so We removed your cover, and your sight today is sharp.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that one's ignorance or unawareness is a veil that covers their understanding, and once that veil is lifted, their perception and insight become clear and sharp, enabling them to see things as they truly are.
orig: لقد كنت في غفلة من هذا فكشفنا عنك غطاءك فبصرك اليوم حديد

translation: And his companion said, 'This is what I have prepared'
interpretation: The verse highlights the arrogance and confidence of the companion, who believes that his own preparations and resources are sufficient to guarantee his success, neglecting the power and might of God.
orig: وقال قرينه هذا ما لدي عتيد

translation: Throw into Hell every stubborn disbeliever
interpretation: This verse highlights the severity of God's wrath towards those who stubbornly reject faith, emphasizing the idea that such individuals will be punished severely in the afterlife.
orig: ألقيا في جهنم كل كفار عنيد

translation: A restrainer of good, exceeding in sin, persistently rebellious.
interpretation: The verse describes a person who actively prevents good deeds and is characterized by excessive sin and persistent rebellion against God's commands, implying a deliberate and intentional disobedience.
orig: مناع للخير معتد مريب

translation: The one who sets up rivals to Allah, He will throw them into severe punishment.
interpretation: The verse highlights the gravity of the sin of polytheism, where one associates partners with Allah, and warns that such an act will inevitably lead to a severe punishment in the hereafter, implying that this punishment will be a direct consequence of rejecting the oneness of Allah.
orig: الذي جعل مع الله إلها آخر فألقياه في العذاب الشديد

translation: He said: 'My Lord! I did not disobey you, but I was in far-off error.'
interpretation: The verse highlights the tendency of humans to justify their mistakes and shift the blame, as seen in the excuse made by the person in the verse, who attributes their error to being 'in far-off error' rather than taking responsibility for their actions.
orig: قال قرينه ربنا ما أطغيته ولكن كان في ضلال بعيد

translation: He said, 'Do not dispute before Me, and I have already warned you.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of submitting to God's will and judgment, and the futility of arguing or disputing with Him, emphasizing the idea that God's warnings and punishments are inevitable and unavoidable.
orig: قال لا تختصموا لدي وقد قدمت إليكم بالوعيد

translation: What is said to me will not be changed, and I am not unjust to the servants.
interpretation: This verse implies that God's words and decrees are absolute and unalterable, and that God is just and fair in dealing with His servants, never oppressing or wronging them.
orig: ما يبدل القول لدي وما أنا بظلام للعبيد

translation: The day We will say to Hell: 'Are you filled?' and it will say: 'Are there some more?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the insatiable nature of Hell, which will continue to consume souls, always craving for more, emphasizing the severity and eternity of punishment for those who reject God's message.
orig: يوم نقول لجهنم هل امتلأت وتقول هل من مزيد

translation: And Paradise will be brought near to the righteous, not far.
interpretation: The verse suggests that for those who are righteous, Paradise is within reach, implying that their good deeds and virtuous behavior have brought them close to achieving eternal bliss and happiness.
orig: وأزلفت الجنة للمتقين غير بعيد

translation: This is what you were promised, every obedient and preserving one.
interpretation: The verse suggests that the righteous individuals who have remained obedient to God's commands and have preserved their faith will ultimately receive the rewards they were promised, implying a sense of fulfillment and redemption.
orig: هذا ما توعدون لكل أواب حفيظ

translation: Who feared the Most Gracious in the unseen and came with a humble heart.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of having a humble and submissive heart when approaching God, suggesting that true devotion and fear of God can only be achieved through a sincere and humble attitude.
orig: من خشي الرحمن بالغيب وجاء بقلب منيب

translation: Enter it in peace, that is the Day of Eternity.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who enter paradise will do so in a state of complete peace and tranquility, free from any fear or anxiety, and that this state will last for eternity.
orig: ادخلوها بسلام ذلك يوم الخلود

translation: They shall have all that they wish for therein, and with Us is more.
interpretation: The verse suggests that the righteous will be granted not only what they desire in paradise, but also additional blessings and rewards that they could not have even imagined, emphasizing God's infinite generosity and mercy.
orig: لهم ما يشاءون فيها ولدينا مزيد

translation: And how many a generation We destroyed before them, who were stronger in power than these, and they searched the lands, is there any way of escape?
interpretation: This verse highlights the futility of human power and wealth in the face of God's wrath, emphasizing that even the strongest and most powerful civilizations have been destroyed by God's punishment, and that no amount of searching or escape can save one from God's justice.
orig: وكم أهلكنا قبلهم من قرن هم أشد منهم بطشا فنقبوا في البلاد هل من محيص

translation: Indeed, in that is a reminder for whoever has a heart or who listens while he is heedful.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of having a receptive heart and being attentive to the message of God, as it is only those who possess these qualities who will truly benefit from the divine guidance and warning.
orig: إن في ذلك لذكرى لمن كان له قلب أو ألقى السمع وهو شهيد

translation: And indeed, We created the heavens and the earth and what is between them in six days, and no fatigue touched Us.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes God's omnipotence and limitless energy, as He created the entire universe in just six days without feeling any fatigue or exhaustion, highlighting His infinite power and ability to accomplish anything without being affected by it.
orig: ولقد خلقنا السماوات والأرض وما بينهما في ستة أيام وما مسنا من لغوب

translation: So be patient over what they say, and glorify the praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting.
interpretation: The verse is encouraging the prophet to remain steadfast in the face of criticism and ridicule, and to focus on his spiritual growth and connection with God, rather than getting distracted by the negativity of others.
orig: فاصبر على ما يقولون وسبح بحمد ربك قبل طلوع الشمس وقبل الغروب

translation: And in the night, prostrate yourself and glorify Him, and at the declining of the stars.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of devoting oneself to prayer and worship, especially during the quiet hours of the night, when worldly distractions are minimal, and one can focus solely on their spiritual connection with God.
orig: ومن الليل فسبحه وأدبار السجود

translation: And listen on the day when the caller will call out from a near place.
interpretation: The verse is emphasizing the importance of being mindful of the Day of Judgment, when the caller will summon all humans to account for their deeds, and the proximity of this event, implying that it is imminent and inevitable.
orig: واستمع يوم يناد المناد من مكان قريب

translation: The day they will hear the Cry in truth, that will be the day of emergence.
interpretation: The verse is describing the Day of Judgment, where the truth will be revealed and humanity will be forced to confront the reality of their actions, marking the beginning of a new era where accountability and justice will prevail.
orig: يوم يسمعون الصيحة بالحق ذلك يوم الخروج

translation: Verily, We give life and cause death, and to Us is the final return.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes God's absolute control and authority over life and death, implying that everything ultimately returns to Him, and that He is the ultimate judge and arbitrator of human destiny.
orig: إنا نحن نحيي ونميت وإلينا المصير

translation: The day it splits asunder, from them, hastening forth, that will be a gathering, easy for Us.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that on the Day of Judgment, the earth will be torn apart, revealing the secrets of the past, and that this event will be effortless for God, implying His omnipotence and control over the universe.
orig: يوم تشقق الأرض عنهم سراعا ذلك حشر علينا يسير

translation: We know what they say, and you are not a compeller over them by force, so remind with the Quran him who fears My threat.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of gentle persuasion and guidance, rather than coercion, in inviting people to the path of righteousness, emphasizing that it is ultimately up to the individual to respond to the divine message.
orig: نحن أعلم بما يقولون وما أنت عليهم بجبار فذكر بالقرآن من يخاف وعيد

translation: And those who scatter far and wide
interpretation: The verse is highlighting the idea that the winds of change and trials will spread far and wide, affecting all aspects of life, and that one must be prepared to face them with faith and perseverance.
orig: والذاريات ذروا

translation: And those who carry the Throne and those around it
interpretation: The verse is highlighting the grandeur and majesty of God, emphasizing that even the mighty angels who carry the Throne of God are not equal to Him, and are instead humble servants who glorify and worship Him.
orig: فالحاملات وقرا

translation: So those who are hastening, hasten.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who are rushing towards their doom will ultimately hasten their own downfall, implying that their actions will lead to their own destruction.
orig: فالجاريات يسرا

translation: Then We have certainly distinguished every sign, an authoritative command.
interpretation: This verse highlights the clarity and decisiveness of God's revelations, emphasizing that each sign or miracle is a deliberate and authoritative command from God, leaving no room for doubt or misinterpretation.
orig: فالمقسمات أمرا

translation: Indeed, you are promised a truthful promise.
interpretation: The verse is a reassurance to the believers that the promise of God is true and will be fulfilled, and that they can have complete trust and faith in His words.
orig: إنما توعدون لصادق

translation: And indeed, the religion is easy.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the idea that Islam is a religion that is easy to follow and does not burden its followers with unnecessary restrictions or difficulties, and that the essence of the faith is simplicity and ease.
orig: وإن الدين لواقع

translation: And the sky that has the returns
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the majesty and power of God by describing the sky as having 'returns', implying that the sky is a witness to the actions of humanity and will ultimately return to God for judgment, emphasizing the idea that all creations will be held accountable for their deeds.
orig: والسماء ذات الحبك

translation: Indeed, you are in a diverse statement.
interpretation: The verse highlights the fact that people often have differing opinions and perspectives, leading to confusion and disagreement, and that this diversity of views can be a source of conflict and strife.
orig: إنكم لفي قول مختلف

translation: He will forgive him from whom He wills to forgive
interpretation: This verse highlights God's absolute authority and mercy, emphasizing that He forgives whomever He chooses, implying that forgiveness is a divine prerogative that cannot be demanded or expected, but rather is a gift from God.
orig: يؤفك عنه من أفك

translation: The wicked have perished.
interpretation: The verse conveys that those who are wicked and corrupt will ultimately meet their downfall, implying that their evil deeds will lead to their own destruction.
orig: قتل الخراصون

translation: Those who are in a flood of ignorance
interpretation: The verse is describing people who are deeply immersed in ignorance, implying a state of being completely absorbed in their own misconceptions and misunderstandings, which prevents them from seeing the truth and guidance.
orig: الذين هم في غمرة ساهون

translation: They ask: When is the Day of Recompense?
interpretation: The verse highlights the skepticism and arrogance of those who doubt the existence of the Day of Judgment, implying that they are unaware of the consequences of their actions and the reckoning that awaits them.
orig: يسألون أيان يوم الدين

translation: The Day they are pushed towards the Fire with a violent thrust.
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that on the Day of Judgment, those who rejected God's message will be forcefully driven towards the Fire, emphasizing the inevitability and intensity of their punishment.
orig: يوم هم على النار يفتنون

translation: Taste your trial; this is what you were hastening.
interpretation: The verse is a warning to those who were impatient for the punishment to come, and now that it has arrived, they must face the consequences of their actions, emphasizing the idea that God's justice is inevitable and unstoppable.
orig: ذوقوا فتنتكم هذا الذي كنتم به تستعجلون

translation: Indeed, the righteous will be in gardens and springs.
interpretation: The verse suggests that those who are righteous and pious will be rewarded with eternal bliss and happiness in the afterlife, where they will enjoy the beauty and tranquility of paradise.
orig: إن المتقين في جنات وعيون

translation: Taking what their Lord has given them, verily, they were before that Muhsineen.
interpretation: The verse highlights the importance of gratitude and appreciation for the blessings and favors bestowed upon believers by God, emphasizing that those who are grateful are the ones who were already good-doers and righteous in their actions and intentions.
orig: آخذين ما آتاهم ربهم إنهم كانوا قبل ذلك محسنين

translation: They used to sleep but little of the night.
interpretation: This verse highlights the righteous individuals' habit of minimizing their sleep and devoting most of their night to prayer, reflection, and worship, demonstrating their strong connection with their Lord and their dedication to spiritual growth.
orig: كانوا قليلا من الليل ما يهجعون

translation: And at dawn, they used to seek forgiveness.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of seeking forgiveness from God, especially during the early hours of the day when the heart is most receptive to spiritual reflection and the mind is most clear, emphasizing the need for constant self-reflection and repentance.
orig: وبالأسحار هم يستغفرون

translation: And in their properties there is a right for the beggar and the deprived.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of recognizing the rights of the underprivileged in society, emphasizing that the wealthy have a moral obligation to support those in need, and that their wealth is not solely their own, but is also meant to be shared with those who are less fortunate.
orig: وفي أموالهم حق للسائل والمحروم

translation: And on the earth are signs for those who are certain
interpretation: The verse highlights the idea that the natural world and the universe contain signs and evidence of God's existence and power, and that those who are certain in their faith can see and understand these signs, leading to a deeper understanding and appreciation of God's majesty.
orig: وفي الأرض آيات للموقنين

translation: And in yourselves, do you not see?
interpretation: This verse is a call to introspection, urging individuals to look within themselves and reflect on their own souls, suggesting that the answers to many questions and the path to self-improvement can be found by examining one's own heart and conscience.
orig: وفي أنفسكم أفلا تبصرون

translation: And in the heaven is your provision and that which you are promised.
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that everything that human beings need, including their sustenance and ultimate destiny, is already decreed and stored in the heavens, emphasizing God's complete control and provision over human life.
orig: وفي السماء رزقكم وما توعدون

translation: By the sky and the earth, indeed, it is a certainty, just as you are speaking.
